rtsig pa'i phyi rol gyi rtsa bar 'dod yon gyi snam bu dmar po la gnas (134) pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo bcu drug gis mchod rdzas du ma thogs nas bskor ba/ nang ka ba brgyad kyi steng rdo rje gdung bzhis bteg pa/ dbus phyur bur gyur pa'i rtse mor rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa phyed pa'i rin po che'i tog gis mtshan pa/

Outside, at the base of the walls, is the red plinth of pleasures, where the sixteen offering goddesses reside holding many offering substances. Inside, four vajra beams are supported by eight columns. The peak of the domed [roof] is marked by a precious finial, a blue five-pointed half-vajra.
sgo bzhi glo 'bur gyi tshul du yod pa la ka ba bzhis bzhis bteg pa'i rta babs bang rim brgyad dang ldan pa'i rtse mor chos kyi 'khor lo ri dwags gdugs tog dang bcas pa/
At the four doors, which protrude, there are four columns supporting the eight-layered torans. On their tops are dharmacakras, deer, and parasol finials.
gzhal yas khang gi nang du byang chub sems kyi rgya mtsho dkar la dmar ba'i mdangs chags pas nang thams cad khebs pa/ /

Inside the palace, the interior is covered with an ocean of bodhicitta, white with a red sheen. In the middle is a multicolored lotus whose infinite petals reach the walls. Its smaller petals are interlaced with garlands and pendants.

de'i dbus su sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma mtha' yas pa'i 'dab ma rnams rtsig pa la thug pa/ / 'dab phran rnams la rin po che'i drwa ba dang drwa phyed sbrel mar yod pa/ de'i dbus su sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa shar sngo/ byang ljang / nub dmar/ lho ser/ mtshams bzhi'i pad 'dab sngon po can gyi mthar gri gug gi ra bas bskor ba/ / de'i lte bar pad+ma nyi zla'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan bcas pa'o/ /

In its center is a multicolored eight-petaled lotus. Its eastern petal is blue, its northern is green, its western is red, its southern is yellow, and the four petals in the intermediate directions are blue. Its outer edge is encircled by a fence of hooked knives. In its center, in the middle of a lotus and sun and moon maṇḍalas, are Bhairava and Kālarātri.
brten pa lha bskyed pa ni/
Generation of the deities, the supported.

de'i steng du g.yon skor gyis/ a A/ i I/ u U/ r-i r-I/ l-i l-I/ e ai/ o au/ aM aH de zhu ba las byung ba'i zla ba me long lta bu'i ye shes/ de'i steng du g.yas skor du/ ka kha ga g+ha nga / tsa tsha dza dz+ha nya/ Ta Tha Da D+ha Na/ ta tha da d+ha na/ pa pha ba b+ha ma/ ya ra la wa/ sha Sha sa ha k+ShaH de zhu ba las byung ba'i nyi ma mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes/

Above those, counterclockwise, are a ā / i ī / u ū / ṛ ṝ / ḷ ḹ / e ai / o au / aṃ aḥ. They melt, from which arises a moon, mirrorlike wisdom. On top of that, clockwise, are ka kha ga gha ṅa / ca cha ja jha nya / ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa / ta tha da dha na / pa pha ba bha ma / ya ra la va / śa ṣa sa ha kṣaḥ. They melt, from which arises a sun, the wisdom of equality.

de gnyis kyi dbus su rang rig hU~M dang ba~M so sor rtog pa'i ye shes/ de las 'od zer 'phros/ 'phags pa mchod/ sems can gyi don byas tshur 'dus te/ nyi zla sa bon gsum ro gcig tu 'dres pa bya ba grub pa'i ye shes/ de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa lte bar hU~M yig sngon pos mtshan pa dang / mdun du gri gug dmar po so yu'i mtshams su ba~M dmar pos mtshan (135) pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes/

In between those two, my own reflexive awareness appears as hūṃ and vaṃ, discriminating wisdom. Light radiates from those, presenting offerings to the noble ones and benefiting sentient beings, and then it gathers back. The mixing together as one taste of the sun, moon, and syllables is the all-accomplishing wisdom. They transform into a blue five-pointed vajra whose center is marked by a blue letter hūṃ. In front is a red hooked knife marked by a red vaṃ at the intersection between the blade and its handle. {135} Those are the wisdom of the dharmadhātu.

de'i phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhi'i pad 'dab kyi steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor re re'i dbus su 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan ma re re'i steng du yab kyi sa bon hU~M yig las he ru ka rigs bzhi'i sa bon 'phros pa ni/ shar du oM/ byang du A/ / nub tu hrIH lhor trA~M/ yum gyi sa bon baM yig las yum bzhi'i sa bon spros pa ni/ shar du mA~M/ byang du trA~M/ nub tu pA~M/ lhor lA~M/

Outside of those, on the lotus petals in the four directions are sun maṇḍalas, and on top of each of those are Bhairava and Kālarātri. Above each of them are hūṃs, the seed syllable of the male consort, from which radiate the seed syllables of the herukas of the four families. In the east is oṃ, in the north is āḥ, in the west is hrīḥ, and in the south is trāṃ. From vaṃ, the seed syllable of the female consort, radiate the seed syllables of the four female consorts. In the east is māṃ, in the north is trāṃ, in the west is pāṃ, and in the south is lāṃ.

sa bon de brgyad yongs su gyur pa las shar du 'khor lo dkar po oM gyis mtshan pa/ / byang du sna tshogs rdo rje ljang gu AHyis mtshan pa/ nub tu pad+ma dmar po hrIHyis mtshan pa/ lhor rin po che ser po trA~M gyis mtshan pa/ de bzhi'i mdun du shar du gri gug sngon po/ byang du gri gug ljang gu/ nub tu gri gug dmar po/ lhor gri gug ser po/ so yu'i mtshams su mA~M lA~M pA~M tA~M bzhis mtshan pa/

Those eight seed syllables transform into, in the east, a white cakra marked by oṃ; in the north, a green viśvavajra marked by āḥ; in the west, a red lotus marked by hrīḥ; and in the south, a yellow jewel marked by trāṃ. In front of those four, in the east is a blue hooked knife, in the north is a green hooked knife, in the west is a red hooked knife, and in the south is a yellow hooked knife. The intersections between the blades and handles are marked by māṃ, lāṃ, vāṃ, and tāṃ.

dbus kyi rdo rje hU~M dang bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las/ bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo bde mchog sku mdog sngon po yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bai DUr+Ya mthing ga bzang po yongs su dang ba'i mdog lta bu zhal bzhi pa/ phyag bcu gnyis pa/ rtsa zhal mthing nag / g.yon zhal ljang ba/ rgyab zhal dmar ba/ g.yas zhal ser ba/ zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa/ mche ba bzhi bzhi cung zad gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas kyi dang po na gser gyi rdo rje rtse dgu pa/ g.yon gyi dang po na dngul dkar gyi dril bu thugs kar bsnol thabs su 'dzin pas yum la 'khyud pa/ g.yas dang g.yon gyi gnyis pa na glang po che dkar po'i pags pa khrag 'dzag pa brgyangs te bsnams pa/ g.yas kyi gsum pa na DA ma ru/ bzhi pa na gri gug / lnga pa na dgra s+t+wa/ drug pa na mdung rtse gsum 'dzin pa/ g.yon gyi gsum pa na kha T+wAM ga / bzhi pa na thod khrag / lnga pa na zhags pa/ (136) drug pa na tshangs pa'i mgo bo gdong bzhi pa 'dzin pa/

The central vajra with a hūṃ transforms, and I become the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, with a brilliant blue color like that of the deep blue of precious vaiḍūrya, a wish-fulfilling gem. I have four faces and twelve arms. My main face is dark blue, my left is green, my rear one is red, and my right is yellow. Each face has three eyes and four slightly bared fangs. In my first right hand I hold a golden nine-pointed vajra; and in my first left, a silver ghaṇṭā. Both are crossed at my heart, embracing my consort. In my second right and left hands, I hold outstretched the skin of a white elephant dripping with blood. In my third right hand, I hold a ḍamaru; in my fourth right, a hooked knife; in my fifth right, an ax; and in my sixth right, a trident. In my third left, I hold a khaṭvāṃga; in my fourth left, a skull cup with blood; in my fifth left, a noose; and in my sixth left, Brahmā’s head with his four faces. {136}
zhabs g.yas brkyangs pas dus mtshan ma dmar mo'i snying ga nas mnan pa/ g.yon cung zad bskums pas 'jigs byed nag po'i mgo bo nas mnan pa/
My right leg is extended, pressing down on the heart of red Kālarātri, and my left is slightly bent, trampling on the head of black Bhairava.

bram ze mo'i tshangs skud kyis ral pa'i thor cog bang rim gsum du bcings pa'i mgo la sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa/ bang rim bar ma la tshes gsum gyi zla ba dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po ches mtshan pa/ dbu rgyan mi bskyod pa/ thor cog gi rtse mor rus pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa'i lte bar rus pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i tog gis mtshan pa rdo rje sems dpa'i yan lag / rna rgyan rin chen 'byung ldan/ mgul rgyan 'od dpag med/ dpung rgyan phyag gdub zhabs gdub rnams rnam par snang mdzad/ rked rgyan don yod grub pa/ thal ba he ru ka'i yan lag ste phyag rgya drug gis brgyan pa/

My hair is in a three-tiered topknot tied with a brahman woman’s thread and marked by a viśvavajra. The middle tier is marked by a moon on the third lunar day and a precious wish-fulfilling gem. My crown ornament is Akṣobhya. At the tip of my topknot is an eight-spoked bone cakra whose center is marked by a finial of a five-pointed bone vajra, the branch of Vajrasattva. My jeweled earrings are Ratnasambhava. My necklace is Amitābha. The bracelets on my arms and wrists and my anklets are Vairocana. My waist ornament is Amoghasiddhi. My ashes are the branch of Heruka. Thus, I am adorned with the six mudrās.

thod pa skam po lngas dbur brgyan cing / rlon pa lnga bcu'i do shal byas pa/ stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs grol ba/ sgeg pa dpa' ba mi sdug pa dang / dgod pa drag shul 'jigs su rung / snying rje rngams zhing zhi ba ste/ gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa/

Five dried skulls adorn my head, and I wear a necklace of fifty fresh ones. My tiger-skin skirt is loosely tied. I display the nine moods of the dramatic arts: erotic, heroic, revolting, laughing, fierce, terrifying, compassionate, amazing, and peaceful.

mdun gyi gri gug ba~M yig dang bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las/ yab kyi pang du bcom ldan 'das ma rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma gsang ba lhan cig skyes ma/ sku mdog pad+ma rA ga ltar dmar ba/ zhal gcig phyag gnyis spyan gsum mche ba bzhi rab tu gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas pas rdo rjes mtshan pa'i gri gug nam mkha' la phyar ba/ g.yon pas thod pa khrag gis gang ba bsnams nas yab kyi mgul nas 'khyud pa/ zhabs g.yon yab kyi g.yas dang mnyam du brkyangs pas dus mtshan ma dmar mo'i snying gar mnan pa/ g.yas yab kyi brla la 'khril zhing 'khyud pa/ dbu skra sil ma sku rgyab tu grol ba/ thal ba spangs pa'i phyag (137) rgya lngas brgyan pa/

In front, the hooked knife with the letter vaṃ transforms, and in my lap as the female consort, it becomes the Bhagavatī, Jetsun Vajrayoginī, the secret Sahajā. She is red in color, like padmarāga. She has one face, two arms, three eyes, and four very bared fangs. Her right hand holds aloft a hooked knife marked by a vajra, and her left holds a skull cup filled with blood, wrapped around the neck of me, her consort. Her left leg is extended, matching my, her male consort’s, right leg, pressing down on the heart of red Kālarātri. Her right leg is wrapped around my, her male consort’s, thigh, embracing me. Her hair is loose, flowing down her back. {137}
thod pa skam po lngas dbur brgyan cing rlon pa lnga bcu'i do shal byas pa/ bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do/ /
She is adorned with the five mudrās, omitting the ashes. Five dried skulls adorn her head, and she wears a necklace of fifty fresh ones. She is the embodiment of the wisdom of great bliss.

phyogs bzhi'i phyag mtshan sa bon dang bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las/ shar du bud+d+ha he ru ka sku mdog dkar po yum mkha' 'gro ma sngon mo dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba/ byang du karma he ru ka sku mdog ljang gu yum lA ma ljang gu dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba/ nub tu pad+ma he ru ka sku mdog dmar po yum khaN+Da ro hi ma dmar mo dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba/ lhor rat+na he ru ka sku mdog ser po yum gzugs can ma ser mo dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba/

In the four directions, the emblems with their seed syllables transform. In the east, white Buddha Heruka and blue Ḍākinī are in nondual union. In the north, green Karma Heruka and green Lāma are in nondual union. In the west, red Padma Heruka and red Khaṇḍarohi are in nondual union. In the south, yellow Ratna Heruka and yellow Rūpiṇī are in nondual union.

yab bzhi ga'ang zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa/ rtsa zhal sku mdog dang mtshungs pa/ ljang gu'i g.yon zhal sngo ba/ dmar po'i rgyab zhal sngo ba/ ser po'i g.yas zhal sngo ba/ dkar po'i phyag g.yas dang pos 'khor lo/ / ljang gus sna tshogs rdo rje/ dmar pos pad+ma/ ser pos rin po che rnams bsnams pa dang / g.yon dang pos dngul gyi dril bu thugs kar bsnol stabs su yum la 'khyud pa/ zhal phyag lhag ma dang phyag mtshan rgyan dang cha byad thams cad gtso bo ji lta ba/

All four male consorts have four faces and two arms. Their main faces are the color of their bodies. The left face of the green one is blue. The rear face of the red one is blue. The right face of the yellow one is blue. In their first right hands, the white one holds a cakra, the green one holds a viśvavajra, the red one a lotus, and the yellow one a jewel. Their first left ones hold silver ghaṇṭās. [These first hands] are crossed at their hearts, embracing their consorts. Their remaining faces and hands, and their emblems, ornaments, and attributes are the same as those of the principal male.

yum bzhi ga'ang zhal gcig phyag bzhi spyan gsum mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas kyi dang po na DA ma ru/ 'og ma na gri gug / g.yon gyi dang po na kha T+wAM ga / 'og ma na thod khrag 'dzin pas yab rnams kyi mgul nas 'khyud pa/ zhabs g.yon yab kyi g.yas dang mnyam du brkyangs pas dus mtshan ma dmar mo'i snying gar mnan pa sogs rgyan cha lugs thams cad gtso mo dang mtshungs pa'o/ /

All four female consorts have one face, four arms, three eyes, and four bared fangs. Their first right hands hold ḍamarus, and their lower right ones hold hooked knives. Their first left hands hold khaṭvāṃgas, and their lower left ones hold skull cups with blood, wrapped around the necks of their consorts. Their left legs are extended, matching their consorts’ right ones, pressing down on the hearts of red Kālarātris. All their other ornaments and attributes are the same as those of the principal female.

mtshams kyi pad 'dab bzhir/ b+h+rU~M ser po bzhi las/ rin po che gser gyi bum pa bzhi las shar lho'i bum pa ga bur gyis gang ba/ lho nub kyi bum pa sih+las gang ba/ nub byang gi bum pa gla rtsis gang ba/ byang shar gyi bum pa bzhi mnyam gyis gang ba/ de rnams kyi (138) khar a las ye shes kyi ka pA la dpral ba dbus su bstan pa zag pa med pa'i bdud rtsis gang ba re re gnas pa'o/ /

On the four lotus petals in the intermediate directions, from four {yellow}[*2] bhrūṃs, appear four precious golden vases. The southeastern vase is filled with camphor. The southwestern vase is filled with sihla. The northwestern vase is filled with musk. The northeastern vase is filled with the fourfold.[3] {138} On the top of each of those, from a’s, are wisdom kapālas filled with undefiled amṛta, their foreheads facing in toward the center.
de nas phung khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa ni/
Consecrating the skandhas, dhātus, and āyatanas.

gtso bo bcom ldan 'das yab kyi spyi bor oM las gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad dkar po 'khor lo dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ lte bar trA~M las tshor ba'i phung po rdo rje nyi ma ser po rin po che dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ mgrin par hrIHlas 'du shes kyi phung po pad+ma gar dbang dmar po pad+ma dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ rkang bol du hoHlas 'du byed kyi phung po rdo rje rgyal po ljang gu sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ snying gar hU~M las rnam par shes pa'i phung po rdo rje sems dpa' sngon po rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ dpral bar hU~M las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid he ru ka mthing ga rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/

As the Bhagavān, the principal male consort, on the top of my head, from oṃ, is my form skandha as white Vairocana holding a cakra and ghaṇṭā. At my navel, from trāṃ, is my skandha of feelings as yellow Vajrasūrya holding a jewel and ghaṇṭā. At my throat, from hrīḥ, is my skandha of discriminations as red Padmanarteśvara holding a lotus and ghaṇṭā. At my insteps, from hoḥs, is my skandha of formative forces as green Vajrarājas holding viśvavajras and ghaṇṭās. At my heart, from hūṃ, is my skandha of consciousnesses as blue Vajrasattva holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā. At my forehead, from hūṃ, is deep blue Heruka, the embodiment of all tathāgatas, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā.

mig tu b+h+rU~M las gti mug rdo rje dkar po 'khor lo dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ rna bar hU~M las zhe sdang rdo rje mthing ga rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ sna la trA~M las ser sna rdo rje ser po rin po che dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ lce la AHlas 'dod chags rdo rje dmar po pad+ma dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ rdo rje nor bu'i rtser kha~M las phrag dog rdo rje ljang gu sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ snying gar hU~M las dbang phyug rdo rje nag po rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/

At my eyes, from bhrūṃs, are white Mohavajras holding cakras and ghaṇṭās. At my ears, from hūṃs, are blue Dveṣavajras holding vajras and ghaṇṭās. At my nostrils, from trāṃs, are yellow Īrṣyāvajras holding jewels and ghaṇṭās. At my tongue, from āḥ, is red Rāgavajra holding a lotus and ghaṇṭā. At the tip of the jewel of my vajra, from khaṃ, is green Mātsaryavajra holding a viśvavajra and ghaṇṭā. At my heart, from hūṃ, is black Vajreśvara holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā.

lte bar lA~M las sa'i khams ltung byed ma ser mo phyag g.yas gnyis kyis cang te'u dang gri gug 'dzin pa/ snying gar mA~M las chu'i khams gsod byed ma sngon mo g.yas gnyis rdo rje dang gri gug 'dzin pa/ mgrin par pa~M las me'i khams 'gugs byed ma dmar mo g.yas gnyis pad+ma dang gri gug 'dzin pa/ spyi bor tA~M las rlung gi khams gar gyi dbang phyug ma ljang mo g.yas gnyis sna tshogs rdo rje dang gri gug 'dzin pa/ de bzhi ga'i g.yon gnyis kha T+wAM dang thod khrag bsnams pa/ gsang bar kha~M las nam mkha'i khams pad+ma drwa ba can dmar mo gri gug (139) dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ spyi gtsug tu hoHlas ye shes kyi khams rdo rje snyems ma sngon mo rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o/ /

At my navel, from lāṃ, is my earth dhātu as yellow Pātanā whose two right hands hold a changteu and hooked knife. At my heart, from māṃ, is my water dhātu as blue Māraṇā whose two right hands hold a vajra and hooked knife. At my throat, from paṃ, is my fire dhātu as red Ākarṣaṇā whose two right hands hold a lotus and hooked knife. At my head, from tāṃ, is my wind dhātu as green Padmanarteśvarī whose two right hands hold a viśvavajra and hooked knife. Those four hold in their left hands khaṭvāṃgas and skull cups with blood. At my secret place, from khaṃ, is my space dhātu as red Padmajālavatī holding a hooked knife and ghaṇṭā. {139} At the crown of my head, from hoḥ, is my wisdom dhātu as blue Vajragarvā holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā.
gsum pa gsang sgrub lus dkyil bsgom pa ni/
C. The Secret Practice: Meditating on the Body Maṇḍala
gtso bo bcom ldan 'das yab kyi thugs kar sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma shar sngo/ byang ljang / nub dmar/ lho ser/ mtshams bzhir sngo ba'i mthar gri gug gi ra ba dang /

As the Bhagavān, the principal male consort, in my heart, is a multicolored lotus. Its eastern petal is blue, its northern one is green, its western one is red, and its southern one is yellow, and the four petals in the intermediate directions are blue. Its outer edge is encircled by a fence of hooked knives.

de'i phyir thugs kyi 'khor lor 'khor lo sngon po rtsibs brgyad pa'i mthar rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa'i ra ba dang / de'i phyir gsung gi 'khor lor 'khor lo dmar po rtsibs brgyad pa'i mthar pad+ma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ra ba dang / de'i phyir sku'i 'khor lor 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa'i mthar 'khor lo dkar po'i ra ba dang / de'i phyir dam tshig gi 'khor lor sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i mthar sna tshogs rdo rje'i ra ba rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba/

Outside of that is the mind cakra, a blue cakra with eight spokes. Its outer edge is encircled by a fence of blue five-pointed vajras. Outside of that is the speech cakra, a red cakra with eight spokes. Its outer edge is encircled by a fence of red eight-petaled lotuses. Outside of that is the cakra of body, a white cakra with eight spokes. Its outer edge is encircled by a fence of white cakras. Outside of that is the samaya cakra, a multicolored eight-petaled lotus. Its outer edge is encircled by a fence of multicolored vajras.

dbus kyi pad+ma'i lte bar pad+ma nyi zla'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan gyi steng du hU~M sngon po dang ba~M dmar po/ de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa lte bar hU~M yig sngon pos mtshan pa dang / gri gug dmar po so yu'i mtshams su ba~M yig dmar pos mtshan pa/ de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo bde mchog sku mdog sngon po yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bai DUr+Ya mthon kha bzang po yongs su dwangs pa'i mdog lta bu zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa yab yum gnyis ka sku mdog zhal phyag rgyan cha lugs thams cad phyi'i he ru ka lta bur gyur/

In the middle of the central lotus are a lotus and sun and moon maṇḍalas. In the center of those are Bhairava and Kālarātri. Above them are a blue hūṃ and a red vaṃ. Those transform into a blue five-pointed vajra whose center is marked by a blue letter hūṃ and a red hooked knife marked by a red letter vaṃ at the intersection between the blade and its handle. Those transform into the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, with a brilliant blue color like that of the deep blue of precious vaiḍūrya, a wish-fulfilling gem.[4] He has four faces and twelve arms. The colors, faces, arms, ornaments, and attributes of both the male and female consorts are the same as those of the outer Heruka.[*3]
zhes sam spro na phyag bcu gnyis pa man gong ltar brjod/
[*3] Interlinear note: Say that or, if you wish to elaborate, recite from “Twelve arms…” above.

phyogs bzhi'i pad 'dab kyi steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang ro'i gdan gyi steng du yum gyi thugs ka nas snying po'i rnal 'byor ma bzhi'i sa bon spros pa ni/ shar nas g.yon skor du mA~M lA~M pA~M tA~M bzhi yongs su gyur pa las shar du mkha' 'gro ma sngon mo/ byang du lA ma ljang gu/ nub tu khaN+Da ro hI ma dmar mo/ / lhor gzugs can ma ser mo/ /

On the lotus petals in the four directions, above sun maṇḍalas and corpse seats, the seed syllables of the four yoginīs radiate from the heart of the female consort. Starting from the east, clockwise, are māṃ, lāṃ, vaṃ, and taṃ. They transform into in the east, blue Ḍākinī; in the north, green Lāma; in the west, red Khaṇḍarohī; and in the south, yellow Rūpiṇī. {140}

bzhi ga'ang zhal gcig phyag (140) bzhi spyan gsum mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas kyi dang po na DA ma ru/ 'og ma na gri gug / g.yon gyi dang po na kha T+wAM ga / 'og ma na thod khrag 'dzin pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyang / g.yon cung zad bskums pas ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa/ dbu skra sil ma sku rgyab tu grol ba/ thod pa skam po lngas dbu la brgyan pa/ rlon pa lnga bcu rtsa gcig gis do shal byas pa/

All four have one face, four arms, three eyes, and four bared fangs. Their first right hands hold ḍamarus and their lower right ones hold hooked knives. Their first left hands hold khaṭvāṃgas and their lower left ones hold skull cups with blood. Their right legs are extended, and their left are slightly bent, planted on corpse seats. Their hair is loose, flowing down their backs. Five dried skulls adorn their heads, and they wear necklaces of fifty fresh ones.

mtshams bzhir b+h+rU~M las gser gyi bum pa bzhi las shar lho'i bum pa ga bur gyis gang ba/ lho nub kyi bum pa sih+las gang ba/ nub byang gi bum pa gla rtsis gang ba/ byang shar gyi bum pa bzhi mnyam gyis gang ba/ de rnams kyi khar thod pa bdud rtsis gang ba dpral ba dbus su bstan pa re re ste bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'o/ /

In the four intermediate directions, from bhrūṃs, appear four golden vases. The southeastern vase is filled with camphor. The southwestern vase is filled with sihla. The northwestern vase is filled with musk. The northeastern vase is filled with the fourfold. On the top of each of those are skull cups filled with amṛta, their foreheads facing in toward the center. That is the mahāsukhacakra.

gtso bo he ru ka'i spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas rnams dang thugs kar thugs gsung sku'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa re re gnas pa'i rtsibs kyi steng du thugs ka'i hU~M las spros pa'i pU dza o a/ go ra de {thugs} ma ka o tra ko / ka la ka hi {gsung} / pre gr-i sau su/ na si ma ku {sku}/

At my places, my head and the others, as the principal Heruka, and above the spokes in each of the eight-spoked cakras of body, speech, and mind in my heart center, from the hūṃ at my heart, stream forth pū ja o a / go ra de ma[*4] {[*4] mind.} ka o tra ko / ka la ka hi[*5] {[*5] speech.} / pre gṛ sau su / na si ma ku.[*6] {[*6] body.}

de rnams yongs su gyur pa las thugs ka'i thugs kyi 'khor lo'i shar rtsibs dang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo phyi'i he ru ka'i spyi bo pU l+li ra ma la yar dpa' bo thod pa'i dum bu dang dpa' mo rab gtum ma/ byang gi rtsibs dang spyi gtsug dzA lan+d+ha rar dpa' bo keng rus chen po dang dpa' mo gtum mig ma/ nub rtsibs dang rna ba g.yas pa o Di yA nar dpa' bo kaM ka la dang dpa' mo 'od ldan ma/ lho rtsibs dang ltag pa a bu tar dpa' bo mche ba rnam gtsigs dang dpa' mo sna chen ma/ shar lho'i rtsibs dang rna ba g.yon pa go dA wa rar dpa' bo lha dgra dang dpa' mo blo gros ma/ lho nub dang smin dbus ra me sha rar dpa' bo snang ba dpag med dang dpa' mo mi'u thung ma/ nub byang dang mig gnyis de wI ko trar dpa' bo rdo rje'i 'od dang dpa' mo laM ka'i dbang phyug ma/ byang shar dang (141) phrag pa gnyis mal war dpa' bo rdo rje'i sku dang dpa' mo shing grib ma ste

Those transform. On the eastern spoke of the mind cakra and at my head, as the outer Heruka, the principal one of the maṇḍala, Pullīramalaya, are the hero Khaṇḍakapāla and the heroine Pracaṇḍā. On the northern spoke and at the crown of my head, Jālandhara, are the hero Mahākaṇkāla and the heroine Caṇḍākṣī. On the western spoke and in my right ear, Oḍḍiyāna, are the hero Kaṅkāla and the heroine Prabhāvatī. On the southern spoke and at the nape of my neck, Arbuda, are the hero Vikaṭadaṃṣṭrī and the heroine Mahānāsā. On the southeastern spoke and in my left ear, Godāvarī, are the hero Surāvairī and the heroine Vīramatī. On the southwestern spoke and in the middle of my eyebrows, Rāmeśvarī, are the hero Amitābha and the heroine Kharvarī. On the northwestern spoke and in both my eyes, Devīkoṭa, are the hero Vajraprabha and the heroine Laṅkeśvarī. {141} On the northeastern spoke and in both my shoulders, Mālava, are the hero Vajradeha and the heroine Drumacchāyā.
gnas dang nye ba'i gnas kyi lha thams cad sku mdog sngon po mkha' la spyod pa/
The deities of the abodes and the nearby abodes are blue and rule the sky.

de'i phyi'i gsung gi 'khor lo'i shar rtsibs dang mchan khung gnyis ka ma rU par dpa' bo myu gu can dang dpa' mo sa srung ma/ byang rtsibs dang nu ma gnyis o trar dpa' bo rdo rje ral pa can dang dpa' mo 'jigs byed chen mo/ / nub rtsibs dang lte ba tri sha ku ner dpa' bo rab dpa' dang dpa' mo rlung gi shugs can ma/ lho'i rtsibs dang sna rtse ko sa lar dpa' bo rdo rje hU~M mdzad dang dpa' mo chang 'thung ma/ me mtshams dang kha ka ling kar dpa' bo rab tu bzang po dang dpa' mo sngo bsangs lha mo/ / bden bral dang mgrin pa lam+ba kar dpa' bo rdo rje bzang po dang dpa' mo rab tu bzang mo/ rlung dang snying ga kany+tsi kar dpa' mo 'jigs byed chen po dang dpa' mo rta rnam/ dbang ldan dang 'doms su hi ma la yar dpa' bo mig mi bzang dang dpa' mo byag dong ma ste

Outside of that, on the eastern spoke of the speech cakra and in both my armpits, Kāmarūpa, are the hero Aṅkuraka and the heroine Airāvatī. On the northern spoke and in both my breasts, Oḍra, are the hero Vajrajaṭila and the heroine Mahābhairavā. On the western spoke and at my navel, Triśakuni, are the hero Mahāvīra and the heroine Vāyuvegā. On the southern spoke and at the tip of my nose, Kośala, are the hero Vajrahūṃkāra and the heroine Surābhakṣī. In Agni’s quarter[*7] and at my mouth, Kaliṅga, are the hero Subhadra and the heroine Śyāmādevī. In Nairṛti’s direction and at my throat, Lampāka, are the hero Vajrabhadra and the heroine Subhadrā. In Vāyu’s direction and at my heart, Kāñchi, are the hero Mahābhairava and the heroine Hayakarṇī. In Īśāna’s direction and at my genitals, Himālaya, are the hero Vīrūpākṣa and the heroine Khagānanā.
zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi lha thams cad sku mdog dmar po sa steng la spyod pa/
The deities of the fields and the nearby fields are red and rule on the earth.

de'i phyir sku'i 'khor lo'i shar rtsibs dang mtshan ma pre ta pu rir dpa' bo stobs po che dang dpa' mo 'khor lo'i shugs can ma/ byang rtsibs dang bshang lam gr-i ha de war dpa' bo rin chen rdo rje dang dpa' mo dum skyes ma/ nub rtsibs dang brla gnyis sau rASh+Tar dpa' bo rta mgrin dang dpa' mo chad 'tshong ma/ lho rtsibs dang byin pa gnyis su war+Na dwI par dpa' bo nam mkha'i snying po dang dpa' mo 'khor lo'i go cha ma/ me dang sor mo bcu drug na ga rar dpa' bo he ru ka dang dpa' mo rab tu gtum mo/ / bden bral dang po la gong gnyis sin+d+hu rar dpa' bo pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug dang dpa' mo stobs chen ma/ rlung dang mthe bong bzhi ma rur dpa' bo rnam par snang mdzad dang dpa' mo 'khor los sgyur ma/ dbang ldan dang pus mo gnyis ku lu tar dpa' bo rdo rje sems dpa' dang dpa' mo brtson 'grus chen mo ste (142)

Outside of that, on the eastern spoke of the body cakra and at my liṅga, Pretapurī, are the hero Mahābala and the heroine Cakravegā. On the northern spoke and at my anus, Gṛhadevatā, are the hero Ratnavajra and the heroine Khaṇḍarohā. On the western spoke and at both my thighs, Saurāṣṭra, are the hero Hayagrīva and the heroine Śauṇḍinī. On the southern spoke and at my calves, Suvarṇadvīpa, are the hero Ākāśagarbha and the heroine Cakravarmiṇī. In Agni’s direction and at my sixteen fingers and toes, Nagara, are Heruka and the heroine Suvīrā. In Nairṛti’s direction and at my insteps, Sindhu, are the hero Padmanarteśvara and the heroine Mahābalā. In Vāyu’s direction and at my thumbs and big toes, Maru, are the hero Vairocana and the heroine Cakravartinī. In Īśāna’s direction and at both my knees, Kulutā, are the hero Vajrasattva and the heroine Mahāvīryā. {142}
'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba dang dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi lha thams cad sku mdog dkar po ste sa 'og la spyod pa/
The deities of the gathering places, the nearby gathering places, the charnel grounds, and nearby charnel grounds are white and rule below the earth.

de ltar 'khor lo gsum gyi dpa' bo nyer bzhi las thugs 'khor ba rnams sngon po phyag dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu/ gsung 'khor ba rnams dmar po phyag dang po gnyis kyis pad+ma dang dril bu/ sku 'khor ba rnams dkar po phyag dang po gnyis kyis 'khor lo dang dril bu rnams thugs kar bsnol stabs su bsnams pas yum nyer bzhir so sor 'khyud pa/ thams cad kyang g.yas kyi 'og ma na DA ma ru/ g.yon gyi 'og ma na kha T+wAM ga / zhabs g.yas brkyang / g.yon cung zad bskums pas ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa/ ral pa'i thor cog gyen du bcings pa phyag rgya drug gis brgyan pa/ thod pa skam po lngas dbu la brgyan pa/ stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs grol ba/ sgeg pa dang dpa' ba dang mi sdug pa/ / dgod pa dang drag shul dang 'jigs su rung ba/ snying rje dang rngams pa dang zhi ba ste gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa'o/ /

Among those twenty-four heroes of the three cakras, those of the mind cakra are blue, and their first two hands hold vajras and ghaṇṭās. Those of the speech cakra are red, and their first two hands hold lotuses and ghaṇṭās. Those of the body cakra are white, and their first two hands hold cakras and ghaṇṭās. All of them hold these items crossed at their hearts, embracing their respective consort of the twenty-four female consorts. They all hold ḍamarus in their lower right hands and khaṭvāṃgas in their lower left. Their right legs are extended, and their left are slightly bent, planted on corpse seats. Their topknots of hair are tied upward, and they are adorned with the six mudrās. Five dried skulls adorn their heads, and their tiger-skin skirts are loosely tied. They display the nine moods of the dramatic arts: erotic, heroic, revolting, laughing, fierce, terrifying, compassionate, amazing, and peaceful.

dpa' mo thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis spyan gsum mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas gri gug nam mkhar 'phyar ba/ g.yon pas thod pa khrag gis bkang ba bsnams nas rang rang gi yab la 'khyud pa/ zhabs g.yon yab kyi g.yas dang mnyam du brkyangs pas ro'i snying gar mnan pa/ g.yas kyi brla yab kyi brla g.yon par 'khril cing bzhugs pa/ dbu skra sil ma sku rgyab tu grol ba/ thod pa skam po lngas dbu la brgyan pa/ rlon pa lnga bcu'i do shal byas pa/ thugs ka'i 'khor lo phyi'i phyogs mtshams brgyad dang gtso bo'i dbang po'i sgo brgyad du hU~M brgyad spros pa yongs su gyur pa las/

All heroines have one face, two arms, three eyes, and four bared fangs. Their right hands hold aloft hooked knives, and their left hold skull cups with blood, wrapped around their respective consorts. Their left legs are extended, matching their consorts’ right ones, pressing down on the hearts of the corpses. Their right thighs are wrapped around their male consorts’ right thighs. Their hair is loose, flowing down their backs. Five dried skulls adorn their heads, and they wear necklaces of fifty fresh ones. In the eight directions and intermediate directions outside the mind cakra and in my eight sense doors, as the principal one, eight hūṃs emanate and transform.

shar phyogs dang kha mdung gis 'bigs pa'i dur khrod du khwa gdong ma sngon mo/ / byang du sna tshogs pa'i ro'i dur khrod du 'ug gdong ma ljang gu/ nub dang mtshan ma (143)rnag gi dri'i dur khrod du khyi gdong ma dmar mo/ lho dang gshang lam rul pa'i dur khrod du phag gdong ma ser mo/ / me dang rna ba g.yas byis pa shi ba'i dur khrod du gshin rje brtan ma g.yas sngo g.yon ser ba/ bden bral dang rna ba g.yon sbrul gyis bzung ba'i dur khrod du gshin rje pho nya mo g.yas ser g.yon dmar ba/ rlung dang mig g.yas drag po'i g.yul gyi dur khrod du gshin rje mche ba ma g.yas dmar g.yon ljang ba/ dbang ldan dang mig g.yon lhag ma can gyi dur khrod du gshin rje 'joms ma g.yas ljang g.yon dmar ba/

In the eastern direction and at my mouth, the Śūlabheda charnel ground, are blue Kākāsyās. In the north and at my nose, the Śavadahana charnel ground, are green Ulūkāsyās.[5] {143} In the west and at my liṅga, the Pūtigandha charnel ground, are red Śvānāsyās. In the south and at my anus, the Saklinna charnel ground, are yellow Śūkarāsyās. In Agni’s direction and at my right ear, the Bālamṛtyu charnel ground, are Yamadāḍhīs, their right sides blue, their left sides yellow. In Nairṛti’s direction and at my left ear, the Sarpadaṃśa charnel ground, are Yamadūtīs, their right sides yellow, their left sides red. In Vāyu’s direction and at my right eye, the Ghorayuddha charnel ground, are Yamadaṃṣṭriṇīs, their right sides red, their left sides green. In Īśāna’s direction and at my left eye, the Ucchiṣṭa charnel ground, are Yamamathanīs, their right sides green, their left sides red.[6]

thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag bzhi spyan gsum mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas kyi dang po na DA ma ru/ 'og ma na gri gug / g.yon gyi dang po na kha T+wA~M ga / 'og ma na thod khrag 'dzin pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyang / g.yon cung zad bskums pas ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa/ thod pa skam po lnga'i dbu rgyan dang / rlon pa lnga bcu'i do shal byas pa'o/ /

All of them have one face, four arms, three eyes, and four bared fangs. Their first right hands hold ḍamarus, and their lower right ones hold hooked knives. Their first left hands hold khaṭvāṃgas, and their lower left ones hold skull cups with blood. Their right legs are extended, and their left are slightly bent, planted on corpse seats. Five dried skulls adorn their heads, and they wear necklaces of fifty fresh ones.
bzhi pa phung khams skye mched byin rlabs ni/
D. The Consecration of the Skandhas, Dhātus, and Āyatanas

phyi nang gi he ru ka drug dang / nang gi dpa' bo nyer bzhi po thams cad kyi snying gar rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo oM haHdkar po/ mgo bor rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin na ma hi ser po/ spyi gtsug tu pad+ma gar dbang gi ngo bo swA hA hu dmar po/ phrag pa gnyis su mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo bau Sha ta he nag po/ mig gnyis su rdo rje nyi ma'i ngo bo hU~M hoHdmar ser/ yan lag thams cad la rta mchog rgyal po'i ngo bo phaT haM ljang gu ste go cha'i dpa' bo drug /

At the hearts of the six external and internal herukas and the twenty-four internal heroes are white oṃ haḥs, the essence of Vajrasattva. In their heads are yellow nama his, the nature of Vairocana. At the crowns of their heads are red svāhā hus, the essence of Padmanarteśvara. In both their shoulders are black vauṣat hes, the essence of Akṣobhya. In both their eyes are orange hūṃ hoḥs, the essence of Vajrasūrya. In all their limbs are green phaṭ haṃs, the essence of Paramāśva Rāja. Those are the six armor heroes.

phyi nang gi yum bcu/ nang gi dpa' mo nyer bzhi/ sgo mtshams ma brgyad bcas kyi lte bar rdo rje phag mo'i ngo bo oM ba~M dmar mo/ / snying gar gshin rje ma'i ngo bo ha~M ya~M sngon mo/ / kha la rmongs byed ma'i ngo bo hrI moM dkar mo/ / mgo bor skyod byed ma'i ngo bo hreM hrIM ser mo/ / spyi gtsug tu skrag byed ma'i ngo bo hu~M hU~M ljang gu/ smin mtshams su gtum mo'i (144)ngo bo phaT phaT dud ka ste go cha'i dpa' mo drug /

At the navels of the ten external and internal female consorts, the twenty-four internal heroines, and the eight female gatekeepers are red oṃ vaṃs, the essence of Vajravārāhī. At their hearts are blue haṃ yoṃs, the essence of Yāminī. At their mouths are white hrī moṃs, the essence of Mohanī. At their heads are yellow hreṃ hrīṃs, the essence of Saṃcālanī. At the crowns of their heads are green huṃ hūṃs, the essence of Saṃtrāsanī. At the points between their eyebrows are smoky phaṭ phaṭs, the essence of Caṇḍikā. {144} Those are the six armor heroines.

phyi nang gi lha thams cad kyi spyi bor zla ba'i steng du oM las sku rdo rje dkar po 'khor lo dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ mgrin par pad+ma'i steng du AHlas gsung rdo rje dmar po pad+ma dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ snying gar nyi ma'i steng du hU~M las thugs rdo rje sngon po rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ spyi gtsug tu nyi ma'i steng du hoHlas ye shes rdo rje mthing ga rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o/ /

At the heads of all the external and internal deities, on moons, from oṃs, is Vajra Body, white, holding a cakra and ghaṇṭā. At their throats, on lotuses, from āḥs, is Vajra Speech, red, holding a lotus and ghaṇṭā. In their hearts, on suns, from hūṃs, is Vajra Mind, blue, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā. At the crowns of their heads, on suns, from hoḥs, is Vajra Wisdom, deep blue, holding vajras and ghaṇṭās.
lnga pa bde chen 'khor lo bsgrub cing ye shes pa gzhug pa ni/
E. The Practice of the Mahāsukhacakra and the Entering of the Wisdom Ones

yab kyi gsang ba hU~M las rdo rje rtse lnga pa bu ga hU~M sngon pos bkag pa/ yum gyi mkha' AHlas pad+ma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa ze'u 'bru AHdmar pos bkag pa/ yab yum snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba chen po dga' ba'i sgra/ ha ha si si kun du ru/ zhes pa'i sgras sku gsung thugs ye shes rdo rje'i lha tshogs rnams kyi thugs rgyud bskul/

At my secret, as the male consort, from hūṃ, is a blue five-pointed vajra whose opening is blocked by a blue hūṃ. In the space of the female consort, from āḥ, is a red eight-petaled lotus whose pistils are blocked by a red āḥ. The joyous sounds of the great bliss of us, the male and female consorts in union, “hi hi si si kunduru,” arouse the mindstreams of the assembly of deities of Vajra Body, Speech, Mind, and Wisdom.

sku gsung thugs ye shes rdo rje'i lha tshogs rnams las 'od zer 'phros/ rten gzhal yas khang brten pa lha dang bcas pa bkug / yab kyi zhal du zhugs/ sku'i dbyibs brgyud/ yum gyi mkhar babs/ lha dang gzhal yas khang du gyur cing phyir 'phros/ rten gzhal yas khang brten pa lha dang bcas pa sngar ltar gsal bar gyur/

From the assembly of deities of Vajra Body, Speech, Mind, and Wisdom, light rays stream forth. It draws in the palace, the support, and the deities, the supported. They enter my mouth, as the male consort, and flow through the shape of my body, descending to the space of the female consort. They become deities and palaces and radiate externally. They appear clearly as the palace, the support, and the deities, the supported, as before.

rdo rje bzhi'i lha tshogs las 'od zer 'phros pas/ 'og min chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo bde mchog lha drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor steng gi cha la rtsa brgyud bla ma dang bcas pa la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dpag tu med pas bskor ba mdun gyi nam mkhar spyan drangs/

Light radiates from the assembly of deities of the four Vajras. From the palace of the dharmadhātu, Akaniṣṭha, the maṇḍala of the sixty-two deities of the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, surrounded by the root and lineage gurus above and a limitless assembly of buddhas and bodhisattvas, are invited into the space in front.
oM badzra sa mA dzaHpheM pheM pheM/ na maHsarba ta thA ga ta shrI tsakra sam+bar sarba bIr yo gi nI ye/ oM badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/ nas shab+da 'i bar gyis
oṃ vajra samājaḥ / pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ / nāmaḥ sarvatathāgata śrīcakrasamvara sarvavīrayoginīye / oṃ vajra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā…śabda…
mchod/
Thus, offer.
dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
dam tshig pa dang gnyis su med par gyur/
They become nondual with the samaya ones.
drug pa dbang bskur rgyas gdab ni/
F. The Bestowal of the Abhiṣeka and the Sealing
slar yang rdo rje bzhi'i lha las 'od zer 'phros pas dbang (145) gi lha rgyal ba rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pa spyan drangs/
Again, from the deities of the four Vajras, light rays stream forth, inviting the abhiṣeka deities, the five families of victorious ones, along with their retinues. {145}
oM badzra sa mA dzaH oM pany+tsa ku la sa pa ri wA ra/ oM badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/ zhes pa nas/ oM badzra shab+da pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṃ vajra samājaḥ / oṃ pañcakula saparivāra / oṃ vajra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā…oṃ vajra śabda pratīccha svāhā
de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis mngon par dbang bskur du gsol/
All tathāgatas, please truly bestow the abhiṣekas.
zhes gsol ba btab pas rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pas bum pa'i bdud rtsis dbang bskur bar gyur/
Having supplicated that way, the buddhas of the five families with their retinues bestow the abhiṣeka with the vase amṛta.
ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis sogs nas shrI ye hU~M/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born [the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bestow the abhiṣeka. oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya] śrīye hūṃ

zhes gsungs shing dbang bskur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / chu'i lhag ma yar lud pa las phyi nang gi gtso bo dang phyi nang gi mkha' 'gro ma gnyis dang thugs 'khor gyi lha tshogs rnams la mi bskyod pa dang / phyi nang gi gtso bo'i yum dang bud+d+ha he ru ka dang sku 'khor gyi lha rnams la rnam par snang mdzad dang / karma he ru ka dang phyi nang gi lA ma gnyis dang sgo mtshams ma brgyad la don yod grub pa dang / pad+ma he ru ka dang phyi nang gi khaN+Da ro hi dang gsung 'khor gyi lha rnams la 'od dpag med dang / rat+na he ru ka dang phyi nang gi gzugs can ma rnams la rin chen 'byung ldan rnams kyis dbur brgyan par gyur/

Thus, the abhiṣeka is bestowed. My body is filled; and my stains, purified. From the excess water rising up and overflowing, the external and internal principal ones, both external and internal Ḍākinīs, and the assembly of deities of the mind cakra are crowned by Akṣobhya; the female consorts of the external and internal principal ones, Buddha Heruka, and the assembly of deities of the body cakra are crowned by Vairocana; Karma Heruka, both external and internal Lāmas, and the eight female gatekeepers are crowned by Amoghasiddhi; Padma Heruka, the external and internal Khaṇḍarohis, and the deities of the speech cakra are crowned by Amitābha; and Ratna Heruka and the external and internal Rūpiṇīs are crowned by Ratnasambhava.
bdun pa bzlas pa bya ba ni/
G. The Recitation

lha thams cad kyi thugs ka'i thugs rdo rje'i thugs kar pad+ma dang nyi ma'i dbus su yab kyi thugs kar hU~M yig sngon po/ yum gyi thugs kar ba~M yig dmar po/ gtso bo yab yum la snying po nye snying rtsa sngags kyis bskor ba dang / 'khor rnams kyi thugs kar rang gi sa bon gyi mthar rang rang gi snying pos bskor ba las 'od zer 'phro 'dus don gnyis mdzad par gyur/ ces bsams la/

In the hearts of the Vajra Minds, who [reside] in the hearts of all the deities, are lotuses and suns. In the centers of those are blue letter hūṃs in the male consorts’ hearts and red letter vaṃs in the female consorts’ hearts. In the principal male and female consorts, those are circled by the essence, quintessence, and root mantras. In the hearts of the retinues are their respective seed syllables, surrounded by their respective essence mantras. From those, light rays radiate and gather back, performing the two benefits. Thus, contemplate.
oM shrI badzra he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/
oṃ śrīvajra he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla samvaraṃ svāhā
snying po'o/ /
That is the essence mantra.
oM hrIHha ha hu~M hU~M phaT/
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
nye snying ngo / /
That is the quintessence mantra.

oM na mo b+ha ga wa te wI re shA ya/ ma hA ka wAg+ni saM ni shA ya/ dzA Ta ma ku Tot+ka TA ya/ daM Sh+T+wA ka ra lo gra b+hi Sha Na mu khA ya/ sa ha sra b+hu dza b+hA su rA ya/ par shu pA shod+yA ta shU la kha T+wAM ga d+hA ri Ne/ (146)byA g+h+rA dzi nAM wa ra d+ha rA ya/ ma hA d+hU mrAn+d+hA kA ra wa pu ShA ya/ ka ra ka ra/ ku ru ku ru/ ban+d+ha ban+d+ha/ trA sa ya trA sa ya/ k+Sho b+ha ya k+Sho b+ha ya/ hrauM hrauM/ hraHhraH pheM pheM/ phaT phaT/ da ha da ha/ pa tsa pa tsa/ / b+hak+Sha b+hak+Sha/ ba sa ru d+hi rAn+t+ra mA lA ba laM bi ne/ gr-ih+Na gr-ih+Na/ sap+ta pA tA la ga ta b+hu dzaM ga par paM bA/ ta rdza ya ta rdza ya/ A kaD+D+h+ya A kaD+D+h+ya/ hriM hriM/ dz+nyauM dz+nyauM/ k+Sh+ma~M k+Sh+ma~M/ hA~M hA~M/ hIM hIM/ hU~M hU~M/ ki li ki li/ si li si li/ hi li hi li/ d+hi li d+hi li/ hU~M hU~M phaT/

oṃ namo bhagavate vīreśāya / mahākalpāgnisaṃniśāya / jāṭamakuṭotkaṭāya / daṃṣṭrākaralograbhiṣaṇamukhāya / sahasrabhujabhāsurāya / paraśupāśodyātaśūlakhaṭvāṃgadhāriṇe / {146} vyāghrājināṃbaradharāya / mahādhūmrāndhakāravapuṣāya / kara kara / kuru kuru / bandha bandha / trāsaya trāsaya / kṣobhaya kṣobhaya / hrauṃ hrauṃ / hraḥ hraḥ / pheṃ pheṃ / phaṭ phaṭ / daha daha / paca paca / bhakṣa bhakṣa / vasarudhirāntramālāvalaṃbine / gṛhṇa gṛhṇa / saptapātālagatabhujaṃgaparpaṃ vā / tarjaya tarjaya / ākaḍḍhya ākaḍḍhya / hriṃ hriṃ / jñauṃ jñauṃ / kṣmaṃ kṣmaṃ / hāṃ hāṃ / hīṃ hīṃ / hūṃ hūṃ / kili kili / sili sili / hili hili / dhili dhili / huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
rtsa sngags so/ /
That is the root mantra.
oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye huM hU~M phaT swA hA/
oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā
yum gyi snying po'o/ /
That is the essence mantra of the female consort.
oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
yum gyi nye snying ngo / /
That is the quintessence mantra of the female consort.
oM shrI bud+d+ha he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/
oṃ śrībuddha he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla samvaraṃ svāhā /
oM shrI karma he he= DA ki= oM shrI pad+ma he he= oM shrI rat+na he he=
oṃ śrīkarma he he…ḍāki…oṃ śrīpadma he he…oṃ śrīratna he he…
he ru ka bzhi'o/ /
Those are the mantras of the four herukas.
oM DA ki nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM lA me huM hU~M phaT/ oM khaN+Da ro hi huM hU~M phaT/ oM rU pi NI huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ ḍākinīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ lāme huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ khaṇḍarohi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ rūpiṇī huṃ hūṃ phaṭ /
snying po'i rnal 'byor ma bzhi'o/ /
Those are the four essence mantras of the yoginīs.

oM khaN+Da ka pA lI ni huM hU~M phaT/ oM pra tsaN+Da huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA kaM ka la huM hU~M phaT/ oM tsaN+Da Ak+Shi yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM kaM ka la huM hU~M phaT/ oM pra b+hA wa tI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM bi kaT daMSh+TA NI huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA nA sI huM hU~M phaT/ oM su ra bai ri Ni huM hU~M phaT/ oM bi ra ma tI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM a mi ta b+hA huM hU~M phaT/ oM kharba rI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra pra b+hA wa huM hU~M phaT/ oM laM ke shwa ri yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra de ha huM hU~M phaT/ oM dru mats+tsha ya huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ khaṇḍakapālīni huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ pracaṇḍa huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahākaṃkala huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ caṇḍa akṣiyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ kaṃkalā huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ prahāvatīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vikaṭadaṃṣṭrīṇī huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahānāsī huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ suravairiṇi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ viramatī huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ amitabhā huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ kharvarīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajraprabhava huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ laṃkeśvariyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajradeha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ drumcchaya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
thugs 'khor ro/ /
Those are the mantras of the mind cakra.

oM aM ku ri ka huM hU~M phaT/ oM ai ra wa tI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra dzA Ti la huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA b+hai ra bI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA bI ra ya huM hU~M phaT/ oM bA yu be ge huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra hU~M ka ra huM hU~M phaT/ oM su ra b+hak+Sha yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM su b+ha dra huM hU~M phaT/ oM sh+yA ma de wI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra b+ha dra huM hU~M phaT/ oM su b+ha dre huM hU~M phaT/ oM (147)ma hA b+hai ra ba hu~M hU~M phaT/ oM ha ya kar+Ne huM hU~M phaT/ oM bi rU pa Ak+Shi huM hU~M phaT/ oM kha ga a na ne huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ aṃ kurika huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ airavatīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajrajāṭila huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahābhairavīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahāvīraya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vāyuvega huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajrahūṃkāra huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ surabhakṣayai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ subhadra huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ śyāmadevīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajrabhadra huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ subhadre huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / {147} oṃ mahābhairava huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hayakarṇe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ virūpa akṣi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ khaga anane huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
gsung 'khor ro/ /
Those are the mantras of the speech cakra.

oM ma hA ba la huM hU~M phaT/ oM tsakra be ge huM hU~M phaT/ oM rat+na badzra huM hU~M phaT/ oM khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT/ oM ha ya grI wa huM hU~M phaT/ oM shauN+Di nI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM A ka sha gar+b+ha huM hU~M phaT/ oM tsakra warmi NI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM he ru ka huM hU~M phaT/ oM su bI re huM hU~M phaT/ oM pad+ma na rte shwa ra huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA ba le huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra bai ro tsa na huM hU~M phaT/ oM tsakra warti nI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra sa twa huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA bIr+Yai huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ mahābala huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ cakravege huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ratnavajra huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hayagrīva huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ śauṇḍinīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ākaśagarbha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ cakravarmiṇīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ heruka huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ suvīre huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ padmanarteśvara huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahābale huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajravairocana huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ cakravartinīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajrasatva huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahāvīryai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
sku 'khor ro/ /
Those are the mantras of the body cakra.

oM kA ka s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM U lU ka s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM shrAn ka s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM sU ka rA s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma dA d+hI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma dU ti yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma daMSh+TI NI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma ma thA nA yai huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ kākasyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ūlūkasyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ śvānakasyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ sūkarāsyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadāḍhīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadūtiyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadaṃṣṭrīṇīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamamathānāyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor te sgo mtshams ma brgyad do/ /
Those are the mantras of the samaya maṇḍala, the eight female gatekeepers.

gtso bo yab yum sngags ni nus dang 'khor rnams la de'i bcu cha la sogs ci nus bzla'o/ / ched du bsnyen skabs ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam grangs dang bzlas pa'i grangs sogs snyan brgyud zin pod ltar bya dgos so/ /

Recite the mantras of the principal male and female consorts as much as you can, and also recite the retinue mantras as much as you are able, such as doing one-tenth of that, [that is, what was done for the principal male and female consorts].[7] When specifically doing the approach, you must do the variations of samādhi, the variations of recitations, and so forth according to the Aural Transmission texts of notes.
gsum pa rjes kyi bya ba
III. The Concluding Section
['di] la bdun/
This has seven parts.
[mchod pa]
A. Offerings
bzlas pa grub pa'i mthar dang po mchod pa ni/ rgyas par dkyil chog nas byung ba'i mchod bstod rnams bya dgos kyang spros pas mi lcogs na/

Following the completion of the recitations, first make offerings. Although you should do the extensive offerings and praises that are found in the maṇḍala ritual, if it is not possible to be elaborate, do the following:
rang gi thugs ka nas spros pa'i lha mo'i tshogs kyis bdag la mchod cing bstod par bsams la /
The assembly of deities who radiate from my heart present offerings and praises to me. Thus, contemplate.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta shrI tsakra sam+ba ra sarba bi ra yo gi nI badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṃ sarvatathāgata śrīcakrasamvara sarvavīrayoginī vajra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā
zhes pa nas mtshan sngags dang bcas pas/
With the name mantra, continue:
shab+da 'i bar gyis
…śabda…
mchod/
Thus, offer.
oM badzra rU pa AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra rūpa āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du rU pa'i gnas su/ shab+da/ gan+d+he/ ra sa/ spar+she rnams bcug / oM badzra wi Ni AHhU~M/
Then, similarly, in place of rūpa, insert: …śabda…gandhe…rasa…sparśe…oṃ vajra vīṇi āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du wi Ni'i tshab tu/ waM se/ mu rany+dze/ ha s+ye/ lA l+ye/ gIrti/ nIrti/ puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ dI pe/ gan+d+he/ rU pa/ ra sa/ spar+she/ d+harma/ (148) d+hA tu/
Similarly, substitute for vīṇi: …vaṃse…murañje…hasye…lāsye…mālye…gīrti…nīrti…puṣpe…dhūpe…dīpe…gandhe…rūpa…rasa…sparśe…dharmadhātu… {148}
zhes re re bzhin bcug pas rig ma bcu drug gis mchod/
Thus, inserting each of those, offer with the sixteen vidyās.
byin gyis brlab pa'i nang mchod 'thor te/ rgyas par mdun bskyed ltar dang / bsdu na/
Sprinkle the consecrated inner offering, and, to be extensive, recite according to the front visualization or, to be abbreviated, say:
rtsa ba dang brgyud par bcas pa'i dpal ldan bla ma dam pa rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To the genuine, glorious root and lineage gurus, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta shrI tsakra sam+ba ra sarba bI ra yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra oM AHhU~M/ badzra d+harma pA la b+ha mi pa ti sa pa ri bA ra oM AHhU~M/
oṃ sarvatathāgata śrīcakrasamvara sarvavīrayoginī saparivāra oṃ āḥ hūṃ / vajra dharmapāla bhūmipati saparivāra oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes pas mchod/
Thus, offer.
gnyis pa bstod pa ni/
B. Praises
rkang pa brgyad pa sogs sam rgya gzhung gang 'grub dang bsdu na/
Do what you can, either the eight-line [praise] and the like or ones found in the Indian texts.[*8] If you wish to abbreviate, say:

chos dbyings rnam dag dbyings las ma g.yos kyang / / thabs kyis khro bo'i skur ston gdug pa 'dul/ / che ba'i che mchog lha yi lhar gyur pa/ / kun bzang he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo/ / phyag byar 'os pa thams cad la/ / sogs kyis bstod/

Though you never move from the pure expanse of the dharmadhātu, you tame malevolent ones by skillfully displaying your wrathful form. You are the greatest of the greats, the deity of deities. Homage to Samantabhadra Heruka. To all those worthy of homage, [bowing with forms as numerous as atoms in the realms, I pay homage with supreme faith at all times.]
gsum pa nongs bshags ni/
C. Confession of Wrongdoings
ma 'byor pa dang sogs he ru ka'i yig brgya lan gsum brjod/
With anything missing or done wrong, [or things I did or had others do out of my ignorance, protectors, please be patient.] Recite the heruka hundred syllables three times.
bzhi pa dkyil 'khor bsdu ba ni/
D. Dissolution of the Maṇḍala

rang gi thugs ka'i 'od kyis phog pas snod bcud thams cad 'od du zhu nas gzhal yas khang la thim/ de 'khor rnams la thim/ de gtso bo yab yum la thim/ yum yab la thim/ de ye shes sems dpa' la thim/ de thugs ka'i hU~M la thim/ de'i zhabs kyu ha la thim/ ha mgo bo la thim/ mgo bo zla tshes la thim/ zla tshes thig le la thim/ thig le nA da la thim/ de shin tu phra bar gyur nas mi dmigs par gyur/ ces mos la ci gnas su mnyam par bzhag /

Having been struck by light from my heart, the environment and its inhabitants melt into light and dissolve into the palace. That dissolves into the retinue. That dissolves into us, the principal male and female consorts. The female consort dissolves into me, the male consort, who dissolves into the wisdom sattva, who dissolves into the hūṃ at his heart. The shapkyu dissolves into the ha. The ha dissolves into its head, the head dissolves into the crescent moon, the crescent moon into the bindu, and the bindu into the nāda. That becomes extremely small, finally becoming unobservable. Remain in equipoise as long as you can.
lnga pa thun mtshams kyi lhar ldang ba ni/
E. Arising as the Deity of Postmeditation
slar rang nyid bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo bde mchog lhan cig skyes pa'i skur gyur/
Again, I become the form of the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara Sahaja.
oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/ oM AHhU~M/
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes brjod la go cha dang gnas gsum bsrung ba'i mos pa bya/
Thus, feel that the armor [has been placed] and your three places are protected.
drug pa bsngo smon ni/
F. Dedication and Aspirations
skye zhing skye bar rigs mchog tu/ / skye zhing khengs med dam tshig ldan/ / 'khor lo sdom pa ston pa dang / / brtse ldan bla mar gus gyur cig /
In birth after birth, may I be born in excellent families, keep samaya without arrogance, and respect the Teacher, Cakrasaṃvara, and my kind gurus.
skye zhing skye bar gyur pa na/ / lag pa rdo rje dril bu 'khrol/ / zab mo'i chos ni ston pa dang / / btsun mo'i shu kra len 'gyur shog /
In birth after birth, vajra in hand, playing the ghaṇṭā, and teaching the profound dharma, may I partake of the queen’s śukra. {149}
kun tu sangs rgyas thams (149)cad kyi/ / rdo rje 'chang chen go 'phang ldan/ / dge ba 'di yis thob 'gyur zhing / / 'gro ba lngas kyang thob par shog /
Through this virtue, may I attain the state of great Vajradhara, who is all buddhas always. May I enable all beings to attain that also.
byang chub rdo rjes bsngags pa yi/ / rdzogs pa'i byang chub phyir spyod dang / / rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa gang / / bdag kyang de nyid spyod par shog /
May I undertake the conduct praised by Bodhivajra: conduct done for the sake of perfect awakening and the conduct of perfect buddhas.
bdun pa shis brjod ni/
G. Expression of Auspiciousness
byin rlabs can gyi tshigs bcad ci rigs par brjod/
Recite any verses that contain blessings.
thun mtshams kyi rnal 'byor bla med spyi dang khyad par 'di nyid kyi rgyud dang man ngag las gsungs pa rnams ci nus su nyams su blang bar bya'o/ /

For the yogas done between sessions, practice what you can of what is taught in the niruttara [tantras,] in general, and, in particular, what is taught in the tantras of this [tradition] and in the esoteric instructions.
tshe gcig mchog la rab sbyor lha mchog dang / / gsang sngags zab mo rgyud nas bsngags pa yi/ / rnal 'byor zab mo mtha' ru phyin nas kyang / / bde ba mchog dang lhan cig gar byed shog /
In one supreme lifetime, may I perfect the profound yoga of the supreme deity of highest union, praised in the profound Secret Mantra tantras. May I dance together with Saṃvara.

ces snyan brgyud 'bring po dwags po lugs yin kyang bka' babs grub chen rma se blo gros rin chen la rgyu dang man ngag rgyas par bka' babs pa'i 'khor lo lnga rnams kyi rtsa ba dang gsal byed yig cha phyag len gyi rgyun bcas gcig tu bsdebs te bka' brgyud rin po che'i rjes zhugs karma ngag dbang yon tan rgya mtsho phrin las kun khyab dpal bzang pos rang lo gya bdun bar shrI de bI koTi tsA 'dra rin chen brag gi sgrub gnas su bsdebs pa'i yi ge pa ni nye bar gnas pa blo gsal gsang sngags bstan 'dzin nas bgyis pa dge legs 'phel// // (150)
(151) @#/ /dpal 'khor lo bde mchog dwags po snyan brgyud lugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bde chen sdom pa zhes bya ba bzhugs so// //
21. Saṃvara of Great Bliss. The Maṇḍala Ritual for the Dakpo Aural Transmission Tradition of the Glorious Cakrasaṃvara[1]
(152) @#/ /gu ru DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM na mA mi/
guru ḍākinījāla samvaraṃ namāmi

dpal ldan snying rje'i stobs can baiDU'i lang tsho 'bar/ / chos kun gnyis su mi phyed khyab cing rtag pa'i sku/ / bde chen thig le gcig tu phrin las lhun rdzogs pa/ / khyab bdag bla ma'i ngo bo he ru ka dpal zhabs la 'dud/

Glorious one with the strength of compassion, blazing with vaiḍūrya splendor, your kāya endures and pervades all phenomena without creating dualities, and you innately perfect activity as the one bindu of great bliss. To the feet of the glorious Heruka, essence of the omnipresent lord guru, I bow.
grub pa'i snyan brgyud las byung zhing / / man ngag rang bzos ma bslad pa/ / skal ldan rjes bzung dbang bskur bcas/ / dkyil 'khor cho ga gsal bar dgod/ /

[Here,] for followers of good fortune, is clearly arranged the maṇḍala ritual and abhiṣekas found in the Aural Transmission of siddhas and the esoteric instructions, not adulterated by personal fabrication.

dpal 'khor lo bde mchog snyan brgyud yid bzhin nor bu'i dkyil 'khor chen po sgrub cing mchod nas slob ma rjes su bzung ba'i rim pa rtsa ba'i gzhung las bla med spyi dang mthun par rgya cher gsungs kyang 'dir dkyus su lag len bya sla ba'i ched du dgos don snying por dril ba la/

Following the sādhana and pūjā of the great maṇḍala of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara Aural Transmission, the process for guiding disciples is taught extensively within the root texts in keeping with the niruttara [tantras] in general. However, here, in order to make the usual procedure easy to implement, I have condensed the necessary topics into what is essential.

thog mar sa brtag slong sbyong srung gi skor rnams sgrub gnas rnying pa dang ras bris dkyil 'khor la mi dgos pas ma smos/ / rdul tshon dkyil 'khor bzhengs grub na de dag gi phyag len snyan brgyud yid bzhin nor bu'i dbang gi phyag len thugs kyi 'khor lo'i pod du bzhugs pa las shes par bya'o/ /

First, since the examining of the ground, requesting it, purifying it, and protecting it are not necessary in an old place of practice or with a cloth-drawn maṇḍala, they are not described. If you are constructing a maṇḍala from colored powders, that procedure should be learned from the procedures for the abhiṣekas of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Aural Transmission contained in the volume of the Mind Cycle.
'dir 'chad par bya ba la gsum/ dang po sta gon/ gnyis pa dngos gzhi/ gsum pa rjes tshogs mchod sogs bya ba'i tshul lo/ /
Here, the explanation has three parts: (1) the prelude, (2) the main practice, and (3) the conclusion, which is how to do the gaṇapūjā and so forth.
dang po sta gon
I. The Prelude
['di] la bzhi yod pa las/
This has four parts.
sa'i lha mo sta gon bya ba ni/
A. The Prelude for the Earth Goddess

slob dpon gyis bdag bskyed bzlas pa bsdu ldangs bcas sngon tu btang nas/ dkyil 'khor gang du bya ba'i gzhir maN+Dal la me tog gi tshom bu (153 )gcig dgod/ de'i mdun du sa lha'i gtor ma dkar zlum dang / mthar mchod pas bskor ba bshams nas/ bsang sbyang /

The ācārya begins with the self visualization, the recitation, dissolution, and arising. Next, on the ground, wherever the maṇḍala is, arrange a bunch of flowers on a maṇḍala [plate]. {153} In front of that, place a white round torma for the Earth Goddess and arrange offerings outside of that in a circle. Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las mdun du dri'i maN+Dal gyi dbus su lA~M las sa'i lha mo sku mdog ser mo dar gyi na bza' dang rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ phyag g.yas dam bca' khas len pa'i phyag rgya can/ g.yon rin po che'i bum pa 'dzin pa/ gnas gsum 'bru gsum gyis mtshan pa bzhugs par gyur/

Within emptiness, in front, in the center of a perfumed maṇḍala, from lāṃ, appears the Earth Goddess, yellow, adorned with silk garments and various precious ornaments. Her right hand is in the mudrā of making a promise, and her left hand holds a precious vase. Her three places are marked with the three seed syllables.
rang gi thugs ka'i 'od zer gyis bskul bas sa 'og nas sa'i lha mo spyan drangs par gyur/
From my heart, light rays arouse, and from below, the Earth Goddess is invited.
ces bsams te lag g.yas rdo rje dang bcas pa'i rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya sa la lan gsum rdeb pa dang mnyam du/
Thus, contemplate. Holding a vajra in your right hand making the three-pointed mudrā, strike the earth three times while saying:
hU~M hU~M hU~M/
hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ
zhes dang /
And:
oM
oṃ

tshur byon tshur byon lha mo che/ / sa yi lha mo 'jig rten yum/ / rin chen kun gyis rab gang ma/ / mchog gi rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan/ / mgul do zhabs gdub sil sil bcas/ / rdo rje sems dpa' rab mchod ma/ / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bka' yis ni/ / skad cig nyid la 'dir spyon cig /

Come here, come here, great goddess. Earth Goddess, mother of the world, the lady filled with all precious things, adorned with all sublime ornaments, with tinkling necklaces and anklets, you who worship Vajrasattva: through the command of Vajradhara, come here in an instant.
oM laM bA su d+hA ri dzaH dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
oṃ laṃ vāsudhāri jaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ baṃ hoḥ /
oM pr-i thI wI de wI pra wa ra sat+kA ra/ oM badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṃ pṛthīvīdevī pravarasatkāra / oṃ vajra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā
Ar+g+haM gyi mal du/ pA d+yaM/ A tsa ma naM/ prok+ShaNaM/ puMSh+pe nas/ shab+da 'i bar rnams (154) bcug pas mchod/
In place of arghaṃ, insert pādyaṃ, ācamanaṃ, prokṣaṇaṃ, puṣpe, up through śabda, and offer. {154}
gtor ma bsang sbyang spyi ltar byin gyis brlab pa'am/
Consecrate the torma by cleansing and purifying as usual, or say:
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
lan gsum gyi brlabs nas/
Saying that three times, consecrate it.
mdun gyi lha mo'i ljags 'od zer gyi sbu gus gtor ma'i bdud rtsi drangs te gsol bas dgyes par gyur/
The goddess in front with her hollow tongue of light draws in and drinks the amṛta of the torma and is thereby pleased.
oM AHhU~M laM bA su d+hA ri ba liM ta kha kha khA hi khA hi/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ laṃ vāsudhāri baliṃta kha kha khāhi khāhi
lan gsum/
Three times.

ma ma rin chen sna tshogs 'dzin/ / sku phyed thon te gser gyi mdog / rin chen sna tshogs rgyan gyis brgyan/ / lha mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ / bum pa dam bca'i phyag rgya can/ / khyod ni sa 'dzin lha mo ste/ / sa 'og gtso mo khyod la 'dud/ /

Dhātrī, holding various jewels, with a body half showing, golden in color, adorned with various precious ornaments, goddess with one face and two arms, with a vase and the mudrā of promise, you are the goddess holding the earth. To you, Principal Lady below the earth, I bow.
ces bstod nas/
Thus, praise.
skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi/ / spyod pa'i tshul dang khyad par gyi/ / sa dang pha rol phyin ma la/ / lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur/ /
Goddess, you witness the conduct and, especially, the bhūmis and pāramitās of all buddhas, the refuge.
shAkya seng ge skyob pa yis/ / ji ltar bdud kyi sde bcom pa/ / de bzhin bdag gis bdud sde las/ / rgyal bar bya phyir dkyil 'khor bri/ /
Just as the Lion of the Śākyas, the refuge, vanquished the hordes of Māra, to be victorious over the hordes of Māra, I will draw the maṇḍala.

zhes lan gsum gyis gsol ba btab pa la/ lha mos/ kyai/ rig pa 'dzin pa ji ltar dgyes pa bzhin du mdzod cig /ces gnang ba byin par gyur/ de la gtang rag gi tshul du/ oM pr-i thI wI de wi sogs kyis gong ltar mchod/
Saying that three times, supplicate. The Goddess says: “Kye. Vidyādhara, do as is pleasing.” Thus, she gives her permission. As thanks for that, offer as before: oṃ pṛthīvīdevī…
zhes mchod pas dgyes te dkyil 'khor gyi gzhi la thim par gyur/ ces bsam/
Pleased by that offering, [the Earth Goddess] dissolves into the ground of the maṇḍala. Thus, contemplate.
gnyis pa lha sta gon ni/
B. The Prelude for the Deity

bsang gtor dang dri bzang gi chus gtor ba'i gzhir slob dpon gyis gtso bo yab yum gyi snying po dang nye snying lan gsum gsum brjod de dbus su dri'i thig le gru bzhi dang / he ru ka bzhi'i sngags brjod de phyogs bzhir zlum por byas par las rdor gyis me tog gi tshum bu re dgod/ de'i mdun du gtor ma dang / mtha' mchod pas bskor te/ bsang sbyang /

On ground that has been sprinkled with purifying water and scented water, the ācārya should recite the essence and quintessence mantras of the principal male and female consorts three times each. In the center of that ground, make a square of scented drops and recite the mantras of the four herukas. In the four directions, make circles. The vajra assistant should arrange bunches of flowers in each one. In front of that, place a torma encircled by offerings. Cleanse and purify.
oM kA ya wA ka tsit+ta At+ma ko‘haM/
oṃ kāya vāk citta ātmako ’haṃ

snod bcud thams cad stong bar gyur/ ces pa nas/ lte ba mthing nag yangs shing rgya che ba/ / zhes pa'i bar dang / de'i phyi rol du dur khrod chen po brgyad kyis bskor ba/ sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba b+h+rU~M dkar po sogs nas/ rang rig dang / bdag nyid zer ba dang / yab kyi gsang ba sogs dor nas/ gsal bar gyur/ ces pa'i bar dang / bsnyen dmigs dang sngags (155) bzla ba rnams dor bas bstod pa'i bar sgrub thabs ltar bya/ spro na mchod bstod mdun bskyed ltar byas te/ rdor dril spos bcas 'dzin pas/

The environment and its inhabitants become empty…. Its center is deep blue, spacious, and vast.[*1] Outside that are the encircling eight charnel grounds. In the center of a viśvavajra is a white bhrūṃ… .[*2] Leave out “my own reflexive awareness,”[*3] “I,”[*4] and “at my secret, as the male consort.”[*5] Continue up to: They clearly become the palace, the support, and the deities, the supported, as before.[*6] {155} Leaving out the approach visualization and the mantra recitation, continue through the praises according to the sādhana. If you wish to elaborate, do the offerings and praises according to the front visualization. Holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā with incense, say:

gnyis med ye shes las byung ba'i/ / khyab bdag dngos kun bdag nyid can/ / ston pa'i gtso bo he ru ka / phag mor lhan cig yang dag ldan/ / gang zhig phyogs bcu'i dpa' bo dang / / rig pa'i lha mo rdzu 'phrul can/ / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs kun/ / ma lus bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /

Omnipresent lord arising from nondual wisdom, embodiment of all things, Heruka, the primary teacher, truly united with Vārāhī, heroes of the ten directions, goddesses of awareness endowed with magical powers, all the bodhisattvas and others, everyone, please regard me.
slob ma la ni phan pa dang / / khyed rnams la yang mchod pa'i phyir/ / rdo rje can bdag 'di zhes pas/ / nangs par dkyil 'khor bzhengs par bgyi/ /
In order to benefit disciples and also to worship you, I, the Vajrin, called such-and-such, will construct the maṇḍala in the morning.
rjes su brtse bas nyer dgongs te/ / kun gyis byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ / zhes gsol ba btab pas gnang ba byin par gyur/
Please regard me closely with your kindness. May all give their blessings. Having thus been supplicated, they give their permission.
u t+tiSh+Tha/ zhes pas dkyil 'khor nam mkhar btegs pa nam mkhar bzhugs par gyur/ ces brjod cing bsam mo/ /
uttiṣṭha Thus, the maṇḍala rises up in space and resides in space. Thus, contemplate.
gsum pa bum pa sta gon ni/
C. The Vase Prelude
bum pa gnyis la gu gul gyis bdug / yungs kar gyi brab/ bum rdzas so lnga btab pa chas dang ldan pa bsang sbyang /
Two vases should be fumigated with guggula and pelleted with mustard seeds. Place the thirty-five vase substances inside. Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las pa~M las pad+ma dang a las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du b+h+rU~M las rin po che'i bum pa gnyis ka rtsa ba dang nag po med pa/ lto ba yangs pa/ mgrin pa ring ba/ mchu 'phyang ba/ kha g.yel ba/ lha rdzas kyi gos kyis mgrin pa dkris pa/ dpag bsam gyi shing gis kha brgyan pa/ de'i nang du sman lnga/ 'bru lnga/ rin po che lnga/ dri lnga/ snying po lnga/ lcags kyu lnga/ sgron ma lnga rnams dang / lha'i bdud rtsi'i chus yongs su gang ba'i dbus su sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar pad+ma nyi zla 'jigs byed dus mtshan dang bcas pa'i steng du hU~M sngon po dang ba~M dmar po/ de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa'i lte bar hU~M sngon pos mtshan pa dang / gri gug dmar po ba~M dmar pos mtshan pa/

Within emptiness, from paṃ, appears a lotus. From a comes a moon maṇḍala, above which, from bhrūṃs, appear precious vases. Both vases have a base and no black, a spacious belly, a long neck, a spout, and a wide mouth. Their necks are tied with cloths of divine substances and adorned with branches from wish-granting trees. Inside, they are filled with the five medicinal herbs, the five grains, the five jewels, the five scents, the five essences, the five hooks, the five lamps, and amṛta water of the gods. In their centers, in the middle of multicolored eight-petaled lotuses are lotuses, suns, moons, Bhairavas, and Kālarātris. Above those are blue hūṃs and red vaṃs. Those transform into blue five-pointed vajras whose centers are marked by hūṃs and red hooked knives marked by red vaṃs.
de'i phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhi'i zhes pa nas rang rig dang / bdag nyid zer ba dor te/ ye shes rdo rje mthing ga (156) rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/

Outside of those, on the lotus petals in the four directions,…[*7] Leave out “my own reflexive awareness”[*8] and “I.”[*9] Continue up to: …are Vajra Wisdom, deep blue, holding vajras and ghaṇṭās.[*10] {156}
zhes pa'i bar sgrub thabs ltar brjod/
Thus, recite according to the sādhana.

las bum gyi dbus su pad+ma nyi ma ro'i gdan gyi steng du ba~M las khaN+Da ro hI nI dmar mo zhal gcig spyan gsum phyag gnyis gri gug dang thod khrag 'dzin pa/ phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa gsal bar gyur/ bum mtshan rnams kyang rigs lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur/

In the middle of the activity vase, on lotus, sun, and corpse seats, from paṃ,[2] clearly appears red Khaṇḍarohīnī, with one face, three eyes, two hands holding a hooked knife and skull cup of blood, adorned with the five mudrās. The qualities of the vase are of the natures of the five families.
rdo rje bzhi'i lha tshogs las 'od zer 'phros pas/ zhes pa nas/ dbur brgyan par gyur/ bar dang / las bum gyi lha la 'od dpag med kyis dbur brgyan par gyur/
From the assembly of deities of Vajra Body, Speech, Mind, and Wisdom, light rays stream forth,…crowned by Ratnasambhava.[*11] And: The deity of the activity vase is crowned by Amitābha.
mchod bstod sgrub thabs ltar ram/ spro na mdun bskyed ltar byas nas gzungs thag blangs te/
Do the offerings and praises according to the sādhana, or if you wish to elaborate, do them according to the front visualization. Pick up the dhāraṇī cord and say:

rang gi thugs ka'i sa bon las sngags phreng 'od zer dang bcas pa 'phros/ gzungs thag la brgyud nas bum lha'i thugs kar phog pas thugs rgyud bskul bas sku las bdud rtsi'i rgyun babs pas bum pa khengs par gyur/

From the seed syllable in my heart, a mantra garland with light rays radiates. It moves along the dhāraṇī cord and strikes the hearts of the vase deities, arousing their mindstreams. A stream of amṛta flows from their bodies, filling the vase.
ces bsams la rnam rgyal gyi lha la lha lnga'am/ spro na 'khor sngags rnams gsum re tsam dang / las bum la/
Thus, contemplate. For the deity of the victory vase, recite the mantras of the five deities or, if you wish, the retinue mantras, three times each. For the activity vase, recite:
oM khaN+Da ro hi huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ khaṇḍarohi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
ces bzlas nas mchod bstod sgrub thabs ltar byas la yig brgya lan gsum dang /
Do the offerings and praises according to the sādhana, and recite the hundred syllables three times.
ma 'byor pa dang sogs kyis bzod gsol dang /
With anything missing or done wrong, [or things I did or had others do out of my ignorance, protectors, please be patient.] Thus, request patience.
oM badzra u da ka hU~M/ oM AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra udaka hūṃ / oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes dung zhal gyi chus mchod yon phul ba'i rkyen gyis bum pa'i lha rnams rjes su chags pa'i mes zhu ba las bum chu dang dbyer med du gyur/
Offer conch water, and say: Through the connection of presenting offering water, the vase deities melt into a fire of passion and become inseparable with the vase water.
ces bsam/ las thams cad pa'i lhas dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba mthar ma phyin gyi bar du bgegs rnams bzlog pa'i phrin las mdzod cig / ces brjod de yig brgya bzla'o/ /
Thus, contemplate. May the deity of all actions perform the activity of averting all obstructors until the activities of the maṇḍala have been completed. Say that and recite the hundred syllables.
bzhi pa slob ma sta gon ni/
D. The Prelude for the Disciples

slob ma rnams la sgo nyung ngu khus byas phyag 'tshal gral du 'khod pa la sbyor ba gsum spyi ltar byed pa dang srung 'khor sgom pa'ang brgyud pa'i phyag bzhes su bzhugs pas spro na spyi ltar byas nas/ kun slong bcos pa dang chos bshad ci rigs byas mthar/

The disciples wash in front of the door, prostrate, and sit in rows. Do the three types of preparation as is customarily done.[3] Since the meditation on the protection cakra is found in the lineage procedures, if you wish to elaborate, do that as is customarily done. Explain the intention to be developed and give a relevant explanation of the dharma. At the end, say:

gangs can gyi ljongs 'dir byon no cog gi lo tsA zhig la mkhas grub chos brgyud 'gro don gang thad nas 'gran zla thams cad dang bral ba rje lho brag mar pa lo tsA chos kyi blo gros zhes grags (157) pa de nyid kyis rgya gar 'phags pa'i yul du lan gsum/ bal por lan bzhi ste/ rgya gar dang bal po'i yul du lan bdun byon/

Of all the lotsāwas to appear in this Land of Snows, the one whose dharma transmission is from the scholar-siddhas and who is unrivaled in being of benefit to beings in all kinds of ways is known as the exalted Lhodrak Marpa Lotsāwa Chökyi Lodrö. {157} He traveled to India and Nepal seven times: to the Noble Land of India three times and to Nepal four times.

dpal nA ro pa chen pos thog drangs pa'i mkhas grub kyi bla ma brgya dang bcu gnyis/ brgyud pa 'dzin pa'i bla ma brgya dang lnga bcu rtsa gsum/ gzhan rig mngon par shes pa'i bla ma bcu gsum/ khyad par grub thob zhe lnga/ rje 'gran gyi do med nA ro mai tri rnam gnyis kyi drung du lo hril po bcu dgu'i bar du bzhugs/

Marpa had one hundred and twelve gurus who were scholar-siddhas, led by the glorious, great Nāropa. He had one hundred and fifty-three gurus who were lineage holders. He had thirteen gurus with the supercognitive abilities of knowing others’ minds. Notably, there were forty-five siddhas. He spent altogether nineteen years in the presence of the two unrivaled exalted ones, Nāropa and Maitrīpa.

khyad par du'ang dpal nA ro pa chen po lo drug zla ba bdun gyi bar du sku'i grib ma ltar 'bral med du bsten nas thugs dam dgyes pa rdo rjes thog drangs rgyud dang man ngag bsam gyis mi khyab pa gsan pa'i tshul rnams rdo rje'i mgur las 'byung ba ltar lags/

In particular, he attended the glorious, great Nāropa for six years and seven months, never separating from him like a shadow. The way he heard the inconceivable esoteric instructions and tantras, led by the yidam Hevajra, is as recounted in his vajra songs.

khyad par bde mchog mkha' 'gro snyan brgyud ces brgyud pa mang po'i bar du gcig brgyud kyi rgyas btab pa 'di nyid grub chen tai lo pa chen pos o rgyan gsang ba'i pho brang du rgyal yum rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la zhus pa'i tshe sku gsung thugs kyi brda gsum bstan te yid bzhin nor bu skor gsum gyi smin grol gdams ngag stsal ba rnams dpal nA ro pa chen po kho na la gnang /

Specifically, this Saṃvara Ḍākinī Aural Transmission, which was sealed as a single transmission for many [generations of] transmission, is the teachings received by the mahāsiddha, the great Tilopa when he supplicated Vajrayoginī, the mother of the victors, in the secret palace in Oḍḍiyāna. He was taught the three symbols of body, speech, and mind and given the maturing and liberating instructions of the Three Cycles of Wish-Fulfilling Gems. These he bestowed only on the glorious, great Nāropa.
