rje mar pa rgya gar du lan gsum byon pa'i rjes mar dpal nA ro pa chen po spyod pa la gshegs zin cing gsol ba btab cing yun ring du btsal bas byang puny+tsa ha rir mngon sum du mjal zhing zla ba drug tu bsten pa'i skabs bde mchog yab bka' yum bka' snyan brgyud kyi gdams pa rnams rdzogs par gnang / mar ston chen pos slob ma mes rdog mtshur gsum sogs la dgyes gsang gtsos rgyud sde rnams kyi bshad bka' lag len rgyas par gnang / bde mchog snyan brgyud skor rje btsun mi la kho na la gcig brgyud du stsal/

At the end of the exalted Marpa’s three trips to India, the glorious, great Nāropa had gone off to engage in [yogic] conduct. Marpa supplicated him and searched for him for a long time, finally actually meeting him in Puṣpahari in the north.[4] During the following six months that Marpa attended Nāropa, Nāropa bestowed upon him the complete instructions of the Aural Transmission of Saṃvara, Yab Ka and Yum Ka. The great teacher Marpa fully bestowed upon his three students Mai, Ngok, and Tsur, and others the extensive explanations and procedures of the classes of tantras, principally Hevajra and Guhyasamāja. He gave the Saṃvara Aural Transmission Cycle as a single transmission only to Jetsun Milarepa.

mi la ras pa grub pa brnyes skabs snyan brgyud kyi bka' rgya cung zad grol ba rdo rje rnal 'byor mas lung bstan pa ltar ras pa mched brgyad la cha shas (158) re gnang ba'i sgros 'dug kyang gzhan rnams mkha' spyod du byon pa tsam las chos rgyun 'dzin pa 'di byung gi gsal kha mi 'dug / ras chung rdo rje grags par gnang ba la ras chung snyan brgyud ces 'bring po dang / dwags po rin po cher gnang ba la dwags po snyan brgyud ces rgyas pa dang / ngom rdzong ras par gnang ba la ngom rdzong snyan brgyud ces bsdus par grags pa gsum da lta'i bar du smin grol gdams ngag dang bcas pa'i rgyun ma chad par bzhugs pa las 'dir dwags po rin po ches dpal ldan dus gsum mkhyen pa la chig brgyud du gnang /

When Milarepa achieved siddhi, the command seal of the Aural Transmission was slightly loosened, and in accordance with the directive given by Vajrayoginī, it is said that he bestowed certain parts on the eight repa brothers. {158} However, these others simply went to the celestial realm, and it is not clear what became of the continuity of that dharma. What he bestowed upon Rechung Dorje Drakpa is called the Rechung Aural Transmission and is the intermediate one. What he bestowed upon Dakpo Rinpoche is called the Dakpo Aural Transmission and is the extensive one. What he bestowed upon Ngomdzong Repa is called the Ngomdzong Aural Transmission and is considered the abbreviated one. These three have continued until now as unbroken streams of maturation and liberation along with their instructions. Among these, Dakpo Rinpoche bestowed [the Dakpo Aural Transmission] as a single transmission on the glorious Dusum Khyenpa.

de nas brgyud pa bcu gsum par dpal tai lo sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam 'phrul me nyag grub thob rma se blo gros rin chen nyid byon pa dang snyan brgyud kyi bka' grol bar lung bstan pa ltar rje lnga pa de bzhin gshegs pas me nyag grub chen nyid la snyan brgyud rdzogs par gnang / des rtogs ldan ya brgyad/ 'ja' mo mi gsum sogs la rdzogs par gnang ba'i gdams skor 'di la nor bu skor gsum gyi nang tshan smin lam yid bzhin nor bu la yab rgyal po lta bu'i smin byed rgyas 'bring bsdus gsum bzhugs pa las da lam yab 'khor lo bde mchog lha drug cu rtsa bzhi'i sgo nas dbang bskur bgyid pa yin/

It was prophesied that Menyak siddha, Mase Lodrö Rinchen, an emanation of the buddha, the glorious Tilopa, would appear as the thirteenth [person to receive] the transmission and the command seal for the Aural Transmission would be removed. In keeping with that, the fifth lord, Dezhin Shekpa, bestowed the complete Aural Transmission on Menyak mahāsiddha. He bestowed it completely on the eight with realization, the three men of Jamo, and others. This instruction cycle consists of the Three Cycles of Gems. Within that, the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Maturing Path contain the extensive, intermediate, and abbreviated means of maturation of the king-like male consort. Among those, now the abhiṣeka of Cakrasaṃvara, the male consort, will be bestowed by means of the sixty-four deities.
de la sta gon dang dngos gzhi gnyis las thog mar sngon 'gro sta gon gyi chos rnams zhu ba'i yon du zhing khams re 'bul bar zhu/
Among the two, the prelude and the main practice, first, as a gift to request the dharma of the preliminary prelude, offer a pure realm.

de nas nang dbang gi slad du dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/ slob dpon he ru ka yab yum gyi thugs ka nas 'od zer 'phros/ slob ma sogs sems can thams cad lha bde mchog tu gyur/ de rnams 'od kyi gong bur zhu ba yab kyi zhal du zhugs/ sku'i dbyibs brgyud nas yum gyi mkhar babs te sras kyi rang bzhin gyi bde mchog sngon po rdor dril 'dzin par gyur pa la/ rgyal ba rab 'byams spyan drangs/ 'od dang bdud rtsir zhu ba spyi gtsug gi gser gyi sgo nas zhugs/ byang chub sems kyi bdud rtsi dang lhan cig (159) mgrin pa man gyi gnas bzhir babs pas dga' bzhi myong / lhan skyes kyi bde ba'i rten du bas pas khyed rang gi spyi bo nas dbang bskur/ bde ba chen po'i ye shes skyes/

Then, for the sake of the inner abhiṣeka, visualize as follows: Light rays stream forth from the heart of the ācārya Heruka, male and female consorts. All sentient beings—the disciples and others—become Saṃvara deities. They all melt into balls of light, which enter the mouth of the male consort. Those flow through his body, descending into the space of the female consort, and become blue Saṃvaras, whose natures are those of children, holding vajras and ghaṇṭās. Infinite victors are invited. They melt into light and amṛta and enter through the golden doors at the crowns of their heads. {159} Together with bodhicitta-amṛta, those fall to the four places, the throat and below, and the four joys are experienced. The support for connate bliss having been formed, you have received abhiṣeka through the top of your heads. The wisdom of great bliss dawns.

mthar yab yum gyi pad+ma nas phyir spros te so so'i gdan la 'khod pa'i mos pa mdzod/ des ni 'jug pa'i skor rnams nyan pa la dbang bar byas pa dang sras su byas phyir 'di phyin chad bu tshur theg pa chen po las sogs bu zhes 'bod par byed pa yin/

Finally, radiating outward from the lotus of the female consort, who is with the male consort, feel that you are taking your own seats. Because you are being empowered to listen to the cycle for entering and are considered to be a child, from now on, you will be called “child,” in the context of “Come, child, into the Mahāyāna” and other verses.
de nas me tog dang bcas pa'i thal mo sbyor la dkyil 'khor du 'jug par gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Now, with your hands in añjali holding flowers, supplicate to enter the maṇḍala by repeating the following three times:
dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa po/ / slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol/ / byang chub chen po'i tshul bstan pa/ / mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo/ /
Great joy, you are my teacher. Ācārya, please consider me. I request the great protector to teach the way to great awakening.
dam tshig de nyid bdag la stsol/ / byang chub sems kyang bdag la stsol/ / sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / skyabs gsum dag kyang bdag la stsol/ /
Bestow on me this samaya. Bestow on me bodhicitta. Bestow on me the three refuges: the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha.
thar pa chen po'i grong khyer du/ / mgon pos bdag ni gzhug tu gsol/ /
Protector, please enter me into the city of great liberation.
de nas spro ba bskyed cing nyan par bskul ba ni/ /
The following will generate your interest and arouse your wish to listen.
bu tshur theg pa chen po las/ / khyod ni tshul chen snod yin gyi/ / gsang sngags spyod pa'i cho ga ni/ / khyod la yang dag bshad par bya / /
Come, child, into the Mahāyāna. You are a receptacle of the great way. I will explain to you fully the rituals for the practices of Secret Mantra.

rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang 'das dang / / de bzhin gang dag ma byon dang / / da ltar byung ba'i rdzogs sangs rgyas/ / 'gro la phan phyir bzhugs pa kun/ / de dag kun gyis gsang sngags kyi/ / cho ga bzang po 'di mkhyen nas/ / dpa' bo byang chub shing drung du/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan ma brnyes/ /

All the perfect buddhas of the past, those yet to come, and the perfect buddhas appearing now, who remain to benefit beings, all know this excellent ritual of Secret Mantra. The hero under the bodhi tree attained the signs of omniscience.
gsang sngags spyod pa mnyam med de/ / skyob pa shAkya seng ge yis/ / bdud sde shin tu mi bzad pa'i/ / dpung chen dag kyang 'di yis bcom/ /
Through the unequaled practice of Secret Mantra, the refuge, the Lion of the Śākyas, conquered the great armies, the frightful hordes of Māra.
de bas kun mkhyen thob bya'i phyir/ / bu yis blo gros 'di gyis shig /
Therefore, in order to attain omniscience, child, hold this in mind.
ces dang /
And:
rtog pa thams cad legs par bsdus (160)nas ni/ / shin tu bsam pa bzang dang ldan pas nyon/ / brjed ngas blo la rdo rje sems sogs kyi/ / dus gsum rgyal ba rnams kyis byin mi rlob/ /
Gathering all thoughts, {160} listen with an excellent intention. The victors of the three times, Vajrasattva and others, do not bless those with a forgetful mind.

ces gsungs pa'i don ltar dga' spro khyad par can bskyed pa dang / nyan par gdams pa'i don ltar rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis nyan par mdzad 'tshal/ de nas bla ma dang dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor dang / gzhan yang sangs rgyas byang sems ma lus pa'i drung du phyag 'tshal ba sogs yan lag bdun pa dang / skyabs su 'gro ba dang / sems bskyed pa dang / khyad par byang sdom bzung nas srung snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/

In keeping with the meaning of what was just said, arouse special enthusiasm and joy. In keeping with the meaning of the instructions for listening, please listen with a one-pointed mind. Then, in the presence of the gurus, the maṇḍala of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, and all buddhas and bodhisattvas, think that you offer the sevenfold service, such as homage, that you take refuge, arouse bodhicitta, and, in particular, will hold and preserve the vows of a bodhisattva. Repeat the following three times:
rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po dang / / rgyal sras tshogs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
I pay homage to great Vajradhara and the victorious ones and their children.
lus dang longs spyod mchod bgyis nas/ / bdag gis sdig pa gang bgyis dang / / bgyid du stsal dang yi rang rnams/ / sangs rgyas spyan sngar mchis nas ni/ / de dag thams cad bshags par bgyi/ /
I offer my body and possessions. Whatever negative actions I have done, have commanded to be done, or have rejoiced in, I confess all of them in the presence of the buddhas.
sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang / / rang rgyal nyan thos 'gro rnams kyis/ / bsgoms dang bzlas brjod bsod nams gang / / de la bdag ni yi rang ngo/ /
I rejoice in the merit gathered by the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and all beings through their meditations and recitations.
sems bskyed mngon par sangs rgyas nas/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi mchog / de la bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ /
I take refuge in the supreme of assemblies of bodhisattvas who have aroused bodhicitta, awakened fully, and turn the wheel of dharma.
sangs rgyas 'byung ba ji lta bar/ / skal ldan byang chub sems dpa' yis/ / byang chub sems ni bskyed pa ltar/ / de bzhin du ni sems bskyed do/ /
I arouse bodhicitta just as the fortunate bodhisattvas have aroused bodhicitta, in the same way the buddhas have done.
bdag gis dge ba'i las rnams 'di dag gis/ / 'jig rten du ni myur du sangs rgyas shog / 'gro la phan phyir chos rnams ston bgyid cing / / sems can sdug bsngal mang pos gzir las sgrol/ /

May I, through all these virtuous actions, quickly become a buddha in the world. For the sake of beings, may I teach the dharma. May sentient beings be free from the torments of their many sufferings.
de nas sngags sdom la thun mong ba brtul zhugs nyer lnga po 'dzin cing srung snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Next, think that you will hold and protect the twenty-five disciplines common to the vows of Mantra, and repeat the following three times:
rdo rje 'dzin pa dgongs su gsol/ /
Vajradhara, please consider me.
thun mong brtul zhugs sdom pa ni/ / (161) srog gcod rdzun du smra ba dang / / gzhan gyi bud med nor 'phrog dang / / chang 'thung myos par mi bgyi'o/ /
As the vows of the common disciplines, {161} I will not kill, lie, take another’s spouse or wealth, and will not drink alcohol and become intoxicated.
rgyan po kha na ma tho'i zas/ / dam tshig bstan bcos smra ba dang / / mu stegs kla klo'i chos spyod min/ /
I will not gamble or consume prohibited food. I will not expound treatises with negative language, and will not engage in the dharma of tīrthikas or barbarians.
dud 'gro byis pa bud med dang / / skyes pa mchod rten bsnun mi bya/ /
I will not harm animals, children, women, men, and stūpas.
dag pa'i grogs dang rje bo dang / / dge 'dun rnams dang rgyal ba dang / / yid gtad rnams la 'khu mi bya/ /
I will not be hostile to good friends, leaders, the saṅgha, the victors, and those who are trustworthy.
gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya la/ / mig sogs dbang po zhen mi bya/ / nga rgyal tshig rtsub spro thung dang / / phra ma sdig pa'i grogs rnams spang / /

I will not be attached to the forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects appearing to my eyes and other senses. I will abandon arrogance, harsh speech, short-temperedness, divisive speech, and evil friends.
phyag rgya mtshan ma grib 'gom min/ / bya ba ma yin rnam par spang / / kha na ma tho'i las 'di dag / deng nas brtsams te spang bar bgyi/ /
I will not taint or walk across mudrās or symbols. I will give up whatever should not be done. I will abandon, starting today, all proscribed actions.
de nas khyed rang slob ma rnams skad cig gis dpal he ru ka sngon po phyag gnyis rdor dril thugs kar bsnol ba'i skur gyur/
Next, you, disciples, instantly become the form of the glorious Heruka, blue, with two hands holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā crossed at your heart.

de la slob dpon gyis rdo rje dang bcas pa'i srin lag gis dri'i thig le gnas gsum du byas pas dpral bar zla ba'i steng du oM dkar po sku rdo rje/ mgrin par pad+ma'i steng du AHdmar po gsung rdo rje/ thugs kar nyi ma'i steng du hU~M sngon po thugs rdo rje'i ngo bor byin gyis rlabs pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Then, holding a vajra, I, the ācārya, with my ring finger, place perfumed drops at your three places. Feel that you receive the blessings of the essence of vajra body, a white oṃ on a moon at your forehead; the blessings of the essence of vajra speech, a red āḥ on a lotus at your throat; and the blessings of the essence of vajra mind as a blue hūṃ on a sun at your heart.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes dri'i thig le bya/
Place the perfumed drops.

de nas slob ma rnams kyi spyi bor oM haHdkar po rdo rje sems dpa'/ mgo bor na ma hi ser po rnam par snang mdzad/ spyi gtsug tu swA hA hu dmar po pad+ma gar dbang / phrag pa gnyis su bo ShaT he nag po mi bskyod pa/ mig gnyis su huM hU~M hoHdmar ser rdo rje nyi ma/ yan lag thams cad la phaT phaT haM ljang gu dpal rta mchog ste/

Next, at the tops of the heads of you, the disciples, are white oṃ haḥs, Vajrasattvas. In your heads are yellow nama his, Vairocanas. At the crowns of your heads are red svāhā hus, Padmanarteśvaras. In both your shoulders are black vauṣaṭ hes, Akṣobhyas. In both your eyes are orange huṃ hūṃ hoḥs, Vajrasūryas. In all your limbs are green phaṭ haṃs, glorious Paramāśvas.
ngo bo lha la rnam pa yi ge'i go chas rgyas btab pa'i mos pa mdzod/ slob ma bud med yod na/ lte bar rdo rje phag mo'i ngo bo oM ba~M dmar po sogs/ so sor dgos par gsung /

Feel that you are sealed with the armor that is in essence the deities, in manifestation the letters. For disciples who are female: At your navels are red oṃ vaṃs, the essence of Vajravārāhī…[*12] Say each that are necessary to be arranged.[5]
de nas dngos grub kyi skal ba brtag pa la nyin mo dngos su brtag pa dang / mtshan mo rmi lam gyis brtag (162) pa gnyis las/ dang po'i slad du so shing sbyin pa ni/
Next, the examination of your fortune for siddhis is twofold: the actual examination during the day and the examination at night using dreams. {162} For the first, you will be given toothsticks.
bsang sbyang /
Cleanse and purify.
stong pa'i ngang las hU~M las so shing sor bcu gnyis pa rtse mor me tog gi phreng ba can slob ma'i dngos grub kyi ltas brtag pa'i nus pa dang ldan par gyur/
Within emptiness, from hūṃ, appears a toothstick, twelve fingerbreadths long with a garland of flowers on its tip. It has the power to examine the omens of siddhis for the disciples.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes bzlas pas so shing dang so shing gi ra ba gnyis char byin gyis brlab/
Reciting that, consecrate both the toothsticks and the tray for the toothsticks.
khyed rang gi kha shar du phyogs pas so shing thal mo sbyar bas zung la so shing gi ra bar sngags 'di'i rjes zlos mdzad de 'dor bar mdzod/
With your mouth facing toward the east, hold the toothstick in añjali. Repeat the following mantra and throw it into the tray for the toothsticks.
oM badzra ha sa ha/ dan+ta sho d+ha ni hU~M/
oṃ vajra hasa ha / danta śodhani hūṃ
zhes dor/
Thus, throw it.
de yi tshe na mtshan ma ni/ / de tshe bdag la blta ba dang / / rtse mo gyen du bstan gyur na/ / de yi dngos grub mchog ces bshad/ /
When you do that, the signs are as follows: If it faces toward you and the tip turns upward, it is said to be its supreme siddhi.
de bzhin shar du bltas na ni/ / de yi dngos grub 'bring du 'gyur/ / mtshams dang byang du kha bltas na/ / 'jig rten gyi ni dngos grub 'thob/ /
Similarly, if it faces toward the east, it is its intermediate siddhi. If it faces toward the intermediate directions or the north, you will obtain worldly siddhis.
so shing dor ba 'ga' zhig las/ / gal te thur du kha bltas na/ / de ni nges par sa 'og gi / dngos grub de la the tshom med/ /
Those who throw the toothstick and it faces downward, will definitely, without any doubt, obtain the siddhis below the ground.
ces pa bzhin 'byung bas nges par mdzad 'tshal/ brgyud nas rmi lam gyi sgo nas brtag pa la rmi lam gsal ba'i phyir khyor chu sbyin pa ni/
Since it will arise that way, please be certain of that. Continue on and examine using your dreams. In order to have clear dreams, you will be given water in your cupped palms.
las bum gyi chu dung zhal du blugs pa/ oM AHhU~M/ bzla/
Pouring water from the activity vase into a conch, recite: oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes byin gyis brlabs pa lan gsum blud pa lan gsum 'thung mdzod/
Thus, for the consecration, pour it three times and drink it three times.
oM hrIHbi shud+d+haHsarba \u0f7fsarba pA paM ni====s+ya saM sho d+hA ya sarba bi ka wA a pa na ya hU~M/
oṃ hrīḥ viśuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ sarvapāpaṃ niṣacāsya saṃśodhāya sarvavikalpā apanaya hūṃ
zhes blud/
Thus, pour.
de nas rmi lam gyi bar chad bsrung phyir srung skud gdags pa ni/
Then, in order to protect your dreams from obstacles, a protection cord will be tied.
srung skud dmar po lus tshad sum lte ba la mdud pa gsum btab pa slob ma'i sgo gsum dang rmi lam gyi bar chad srung ba'i nus pa dang ldan par gyur/
A red protection cord, the length of your body, is folded in thirds and three knots are tied in its middle. It has the power to protect the disciples’ three doors and dreams from obstacles.
oM hrIHha ha hU~M hU~M phaT/
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

ces bzlas pa skyes pa'i dpung ba g.yon dang bud med kyi g.yas la btags te/ las sngags brjod cing las bum chu gtor/ mdud steng rdo rje rgya gram du bzhag ste/ oM bud+d+ha mai tri rak+Sha rak+Sha sarbA na swA hA/ zhes brjod/

Reciting that, tie [the protection cord] around the left upper arm on men and around the right upper arm on women. Recite the activity mantra, and sprinkle water from the activity vase. Place crossed vajras on top of the knot, saying: oṃ buddhamaitri rakṣa rakṣa sarvāna svāhā

de nas rmi lam mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ku sha sbyin pa ni/ hU~M dang d+hIHlas byung ba'i (163) ku sha'i chun po che chung sngo ljang rtsa rtse ma nyams pa slob ma'i rmi lam mi 'khrug pa'i nus pa dang ldan par gyur/

Next, in order to ensure that your dreams will not be disturbed, you will be given kuśa. {163} Arising from hūṃ and dhīḥ, the larger and smaller bunches of blue-green kuśa, with intact roots and tips, have the power to ensure that the disciples’ dreams are undisturbed.
d+hIHhU~M/ zhes bzlas pas byin gyis brlabs pa/
dhīḥ hūṃ Reciting that, they are consecrated.
oM badzra tIk+Sh+Na hU~M/ zhes pas sbyin/
oṃ vajra tīkṣaṇa hūṃ Give them the kuśa.
ku sha'i sngas gdan la nyol la rmi lam rtogs shig / de nas zab pa dang rgya che ba'i chos bshad pa ni 'di la gsan 'tshal/
Lie down on the kuśa as your pillow and bed, and recognize your dreams. Next, I will explain the profound and vast dharma. Please listen.
'jig rten du na kun mkhyen dag / u dum+bA ra'i me tog bzhin/ / brgya lam na ni res 'ga' zhig / 'byung 'gyur yang ni mi 'byung ngo / /
In the world, omniscient ones, like udumbāra flowers, may appear once in a hundred times or not even then.
gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung ba/ / de bas kyang ni dkon pa ste/ /
The appearance of Secret Mantra practice is even rarer than that.

gang gis mnyam med sems can don/ / mya ngan mi 'da' byed par nus/ / bskal pa bye ba du ma ru/ / sngon chad sdig pa byas pa gang / / de kun dkyil 'khor 'di 'dra ba/ / mthong bas byang bar 'gyur ba na/ /

Those who are unequalled in benefiting beings, who are able not to pass into nirvāṇa, and those who have committed evil deeds throughout many millions of eons, all of them, by seeing a maṇḍala like this will become purified.
grags pa mtha' yas sngags spyod pa'i/ / tshul la gnas na smos ci dgos/ / skyob pa'i gsang sngags bzlas na ni/ / go 'phang bla na med par 'gro/ /
What need is there to mention abiding in the way of Mantra practice, whose fame is infinite. If you recite the secret mantras of refuge, you will go to the unsurpassable state.
gang dag spyod pa mchog 'di la/ / blo gros shin tu mi g.yo na/ / sdug bsngal kun 'byung rab tu gcod/ /
If your mind does not waver about this sublime practice, you will sever the origin of suffering.
bdag nyid chen po khyed rnams kyis/ / rnyed pa mnyam med de ring rnyed/ /
Today, you, great beings, have made this unequalled discovery.
gang phyir rgyal ba sras bcas pa/ / bdag nyid chen po kun gyis ni/ / bstan pa 'di la khyed rnams kun/ / yongs su bzung ste skye bzhin par/ /
The victors and their children, and all great beings, have accepted you into this teaching— it is like birth.
de phyir khyed rnams theg chen la/ / dbang thob rab tu skye bar 'gyur/ /
Therefore, you will take birth, receiving the abhiṣekas in the Mahāyāna.
theg pa chen po cher 'byung ba'i/ / lam mchog 'di ni dpal dang ldan/ / lam 'dir khyod nyid 'gro gyur pas/ / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su 'gyur/ /
Since you will proceed on this path, this supreme, glorious path arising as the greatness of the Mahāyāna, you will become tathāgatas.[6]
ces gsungs pa'i tshig gi don ltar gsang sngags kyi bstan pa dang mjal ba la dga' ba dang spro ba rgya cher skyed mdzod/ /
In keeping with the meaning of what was just said, arouse great enthusiasm and joy in meeting the Secret Mantra teachings.
des sta gon gyi chos rnams grub pa lags/
That completes the dharma of the prelude.

zhes brjod de bsngo smon byas nas slob ma rnams gyes/ sgrub thabs gsham nas 'byung ba ltar lag mchod/ gtor 'bul/ tshogs mchod rnams bya/ ma lcogs na (164) gtor 'bul tsam dang sgrub thabs ltar mchod bstod mdor bsdus/ bzod gsol/ lha mgron brtan bzhugs/ bsngo smon shis brjod byas pas 'grub bo// /

Having said that, do the dedications and aspirations and send the disciples away. Do the hand offering, the torma offering, and the gaṇapūjā offering according to what is found at the end of the sādhana.[*13] {164} If you are unable to do all that, simply offer the torma. As is done in the sādhana, present the abbreviated offerings and praises, request patience, request the deities and guests to remain in the representations, and finish with the dedications, aspirations, and expression of auspiciousness.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi
II. The Main Practice
['di] la gnyis/ dbang don dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa dang / dbang bskur ba dngos so/ /
This has two parts: (1) the practice of the maṇḍala for the purpose of [conferring] the abhiṣekas and (2) the actual bestowal of the abhiṣekas.
dang po [dbang don dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa] ni/
A. The Practice of the Maṇḍala for the Purpose of [Conferring] the Abhiṣekas

stegs bu'i steng du ras bris kyi dkyil 'khor bkram/ dbus su many+dzi'i steng sngar sta gon byas pa'i rnam rgyal bum pa dung chos gzungs rdor bcas bkod/ dkyil 'khor gyi byang shar du las bum/ lhor dbu rgyan/ nub tu rdo rje/ byang du dril bu/ mdun thod chang / gsang thod dang rig tsaka /

Arrange a cloth-drawn maṇḍala on top of a small stand. In the middle, on a mañji, arrange the victory vase, conch, and dhāraṇī vajra used previously during the prelude. In the northeast of the maṇḍala, place the activity vase; in the south, a crown; in the west, a vajra; in the north, a ghaṇṭā; and in front, a skull cup with alcohol, the secret [abhiṣeka] skull cup, and the vidyā icon.
mtha' skor du chu gnyis nyer spyod g.yon skor/ rgyab phyogs su 'bul gtor lugs 'di'i phyag bzhes ltar grub dka' bas bshos zlum gtso 'khor lnga rgyan spros btsos pa bshams/

Arrange the two waters and the traditional offerings outside of that in a counterclockwise circle. To the rear, place the offering torma. Since it is difficult to do that according to the procedures of this tradition, place round cakes [representing] the five principal ones and retinue with ornaments and other elaborations.

logs gar bdar gri gug / thod pa/ kha twAM/ tshangs skud/ rus pa'i rgyan drug bcas dngos sam tsakli/ snyan brgyud kyi glegs bam/ phreng ba/ dung dkar rnams dang / sbyong chas chang bu/ til/ me chu'i snod/ mig dar/ me tog / mig thur/ slob ma mchod pa nyer spyod lnga/ sngon gtor sogs 'du bya/

To one side, place a hooked knife, skull cup, khaṭvāṃga, brahman thread, and the six bone ornaments, either real ones or icons.[7] Also, arrange a volume of the Aural Transmission, a mālā, a white conch, the items for purification (changbu, sesame seeds, and the containers for fire and water), blindfolds, flowers, an eye spoon, the five traditional offerings for the disciples, a preliminary torma, and so on.

de nas sgrub thabs kyi dag pa gsum dran pa nas bzung bskyed bzlas dang gsham gyi lhar ldang bar rdzogs par btang / de nas bum bskyed bzlas pa sogs gong ltar tshang bar bya/ de nas mdun bskyed dkyil 'khor bsang sbyang /

Next, starting with the recollection of the three purifications in the sādhana, do the complete visualization, recitations, and arising as the deity at the end. Then, do the full vase visualization, the recitations, and so forth, as above. This is followed by the maṇḍala of the front visualization. Cleanse and purify.
oM kA ya wA ka tsit+ta At+ma ko‘haM/
oṃ kāya vāk citta ātmako ’haṃ
snod bcud thams cad stong par gyur/ ces pa nas/ lte ba mthing ga yangs shing rgya che ba/
The environment and its inhabitants become empty…Its center is deep blue, spacious, and vast.[*14]

de'i phyi rol du dur khrod chen po brgyad kyis bskor ba/ sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba b+h+rU~M dkar po las/ zhes pa nas rang rig dang bdag nyid dang / yab kyi gsang ba sogs nas gsal bar gyur/ ces pa'i bar rnams dor bas/ mdun gyi nam mkhar spyan drangs/ zhes pa'i bar byas nas/ sta gon gyi lha la'ang dmigs te spos dang rdor dril 'dzin pas/

Outside that are the encircling eight charnel grounds. In the center of a viśvavajra is a white bhrūṃ… .[*15] Leave out “my own reflexive awareness,”[*16] “I,”[*17] and “at my secret, as the male consort…. They clearly become the palace, the support, and the deities, the supported, as before.”[*18] Continue up to: …are invited into the space in front.[*19] Visualize the deities of the prelude and, holding incense, vajra, and ghaṇṭā, say:
oM/ khyab bdag dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin can/ / gnas med 'gro 'ong bral ba nam mkha' bzhin/ / gshegs dang 'byon pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga' yang / / chu zla bzhin du gar dmigs dar snang ba/ /

oṃ Omnipresent lord, the nature of all things, nondwelling, free from coming and going, like space, although you are without the characteristics of departing or arriving, you appear wherever you are visualized, like the moon reflected in water.
bdud dpung 'joms mdzad dpal ldan he ru ka / bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro'i 'khor dang bcas/ / bdag gis (165)dad pas deng 'dir spyan 'dren na/ / dmigs med thugs rje'i dbang gis 'dir byon mdzod/ /
Glorious Heruka, destroyer of the hordes of Māra, gurus, yidams, and retinues of ḍākinīs, {165} with faith, I invite you here and now. Through your nonreferential compassion, please come here.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta shrI tsakra sam+ba ra/ zhes pa nas/ dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH/
oṃ sarvatathāgata śrīcakrasamvara…jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ[*20]

brjod dus sta gon gyi lta bang mdun bskyed la thim par dmigs pa bcas kyis/ dbur brgyan par gyur/ ces pa'i bar sgrub thabs ltar byas nas/ mchod pa kha gsos la byin rlabs sgrub thabs ltar bya/ dang por thun mong ma yin pa'i sngags mchod ni/ lha re re bzhin gsal btab la sgrub thabs nas 'byung ba'i sngags rnams brjod/

When you say that, visualize that the deities of the prelude dissolve into the front visualization. Say up to, according to the sādhana: …are crowned by Ratnasambhava.[*21] Replenish the offerings and consecrate them according to the sādhana. First, the uncommon mantra offering. While visualizing each deity, recite the mantras found in the sādhana.
de nas phyi mchod ni/
The outer offerings.
oM/ dag cing dri med yid 'ong ba'i/ / sngags kyi mchod yon mchog 'di dag / mchog tu gus pas khyed la 'bul/ / bzhes nas bdag la dgyes par mdzod/ /
oṃ This sublime offering water of Mantra, pure, stainless, and pleasing, I present to you with supreme devotion. Accepting it, be pleased with me.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta shrI tsakra sam+ba ra sarba wIr yo gi nI badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha pU dza me g+ha sa mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye hU~M swA hA/
oṃ sarvatathāgata śrīcakrasamvara sarvavīrayoginī vajra arghaṃ pratīccha pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ svāhā
oM/ dag cing dri med= sngags kyi zhal bsil mchog 'di dag / mchog tu= bzhes nas= sngags thog mtha' sngar ltar la Ar+g+haM gyi gnas su/ A tsa mA naM/ sbyar/
oṃ This sublime face water of Mantra, pure, stainless,… I present to you,… Accepting it,… With the same beginning and end to the mantra, in place of arghaṃ insert ācamānaṃ.
oM/ dag cing dri med= sngags kyi 'thor 'thung mchog 'di dag / mchog tu= bzhes nas= prok+Sha NaM=
oṃ This sublime purifying water of Mantra, pure, stainless,… I present to you… Accepting it,… …prokṣaṇaṃ…
oM/ dag cing dri med= sngags kyi zhabs bsil mchog 'di dag / mchog tu= bzhes nas= pA d+yaM/
oṃ This sublime foot water of Mantra, pure, stainless,… I present to you… Accepting it,… …pādyaṃ…
oM/ me tog 'di ni gtsang zhing dge/ / dag pa'i skye gnas las dag pa/ / bdag gis dad pas 'bul lags kyi/ / bzhes nas bdag la dgyes par mdzod/ /
oṃ These flowers, clean and virtuous, purer than those of pure sources, I present with faith. Accepting them, be pleased with me.
badzra puSh+pe= nags tshal las byung phan pa yi/ / dag pa'i dri ldang bdug spos mchog / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…vajra puṣpe… Sublime incense with scents pure and beneficial, found in the forests, I present with faith. Accepting this,…
d+hU pe= srin po 'joms shing dag byed la/ / dge zhing mun pa rnam sel ba/ / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…dhūpe… What purifies, is the vanquisher of rākṣasas, is virtuous, and dispels darkness, I present with faith. Accepting this,…
A lo ke= lhan cig skyes dang sbyar ba'i dri/ / tshim byed dag pa'i dri mchog 'di/ / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…āloke… These sublime scents, pure and satisfying, scents that are natural and compounds, I present with faith. Accepting them,…
gan+d+he= bshos gtsang bza' ba dang bcas pa'i/ / kha dog dri dang ro ldan pa/ / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…gandhe… Clean, edible food— flavorful, fragrant, and colorful— I present with faith. Accepting them,…
nai wi d+ya (166) pa Ta ha dang cang te'u dang / / sgra dbyangs yid 'phrog sna tshogs pa/ / bdag gis= bzhes nas bdag la=
…naividya…{166} Various melodic, captivating sounds, made with a paṭaha and changteu, I present with faith. Accepting them, be pleased with me.
shab+da pra tIts+tsha= khyad par rig ma bcu drug 'bul ba ni/ rdo rje lha mo pi waM brdung / / mtha' gnyis rdo rje dril bu bsnams/ /
…śabda pratīccha… In particular, the offering of the sixteen vidyās. The vajra goddess strums a lute. Her lower two hands hold a vajra and ghaṇṭā.
rol pa'i lha mo sku mdog sngo/ / bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro mchod/ /
The playful goddess, blue in color, offers to the gurus, yidams, and ḍākinīs.
oM badzra bI Ne huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ vajra vīṇe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
rdo rje lha mo gling bu 'bud/ / rkang pa gsum par= / rol pa'i lha mo sku mdog ser/ / waM she=
The vajra goddess plays a flute… As the third line: The playful goddess, yellow in color,… …vaṃśe…
rdo rje lha mo rnga chen brdung / / rol pa'i lha mo sku mdog dmar/ / mr-i taM ge= rdo rje lha mo rdza rnga brdung / /
The vajra goddess beats a great drum… The playful goddess, red in color,… …mṛtaṃge… The vajra goddess beats a clay drum…
rol pa'i lha mo sku mdog ljang / / mu ra dze= bzhad pa rdo rje lha mo ni/ / dmar skya phyag gnyis bzhad dang bcas/ / mtha' gnyis thod pa cang te'u brdung / / gsang ba mchog gi dgyes par rol/ /

The playful goddess, green in color,… …muraje… The vajra goddess of laughter is pink, with two hands [expressing] laughter, and her lower two with a skull cup and beating a changteu. She enjoys the supreme, secret delight.
hA s+ye= sgeg pa rdo rje lha mo ni/ / sngon mo phyag gnyis sgeg dang bcas/ / rkang pa phyi ma gnyis sngar ltar sbyar te/
…hāsye… The vajra goddess of grace is blue, with two hands [expressing] grace,… Add the two last lines as before and say:
lA s+ye= glu yi rdo rje lha mo ni/ / ser mo ting ting shags dang bcas/ /
…lāsye… The vajra goddess of song is yellow, playing bell cymbals…
gI tI= gar gyi rdo rje lha mo ni/ / ljang gu phyag gnyis gar dang bcas/
…gītī… The vajra goddess of dance is green, with two hands [expressing] dance,…
nri t+ye= mdog dkar rdo rje me tog ni/ / g.yas na me tog cang te'u dang / / g.yon pas thod pa kha T+wAM ga / mchog rnams rdo rje dbyings mnyes mdzod/ /
…nṛtye… The vajra goddess of flowers is white. In her right hands she holds flowers and a changteu; in her left, a skull cup and khaṭvāṃga. May she please the supreme ones with vajradhātu.
puSh+pe= mdog mthing rdo rje bdug spos ni/ / g.yas na bdug spos cang te'u dang / / tshig phyi ma gnyis sbyar zhing /
…puṣpe… The vajra goddess of incense is deep blue. In her right hands she holds incense and a changteu,… Add the last two lines and say:
d+hU pe= mdog dmar rdo rje mar me ni/ / g.yas na mar me cang te'u dang /
…dhūpe… The vajra goddess of lamps is red. In her right hands she holds a lamp and changteu,…
dI pe= mdog ljang rdo rje dri chab ni/ / g.yas na dri chab cang te'u dang / /
…dīpe… The vajra goddess of perfume is green. In her right hands she holds perfume and a changteu,…
gan+d+he= gzugs kyi rdo rje me long bsnams/ / dkar mo g.yas mtha' cang te'u dang / / g.yon pas thod pa kha T+wAM ga / bzhes nas byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ /

…gandhe… The vajra goddess of forms holds a mirror. White, holding a changteu in her lower right hand, with her left hands she holds a skull cup and khaṭvāṃga. Accepting this, please grant your blessings.
oM rU pa badzri= ro yi rdo rje 'khar gzhong bsnams/ / dmar mo sogs gong bzhin te/ /
…oṃ rūpa vajri… The vajra goddess of tastes holds a bowl. Red,… The same as above.
ra sa badzri= reg gi rdo rje na bza' bsnams/ / ljang gu=
…rasa vajri… The vajra goddess of tangible objects holds a cloth. Green,…
spar+she badzri= chos dbyings rdo rje (167) chos 'byung bsnams/ / dkar mo=
d+harma d+hA tu badzri huM hU~M phaT/
…dharmadhātu vajri huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
rgyal srid ni/ rgyas par na/
The emblems of sovereignty. To offer in an extensive way:
lha rdzas las grub sogs nas/ 'khor lo rin chen nam mkha' bkang ste 'bul/_/
Made from divine substances … I offer the precious cakra, filling space.[8]

lha rdzas las byas lte ba shin tu zlum/ / rtsibs stong ldan zhing mu khyud rab mnyam bzang / / sdang ba'i dgra las rnam par rgyal gyur pa'i/ / 'khor lo rin chen nam mkha' bkang ste 'bul/ / oM sarba ta thA ga tA Ar+ya lo ke shwa rA sa pa ri wA ra tsakra rat+na pra tIts+tsha hUM swAhA/
Made from divine substances [with a perfectly round center, a thousand spokes and rim, well balanced, residing on the first ground, and all-victorious—… oṃ cakra ratna…

rin chen ngo bo lha rdzas bai DUr+ya/ / kun tu dpag tshad tsam du snang byed cing / / dri med nyin mo de bzhin mtshan de bzhin/ / nor bu rin chen nam mkha' bkang ste 'bul/ / oM sarba nas ma Ni rat+na pra tIts+tsha hU~M swAhA/
Precious in essence, the divine vaiḍūrya, always illuminates for yojanas, is stainless, and as it is in the day, so it is at night. I offer the precious jewel, filling space. oṃ maṇi ratna…

gzugs mdzes blta na sdug cing tshul bzang ma/ / pags pa'i mdog legs 'jam zhing dri mchog ldan/ / yid 'ong 'dod dgu'i reg bya dang ldan pa'i/ / btsun mo rin chen nam mkha' bkang ste 'bul/ / oM sarba nas sbi rat+na pra tIts+tsha hU~M swAhA/
Lovely to see, with beautiful form, elegant style, excellent complexion, soft and fragrant, pleasing, holding objects granting all desires— I offer the precious queen, filling space. oṃ strī ratna…

gang yang rgyal ba mu tig mdangs ldan pa'i/ / gser sogs mang po thub la phul ba ltar/ / bzod ldan mtshungs pa'i khyim bdag nor ldan pa'i/ / blon po rin chen nam mkha' bkang ste 'bul/ / oM sarba nas pu ru Sha rat+na pra tIts+tsha hU~M swAhA/
Always victorious, with a pearly glow, able to gather and offer much gold and the like, the steward with patience and meaning— I offer the precious minister, filling space. oṃ puruṣa ratna…

yan lag thams cad legs skyes sa la ni/ / rab gnas gangs chen ri 'dra glang po che/ / rgyal po la 'os mkha' la rab 'gro ba'i/ / glang po rin chen nam mkha' bkang ste 'bul/ / oM sarba nas hasti rat+na pra tIts+tsha hUM swAhA/

With excellent limbs planted on the ground, the great elephant is like the great snowy mountains. Capable of conveying the king through space as needed, I offer the precious elephant, filling space. oṃ hasti ratna…

tho rangs dus su phyogs rnams ma lus pa'i/ / sa rnams bskor te slar yang ldog 'gyur pa/ / rma bya'i mgrin pa'i spu ltar yid 'ong ba'i/ / rta mchog rin chen nam mkha' bkang ste 'bul/ / oM sarba nas a shwa rat+na pra tIts+tsha hUM swAhA/
Able to circle all the lands in the morning and return immediately, beautiful, like the feathers of a peacock’s throat— I offer the precious supreme horse, filling space. oṃ raṅga aśva ratna…

'gro dang ldog dang kun nas 'ong gyur pa'i/ // bdud dpung ma lus 'jig par byed pa ste/ / dpal ldan 'byor pa'i dpung dang bcas pa yi/ / dmag dpon rin chen nam mkha' bkang ste 'bul/ / oM sarba nas khang+ga rat+na pra tIts+tsha hU~M swAhA/
Inspiring fear in the hordes of Māra, who come, retreat, and appear from everywhere, with an army of riches and glory— I offer the precious general, filling space. oṃ khaṅga ratna…]
zhes bsgyur ba dang sngags bcas kyis mchod/ bsdu na/
Make [the necessary] changes and offer with the mantras. The abbreviated offering:
gser gyi 'khor lo nor bu rin po che/ / btsun mo blon po glang po rta mchog dang / / dmag dpon 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid kyis/ / nam mkha' bkang ste dkyil 'khor lha tshogs mchod/ /
With the golden cakra, precious gem, queen, minister, elephant, supreme horse, and general—the emblems of sovereignty of a cakravartin— filling space, I offer to the deities of the maṇḍala.
sngags sngar ltar gyi mthar/
At the end of the same mantra as before:
sab+ta rat+na badzra pU dzi te AHhU~M/
…sapta[9] ratna vajra pūjite āḥ hūṃ
nang mchod 'dod yon lnga ni/
The inner offering of the five sense pleasures.
gzugs la rnam gsum shes bya ste/ / lha rnams la ni dbul bar bya/ / de nyid bcom ldan rgyal ba ni/ / mnga' bdag rdo rje rnam snang mdzad/ /
Know that forms are of three types, and offer them to the deities. They are the victor bhagavān, the master Vajravairocana.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta shrI tsakra sam+ba ra sarba wI ra yo gi nI badzra rU pa pU dza me g+ha sa mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye hU~M/
oṃ sarvatathāgata śrīcakrasamvara sarvavīrayoginī vajra rūpa pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ
sgra la rnam gsum shes= lha rnams la ni= de nyid bcom ldan rdo rje can/ / rdo rje sems dpa' grags chen po/ /
Know that sounds are of three types, and offer them… They are the bhagavān Vajrin, the renowned Vajrasattva.
ru pa'i gnas sa shab+da zhes bcug
Insert śabda in place of rūpa.
dri la rnam gsum= lha rnams la ni= de nyid bcom ldan sangs rgyas ni/ / rin chen phung por rab tu grags/ /
Know that smells are of three types, and offer them… They are the bhagavān buddha, the renowned Ratnaskandha.
gan+d+he= ro la rnam gsum= lha rnams la ni= de nyid bcom ldan 'dod chags che/ / rdo rje chos kyis bzhes su gsol/ /
…gandhe… Know that tastes are of three types, and offer them… They are the bhagavān Great Passion, the one known as Vajradharma.
ra sa= reg la rnam gsum= lha rnams la ni= de nyid bcom ldan sna tshogs pa/ / don yod 'bras bu ster ba po/ /
…rasa… Know that tangible objects are of three types, and offer them… They are the bhagavān Varied, the bestower of meaningful results.
spar+she= zhes dang /
…sparśe…
bdud rtsi 'bul ba ni/
The offering of amṛta.
hU~M/ bdud rtsi chang gi mchod pa ni/ / tshes bcu dus su chang sna bzhi/ / shes rab g.yon gyi lag pa la/ / thabs chen g.yas kyi lag pas mchod/ /
hūṃ The offering of amṛta alcohol, [made] on the tenth lunar day with the four kinds of beer, is offered into the left hand of prajñā by the right hand of great method.
mtshan ldan rdo rje'i ka pA la/ / ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa/ / pA ni ma skyes skye ba med/ / la ni blo 'das yid dang bral/ /
The vajra kapāla is authentic: ka means not abiding anywhere, pā means not born, without birth, la means transcending the intellect, free from mentation.
sku gsum mi 'gyur ka pA la/ / zag med bde ba'i chang phung gtams/ / skye 'chi med pa'i bdud rtsi blugs/ / yi ge gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs/ / (168)
The kapāla of the unchanging three kāyas is filled with the select alcohol of undefiled bliss. Pour in the amṛta of no birth or death. Consecrate this with the three letters. {168}

oM gyis zag med bdud rtsir gyur/ / AHyis skye med bdud rtsir sbyangs/ / hU~M gis blo 'das bdud rtsir spel/ / lan gsum dkrugs pas bdud rtsi 'dis/ / pha rol phyin drug lha mo mchod/ / sa bcu non phyir bzhes su gsol/ /

Oṃ turns it into undefiled amṛta. Āḥ purifies it into unborn amṛta. Hūṃ expands it as amṛta transcending the intellect. Stirred three times, this amṛta is offered by the goddesses as the six pāramitās. Please accept it for the sake of mastering the ten bhūmis.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
bdud rtsi mtheb srin gyis blang zhing gtor nas/
Take up the amṛta with your thumb and ring finger, and sprinkle it as you say:

byin rlabs kyi rtsa ba bka' brgyud bla ma rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/ dngos grub kyi rtsa ba yi dam lha tshogs rnams kyi= rten 'brel gyi rtsa ba dpa' bo mkha' 'gro rnams kyi= phrin las kyi rtsa ba chos skyong srung ma rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/

To the root of blessings, the Kagyu gurus, oṃ āḥ hūṃ. To the root of siddhis, the assembly of yidam deities,… To the root of auspicious connections, the heroes and ḍākinīs,… To the root activities, the dharma protectors and guardians, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
oM shrI badzra he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/ oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/ oM AHhU~M/
oṃ śrīvajra he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla samvaraṃ svāhā / oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ āḥ hūṃ
oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra= oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM AHhU~M/
oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajra…oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du/
Similarly:
oM shrI bud+d+ha he he= karma he he ru= pad+ma he he ru= rat+na he he ru=
oṃ śrībuddha he he… …karma he he ru… …padma he he ru… …ratna he ru ru…
yum bzhi ni/
The four female consorts.
DA ki nI= lA mye= khaN+Da ro hi= rU pi ni= oM AHhU~M/
…ḍākinī… …lāmye… …khaṇḍarohi… …rūpiṇī…oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes mtheb srin gyis 'thor la 'bul/
Sprinkle and offer with your thumb and ring finger.
oM a mr-i ta swA da na badzra swa b+hA wa At+ma ko‘haM/
oṃ amṛta svādana vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ
zhes pas rang gis myong /
Taste it yourself.
gsang mchod ni/
The secret offering.
hoH srid pa gsum gyi bde rnyed gtso/ / a la la la la la hoH/ /
hoḥ The principal one discovers the bliss of the three existences. a la la la la la hoḥ
rgyal ba bde chen dgyes pa'i tshogs/ / pad+ma la ni rdo rje rol/ / a la la la la la hoH/ /
The victors are the assembly who delights in great bliss, frolicking with vajras in lotuses. a la la la la la hoḥ

oM rdo rje sems dpa' legs dgyes mchod/ / ro dang ro mchog thams cad de/ / dgyes pa chen po'i bde ba rnams/ / rtag par dngos grub kun la yang / / rol cig rol cig lha mo la/ / rnal 'byor ma yi thams cad dang / / bcom ldan rdo rje chen po ni/ / lha mo'i pad+ma rab dgyes rol/ /

oṃ Vajrasattva, I offer excellent enjoyment. In all tastes and sublime tastes, in all the bliss of great pleasure, and in the siddhis too, revel, revel, goddesses. All yoginīs and the bhagavān Great Vajra, revel in the delights of the lotuses of the goddesses.
hU~M a la la la ho dgyes che/ / bcom ldan 'dod pas dgyes pa khyod/ / 'dod pa'i dngos grub legs par stsol/ / pad+ma mchog la dgyes par rol/ /
hūṃ A la la la ho, great delight. Bhagavān, you who delight in pleasure, please bestow all desired siddhis. Revel in delight in the sublime lotus.
oM a la la ho dgyes pa che/ /
oṃ A la la ho, great delight.
tshogs kyi bde bas dus rtag tu/ / rdo rje mchog ni 'dzin pa yi/ / pad+ma'i zhal mchog dbye ba yi/ / pad+ma la ni rol par mdzod/ /
With the bliss of the assembly, at all times, the holder of the sublime vajra revels in the lotuses of those with the sublime lotus faces. {169}
ji ltar bung bas (169) sbrang rtsi bzhin/ / lha rnams pad+ma nyid la rol/ /
Like bees [drawn] to honey, the deities revel in the lotuses.
shrI ma hA su kha he he ru ru kaM AHhU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/
śrīmahāsukha he he ru ru kaṃ āḥ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā
de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa ni/
The offering of suchness.
rang bzhin med pa'i gnas goms pas/ / lha yi snying po sgom byed pa/ / de ni mchod pa chen por 'dod/ / sangs rgyas thams cad rtogs byed pa'o/ /
Being accustomed to the state of no nature is to meditate on the essence of the deity. That is said to be the great offering, which brings the realization of all buddhas.
mchod gnas mchod byed mchod pa rnams/ / gang tshe sna tshogs mi dmigs pa/ / de tshe mchod pa chen po ste/ / rdo rje'i mchod pa zhes brjod do/ /
When the place of offerings, the means of offering, and the offerings are not observed as a multitude, that is the great offering, called the vajra offering.
zhes pa rnams kyis mchod/
With those, make the offerings.
bstod pa rkang brgyad ni/
The eight lines of praise.
oM bcom ldan mgon po dpa' bo chen po ni/ / bskal pa'i me dpung lta bur rab tu 'bar/ / ral pa'i cod pan dbu yi rgyan du bcings/ / mche ba rab gtsigs drag shul 'jigs pa'i zhal/ /
oṃ Bhagavān, protector, great hero, blazing like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs.
dbu la spyan gsum gzi brjid ldan pa po/ / dgra s+t+wa zhags pa kha T+wAM mdung rtse bsnams/ / rab 'jigs stag gi pags pa sku la gsol/ / sku chen dud ka bgegs 'dul mdzad la 'dud/
You are majestic with three eyes, hold a battle-ax, noose, khaṭvāṃga, and spear, and are frightening, draped in a tiger skin. To the one with the great smoky body, subduer of obstructors, I bow.

oM/ bcom ldan rnam kun rdo rje phag mo che/ / 'jig rten gsum gzhan rgol bas mi tshugs shing / / 'byung po'i 'jigs kun rdo rje phag mos 'joms/ / rdo rje'i gdan bzhugs tshangs pa las rgyal zhing / / bdud kyi 'jigs kun skem zhing pham mdzad ma/ /

oṃ Bhagavatī, great Vajravārāhī of all manifestations, unswayed by opponents, the three worlds, Vajravārāhī, conquering fears of bhūtas, residing at Vajrāsana, and victorious over Brahmā, you dry up and destroy all fears of Māra.
skye gnas 'byung ba kun gyi rang bzhin gzugs/ / sa gsum dbang phyug chos rnams yongs rdzogs mdzad/ / rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma la 'dud/
With a form the nature of all birth, abiding, and arising, you are empress of the three planes, the perfection of phenomena. To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I bow.
rgya gzhung nas/
From the Indian texts:

oM/ rgyal ba'i sprul pa dus mtha'i me ltar rab tu 'jigs mdzad cing / / ra~M ra~M rnam 'phrul ut+pal sngo 'dra nyi ma brgya yi gzi/ / rdo rje dang ni kha T+wAM ga bcas oM oM dag dang ldan/ / tshangs dang lha chen khyab mjug mgo bcad dbu yi cod pan mdzad/ /

oṃ Emanation of the victors, terrifying like the fires at the end of time, projecting raṃ raṃ, with the radiance of a hundred suns, like blue utpālas, with vajra and khaṭvāṃga, and oṃ oṃ, the severed heads of Brahmā, Mahādeva, and Viṣṇu are your crowns.
hU~M hU~M phaT phaT ha ha zhes bya khro ba dang bcas pa/ / mi yi seng ge dregs pa 'joms mdzad 'jigs pa zhabs gnon cing / / a la la yi sgra sgrogs bgegs rnams yongs su (170)'dul bar mdzad/ /

cang te'u'i sgra sgrogs lha chen khyab 'jug stag gi pags pa bsnams/ / thugs rjes cher sprul rab khros dzaHhU~M ba~M hoHhU~M mdzad cing / / ging ring pho mo zhabs kyis mnan cing sku rtsar rab tu bzhugs/ /

Playing a changteu and wearing the tiger skins [of] Mahādeva and Viṣṇu, you emanate as great compassion, wrathfully making jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ hūṃ, squashing ging ring, male and female, with your feet, standing directly on them.[10]
lha rnams mgo la zhabs mnan bde gshegs lnga yi dbu rgyan can/ / lha rnams thams cad 'khor gyis 'khor lo yongs su bskor mdzad pa/ /
Your feet press down on the heads of the gods, the five sugatas are your crown ornament, and a retinue of the gods surround you as your circle.

hu lu hu lu dza dza~M dza~M tra~M ba~M rgyu ma thod rlon gyis/ / phreng ba mdzad cing rdo rje mkha' 'gro 'jigs pa'i khros pa yi/ / glu sgra mi bzad hu lu hu lus rab tu rmongs mdzad ma/ / rdo rje chen mo mA ma kis ni sku lus rnam par rgyan/ /

Hu lu hu lu jeṃ jeṃ traṃ vaṃ, intestines and fresh skulls are your garlands, and with the terrifying wrathful songs of Vajraḍākinī, you are overwhelming—with hu lu hu lu, Mohanī, and Great Vajra Lady, Māmakī, adorn your body.

dur khrod rab tu 'jigs shing gar gyis 'khor lo'i tshogs skrag mdzad/ / ka ha ka ha'i bzhad sgra hi his gnod byed skrag rengs mdzad/ / brkyang bskum tshul gyis bzhugs shing ba~M ni pa~M nis lus la rnam par brgyan/ /

You are terrifying in charnel grounds and, with your dances, frightening at gaṇacakras. Your laughter of ka ha ka ha and sounds of hi hi terrify and paralyze those who cause harm. You stand [with legs] extended and bent, and your body is adorned with vaṃ ni vaṃ ni.

bskal pa grangs med rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dus kyi mthar yang ni/ / ha na ha na da ha da ha phaT kyi mdzad pa can/ / stong pa'i ngang las sku gsung thugs kyi sangs rgyas rnam par 'phro/ / phyin ci log dang sdang ba mtha' dag ma lus zhi mdzad cing / /
Even at the end of unceasing countless eons, you create ha na ha na da ha da ha phaṭ. Within emptiness, you radiate the buddhas of body, speech, and mind. You pacify all perversions and anger.
ku lu ku lu dza~M dza~M ya~M ya~M dag gis zhi bar mdzad/ / nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam pa'i ting 'dzin thugs ni rnam par smin/ /
With ku lu ku lu jaṃ jaṃ yaṃ yaṃ, you pacify. Your samādhi mind, equaling the reaches of space, matures.
bde ba chen po'i mgon khyod ma~M ma~M zhes ni mdzad pa can/ / sems can don du thugs rje chen pos dgyes par mdzad pa po/ /
Protector of great bliss, you are the one saying maṃ maṃ. For the sake of sentient beings, you please with great compassion.
A li kA li'i rnal 'byor pa yi sdom pa gsal mdzad cing / / bcom ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gros dam tshig ma lus ston mdzad pa'i/ / he ru ka dpal brtan g.yo'i bdag po de la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

You illuminate the bonds of the yogins and yoginīs of ā li kā li. To the one who teaches all the samayas through the Bhagavatī, Vajrayoginī, glorious Heruka, lord of the animate and inanimate, I pay homage.
hU~M/ zhe sdang tshul gyis zhe sdang 'joms mdzad cing / / snang stong me long ye shes ngo bo nyid/ / rdo rje rnal 'byor ma dang mnyam sbyor ba'i/ / rdo rje he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
hūṃ You destroy aggression using the mode of aggression. You are the essence of mirrorlike wisdom, appearance-emptiness. To Vajraheruka united with Vajrayoginī, I pay homage.
gti mug tshul gyis gti mug 'joms mdzad cing / / spros bral chos dbyings ye shes ngo bo nyid/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang mnyam sbyor ba'i/ / bud+d+ha he ru ka la phyag (171) 'tshal lo/ /
You destroy bewilderment using the mode of bewilderment. You are the essence of the wisdom of the dharmadhātu, free from elaborations. To Buddha Heruka united with Vajraḍākinī, I pay homage. {171}
phrag dog tshul gyis phrag dog 'joms mdzad cing / / phrin las bya grub ye shes ngo bo nyid/ / lA ma mkha' 'gro ma dang mnyam sbyor ba'i/ / karma he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
You destroy jealousy using the ways of jealousy. You are the essence of all-accomplishing wisdom, the activity. To Karma Heruka united with Lāma Ḍākinī, I pay homage.
'dod chags tshul gyis 'dod chags 'joms mdzad cing / / sna tshogs sor rtog ye shes ngo bo nyid/ / dum skyes mkha' 'gro ma dang mnyam sbyor ba'i/ / pad+ma he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
You destroy desire using the ways of desire. You are the essence of discriminating wisdom, the varieties. To Padma Heruka united with Khaṇḍarohā Ḍākinī, I pay homage.
nga rgyal tshul gyis nga rgyal 'joms mdzad cing / / bde chen mnyam nyid ye shes ngo bo nyid/ / gzugs can mkha' 'gro ma dang mnyam sbyor ba'i/ / rat+na he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
You destroy pride using the mode of pride. You are the essence of the wisdom of equality, great bliss. To Ratna Heruka united with Rūpiṇī Ḍākinī, I pay homage.
hU~M gi rdo rje las byung char sprin mdog / dga' ba rnam dag drag po'i zhal bzhi ldan/ / gar gyi nyams dgus gdug pa ma lus 'dul/ / hU~M mdzad rdo rje de la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Arisen from vajra hūṃ, the color of rain clouds, with four wrathful faces, the purities of the joys, taming malevolent ones through the nine moods of the dramatic arts, to Vajra Hūṃkāra, I pay homage.
rten 'brel bcu gnyis dag pa'i sa rnams rdzogs/ / bcu gnyis phyag gis mtshon cha sna tshogs bsnams/ / yul dang yul can rnam rtog gcod mdzad pa/ / ngo mtshar mtshon cha bsnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Having perfected the bhūmis, the purities of the twelve links of dependent origination, your twelve hands hold various weapons. You have severed thoughts involving objects and subjects. To the one holding wondrous weapons, I pay homage.
hU~M gis nga ros srid gsum skrag mdzad cing / / rngams pa'i rkan sgras phaT ces sgra sgrogs shing / / bdud dang bgegs tshogs gdug pa ma lus 'dul/ / rnam rtog bgegs 'dul 'joms la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Your roar of hūṃ scares the three existences. You make the sounds of phaṭ with your amazing palate. You tame malevolent ones, the gatherings of māras and obstructors. To the destroyer and tamer of thoughts and obstructors, I pay homage.
hU~M/ spros bral bde chen pad+ma rA ga'i mdog / stong nyid 'od gsal dus gsum bder gshegs yum/ / gzung 'dzin rtog pa'i drwa ba 'joms mdzad pa'i/ / bde chen rgyal ba'i yum la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

hūṃ You are the color of padmarāga, great bliss, free from elaborations, mother of the sugatas of the three times, emptiness-luminosity, destroyer of the nets of thoughts involving percepts and perceivers. To the mother of the victors, great bliss, I pay homage.
sa chu me rlung 'byung bzhi rnam dag pa/ / dag pa'i zhal bzhis rigs kyi yum bzhir rol/ / dran pa nyer bzhag ye shes bzhi yi dngos/ / mkha' 'gro ma tshogs yum la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

The purities of the four elements—earth, water, fire, and wind— are the four pure faces manifesting as the four female consorts of the families. You are the foundations of mindfulness, the objects of the four wisdoms. To the ḍākinīs, the female consorts, I pay homage.
sems kyi rnam 'phrul sa bla'i srid pa sbyong / / zhe sdang rnam dag thugs kyi 'khor lor snang / / thod pa'i dum bu rab gtum ma la sogs/ / gnas dang nye gnas rnam la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

The projections of mind rule existence above the earth. The purity of aggression appears as the mind cakra. To Khaṇḍakapāla and Pracaṇḍā, and the others, those of the abodes and nearby abodes, I pay homage. {172}
gsung gi spros pas sa steng srid (172)pa spyod/ / 'dod chags rnam dag gsung gi 'khor lor snang / / myu gu can dang sa srung ma la sogs/ / zhing dang nye zhing bzhugs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

The emanations of speech rule existence on the earth. The purity of desire appears as the speech cakra. To Aṅkuraka and Airāvatī, and the others, those abiding in the fields and nearby fields, I pay homage.
sku la rol pas sa 'og srid pa spyod/ / gti mug rnam dag sku yi 'khor lor snang / / stobs po che dang 'khor lo'i shugs can sogs/ / 'du dang nye 'dur bzhugs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

The displays of body rule existence below the earth. The purity of bewilderment appears as the body cakra. To Mahābala and Cakravegā, and the others, those abiding gathering places and the nearby gathering places, I pay homage.
yang dag las mtha' 'tsho ba rtsol dang dran/ / bde chen dga' la mos dang gtso la phyogs/ / gdug pa'i dgra bgegs ma lus 'dul mdzad pa'i/ / sgo bzhi'i lha mo rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

To those of correct actions, livelihood, effort, and mindfulness, with conviction in the joy of great bliss and on the side of the principal one, who tame the malevolent enemies and obstructors, to the goddesses of the four doors, I pay homage.
brtson 'grus rnam dag yang dag spong ba bzhi/ / gshin rje brtan ma la sogs lha mo rnams/ / phyogs gnyis 'dzin pa'i sku mdog phyed gzugs zhal/ / gtso chen mtshams ma rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

The purity of exertion and the four correct relinquishments are the goddesses, Yamadāḍhī and the others, with forms and faces of divided colors, bodies that embrace two directions. To the ladies of the intermediate directions of the great principal one, I pay homage.
rin chen las grub dpag med gzhal yas khang / / byang chub mchog gi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs/ / gtso bo bde chen thugs kyi snang ba ste/ / rgyan dang lha mos mdzes la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

The unfathomable palace made of precious gems, complete with the qualities of sublime awakening, is an appearance of the principal one, mind, great bliss. To the ornaments and goddesses who beautify, I pay homage.

bder gshegs brgyad ni bstan pa'i snyigs mar 'byung / / bdag med 'khor lo dur khrod brgyad du byung / / byang chub rten du shing brgyad mngon du gyur/ / 'jig rten chos brgyad bsregs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

The eight sugatas appear during the degeneration of the teachings. The cakra of no-self arises as the eight charnel grounds. The eight trees manifest as the supports for awakening. To the burning of the eight worldly values, I pay homage.
zhes dpal nA ro pas mdzad pas bstod/ / sgrub thabs ltar/
Praise with those verses composed by the glorious Nāropa. As in the sādhana, say:
lha thams cad kyi thugs ka'i thugs rdo rje sogs bzlas dmigs bzlas pa bcas ji ltar 'os par byas mthar/
In the hearts of the Vajra Minds, who [reside] in the hearts of all the deities,…[*22] Do the recitation-visualization with the mantra recitation as is suitable. At the end, say:
bcom ldan 'das bdag dang sems can thams cad la mchog dang thun mong gi dngos grub ma lus pa stsal du gsol/
Bhagavān, please bestow upon me and all sentient beings all the supreme and common siddhis.
zhes gsol ba gdab bo/ /
Thus, supplicate.
de nas slob ma 'jug pa ltar bdag 'jug rdzogs par blangs pa'i mthar bden stobs brjod pa ni/
Next, complete the self-entering [up through] the complete arising [as the deity] according to the entering of disciples. At the end, say the expression of the strength of truth as follows:
nam mkha' las byung mtshan ldan phyir/ / thog ma tha ma med pa'i bdag / rdo rje sems dpa' che'i rang bzhin/ / bde mchog 'khor lor bdag grub mdzod/ /
Because it is authentic, arising from space, the self that is beginningless and endless and of the nature of great Vajrasattva is Cakrasaṃvara: I will achieve that.
kun mchog yon tan chen po ste/ / dbang phyug chen po lhag pa'i lha/ / rdo rje 'dzin pa kun gyi rgyal/ / mi 'gyur mchog (173)tu bdag grub mdzod/ /
Most sublime, the one of great virtues, Maheśvara, the special deity, Vajradhara, victor of all, {173} the unchanging sublime: I will achieve that.
nyes pa mi mnga' rtag pa ste/ / 'dod chags kun gyi rjes chags pa/ / 'dod chags chen po dga' ba che/ / bcom ldan de nyid bdag grub mdzod/ /
Permanent, free from flaws, the passion of all desires, great passion, great joy, the Bhagavān: I will achieve that.
shin tu dga' ba rnams kyi mchog / gdod nas grol ba de bzhin gshegs/ / kun tu bzang po kun bdag nyid/ / byang chub sems dpar bdag grub mdzod/ /
The best of all joys, the tathāgata, free from the start, Samantabhadra, lord of all, the bodhisattva: I will achieve that.
kun mchog dngos grub chen po ste/ / dbang phyug chen po phyag rgya'i mchog / grub pa'i rdo rje cher ston pa/ / rdo rje snyems ma bdag grub mdzod/ /
All-supreme, the one of great siddhis, Maheśvara, the best of mudrās, teacher of the great vajra of siddhi, lord Vajragarva: I will achieve that.[11]
sems can kun gyi yid khyab pa/ / sems can kun gyi yid la gnas/ / sems can kun gyi yab yin te/ / 'dod chags mchog gi dam tshig mchog /
Pervading the minds of all sentient beings and abiding in the minds of all sentient beings is the father of all sentient beings. Passion is the sublime samaya, sublime.
ces dang /
And:
shes rab thabs bdag dkyil 'khor 'dir/ / bden pa gang gi ye shes mchog / bden pa 'di yi mgon khyod kyis/ / bdag gi 'dod pa yongs rdzogs mdzod/ /
In this maṇḍala of the lord of prajñā and method is the supreme wisdom of truth. You, protector of this truth, please fulfill my desires.
chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste/ / dag cing gsal la rnyog pa med/ / gzung du med cing brjod du med/ / rgyu dang las las kun tu 'byung / /
All phenomena are like reflections: pure, clear, and unsullied. They cannot be grasped or described. They arise from causes and karma.
de bzhin gnyis med las byung ba/ / bden pa de yis dkyil 'khor du/ / gzugs brnyan gsal bar slob ma rnams/ / kun gyis sgrib med mthong bar shog /
Similarly, they arise from nonduality. Due to that truth, the disciples appear as reflections in the maṇḍala. May all see without obscuration.
de nas sgrub thabs ltar sngags rnams kyis mchod do/ /
Then, make offerings with the mantras according to the sādhana.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi'i dbang bskur ba ni/
B. The Bestowal of the Abhiṣekas in the Main Practice
slob ma rnams la sgo drung du khrus byas phyag 'tshal gral du 'khod pa la me tog bkram bsdu dang / kun slong bcos pa chos bshad ci rigs bcas kyis mtshams sbyar te/

In front of the door, the disciples should wash, prostrate, and sit in rows. Distribute flowers and then collect them. With an explanation of the intention to be developed and a relevant explanation of the dharma, make the introductory [remarks].
'dir sgra bsgyur mar pa'i thugs bcud bde mchog 'khor lo lha bcu pa dwags po'i snyan brgyud lugs kyi dbang bskur bgyi ba la slob dpon gyis bgyi 'os mtha' dag legs par grub/

Here, what is to be done for the abhiṣekas of the Dakpo Aural Transmission tradition—the ten deities of Cakrasaṃvara, which are the heart-elixir of the translator Marpa—have been properly done by the ācārya.
khyed rang rnams kyi ngo skal du gyur pa la dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i skor dang / zhugs pa la mngon par dbang bskur ba gnyis las/
For all of you, there are two parts: entering the maṇḍala and, having entered, the actual bestowal of the abhiṣekas.
dang po dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i chos rnams zhu ba'i ched du maN+Dal phul mdzod/ de nas (174) snyims pa me tog dang bcas pa'i thal mo sbyor la gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
First, to request the dharma for entering the maṇḍala, offer a maṇḍala. {174} Then, with your hands in añjali with beautiful flowers, repeat this supplication three times:
dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa ste/ / sogs/

Great joy, you are my teacher [Ācārya, please consider me. I request the great protector to teach the way to great awakening. Bestow on me this samaya. Bestow on me bodhicitta. Bestow on me the three refuges: the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha. Protector, please enter me into the city of great liberation.]
zhes kha bskang /
In addition, say:
de nas rigs nges par bya ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di skad dris pa'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Then, to determine your family, feel that the ācārya is questioning you:
kyai sdug pa khyod su yin/ / zhes dris pa'i lan btab par mos te 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
“Kye. Beautiful one, who are you?” Feel that you are answering that question and repeat:
bde ba chen por mos pa bdag ni skal pa bzang po'o/ / de nas 'dun pa nges phyir 'di skad dris pa'i mos pa mdzod/
I who aspire to great bliss am one of good fortune. Then, to be certain of your intention, feel you are being asked,
bu khyod ci zhig 'dod/ / ces dris pa'i lan btab par mos te 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
“Child, what do you desire?” Feel that you are answering that question as you repeat:
sangs rgyas mchog gi dam tshig 'dod de 'tshal lo/ /
I desire and seek the samayas of the supreme buddhas.
til dang me snod chu snod rnams 'du bgyis te/
Assemble the sesame seeds, fire container, and water container.
de nas sdig pa sbyang ba'i slad du dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/
Then, in order to purify your negative actions, do the following visualization:
khyed rang rnams kyi rkang mthil du ya~M/ lte bar ra~M/ de'i steng du hU~M/ snying gar sdig pa'i ngo bo ka~M nag po rnams sgoms/
Meditate that there are yaṃs at the soles of your feet, a raṃ at your navel, a hūṃ above that, and a black kaṃ, the essence of your negative actions, at your heart.

rkang mthil gyi ya~M las rlung g.yos/ ra~M las me 'bar ba dang / de'i steng gi hU~M khro bo rdo rje gnod sbyin du gyur pas/ snying ga'i ka~M ded de sna sgo nas thon/ sdig pa rwa can gyi rnam par gyur pa til la thim pa mes bsregs shing / chus sbyangs pa'i mos pa mdzod/

From the yaṃs at the soles of your feet, wind blows. From the raṃ, fire blazes. The hūṃ above that becomes wrathful Vajrayakṣa. The kaṃ at your heart flees and goes out your nostril. Your negative actions become a form with horns and dissolve into the sesame seeds. Feel that they are burned up by the fire and cleansed by the water.
til me dang chur 'debs shing /
Throw the sesame seeds into the fire and water.
oM badzra kro d+ha trai lo kya bi dza khA hi khA hi/ sarba pA pa~M da ha na b+ha smin ku ru hU~M phaT/
oṃ vajrakrodha trailokyavija khāhi khāhi / sarvapāpaṃ dahana bhasmina kuru hūṃ phaṭ
ces mang du bzla/ de nas chang bu mang po la chab bran/
Recite that many times. Then, sprinkle water on many changbus.
oM badzra a mr-i ta sogs kyis bsang /
oṃ vajra amṛta… Cleanse with that.
a kA ro lan gsum gyis byin gyis brlab/ bden stobs brjod la bgegs 'gugs/ cha gsum ltar/ gung ka ris bsngo / Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod /

Saying akāro three times, consecrate. Say the expression of the strength of truth and summon the obstructors. According to the three-part [rituals], dedicate with gung ka ri. Make offerings with arghaṃ and so forth.
gang zhig mtshan mor rgyu ba yi/ / sogs kyis

Those who move in the night, [bhūtas and piśāca, rākṣasas eating raw meat, all kinds of sentient beings, those dwelling in trees, branches, and the like, for them, we offer this torma of food, meat, beer, turnips, cooked rice, and fruits. May these delight you. May your ill will be pacified, and from today on, may you arouse a helpful attitude toward us. Those who are adorned with ornaments, practicing the dharma, tamed, acting purely with the vows, and give up punishing beings are bhikṣus, śrāmaṇas, and brahmans. Everyone is afraid of weapons. All protect their own lives. Taking your own body as an example, do not harm others. oṃ Whether you are great or small, take these illnesses that harm our bodies, and, spirits, go back to your own places. We have done whatever we can, making offerings and paying respect. Thus, abide in samaya and fulfill our intentions. Always abide within samaya and cure the illnesses of all sentient beings here. Spirits, go to your own places.]
phrin las bcol/ sum+b+ha ni'i sngags kyis bgegs bskrad/
Thus, entrust them with activity. With the sumbha ni mantra, expel the obstructors.
oM badzra rak+Sha rak+Sha hU~M/
oṃ vajra rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ
rdo rje'i srung 'khor brtan pos bsrung bar gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that the stable vajra circle of protection provides protection.

de nas khyed rang skad cig gis bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo bde mchog sngon po rdo rje dang dril bu thugs kar bsnol te 'dzin pas yum rdo rje phag mo dmar mo gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa dang mnyam par sbyor ba/ he ru ka'i cha byad thams cad (175) rdzogs pa'i skur gyur/

Then, instantly you become the form of the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, blue, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā crossed at your heart, in union with your consort Vajravārāhī, who is red and holding a hooked knife and skull cup. All the attributes of a heruka are complete. {175}

de'i spyi bor oM haHdkar po rdo rje sems dpa'/ mgo bor na ma hI ser po rnam par snang mdzad/ spyi gtsug tu swA hA hu dmar po pad+ma gar dbang / phrag pa gnyis su bau ShaT he nag po mi bskyod pa/ mig gnyis su hU~M hoHdmar ser rdo rje nyi ma/ yan lag thams cad la phaT haM ljang gu dpal rta mchog ste/ ngo bo lha la rnam pa yi ge'i go chas rgyas btab pa'i mos pa mdzod/

At the top of your head is white oṃ haḥ, Vajrasattva. In your head is yellow nama hī, Vairocana. At the crown of your head is red svāhā hu, Padmanarteśvara. In both your shoulders are black vauṣaṭ hes, Akṣobhyas. In both your eyes are orange hūṃ hoḥs, Vajrasūryas. In all your limbs are green phaṭ haṃs, glorious Paramāśvas. Feel that you are sealed by the armor that is in essence the deities, in manifestation the letters.
de nas sngon chad dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor chen po ma mjal ba'i brdar ras yugs dmar po re gdong g.yogs su byin pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Next, as a symbol that you have not previously met the great maṇḍala of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, feel that you are being given a red cloth as a blindfold.
oM tsak+Shu r+b+han+d+ha wa ra mA na ya hU~M/ zhes sbyin/
oṃ cakṣurbhandha varamānaya hūṃ Give them the blindfold.
dkyil 'khor gyi lha dang mjal ba'i phyag rten gyi slad du u dum wA ra la sogs pa'i me tog gi chun po kha dog lnga ba re byin pa'i mos pa mdzod/
In order to have a gift for meeting the deities of the maṇḍala, feel that you are being given a bouquet of flowers of five colors, such as udumbāras.
oM A khaM bI ra hU~M/ zhes sbyin/
oṃ akhaṃ vīra hūṃ Give them flowers.
ji skad du/ dkyil 'khor du ni 'jug pa la/ / gong ma gong ma'i sdom pa ni/ / bu khyod kyis ni bsrung bya ste/ / grol ba'i rgyu ni de las gzhan/ / thabs ni cung zad yod ma yin/ /
As is said, to enter the maṇḍala, child, you must protect the vows higher than the high. Those are the causes of liberation— there are no other methods.
ces gsungs pa ltar thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sdom pa 'dzin dgos pas thog mar sdom pa zhu phyir maN+Dal phul/ de nas gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
As is said, you must keep the vows, common and uncommon. First, in order to request the vows, offer a maṇḍala. Then, repeat the following supplication three times:

sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin sku/ / slob dpon la ni skyabs su mchi/ / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma 'khor lo/ / rnal 'byor gnas la bdag phyag 'tshal/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi dam tshig dang / / sdom pa gsang mchog bshad du gsol/ /

In you whose body is of the nature of all buddhas, ācārya, I take refuge. To the cakras of heroes and yoginīs, abiding in yoga, I pay homage. Please explain the sublime secret vows and samayas of all buddhas.

de nas bla med sngags kyi sems bskyed pa'i slad du/ /sems can thams cad kyi don du myur du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'i blo dung ba re skyed mdzod/ de yongs su gyur pa las khyed rang lhar gsal ba'i snying gar kun rdzob byang chub sems kyi ngo bo zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nya gang ba bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin tu mos mdzod/ de nas chos thams cad spros pa thams cad (176)dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bu'o snyam pa'i don dam byang chub sems kyi ngo bo rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa re gyur par mos la bden gnyis dbyer med du sems bskyed pa'i blos 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/

Next, in order to arouse the intention of the unsurpassable Mantra, generate the longing, thinking, “For the sake of all sentient beings, I will quickly attain the state of perfect buddhahood.” Having done that, visualize yourself as the deity. Feel that in your heart is a maṇḍala of the full moon, the essence of conventional bodhicitta, of the nature of great bliss. {176} Then, thinking that all phenomena are free from elaborations, like space, feel that there is a blue five-pointed vajra, the essence of ultimate bodhicitta. With a mind that gives rise to both truths inseparably, repeat the following:
oM bo d+hi tsit+ta sarba yo ga tsit+ta ut+pA da yA mi/
oṃ bodhicitta sarvayogacitta utpādayāmi
de nyid slob dpon gyis rdo rje me tog dang bcas pa snying gar bzhag ste brtan par byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Then, as the ācārya places a vajra with flowers on your heart, feel that that is stabilized.
oM su ra te sa ma ya s+t+waM hoH/ sid+d+hi badzra ya thA su khaM/
oṃ surate samayastvaṃ hoḥ / siddhi vajra yathā sukhaṃ
de nas gsang bar gdams pa ni/ rdo rje spyi bor bzhag ste/
Next, the instructions for secrecy. Place a vajra on their heads.
deng khyod de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis mchog tu gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs kyi/ gzhan ma zhugs pa rnams kyi mdun du smra bar mi bya'o/ / khyod kyis ma dad par yang mi bya'o/ /
Today, you have entered the most secret maṇḍala of the tathāgatas. You must not speak of this in the presence of those who have not entered. You also must not do so with those who have no faith.

de nas bla ma dang dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs/ gzhan yang sangs rgyas byang sems rnams kyi drung du thun mong ba byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa dang / des bsdus pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa 'dzin cing srung snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/ /

Next, in the presence of the gurus, the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, the buddhas, and bodhisattvas, thinking that you arouse the common supreme bodhicitta and that you will hold and preserve the vows of a bodhisattva, which encompass that, repeat the following three times:
dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/ / sogs/

I take refuge in the three jewels. [I confess each and every negative action and unvirtuous deed. I rejoice in the virtuous actions of all beings. I supplicate you to turn the wheel of dharma. I supplicate you not to pass into nirvāṇa. May I abide on the path of yoga. May I guard all samayas. May I achieve the freeing of all sentient beings from suffering. May I become a buddha: one endowed with all the most sublime manifestations, the virtues of the teachings, and so on. May I liberate all beings.]
de nas thun mong ma yin pa sngags kyi sdom pa 'dzin cing srung snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Next, thinking that you will hold and preserve the vows of the uncommon Mantra, repeat the following three times:
sras bcas sangs rgyas thams cad dang / / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams kun/ / bdag la dgongs par mdzad du gsol/ /
All buddhas together with your children, all heroes and yoginīs, please consider me.

bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas ni/ / dus ni 'di nas bzung nas su/ / byang chub snying por mchis kyi bar/ / ji ltar dus gsum mgon po rnams/ / byang chub tu ni nges mdzad pa'i/ / byang chub sems ni bla na med/ / dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi/ /

I, called by this name (insert your name), starting from this time until reaching the heart of awakening, give rise to genuine [bodhicitta], just as the protectors of the three times gave rise to unsurpassable bodhicitta, which definitely brings awakening.
sangs rgyas rnal 'byor sdom pa la/ / tshul khrims kyi ni bslab pa dang / / dge ba'i chos ni sdud pa dang / / sems can don byed tshul khrims gsum/ / bdag gis brtan por gzung bar bgyi/ /
For the vow of buddhayoga, I will hold firmly the three modes of ethical conduct: training in ethical conduct, gathering virtuous qualities, and benefiting sentient beings.
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / bla na med pa'i dkon mchog gsum/ / deng nas brtsams te gzung bar bgyi/ / nam du yang ni (177) mi spang ngo / /
The Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha are the unsurpassable three jewels. From now on, I will hold them {177} and will never abandon them.
rdo rje'i rigs mchog chen po la/ / rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya yang / / yang dag nyid du gzung bar bgyi/ / slob dpon dag kyang gzung bar bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme vajra family, I will hold perfectly the vajra, ghaṇṭā, and mudrās and I will hold the ācārya.
rin chen rigs mchog chen po yi/ / dam tshig yid du 'ong ba la/ / nyin re zhing ni dus drug tu/ / sbyin pa rnam bzhi rtag tu sbyin/ /
For the great, supreme ratna family, I will always perform the four types of generosity six times each day as the samaya that is pleasing to the mind.
byang chub chen po las byung ba'i/ / pad+ma'i rigs chen dag pa la/ / phyi nang gsang ba theg pa gsum/ / dam pa'i chos ni gzung bar bgyi/ /
For the great, pure padma family, arising from great awakening, I will hold the genuine dharma of the three yānas, outer, inner, and secret.
las kyi rigs mchog chen po la/ / sdom pa thams cad ldan par ni/ / yang dag nyid du gzung bar bgyi/ / mchod pa'i las kyang ci nus bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme karma family, I will hold perfectly all the vows. I will perform all possible acts of worship.
bla na med pa'i byang chub sems/ / dam pa bdag gis bskyed bgyis nas/ / sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir/ / bdag gis sdom pa ma lus bzung / /
Having developed genuine, unsurpassable bodhicitta, I will hold all the vows for the benefit of all sentient beings.
ma brgal ba rnams bsgral bar bgyi/ / ma grol ba rnams bdag gis dgrol/ / dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung zhing / / sems can mya ngan 'das la 'god/ /
May I release those who have not been released. May I liberate those who have not been liberated. May I provide relief to those who have no relief. May I establish sentient beings in nirvāṇa.
de nas khyad par gyi dam tshig rtsa ltung bcu bzhi dang sbom po brgyad de nyer gnyis po rnams 'dzin cing srung snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Next, thinking that you will hold and preserve the specific samayas—the fourteen root downfalls and the eight gross transgressions—those twenty-two, repeat the following three times:
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun la/ / rtag par bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ /
In the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha, I always take refuge.
rnal 'byor gsang sngags mkha' 'gro ma/ / 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid can/ / kun la rtag tu skyabs su mchi/ /
In the Yogin, the secret mantras, and ḍākinīs, who are embodiments of the three cakras, I always take refuge.
dpa' bo dpa' mo dbang lha mo/ / byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid che/ / khyad par du yang slob dpon la/ / rtag par bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ /
In the heroes, heroines, abhiṣeka goddesses, bodhisattvas, great beings, and, especially, the ācārya, I always take refuge.
dpal ldan khrag 'thung sogs dpa' bo/ / rnal 'byor ma dang snang mdzad sogs/ / byang chub sems dpa' dpag med pa/ / thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
Heroes, the glorious Heruka and others, the yoginīs, Vairocana and the others, the innumerable bodhisattvas, please consider me.
bdag gis dus 'di nas bzung ste/ / ji srid gnyis med la gnas pa/ / de yi tshangs spyod gnyis med pa/ / nyi shu rtsa gnyis legs par gzung / /
