From this time onward, as long as I abide in nonduality, I will hold properly the twenty-two forms of the nondual pure conduct.
de nas gzhal yas khang du 'jug par zhu ba'i slad du maN+Dal phul/ (178) de nas snyims pa me tog dang bcas pa'i thal mo sbyor la gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Next, as a request to enter the palace, offer a maṇḍala. {178} Then, with your hands in añjali with beautiful flowers, repeat this supplication three times:
don dam smra ba'i seng ge'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba/ / nyon mongs gcod pa'i don la shin tu mkhas gyur pa/ /
Those called “lionlike yogic practitioners proclaiming the ultimate,” are very skilled in the meaning of severing mental afflictions.
srid pa'i nyes brgya skyed rtsa'i nyon mongs choms mdzod la/ / rnal 'byor don dam rgyal po de nyid grub par mdzod/ /
To uproot the root mental afflictions, which generate the hundred flaws of existence, I will achieve this king of ultimate yogas.
ces gsol ba btab pa'i lan du gnang ba sbyin pa ni 'di la gsan 'tshal/ /
As the reply to that supplication, please listen to this granting of permission:
de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas/ / he ru ka dpal grong khyer mchog / snying po'i dkyil 'khor 'di ru ni/ / bdag gis slob ma gzhug par bgyi/ /
Into the place of all tathāgatas, the supreme city of the glorious Heruka, this heart maṇḍala, I will enter the disciples.
zhes gnang ba byin nas slob dpon gyis khyed rang he ru kar gsal ba dkyil 'khor gyi shar sgo nas nang du khrid pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Saying that and having granted permission, feel that the ācārya leads you, who appear as the Heruka, through the eastern door of the maṇḍala and inside.
hU~M dza hU~M/
hūṃ ja hūṃ
nang du dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor gsal bar bzhugs pa rnams la thal mo gnas gsum du sbyar te sku gsung thugs la phyag 'tshal ba'i mos pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/ /

To all those who reside clearly within the maṇḍala of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, feel that you are joining your hands in añjali at your three places and paying homage to their bodies, speech, and minds while repeating:
oM na maHte hU~M/ na mA mi hU~M/ na mo na maHhU~M/
oṃ namaḥ te hūṃ / namā mi hūṃ / namo nāmaḥ hūṃ
yang shar sgo'i thad kyi khyams nas phyag 'tshal bar mos pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
Again, feel that you make prostrations in the courtyard directly in front of the eastern door while repeating the following:
oM sarba ta tha ga ta bI ra yo gi ni/ pU dza u pa s+thA na ya/ At+ma nAM nir+YA ta yA mi/ sarba ta thA ga ta bI ra yo ga nI/ At+ma DA ki nI/ Ad+hi tiSh+Tha swA mAM/
oṃ sarvatathagata vīra yogini / pūja upasṣānaya / ātmanāṃ niryātayāmi / sarvatathāgata vīra yoginī / ātma ḍākinī / adhitiṣṭha svāmāṃ
yang g.yon skor gyis song ste byang sgo'i thad nas phyag 'tshal bar mos pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
Next, feel that you circle counterclockwise and make prostrations directly in front of the northern door while repeating the following:
oM sarba ta thA ga ta bI ra yo gi ni/ pU dza karma ni/ At+ma nAM ni r+YA ta ya mi/ sarba ta thA ga ta bI ra yo gi nI/ At+ma lA ma ye badzra karmA ku ru mAM/
oṃ sarvatathāgata vīra yogini / pūja karmani / ātmanāṃ nīryātayami / sarvatathāgata vīra yoginī / ātma lāmaye vajra karmā kuru māṃ
yang g.yon skor gyis song ste nub sgo'i thad nas phyag 'tshal bar mos pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
Again, feel that you circle counterclockwise and make prostrations directly in front of the western door while repeating the following:
oM sarba ta thA ga ta bI ra yo gi nI/ pU dza pra warta nA ya/ At+ma nAM nIr+Ya ta yA mi/ sarba ta thA ga ta bI ra yo gi nI/ At+ma khaN+Da ro hi/ badzra d+harma pra wartA ya maM/
oṃ sarvatathāgata vīra yoginī / pūja pravartanāya / ātmanāṃ nīryatayāmi / sarvatathāgata vīra yoginī / ātma khaṇḍarohi / vajra dharma pravartāya maṃ
yang g.yon skor gyi song ste lho sgo'i thad nas phyag 'tshal bar mos pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
Next, feel that you circle counterclockwise and make prostrations directly in front of the southern door while repeating the following:
oM sarba ta thA ga ta bI ra yo gi nI/ pU dza a b+hi She ka ya/ At+ma nAM nir+Ya ta yA mi/ sarba ta thA ga (179) ta bI ra yo gi nI/ At+ma rU pi ni/ badzra rat+na a b+hi Shiny+tsa mAM/
oṃ sarvatathāgata vīra yoginī / pūja abhiṣekaya / ātmanāṃ niryatayāmi / {179} sarvatathāgata vīra yoginī / ātma rūpini / vajra ratna abhiṣiñja māṃ
de rnams kyis phyi 'jug grub/
Those complete the external entering.
gnyis pa nang 'jug gi sngon 'gro dam la bzhag pa la bzhi las/ dang po phan yon gyi sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/
Second, the preliminaries for entering inside are to establish your commitment. This has four parts. The first is to establish your commitment by referring to the benefits.
rdo rje mgor bzhag la/
Place a vajra on their heads and say:

deng khyod dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rigs su zhugs kyi/ ngas khyod la rdo rje'i ye shes bskyed par bya ste/ ye shes gang gis khyod de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dngos grub kyang 'thob par 'gyur na/ dngos grub gzhan lta ci smos/ khyod kyis dkyil 'khor chen po ma mthong ba rnams kyi mdun du smra bar mi bya ste khyod dam tshig nyams par 'gyur ta re/

Today, you have entered into the family of heroes and yoginīs. I will arouse vajra wisdom within you. If that wisdom brings the attainment of the siddhis of all tathāgatas, what need is there to mention other siddhis? You must not speak of this in the presence of those who have not seen the great maṇḍala. You will risk damaging your samaya.
gnyis pa nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/ rdo rje snying gar bzhag la/
The second is to establish your commitment by referring to the disadvantages. Place a vajra at their hearts and say:
he ru ka dpal deng khyod kyi/ / snying la yang dag zhugs gyur te/ / gal te tshul 'di smras na ni/ / de ma thag tu dral te gshegs/ /
Today, glorious Heruka has truly entered your heart. If you speak about this state, immediately he will separate and be gone.
gsum pa phan yon nyes dmigs gnyis ka'i sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/ dung zhal gyi chur nang mchod btab pa byin te/
The third is to establish your commitment by referring to both the benefits and the disadvantages. Put the inner offering in the water of the conch and give it to them, saying:
'di ni khyod kyi dmyal ba'i chu/ / dam tshig 'das na sreg par byed/ / dam tshig bsrungs na dngos grub ni/ / rdo rje bdud rtsi'i chu 'dis 'grub/ /
This is the water of hell for you. If you transgress samaya, it will burn. If you preserve samaya, you will achieve siddhi with this water of vajra amṛta.
oM pany+tsa a mr-i ta u da ka Tha Tha hU~M/
oṃ pañca amṛta udaka ṭhaṭha hūṃ
bzhi pa rdo rje slob dpon bka' gnyan pa'i sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/ rdo rje spyi bor bzhag la/
The fourth is to establish your commitment by referring to the strict command of the vajrācārya. Place a vajra on their heads and say:

deng phyin chad khyod kyi he ru ka nga yin gyi/ gang ngas 'di gyis shig ces bsgo ba de khyod kyi bya dgos so/ / khyod kyis nga la brnyas par ma byed cig / byas na khyod mi bde ba ma spangs par tshe'i dus byas nas dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ta re/

From today on, I am your Heruka. Whatever I say to do, you must do that. You must not have contempt for me. If you do, you risk not being able to abandon unhappiness and, when your life ends, falling into hell.
de nas nang 'jug gi dngos gzhi ye shes dbab pa zhu ba'i yon tu maN+Dal phul/ de nas thal mo sbyor la gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Next, the main practice of entering inside. As a gift for requesting the descent of the wisdom ones, offer a maṇḍala. Then, with your hands in añjali, repeat this supplication three times:

bla ma dam pa dang dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyis byin gyis rlobs la/ dpal he ru ka bdag la dbab par mdzad du gsol/ de nas ye shes dbab pa'i slad du khyed rang rnams skyil krung mnyam bzhag gi phyag rgya dang / (180) lus drang por bsrang / lta stangs nam mkha' la gtod/ rig pa hur bton te/

Genuine gurus, heroes, and yoginīs, bless me. Bring down the glorious Heruka upon me. Then, in order that the wisdom ones descend, you should sit cross-legged, with the mudra of equipoise. {180} Straighten your body. Direct your gaze into space, and intensify your awareness.

skad cig gis khyed rang dpal 'khor lo sdom pa sngon po phyag gnyis rdor dril thugs kar bsnol te 'dzin pas yum rdo rje phag mo dmar mo gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin par 'khyud pa/ zhabs g.yas bskums pa'i stabs kyis bzhengs pa/ de'i thugs kar nyi zla g.yas g.yon du 'khor ba'i gdan la lhan skyes yab yum sku shin tu phra ba/ cang te'u dang dril bu 'khrol ba/ gar mdzad cing nam mkha' la gzigs nas pheM gyi sgra sgrogs pa/ nyi ma bye ba du ma las kyang ches cher 'bar ba'i 'od zer gyis sa gsum gyi dpa' bo dang / rnal 'byor ma dang / dus gsum gyi bde bar gshegs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad bsdus te spyan drangs nas byon pa rnams khyed rang gi spyi bo'i gtsug / dbang po'i sgo/ ba spu'i bu ga rnams la char babs pa ltar sib sib thim pa'i mos pa rtse gcig tu mdzod cig /

Instantly, you become the complete form of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, blue, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā crossed at your heart, embracing your consort Vajravārāhī, who is red and holding a hooked knife and skull cup. You stand in the posture of your right leg bent. In your heart, on sun and moon seats, circling clockwise and counterclockwise are very small forms of the Sahaja, male and female consorts. They are playing changteus and ghaṇṭās. Dancing and gazing into space, they make the sounds of pheṃ. Light rays blazing stronger than millions of suns gather and invite the heroes and yoginīs of the three planes, the sugatas of the three times, and the retinue of the maṇḍala. Feel that they come and, like rain falling, dissolve gently into the crown of your head, your sense doors, and your pores. Be one-pointed.
spos rol DA dril dang bcas te yab yum gyi snying po dang nye snying bzhi'i mthar/
With incense and music, including ḍamaru and ghaṇṭā, say the four essence and quintessence mantras of the male and female consorts. At the end, say:
oM tiSh+Tha ma hA kro d+ha A we sha ya hU~M/ oM shrI he ru kA bid+ma he bid+yA rA dza ya d+hI ma he swA hA/
oṃ tiṣṭha mahākrodha āveśaya hūṃ / oṃ śrīherukā vidmahe vidyārājaya dhīmahe svāhā
zhes mang du bzla/
Repeat that many times.
de ltar ye shes phab pa de spyi bor rdo rje rgya gram du bzhag ste brtan par byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Thus, the wisdom ones have descended. Feel that, with the placing of the crossed vajras on your head, that is stabilized.
tiSh+Tha badzra/
tiṣṭha vajra
zhes brjod/
Say that.
de nas dngos grub kyi ltas brtag pa'i phyir mig mig ras dang bcas te dkyil 'khor gyi steng gi nam mkha' la ltos la kha dog gang mthong ba de nga la smros shig /
Then, in order to examine the omens for the siddhis, with your eyes blindfolded, look into the space above the maṇḍala and tell me what colors you see.
ces smras pas lan du/ sna tshogs mthong / rang rang gis gang mthong lan gsol/
Have them reply: I saw various [colors]. Or they can offer whatever color they saw as their reply.
de'ang dkar pos zhi ba/ ser pos rgyas pa/ dmar pos dbang / sngon po dang nag pos drag po/ ljang gu dang khra bos phrin las sna tshogs 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /
White indicates that you will achieve pacifying activity; yellow, enriching; red, magnetizing; and blue or black, wrathful. Green or mottled means you will achieve various kinds of activities.
de nas slob ma lhag pa'i lha dang ngo sprad pa'i phyir bden pa'i stobs brjod pa ni/
Next, in order to introduce the disciples to their special deity, the strength of truth will be expressed.
de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas/ / he ru ka dpal pho brang mchog / snying po'i dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du/ / bdag gi slob ma gzhug par bgyi/ /
Into the abode of all tathāgatas, the supreme palace of the glorious Heruka, this heart maṇḍala, I will enter the disciples.
lha yi rigs kyi rim pa dag / bsod nams (181) ji lta de ltar shog /
The processes of the families of the deities are pure. {181} Whatever is their merit, may that be so.
'di yis dngos grub gang 'grub dang / / rigs ni gang gi snod du 'gyur/ / de yi bsod nams ci yod pa/ / dkyil 'khor 'dir ni de bzhin shog /
Through this, whatever siddhis they may achieve, whatever family they are a recipient for, and the merit for that they have, may those occur accordingly in this maṇḍala.

de nas dkyil 'khor la me tog 'bul ba ni/ 'di na dpal 'khor lo sdom pa lha bcu ba'i dkyil 'khor du bzhugs pa yin cing / de'ang gtso bo'i ye shes kyi rnam rol las rgyud tha dad pa'i gtso 'khor med kyang sngon nas las kyis 'brel ba'i rigs de la 'bab par gyur cig snyam du yid kyis bsam pa sngon du 'gro bas dngos su phyag gi me tog gi phreng ba rin po che'i phreng ba rin thang brjod pa dang bral bar gyur pa gtso bo'i dbu'i rgyan du phul pa'i mos pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzad de me tog gi dkyil 'khor du phul mdzod/

Next is the offering of flowers to the maṇḍala. Now, you have entered the maṇḍala of the ten deities of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara. There are no principal one and retinue who are separate continua from being the display of the wisdom of the principal one. Nevertheless, thinking, “May [my flower] fall on the family with whom I have a previous karmic connection,” mentally set your intention first. Then, feeling that the garland of flowers you are actually offering becomes a priceless garland of jewels that you present to the crown of the head of the principal one, repeat the following and offer flowers to the maṇḍala.
oM pra tIts+tsha badzra hoH/
oṃ pratīccha vajra hoḥ
de nas mig dbye ba ni/
Opening the eyes.
slob dpon gyis rdo rje ye shes kyi thur mas khyed rang gi ma rig pa'i ling tog bsal nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyan du byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that the ācārya removes the cataracts of your ignorance with the spoon of vajra wisdom and that you gain the eyes of omniscience.
he ru ka dpal deng khyod kyi/ / mig 'byed par ni brtson par mdzad/ / phye bas thams cad mthong 'gyur ba'i/ / rdo rje'i mig ni bla na med/ /
Today the glorious Heruka has strived to open your eyes. Once open, they are unsurpassable vajra eyes seeing everything.
oM badzra nai tra a pa ha ra pa tra laM hrIHprA~M/
oṃ vajra naitra apahara patra laṃ hrīḥ prāṃ
zhes mig ras dbye/ de nas/
Remove their blindfolds.
he badzra pA sh+ya/
hevajra pāśya
dkyil 'khor bzang po 'di la ltos/ / nga ni dad pa rab tu skyed/ / khyod ni rnal 'byor ma'i rigs skyes/ / sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlabs/ /
Behold this excellent maṇḍala. Now arouse strong faith. You have been born in the family of yoginīs. You are blessed by mantras and mudrās.
'gro ba phun sum tshogs kun dang / / dngos grub kun khyod mngon sum gyur/ /
The abundant excellence of beings and all siddhis will manifest for you.
dam tshig thams cad skyong ba dang / / gsang sngags la yang brtson par gyis/ /
Protect all samayas. Exert yourself in Secret Mantra.
zhes dkyil 'khor blta bar bskul nas/
Urge them to view the maṇḍala.

'di na bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi lha tshogs bzhugs pa yin te/ de'ang 'byung ba rim brtsegs ri rab dang bcas pa'i steng du dur khrod brgyad kyis bskor ba'i sna tshogs pad+ma'i dbus su sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar rin po che las grub pa'i gzhal yas/ zhes pa nas/ 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan gyi gdan dang bcas pa ni rten dang /

This is where the assembly of deities of the Bhagavān, glorious Cakrasaṃvara, reside. Above the layers of the elements and Mount Meru, there is a multicolored lotus surrounded by the eight charnel grounds. In its center is a viśvavajra, in whose center is a palace made of jewels,…are Bhairava and Kālarātri.[*23] That is the support.
brten pa lha ni gdan dbus ma'i steng du (182) bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo bde mchog / ces pa nas/ gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa/

The supported deities are as follows: {182} On the middle seat is the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara,…display the nine moods of the dramatic arts: erotic, heroic, revolting, laughing, fierce, terrifying, compassionate, amazing, and peaceful.[*24]
yab kyi pang du bcom ldan 'das ma/ zhes pa nas/ bdag nyid do/ / zhes pa'i bar dang / shar du bud+d+ha he ru ka nas/ bdud rtsis gang ba re re gnas pa'o/ /

In the lap of the male consort is the Bhagavatī,…the embodiment of the wisdom of great bliss.[*25] In the east, white Buddha Heruka…wisdom kapālas filled with undefiled amṛta, their foreheads facing in toward the center.[*26]
zhes pa'i bar la thig rtags can gyi tshig rnams dor ba brjod nas/
Say up to there, leaving out words with dot marks.[*27] Then say:

gtso bo yab kyi sku'i gnas rnams dang thugs kar yang dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi lha tshogs drug cu rtsa gnyis bzhugs pa/ de rnams brten pa lha ste dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad mngon sum du mjal ba'i mos pas dad gus dga' spro rgya cher skyed mdzod/ de rnams kyis dkyil 'khor chen por 'jug pa'i skor yongs su rdzogs pa grub pa lags/

In the heart and the places of the body of the principal male consort reside the sixty-two deities of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara. Feeling that you now actually meet those deities, who are the supported, and the entire maṇḍala, give rise to great faith, devotion, joy, and inspiration. That completes the section of entering the great maṇḍala.
gnyis pa zhugs pa la mngon par dbang bskur ba la dbang bzhi las/ dang po bum dbang la thun mong ba phyi dkyil gyi dbang dang / khyad par ba lus dkyil gyi dbang gnyis kyi/ /

Second, having entered [the maṇḍala], the actual abhiṣekas will be bestowed. Among the four abhiṣekas, the first is the vase abhiṣeka. It has two parts: (1) the abhiṣeka of the common outer maṇḍala and (2) the abhiṣeka of the special body maṇḍala.
dang po la bum dbang drug bskur ba dang / mtha' rten rjes gnang bdun bya ba'o/ /
The first is the bestowal of the six vase abhiṣekas and the conclusion of seven authorizations.
de dag las dang po zhu ba'i slad du maN+Dal phul/ de nas thal mo sbyor la gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
To request the first, offer a maṇḍala. Then, with your hands in añjali, repeat the following supplication three times:
he ru ka dpal dbang bskur ba/ / 'gro ba skyob phyir gzi brjid can/ / ji ltar yon tan 'byung gnas stsal/ / de bzhin bdag la deng stsol cig /
Just as Tejas bestowed upon Guṇaketu the abhiṣeka of the glorious Heruka for the sake of protecting beings, similarly, please bestow it upon me today.

de nas bum dbang gi slad du dbang stegs rin po che'i khri dang pad+ma nyi zla'i steng du khyed rang dpal 'khor lo sdom pa sngon po rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas yum rdo rje phag mo dmar mo gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa dang mnyam par sbyor ba he ru ka'i cha byad thams cad rdzogs pa'i dpral bar zla ba la oM dkar po/ mgrin par pad+ma la AHdmar po/ thugs kar nyi ma la hU~M sngon pos mtshan par gyur/

Now, for the vase abhiṣeka, [imagine the following]: On the abhiṣeka stand, a jeweled throne, on top of a lotus, sun, and moon, you are the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, blue, holding a hooked knife and skull cup, in union with your consort Vajravārāhī, who is red and holding a hooked knife and skull cup. All the attributes of a heruka are complete. At your forehead is a moon marked by a white oṃ. At your throat is a lotus marked by a red āḥ. At your heart is a sun marked by a blue hūṃ.

slob ma dang slob dpon gyi thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od zer 'phros pas dbang gi lha bla ma he ru ka dang rigs lnga yab yum/ dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / steng du brgyud pa'i bla ma grub thob (183)kyi tshogs dang bcas pa nye bar bskul cing spyan drangs/

Light rays stream forth from the hūṃs at the hearts of the disciples and the ācārya invoking and inviting the abhiṣeka deities, gurus, Heruka, the male and female consorts of the five families, the heroes and yoginīs, the buddhas and bodhisattvas, together with an assembly of the siddha-gurus of the lineage above. {183}
oM badzra sa mA dzaH
oṃ vajra samājaḥ
oM pany+tsa ku la sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/ nas/ shab+da 'i bar dang / oM AHhU~M/ zhes bdud rtsi dbul/
oṃ pañcakula saparivāra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā…śabda… And: oṃ āḥ hūṃ Offer amṛta.
gang gi drin gyis bde chen nyid/ / sogs dang /
Through your kindness, great bliss [arises in an instant. To the lotus feet of the guru, with a precious vajra body, I bow.]
chos sku nam mkha' bzhin du dbyer med cing / / sogs dang /

Although inseparable from the space-like dharmakāya, [your rainbowlike form kāyas appear individually. Homage and praises to the sugatas of the five families, those who have mastered the sublime methods and prajñā.]
rdo rje can gyis sangs rgyas la/ / 'gro ba bskyab pa'i ched du dbang / / yon tan 'byung gnas ji ltar stsal/ / de ltar 'di la'ang stsal du gsol/ /
Just as the Vajrin bestowed abhiṣeka upon Guṇaketu in order to give beings refuge in the buddhas, in the same way, please bestow that here.
zhes mchod cing bstod de gsol ba btab pas/
Thus, having supplicated with offerings and praises, say:

dbang gi lha de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur ba'i dgongs pa mdzad/ khro bo dang khro mo rnams kyis bar du gcod pa'i bgegs bskrad/ sems dpa' dang sems ma rnams kyis me tog gi char chen po phab/ dbyings kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis rdo rje'i glu blangs/ rig ma rnams kyis bkra shis kyi tshigs su bcad pa brjod/ bla ma brgyud pa'i grub thob rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs/ bla ma he ru ka yab yum gyis dbang rnams bskur bar mdzad pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Feel that the abhiṣeka deities, the tathāgatas, direct their attention to bestowing the abhiṣeka. The krodhas and krodhīs dispel obstructors, who create obstacles. The male and female bodhisattvas create a great rain of flowers. The ḍākinīs of the expanse sing vajra songs. The vidyās recite verses of auspiciousness. The siddhas who are lineage gurus bestow blessings. The guru Heruka, male and female consorts, confers the abhiṣekas.

de la bum dbang drug las/ dang po me tog phreng ba'i dbang ni/ slar dkyil 'khor la phul ba'i me tog gtso bo'i dbu rgyan du gnas pa de bla ma he ru kas blangs te khyed rang gi spyi bor bcings te dbang thams cad las snga ba me tog phreng ba'i dbang bskur zhing bla mas me tog gang la phul ba'i lha la bos nas/

Among the six vase abhiṣekas, the first is the abhiṣeka of the garland of flowers. The flowers that your offered to the maṇḍala, which rest as the crown ornament of the principal one, are taken up by the guru Heruka and are bound to your head. Among all the abhiṣekas, this is the bestowal of the first, the abhiṣeka of the garland of flowers. The guru calls to the deity to whom your flower was offered, saying:
sems dpa' stobs chen khyod kyis ni/ / slob ma 'di rab gzung bar mdzod/ /
Sattva of great strength, you should accept this disciple.

ces brjod de dbang bskur bas me tog gang la phog pa'i lha'i rigs nges par byas shing der 'tshang rgya ba'i bag chags khyad par can bzhag cing / dbang de las skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes rgyud la skyes pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Thus, the abhiṣeka is bestowed. You definitely join the family of the deity upon whom your flower fell and the special latent tendency for awakening in that [family] is established. Feel that the wisdom of great bliss arising from that abhiṣeka wells up in your mindstream.
oM pra ti gr-ih+Na i maM sa twa ma hA pa la/ zhes me tog mgor bzhag /
oṃ pratigṛhṇa imaṃ satva mahābala Place flowers on their heads.
de nas badzra he ru ka'i chu'i dbang gi slad du dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/ bsang sbyang /
Next, to receive the water abhiṣeka of Vajraheruka, visualize as follows: Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las khyed rang badzra he ru ka sngon po rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i skur gyur/ de la bla ma he ru ka yab (184)yum dang / dbang lha dpag tu med pa rnams kyis gtso bo mi bskyod he ru ka'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa'i chu spyi gtsug tu blugs te dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/

Within emptiness, you become the form of Vajraheruka, blue, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā. {184} Feel that the guru Heruka, male and female consorts, and innumerable abhiṣeka deities pour water from the vase that is of the nature of the principal one Akṣobhya Heruka on the crown of your head, bestowing the abhiṣeka.
dbang bskur rdo rje chen po ni/ khams gsum kun gyis phyag byas pa/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang gsum gyi/ / gnas las byung ba sbyin par bya/ /
The great vajra abhiṣeka is worshipped by all in the three realms. I give you this that arises from the places of the three secrets of all buddhas.
oM hrIHha ha hu~M hU~M phaT/ ces sogs
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ…
yab yum gyi snying po nye snying bzhi dang /
Say the four essence and quintessence mantras of the male and female consorts and then:
oM shrI badzra a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ zhes dang /
oṃ śrīvajra abhiṣiñca hūṃ And:
ji ltar bltams pa sogs nas / shri ye hU~M/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born [the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bestow the abhiṣeka. oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya] śrīye hūṃ
zhes btung du gzhug cing kha rgyan gyis slob mar 'thor/
Have them drink and sprinkle the disciples using the top ornament.

zhes dbang bskur bas lus ngag yid gsum gyi dri ma dag kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa me long lta bu'i ye shes su gnas gyur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / chu'i lhag ma spyi bor 'khyil pa las spyi gtsug tu rdo rje sems dpas dbur brgyan pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Thus, you receive the abhiṣeka. The stains of your body, speech, and mind are purified. Your ālaya consciousness is transformed into mirrorlike wisdom. Feel that your body is full, your stains are purified, and the excess water swirls to the top of your head and the top of your head is crowned by Vajrasattva.
de nas rat+na he ru ka'i dbu rgyan gyi dbang gi slad du dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/ bsang sbyang /
Next, to receive the crown abhiṣeka of the water of Ratna Heruka, visualize as follows: Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las khyed rang rat+na he ru ka ser po rin po che dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i skur gyur/ de la bla ma dang dbang lhas rat+na he ru ka'i rang bzhin gyi dbu rgyan cod pan dang bcas pa dbu la bcings te dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/

Within emptiness, you become the form of Ratna Heruka, yellow, holding a jewel and ghaṇṭā. Feel that the guru and the abhiṣeka deities tie the ribboned crown that is of the nature of Ratna Heruka to your head, bestowing the abhiṣeka.
thor tshugs cod pan gyis brgyan pa/ / sangs rgyas kun gyis bsngags pa yi/ / rin chen dag gis dbu rgyan dang / / dar dpyangs dbang bskur sbyin bar bya/ /
The crown adorns the topknot. With the jeweled crown and silks praised by all buddhas, I give you this abhiṣeka.
oM shrI rat+na he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/ oM shrI rat+na A b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ śrīratna he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā / oṃ śrīratna abhiṣiñca hūṃ
mtha' rten du bum pa'i chus kyang dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/
As the conclusion, feel that the water from the vase bestows the abhiṣeka.
ji ltar bltams pa/ sogs nas/ shri ye hU~M/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born ……………………………. śrīye hūṃ

zhes dbang bskur bas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gnas gyur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / chu'i lhag ma gyen du lud pa las rna ltag g.yas par rdo rje nyi mas dbur brgyan pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Thus, you receive the abhiṣeka. Your afflicted mentation is transformed into the wisdom of equality. Feel that your body is full, your stains are purified, and the excess water rises up and your head above your right ear is crowned by Vajrasūrya.
de nas pad+ma he ru ka'i rdo rje'i dbang gi slad du dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/ bsang sbyang /
Next, to receive the vajra abhiṣeka of Padma Heruka, visualize as follows: Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las khyed rang pad+ma he ru ka dmar po pad+ma dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i skur gyur/ de la bla ma dang dbang (185)lhas pad+ma he ru ka'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje phyag g.yas su byin te dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/

Within emptiness, you become the form of Padma Heruka, red, holding a lotus and ghaṇṭā. {185} Feel that the guru and the abhiṣeka deities place the vajra that is of the nature of Padma Heruka in your right hand, bestowing the abhiṣeka.
he ru ka dpal dbang bskur bas/ / de ring khyod la dbang bskur te/ / 'di de sangs rgyas thams cad kyis/ / rab tu grub phyir rdo rje zung / /
By bestowing the abhiṣeka of the glorious Heruka, today you have been granted abhiṣeka. In order to fully achieve the state of all buddhas,[12] hold this vajra.
oM shrI pad+ma he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/ oM shrI pad+ma a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ śrīpadma he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā / oṃ śrīpadma abhiṣiñca hūṃ
mtha' rten du bum pa'i chus kyang dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/
As the conclusion, feel that the water from the vase bestows the abhiṣeka.
ji ltar bltams pa sogs nas shri ye hU~M/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born ……………………………. śrīye hūṃ

zhes dbang bskur bas dngos po la 'jug pa'i yid so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su gnas gyur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / chu'i lhag ma yar lud pa las ltag par pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug gis dbur brgyan pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Thus, you receive the abhiṣeka. Your mental consciousness, which engages objects, is transformed into the discriminating wisdom. Feel that your body is full, your stains are purified, and the excess water rises up and the back of your head is crowned by Padmanarteśvara.
de nas karma he ru ka'i dril bu'i dbang gi slad du dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/ bsang sbyang /
Next, to receive the ghaṇṭā abhiṣeka of Karma Heruka, visualize as follows: Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las khyed rang las kyi he ru ka ljang nag sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i skur gyur/ de la bla ma dang dbang lhas karma he ru ka'i rang bzhin gyi dril bu phyag g.yon du byin te dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/

Within emptiness, you become the form of Karma Heruka, dark green, holding a viśvavajra and ghaṇṭā. Feel that the guru and the abhiṣeka deities place the ghaṇṭā that is of the nature of Karma Heruka in your left hand, bestowing the abhiṣeka.
'di ni rnal 'byor ma kun gyi/ / shes rab dbyangs kyi rjes 'gror bshad/ / khyod kyis kyang ni rtag tu bcang / / byang chub mchog tu rgyal bas bzhed/ /
This expresses what accompanies the prajñā melodies of all yoginīs. You must always hold it. The victors call it sublime awakening.
oM shrI karma he he ru ru kaM hu~M hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/ oM shrI karma a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ śrīkarma he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā / oṃ śrīkarma abhiṣiñca hūṃ
mtha' rten du bum pa'i chus kyang dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/
As the conclusion, feel that the water from the vase bestows the abhiṣeka.
ji ltar bltams pa sogs nas shrI ye hU~M/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born ……………………………. śrīye hūṃ

zhes dbang bskur bas sgo lnga'am 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bya ba grub pa'i ye shes su gnas gyur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / chu'i lhag ma yar lud pa las rna ltag g.yon par don yod grub pa rdo rje rgyal pos dbur brgyan pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Thus, you receive the abhiṣeka. Your consciousnesses that engage, or are the five doors, are transformed into the all-accomplishing wisdom. Feel that your body is full, your stains are purified, and the excess water rises up and your head above your left ear is crowned by Amoghasiddhi Vajrarāja.
de nas bud+d+ha he ru ka'i ming gi dbang gi slad du dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/ bsang sbyang /
Next, to receive the ghaṇṭā abhiṣeka of Buddha Heruka, visualize as follows: Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las khyed rang bud+d+ha he ru ka dkar po 'khor lo dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i skur gyur/ de la bla ma dang dbang (186)lhas bud+d+ha he ru ka'i rang bzhin gyi rdor dril mgo thog tu dkrol cing de'i rang bzhin gyi ming btags pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Within emptiness, you become the form of Buddha Heruka, white, holding a cakra and ghaṇṭā. {186} Feel that the guru and the abhiṣeka deities play the vajra and ghaṇṭā that are of the nature of Buddha Heruka above your head, giving you a name that is of that nature.
rdo rje dril bu yang dag 'khyud/ / g.yon snyems ma dang sgros 'dzin ma/ / gnyis med gnyis min rnal 'byor bdag / phyag rgya chen por byin gyis brlabs/ /
Truly embrace the vajra and ghaṇṭā. [With] Left Garvā and Drözinma,[13] nondual, I, the yogin with no duality am blessed as mahāmudrā.
oM shrI bud+d+ha he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/ oM shrI bud+d+ha A b+hi Shin+tsa hU~M/
oṃ śrībuddha he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā / oṃ śrībuddha abhiṣiñca hūṃ
mtha' rten du bum pa'i chus kyang dbang bskur pa'i mos pa mdzod/
As the conclusion, feel that the water from the vase bestows the abhiṣeka.
ji ltar bltams pa sogs nas shri ye hU~M/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born ……………………………. śrīye hūṃ

zhes dbang bskur bas ming gzhi chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes su gnas gyur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / chu'i lhag ma yar lud pa las dpral bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbur brgyan pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Thus, you receive the abhiṣeka. Your basis for a name is transformed into the wisdom of the dharmadhātu. Feel that your body is full, your stains are purified, and the excess water rises up and the front of your head is crowned by the tathāgata Vairocana.
de ltar rig pa'i dbang lngas nyon mongs pa lnga sbyangs nas ye shes lnga'i ngo bo he ru ka lnga bsgom pa'i skal pa can du byas pa yin no/ /
In that way you have become a fortunate one: the five abhiṣekas of awareness have purified your five mental afflictions and you can meditate on the five herukas, the essences of the five wisdoms.
gnyis pa mtha' rten rjes gnang byed pa la bdun las/
Second, there is the conclusion of seven authorizations.

dang po gsung gsang sngags kyi rjes gnang gi slad du slob dpon 'khor lo bde mchog tu gsal ba'i thugs kar nyi ma'i steng du hU~M yig gi mthar sngags phreng gis bskor ba las sngags phreng gnyis pa chad/ zhal nas thon/ slob ma'i zhal du zhugs/ thugs ka'i hU~M yig gi mthar 'khod pa'i mos pa mdzod la

First, to receive the authorization of speech, secret mantra, imagine that in the heart of the ācārya, clearly appearing as Cakrasaṃvara, on a sun is the letter hūṃ surrounded by the mantra garland. From that a second mantra garland manifests, goes out his mouth, enters the mouths of you, the disciples, and is arranged outside the letter hūṃ in your hearts.
yab yum gyi snying po nye snying rtsa sngags rnams kyi rjes zlos lan gsum re mdzod/
Repeat each of the essence, quintessence, and root mantras of the male and female consorts three times.
byas nas sgrub thabs ltar sngags rnams rjes zlos bya/
Have them repeat the mantras according to the sādhana.
de ltar byas shing phreng ba mgrin par bzhag pas ngag gi sgrib pa dag nas gsung gi dbang dang byin rlabs dngos grub thams cad thob pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Having done that and received a mālā at your throats, feel that the obscurations of your speech are purified and that you receive the abhiṣeka of speech and all the blessings and siddhis.
de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi/ / rtsa ba'i rig pa yang dag ldan/ / nyi shu rtsa gnyis sngags kyi ni/ / snying po'i dbang bskur sbyin par bya/ /
Containing the true root awareness of all tathāgatas, I give you the abhiṣeka of the essence of the mantra of twenty-two [letters].
slar yang sngags rnams bzla/
Again, recite the mantras.

gnyis pa thugs brtul zhugs kyi dbang la/ he ru ka'i brtul zhugs kyi slad du khyed rang dpal he ru ka yab yum du bskyed pa la rdo rje dril bu gtad de (187)brtul zhugs kyi rjes su gnang ba stsal bas stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po zung du 'jug pa'i mos pa mdzod/

The second is [the authorization of] mind, the abhiṣeka of discipline. To receive the discipline of a heruka, generate yourself as the glorious Heruka, male and female consorts. {187} Feel that you are given the vajra and ghaṇṭā and, by receiving the authorization of the discipline, you unify emptiness and great compassion.
'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi/ / he ru ka dpal phyag na gnas/ / khyod kyis kyang ni rtag tu bcang / / he ru ka dpal brtul zhugs brtan/ /
This abides in the hand of the glorious Heruka, who is all buddhas. You must always hold it. It stabilizes the discipline of the glorious Heruka.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta sid+d+hi badzra sa ma ya tiSh+Tha i Sha s+t+waM d+ha ra yA mi hi hi hi hi hU~M/
oṃ sarvatathāgata siddhi vajra samaya tiṣṭha iṣastvaṃ dharayāmi hi hi hi hi hūṃ
gsum pa spyod pa'i brtul zhugs kyi slad du kha T+wAM ga DA ma rus brgyan pa gru mor gtad/ tshangs skud se ral khar brgyan/ gri gug dang thod pa phyag tu gtad de brtul zhugs byin pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Third, to receive [the authorization of] the discipline of conduct, feel that you are given the khaṭvāṃga adorned with a ḍamaru and bone ornaments to rest in the crook of your elbow, and feel that you are given the brahman’s thread to be slung over your chest and the hooked knife and skull cup are placed in your hands. Those give you the discipline.
he ru ka dpal kha T+wAM ga / rnal 'byor ma ni Da ma ru/ / rdo rje kha T+wAM rdo rjer bcas/ /
The glorious Heruka is the khaṭvāṃga, the Yoginī is the ḍamaru. The vajra khaṭvāṃga has a vajra.
dril bu sil sil sgra sgrogs shing / / tshangs pa'i skud thogs rnal 'byor dag / kha T+wAM ga dang rnal 'byor snod/ / dpa' bo chen pos blang bar gyis/ /
The ghaṇṭā tinkles with the sounds of bells. The yogic practitioner wears a brahman’s thread and, with a khaṭvāṃga, is a receptacle for yoga. Great heroes and heroines, take these.
bzhi pa mchod pa'i rjes su gnang ba'i slad du khyed rang he ru kar gsal ba la mchod pa sna tshogs pas mchod pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Fourth, to receive the authorization for offerings, visualize yourself as the Heruka and feel that you are being presented with various offerings.
e ma/ gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya chos/ / sna tshogs rol ba'i 'dod yon rnams/ / shel la tshon gyi rang bzhin du/ / sgyu ma lta bur rol par gyis/ / a la la hoHrol du gsol/ /
e ma The sense pleasures that you delight in, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, tangible objects, and phenomena: enjoy them like illusions, being of a nature of colors in a crystal. A la la hoḥ—revel!
lnga pa rnal 'byor gyi rjes su gnang ba'i slad du me long dri ma med pa thogs te gzugs brnyan gyi brdas chos thams cad rten 'byung du ston pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Fifth, to receive the authorization for the yoga, a stainless mirror is held. Feel that the symbol of its reflection shows that all phenomena are dependent arisings.
chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste/ / dag cing gsal la rnyog pa med/ / gzung du med cing brjod du med/ / rgyu dang las las kun tu 'byung / /
All phenomena are like reflections: pure, clear, and unsullied. They cannot be grasped or described. They arise from causes and karma.
ngo bo med cing gnas med pa/ / de ltar chos rnams shes gyis la/ / sems can don ni mnyam med gyis/ / 'on te rnal 'byor ma'i sras skyes/ /
They have no essence and no abode. Know all phenomena to be that way. Perform unequaled benefit for others. Continue to take birth as a child of the Yoginī.

drug pa 'bras bu la lung ston cing gzengs bstod pa'i slad du slob dpon gyi phyag g.yas skyabs sbyin dang g.yon chos gos kyi grwa ri dwags kyi rna ba ltar byas pa dang rdor dril bcas slob ma'i mgor bzhag ste lung ston pa dang lhan cig sangs (188)rgyas thams cad kyis kyang lung ston pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Sixth, to receive [the authorization of] the prophecy and assurance for the result, I, the ācārya, holding my right hand [in the mudrā of] giving refuge and my left holding the corners of my dharma robe like the ears of a deer with my vajra and ghaṇṭā, will place those on the heads of you, the disciples. Feel that as you receive the prophecy, you receive the prophecy from all the buddhas. {188}
oM 'di ltar ngas ni lung bstan te/ / he ru ka dpal de bzhin gshegs/ / dngos po mchog tu bsgrub pa'i phyir/ / srid pa'i ngan 'gro rnams las bton/ /
oṃ In this way I prophesize: in order to achieve the sublime state of the tathāgata, the glorious Heruka, you will leave the negative states of existence.
oM shrI he ru ka na mas+sarba ta thA ga ta sid+d+hi sa ma ya s+t+wAM/ b+hur+b+hu waHswaH
oṃ śrīheruka namassarvatathāgata siddhi samayastvaṃ / bhur bhuvaḥ svaḥ
zhes lung ston pa ste ma 'ongs pa na gsang mtshan dang mthun pa'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro/ /
Thus it is prophesied: in the future you will become a tathāgata in keeping with your secret name.
bdun pa dbugs dbyung ba ni 'di la gsan pas khyab par gda'/
Seventh, [the authorization of] the confirmation. Listening to this covers [everything].
khams gsum kun gyi rgyal srid che/ / rgyal po bdag por bstan pa ste/ / de ni bdud las rnam rgyal zhing / / grong khyer mchog tu zhugs pa yin/ /
You will appear as the ruling sovereign of the great kingdom of the three realms. Victorious over Māra, you will enter the supreme city.
de nas sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par/ / khyed rnams the tshom med pa yin/ / dbang ni bskur ba tsam gyis ni/ / slob ma yon tan bdag por 'gyur/ /
Then, you will attain buddhahood. You should have no doubts. Through just receiving this abhiṣeka, you will become masters with excellent qualities.
slob dpon nyid kyi bde ba yis/ / brtan g.yo kun gyi dam tshig go/ /
The bliss of this ācārya is the samaya of the animate and inanimate.
de man chad kyis thun mong ba phyi dkyil gyi bum dbang grub pa lags/
With that, the vase abhiṣeka of the common outer maṇḍala is completed.
gnyis pa khyad par ba lus dkyil gyi dbang bskur gsan pa'i yon du maN+Dal phul/ de nas rdo rje'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba'i brdar ras yug dmar po res gtod g.yogs pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Second, as a gift to listen to the bestowal of the abhiṣeka of the special body maṇḍala, offer a maṇḍala. Then, as a symbol that you have not seen the maṇḍala of vajra body, feel that your face is covered with a red cloth.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
rdo rje'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor chen po mjal ba'i tshe dbul ba'i ched du me tog gi phreng ba re 'dzin pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that you are holding a garland of flowers so that you can present it when you meet the great maṇḍala of vajra body.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
de nas snyims pa me tog dang bcas pa'i thal mo sbyar nas gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Then, with your hands in añjali with beautiful flowers, repeat this supplication three times:
kye kye dpal ldan khrag 'thung che/ / srid pa'i 'ching ba rnam grol mdzod/ / gsang ba mchog gi dkyil 'khor du/ / dam pas bdag nyid rjes bzung mdzod/ /
Kye kye, glorious, great Heruka, who liberates from the bonds of existence, holy one, please accept me into the maṇḍala of the supreme secret.
ces lan gsum du gsol ba btab pa la slob dpon gyis 'di ltar dris pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Having supplicated three times, feel that the ācārya is questioning you.
gsang ba 'dir zhugs khyod kyis ni/ / dam tshig gsang ba bla na med/ / bsten cing mchod par khyod nus sam/ /
You who have entered this secret, are you able to serve and worship the unsurpassable, secret samaya?
zhes dris pa'i lan zhus par mos te 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
Feel that you are replying to that question and repeat:
dpal ldan dpa' bos gnang mdzad pa/ / de dag thams cad bdag bgyid 'tshal/ /
Whatever the glorious hero gives me to do, I will do it all. {189}
de nas slar (189) yang phyag dgu phrugs su 'tshal zhing gser dang rin po che sna tshogs dang yid 'ong mtshan dang ldan pa'i rig ma rnams phul bar mos la maN+Dal phul/ /
Then, feeling that you are offering nine prostrations and presenting gold, various jewels, and beautiful and authentic vidyās, offer a maṇḍala.
de nas las bum gyi chu 'thor bas chu'i rdul re re bzhin khro bo dang khaN+Da ro hi'i tshogs dpag tu med pa spros te bgegs rnams rgyang ring du bskrad pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Next, as water from the activity vase is sprinkled, feel that each drop radiates innumerable assemblies of krodhas and Khaṇḍarohi who drive all obstructors far away.
oM khaN+Da ro hi huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ khaṇḍarohi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
ces bzla zhing las bum chu 'thor/
Recite that, and sprinkle water from the activity vase.
de nas khyed rang 'khor lo bde mchog tu gsal ba'i gnas gsum gyi 'bru gsum sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum du dri'i thig le byas pa'i sgo nas byin gyis brlabs pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Now, visualize yourself as Cakrasaṃvara. Feel that by means of the drops of scented water, the three seed syllables in your three places are consecrated as the vajra body, speech, and mind of all buddhas.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes thig le re bya/
Flick drops [of scented water].
khyed rang he ru kar gsal ba la mchod pas mchod pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that you, visualized as the Heruka, are presented with offerings.
oM badzra Ar+g+haM AHhU~M/ nas shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ vajra arghaṃ āḥ hūṃ…śabda… Thus, the offerings are made.
de nas dam tshig sbyin pa ni 'di la ma yengs bar gsan 'tshal/
Next the samayas are given. Listen to this without distraction.
khyod kyis srog chags gsod par gyis/ / ma byin par yang len par gyis/ / pha rol bud med bsten par gyis/ / rdzun du yang ni smra bar byos/ /
You should kill living beings. Take what is not given. Be with the spouse of others. Say what is not true.
yul kun rtag tu bsten pa dang / / bla na med pa'i dam tshig mchog / 'di la nam yang 'da' mi bya/ /
Always practice those in all situations. The unsurpassable samaya is supreme. Never transgress it.

de nas ye shes dbab pa'i slad du lus skyil krung drang por bsrang / ngag rlung rang babs su bzhag / sems kyis dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/ / khyed rang dpal bde mchog he ru kar gsal ba'i sku lus kyi gnas nyer bzhi'i rtsa dang thig le rnams dpa' bo nyer bzhi dang dpa' mo nyer bzhi/ dbang po'i sgo brgyad du sgo mtshams ma brgyad dang bcas pa skad cig gis gsal mdzod/

Now, to receive the descent of the wisdom ones, sit cross-legged and straighten your body. Let your speech and winds settle naturally. With your mind, do the following visualization. You appear clearly in the form of the glorious Saṃvara Heruka. Visualize in an instant its channels, which are the twenty-four sacred places within the body; its bindus, which are the twenty-four heroes and twenty-four heroines; and the eight female gatekeepers at the eight doors of the senses.

de'i thugs kar bde mchog lhan skyes yab yum tshon gang ba/ de'i phyogs bzhir snying po'i rnal 'byor ma bzhi sngo ser dmar ljang Da ma ru'i sgra sgrogs bzhin par g.yon du 'khor ba'i 'od zer gyis bla ma dang mdun bskyed kyi lha'i thugs rgyud bskul/ de dag gi gnas gsum dang / phyogs bcu'i zhing nas sangs rgyas byang sems dang dpa' bo mkha' 'gro thams cad 'khor lo bde mchog gi lha tshogs kyi sku dang sngags phreng phyag mtshan gyi rnam (190) par kha ba babs pa ltar byon cing thim pas/ lus kyi rtsa gnas kyi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams bro 'khrab gar byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/

In your heart is a thumb-sized Saṃvara Sahaja, male and female consorts. In the four directions are the four essence yoginīs, blue, yellow, red, and green, playing ḍamarus while circling counterclockwise. Light rays from them arouse the mindstreams of the gurus and the deities of the front visualization. From their three places and from the realms in the ten directions, buddhas, bodhisattvas, heroes, and ḍākinīs, in the forms of the assembly of deities of Cakrasaṃvara, mantra garlands, and emblems, come and dissolve into you like falling snow. {190} Feel that the heroes and yoginīs in the channel locations in your body whirl and dance.
oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/ badzra dz+nyA na A we sha ya a AH
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / vajra jñāna āveśaya a āḥ
zhes bzla zhing spos rol Da dril bya/
Recite that with incense and the music of the ḍamaru and ghaṇṭā.
de nas phyag gi me tog de bla ma he ru ka'i thugs kar phul ba'i mos pas sngags 'di'i rjes zlos mdzad de phyag tu phul mdzod/
Next, feeling that you offer the flowers in your hand to the heart of the guru Heruka, repeat this mantra as you offer to the [guru’s] hand:
oM puSh+pe pra tIts+tsha hoH
oṃ puṣpe pratīccha hoḥ
zhes phul ba'i me tog de slar yang khyed rang gi spyi bor bcings te dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Feel that that offered flower is now attached to the top of your head and the abhiṣeka is granted.
oM pra ti gr-Ih+Na i maM sa twa ma hA ba la/
oṃ pratigṛhṇa imaṃ satva mahābala
de nas ma rig pa'i ling tog mig ras dang lhan cig phyes pas dag pa rdo rje mig thob pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Now feel that, with the removal of your blindfold, the cataracts of your ignorance are removed and you develop pure vajra eyes.
oM badzra nai tra a pa ha ra pa tra laM hrIHpra~M/ he badzra pA sh+ya/
oṃ vajra naitra apahara patra laṃ hrīḥ praṃ / hevajra pāśya

zhes blta bar bskul nas/ gang la blta bya'i dkyil 'khor ni slob dpon 'khor lo bde mchog tu gsal ba'i spyi bo sogs gnas nyer bzhir dpa' bo dpa' mo nyer bzhi dang / dbang po'i sgo brgyad du sgo mtshams brgyad dang bcas rtsa rlung thig le rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid du bzhugs pa thams cad mthong ba'i mos pas dad gus dang dga' spro rgya cher skyed mdzod/

Thus, you are urged to look. Feel that whatever maṇḍala you behold is that of the ācārya clearly manifesting as Cakrasaṃvara. Feeling that you see the twenty-four heroes and heroines of the twenty-four places, such as the head, and the eight female gatekeepers at the eight doors of the senses as embodiments of the purities of the channels, winds, and bindus, arouse great faith, devotion, joy, and inspiration.
ngas 'jug pa'i rim pa rnams grub pa lags/ zhugs pa la mngon par dbang bskur ba la dngos dang / byin gyis brlab pa dang / ngo sprod pa dang gsum las/
That completes the process of being entered.[14] Having entered, the actual bestowal of the abhiṣekas has three parts: (1) the actual [bestowal], (2) the consecration, and (3) the introduction.

dang po dbang bskur pa'i slad du/ khyed rang 'khor lo bde mchog tu gsal ba'i thugs kar dbus su bde mchog he ru ka dang / phyogs bzhir snying po'i rnal 'byor ma bzhi/ mtshams bzhir gser gyi bum pa bzhi bcas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo dang / spyi bo sogs gnas nyer bzhir dpa' bo dpa' mo nyer bzhi/ dbang po'i sgo brgyad du sgo mtshams ma brgyad bcas bzhugs pa slar yang gsal thob mdzod/

First, to receive the abhiṣeka, visualize yourself as Cakrasaṃvara. In the middle of your heart is Saṃvara Heruka, in the four directions are the four essence yoginīs, and in the four intermediate directions are four golden vases, [forming] the mahāsukhacakra. In your twenty-four places, such as your head, are the twenty-four heroes and heroines. In the eight doors of your senses are the eight female gatekeepers. Again, make all that vivid.

de rnams las 'od zer 'phros pas bla ma he ru ka'i thugs ka'i bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la phog pas thugs rgyud bskul/ thugs ka'i he ru ka'i thugs ka nas hU~M dgu spros te/ khyed rang gi thugs ka'i lha (191) lnga/ mtshams kyi bum pa dang bcas pa la phog pas/ de rnams 'od du zhu nas thig le dgur gyur/ de rnams yongs su gyur pa las dpal lhan skyes yid bzhin nor bu lha lnga/ mtshams kyi bum pa bzhi dang bcas par gyur/

From all of them, light rays stream forth, striking the mahāsukhacakra in the heart of the guru Heruka and arousing their mindstreams. From the heart of the Heruka in [the guru’s] heart, nine hūṃs radiate, striking the five deities in your heart and the vases in the intermediate directions. {191} They melt into light and become nine bindus. Those transform into the five deities of the glorious Sahaja Wish-Fulfilling Gem and four vases in the intermediate directions.

de bzhin du bla ma'i gnas nyer bzhi'i thugs dang gsung dang sku dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo rnams las rim bzhin hU~M dang AHdang oM rnams bcu drug re dang / hU~M brgyad rnams spros te slob ma'i lus kyi gnas nyer bzhi dang dbang po'i sgo brgyad kyi lha rnams la phog pas de rnams 'od du zhu nas thig le re rer gyur/ de rnams yongs su gyur pa las dpa' bo dang dpa' mo nyer bzhi/ /sgo mtshams ma brgyad dang bcas par gyur/

Similarly, from the cakras of mind, speech, body, and samaya in the twenty-four places of the guru, sixteen hūṃs, sixteen āḥs, sixteen oṃs, and eight hūṃs stream forth. They strike the deities of the twenty-four places and the eight doors of the senses in the bodies of you, the disciples. They all melt into light, and each become a bindu. Those transform into the twenty-four heroes and heroines and the eight female gatekeepers.

de nas bla ma dang dbang lha nam mkha' gang ba lhan cig pas ka pA la byang chub sems kyi bdud rtsis gang ba khyed rang gi spyi bor blug cing dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/ thod chang dang bum chu bsnon pa thogs te/

Then, the guru and the abhiṣeka deities, filling space, together fill the kapāla with bodhicitta-amṛta. Feel that this is poured on your head and that the abhiṣeka is conferred. Hold the skull cup with alcohol, having added vase water to it.
sangs rgyas rnams ni thams cad kyi/ / gsang gsum rdo rje'i gnas las byung / / ye shes bla na med pa yi/ / byang chub sems kyi dbang bskur ro/ /
This bestows the abhiṣeka of bodhicitta: unsurpassable wisdom arising from the places of the three vajra secrets of all the buddhas.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta dz+nyA na a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ sarvatathāgata jñāna abhiṣiñca hūṃ
zhes btung ba dang 'thor ba'ang bya/
Drink and sprinkle.

zhes btung zhing bkrus pas ye shes kyi khams bde ba chen po'i ye shes su gyur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / chu'i lhag ma yar lud pa las slob ma he ru kar gsal ba dang / thugs ka'i gtso bo la rdo rje sems dpa'/ rnal 'byor ma bzhi la rigs bzhi so so dang / sku 'khor la rnam par snang mdzad dang / gsung 'khor la pad+ma gar dbang dang / thugs 'khor la he ru ka dang / phrin las kyi 'khor lo sgo mtshams ma brgyad la rdo rje rgyal po rnams kyis dbur brgyan pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Having drunk and bathed, your wisdom dhātu is the wisdom of great bliss. Feel that your body is full, your stains are purified, and the excess water rises up and that you, disciples, are clearly the Heruka. Feel that the principal one in your heart is crowned by Vajrasattva, the four yoginīs by their respective four families, those of the body cakra by Vairocana, those of the speech cakra by Padmanarteśvara, those of the mind cakra by Heruka, and the eight female gatekeepers of the activity cakra by Vajrarāja.

gnyis pa byin gyis brlab pa la bde ba chen pos byin gyis brlab pa ni/ bla ma dang khyed rang gi snying ga'i lha rnams dang gnas nyer bzhi'i lha rnams bde ba chen por snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba'i sgra dang 'od zer gyis/ sa gsum gyi (192)dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad spyan drangs te slob ma'i gnas so so'i lha rnams la bstims pas bde ba chen po'i ngo bor byas shing bde ba chen po'i ye shes rgyud la skyes pa'i mos pa mdzod/

The second, the consecration, is to be consecrated by great bliss [first]. The deities in the guru’s heart and in your heart and the deities of the twenty-four places are united in great bliss. {192} The sounds of their bliss and their light rays invite the heroes and yoginīs of the three planes. They dissolve into the deities of their respective places in you, the disciples. Feel that they become of the essence of great bliss and the wisdom of great bliss arises in your mindstream.
oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
ces bzla zhing spos rol Da dril bya/
Recite that with incense and music, ḍamaru and ghaṇṭā.

gnyis pa rang bzhin byin gyis brlab pa ni/ khyed rang gi thugs ka'i gtso bo lhan cig skyes pa'i thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od zer 'phros/ snod bcud thams cad la phog pas/ de thams cad dpal lhan cig skyes pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu yab yum du gdod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod/ sngags bzla zhing spos rol bya/

The second is the natural consecration. From the hūṃ in the heart of principal one, the Sahaja, in your heart, light rays radiate, striking the environment and its inhabitants. Feel that they become the male and female consorts of the glorious Sahaja Wish-Fulfilling Gem, the essence of primordial purity. Recite the mantras with incense and music.

gsum pa ngo sprad pa ni/ chos thams cad lhan cig skyes pa/ skye ba med pa sku'i gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ 'gag pa med pa gsung gi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ gnas pa med pa thugs kyi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ dbye ba med pa ye shes kyi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bdag nyid gdod ma nas yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par mdzod cig /

The third is the introduction. All phenomena are connate. Being unborn, they are primordially the embodiment of the inconceivable secret of body. Being unceasing, they are primordially the embodiment of the inconceivable secret of speech. Being nonabiding, they are primordially the embodiment of the inconceivable secret of mind. Being indivisible, they are primordially the embodiment of the inconceivable secret of wisdom. Realize that primordial nature.
des phyi bris pa rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du/ bum pa'i dbang thob/ lus kyi sgrib pa dag / sku bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / sku rdo rje dang sprul sku 'grub pa'i skal pa can du byas pa yin no/ /

Through those, you receive the vase abhiṣeka in the outer drawn maṇḍala of colored powders. Your obscurations of body have been purified, you are empowered to meditate on the process of generation of body, and you have become a fortunate one who will achieve vajra body and the nirmāṇakāya.
gnyis pa gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba gsan pa'i yon du maN+Dal phul/ de nas thal mo sbyor la gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Second, as a gift to listen to the bestowal of the secret abhiṣeka, offer a maṇḍala. With your hands in añjali, repeat the following supplication three times:
byang chub rdo rjes sangs rgyas la/ / ji ltar che ba'i che sbyin ltar/ / bdag cag bskyab pa'i don gyi phyir/ / nam mkha'i rdo rje deng bdag stsol/ /
Just as Bodhivajra made the greatest of offerings to the Buddha, for the sake of protecting me, please grant me the vajra space today.

zhes lan gsum du gsol ba btab pa la gsang dbang bskur ba'i slad du bla ma dpal bde mchog he ru ka dang / rig ma rdo rje phag mor gsal ba lha'i 'du shes/ yab kyi gsang gnas hU~M las rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa'i nor bur oM dang bu ga phaT kyis bkag pa/ yum gyi mkha' oM las pad+ma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ze'u 'brur AHyis (193)mtshan pa sngags kyi 'du shes/ thabs 'di la brten nas bde ba chen po'i ye shes mngon du bya'o snyam pa chos kyi 'du shes te/

Having recited that three times, to receive the secret abhiṣeka, the guru appears clearly as the glorious Saṃvara Heruka and the vidyā as Vajravārāhī. That is the perception of the deities. The secret of the male consort is a blue five-pointed vajra from hūṃ, whose jewel is [marked by] oṃ and opening is blocked by phaṭ. The space of the female consort is a red eight-petaled lotus from oṃ, whose pistils are marked by āḥ. {193} That is the perception of the mantras. Think that on the basis of this method, you will actualize the wisdom of great bliss. That is the perception of the dharma.

'du shes gsum ldan gyis snyoms par zhugs pa'i/ bde ba'i sgra dang 'od zer gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs te rang gi spyi bo nas zhugs/ byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig tu zhu ba spyi bo nas mgrin par babs pas dga' ba'i ye shes skyes/ de nas snying gar babs pas mchog dga'i ye shes skyes/ de nas lte bar babs pas khyad par gyi dga' ba'i ye shes skyes/ de nas gsang bar babs pas lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes skyes/

With those three perceptions, the sounds and light rays of the bliss of union invite the buddhas of the ten directions, and they are seated on the top of your head. They melt with the bodhicitta and that descends from the top of your head to your throat, giving rise to the wisdom of joy. Then, that flows down to your heart, giving rise to the wisdom of supreme joy. Next, that descends to your navel, giving rise to the wisdom of special joy. Then, that flows down to your secret place, giving rise to the wisdom of the connate.

de ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes kyi rten du gyur pa'i bdud rtsi byang chub kyi sems dkar po/ mngar gsum gyi skyob dang bcas pa'i thod pa'i bdud rtsir bsres pa lcer bzhag ste gsang dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/

Feel that that white bodhicitta-amṛta, which is the support for the wisdom of the connate, mixed with the amṛta of the skull cup, which includes a paste of the three sweet substances, is placed on your tongue and that the secret abhiṣeka is conferred.
'di ni dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma'i/ / dam tshig rmad byung chen po ste/ / khams lnga bcud kyi bdag nyid can/ / yang dag bde ba myang bar gyis/ /
This great, wondrous samaya of the heroes and yoginīs embodies the elixir of the five elements. Experience true bliss.
oM AHhU~M/ zhes sbyin/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Bestow it.
zhes pas byin pa de nyid sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa'i ngo bor mos nas/
Feel that this gift is the essence containing all buddhas.
a hoHma hA su kha hoH/ zhes gsung zhing btung bar mdzod/
a hoḥ mahāsukha hoḥ Say that and drink.
de ltar btung ba des lus thams cad khyab pas gsal stong gi ye shes rgyud la skyes pa'i mos pa mdzod la cung zad mnyam par 'jog par mdzod/
Feel that having drunk that, it pervades your body and the wisdom of clarity-emptiness arises in your mindstream. Rest for a bit in meditative equipoise.

des nang kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems kun+da lta bu'i dkyil 'khor du/ gsang ba'i dbang thob/ ngag gi sgrib pa dag / ngag rdo rje'i bzlas pa byed pa la dbang / gsung rdo rje dang longs sku 'grub pa'i skal ba can du byas pa yin no/ /

Through that, you receive the secret abhiṣeka in the inner maṇḍala of conventional kunda-like bodhicitta. Your obscurations of speech are purified, you are empowered to perform the vajra recitations with your speech, and you have become a fortunate one who will achieve vajra speech and the saṃbhogakāya.
gsum pa shes rab ye shes kyi dbang zhu ba'i yon du maN+Dal phul/ de nas thal mo sbyor la gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Third, as a gift to request the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka, offer a maṇḍala. With your hands in añjali, repeat the following supplication three times:
skyabs med skyob pa skyabs med skyabs/ / 'khor lo sdom pas bdag la skyobs/ / rgyu med par yang thugs rje che/ / mgon med mgon (194) bdag bka' drin stsol/ /

The refuge for those without refuge, who provides refuge for those without refuge, Cakrasaṃvara, give me refuge. Great Compassionate One without cause, I have no protector—kindly be my protector. {194}
bdag nyid che khyod ji lta bar/ / gtso bas bdag kyang de 'drar mdzod/ / 'khor ba 'dam gyi tshogs nang du/ / bying pa bdag la skyob mdzod cig /
May the principal one make me just like you, Great Being. In the quagmire of saṃsāra, where I am sinking, please provide me with refuge.
ces lan gsum du gsol ba btab pa la 'di ltar dris pa'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Recite that three times. Feel that you are questioned as follows:

bram ze rgyal rigs rje'u rigs dang / / dmangs rigs mthar gnas bud med kun/ / gus dang bcas pas mchod pa dang / / gnyis med tshul gyis rab sbyor bas/ / dpa' bo khyod ni spro gyur tam/ / smros shig dpa' bo bde ba che/ /

With consorts who are brahmans, kshatriyas, vaiśyas, śūdras, or lowlifes, would you, hero or heroine, be able to take delight in worshipping them with respect and uniting in a nondual way? State that, hero or heroine of great bliss.
zhes dris pa'i lan gsol bar mos pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
Feeling that you are replying to that question, repeat the following:
ji ltar gsungs pa'i dam tshig kun/ / bdag gis legs par bsten par bgyi/ /
All the samayas that you teach, I will attend to properly.

zhes lan gsol ba la mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'i rig ma'i lag pa g.yas pa khyed rang gi g.yon par slob ma dang rig ma'i srin lag gnyis bla mas rdo rje dang bcas pas bsdams te sangs rgyas thams cad dpang por byas nas gtad pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Having thus replied, feel that with a vajra the guru joins together the ring fingers of the right hand of the vidyā and of the left hand of you, the disciple, while all the buddhas give their attention as witnesses.

phyag rgya bzang mo 'di nyid ni/ / bsten byar sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs/ / bram ze rgyal rigs rje'u rigs dang / / dmangs rigs mthar skyes bud med kun/ / b+ha ga'i pad+mar tsum+ba nis/ / bdud rtsi lnga rnams bsgrub par bya/ /

This excellent mudrā: serve them, the buddhas say. With all consorts who are brahmans, kshatriyas, vaiśyas, śūdras, and lowlifes, by cumba in the padma of the bhaga, you can experience the five amṛtas.
deng nas brtsams te bu khyod kyis/ / brtul zhugs bzang pos 'gro don gyis/ / zhes sbyin/
Starting from today, child, you should benefit beings with this excellent discipline. Thus, give them.
de nas khyed rang dpal bde mchog he ru ka dang / zhes pa nas/ lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes skyes/ zhes pa'i bar gong gsang dbang ltar dang /
You are the glorious Saṃvara Heruka…giving rise to the wisdom of the connate.[*28] Say that, as is found in the secret abhiṣeka above.

slar yang rlung 'pho ba med pa hU~M gi gdangs can gyis byang sems gyen du bzlog ste gsang gnas nas lte bar slebs pas dga' ba/ de nas snying gar slebs pas mchog dga'/ de nas mgrin par slebs pas khyad par gyi dga' ba/ de nas spyi bor slebs pas lhan skyes kyi dga' ba'i ye shes/

Again, without the movement of the winds and with the melody of hūṃ, bodhicitta is reversed upward and, reaching the navel from the secret place, there is joy. When it reaches the heart, there is supreme joy. When it reaches the throat, there is special joy. Then, when it reaches the top of the head, there is the wisdom of connate joy.

byang sems des lus thams cad khyab pas lus sems thams cad bde cham gyis song / de ltar bde ba chen po de yul can du byas te yul chos thams cad kyi gnas lugs bde stong spros pa'i mtha' (195) thams cad dang bral ba mngon sum du rtogs par mos pas bde stong dbyer med la cung zhig mnyam par 'jog par mdzod/

Through that bodhicitta pervading your entire body, your body and mind become completely blissful. In that way, great bliss is taken as the perceiving subject. Feel that you directly realize that the abiding state of all phenomena, the objects, is bliss-emptiness, free from elaborations. {195} Rest evenly for a bit in the inseparability of bliss and emptiness.

des gsang ba shes rab ma'i gsang ba'i reg bya'i dkyil 'khor du/ shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob/ yid kyi sgrib pa dag / pho nya'i lam bsgom pa la dbang / thugs rdo rje dang chos sku 'grub pa'i skal ba can du byas pa yin no/ /

Through that, you receive the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka in the maṇḍala of contact with the secret of the secret prajñā consort. Your obscurations of mind have been purified, you are empowered to meditate on the path of emissaries, and you have become a fortunate one who will achieve vajra mind and the dharmakāya.
bzhi pa tshig dbang rin po che zhu ba'i yon du maN+Dal phul/ de nas me tog dang bcas pa'i thal mo sbyor la gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/
Fourth, as a gift to request the precious word abhiṣeka, offer a maṇḍala. With your hands in añjali holding flowers, repeat the following supplication three times:

sgrib pa ma lus 'joms mdzad pa/ / he ru ka dpal bde chen po/ / shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin can/ / rdo rje sems dpa' mi 'gyur ba/ / phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes kyi/ / dbang bskur bdag la stsal du gsol/ /
Conqueror of all obscurations, glorious Heruka, great bliss, with the nature of prajñā and method, unchanging Vajrasattva, please grant me the abhiṣeka of the wisdom of mahāmudrā.
zhes lan gsum du gsol ba btab pa la bla mas tshig gis ston par byed pa ni/ /
Supplicate three times. I, the guru, instruct you with the following words:
rtsa ba'i rgyud las/
The root tantra states:
las kyi phyag rgya yongs su spang / / ye shes phyag rgya'i rnam rtog dor/ / mchog tu mi 'gyur rnal 'byor pas/ / phyag rgya chen po bsgom par bya/ /
Give up karmamudrās. Cast aside thoughts of jñānamudrās. The immutable yogic practitioner should meditate on mahāmudrā.[15]

zhes gsungs pa'i don nyams su len pa la khyed rang lus rnam par snang mdzad kyi chos bdun mdzod/ sems ma bcos par zhog la/ 'di ltar snang zhing srid pa'i shes bya thams cad yul rdo rje phag mo dang / yul can rang rig pa'i ye shes he ru ka dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bde ba chen po mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod la cung zhig mnyam par 'jog par mdzod/

To practice the meaning of that statement, sit in the seven-point posture of Vairocana with your body. Leave your mind without contrivances. Feel that you realize that objects—all objects of knowledge, which are all possible appearances—are Vajravārāhī, the female consort; that the perceiving subject, reflexively aware wisdom, is the Heruka; and that nondual wisdom, great bliss, is the inconceivable nature free from all characteristics. Rest for a bit in meditative equipoise.

des yang gsang don dam byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor du/ dbang bzhi pa tshig dbang rin po che thob/ sgo gsum gyi sgrib pa dag / don dam phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa la dbang / ye shes rdo rje dang ngo bo nyid sku 'grub pa'i skal ba can du byas pa yin no/ /

Through that, you receive the fourth abhiṣeka, the precious word, in the most secret maṇḍala of ultimate bodhicitta. The obscurations of your three doors are purified, you are empowered to meditate on ultimate mahāmudrā, and you have become a fortunate one who will achieve vajra wisdom and the svabhāvakāya.
de nas dbang bzhi pa'i dam tshig bsgrag pa la/ dang po bum dbang dang 'brel ba'i dam tshig ni/
Next, the samayas of the four abhiṣeka are announced. First, the samayas connected with the vase abhiṣeka are as follows: {196}
nangs par sngar langs sems (196) bdag nyid/ / ma lus lus la byas nas kyang / / bsrung dang bza' ba la sogs pa/ / 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can bsrung ngo/ /
In the morning before rising, [set] the nature of your intention, do your physical actions thoroughly, and preserve what embodies your wishes connected to what is to be protected, eaten, and so on.
lus dang srog la ltos med par/ / dam tshig dang ni sdom pa bsrung / / nyin dang mtshan mo lan gsum du/ / nyin re bzhin du bslab par bya/ /
With no concern for body or life, preserve your samayas and vows. Three times during the day and night, every single day, train in them.
gang tshe nyams na rnal 'byor pa/ / kha na ma tho sbom por 'gyur/ / dgun zla 'bring sogs nas brtsams te/ / zla ba re rer bsrungs nas ni/ /
If they are damaged, the yogic practitioner will have committed a gross transgression, something proscribed. Starting from [a time] such as the middle month of winter, preserve them every month.
gnyis med gnyis med 'khor lor gnas/ / tshes bcu la ni de rab mchod/ / sha dang chang sogs gang yang rung / / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma yi tshogs/ /
Without duality, without duality, abide in the cakra. On the tenth lunar day, worship. Whatever you have, meat, alcohol, and the like, is a feast for heroes and yoginīs.
thams cad gnyis med par ni gnas/ / he ru ka dpal rab tu mchod/ / spyod pa grol ba'i gnas 'dod pa/ / yid la 'dod pa kun 'grub 'gyur/ /
All abiding in nonduality worship the glorious Heruka. Those who wish to abide in liberating conduct achieve all they desire in their minds.
zhes dang /
Thus it is said.[16]
gsang dbang dang 'brel ba'i dam tshig ni/ /
The samayas connected to the secret abhiṣeka are as follows:
gnyis med ye shes sems ldan la/ / mi bya ba ni ci yang med/ / tshangs par spyod pa rtag mnos la/ / 'dod pa lnga ni spyod par gyis/ /
For those with the mind of nondual wisdom there is nothing that is not done. Always contemplate the pure conduct and enjoy the five sense pleasures.
gnyis med la gnas zas la ni/ / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs bdag / gnyis med pa dang gos pa med/ / dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod pa bya/ /
The food for those abiding in nonduality is the lords, Vajrasattva and the others. Without duality and without veils, practice the conduct of samaya.
zhes dang /
Thus it is said.
sher dbang dang 'brel ba'i dam tshig ni/ /
The samayas connected to the prajñā abhiṣeka are as follows:
sna tshogs dbang phyug legs spyod cing / / tshangs par spyod pa'ang de bzhin no/ / khro ba med pa'i rgyun sbyong ba/ / sgrub pa pos ni yongs su bsrung / /
The excellent conduct of Puṃseśvara and the pure conduct are alike. Without anger, sever the stream.[17] That should be protected by the practitioner.
rtag tu sgrub la gnas pa ni/ / yul kun la ni rnam rol cing / / gnyis med grub pa'i rnal 'byor ma/ / mi brnyas srog ni ji srid bar/ / bu khyod kyis ni bsgrub par bya/ /
Those who always abide in the practice should delight in all objects. Have no contempt toward the yoginī who has achieved nonduality, and, child, practice for as long as you live.
'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad la/ / ci dga' bar ni longs spyod cig / ces dang /
Whatever pleases your senses, you should enjoy. Thus it is said.
dbang bzhi pa dang 'brel ba'i dam tshig ni/ /
The samayas connected to the fourth abhiṣeka are as follows:
bsam pa thams cad rab tu brtags/ / bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad dang / / rnal 'byor ma ni kun gyi gnas/ / de bas 'bad pa thams cad kyis/ / he ru ka dpal bdag mchod do/ /
Examine all your intentions. All the lords, the buddhas, and all yoginīs are the source of everything. Therefore, with all your effort, worship the glorious Heruka, the lord.
'dod chags bral ba lta bu yi/ khams gsum na ni sdig med pas/ / de bas 'dod la chags bral ba/ / khyod kyis nam yang mi bya'o/ /
Since there are no negative actions in the three realms that are devoid of passion, being devoid of passion is not something you should ever do.[18] {197}
de (197) nas dbang bzhi pa dang rjes su 'brel bar rdo rje slob dpon du dbang bskur ba zhu ba'i slad du maN+Dal phul/ de nas gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/ /
Next, to request the bestowal of the vajrācārya abhiṣekas connected with the fourth abhiṣeka, offer a maṇḍala. Then, repeat the following supplication three times:
gang gis bdag ni khyod drin las/ / rang dang gzhan don nus gyur pa'i/ / rdo rje slob dpon gyi ni dbang / / thugs rje'i gter gyis bdag la stsol/ /
Through your kindness to me, and with the treasure of your compassion, please bestow upon me the vajrācārya abhiṣeka to have the ability to benefit myself and others.
sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir/ / bdag ni rtag tu slob dpon bgyid/ /
For the sake of all beings, may I always be an ācārya.

ces lan gsum du gsol ba btab nas dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod/ skad cig gis seng ge chen po brgyad kyis bteg pa'i rin po che'i khri lha'i gos sna tshogs kyis nye bar bkab cing rgyab yol dang ldan pa yangs shing rgya che ba'i steng du pad+ma rab tu rgyas pa dang nyi zla'i gdan la khyed rang bde mchog he ru ka'i rnam par gyur ba sngags 'dis bkod pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Having supplicated three times, visualize as follows: Instantly, on a jeweled throne supported by eight great lions—covered with various divine cloths and rear cloths, spacious and vast—on a fully blooming lotus, sun and moon seats, you manifest as Saṃvara Heruka. Feel that this mantra makes it so.
oM badzra d+hA ra sa ma ya s+t+wAM/
oṃ vajradhāra samayastvaṃ

de'i dbu'i steng du gdugs dang / g.yas g.yon du 'phan dang ba dan dang rgyal mtshan du ma dang / mtha' skor du rgyal srid sna bdun bkra shis pa'i rtags rdzas brgyad sogs mchod pa'i tshogs du ma dang bcas par gyur/

Above your head is a parasol, to your right and left are many pendants, flags, and victory banners, and surrounding those are numerous offerings: the seven [emblems of] sovereignty, the eight auspicious symbols, the eight auspicious substances, and more.
de la skad cig gis dbang lha nam mkha' gang bar byon pa dang slob dpon lhan cig pas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rgyal srid du dbang bskur ba ltar bum pa'i bdud rtsis dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/

Instantly, the abhiṣeka deities come, filling the sky. Feel that together with the ācārya, they confer the abhiṣeka with the amṛta in the vase, like the way a cakravartin receives the abhiṣeka for his kingdom.
ji ltar bltams pa sogs nas shrI ye hU~M/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born …………………………… śrīye hūṃ
bum chu sbyin cing kha rgyan gyis 'thor/ zhes gsung zhing dbang bskur/
Give them vase water, and sprinkle them using the top ornament. Thus, the abhiṣeka is bestowed.
sku gang / dri ma dag / bde ba chen po myong / chu'i lhag ma spyi bor lud pa las rdo rje sems dpas dbur brgyan pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that your body is full, your stains are purified, you experience great bliss, and the excess water rises up to the top of your head and you are crowned by Vajrasattva.
de nas de la rus pa dang rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs pas mnga' gsol ba phul ba'i mos pa mdzod/
Next, feel that you are being offered various ornaments of bones and jewels for your investiture.
'khor lo thod pa rna rgyan dang / / mgul rgyan gdu bu ska rags dang / / do shal dang ni rnam pa bdun/ / phyag rgya yi ni dbang bskur ro/ /
With the cakra, skulls, earrings, collar necklace, bracelets, sash, and necklace, the seven, the abhiṣeka of the mudrās is bestowed.
zhes bskon/
Have them put them on.
de nas dbu rgyan spyi bor bcings te dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/
As the crown is tied to your head, feel that the abhiṣeka is bestowed.
thor tshugs cod pan gyis brgyan pa/ / sangs rgyas kun (198) gyis bsngags pa yi/ / rin po che yi dbu rgyan dang / / dar dpyangs ldan pa'i dbang bskur ro/ /
The crown adorns the topknot. {198} With the jeweled crown and silks praised by all buddhas, the abhiṣeka is conferred.
oM rat+na mu ku Ta a b+hi Shiny+tsa yA mi/ zhes bskon/
oṃ ratna mukuṭa abhiṣiñcayāmi Have them put that on.

de nas de la sku gsung thugs kyi dam tshig gsum byin te rdo rje slob dpon gyi dbang gi dngos gzhi sbyin pa la/ dang po thugs kyi dam tshig tu rdo rje phyag g.yas su byin te dbang bskur ba'i mos pa mdzod/

Next, for that, the samayas of body, speech, and mind are given. The main giving of the vajrācārya abhiṣeka is as follows. First, for the samaya of mind, feel that as a vajra is placed in your right hand, the abhiṣeka is conferred.
thog mtha' med pa'i sems dpa' ni/ rdo rje sems dpa' dga' ba che/ / kun tu bzang po kun bdag nyid/ / rdo rje snyems tshul bdag po'i bdag /
Sattva without beginning or end, you are Vajrasattva, great joy, embodiment of Samantabhadra, lord of lords, with Vajragarvā.
oM badzra sa twa hU~M/ zhes sbyin/
oṃ vajrasatva hūṃ Give them the vajra.
gsung gi dam tshig tu dril bu phyag g.yon tu byin pas chos phung brgyad khri bzhi stong gi sgra sgrogs par mos la dkrol zhing dkur brten mdzod/
For the samaya of speech, feel that as a ghaṇṭā is placed in your left hand, it resounds with the sounds of the eighty-four thousand collections of dharma. Play it and place it at your hip.
aH/ srid pa ngo bo nyid kyis dag / ngo bo nyid kyis srid bral byas/ / rang bzhin dag pa'i sems dpa' ni/ / srid pa dam pa byed par 'gyur/ /
aḥ Existence is pure in its very essence. In its very essence, there is no existence. The naturally pure sattva creates sacred existence.
d+harma d+hA tu aH/ zhes sbyin/
dharmadhātu aḥ Give them the ghaṇṭā.
oM shrI he ru ka a d+hi pa ti staM/ a b+hi Shiny+tsa ma ti dz+nyA na bI ras ma ya s+t+waM/ zhes dkrol du gzhug /
oṃ śrīheruka adhipatistvaṃ / abhiṣiñca matijñāna vīra samayastvaṃ Have them play the ghaṇṭā.

sku'i dam tshig tu khyed rang dpal bde mchog he ru kar gsal ba rig ma dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i bde bas dgyes par mos la rdor dril thugs kar bsnol te sku'i sgo nas sems can gyi don bya'o snyam pa re mdzod/

For the samaya of body, visualize yourself as the glorious Cakrasaṃvara Heruka and imagine that you enjoy the bliss of union with your vidyā. Cross the vajra and ghaṇṭā at your heart and think that you will act for the welfare of sentient beings with your body.
yid kyi lus ni brtan bya'i phyir/ / phyag rgya'i dam tshig ces su brjod/ / dam tshig yid ni brtan pa gang / / des na phyag rgyar rab tu grags/ /
To stabilize the mental body, there is what is called “the samaya of mudrā.” Samaya is what stabilizes the mind. Therefore, it is known as mudrā.
slar yang rdor dril phyag g.yas g.yon du byin te slob dpon du rjes su gnang ba byin pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Again, as the vajra and ghaṇṭā is placed in your right and left hands, feel that you are being authorized as an ācārya.
rdo rje rab mchog rdo rje ni/ / che dang dril bu chen po zung / / de ring rdo rje slob dpon gyur/ / slob ma bsdu ba nyid du gyis/ /
