Take this great vajra, the best of vajras, and the greatest of ghaṇṭās. Today you become a vajrācārya. Gather disciples.

deng nas khyod kyis dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i sgo nas sems can thams cad smin par bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur/ rgyud shod/ phrin las dang ye shes ma lus bsgrubs shig / de ltar slob dpon du dbang bskur ba la mchod pas mchod pa'i mos pa mdzod/

For the sake of maturing sentient beings by means of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, bestow abhiṣekas, explain the tantras, and engage in all forms of activity and wisdoms. Since, as part of the conferral of this abhiṣeka as an ācārya, you are presented with offerings, feel that you are being offered to.
oM badzra puSh+pe pra tIts+tsha hU~M/ zhes pa nas shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/ me tog 'thor te/
oṃ vajra puṣpe pratīccha hūṃ…śabda… Thus, make offerings and sprinkle flowers. {199}

mnga' bdag chen po sku mdog sngon po (199) rgyal gyur cig / dmar po ji ltar mdzes par byas pa rgyal gyur cig / dam tshig mchog gis rgyan gyis mdzes pa rgyal gyur cig / lha mo'i 'khor lo'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa rgyal gyur cig /

Be victorious as a great master, blue in color. Be victorious as one red and beautiful. Be victorious as one beautiful with the ornaments of supreme samaya. Be victorious as one adorned with the ornaments of a circle of goddesses.

dang po'i sangs rgyas kun mchog gnas pa rgyal gyur cig / 'dod pa thar pa nor dang chos sbyin rgyal gyur cig / rnam par dgyes par rol pa'i rang bzhin rgyal gyur cig / phyag na rdo rje bde ba'i mgon po rgyal gyur cig /

Be victorious as one abiding as the all-supreme first buddha. Be victorious as one who gives the dharma and gem of liberation from desire. Be victorious as the nature of the play of delight. Be victorious as Vajrapāṇi, the protector of bliss.
oM su pra tiSh+Tha badzra hU~M/
oṃ supratiṣṭha vajra hūṃ
de nas phrin las kyi rjes su gnang ba ni/ /glegs bam gtad pas khyod kyis thabs sna tshogs kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mos mdzod/
Next, the authorization for activity. Having been given the volume, feel that you are turning the wheel of dharma through various methods.
'jig rten khams ni thams cad du/ / sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir/ / bya ba spyod tshul gsang ba yi/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ /
In all the realms of the world, in order to benefit sentient beings, turn the wheel of the dharma, the secret mode of activities.
rdo rje'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ / rin chen 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ / pad+ma'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ / las kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ /
Turn the vajra wheel. Turn the ratna wheel. Turn the padma wheel. Turn the karma wheel.
de rnams ni rdo rje slob dpon du dbang bskur ba'o/ / de dang rjes su 'brel bar rjes su gnang ba la bdun las/
Those confer the vajrācārya abhiṣekas. There are seven authorizations connected to those.
dang po gar ni/ kun gyis pad kor sogs gar cung zad bsgyur bar mdzod/
First, dance. All should perform some small dance moves, such as lotus circles.
deng nas brtsams te rdzogs sangs rgyas/ / rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' bo'i tshogs/ / shes rab thabs kyis snyems chen gyis/ / gsang mchog bde ba'i dga' ston gyis/ /
From today onward, in assemblies of perfect buddhas, yoginīs, and heroes, with prajñā and method, and with great pride, conduct feasts of the secret, sublime bliss.
gnyis pa ni/ phreng ba sbyin cing rjes su gnang ba'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Second. As you are given a mālā, feel that you are receiving the authorization.
sgeg dang bcas pa'i phreng ba zung / / sangs rgyas kun gtso rnal 'byor ma/ / de ni 'bral bar mi 'gyur te/ / phreng ba 'di ni rgyan yin no/ /
Take the mālā that comes with charm. Never separate from the Yoginī, the principal one of all buddhas. This mālā is an ornament.
gsum pa glu ni/ snyan pa'i 'gyur khugs dang bcas te rjes su gnang ba'i mos pa mdzod/
Third, song. As you [hear] a round of sweet sounds, feel that you receive the authorization.
lus can rnams la dam chos kyi/ / glu ni khyod kyis blang bar bya/ / des ni rnal 'byor ma de dang / / myur du bde ba myong bar 'gyur/ /
For all embodied beings, you should sing songs of the sacred dharma. Those will swiftly bring bliss with the yoginī.
bzhi pa mig thur ni/
Fourth, the eye spoon.
gser gyi mig thur gyis mig sman mig la byug cing ye shes kyi spyan dang ldan par rjes su gnang ba'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Feel that the golden eye spoon pours eye medicine into your eyes and that you receive the authorization for being endowed with wisdom eyes.
ji ltar mig mkhan rgyal po yis/ / 'jig rten rab rib (200) bsal ba ltar/ / dag cing gsal la rnyog pa med/ / rab rib rgyal ba rnams kyis bsal/ /
Just as a king who is an eye expert {200} can remove the eye diseases of the world, the victors remove all eye diseases, [giving you eyes that are] pure, clear, and free from flaws.
oM badzra ni tra a pa ha ra pa tra laM hrIHprA~M/
oṃ vajra nitra apahara patra laṃ hrīḥ prāṃ
lnga pa ni/
Fifth.
dud dkar byin te chos 'chad pa'i rjes su gnang ba'i mos pa mdzod/
As you are given the conch, feel that you are receiving the authorization for explaining the dharma.
khyod kyis the tshom dogs med par/ / yid gnyis med pa'i sems kyis ni/ / chos kyi dung ni bla med pa/ / dri med kun tu gang bar gyis/ /
With no doubts or hesitations, without being of two minds, fill the conch of dharma, unsurpassable and stainless.
drug pa ni/
Sixth.
las bzhi'i dbyibs bcos pa'i tsakli btegs la/ phrin las bzhi po rjes su gnang ba'i mos pa mdzod/
Hold up icons made in the shapes of the four activities. Feel that you receive the authorization for the four activities.
zhi dang rgyas dang dbang dang dgug / sdang bar byed dang gdon tshogs dag / bsad dang bskrad pa thams cad de/ / las de rnams ni bsgrub par gyis/ /
Pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, summoning, arousing hostility, killing spirits, and expelling are the activities to practice.
bdun pa ni/
Seventh.
grub pa brgyad kyi gzugs bris pa'i tsakli btegs la/ thun mong gi grub pa brgyad po rjes su gnang ba'i mos pa mdzod/
Hold up icons with drawings of the eight siddhis. Feel that you receive the authorization for the eight common siddhis.
ral gri mig sman sa 'og dang / / rkang mgyogs mi snang ril bu bcud/ / mkha' la spyod pa'i dngos grub kun/ / thams cad ci dgar bsgrub par gyis/ /
The siddhis of the sword, eye medicine, [traveling] below the earth, swift feet, invisibility, pills, elixirs, and the enjoyment of space are all to be practiced with delight.
zhes brjod/
And:

de nas de dag gi skabs su khas blangs pa'i dam tshig dang sdom pa rnams la srung sdom ci nus su bgyid snyam pa'i srung sems nan tan du bskyed nas dam tshig mdor bsdus te khas len pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/

Then, on this occasion, arouse vigorously the intention to preserve all the samayas and vows you have taken, thinking that you will do whatever you can to preserve and keep them. Repeat three times the following promise that summarizes the samayas:
gtso bos ji ltar bka' stsal pa/ / de dag thams cad bdag gis bgyi/ /
Whatever the principal one commands, all that I will do.

dbang legs par thob pa'i bka' drin gtang rag gi slad du maN+Dal phul/ maN+Dal du ma zad lus longs spyod dus gsum gyi dge tshogs thams cad 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rgyal srid ltar sprul nas 'bul na cha shas re re nas so sor bzhes te longs spyad du gsol snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/

As thanks for the kindness that enabled you to receive the abhiṣekas, offer a maṇḍala. And not only a maṇḍala, imagine that your body, possessions, and collection of virtue in the three times manifest like the kingdom of a cakravartin and offer them. Thinking, “May each and every one of them be accepted and enjoyed,” repeat the following three times:
de de nas brtsams te bdag dran du/ / khyed la bdag ni 'bul lags na/ / khyod kyis slob mar gzung ba dang / / cha yis kyang ni spyad du gsol/ /
From today onward, I offer myself[19] to you as a servant. Please accept me as a disciple, and use any part of me.

de ltar de nyid kyi sgo nas dpal 'khor lo bde mchog grub thob chen po tai lo pa dang nA ro pa'i lugs kyi dbang bskur gyi rim pa zab pa las kyang ches zab pa phul grub pa lags pas 'di'i sgo nas rang gzhan gyi don rgya chen po mdzad pa dang / de ltar (201) gsan pa'i rnam dkar gyis mtshon dus gsum du bsags pa'i dge ba thams cad phyogs gcig tu bsdus te bla na med pa'i byang chub chen por bsngo ba'i 'dun pas bsngo smon mdzad 'tshal/

That completes the offering of the more profound than profound process for conferring the abhiṣekas belonging to the tradition of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara mahāsiddhas Tilopa and Nāropa. {201} Please make the aspiration that through this there will be vast benefit for yourself and others. Gathering together all the virtue accumulated during the three times, represented by the virtue of hearing [this abhiṣeka], please dedicate all that to the great, unsurpassable awakening. With that intention, do the dedications and aspirations.
bsod nams 'di yis sogs bsngo smon bgyis te slob ma rnams gyes par bya'o/ /

By this merit [may we attain omniscience and defeat the enemy of wrongdoing. From the ocean of existence, with its stormy waves of birth, old age, sickness, and death, may all beings be free.] Do dedications and aspirations, and send the disciples away.
gsum pa rjes kyi rim pa la/
III. The Concluding Section
[A. Hand Offering]
tshogs mchod sogs kyi gong du lag mchod bya ba ni/ sngar byin gyis brlabs pa'i thod pa'i bdud rtsi mdun tu bzhag / g.yon pa'i mtheb srin gyis zeg ma gtor la/
Do the hand offering before the gaṇapūjā and the rest. Place the skull cup with the previously consecrated amṛta in front. Sprinkle drops with your left thumb and ring finger, saying:
oM khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT brjod/
oṃ khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
g.yon skor gyis zlum skor bya zhing /
Make a circle counterclockwise, saying:
oM swa b+hA ba sogs/
oṃ svabhāva…
g.yon skor gyis chos 'byung 'bri la/
Draw a source of dharmas counterclockwise, saying:
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
g.yas skor du bris te/
Draw one clockwise:
hU~M AHoM/
hūṃ āḥ oṃ
dbus su/
In the middle:
hU~M ba~M/
hūṃ vaṃ
phyogs bzhir/
In the four directions:
ma~M la~M pA~M tA~M/
māṃ lāṃ pāṃ tāṃ
rnams las gtso bo yab yum dang mkha' 'gro bzhi/ zur drug la/
From those, the principal male and female consorts and the four ḍākinīs [appear]. In the six corners:
oM haH na ma hi/ swA hA hu/ bau ShaT ho/ hU~M hU~M heH/ phaT haM/
oṃ hoḥ / nama hi / svāhā hu / vauṣaṭ he[20] / hūṃ hūṃ heḥ / phaṭ haṃ
zhes dang /
And:
oM ba~M/ ha~M ya~M/ hrIM moM/ hrIM hrIM/ hU~M hU~M/ phaT phaT/
oṃ vaṃ / haṃ yoṃ / hriṃ moṃ / hriṃ hrīṃ / hūṃ hūṃ / phaṭ phaṭ
zhes yab yum gyi go cha'i lha rnams bkod tshul thig le bya/
Place drops to arrange the male and female armor deities.
de rnams yongs su gyur pa las skad cig gis bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo bde mchog bde ba chen po lha lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yongs su gsal bar gyur/
Instantly, those transform into the vivid maṇḍala cakra of the five mahāsukha deities of the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara.

lag pa gnyis phan tshun chang gtor la/ khaN+Da ro he 'i sngags brjod / oM swA b+hA wa sa g.yas pa'i mtheb srin gyis g.yon pa'i mthil du g.yon skor du zlum skor bya ba dang chos 'byung bsnol ma dbus kyi sa bon lnga po sngar ltar g.yas pas bkod pa la/

Sprinkle alcohol on both hands and say the khaṇḍarohe mantra. With svabhāva, using your right thumb and ring finger, draw a circle, counterclockwise, on the palm of your left hand. In the middle of crossed sources of dharmas, place the five seed syllables clockwise, as above, and say:
thig le lnga po yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo bde mchog yab yum bde chen gyis rnal 'byor ma bzhi dang bcas pa sku mdog phyag mtshan rgyan cha lugs thams cad yongs su gsal bar gyur/ /
The five bindus transform into the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, male and female consorts, with the four yoginīs of great bliss, complete with their vivid colors, emblems, ornaments, and attributes.
oM shrI tsakra sam+ba ra sarba bI ra yo gi ni Ar+g+haM nas / shab+da 'i bar dang / a mr-i ta ma taM gi rnams sbyar ba'i phyi nang gsang gsum gyis mchod/ rkang brgyad kyis bstod/
oṃ śrīcakrasamvara sarvavīrayoginī arghaṃ…śabda… Add: …amṛta…mataṃgi… Thus, present the outer, inner, and secret offerings. Praise with the eight lines.[*29]

rang gi lag pa g.yas pa'i mthil du a las zla ba'i steng du dbyangs yig dkar po shes rab kyi rang bzhin/ g.yon par ma~M las nyi ma'i steng du gsal byed so bzhi dmar po thabs kyi rang bzhin/ steng 'og gi yi ge las 'od zer dkar dmar 'phros te thod pa'i nang du song bas (202) gnyis su med par 'dres shing khol nas ma dag pa phyir lud/ rlangs pa'i 'od zer mchod sprin du gyur pas 'khor lo sdom pa'i lha tshogs mnyes par byas/

On the palm of my right hand, from a, is a moon, on top of which are the vowels, white and of the nature of prajñā. On my left, from māṃ, is a sun, on top of which are the forty-two consonants, red and of the nature of method. From the letters above and below, white and red light rays radiate. {202} They go inside the skull cup and blend inseparably. [The contents] boil, expelling all impurities. The light rays from the steam become offering clouds, which please the assembled deities of Cakrasaṃvara.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ

slar yang lag pa g.yas pa'i mthil dang g.yon gyi mdzub mo lnga dang sen mo rnams la/ oM haH na ma hi/ swA hA hu/ bau Sha Ta ha/ hU~M hU~M ho/ phaT haM yab kyi go cha'i dpa' bo drug dang / g.yon pa'i mthil du oM ba~M/ ha~M yoM/ hrIM moM/ hrIM hrIM/ hU~M hU~M/ phaT phaT las yum gyi go cha'i lha mo drug gsal bar gyur/

Again, on the palm of my right hand, the five fingers of my left hand, and all my fingernails, from oṃ hoḥ, na ma hi, svāhā hu, vauṣaṭ he,[21] hūṃ hūṃ hoḥ, and phaṭ haṃ, the six heroes who are the armor of the male consort appear clearly. On the palm of my left hand, from oṃ vaṃ, haṃ yoṃ, hriṃ moṃ, hriṃ hriṃ, hūṃ hūṃ, and phaṭ phaṭ, the six goddesses who are the armor of the female consort appear clearly.
oM badzra puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ a lo ke / gan+d+he/ ni wi d+ya pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṃ vajra puṣpe / dhūpe / āloke / gandhe / nividya pratīcchā[22] svāhā

lha thams cad phan tshun yum gyis yab la 'khyud/ yab kyis yum la 'khyud/ thal mo kha sbyar la/ yab yum gnyis su med par snyoms par zhugs pa'i byang sems dkar dmar babs pas bdud rtsi dang 'dres/ slar yang lha rnams 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i zag pa med pa'i bdud rtsi'i rgya mtsho chen por gyur/ lag pa gnyis kha sbyar ba 'og tu blta ba'i mtheb srin gyis g.yon skor du lan gsum dkug /

All the deities embrace each other: the female consorts embrace the male consorts, and the male consorts embrace the female consorts. With your hands in añjali, say: The white and red bodhicittas of the male and female consorts in nondual union descend and mix with the amṛta. Next, the deities melt into light, from which comes a great ocean of undefiled amṛta. With your hands joined and your thumb and ring fingers facing downward, summon by circling counterclockwise three times.

oM A:hU~M/ zhes brjod la g.yon pa'i mtheb srin gyis phyi rol dang / mchod rdzas dang rang nyid rnams la gtor zhing / gnas dang rnal 'byor bdag cag rnams srung ba mtshams kyi gur khang dpa' bo mkha' 'gro mas gtams par gyur/ bdud rtsi g.yon pa'i mtheb srin gyis blangs la smin mtshams nas steng 'og rim bzhin du 'thor nas mchod par bsams la/

oṃ āḥ hūṃ Saying that, with your left thumb and ring finger, sprinkle externally, on the offering substances, and on yourself. This place with us, yogins and yoginīs, and the tent of the protected area are filled with heroes and ḍākinīs. Taking up the amṛta with your left thumb and ring finger, sprinkle from the level of the point between your eyebrows, above and below, thinking that you are offering.

oM AHhU~M/ chos sku drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po/ te lo shes rab bzang po/ na ro dz+nyA na sid+d+hi/ mar pa chos kyi blo gros/ mi la bzhad pa rdo rje/ dwags po zla 'od gzhon nu/ dpal ldan dus gsum mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba dang brgyud par bcas pa'i dpal ldan bla ma dam pa rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/

oṃ āḥ hūṃ To the great Vajradhara, the sixth one, the dharmakāya, to Tilo Prajñābhadra, Nāro Jñānasiddhi, Marpa Chökyi Lodrö, Mila Shepa Dorje, Dakpo Daö Zhönu, the glorious Dusum Khyenpa and others, to the genuine, glorious root and lineage gurus, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

gang 'dir phung khams rgyal ba yab yum nyid/ / yul dbang sems las dbang yul khro mo dpa'/ / srid gsum dbyer med lhan skyes rnal 'byor mchod/ / ces rang gi lus kyi lha tshogs mchod cing / rgyud sde bzhi yi dkyil 'khor lha rnams dang / / dpa' bo mkha' 'gro chos skyong srung ma rnams/ / bdud rtsi'i rgyun (203) gyis gus pas rab mchod na/ / rjes su brtse bas byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ /
oM shrI badzra he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki mI dzA la sam+ba raM huM hU~M phaT/ sogs
oṃ śrīvajra he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla samvaraṃ svāhā…
yab yum 'khor dang bcas pa'i snying po rgyas bsdus gang rung gi mthar/
At the end of the long or short essence mantras of the male and female consorts and their retinue add:
oM AHhU~M btags la 'bul/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Thus, offer.
shrI ma hA kA la oM A:hU~M/ shrI ma hA kA li oM AHhU~M/
śrīmahākāla oṃ āḥ hūṃ / śrīmahākāli oṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes chos skyong rnams la 'bul/ lag mchod chang des tshogs gtor rnams la bran dgos pa yin no/ /
Thus, offer to the dharma protectors. The alcohol of the hand offering must be sprinkled on the feast torma.
gnyis pa
B. [Torma Offering]
gtor ma zur du byed na/ mchod gtor bdud rtsi ltar byin gyis brlab/ bla ma yi dam chos skyong rnams la gong ltar sngags lan gsum res 'bul/ phyi nang gsang gsum mchod/ rkang brgyad kyis bstod/

If you have a torma put to the side, consecrate the offering torma as done for the amṛta. Offer to the gurus, yidams, and dharma protectors using the mantras three times as above. Present the outer, inner, and secret offerings. Praise with the eight lines. Saying,
mchod sbyin gtor ma 'di bzhes la sogs kyis phrin las bcol/

Accept this offering and gift of torma, [May we yogins and yoginīs with our retinues be without illness, have long lives, might, glory, fame, excellent fortune, and vast enjoyments. Bestow on us the siddhis of actions: pacifying, enriching, and the others. Samaya holders, protect us. Be our friend and aid for the siddhis. May we not meet with untimely death, illness, spirits, or hindrances. May we not have bad dreams, bad omens, or bad interactions. May there be peace in the world, good harvests, plentiful grains, the flourishing of dharma, and an abundance of goodness. May all that we desire be accomplished.] …entrust them with activity.
mdun bskyed la dmigs na de tsam gyis chog / gtor mgron gsar du spyan drangs na bzod gsol byas la gshegs su gsol lo/ /
If you are focusing on a front visualization, this much is enough. If you have newly invited the torma guests, request their patience and that they depart.
gsum pa tshogs mchod ni
C. The Gaṇapūjā
stag lpags la sogs pa'i steng du chos 'byung bris pa'i dbus su tshogs gtor dang sha chang gtso bor gyur ba'i tshogs rdzas ji tsam 'byor ba bsham/ bdud rtsi ltar byin gyis brlab/

On a tiger skin and the like, in the middle of a drawing of a source of dharmas, arrange the feast torma and whatever feast substances you can, with the main ones being meat and alcohol. Consecrate them as done for the amṛta.
na mo
namo

thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo rgya chen po 'di/ rang bzhin rnam par dag pa skye ba med pa/ ngo bo rnam par dag pa A li kA li/ mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa sha lnga bdud rtsi lngas rgyas btab pa 'di bsngo zhing 'bul ba'i gnas su gyur pa ni/

This vast gaṇacakra in which method and prajñā are not dual is of a pure nature: unborn. Its pure essence is ā li kā li. Its pure characteristics are sealed by the five meats and five amṛtas. This has become something to be dedicated and offered.
byin rlabs kyi rtsa ba bka' brgyud bla ma rnams kyi zhal du khA hi/
To the roots of blessing, the Kagyu gurus, khāhi.
dngos grub kyi rtsa ba yi dam lha tshogs rnams kyi=
To the roots of siddhis, the assembly of yidam deities,…
phrin las kyi rtsa ba chos skyong srung ma rnams kyi=
To the roots of activities, the dharma protectors and guardians,…
pany+tsa a mr-i ta la khA hi/ ga Na tsakra la khA hi/ tshogs nyid spyan 'dren pa ni/ hU~M/
pañca amṛta la khāhi / gaṇacakra la khāhi The invocation of the assembly. hūṃ
bzhengs shig bla ma rnams bzhengs shig / bka' brgyud bla ma sku bskyod 'tshal/ / rig 'dzin mkha' 'gro 'bum gyi dbus/ / 'dir gshegs tshogs kyi mchod pa bzhes/ /
Arise, gurus, arise. Kagyu gurus, please approach, in the midst of hundreds of thousands of vidyādharas and ḍākinīs, please come here and accept the gaṇapūjā.
hU~M bzhengs shig yi dam rnams bzhengs shig / bde mchog yab yum sku bskyod 'tshal/ / dpa' bo mkha' 'gro 'bum gyi dbus/ / 'dir gshegs tshogs kyi=
hūṃ Arise, yidams, arise. Saṃvara, male and female consorts, please approach, in the midst of hundreds of thousands of heroes and ḍākinīs, please come here and accept…
hU~M bzhengs shig chos skyong rnams bzhengs shig / ma mgon (204)lcam dral da bskyod 'tshal/ / dam tshig mkha' 'gro 'bum gyi dbus/ / 'dir gshegs tshogs kyi=
hūṃ Arise, dharma protectors, arise. {204} Ma-Gön cham-dral, please approach, in the midst of hundreds of thousands of samayaḍākinīs, please come here and accept…
gnas khang 'di la byin gyis rlobs/ / tshogs gtor 'di la bcud cig phob/ / 'dir 'tshogs rnam 'byor bdag cag la/ / mchog dang thun mong dngos grub stsol/ /
Consecrate this place. Give this torma potency. To us yogins and yoginīs gathered here, please grant the supreme and common siddhis.
de nas tshogs rdzas bstab pa ni/ /
Serving the feast substances.
hU~M phyag rgya chen po'i gzhal yas nas/ / bka' brgyud bla ma 'khor bcas la/ / zag med tshogs kyi mchod pa 'di/ / gnyis med ngang du 'bul lags na/ / bde ba chen por bzhes su gsol/ /
hūṃ In the palace of mahāmudrā, to the Kagyu gurus and their retinues, I present within nonduality this undefiled gaṇapūjā. Please accept it as great bliss.
mchog dang thun mong dngos grub rnams/ / 'dir 'tshogs rnams la stsal du gsol/ /
Please bestow on all gathered here the supreme and common siddhis.
hU~M gsang ba'i dur khrod gnas brgyad nas/ / grub thob pho mo 'khor bcas la/ / zag med sogs 'gres /
hūṃ In the eight secret charnel grounds, to the male and female siddhas and their retinues, I present…
hU~M chos dbyings bde ba chen po nas/ / 'khor lo bde mchog 'khor bcas la/ / zag med=
hūṃ In the dharmadhātu, great bliss, to Cakrasaṃvara and retinue, I present…
hU~M o rgyan rang byung dur khrod nas/ / gsang ba ye shes 'khor bcas la/ / zag med=
hūṃ In the self-arisen charnel grounds of Oḍḍiyāna, to Guhyajñāna and retinue, I present…
hU~M shar phyogs gsang ba'i dur khrod nas/ / mkha' 'gro yab yum 'khor bcas la/ / zag med= /
hūṃ In the secret charnel ground in the east, to Ḍākinī, male and female consorts, and retinue, I present…
hU~M byang phyogs gsang ba'i dur khrod nas/ / lA ma yab yum 'khor bcas la/ / zag med= /
hūṃ In the secret charnel ground in the north, to Lāma, male and female consorts, and retinue, I present…
hU~M nub phyogs gsang ba'i dur khrod nas/ / dum skyes yab yum 'khor bcas la/ / zag med= /
hūṃ In the secret charnel ground in the west, to Khaṇḍarohā, male and female consorts, and retinue, I present…
hU~M lho phyogs gsang ba'i dur khrod nas/ / gzugs can yab yum 'khor bcas la/ / zag med=
hūṃ In the secret charnel ground in the south, to Rūpiṇī, male and female consorts, and retinue, I present…
hU~M gnas mchog nyi shu rtsa bzhi nas/ / dpa' bo mkha' 'gro 'khor bcas la/ / zag med=
hūṃ In the twenty-four supreme places, to the heroes and ḍākinīs, and retinue, I present…
hU~M 'jig rten sna tshogs dur khrod nas/ / sna tshogs mkha' 'gro 'khor bcas la/ / zag med =
hūṃ In the various charnel grounds in the world, to the various ḍākinīs and retinue, I present…

hU~M bdud 'dul chen po'i pho brang nas/ / ye shes chos skyong 'khor bcas la/ / zag med tshogs kyi mchod pa 'di/ / gnyis med ngang du 'bul lags na/ / bde ba chen por bzhes su gsol/ / mchog dang thun mong dngos grub rnams/ / 'dir 'tshogs rnams la stsal du gsol/ /

hūṃ In the great palace of subjugating Māra, to the wisdom dharma protectors and their retinues, I present within nonduality this undefiled gaṇapūjā. Please accept it as great bliss. Please bestow on all gathered here the supreme and common siddhis.

skabs 'dir gong du smos pa ltar gtor chog gis gtor ma 'bul/ grub na mkha' (205) 'gro spyi gtor dang gzhi bdag gtor ma'ang btang / phrin las bcol ba'i rjes su skong rdzas dngos 'byor yid sprul bsam gyis mi khyab par dmigs la/

Here, offer a torma using the torma ritual, as described above. {205} If you can, give a general ḍākinī torma and a local deity torma. After entrusting them with activity, focus on the restoration substances, actual and imagined, as being of inconceivable amounts and say:
hU~M/ phyag rgya chen po'i gzhal yas nas/ / bka' brgyud bla ma 'khor bcas rnams/ / tshogs dang gtor mas thugs dam bskang / /
hūṃ In the palace of mahāmudrā, Kagyu gurus and your retinues, may this feast and torma fulfill your commitment.
thugs dam bskang ngo tshangs pa'i dngos grub stsol/ / zhes gong ltar tshang bar sbyar/
May your commitment be fulfilled—please bestow upon us the pure siddhis. Add all [the subsequent verses] as above.
bshags pa bya ba ni/
Confession.
hU~M/ phyag rgya chen po'i gzhal yas nas/ / bka' brgyud bla ma 'khor bcas rnams/ / gsan cing bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
hūṃ In the palace of mahāmudrā, Kagyu gurus and your retinues, please listen and consider me.
bdag cag ma rig dbang gis ni/ / sku gsung thugs dang ci 'gal ba/ / mthol lo bshags so tshangs pa'i dngos grub stsol/ /
Any transgressions of body, speech, and mind I have done out of ignorance, I acknowledge and confess—please bestow upon me the pure siddhis.
zhes snga ma'i go rim ltar sbyar/ las rdor gyis/
Add [the subsequent verses] according to the previous sequences. The vajra server says:
gzigs shig mdzes ldan sogs kyis tshogs drang /
Behold this beautiful [sacred dharma. It is wrong to doubt it. Regarding brahmans, dogs, and śūdras to be of one nature, enjoy.] Thus, the feast is served.
rin thang med las sogs kyis blangs la nang gi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rol/ lhag ma rnams bsdus la bdud rtsis bran/ a kA ro sa byin gyis brlab /

Beyond what is priceless, [the dharma of Svāgata is unsullied by desire and the rest, free from percepts and perceivers. Thus, I pay homage to thusness. a la la hoḥ] Receiving [the feast offerings], enjoy them with the inner yoga. Collect the leftovers, and sprinkle them with amṛta. Consecrate them with akāro.

hU~M/ gzhan yang las kyi mkha' 'gro ma/ / shin tu 'jigs pa'i keng rus gzugs/ / yan lag rus pa'i 'khor los brgyan/ / snying khrag rngub cing rkan sgra sgrogs/ / rkang mgyogs brtul zhugs gdug rtsub can/ / dam tshig can gyi las mkhan yin/ /

hūṃ Karmaḍākinīs, with terrifying skeleton forms, bone cakras adorning your limbs, sucking heart blood, smacking your palates, you are swift-footed with mischievous discipline. You are the servants of those with samaya.
dam tshig nyams pa'i srog gcod yin/ / phud lhag bshal chu'i gtor ma bzhes/ / dkon mchog gsum gyi bstan ba srungs/ / da res nyul la mel tshe mdzod/ /
You will take the life of those who break samaya. Accept this torma of the select portion, leftovers, and rinse water. Protect the teachings of the three jewels. Now, be a spy and lookout.
hU~M/ 'jig rten mkha' 'gro rdzu 'phrul can/ / srin po'i lus la ce spyang gdong / sbrul nag lce la spyan mig glog / kha rlangs dug la nga ro 'brug /
hūṃ Worldly ḍākinīs performing miracles, with bodies of rākṣasīs and heads of jackals, tongues of black snakes, eyes of lightning, poisonous breath and thunderous roar,

mi lpags g.yab mo phyogs bcur rdeb/ / rgyu zhags 'dom dgus dgra bo 'ching / / khros pa'i smin phrag ser chen 'bebs/ / bye ba dung phyur sa ma ya/ / ba spu mtshon cha me ltar 'bar/ / dam tshig can gyi sogs /

you wave human skins, striking the ten directions, you bind your enemies with lassoes of intestines, nine fathoms long, your ferocious eyebrows bring down hail— millions and hundreds of millions, samaya— your body hairs are weapons, blazing like fire. You are the servants…
hU~M/ sha za'i mkha' 'gro yang sprul tshogs/ / yi dwags lus la dur bya'i gdong / / chu srin rkan la thod pas brgyan/ / lus la rnag khrag chu ser (206) lhags/ /

hūṃ Flesh-eating ḍākinīs with your assembly of re-emanations, with preta bodies and charnel-ground bird heads, with makara palates, and ornamented with skulls, your bodies exude pus, blood, and lymph. {206}
smre sngags tshig la ngu 'bod dbyangs/ / phyi nas 'dre 'tshub sprin bzhin ldang / / bkra mi shis shing rjes ngan gtong / /
You wail with mournful cries. Externally, you stir up cloudlike swirls of spirits, creating disaster and bad luck.
ro langs rkang pas dur khrod nyul/ / phung sri lag pas srog rtsa gcod/ / gza' srin mig gis zla tshes blta/ / dam tshig sogs /
You roam the charnel grounds on your zombie legs, severing aortas with your destructive hands, and gazing at the crescent moon with your Rāhu-rakṣasa eyes. You are the servants…
hU~M/ gzhan yang mkha' 'gro pho nya'i tshogs/ / las la myur zhing bstan pa srung / / lce spyang mang po rol du khrid/ / bu chung lus la bya rog gdong / / bshugs glu'i dbyangs la smre sngags tshig /

hūṃ Ḍākinīs with assemblies of emissaries, who are quick to act and guard the teachings, leading packs of jackals in frolic, with small children’s bodies and ravens’ heads, in whistling melodies, you make your mournful cries.
ri gsum 'grim zhing lung gsum bskor/ / chu la zhon nas grib so 'grim/ / dkyil 'khor mtha' ma bskor zhing nyul/ / dam tshig can sogs /
You wander in three mountains, circle in three valleys, ride on water, and dart through shadows. You circle and roam the edges of the maṇḍala. You are the servants…
oM uts+tshi Sh+Ta ba l+yA di b+hak+Sha b+hak+Sha si swA hA/
oṃ ucchiṣṭa balyādi bhakṣa bhakṣasi svāhā
de nas rdo rje'i glu len pa ni/
Singing a vajra song.
pad+ma la ni rdo rje gnas/ / pad+ma nyid ni zhing yin no/ / rgyun tu cang te'u brdung bya ste/ / snying rjes ku co bsgrags mi bya/ /
The vajra resides in the lotus. The lotus is in the field. Playing the changteu continuously, We will be compassionate, not quarrelsome.
da ru stobs ldan 'bad par bya/ / chang ni mang po btung bar bya/ / grogs po skal ldan gzhug par bya/ / skal pa med par rnam par spang / /
Now we apply ourselves to bala, and drink lots of alcohol. Fortunate friends may come in, but the unfortunate will be barred.
bzhi mnyam gla rtsi sih+la/ / ga bur rnams kyis byug par bya/ / der ni tshod ma sha chen gyis/ / bkang ba yang dag bza' bar bya/ /
We will smear ourselves with the fourfold, musk, sihlā, and camphor. There we will consume our fill of great flesh with its seasonings.
'gro dang 'ong ba 'gog mi bye/ / dag dang ma dag bsam mi bya/ / rus pa'i rgyan gyis lus la brgyan/ / de ru ro ni gzhug par bya/ /
We will come and go unimpeded, not seeing anything as pure or impure. Our bodies adorned with bone ornaments, there we enter the corpse.
'dus phyir gnyis ni sbyor bar bya/ / der ni reg min spang mi bya/ /
For our gathering, we will unite the two. There we don’t reject untouchables.
zhes brjod/
Thus it is said.[23]
bzhi pa gtang rag gi mchod bstod ni/
D. Offerings and Praises in Thanks
mchod pa kha gsos la byin rlabs bya/ sgrub mchod skabs sogs su chu bzhi nyer spyod/ rig ma bcu drug bcas tshigs bcad sngags dang bcas pas mchod/
Replenish the offerings and consecrate them. On the occasion of sādhanapūjās and the like, offer the four waters, the traditional offerings, and the sixteen vidyās with the verses and mantras.
bka' brgyud bla ma/ yi dam lha tshogs/ sangs rgyas byang sems/ dpa' bo mkha' 'gro/ chos skyong srung ma rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To the Kagyu gurus, assembly of yidam deities, buddhas and bodhisattvas, heroes and ḍākinīs, and dharma protectors and guardians, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
zhes pas nang mchod dang /
Thus, present the inner offering.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta a nu rA ga Na badzra swa b+hA wa At+ma ko‘haM/
oṃ sarvatathāgata anurāgaṇa vajra svabhāva atmako ’haṃ

zhes pas gus mchod 'bul/ rkang brgyad kyis bstod/ cho ga dkyus ma tsam la/ bsdu na/ chu bzhi nyer spyod/ rig ma bcu drug bcas sngags tsam dang / pany+tsa a mr-i ta sa nang mchod / ma taM gi sa gsang mchod 'bul /

Thus, present the secret offering.[24] Praise with the eight lines. As the general rituals, you can abbreviate as follows: Present the four waters, the traditional offerings, and the sixteen vidyās with just the mantras. With pañca amṛta present the inner offering. With mataṃgi present the secret offering. {207}
chos (207) dbyings rnam dag dbyings las ma g.yos kyang / / thabs kyis khro bo'i skur ston gdug pa 'dul/ / che ba'i che mchog lha yi lhar gyur pa/ / kun bzang he ru ka la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

Though you never move from the pure expanse of the dharmadhātu, you tame malevolent ones by skillfully displaying your wrathful form. You are the greatest of the greats, the deity of deities. Homage to Samantabhadra Heruka.
zhes pa tsam gyis bstod/
Praise with just that.
bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi lha tshogs rnams kyis bdag dang sems can thams cad la mchog thun mong gi dngos grub ma lus par stsal du gsol/ zhes 'dod don gsol/
Assembled deities of the Bhagavān, glorious Cakrasaṃvara, please bestow the supreme and common siddhis upon me and all sentient beings. Thus, request [the fulfillment of] your desired aims.
lnga pa bzod par gsol ba ni/
E. Request for Patience
ma 'byor ba dang nyams pa dang / / sogs dang he ru ka'i yig brgya lan gsum brjod/
With anything missing or done wrong, [or things I did or had others do out of my ignorance, protectors, please be patient.] Recite the heruka hundred syllables three times.
drug pa gshegs bsdu ni/
F. Departure and Dissolution
mdun bskyed dkyil 'khor ye shes pa ras bris sogs la brtan bzhugs bya/ rten med na gshegs su gsol/
Request the wisdom ones of the front visualization maṇḍala to abide in the support, such as a cloth-drawn [maṇḍala]. If there is no support, request them to depart.

dam tshig pa'i dkyil 'khor 'khor dang bcas pa 'od du zhu nas rang la thim par mos/ rang nyid bcom ldan 'das dpa' bo gcig par gsal ba'i spyi bor oM dkar po/ mgrin par AHdmar po/ snying gar hU~M sngon po rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyis bsrung bar mos/

The maṇḍala of samaya ones with their retinue melts into light and dissolves into me. I am clearly the Bhagavān, the single hero. At my head is a white oṃ, at my throat is a red āḥ, and at my heart is a blue hūṃ. I am protected by the natures of the three vajras.
spyi bor oM ha dkar po sogs go cha'i dpa' bo drug bkod pa dang / sum+b+ha ni sa phyogs mtshams srung ba ni bde mchog spyi ltar bya'o/ /
With “At my head is a white oṃ haḥ,…,”[*30] place the six armor heroes. With sumbha ni, protect the main and intermediate directions as done generally in Saṃvara [rituals].
bdun pa bsngo smon shis brjod bya ba ni/
G. Dedication, Aspiration, and Expression of Auspiciousness
skye zhing skye bar rigs mchog tu sogs sgrub thabs bzhin brjod/
In birth after birth, may I be born in excellent families,…[*31] Recite this as found in the sādhana.
shis pa brjod pa ni me tog 'thor la/
Expression of auspiciousness. Throw flowers while saying:

bkra shis gang zhig chos kyi sku la legs gnas pa'i/ / bka' brgyud rin chen thugs rje'i mdzad phrin dpag yas kyis/ / 'gro rnams zag med bde chen dbyings la 'god mdzad pa/ / bden pa des kyang bde chen la gnas bkra shis shog /

One auspiciousness abides in the dharmakāya: the vast compassionate activities of the precious Kagyu establish all beings in the expanse of undefiled great bliss. Through this truth, may there be the auspiciousness of abiding in great bliss.
bkra shis gang zhig chos kyi dbyings la legs 'byung zhing / / he ru ka dpal 'jigs byed rgyal po 'bar ba'i sku/ / shes rab phag mo'i pad+mar rdo rjes rol mdzad pa/ / bden pa=
Another auspiciousness arises within the dharmadhātu: the glorious Heruka, King Bhairava, with blazing form, whose vajra revels in the lotus of prajñā Vārāhī. Through this truth,…
bkra shis gang zhig phyogs kyi pad+ma'i 'dab ma la/ / rigs kyi yum bzhi dpa' bo phyogs bzhi'i zhal la gzigs/ / pad+ma'i mu khyud gri gug phreng ba rnam par mdzes/ / bden pa=

Another auspiciousness is on the lotus petals in the main directions: the four female consorts of the families gaze at the faces of the heroes in the four directions. They are beautified with rings of lotuses, hooked knives, and garlands. Through this truth,…
bkra shis gang zhig mtshams kyi pad+ma'i 'dab ma la/ / byang chub sems dang tsan+dan gur gum dri chen chu/ / dag pa'i snod mchog dga' ba'i (208)reg pas rnam par spyod/ / bden pa=

Another auspiciousness is on the lotus petals in the intermediate directions: [containing] perfumed waters, bodhicitta, sandalwood, and saffron, {208} the pure, sublime containers are relished through joyful contact. Through this truth,…
bkra shis gang zhig sa bla sa steng sa 'og tu/ / 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad phreng skor gnas dang nye ba'i gnas/ / zhing dang nye zhing 'du dang nye 'dur dpa' bo rol/ / bden pa=

Another auspiciousness is above the earth, on it, and below: on the eight spokes of the cakras with their encircling garlands, in the abodes and nearby abodes, the fields and nearby fields, and the charnel grounds and nearby charnel grounds, the heroes play. Through this truth,…
bkra shis gang zhig phyogs bzhi dag dang mtshams rnams su/ / khwa gdong la sogs ma mo yid 'ong gzugs gnyis ldan/ / thugs rjes 'gro ba'i don mdzad gdug pa kun 'dul ba/ / bden pa=

Another auspiciousness is in the four main directions and the intermediate ones: the ravishing mamos, Kākāsyā and the others, with two forms, through their compassion benefit beings and tame malevolent ones. Through this truth,…
bkra shis gang zhig byang chub phyogs chos sum cu bdun/ / yongs rdzogs rin chen gzhal yas rta babs 'dod snam dang / / rgyan dang bkod pa sna tshogs dag gis mngon mdzes pa/ / bden pa=
Another auspiciousness is the thirty-seven factors for awakening: the perfect jeweled palace—with its torans, plinths, ornaments, and all its displays—is truly gorgeous. Through this truth,…

bkra shis gang zhig dur khrod chen po brgyad rnams su/ / ri dang mchod rten chu shing me dang sprin rnams la/ / grub ba lha klu zhing skyong rnal 'byor ma rnams rol/ / bden pa des kyang bde chen la gnas bkra shis shog /

Another auspiciousness is in the eight great charnel grounds: on the mountains, at the stūpas, by the rivers, near the trees and fires, and in the clouds, the siddhas, deities, nāgas, field protectors, and yoginīs play. Through this truth, may there be the auspiciousness of abiding in great bliss.
ces dang /
Say that and:
sems dpa' rang byung rdo rje ni/ / yid bzhin nor bu rnyed pa ltar/ / bdag gzhan yongs kyi dbul ba sel/ / dgos 'dod 'byung ba'i bkra shis shog /
Sattva Rangjung Dorje is like discovering a wish-fulfilling gem— he dispels poverty for me and others. May there be the auspiciousness of fulfilling all desires and needs.
ces sogs brjod la mtha' rgyas su bya'o/ /
Saying that and other [verses] brings the conclusion.
dpal ldan mkha' 'gro snyan brgyud rdo rje'i tshig / rdo rje 'chang nas rtsa ba'i bla ma'i bar/ / byin rlabs chu rgyun chad med legs byon pa/ / thos pa'i skal bas rang blo yongs su tshims/ /

The vajra verses of the glorious Ḍākinī Aural Transmission, passed from Vajradhara to my root guru, come with an unbroken stream of blessings. Through the good fortune of hearing them, my mind is satisfied.
bka' babs grub chen ma ti rat+na'i gsung / / brgyud pa'i phyag bzhes bslad pa med pa ru/ / bkod pa'i dge bas snyan brgyud rin po che'i/ / bstan pa dar zhing bde ba mchog 'grub shog /

Through the virtue of presenting, without adulteration, the procedures of the transmission— the entrusted transmission, the teachings of mahāsiddha Mati Ratna— may the teachings of the precious Aural Transmission spread and bring the achievement of Saṃvara.

ces pa'ang gdams ngag rin po che'i mdzod las bka' brgyud che bzhi chung brgyad kyi khrid srol rnams kyi smin byed kyi gtso bo bde mchog snyan brgyud che 'bring chung gsum bzhugs su gsol ba'i skabs/ rgyal dbang karma bka' brgyud kyi gral mthar 'khod pa karma ngag dbang yon tan rgya mtsho phrin las kun khyab dpal bzang pos zur mang snyan brgyud kyi rtsa ba dang gsal byed yig cha rnams kyi dgongs don sor bzhag ste rang lo gya bdun pa la dpal spungs yang khrod tsA 'dra rin chen brag gi sgrub sder bkod pa'i yi ge ba ni nye bar gnas pa blo gsal gsang sngags bstan 'dzin gyis bgyis pa dge legs 'phel// // (209)

In the context of including within The Treasury of Precious Instructions the major, intermediate, and minor Saṃvara Aural Transmissions—which are the primary means of maturation for the four senior and eight junior Kagyu instructional traditions—[I,] Karma Ngakwang Yönten Gyatso Tinle Kunkhyap Palzangpo, who sits at the end of the row in the Gyalwang Karma Kagyu tradition, composed this preserving the intended meaning of the root [texts] and clarifying manuals of the Zurmang Aural Transmission. This was done in my eighty-seventh year at the retreat center of Tsādra Rinchen Drak, the isolated hermitage at Palpung. The secretary was my attendant Losel Sangak Tenzin. May virtue and excellence increase. {209}
@#/ /snyan brgyud lhan cig skyes ma'i yum bka' rgyas pa'i mngon dkyil dang dbang bskur gyi cho ga bdud rtsi bum pa zhes bya bzhugs so// //
22. VASE OF AMṚTA. The Rituals for the Manifest Maṇḍala and Abhiṣekas of the Extensive Yum Ka of the Aural Transmission Sahajā[1]
(210)@#/ / na mo gu ru/
namo guru
bla med bla ma gsang ba lhan cig skyes pa'i mkha' 'gro de la phyag 'tshal zhing nye bar skyabs su mchi'o/ /
To the ḍākinī of the secret connateness, the highest guru, I pay homage and take refuge.
gsang ba bcom ldan pad+ma rA ga'i mdog / dngos kun rang bzhin spros pa kun gyis stong / / bde gshegs ma lus skyed cing sbyor ba'i yum/ / bde ster dpa' mo khyod la phyag 'tshal nas/ /

Secret Bhagavatī, the color of padmarāga, the nature of all things, empty of all elaborations, the mother and consort who generates and unites with all sugatas, to you, Heroine, bestower of bliss, I pay homage.
snyan brgyud lhan cig skyes ma'i mngon dkyil gyi/ / chog 'grigs gong ma'i man ngag bzhin du bri/ /
I will compose the arrangement for the ritual of the manifest maṇḍala of the Aural Transmission Sahajā according to the esoteric instructions of the earlier masters.

de yang bcom ldan 'das ma dpal gsang ba lhan skyes rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i dkyil 'khor du dbang dang sdom pa thob cing dam tshig dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas/ spros med zab mo sin+d+hu ra rdo rje ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor du bdag nyid 'jug pa dang / gzhan don du dbang bskur ba'i rim pa la gsum/ sbyor ba dang / 'jug pa dang / rjes so/ /

Yogic practitioners who have received the abhiṣekas and vows for the maṇḍala of the Bhagavatī, the glorious secret Sahajā, Vajrayoginī, and who have the samayas enter themselves into the profound, unelaborate sindūra vajra wisdom maṇḍala and, for the benefit of others, confer the abhiṣekas. This process has three parts: (1) the preparation, (2) the entering, and (3) the concluding section.
dang po ni/
I. The Preparation
blo ldan man ngag gi de nyid dang ldan pa dag gis rgyud las gsungs pa'i gnas dben zhing nyams dga' ba yid dang mthun par phyag bdar dang chags chags gdab/ gu gul dang sha chen gyis bdug /

Those endowed with intelligence and possessing these specific esoteric instructions [should find] a place described in the tantras, one that is isolated, pleasing, and conducive for the mind. Sweep and tidy it up. Fumigate with guggula and great flesh.

rgyan dang rten mchod bkram/ rje btsun ma'i thang sku'am/ sku'i bkod pa bsham/ dbus su maN+Dal gru bzhi pa byas la a mr-i ta dang dri bzang gis byugs pa la las dang ye shes kyi thig btab la chos 'byung bsnol ma dbus dang zur drug la dga' 'khyil dang / dbus su pad nyi ro gdan la lha mtshan gri gug dang / pad 'dab bzhi la mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'am phyag mtshan bkod pa'i phyi rol pad+ma 'dab brgyad dam pad ra rdo ra dang dur khrod brgyad kyis bskor ba me 'od (211) kyi phreng ba dang bcas pa bri bar snyan brgyud kyi yig cha rnying ma rnams las gsungs kyang / 'dir phyag bzhes su sin+d+hU ra'i dkyil 'khor kho na la brten pas 'thus par yang mdzad/

Arrange the ornaments, representations, and offerings. Place a tangka of Jetsunma or a manifestation of her form, [that is, a statue]. In the middle, make a square maṇḍala. Anoint it with amṛta and scented water. Draw the karma and wisdom lines. In the middle of crossed sources of dharma and in their six corners draw coils of joy. In the center, on lotus, sun, and corpse seats, draw a hooked knife, the deity’s emblem and on the four petals of the lotus, arrange the four ḍākinīs or their emblems. Outside of those, draw either eight-petaled lotuses or a lotus fence and a vajra fence, surrounded by the eight charnel grounds with garlands of fire light. {211} Although that is taught in the old manuals of the Aural Transmission, here, since the custom is to rely only on a sindūra maṇḍala, that also is sufficient.

rgyas bsdus gang mdzad kyang dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su many+dzi sogs khri'i khar bum pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bsang ba dang sbyang ba byas pa'i nang du bum rdzas rgyas pa'am dri dang sman gang 'dzom gyis bkang zhing mgul chings dar dang phyag mtshan sna tshogs dang ldan par bzhag /

Whether you use an extensive or an abbreviated [maṇḍala], in the middle of the maṇḍala, on top of a stand, such as a mañji, place an authentic vase. Cleanse and purify it. It should be filled with the extensive vase substances or whatever scents and medicinal herbs you have, have a ribbon around its neck, and have various emblems.

de'i steng du thod pa mtshan ldan dum bu gcig pa'i nang du myos byed kyi bdud rtsis bkang la sin+d+hU ra dang sbyar ba'i steng du zhing skyes kyi bu mo'i lag nas byung ba'i me long dri ma med pa la/ phyi rol gnas dang nang du mtshan ldan ma las 'bab pa'i sin+d+hU ra gnyis sing ras la btsags te des byugs pa la gser gyi thur ma'am rdo rje rtse lnga pa chos 'byung bsnol ma khug drug la dga' 'khyil yod pa'i phyi rol tu dur khrod me ris bskor ba'i dbus su pad 'dab kyi lte bar nyi zla'i steng du rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i lte bar ba~M gyi mtha' mar oM badzra bai ro tsa ni ye hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/ zhes pas bskor ba bris la bzhag

Above that, set an authentic skull cup of one piece, fill it with intoxicating amṛta and mix in sindūra. Above that, place a stainless mirror that has come from a field-born woman. Smear that with two types of sindūra (one that comes from an external place and one that comes internally from an authentic woman) that have been strained through cheesecloth. Using a golden spoon or a five-pointed vajra, draw crossed sources of dharmas with coils of joy in its six corners. Outside of those, draw the charnel grounds surrounded by volcanoes. In the middle, in the center of a lotus with petals, above a sun and moon, draw a five-pointed vajra. In its center draw a vaṃ and, surrounding that, oṃ vajra vairocaniye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā, saying them as you draw them.

de la dar dmar po'i zhal khebs kyi steng du tsakli'am rdo rje rtse lnga pa rnal 'byor mar dmigs te gzungs thag dang bcas pa bzhag shar du rak+ta dang kun+das byugs pa'i stegs kyi khar ban+d+ha dum gcig lcang lo can gyi nang du brgyud pa'i dam rdzas dang bdud rtsi ril bu btab pa'i nang mchod bzhag gzhan yang dbang rdzas rdo rje rtse lnga pa/ snyan brgyud kyi glegs bam/ nor bu rin po che sogs brda dpang bcu gsum (212) gyi rdzas dang mig dar dang me tog rnams bzhag /

Cover that with a red silk cloth. Above that, place either an icon or a five-pointed vajra, visualized as the Yoginī, along with a dhāraṇī cord. In the east, on a stand smeared with rakta and kunda, place the inner offering: a bandha of one piece with braided hair, inside of which are samaya substances of the lineage and amṛta pills. Also, arrange the abhiṣeka implements, a five-pointed vajra, a text of the Aural Transmission, the implements for the thirteen symbolic abhiṣekas (such as the precious gem), blindfolds, and flowers. {212}
las bum du dri bzang gi chu dang bum rdzas dang bdud rtsi ril bu bag tsam sbyar ba'i chus bkang la nub byang dang gdan gyi khar bzhag mthar mar me la sogs pa'i nyer spyod tshar bdun re bsham/

Fill the activity vase with scented water and water that is a mixture of vase substances and a few amṛta pills. Place it on top of a seat in the northwest. Outside of those, arrange a set of the seven traditional offerings, such as a lamp.

gong du bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro chos skyong gi gtor ma bzhi/ gtsang gtor gcig dang bcas pa nas phud la bshams shing de la sha dang zan gyis bskor bar gsungs pa ltar bya/ 'og tu stobs dang myos byed la sogs pa'i tshogs rdzas la zhal zas kyi rigs sna tshogs pa bzhag / 'bul gtor la rgyas par yul nyer bzhi'i lha grangs dang bstun bdun bshams par gsungs so/ / de ltar na bla ma mnyes pa'i maN+Dal/ yi dam mnyes pa'i mchod pa/ mkha' 'gro mnyes pa'i tshogs 'khor rgya chen/ chos skyong mnyes pa'i gtor ma bsham par gsungs pa ltar bya ba yin no/ /

Above, arrange the four tormas of the guru, yidam, ḍākinīs, and dharma protectors, along with one tsangtor.[2] Arrange the select portion and surround that with meat and food, as is taught. Below, place various kinds of food as the feast substances, such as “strength” and intoxicants. As the offering torma, it is taught that the extensive way is to arrange [tormas] corresponding to the number of deities in the twenty-four sacred regions [with] the seven [offerings].[3] In that way, follow the explanation to arrange maṇḍalas that please the gurus, offerings that please the yidams, vast gaṇacakras that please the ḍākinīs, and tormas that please the dharma protectors.

dkyil 'khor la dar dmar po'i 'grib yol cis kyang bya/ gzhan yang bla bre dang phyi yol sogs byas la dam tshig dang ldan pa ma gtogs phyi nang gi mtshams bsdam/ mdun du byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje dril bu dang Da ma ru sogs bzhag / mdun gyi mthar stegs dang bcas pa'i dkar gtor dang / sgrub pa pa rnams kyi glud gtor gyi changs bu bsdus la sha chang la phug sogs kyis sbags pa bshams pa sogs tshogs chen dang 'dra'o/ /

The maṇḍala should have a red silk curtain of some kind. Also set up a canopy, an outer curtain, and so on. Close the outer and inner boundaries [barring everyone] except those with the samaya. In front, arrange a vajra, ghaṇṭā, ḍamaru, and so forth that have been consecrated. Around the outside of those in front, set a white torma with a plate and changbu for the substitute torma for the practitioners. Place meat, alcohol, turnips, and so forth on a skin as [described] in the great feasts.
gnyis pa 'jug pa
II. The Entering
['di] la gnyis/ slob dpon gyi 'jug pa dang / slob ma'i 'jug pa'o/ /
This has two parts: (1) entering the ācārya and (2) entering the disciples.
dang po
A. Entering the Ācārya
['di] la'ang sngon 'gro dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes thob kyi bya ba'o/
This has three sections: (1) the preliminaries, (2) the main practice, and (3) the activities of subsequent attainment.
dang po ni/
1. The Preliminaries

thun bzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi skabs yin na nangs par mnal sad pa'i dus kyi tshe nam mkha' la rnal 'byor ma bzhis Da ma ru'i sgras bskul te/ mnal sad par mos nas dag pa gsum gyi skur langs pa'am/ sgrub mchod kyi cho ga la 'jug pa lta bu'i tshe na sngon 'gro'i rim pa rnams sgrub pa'i thog mar sgo gsum dag par bya ba ni/ bdag nyid skad cig gis lhag pa'i lha rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sku lus dag pa lnga'i rang bzhin du gsal bar gyur/

In the context of four-session yoga, when you wake up in the morning, you are roused by the sounds of the ḍamarus made by four yoginīs in the sky. Feeling that those wake you up, arise as a body with the three purities. Alternatively, if it is an occasion such as entering the ritual of a sādhanapūjā, begin your practice of the preliminary processes with the purification of your three doors. Instantly, I become the form of my special deity, Jetsun Vajrayoginī. My body clearly becomes of the nature of the five purities.
oM a A i I u U r-i r-I l-i l-I e ai o au aM aH ka kha ga g+ha nga / sogs nas/ ha k+Sha hU~M phaT/
a ā i ī u ū ṛ ṝ ḷ ḹ e ai o au aṃ aḥ / ka kha ga gha ṅa…ha kṣaḥ hūṃ phaṭ

rlung phyi nang brjod du med pa ngag dag pa sngags kyi rang bzhin du gyur/ bdud rtsi ril bu bza' ba'am byin rlabs brgyud pa'i bdud rtsi sbyar ba'i a mr-i ta mtheb srin gyis blangs te lce la bzhag nas/

My inner and outer winds are inexpressible: my speech becomes pure and of the nature of mantra. Eat amṛta pills or, with your thumb and ring finger, take amṛta that is mixed with amṛta consecrated by the lineage and place it on your tongue. {213}
oM badzra b+hA rA hI (213) a haM/
oṃ vajra vhārāhī a haṃ
badzra gnyis med ye shes te/ / b+hA ni rgyu sogs stong pa nyid/ / rA ni spros dang bral ba ste/ / hI ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa/ / a haM bde ba chen mo'o/ /
Vajra signifies nondual wisdom. Vhā means that causes and the rest are empty. Rā stands for the absence of elaborations. Hī means not dwelling anywhere. Ahaṃ is great bliss lady.
bla ma yab yum gyi byang chub sems kyi bdud rtsis rtsa gnas thams cad la khyab pas yid dag pa zag med bde stong gi ye shes su gyur/ zhes brjod cing de rnams kyi don dran par byas la/

The bodhicitta-amṛta of the guru male and female consorts pervades all the places of my channels, purifying my mind, which becomes wisdom, undefiled bliss-emptiness. Reflect on the meaning of all of that.
thog mar nang mchod byin gyis brlab pa ni/
First, the consecration of the inner offering.
bdud rtsi chu gtsang gis bran la/
Sprinkle clean water on the amṛta.
oM khaN+Da ro hi hU~M phaT kyis bsang /
oṃ khaṇḍarohi hūṃ phaṭ Thus, cleanse.
oM swa b+hA wa shud+d+ha sarba d+harmAHswa b+hA wa shud+d+ho‘haM/ zhes pas sbyang /
oṃ svabhāva śuddha sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’ham Thus, purify.
stong pa'i ngang las ya~M las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu yi dbyibs can ba dan dang chang bzung la ya~M gis mtshan pa/
Within emptiness, from yaṃ, appears a wind maṇḍala in the shape of a bow, with banners and grip marked with yaṃs.

de'i steng du ra~M las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum dmar po ra~M gyis mtshan pa/ de'i zur gsum la ka~M ka~M ka~M gsum las mi mgo rlon pa'i sgyed bu gsum gyi steng du AHlas ka pA la dum bu gcig pa dpral ba rang la bstan pa phyi dkar la nang dmar ba yangs shing rgya che ba nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam pa/

Above that, from raṃ, appears a fire maṇḍala, triangular, red, and marked with raṃ. In its three corners, from kaṃ kaṃ kaṃ, come three hearths that are fresh human heads. Above that, from āḥ, is a kapāla. It is of one piece, its forehead facing me, white on the outside, red on the inside, spacious and vast, equaling the extent of space.

de'i nang du pa~M las pad+ma ra kA li las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor A li las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan gyi steng du/ dbus su bi las dri chen/ shar du mu las dri chu/ byang du ma las klad gzhung / nub tu shU las byang sems/ lhor ra las rak+ta/

Within that, from paṃ, is a lotus. On that, from kā li, is a sun maṇḍala and, from ā li, is a moon maṇḍala. Above those seats, in the middle, from vi, is excrement. In the east, from mu, is urine. In the north, from ma, is spinal cord. In the west, from śū, is bodhicitta. In the south, from ra, is rakta.
dbus su na las mi'i sha / shar lho go las rta'i sha / lho nub tu ku las khyi'i sha / nub byang du da las ba glang gi sha / byang shar du ha las glang po che'i sha

In the middle, from na, is human flesh. In the southeast, from go, is horse flesh. In the southwest, from ku, is dog flesh. In the northwest, from da, is cow flesh. In the northeast, from ha, is elephant flesh.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ

thugs ka'i ba~M las 'od zer 'phros/ rlung g.yos/ me sbar/ sha lnga bdud rtsi lnga zhu/ rlangs pa oM lhungs pas rgya mtsho chen por gyur/ AHlhungs pas ye shes kyi bdud rtsir gyur/ hU~M las rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa kha gdengs pa khong sing gi lte ba la hU~M gis mtshan par gyur/

From the vaṃ in my heart, light rays radiate. Wind blows and the fire blazes, causing the five meats and five amṛtas to melt. In the steam, oṃ descends and there is a great ocean. Āḥ descends and there is wisdom amṛta. From hūṃ, there is a blue five-pointed vajra, open at the top, and inside its middle is marked by hūṃ.

de las 'od 'phros pas mkha' spyod/ sa spyod/ sa 'og na spyod pa sogs dang / dus gsum gyi bde bar gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs las ye shes kyi bdud rtsi mkha' 'gro ma ser mo gri gug dang thod khrag can gyi tshul dpag (214)tu med pa spyan drangs par gyur/

Light streams forth from that invoking, from the bodies, speech, and minds of those ruling the sky, those ruling on the earth, those ruling below the earth, and all the sugatas of the three times, wisdom amṛta in the form of innumerable yellow ḍākinīs with hooked knives and skull cups with blood. {214}
hU~M la thim/ rdo rje hU~M dang bcas pa 'od du zhu ba ye shes kyi rang bzhin zag pa med pa'i bdud rtsi kha dog dri ro nus pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur/
They dissolve into the hūṃ. The vajra and hūṃ melt into light and become undefiled amṛta of the nature of wisdom, with excellent color, scent, taste, and potency.
oM AHhU~M/ zhes brjod cing
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
bdud rtsis gtor ma rnams bran zhing / mchod rdzas la'ang bdud rtsi'i chu gtor nas/ oM khaN+Da ro hi dang / swa b+ha was sngar bzhin sbyangs par byas la/
Sprinkle amṛta on the torma. Also sprinkle amṛta water on the offering substances. With oṃ khaṇḍarohi and svabhāva, purify as before.

stong pa'i ngang las a las byung ba'i snod yangs shing rgya che ba rnams kyi nang du hU~M yig gi tshogs dpag tu med pa yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i lha rdzas las grub pa'i rdo rje'i mchod yon/ zhabs bsil/ me tog bdug spos/ mar me/ dri chab/ zhal zas/ rol mo la sogs pa mchod pa'i tshogs ngo bo stong pa la zag med bde ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod rdzas su snang ba dwangs shing thog pa med pa 'phro bas chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam par 'gengs shing 'khor ba'i mu mthar thug gi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i mchod pa'i sprin rgya mtsho 'phro ba'i dam tshig tu gyur/

Within emptiness, from a, spacious and vast containers appear. Within them, innumerable letter hūṃs transform into masses of offerings: vajra offering waters, foot waters, flowers, incense, lamps, scented waters, food, music, and more, all made from divine substances. They are in essence empty and yet they are of the nature of undefiled bliss, appearing as offering substances that are varied in manifestation. Pristine and radiating unobstructedly, they spread evenly throughout the dharmadhātu. They are the samaya of emanating an ocean of offering clouds that continues uninterruptedly for the length of saṃsāra.
so so'i phyag rgya dang bcas pas/
With the specific mudrās, say:
oM badzra Ar+g+haM AHhU~M/ oM badzra pA d+yAM AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra arghaṃ āḥ hūṃ / oṃ vajra pādyaṃ āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du sngags kyi thog mtha' gnyis sbyar la/
In the same way, add the beginning and ending mantras to:
puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ A lo ke gan+d+he/ nai wid+ya/ shab+da AHhU~M/ gi bar brjod pa ni mchod pa byin gyis brlab pa'o/ /
puṣpe / dhūpe / āloke / gandhe / naividya / śabda āḥ hūṃ Thus, the offerings are consecrated.
spro na rdor dril byin rlabs kyang yab bka' ltar bya ba'am/ yang na Da ma ru blangs nas/
If you wish to elaborate, do the consecration of the vajra and ghaṇṭā according to a Yab Ka [sādhana].[*1] Alternatively, take up the ḍamaru and say:

oM badzra d+harmA ra Ni ta/ pra ra Ni ta/ saM pra ra Ni ta/ sarba b+hU ta k+Shetra pra tsa li ni/ pradz+nya pA ra mi tA nA tha sam+b+ha we/ badzra d+harmA hr-i da ya/ san+to Sha Ni hU~M hU~M hU~M ho ho ho AHkhaM swA hA/
oṃ vajradharmā raṇita / praraṇita / saṃpraraṇita / sarvabhūtakṣetrapracalini / prajñapāramitānāthasambhave / vajradharmahṛdaya / sanhoṣaṇi hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ ho ho ho āḥ khaṃ svāhā
zhes Da dril drag tu dkrol la rol mo dang mchod rdzas la byin dbab pa'o/ /
Play the ghaṇṭā forcefully, and consecrate the music and offering substances.

de nas tshogs chen gyi dus ltar dkar gtor byin gyis brlabs nas yul bdag la gtor ma gtong zhing bka' bsgo bya'o/ / glud gtor byin rlabs 'gugs gzhug sogs byas la gung ka ris bsngo zhing nyer spyod kyis mchod cing /

Then, do the consecration of the white torma through throwing out the torma for the regional deities and giving the commands, as done during major feasts. Do the consecration, summoning, entering, and so forth for the substitute torma. Dedicate with gung ka ri and present the traditional offerings.
gang zhig mtshan mo rgyu ba yi/ /

Those who move in the night, [bhūtas and piśāca, rākṣasas eating raw meat, all kinds of sentient beings, those dwelling in trees, branches, and the like, for them, we offer this torma of food, meat, beer, turnips, cooked rice, and fruits. May these delight you. May your ill will be pacified, and from today on, may you arouse a helpful attitude toward us. Those who are adorned with ornaments, practicing the dharma, tamed, acting purely with the vows, and give up punishing beings are bhikṣus, śrāmaṇas, and brahmans. Everyone is afraid of weapons. All protect their own lives. Taking your own body as an example, do not harm others. oṃ Whether you are great or small, take these illnesses that harm our bodies, and, spirits, go back to your own places. We have done whatever we can, making offerings and paying respect. Thus, abide in samaya and fulfill our intentions. Always abide within samaya and cure the illnesses of all sentient beings here. Spirits, go to your own places.]
zhes sogs kyis nag phyogs kyi 'byung po la gtor ma byin la bgegs bskrad drag po bya'o/ ! /
With that, give the torma to the bhūtas on the dark side and forcefully expel obstructors.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi
2. The Main Practice
['di] la gsum ste/ bdag bskyed sgrub pa/ bum (215) sogs sgrub pa/ mdun bskyed sgrub pa'o/ /
This has three parts: (1) the practice of the self visualization, (2) the practice of the vase and so forth, and (3) the practice of the front visualization. {215}
dang po
a. The Practice of the Self Visualization
['di] la gsum/ sbyor ba blon po rig ma gsum las byed/ dngos gzhi rgyal mo chos nyid mi 'gyur ba/ rjes thob 'bangs phrin las mthun sbyor rnams so/ /

This has three sections: (1) the preparation: the ministers, three types of actions;[4] (2) the main practice: the queen, unchanging dharmatā; and (3) the subsequent attainment: the people, conducive activities.
dang po
i. The Preparation: The Ministers, Three Types of Actions
la'ang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa gnyis kyi
This has two divisions: (1) the common and (2) the uncommon.
dang po ni/
A) The Common
srung ba'i 'khor lo dang gnas khang byin gyis brlab pa'i don du thog mar/ sum+b+ha ni sa bgegs bskrad pa'i rjes su/
To consecrate the protection cakra and the building, begin by expelling obstructors with sumbha ni. Then, say:

'og tu AHlas sna tshogs rdo rje sngon po'i lte bar yangs shing rgya che ba de las yi ge hU~M gi rnam pa dpag tu med pa 'phros pas de thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur te/ 'og thams cad sna tshogs rdo rje'i sa gzhi/ steng thams cad rdo rje'i gur dang bla bre/ logs thams cad rdo rje rim pa lnga'i ra ba zlum po dang / rdo rje mda'i ra ba dang rdo rje me ri'i gur khang du gyur/

Below, from āḥ, is a blue viśvavajra. From its spacious and vast center, innumerable forms of the letter hūṃ stream forth and become of a vajra nature. Below, all is a ground of viśvavajras. Above, all is a vajra tent and canopy. On all sides are a circular fence of five layers of vajras, a fence of vajra arrows, and dome of vajra volcanoes.

oM me dI ni badzri b+hA wa badzra b+han+d+ha hU~M hU~M hU~M/ oM badzra b+hin+d+hi ni hU~M khaM hU~M/ oM badzra pra kA ra hU~M ba~M hU~M/ oM badzra pany+dza ra hU~M yaM hU~M/ oM badzra bi tA na hU~M khaM hU~M/ oM badzra sa ra dza la traM saM traM/ oM badzra dz+wa la a na lArka hU~M ra~M hU~M/

oṃ medīni vajrībhava vajrabhandha hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ / oṃ vajrabhindhani hūṃ khaṃ hūṃ / oṃ vajraprakāra hūṃ vaṃ hūṃ / oṃ vajrapañjara hūṃ yaṃ hūṃ / oṃ vajravitāna hūṃ khaṃ hūṃ / oṃ vajrasarajāla traṃ saṃ traṃ / oṃ vajrajvala analārka hūṃ raṃ hūṃ
zhes pas srung 'khor bsgom mo/ /
Meditate on the protection cakra.

sa gzhi thams cad o rgyan rang byung gi dur khrod chen po mi ro dang rta ro khral khrol du 'dug pa/ rtsi shing thams cad mda' dang mdung du 'dug pa/ chu rnams thams cad khrag dang rnag tu 'dug pa/ sgra skad thams cad dud mo'i skad du sgrogs pa/ mtshan bzhin du me 'bar ba/ nyin bzhin du rlung 'tshubs pa/ ri bo thams cad he ru ka pho mo ltar bro khrigs khrigs/ gar khyug khyug tu 'dug pa/

The entire ground is the great self-arising charnel ground of Oḍḍiyāna, with broken bits of human corpses and horse corpses. All the plants and trees are arrows and spears. All water is blood and pus. All sounds reverberate as wailing. During the night, fires blaze, and during the day, winds swirl. All the mountains sway and swirl like male and female herukas.

de'i dbus su dur khrod kyi gzhal yas khang pa/ mi mgo rlon pa la nang gi rtsig pa byas pas nang dmar ba/ skam po la phyi yi rtsig pa byas pas phyi dkar ba/ dur khrod kyi rus pa dum bu la khrog byas pa/ go ro tsa na dang dri chen gyis zhal byas pa/ mi chen po'i keng rus la ka ba dang gdung ma byas pa/ bu tsha chung ngu'i keng rus la gshag grab byas pa/ phyogs bzhi la sgo yod pa/ logs bzhi la rus chen gyi phreng ba'i dra ba dra phyed gser gyi dril chung g.yer khas mdzes pa/

In the middle of that is a charnel ground palace. It is red on the inside since its inner walls are made of fresh human heads, and it is white on the outside since its outer walls are made of dried ones. Pieces of charnel ground bones are the hanging decorations. Gorocana and feces are the plaster. Skeletons of large people are the columns and beams. Skeletons of small children are the shakdrap. [5] There are doors in the four directions. The four sides are beautified with small golden bells and garlands and pendants of great bones.

de'i phyi rol du mda'i ra ba/ de'i phyi rol du dur khrod chen po brgyad/ de'i phyi rol tu 'og rdo rje'i sa (216) gzhi/ phyogs mtshams thams cad rdo rje'i ra ba dang dra ba/ steng rdo rje'i gur dang bla bre/ phyi rol ye shes kyi me dpung bskal pa 'jig dus kyi me ri dmar nag g.yon ngos su 'khyil zhing 'tshubs pa'i gur khang du gyur/

Outside of that is a wall of arrows. Outside of that are the eight great charnel grounds. Outside of that, below is a vajra ground. {216} In all directions are a vajra fence and net. Above is a vajra tent and canopy. Outside is a dome of dark-red volcanoes that destroy an eon, masses of wisdom fire, pulsating and swirling to the left.

gnas khang de nyid kyi steng gi cha la bka' brgyud kyi bla ma rnams dang grub thob pho mo sprin bzhin du gtibs pa/ rgyab tu dkon mchog rgya mtsho'i tshogs rnams dang g.yas g.yon du rgyud sde bzhi yi lha tshogs/ mdun du chos skyong srung ma'i tshogs dang bcas pa rnams dpung nge thibs se byin gyis rlob pa'i tshul du bzhugs par gyur/ skabs 'dir dag pa gsum gyi skur bzhengs pa gzhung gi dgongs don ji lta ba yin yang / rje mar pas mdzad pa'i yab bka'i 'grigs dang bstun nas gong du byas pa yin/

Above that building are the Kagyu gurus and male and female siddhas, gathered like clouds. To its rear is an assembly of an ocean of the jewels, and to its right and left are assemblies of deities of the four classes of tantras. In front are massing legions of dharma protectors and guardians, all present in the manner of blessings. Although at this point arising as a body with the three purities is the intention of the main text, what is done above is in keeping with the arrangement in the Yab Ka composed by the exalted Marpa.

skyabs yul de dag gi drung du/ 'gro drug sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub la mchis kyi bar du skyabs mgon dpung gnyen dam pa bla ma dkon mchog khyed mkhyen snyam pa snying khung rus pa'i gting nas byas te/ bdag gzhan ma gyur nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad bla ma la skyabs su mchi'o/ /

In the presence of those objects of refuge, arouse from the depths of your heart the thought, “You know,” [thinking about] the guru jewel, the genuine defender, the protector and refuge for all six classes of sentient beings until they reach the highest awakening. I and all others—all my mother sentient beings, who equal the extent of space—take refuge in the gurus.

sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o/ / chos la skyabs su mchi'o/ / dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o/ / rje bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro gsum la gsol ba 'debs so/ / sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun gsum la gsol ba 'debs so/ /
We take refuge in the buddhas. We take refuge in the dharma. We take refuge in the saṅgha. We supplicate the exalted gurus, yidams, and ḍākinīs. We supplicate the buddhas, dharma, and saṅgha.

zhes sogs dang / gnas 'og min bde ba chen po'i pho brang na/ / longs sku rdo rje 'chang chen po la gsol ba 'debs/ / rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug tai lo pa la gsol ba 'debs/ / rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug nA ro pa la gsol ba 'debs/ / mar pa lho brag pa la gsol ba 'debs/ / zhes pa nas/

And: We supplicate great Vajradhara, the saṃbhogakāya, in the palace of great bliss in Akaniṣṭha. We supplicate Tilopa, lord of yogins. We supplicate Nāropa, lord of yogins. We supplicate Marpa Lhodrakpa.

bla ma'i rnal 'byor gyi skabs kyi skyabs 'gro sems bskyed dang tshad med bzhi'i 'don bya ji ltar rigs par byas te/ btang snyoms chen po la gnas par gyur cig / nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub la 'god par bya ba'i phyir du bla ma'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bgyi'o/ /
gnyis pa
B) The Uncommon

thun mong ma yin pa blon po rigs gsum las byed dngos la gsum ste/ sgrib sbyong rdo rje sems dpa'i bsgom bzlas dang / (217) byin rlabs bla ma'i rnal 'byor dang / ting nge 'dzin he ru ka'i bdag dbang dang gsum gyi

The uncommon actual [practices] of the ministers, three types of actions, have three parts: (1) the meditation and recitation of Vajrasattva to purify obscurations, (2) the guru yoga for blessings, and (3) the samādhi self-abhiṣeka of the heruka.
dang po ni/
1) The Meditation and Recitation of Vajrasattva

rang nyid tha mal du gnas pa'i spyi bor pa~M las pad+ma dang raM las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bla ma rdo rje sems dpa' bde chen 'khor lo sku mdog gangs ri'i phung po la nyi ma shar ba lta bu zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa/ spyan gsum rab tu dmar zhing g.yo ba/ mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa/ phyag gnyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas yum la 'khyud pa/ yum rdo rje snyems ma sku mdog dmar mo gri gug dang thod khrag 'dzin pa yab la 'khyud pa/

I am in my ordinary form. On my head, from paṃ, is a lotus and, from raṃ, a sun maṇḍala. Above that is the guru Vajrasattva, the mahāsukhacakra, with a color like the sun shining on a massive snow mountain, with one face and two arms. His three eyes are very red and moving. His four fangs are bared. Holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā in his hands, he embraces his consort. His consort Vajragarvā is red. Holding a hooked knife and skull cup of blood, she embraces her consort.

zhabs g.yas brkyang g.yon bskum pa'i gar gyis bzhengs pa/ ral pa'i thor cog dang rus pa'i rgyan drug rin po che sna tshogs kyi phreng ba dang / rdo rje'i phreng ba dang / me tog gi phreng ba du mas brgyan pa 'od dang 'od zer gyi phung po gar dgu'i nyams dang ldan zhing dam tshig gi ye shes dang gnyis su med pa/

He stands in a dancing posture with right leg extended and left leg bent. His hair is in a topknot, and he is adorned by the six bone ornaments, garlands of various jewels, garlands of vajras, and many garlands of flowers. In a mass of light and light rays, he displays the nine moods of the dramatic arts. He is nondual with the wisdom ones of samaya.

de'i 'khor lo lnga la pad+ma dang nyi ma'i gdan gyi steng du/ spyi bor de bzhin gshegs pa rdor rje sems dpa' yab yum sku mdog dkar po/ mgrin par gar gyi dbang phyug yab yum dmar po/ snying gar he ru ka yab yum sngon po/ lte bar rdo rje nyi ma yab yum ser po/ gsang gnas su rdo rje rgyal po yab yum ljang gu ste/ yab yum thams cad kyang rgyan cha lugs gtso bo lta bu mtshan dang dpe byad yongs su rdzogs pa'i skur gyur/

In his five cakras are lotus and sun seats. At the top of his head is the tathāgata Vajrasattva, white male and female consorts. At his throat is Padmanarteśvara, red male and female consorts. At his heart is Heruka, blue male and female consorts. At his navel is Vajrasūrya, yellow male and female consorts. At his secret place is Vajrarāja, green male and female consorts. All the male and female consorts have ornaments and attributes like the principal ones, and their forms are complete with the major and minor marks.

de dag gi dpral bar oM dkar po/ mgrin par AHdmar po/ snying ga so so'i mdog gi pad+ma'i steng na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor/ de dag gi steng na hU~M so so'i mdog can gyi mthar sngags kyi phreng bas bskor bar gyur/

At their foreheads are white oṃs, at their throats are red āḥs, and at their hearts are lotuses of their respective colors, above which are sun maṇḍalas, above which are hūṃs of their respective colors surrounded by mantra garlands.
oM badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṃ vajra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā
de bzhin du/
Similarly:
pA d+yaM/ puSh+pe/ d+hu pe/ A lo ke gan+d+he/ nai wid+ya/ shab+da sogs kyis mchod nas/
…pādyaṃ…puṣpe…dhūpe…āloke…gandhe…naividya…śabda… Thus, offer.
gsol ba gdab pa ni/
The supplication.

bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum gyis bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par mdzad du gsol/ zhes pas lan gsum gsol ba btab nas/ sngags kyi phreng ba g.yon du 'khor ba la dmigs te/

Bhagavān Vajrasattva, male and female consorts, please cleanse and purify the negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains of myself and all limitless sentient beings. Supplicate three times. Visualize that the mantra garland circles counterclockwise and say: {218}

oM (218) badzra he ru ka sa ma ya/ ma nu pA la ya/ badzra he ru ka twe no pa tiSh+Tha/ dri D+ho me b+ha wa/ su to Sh+yo me b+ha wa/ a nu rok+ta me b+ha wa/ su po Sh+yo me b+ha wa/ sarba sid+d+hi m+me pra yats+tsha/ sarba karma su tsa me/ tsit+taM shre yaM ku ru hU~M/ ha ha ha ha hoH b+ha ga wAn badzra he ru ka ma me muny+tsa badzra he ru ko b+ha wa ma hA sa ma ya sa twa AHhU~M/

oṃ vajraheruka samaya / manupālaya / vajraheruka tvenopatiṣṭha / driḍho me bhava / sutoṣyo me bhava / anurakto me bhava / supoṣyo me bhava / sarvasiddhimme prayaccha / sarvakarmasu ca me / cittaṃ śreyaṃ kuru hūṃ / ha ha ha ha hoḥ bhagavān vajraheruka mā me muñca vajraheruko bhava mahāsamayasatva āḥ hūṃ
zhes bgrangs la thugs rgyud bskul bar bsams te sngags bgrang zhing / de'i tshe dmigs pa ni/
Count and contemplate arousing their mindstreams. Count the mantras while visualizing as follows:

bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rigs bsdus kyi lha tshogs rnams kyi sku gsung thugs las ye shes kyi bdud rtsi dkar dmar sngon po dpag tu med pa na ra ra tshangs bug tu bab/ lus phyi nang thams cad khyab/ phyi lus kyi sdig sgrib/ nang sems kyi sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad rkang mthil sor mo'i rgyud du nag nur gyis thon nas/ lus thams cad shel gong dag pa ltar gyur pa'i nang du rdo rje sems dpa' rigs bsdus yab yum thams cad kyi sbyor mtshams nas byang sems dkar dmar na ra ra babs/ spyi bo tshangs bu ga nas zhugs lus gnas rtsa'i dkyil 'khor khyab cing ba spu'i bu ga dang lhug lhug gang bar gyur/ rang nyid rdo rje sems dpa' rigs bsdus kyi rang bzhin gyi bde mchog bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes dang ldan par gyur/

From the bodies, speech, and minds of the assembly of deities of the bhagavān Vajrasattva, the embodiment of all families, an immeasurable stream of white, red, and blue wisdom amṛta falls through my opening of Brahmā. It pervades my body, inside and out. All the negative actions and obscurations of my external body and all the negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains of my internal mind are expelled in a thick black stream from the soles of my feet and toes. My body becomes like a pure crystal sphere. Internally, from the places of union of all the male and female consorts of Vajrasattva, the embodiment of all families, a stream of red and white bodhicitta-amṛta falls. Entering my body through the opening of Brahmā at my head, it pervades the maṇḍalas of channels abiding in my body and fills up to my hair pores, tingling. I become of the nature of Vajrasattva, the embodiment of all families, endowed with the wisdom of unimaginable sublime bliss.
oM shrI badzra he ru ka sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM la sogs pas mchod nas/
oṃ śrīvajraheruka saparivāra arghaṃ… Thus, offer.
gtor ma 'bul bar 'dod na skabs 'di'i thun bar rnams su gtor ma byin gyis brlab/
If you wish to offer a torma, consecrate a torma in keeping with this occasion.
badzra he ru ka i daM ba ling+ta kha kha khA hi khA hi/ zhes lan gsum mam bdun gyis 'bul la/
vajraheruka idaṃ baliṃta kha kha khāhi khāhi Saying that either three or seven times, offer.
bla ma rdo rje ye shes che/ / rdo rje dbyings ni mkha' chen po/ / rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsungs/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gror phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Guru, great vajra wisdom, vajra expanse, great space, you are the threefold vajra, the sublime speech maṇḍala. To Vajraḍāka, I offer homage and praise.
ces pas bstod pa bya ba'am/ dkyus kyi tshe gtor ma mi 'bul na/ Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod pa'i rjes su/
Thus praise. Alternatively, during normal occasions, if you are not offering a torma, offer with arghaṃ and the rest. After that, say:

bla ma dam pa/ bdag ni mi shes rmongs gyur pas/ / dam tshig las ni 'gal zhing nyams/ / bla ma mgon pos skyabs mdzod cig / gtso bo rdo rje 'dzin pa ste/ / thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid can/ / 'gro ba'i gtso la bdag skyabs mchi/ /

Genuine guru, through ignorance and delusion, I have transgressed and broken my samaya. Guru Protector, please grant me refuge. Vajradhara, principal one, embodiment of compassion, I take refuge in you, leader of beings.

bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro gsum gyi sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las lnga'i dam (219) tshig nyams pa thams cad mthol lo bshags so/ / sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par mdzad du gsol/

I acknowledge and confess all broken samaya related to the bodies, speech, minds, excellent qualities, and activities of the gurus, yidams, and ḍākinīs. {219} Please cleanse and purify all my negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum 'od du zhu nas rang la thim/
Vajrasattva, male and female consorts, melt into light and dissolve into me.
gnyis pa bla ma'i rnal 'byor ni/
2) Guru Yoga

skad cig gis rang nyid lhag pa'i lha rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i nga rgyal brtan par gyur pa'i mdun gyi nam mkha' la me ri 'od phung gi dbus na rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma lha lnga'i dkyil 'khor rten brten pa dang bcas pa bzhugs pa'i 'dom gang tsam gyi steng gi bar snang la pa~M las sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa yangs shing rgya che ba/ de'i dbus su A li kA li zla nyi sbyor ba'i steng du drin chen rtsa ba'i bla ma rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug tai lo pa chen po ngo bo bla ma rnam pa 'khor lo bde mchog / sku mdog ut+pal ltar dwangs pa/ zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje dang thod pa 'dzin pas yum la 'khyud pa/ rus pa dang rin po che zla phyed rdo rje nor bu dang bcas pa gar gyi nyams dgu/ mtshan dang dpe byad yongs su rdzogs pa'i sku/ thugs rje tshad med pa'i spyan rtsa dmar kyi le gzigs pa

Instantly, I stabilize the pride of Vajrayoginī, my special deity. In the space in front, in the middle of a mass of volcano light, sits the five-deity maṇḍala of Jetsun Vajrayoginī, support and supported. In the space about one fathom above that, from paṃ, is a multicolored eight-petaled lotus, spacious and vast. In its center, above ā li kā li, sun and moon united, is my kind root guru, in essence the great Tilopa, lord of yogins, in manifestation the guru Cakrasaṃvara. His color glows like an utpala.
