He has one face and two arms. Holding a vajra and skull cup, he embraces his consort. He has the bones, jewels, half moon, vajra, gem, and displays the nine moods of the dramatic arts. His form is complete with the major and minor marks. His bloodshot eyes of immeasurable compassion look all around.

de'i thugs ka nas hU~M brgyad 'phros pa las/ de rnams phyi rol gyi pad 'dab brgyad la zla ba'i steng du shar du in+d+ra b+hU ti mi sha kha/ byang du ku ku ri ba du ba'i mdog can/ nub tu pad+ma badzra pad+ma rA ga'i mdog lhor klu sgrub snying po gser btso ma'i mdog / shar lhor Dom+b+hi he ru ka dmar smug / lho nub tu rdo rje dril bu pa gser btso ma'i mdog can/ nub byang du lU ha pa mthing mdog / byang shar du sa ra ha pa thal ba'i mdog can te/ grub chen brgyad sku mdog so so la rdo rje thod pa yum dang bcas pa ral pa'i thor cog dang / spyan rtsa rab tu dmar zhing g.yas brkyang g.yon bskum du bzhengs pa'o/ /

From his heart, eight hūṃs stream forth. They become, on top of external eight-petaled lotuses with moons, in the east Indrabhūti, human-flesh color; in the north Kukurīpa, the color of smoke; in the west Padmavajra, the color of padmarāga; in the south Nāgagarbha, the color of molten gold; in the southeast Ḍombi Heruka, dark red; in the southwest Vajraghaṇṭapa, the color of molten gold; in the northwest Lūhipa, deep blue; and in the northeast Saraha, the color of ashes. Each of the eight mahāsiddhas has their respective color, a vajra and skull cup, a consort, a topknot of hair, very bloodshot eyes, and stands with their right legs extended and left ones bent.

bla ma he ru ka'i thugs kar sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar nyi ma'i steng du dpal tai lo pa chen po yab yum sku mdog mthing nag yab kyis rdo rje thod pa dang yum gyis gri gug thod khrag 'dzin pa/ ral pa'i thor cog rgyan thams cad dang ldan zhing / g.yas bskum g.yon (220) brkyang bde ba chen po'i nyams kyis yongs su gang ba'i spyan rtsa rab tu dmar zhing g.yo ba/

In the heart of the guru Heruka, in the middle of a multicolored eight-petaled lotus, on a sun, is the great, glorious Tilopa, male and female consorts, dark blue in color. The male consort holds a vajra and skull cup, and the female consort holds a hooked knife and skull cup with blood. They have topknots of hair and all the ornaments. {220} With [his] right leg bent and left stretched out, they are filled with the experience of great bliss. Their eyes are very bloodshot and moving.

de'i yang pad+ma 'dab brgyad la grub chen brgyad so so'i sku mdog ltar gsal ba/ de rnams kyi spyi gtsug nas brgyud pa'i bla ma rnams rim bzhin rdo rje 'chang gi bar thams cad gar thabs su bzhengs shing yab yum gnyis su med pa/ zhal nas A ra li dang pheM gyis sgra sgrogs pa/ 'od dang 'od zer gyi phung po mkha' 'gro ma bye bas bskor pa de thams cad kyi spyi bor oM/ mgrin par AH thugs kar hU~M/ thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od zer 'phros pas bsgoms pa dang 'dra ba'i ye shes sems dpa' spyan drangs/

Again, on the eight petals of the lotus, the eight mahāsiddhas appear clearly according to their respective colors. Above their heads are the lineage gurus up through Vajradhara. All are standing in a dancing posture and are nondual male and female consorts. From their mouths come the sounds of ārali and pheṃ. In the midst of masses of light and light rays, they are surrounded by millions of ḍākinīs. At their heads are oṃs, at their throats are āḥs, and at their hearts are hūṃs. From the hūṃs in their hearts, light rays radiate, inviting wisdom ones similar to the meditated ones.
ma hA gu ru de wa DA ki ni d+harmA pA la kA ya wAk+tsit+tas pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dza dzaH dza hU~M ba~M hoH/
mahāguru deva ḍākini dharmāpāla kāya vākcitta saparivāra vajra samāja jaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang gnyis su med par gyur/
They become nondual with the samaya maṇḍala.
ma hA gu ru de wa DA ki ni d+harmA pA la kA ya wAk+tsit+tas pa ri wA ra badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
mahāguru deva ḍākini dharmāpāla kāya vākcitta saparivāra vajra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā
de bzhin du/
Similarly:
puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ A lo ke gan+d+he/ nai wi d+ya/ shab+da sarba pany+tsa a mr-i ta badzra ma taM gi/
…puṣpe…dhūpe…āloke…gandhe…naividya…śabda sarva pañca amṛta vajra mataṃgi…
zhes phyi nang gsang gsum gyis mchod la/
Thus, present the outer, inner, and secret offerings.
na mo sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa'i sku/ sogs
Namo Embodiment of all buddhas, [essence of Vajradhara, root of the three jewels, to the gurus, I pay homage.]
dang / bla ma'i sku ni rdo rje'i sku sogs

And: The body of the guru is a vajra body— [beautiful, one we never tire of seeing, and endowed with unimaginable virtues. To the body of the guru, I pay homage. The speech of the guru is the melodies of Brahmā— endowed with the lion’s sounds of nonself, terrifying to the tīrthika deer. To the speech of the guru, I pay homage. The mind of the guru is like space, abiding in threefold liberation within bliss, clarity, nonconceptuality, and emptiness. To the mind of the guru, I pay homage.]
sh+lo ka gsum dang / ston pa bla med sangs rgyas rin po che/ sogs

Those three ślokas, and: To the unsurpassable Teacher, the precious Buddha, [to the unsurpassable refuge, the precious genuine dharma, to the unsurpassable guides, the precious saṅgha, to the unsurpassable three jewels, I pay homage.]
dang / bya spyod rnal 'byor sogs
And: In kriyā, caryā, yoga, [the four classes of tantras, taught by the Teacher, are the outer, inner, and secret yidams to whom I pay homage.]
dang / ston pa'i bstan pa sogs
And: In the presence of the Teacher, [you promised to protect just as commanded the precious teachings of the Teacher. To the dharma protectors, I pay homage and praise.]
dang / phyag byar 'os pa sogs kyis bstod/
And: To those worthy of worship, [I bow with as many bodies as there are particles in the realms, and give praise with supreme faith.] Thus, praise.
phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod cing bshags pa sogs brjod/
Through paying homage, offering, confessing, [rejoicing, requesting, and supplication, whatever bit of merit is collected, I dedicate it all to awakening.]
maN+Dal rgyas pa 'bul ba'am bsdu na/ sa gzhi spos chus byugs shing sogs

Offer an extensive maṇḍala, or an abbreviated one: The earth is perfumed with scented water [and strewn with flowers, adorned with Mount Meru, the four continents, the sun and the moon. Imagining this as the buddha realm, I offer it so that all beings may enjoy that pure realm.]
dang / mnyes byed maN+Dal sogs kyis 'bul/

And: This excellent, pleasing maṇḍala [is offered: may obstacles not arise on the path to awakening, the intentions of the sugatas of the three times be realized, existence not disturbed, peace not be dwelled in, and may beings, who equal space, be free.] Thus, offer.
mgon po sangs rgyas rnams dang ni/ / sras bcas bdag la dgongs su gsol/ ces pa nas/ bdag 'jug gi skabs ltar 'don rgyu btsud/ lags so/ /
Protector buddhas and your children, please consider me.[*3] Continue, inserting the liturgy according to the self-entering. Thus it is.
chos kyi rje dpal ldan bla ma dam pa 'khor dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
Dharma lords, glorious, genuine gurus with your retinues of heroes and yoginīs, and all buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions and three times, please consider me.
bdag cag rnams kyi sngon tshe rabs …

bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas tshe 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas tha ma da lta la thug gi bar du nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas sdig pa mi dge ba bcu bgyis pa dang /

[I, called by this name (insert your name)—since beginningless time in saṃsāra until now, under the influence of my mental afflictions of desire, aggression, and bewilderment and by means of my body, speech, and mind—have committed the ten negative, unvirtuous actions;

mtshams ma mchis pa lnga bgyis pa dang / de dang nye ba lnga bgyis pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang 'gal ba bgyis pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang 'gal ba bgyis pa dang / gsang sngags kyi dam tshig dang 'gal ba bgyis pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa bgyis pa dang /

I have committed the five acts of immediate consequence; I have committed the five secondary acts; I have transgressed my prātimokṣa vows; I have transgressed the bodhisattva trainings; I have transgressed my Secret Mantra samayas; I have harmed the three jewels;

dam pa'i chos spangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la skur ba btab pa dang / pha dang ma la ma gus pa bgyis pa dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon la ma gus pa bgyis pa dang / grogs tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la ma gus pa bgyis pa la sogs

I have abandoned the dharma; I have disparaged the noble saṅgha; I have been disrespectful to my parents; I have been disrespectful to my upādhyāyas and ācāryas; and I have been disrespectful to my companions observing pure conduct.

mdor na mtho ris dang thar pa'i gegs su gyur cing / 'khor ba dang ngan song gi rgyur gyur pa nyes pa dang / ltung ba'i tshogs ci mchis pa de dag thams cad bla ma rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po la sogs pa phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyi spyan sngar mthol lo bshags so/

In brief, in the presence of the guru, great Vajradhara, and all buddhas and bodhisattvas abiding in the ten directions, I acknowledge and confess whatever wrongdoings and downfalls I have amassed, which are hindrances for the higher states and liberation and are causes for saṃsāra and negative states.
mi 'chab bo/_mi sbed do/ de ltar mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyis/ ma mthol ma bshags na de ltar mi 'gyur ba lags so/_/
I do not hide or conceal anything. If I acknowledge and confess in this way, I dwell in a state of ease and comfort. If I do not acknowledge and confess, that will not occur.][6]
…zhes pa bshags pa rgyas pa dang /
Thus, make an extensive confession.
thams cad mkhyen gzigs lha rnams dgongs su gsol/ ces pa nas/ byang zhing dag par mdzad du (221) gsol/

All-knowing, all-seeing deities, please consider me. [From beginningless time, with body, speech, and mind under the influence of the three poisons, I have transgressed the three vows, the Victor’s precepts. I acknowledge and confess flaws, downfalls, and negative actions. I will not do them again. May I not experience [their results]. May all my broken and impaired samayas, root and branch, related to body, speech, and mind, as well as the delusive appearances of the six kinds of beings, the seeds of latent tendencies, the tears in the three vows, and the mass of flaws, downfalls, and stains be instantly] cleansed and purified. {221}
na mo gu ru de wa DA ki n+yi/
namo guru deva ḍākinyi
rdo rje 'chang chen dbang phyug tai lo pa/ / zhes sogs gsol 'debs rgyang 'bod kyi gdung dbyangs dang bcas pa byas pa'i rjes su byin rlabs kyi dbang bzhi len pa'i don du gsol ba gdab pa ni/
Great Vajradhara, lord Tilopa,…[*4] Do the supplication with the longing melody of calling from afar. After that, do the following supplication in order to receive the four abhiṣekas of blessings.
oM AHhU~M
oṃ āḥ hūṃ

dpal ldan bla ma dam pa 'khor dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs rnams kyis bdag gzhan sems can thams cad kyi lus ngag yid gsum byin gyis rlob par mdzad du gsol/ smin par mdzad du gsol/ grol bar mdzad du gsol/ grol ba mthar phyin par mdzad du gsol/

Glorious, genuine gurus with your retinues of heroes and ḍākinīs, please bless my body, speech, and mind and those of others, all sentient beings. Please mature us. Please liberate us. Please bring us to final liberation.
gsum pa ting nge 'dzin he ru ka'i bdag dbang ni/
3) The Samādhi Self-Abhiṣeka of the Heruka

'di nas bzung ste dmigs pa gsal pos yid 'don bya/ zhes gsol ba btab pas bla ma bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo de nyid kyis rlung tshur rngub pa lta bur mdzad par brten nas/ rang nyid bla ma de nyid kyi zhal du zhugs/ thugs kar tai lo pa'i zhal du zhugs/ byang chub kyi sems dang bcas pas de'i gsang ba nor bu nas yum gyi mkhar babs/ yum gyi spyi bor thug tsam du byas pa dang / yang mar drang yab yum gyi sbyor mtshams thig le gcig tu gyur nas babs/ rnal 'byor pa brgyad kyi sbyor mtshams nas byang chub kyi sems thig le re re babs pa dang tshur 'dus gcig tu gyur nas mdun du pad zla nyi ma'i gdan la 'jigs byed chung ma dang bcas pa'i steng du rang nyid bde mchog yab yum gar gyi nyams dgu dang mtshan dang dpe byad dang ldan par gyur par bsgom pa de ni bum pa'i dbang ngo / /

Starting here, with a clear visualization, recite mentally. Having supplicated, the guru, the mahāsukhacakra, seems to draw in his breath, and I enter his mouth and then enter the mouth of Tilopa in his heart. With bodhicitta, I descend from the gem of his secret to the space of his consort. Simply reaching the top of the head of the female consort, again, I am drawn below, become one bindu at the place of union of the male and female consorts, and descend. A bindu of bodhicitta descends from each of the points of union of the eight yogins. These gather and become one. In front, on lotus, moon, and sun seats, above Bhairava and his wife, I am Saṃvara, male and female consorts, with the nine moods of the dramatic arts and the major and minor marks. Thus, meditate. That is the vase abhiṣeka.

yang rang nyid de ltar gnas pa'i thugs ka nas mchod pa'i lha mo spros te mchod par gyur/ nyer spyod lha mo bcu drug sngags 'bul dang / sarba pany+tsa a mr-i ta dang / badzra ma taM gi sa mchod do/ / de ltar yid kyi mchod pa phul/ 'od zer yar 'phros/ lha tshogs thams cad kyi thugs rgyud bskul/ thams cad kyang yab yum gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po yongs su rgyas pa'i byang sems dkar dmar sbyor mtshams su babs pas rang gi lce la zhugs/ des lus rtsa'i pho brang thams cad khyab/ ngag gi nyes pa dag ste gsung gi dkyil 'khor brjod du med pa A li kA li'i (222) rang bzhin mngon du gyur/ gsang dbang thob/

From my heart, as I abide in that way, offering goddesses emanate and make offerings. Present the traditional offerings and the sixteen goddesses [with] mantras. Offer with sarva pañca amṛta and vajra mataṃgi. In that way, present imagined offerings. Light rays radiate upward, invoking the mindstreams of all the assembled deities. The white and red bodhicittas of the expanding great bliss of the nondual male and female consorts descend from their place of union and come to my tongue, then pervading all the palaces of the channels in my body. The wrongdoings of my speech are purified, and the inexpressible speech maṇḍala manifests as the nature of ā li kā li. {222} I have received the secret abhiṣeka.

yang gong ltar yid kyi mchod pa 'bul ba'i/ 'od zer gyis lha tshogs thams cad bskul te/ yum las yum gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phros nas/ rang gi lus la thim/ yum bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du byas/ bsrub pa dang bsrub pa'i sbyor ba las/ spyi bo'i haM las byang sems babs/ rtsa yi gnas bzhir dga' ba bzhi rgyud la skyes te gyen du ldog pa ni/ hU~M ha/ ke ha/ ke hig / ces brjod pas gsang ba nas lte bar dga' ba/ snying gar mchog dga'/ mgrin par dga' bral/ spyi bor haM la bstim/ bde stong gi ye shes lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rgyud la skyes par bsam/

Again, as above, present imagined offerings. Light rays invoke all the assembled deities. From the female consorts, innumerable female consorts stream forth and dissolve into my body, making me of the nature of great bliss, the female consort. From the union of churning and churning, bodhicitta descends from the haṃ at the top of my head, giving rise to the four joys in my mindstream in the four channel locations. These are reversed upward. Saying mi, hūṃ ha, ke ha, ke hik, from my secret place to my navel is joy, at my heart is supreme joy, and at my throat is without-joy. Dissolving into the haṃ at the top of my head, connate joy, the wisdom of bliss-emptiness, arises in my mindstream.
shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob yang yid kyi mchod pa dang / 'od zer gyis bskul bas/ lha tshogs thams cad kyis mgrin gcig tu/ /
I have received the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka. Again, I make imagined offerings. Invoked by rays of light, all the assembled deities say in unison:
sna tshogs chos rnams bde ba che/ / bde mchog 'khor lo bde ba'i mchog / bla ma bla ma phyag rgya che/ /
The myriad phenomena are great bliss, Cakrasaṃvara, the sublime bliss, the guru, guru mahāmudrā.

zhes gsungs nas rnal 'byor pa brgyad gtso bo la thim/ gtso bo rang la thim/ rang nyid 'od gsal mtha' dbus med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes chos kyi sku can du gyur pa'i ngang la yun ring du mnyam par bzhag go /

Then, the eight yogins dissolve into the principal one. The principal one dissolves into me. I become the dharmakāya: luminosity with no edge or center, inconceivable wisdom. Rest evenly in that state for a long time.
des tshig dbang rin po che thob/ tshogs zhing gi lha tshogs rnams kyang rang nyid la thim pas rang gi lus ngag yid gsum dang tshogs zhing gi lha tshogs thams cad dbyer med du gyur/

Thus, I have received the precious word abhiṣeka. The assembled deities of the field of accumulation dissolve into me, and my body, speech, and mind and the deities of the field of accumulation become inseparable.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi rgyal mo chos nyid mi 'gyur pa dngos ni/
ii. The Main Practice: The Queen, the Actual Unchanging Dharmatā[*5]
{yid kyi dmigs pa gsal ba'i ngang nas bde mchog phyi sgrub dang snyan brgyud man ngag 'don pa'i dus ltar ngag bcad la sgra bcas su mi 'don zhing rang gis tshor ba tsam du 'don pa yin no/ /mchan/}

[*8] Interlinear note: Within a state of a clear mental visualization, keep silence and do not recite with sound—recite just so that you can sense it—as is done when reciting the outer practice of Cakrasaṃvara and the Aural Transmission esoteric instructions.

rang nyid phyi snod nang bcud chos 'byung lha dang bcas pa ltem gyis 'od du zhu ba'i stong pa'i rang las rang nyid byang chub kyi sems pad+ma rA ga li khri ltar dmar ba/ nyi ma bye ba'i 'od zer las rab tu rnam par gsal ba/ ngo bo mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa/ mtshan nyid tshad dang gzhal du ma mchis pa'i bde ba chen po nyid do/ /

I, the external environment, the internal inhabitants, the sources of dharmas, and the deities fully melt into light. Within emptiness, I am bodhicitta, red, like padmarāga and vermillion: in manifestation, more brilliant than the light rays of a million suns; in essence, emptiness, free from all extremes; in terms of characteristics, great bliss, which is limitless and immeasurable.

zhes gsal btab la de'i ngang la yun ring du mnyam par bzhag / de nas sems 'phro bar gyur na/ de'i (223) ngang las zung 'jug gi skur bzhengs pa ni/ rang bzhin gyi gnas nas rdo rje rnal 'byor ma bzhis rdo rje'i glus bskul bar mos te/

Thus, rest evenly in that clear state for a long time. {223} Then, when your mind scatters, arise from that state as the body of unification. From the natural places, four Vajrayoginīs invoke with vajra song. Thus, contemplate.[*6]
{ zhes pa'i sgra thos ma thag }
[*9] Interlinear note: As soon as that sound is heard [say the following].
hU~M/ bzhengs shig bzhengs shig dgyes ma hoH/ /
hūṃ Arise, arise, lady of delight—hoḥ.
bde ba chen po rdo rje ni/ / bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid las/ / 'di nyid du ni bzhengs su gsol/ /
oM shrI badzra ma hA yo gi nI ka ya wAk+tsit+ta swa b+hA wa At+ma ko‘haM/
oṃ śrīvajra mahāyoginī kaya vākcitta svabhāva ātmako ’ham

zhes 'khor lo drug dbyer mi phyed pa'i dpal rdo rje/ rnal 'byor ma lha lnga lus kyi dkyil 'khor chos 'byung bsnol ma'i gzhal yas khang rdo rje me ri dang bcas pa gcig char du skad cig gis bzhengs pa rim gyis gsal gdab pa ni/

Instantly, the body maṇḍala of the five deities of glorious Vajrayoginī—who is inseparable from the six cakras—with the palace of crossed sources of dharma and the vajra volcanoes arise simultaneously. Sequentially clarify that.

hrIHlas chos 'byung bsnol ma'i khug drug las dga' ba 'khyil pa drug pa yangs shing rgya che ba de'i dbus su pa~M las sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa/ de'i lte bar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od zer bye ba phrag bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa/ de'i steng du pa~M yongs su gyur pa las rang nyid bcom ldan 'das gsang ba ye shes lhan cig skyes ma sku mdog bskal ba'i me ltar rab tu dmar zhing gsal ba/ zhal gcig pa/ phyag gnyis pa/ spyan gsum rab tu dmar zhing khrol khrol gyi gzigs pa g.yo ba/ zhal mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas pas gser gyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsnams nas sdigs mdzub dang bcas pas 'debs pa'i tshul du thur du brkyangs pa/ g.yon pas bdud bzhi'i khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa thugs kar bsnams pa/ kha T+wAM ga la 'khyud pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyangs pas 'jigs byed nag po gan rkyal bsgyel ba'i brang bar du mnan pa/ g.yon bskums nas dus mtshan ma dmar mo mgo bo sum ltabs su mnan pa/

From hrīḥ appears crossed sources of dharma with six coils of joy in their six corners, spacious and vast. In the middle, from paṃ, is a multicolored eight-petaled lotus. In its center is a sun maṇḍala, with unimaginable millions of light rays. Above that, vaṃ transforms, and I am the Bhagavatī, the Secret Wisdom Sahajā, clear and very red, like the eon-ending fires. I have one face, two arms, and two bright-red eyes, moving and glaring. My four fangs are bared. My right hand, holding a gold five-pointed vajra in the threatening gesture, is stretched down in the manner of striking. My left hand holds a skull cup filled with the blood of the four māras to my heart. I embrace a khaṭvāṃga. My outstretched right leg presses down on the chest of black Bhairava lying on his back. My bent left leg tramples on the bent head of red Kālarātri.

dbu skra sil ma sku rgyab tu grol ba/ thod pa skam po lngas dbu la brgyan pa/ ba su ta la brgyus pa'i thod rlon lnga bcus do shal byas pa/ phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs dang me tog gi phreng bas rab tu brgyan pa/ bde ba chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nyams kyis yongs su gang bas ba spu nu ma langs shing b+ha ga rab tu rgyas shing pad+ma rA ga mngon bzhin pa/ cung zad sgeg (224)pa'i gar gyis gzhon sha rab tu rgyas pa/ nyi ma bye ba 'bum gyi 'od zer las ches rab tu 'phro ba/ zhal nas A ra li pheM zhes bzhad pa'i gad rgyangs phyogs kun tu sgrogs pa'i nga rgyal gyis/ sprul pa yang sprul gyi mkha' 'gro ma nam mkha'i mtha' steng 'og phyogs mtshams kun tu 'gengs shing bzhad pa'i gad mo cher sgrogs pas 'jig rten thams cad 'dar zhing ches g.yo bar mdzad cing zil gyis gnon pa/

My hair is loose, flowing down my back. Five dried skulls adorn my head. I have a necklace with fifty fresh skulls strung on basuta. I am adorned with the five mudrās, various jewels, and garlands of flowers. Filled with unimaginable experiences of great bliss, my body hairs and breasts stand up and my bhaga is full, like padmarāga. {224} With a slightly erotic dance, my youthful body glows. I radiate even more than the light rays of millions of suns. I have the pride that expresses itself as a roaring laughter of ārali pheṃ that can be heard in all directions. My emanated and re-emanated ḍākinīs completely fill the reaches of space, from above and below, in all directions. Their great laughter spreads throughout the world and shakes it. We dazzle.
de'i shar gyi pad 'dab kyi steng du nyi ma la mA~M las mkha' 'gro ma sngon mo/ / byang du tA~M las lA ma ljang gu/ nub tu pA~M las khaN+Da ro hi dmar mo/ lhor mA~M las gzugs can ma ser mo/ /
On the lotus petal in the east, on a sun, from māṃ, is blue Ḍākinī. In the north, from tāṃ, is green Lāma. In the west, from paṃ, is red Khaṇḍarohi. In the south, from māṃ, is yellow Rūpiṇī.

thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis spyan gsum pa mche ba bzhi rab tu gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas pa rnams kyis rdo rje dang g.yon pa rnams kyis thod khrag bsnams shing kha T+wAM ga la 'khyud pa/ bcu drug lon pa ltar bcud kyis rgyas shing bde ba chen pos rab tu rgyas shing mngon par chags pa'i spyan zur gyis gzigs pa can/ thams cad kyang ye shes kyi me ri rab tu 'bar ba'i dkyil tu 'gying ba'i tshul gyis bzhengs pa/

All have one face, two arms, three eyes, and four very bared fangs. Their right hands hold vajras, their left hold skull cups with blood, and their left arms embrace khaṭvāṃgas. They are full of vitality and great bliss, like sixteen-year-olds. They glance from the corners of their eyes with obvious passion. They stand poised in the middle of raging volcanoes of wisdom.

'og tu sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba yangs shing rgya che ba'i sa gzhi'i steng du rdo rje rim pa lnga'i gur dang bla bre/ de'i phyi rol tu ye shes lnga'i me ri me dpung sna tshogs pa rab tu dmar zhing g.yon ngos su 'khril zhing 'tshubs par gyur par bsgom/

Below, on the ground, in the middle of a spacious and vast viśvavajra, is a tent of five layers of vajras and a canopy. Outside of that are volcanoes of the five wisdoms—raging red fires, pulsating and swirling to the left. Thus, meditate.
de ni phyi dkyil lha lnga'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa yin la/
That is the meditation on the outer maṇḍala, the maṇḍala of the five deities.
bdag bskyed kyi lus dkyil lha so bdun po yongs rdzogs bsgom pa ni/
The meditation on the complete thirty-seven deities of the body maṇḍala, which is the self visualization.

de ltar bsgoms pa'i snying gar bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor ma pad ma nyi ma'i gdan la bzhengs pa/ ba~M dang ma~M~M ta~M ba~M~M ta~M las gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams dang sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo spyi bor pul+li rA ma la ya nas/ pus mo gnyis ku lu tA yan chad kyi gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rtsa mdud rnams su/ puM dzAM auM aM/ goM reM deM maM/ kAM oM triM koM/ kaM laM kaM hiM/ preM graM sauM suM/ nAM siM maM kuM/ sa bon de dag yongs su gyur pa las/ chos 'byung bsnol ma'i gzhal yas khang gi nang du pad nyi ro yi gdan la gnas pa'i rlung sems kyi ngo bo ba~M (225) rnams yongs su gyur pa las rnal 'byor ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi gsal gdab pa ni/

Meditating in that way, in my heart is the Yoginī of the mahāsukhacakra standing on lotus and sun seats. Vaṃ and māṃ taṃ vaṃ taṃ transform into the yoginīs. For the maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind, in the channel knots of the twenty-four sacred places—from Pullīramalaya at the head down to Kulutā at both knees—are the seed syllables puṃ jāṃ auṃ aṃ, goṃ reṃ deṃ maṃ, kāṃ oṃ triṃ koṃ, kaṃ laṃ kaṃ hiṃ, preṃ gṛṃ sauṃ suṃ, and nāṃ siṃ maṃ kuṃ. They transform into palaces of crossed sources of dharma, inside of which are lotus, sun, and corpse seats. {225} On those are vaṃs, the essence of wind-mind, which transform into the clear appearances of the twenty-four yoginīs.

spyi ba pUl+li ra ma la yar rnal 'byor ma rab tu gtum mo/ spyi gtsug dzA lan+d+har rnal 'byor ma gtum pa'i mig can ma/ ma dper yi ge ma gsal/ ltag pa Arbu tAr rnal 'byor ma sna chen ma/ rna ba g.yon pa go da wa rir rnal 'byor ma blo gros ma/ smin dbus ra mai shwa rar rnal 'byor ma mi'u thung ma/ mig gnyis de wi ko Tir rnal 'byor ma lang ka'i dbang phyug ma/ phrag pa gnyis ma la wa ra rnal 'byor ma shing grib ma'o/ /

At my head, Pullīramalaya, is the yoginī Pracaṇḍā. At the crown of my head, Jālandhara, is the yoginī Caṇḍākṣī. In my right ear, Oḍḍiyāna, is the yoginī Prabhāvatī. At the nape of my neck, Arbuda, is the yoginī Mahānāsā. In my left ear, Godāvarī, is the yoginī Vīramatī. In the middle of my eyebrows, Rāmeśvarī, is the yoginī Kharvarī. In both my eyes, Devīkoṭa, is the yoginī Laṅkeśvarī. In both my shoulders, Mālava, is the yoginī Drumacchāyā.

de dag ni nye ba'i gnas te thugs kyi rnal 'byor ma sku mdog nag mo mkha' la spyod pa brgyad 'khor mkha' 'gro ma bye ba bye bas yongs su bskor ba/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs kyi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo'o/ /

Those are the nearby abodes. The black yoginīs of mind, the eight who rule space, are surrounded by their retinue of millions of ḍākinīs. They are of the essence of the inconceivable secret of the minds of the buddhas of the three times.

mchan khung gnyis kA ma ru par rnal 'byor ma sa srung ma/ nu ma gnyis o trer rnal 'byor ma 'jigs byed chen mo/ zhing ngo / lte ba tri sha ku ner rnal 'byor ma rlung gi shugs can ma/ sna rtse ko sa lar rnal 'byor ma chang 'thung ma/ nye ba'i zhing / kha ka ling+kar rnal 'byor ma sngo sangs lha mo/ /

In both my armpits, Kāmarūpa, is the yoginī Airāvatī. In both my breasts, Oḍra, is the yoginī Mahābhairavā. Those are the fields. At my navel, Triśakuni, is the yoginī Vāyuvegā. At the tip of my nose, Kośala, is the yoginī Surābhakṣī. Those are the nearby fields. At my mouth, Kaliṅga, is the yoginī Śyāmādevī.

mgrin pa laM ba kar rnal 'byor ma shin tu bzang mo/ tshan+d+ho ha/ snying kany+tsir rnal 'byor ma rta rna ma/ lgad pa hi ma la yar rnal 'byor ma bya gdong ma ste de dag ni nye ba'i tshan+d+ho ha ste gsung gi rnal 'byor ma sku mdog dmar mo sa la spyod ma brgyad 'khor mkha' 'gro ma bye ba bye bas yongs su bskor ba/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung gi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo'o/

At my throat, Lampāka, is the yoginī Subhadrā. Those are the chandohas. At my heart, Kāñchi, is the yoginī Hayakarṇī. At my bladder, Himālaya, is the yoginī Khagānanā. Those are the nearby chandohas. The red yoginīs of speech, the eight who rule the earth, are surrounded by their retinue of millions of ḍākinīs. They are of the essence of the inconceivable secret of the speech of the buddhas of the three times.

mtshan ma pre ta pu rir rnal 'byor ma 'khor lo'i shugs can ma/ bshang la gr-i ha de war rnal 'byor ma dum skyes ma/ 'du ba/ brla gnyis sau raSh+Tar rnal 'byor ma chang tshong ma/ byin pa gnyis su war+Na dwI par rnal 'byor ma 'khor lo'i go cha ma/ nye ba'i 'du ba/ sor mo bcu drug nA ga rar rnal 'byor ma shin tu dpa' mo/ / bol gong gnyis sin+d+hU ra rnal 'byor ma stobs chen ma dur khrod/ mthe bong bzhi ma rur rnal 'byor ma (226) 'khor los skyur ma/ pus mo gnyis ku lu tAr rnal 'byor ma brtson 'grus chen mo'o/ /

At my genitals, Pretapurī, is the yoginī Cakravegā. At my anus, Gṛhadevatā, is the yoginī Khaṇḍarohā. Those are the gathering places. At both my thighs, Saurāṣṭra, is the yoginī Śauṇḍinī. At my calves, Suvarṇadvīpa, is the yoginī Cakravarmiṇī. Those are the nearby gathering places. At my sixteen fingers and toes, Nagara, is the yoginī Suvīrā. At both my insteps, Sindhu, is the yoginī Mahābalā. Those are the charnel grounds. At my thumbs and big toes, Maru, is the yoginī Cakravartinī. {226} At both my knees, Kulutā, is the yoginī Mahāvīryā.

de dag ni nye ba'i dur khrod de sku yi rnal 'byor ma sku mdog dkar mos 'og na spyod ma brgyad 'khor mkha' 'gro ma bye ba bye bas yongs su bskor ba/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku yi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo thams cad sku mdog so so la zhag gcig phyag gnyis spyan gsum pa mche ba bzhi rab tu gtsigs pa/ phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje dang thod khrag kha T+wAM ga la 'khyud pa/ bcu drug lon pa ltar bcud kyis rgyas shing nu ma b+ha ga rab tu rgyas pa/ bde ba chen po rab tu rgyas pa'i yongs su chags pa'i mdangs kyi spyan rtsa dmar kyil kyil gyis gtso bo la mngon par gzigs pa'o/ /

Those are the nearby charnel grounds. The white yoginīs of body, the eight who rule below the earth, are surrounded by their retinue of millions of ḍākinīs. They are of the essence of the inconceivable secret of the bodies of the buddhas of the three times. All have their respective colors, one face, two arms, three eyes, and four bared fangs. In their two hands are vajras and skull cups with blood, and they embrace khaṭvāṃgas. They are full of vitality, like sixteen-year-olds, and their breasts and bhagas are full. Their bloodshot eyes, glowing with the passion of expansive great bliss, look on the principal one.

de nas kha la shar sgor khA gdong ma/ sna la 'ug gdong ma/ mtshan ma'i sgor khyi gdong ma/ bshang sgor phag gdong ma/ de ni 'thung gcod do/ / mig g.yas par gshin rje brtan ma/ g.yon par gshin rje pho nya mo/ rna ba g.yas par gshin rje mche ba ma/ rna ba g.yon par gshin rje 'joms ma/ de dag ni nye ba'i 'thung gcod de dam tshig mkha' 'gro ma/ shin tu khros shing gtum pa'o/ /

Then, at my mouth, the eastern door, is Kākāsyā. At my nose is Ulūkāsyā. At the door of my genitals is Śvānāsyā. At the door of my anus is Śūkarāsyā. Those are the pīlavas. At my right eye is Yamadāḍhī. At my left eye is Yamadūtī. At my right ear is Yamadaṃṣṭriṇī. At my left ear is Yamamathanī. Those are the nearby pīlavas. Those are the samayaḍākinīs. They are very wrathful and fierce.

de ltar gnas pa'i spyi bo'i gtsug tu rigs kyi bdag po bla ma bde ba chen po dang bcas pa/ gdod ma nas dam tshig dang ye shes gnyis su med pa'i lha'i sku snang la rang bzhin med pa chu yi zla ba lta bu/ gsal la rnyog pa med pa mkha' la 'ja' tshon shar ba lta bur gsal ba'i thugs kar nyi ma la gnas pa'i yi ge mi shigs pa'i thig le/ ye shes drug gi bdag nyid ba~M gyi rnam pa'i tha mar sngags kyi phreng ba g.yas su bkod pa g.yon du 'khor bar gyur/

On the crowns of their heads are the guru-lords of their families with great bliss. All appear in the forms of deities who are the primordial nonduality of samaya and wisdom, and yet they lack any nature, like the moon reflected in water. They are clear and unsullied, like rainbows in the sky. At their hearts, on suns, abide the letters, indestructible bindus: embodiments of the six wisdoms, manifesting as vaṃs, surrounded by mantra garlands that are arranged clockwise and turn counterclockwise.
oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye hU~M hU~M phaT phaT swA hA/ oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye hU~M phaT swA hA/
oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā / oṃ vajravairocanīye hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

zhes pa la dmigs nas ci nus su mnyam par bzhag cung zad ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'am bzlas pa byed par spro na bcom ldan 'das ma'i bzlas rim chen mo ltar/ sku gsal gdab kyi bzlas pa dang / ngag rdo rje'i bzlas pa sogs rim gyis rtags dang bstun zhing de nas yid rdo rje'i bzlas pa sogs byas pas/ de ltar bsgoms pa (227) las byung ba'i bde drod gsal la mi rtog pa dang / du ba smrig rgyu dang / srin bu me khyer/ mar me lta bu/ mkha' gsal lta bu dang / sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dangs pa lta bu'i zab zhi spros pa dang bral ba'i 'od gsal ba chen po/ gsal la sgrib g.yogs med pa/ stong la phyogs ris med pa/ 'di la zag pa med pa'i ye shes rtogs shing mngon du byed par 'gyur ba ni/ gdams pa 'di'i bsgrubs 'bras thun mong ma yin pa yin gyis/ las tshogs dang mkha' spyod 'grub pa tsam ni yon tan thun mong ba'o/ /

Visualize that, and rest evenly as long as you can. If you slightly arise from samādhi or wish to do recitation, do the recitation of clarifying the body, the recitation of vajra speech, and the others sequentially and in keeping with the signs, according to the great processes of recitation of the Bhagavatī. Then, do the mental vajra recitation and the others. {227} By meditating in that way, there will arise bliss, heat, clarity, nonconceptuality; what are like smoke, mirages, fireflies, and candle flames; what is like a clear sky; great luminosity, which is free from elaborations and is peace and profound, like a brilliant cloud-free sky; clarity with no obscurations; emptiness with no partiality; and the wisdom of undefiled bliss. Such realizations and actualizations are the uncommon results of the practice of these instructions. Just the activity practices and khecarī accomplishments can [bring] the common excellent qualities.

thun 'jog pa'i tshe thugs ka'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer las mchod pa'i lha mo bcu drug dpag tu med pa sprul pas mchod pa'i sprin tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa nam mkha' bar snang yongs su gang bas bdag la mchod cing bstod par dmigs la /

At the end of the session, say: Light rays from the seed syllable in my heart emanate as innumerable forms of the sixteen offering goddesses, filling space and everywhere in between with unimaginable clouds of offerings. Offerings and praises are made to me. Thus, visualize.
oM badzra wA rA hI ma hA yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM/ pA d+yaM/ puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ A lo ke gan+d+he/ nai wi d+ya/ shab+da pra tIts+tsha AHhU~M zhes dang / oM badzra wI Ni AHhU~M
oṃ vajravārāhī mahāyoginī saparivāra arghaṃ pādyaṃ puṣpe dhūpe āloke gandhe naividya śabda pratīccha āḥ hūṃ And: oṃ vajra vīṇi āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du /
Similarly:
wi she/ mu rany+dze/ mr-i taM ge ha s+yA/ lA s+ya/ gI ti/ nr-i t+yi/ puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ A lo ke gan+d+he/ rU pa/ rwa sa/ spar+she/ d+harma d+hA tu AHhU~M/ zhes pa dang /
…vaṃśe…murañje…mṛtaṃge…hasyā…lāsye…gīti…nṛtyai…puṣpe…dhūpe…āloke…gandhe…rūpa…rāsa…sparśe…dharmadhātu āḥ hūṃ

rgyas par na gzhung las byung ba'i yum gyi rtsa sngags dang lha mo so bdun gyi snying po dang thun mong min pa'i rkang brgyad kyi sngags kyis mchod cing bstod pa ni snyan brgyud kyi phyag bzhes yin la/ spro na rgyal srid sna bdun dang / 'dod yon lnga dang / nang gi mchod pa/ sarba pany+tsa a mr-i ta dang / gsang ba'i mchod pa/ badzra ma taM gi AHhU~M/ zhes bya ba rnams kyis mchod la/

If you wish to be extensive, the custom of the Aural Transmission is to make offerings and praises with the root mantra of the female consort, the essence mantras of the thirty-seven female deities, and the mantras of the uncommon eight lines, all of which are found in the main texts. If you wish to elaborate, present the seven [emblems of] sovereignty, the five sense pleasures, and the inner offering with sarva pañca amṛta, and the secret offering with vajra mataṃgi āḥ hūṃ.

oM bcom ldan rnam kun rdo rje phag mo ni/ / 'jig rten gsum gzhan rgol bas mi tshugs shing / / 'byung po'i 'jigs pa ma lus rdo rje phag mos 'joms/ / rdo rje gdan bzhugs tshangs pa las rgyal zhing / / bdud kyi 'jigs pa ma lus skems shing pham mdzad pa/ / skye gnas 'byung ba kun gyi rang bzhin gzugs/ / sa gsum dbang phyug chos rnams yongs rdzogs mdzad/ /

oṃ Bhagavatī, great Vajravārāhī of all manifestations, unswayed by the opponents, the three worlds, Vajravārāhī, conquering the fears of bhūtas, residing at Vajrāsana, and victorious over Brahmā, you dry up and destroy all fears of Māra, With a form the nature of all birth, abiding, and arising, you are empress of the three planes, the perfection of phenomena.
rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma la 'dud/ / dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ /

To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I bow. Glorious Vajraḍākinī, [cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage and offer praise. To all the many vajraḍākinīs who cut through the bonds of concepts and engage the things of the world, to all of them, I pay homage and offer praise.]
zhes pa'i sh+lo ka gnyis kyis bstod cing /
Thus, praise with the two ślokas.
mchod pa'i lha mo thams cad bdag la thim par mos/
All the offering goddesses dissolve into me. Thus, contemplate. {228}

rdzogs (228) rim 'od gsal du bsdu ba'i tshul thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pas mnyam par 'jog cing ting nge 'dzin de las ldang ba'i tshe rang nyid rten brten pa dang bcas pa lha'i nga rgyal du bya ba ni/

With the common and uncommon modes of dissolving into luminosity as the perfection process, rest evenly, and when you arise from that samādhi, have the pride of the deity: that you are both the support and supported.

skad cig gis rang nyid zung 'jug gzugs kyi skur gsal ba'i lte bar a~M ba~M las rdo rje phag mo dmar mo/ / snying gar ha~M ya~M las gshin rje gshed ma sngon mo/ / mgrin par hriM moM las rmongs byed ma dkar mo/ / spyi bor hriM hriM las skyod byed ma ser mo/ spyi gtsug tu hU~M hU~M las skrag byed ma ljang gu/ yan lag gi tshigs thams cad la phaT phaT gtum mo tsaN+Di ka dud ka / thams cad yig 'bru lha'i rang bzhin/ drag po'i 'od zer phyogs kun tu 'phros pas gang gis kyang mi tshugs pa'i go cha gsal bar gyur par bsgom zhing spyod lam dang rnal 'byor gyi cho ga bsgom pa la 'jug cing /

Instantly, I am clearly the rūpakāya of unification. At my navel, from oṃ vaṃ, is red Vārāhī. At my heart, from haṃ yoṃ, is blue Yāminī. At my throat, from hrīṃ moṃ, is white Mohanī. At my head, from hriṃ hrīṃ, is yellow Saṃcālanī. At the crown of my head, from huṃ hūṃ, is green Saṃtrāsanī. In the joints of all my limbs, from phaṭ phaṭ, is smoky Caṇḍikā. All are of the nature of the seed syllables and deities. Wrathful light rays radiate to all directions, becoming clearly an armor that none can pierce. Thus, meditate. Engage in your daily activities, and cultivate the ritual for yoga.
thun mtshams su/
Between sessions, say:
dge ba 'di yis myur du bdag / rdo rje phag mo 'grub gyur nas/ / zhes sogs kyis smon lam gdab par bya'o/ /
By this virtue, may I swiftly accomplish Vajravārāhī [and thus establish in that state each and every being.] Thus, with that and others, make aspiration prayers.

skabs 'dir bdag bskyed la mchod pa sogs kyi don du lag mchod bya ba ni/ sngar gyi nang mchod bshams pa de nyid/ oM khaN+Da ro hi sa bsang / g.yon bar mtheb srin sbyar bas g.yon skor du zlum skor byas la/

At this point, do the hand offering in order to offer, and so forth, to the self visualization. Arrange the previous inner offering. Cleanse it with oṃ khaṇḍarohi. Joining your left thumb and ring finger, make a circle counterclockwise, saying:
oM swa b+hA wa shud+d+ha sarba \u0f7fswa b+hA wa shud+d+ho‘haM/
oṃ svabhāva śuddhā sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ
g.yon skor du chos 'byung bris la/
Draw a source of dharmas counterclockwise, saying:
oM AHhU~M
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
g.yas skor gyis chos 'byung gnyis pa bris la/
Draw a second source of dharmas clockwise, saying:
hU~M AHoM
hūṃ āḥ oṃ
dang / dbus dang phyogs bzhir thig le byas la/
Make drops in the center and four directions, saying:
bA~M mA~M lA~M pA~M tA~M/
vāṃ māṃ lāṃ pāṃ tāṃ

de rnams yongs su gyur pa las dbus su bcom ldan 'das gsang ba ye shes lhan cig skyes ma lha lnga'i dkyil 'khor yongs su gsal bar gyur lag pa g.yas pas g.yon pa'i mthil du chang gtor nas/ oM khaN+Da ro hi sa bsang / sngar ltar zlus skor dang chos 'byung gnyis dang dbus kyi thig le lnga byas nas/

Those transform into the maṇḍala of the five deities with the Bhagavatī, the Secret Wisdom Sahajā, in the center. Sprinkle alcohol on the palm of your left hand with your right hand. Cleanse with oṃ khaṇḍarohi. As before, make a circle, the two sources of dharma, and the five drops in its middle.

dbus kyi thig le lnga po yongs su gyur pa las yum gsang ba ye shes lhan cig skyes ma sku mdog dmar mo de yi phyogs bzhi bde chen gyi rnal 'byor ma bzhi phyogs kyi mdog can/ thams cad kyang phyag rgya lnga la sogs pa rgyan cha lugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i skur gsal bar gyur/

The five drops in the middle transform into the female consort, red Secret Wisdom Sahajā. In the four directions are the four yoginīs of great bliss, who have the color of their direction. All appear clearly in forms that are complete with all the ornaments and attributes, such as the five mudrās.
oM badzra wA rA hI Ar+g+haM sogs nas nyer spyod dang nang mchod/ a mr-i ta dang / (229) gsang ba/ ma taM gi sa mchod nas/
oṃ vajravārāhī arghaṃ… Thus, present the traditional offerings. {229} Present the inner offering with amṛta and the secret offering with mataṃgi.
dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / zhes sogs kyis mchod/
Glorious Vajraḍākinī [cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I present offerings.] Thus, offer.
mdun gyi nam mkhar rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma lha lnga'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms pa dang 'dra ba'i ye shes pa spyan drangs par gyur/
In the space in front, the wisdom ones corresponding to the meditated maṇḍala of the five deities of Jetsun Vajrayoginī are invited.
oM badzra wA rA hI sogs
oṃ vajravārāhī…

phyi nang gsang gsum gyis mchod la dkyil 'khor gsum po thun mong du rkang brgyad kyis bstod/ spro na yab bka' ltar rang gi lag pa gnyis su dbyangs gsal bkod pas bdud rtsir sbyangs shing go cha'i lha rnams 'od du zhu ba'i bar byed pa snyan brgyud rang lugs yin yang bsdus pa la dga' na/ nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor rnams lag pa'i dkyil 'khor dang de yang bdud rtsi'i dkyil 'khor la thim pas dkyil 'khor gsum po dbyer med gcig tu 'dres te 'od du zhu ba las byung ba zag pa med pa bdud rtsi'i rgya mtsho chen por gyur/

Present the outer, inner, and secret offerings. With the eight lines, praise the three maṇḍalas together. If you wish to elaborate, do the placement of the vowels and consonants on both your hands, purifying into amṛta, up through the dissolution of the armor deities into light, according to Yab Ka [sādhanas]. This is the custom of the Aural Transmission itself. However, if you wish to abbreviate, do the following: The maṇḍala in space dissolves into the maṇḍala of the hand, and that dissolves into the maṇḍala of amṛta. Thus, the three maṇḍalas have mixed inseparably as one. Melting into light, they become a great ocean of undefiled amṛta.
oM AHhU~M
oṃ āḥ hūṃ

zhes brjod la g.yon skor du lan gsum dkrugs la/ mtheb srin gyis bdud rtsir blangs nas gnas khang dang mchod rdzas dang rang nyid rnams la 'thor zhing / gnas dang rnal 'byor bdag cag rnams srung ba'i 'khor lo'i gur khang dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor mas gtams par gyur/

Saying that, stir counterclockwise three times. Taking up the amṛta with your thumb and ring finger, sprinkle the room, the offering substances, and yourself. This dwelling and the yogins and yoginīs are surrounded by the dome of the protection cakra, the heroes, and yoginīs.
oM AHhU~M
oṃ āḥ hūṃ

zhes smin mtshams nas steng 'og rim bzhin gtor la/ brgyud pa'i bla ma rnams kyi mtshan dang yi dam mkha' 'gro chos skyong sogs mchod par 'os pa rnams la 'bul ba'i mthar rang gi yang lce la myong zhing mgrin par byug go /

Sprinkle from the level of the point between your eyebrows, up and down, gradually. Offer [with] the names of the lineage gurus and to those who are worthy of offerings, such as the yidams, ḍākinīs, and dharma protectors. At the end, taste it with your tongue and anoint your throat.
gsum pa rjes thob 'bangs 'phrin las bdun sbyor ni
iii. The Subsequent Attainment: The Seven Activities of the Common People
'og tu gsal ba ltar yin la/
These are as stated clearly below.
spyi don gnyis pa bum sogs bsgrub pa ni/
b. The Second General Topic: The Practice of the Vase and So Forth

bum bskyed zur du byed par spro na/ oM khaN+Da ro hi sa bsang / oM swa b+hA wa sa sbyang / stong pa'i ngang las b+h+rU~M las rin po che'i bum pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yangs shing rgya che ba/ kha g.yel ba/ zhabs zhum pa/ lto ba ldir ba/ mgrin pa ring ba/ mchu 'phyangs pa/ lha rdzas kyi gos kyi mgul chings dang dpag bsam shing gis kha brgyan pa/ bcud sna tshogs kyis gang ba'i bum pa gzhal yas khang hrIHlas chos 'byung bsnol ma'i khug drug la dga' ba 'khyil pa drug pa yangs shing rgya che ba zhes pa nas/ me ri rab tu 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'gying ba'i tshul gyis bzhengs pa/

If you wish to do the vase visualization separately, do as follows: Cleanse with khaṇḍarohi and purify with oṃ svabhāva. Within emptiness, from bhrūṃ, appears a precious vase with all the attributes, spacious and vast. It has a wide mouth, flat bottom, rounded belly, long neck, and a spout. Its neck is tied with cloth of divine substances, and it adorned with a branch from a wish-granting tree. Filled with various elixirs, the vase is a palace [inside of which], from hrīḥ, appears crossed sources of dharma with six coils of joy in their six corners, spacious and vast[*7]…poised in the middle of raging volcanoes of wisdom. {230}
las (230) bum gyi nang du pad nyi ro yi gdan la ba~M las dum skyes ma sku mdog dmar mo sogs yab bka' ltar bskyed nas/
Inside the activity vase, on lotus, sun, and corpse seats, from paṃ, is red Khaṇḍarohā… Generate according to a Yab Ka [sādhana].[7]
lha tshogs de rnams kyi dpral bar zla ba la oM dkar po sogs
At the foreheads of those assembled deities, on moons, are white oṃs…
yab bka' ltar spyan 'dren bzhugs gsol dzaHhU~M ba~M hoHgnyis su med par gyur/
Do the invocation and request to be seated according to the Yab Ka [sādhana] up to: jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ They become nondual.
de nas dbang lha spyan 'dren mchod pa dbang bskur dbur brgyan rnams mdun bskyed ltar bya'o/ / de nas mchod pa nyer spyod rol mo dang bcas pa dang lha mo bcu drug gis mchod la

Then, do the invocation of the deities, offerings, abhiṣekas, and crowning as done in the front visualization. Next, with the traditional offerings, music, and the sixteen offering goddesses, present offerings.
bstod pa ni/
Praises.
dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / zhes dang /
Glorious Vajraḍākinī, [cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage and offer praise.] And:
ji snyed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / sogs kyi skabs su/
To all the many vajraḍākinīs [who cut through the bonds of concepts and engage the things of the world, to all of them, I pay homage and offer praise.] In this context:
chos rjes dran pa'i ngo bo nyid/ / gos dkar mo de me yi khams/ / pad+ma'i rigs kyi mkha' 'gro yum/ / dum skyes ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Essence of the mindfulness of phenomena, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, the fire dhātu, ḍākinī consort of the padma family, to Khaṇḍarohā, I pay homage.

rang gi thugs ka'i sa bon dang sngags 'khor las sngags phreng 'phros te gzungs thag la brten nas song ba bum lha rnams kyi thugs kar thim/ thugs ka nas 'phros pa'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas byang sems rnams kyi thugs ka nas ye shes kyi bdud rtsi spyan drangs nas bum par thim/ bum lha rnams bde ba chen po'i bcud kyis rgyas pa'i byang sems dang phyogs bcu'i dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams snyoms par zhugs pa'i byang sems dkar dmar dang so so'i sku las kyang bdud rtsi'i rgyun babs pas bum pa yongs su gang bar gyur/ hU~M zhes gzungs thag blangs la g.yon pas snying gar bzung zhing g.yon pas phreng ba la grangs bya/

From the seed syllable and surrounding mantra at my heart, mantra garlands radiate. Going along the dhāraṇī cord, they dissolve into the hearts of the vase deities. The light rays of the mantras radiating from my heart invoke wisdom amṛta from the hearts of the buddhas and bodhisattva of the ten directions, which dissolve into the vase.[8] The vase fills with the bodhicittas that come from the vase deities being infused with the elixir of great bliss, with the white and red bodhicittas from the union of the heroes and yoginīs of the ten directions, and with the streams of amṛta that flow from their individual bodies. Saying hūṃ, pick up the dhāraṇī cord. Hold it at your heart with your left hand, and count on your mālā with your left hand.
oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye badzra bai ro tsa ni ha ri ni sa ye hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/
oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye vajravairocani ha ri ni sa ye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā
zhes sam yang na gtso mo kho na la brgya skor ci mang dang / 'khor rnams ci nus zur du bzlas kyang rung / gzungs thag rdo rje las bum du spos la/

Say that or recite only the principal one’s mantra in sets of one hundred, as many as you can, and, additionally, the retinue mantras as many as you are able. Move the dhāraṇī cord and vajra to the activity vase.
oM khaN+Da ro he hU~M hU~M phaT/
oṃ khaṇḍarohe hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ
ces pa la brgya rtsa brgyad man chad ci 'grub bzlas pa byas la/
Recite that as much as you can, at least one hundred and eight times.
oM badzra Ar+g+haM AHhU~M
oṃ vajra arghaṃ āḥ hūṃ
zhes dung chos yod na de yi chu bum par blugs/
If there is conch water, pour its water into the vase.
lha'i 'khor lo chags pa chen po'i mes byang chub sems kyi ngo bor zhu ba'i chu dang ro gcig tu gyur/
This becomes of one taste with the water melted into the essence of bodhicitta by the fires of the great passion of the cakras of deities.

puSh+pe brjod la me tog gis kha bcad pa'i kha rgyan bzhag / las bum la bum chu gtor zhing reg la/ dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba ma rdzogs bar bgegs kyi tshogs rnams bzlog par mdzod cig / ces dang / grub nas mchod bstod dang bcas (231) pa bzhag go /
de nas gsum pa mdun bskyed bsgrub pa ni/
c. The Practice of the Front Visualization

dkyil 'khor yod na de dang bcas pa thams cad la dmigs rten bya/ de ltar min kyang skabs 'di'i dkyil 'khor dngos kyi gtso bo sin+d+hU ra'i dkyil 'khor kho na yin pas de la dmigs yul gtso bor bya zhing / de dang bum pa gcig tu sgrub na bum bskyed zur du ma byas kyang chog par 'dug go /

If there is a maṇḍala, take all that as the support for the visualization. Even without that, since the principal one of the actual maṇḍala in this context is the sindhūra maṇḍala, take that as the primary object for the visualization. If you do the practice for that together with the vase, the vase visualization does not need to be done separately. But to do so is fine.
des na mdun du dkyil 'khor yod na de dang min kyang sin+d+hU'i dkyil 'khor la/ oM khaN+Da ro hi sa bsang / swa b+hA wa sa sbyang /
Next, if there is a maṇḍala in front—or, if not, the sindhu maṇḍala—cleanse with oṃ khaṇḍarohi and purify with svabhāva.

stong pa'i ngang las mdun gyi dkyil 'khor hrIHlas chos 'byung bsnol ma khug drug la dga' ba 'khyil ba drug pa yangs shing rgya che ba/ de'i dbus su pa~M las pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa/ de'i lte bar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od zer bye ba phrag bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa/ de'i steng du ba~M yongs su gyur pa las/ bcom ldan 'das ma gsang ba ye shes lhan cig skyes ma sku mdog bskal ba'i me ltar rab tu dmar zhing gsal ba/ zhal gcig pa/ phyag gnyis pa/ spyan gsum rab tu dmar zhing khrol khrol gyi gzigs pa g.yo ba/ zhal mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas pas gser gyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsnams nas sdigs mdzub dang bcas pas 'debs pa'i tshul gyis/ thur du brkyangs pa/ g.yon pas bdud bzhi'i khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa thugs kar bsnams pa/ kha T+wAM ga la 'khyud pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyangs pas 'jigs byed nag po gan rkyal du bsgyel ba'i brang bar du mnan pa/ g.yon bskums nas dus mtshan ma dmar po mgo bo sum ltabs su mnan pa/

Within emptiness, from the hrīḥ on the front maṇḍala, appears crossed sources of dharma with six coils of joy in their six corners, spacious and vast. In the middle, from paṃ, is an eight-petaled lotus. In its center is a sun maṇḍala, with unimaginable millions of light rays. Above that, vaṃ transforms into the Bhagavatī, the Secret Wisdom Sahajā, clear and very red, like the eon-ending fires. She has one face, two arms, and two bright-red eyes, moving and glaring. Her four fangs are bared. Her right hand, holding a gold five-pointed vajra in the threatening gesture, is stretched down in the manner of striking. Her left hand holds a skull cup filled with the blood of the four māras to her heart. She embraces a khaṭvāṃga. Her outstretched right leg presses down on the chest of black Bhairava lying on his back. Her bent left leg tramples on the bent head of red Kālarātri.

dbu skra sil ma sku rgyab tu grol ba/ thod pa skam po lngas dbu la brgyan pa/ ba su ta la brgyus pa'i thod rlon lnga bcu'i do shal byas pa/ phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs dang me tog gi phreng bas rab tu brgyan pa/ bde ba chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nyams kyis yongs su gang bas ba spu nu ma langs shing b+ha ga rab tu rgyas pa'i pad+ma rA ga mngon bzhin pa/ cung zad sgeg pa'i gar gyis gzhon sha rab tu rgyas pa/ nyi ma bye ba 'bum gyi 'od zer las ches rab tu 'phro ba/ zhal nas A ra (232) li pheM zhes bzhad pa'i gad rgyangs phyogs kun tu sgrogs pa'i nga rgyal gyis/ sprul pa yang sprul gyi mkha' 'gro ma nam mkha'i mtha' steng 'og phyogs mtshams kun tu 'gengs shing bzhad pa'i gad mo cher sgrogs pas 'jig rten thams cad 'dar zhing ches g.yo bar mdzad cing zil gyis gnon pa/

Her hair is loose, flowing down her back. Five dried skulls adorn her head. She has a necklace with fifty fresh skulls strung on basuta. She is adorned with the five mudrās, various jewels, and garlands of flowers. Filled with unimaginable experiences of great bliss, her body hairs and breasts stand up and her bhaga is full, like padmarāga. With a slightly erotic dance, her youthful body glows. She radiates even more than the light rays of millions of suns. {232} She has the pride that expresses itself as a roaring laughter of ārali pheṃ that can be heard in all directions. Her emanated and re-emanated ḍākinīs completely fill the reaches of space, from above and below, in all directions. Their great laughter spreads throughout the world and shakes it. They dazzle.

de'i shar gyi pad 'dab kyi steng du nyi ma la mA~M las mkha' 'gro ma sngon mo/ / byang du tA~M las lA ma ljang gu/ nub tu pa~M las khaN+Da ro hi dmar mo/ / lhor lA~M las gzugs can ma ser mo/ / thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa spyan gsum pa/ mche ba bzhi rab tu gtsigs pa/ phyag g.yas pa rnams kyis rdo rje/ g.yon pa rnams kyis thod khrag bsnams shing kha T+wAM ga la 'khyud pa/ bcu drug lon pa ltar bcud kyis rgyas shing bde ba chen pos rab tu gang bas mngon par chags pa'i spyan zur gyis gzigs pa can thams cad kyang ye shes kyi me ri rab tu 'bar ba'i dkyil tu 'gying ba'i tshul gyis bzhengs pa/

On the lotus petal in the east, on a sun, from māṃ, is blue Ḍākinī. In the north, from tāṃ, is green Lāma. In the west, from paṃ, is red Khaṇḍarohi. In the south, form māṃ, is yellow Rūpiṇī. All have one face, two arms, three eyes, and four very bared fangs. Their right hands hold vajras, their left hold skull cups with blood, and their left arms embrace khaṭvāṃgas. They are full of vitality and great bliss, like sixteen-year-olds. They glance from the corners of their eyes with obvious passion. They stand poised in the middle of raging volcanoes of wisdom.

'og tu sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba yangs shing rgya che ba sa gzhi'i steng du rdo rje rim pa lnga'i gur dang bla re/ de'i phyi rol tu ye shes lnga yi me ri me dpung sna tshogs su rab tu 'bar zhing g.yon ngos su kyi li li 'khyil zhing 'tshubs par gyur/

Below, on the ground, in the middle of a spacious and vast viśvavajra, is a tent of five layers of vajras and a canopy. Outside of that are volcanoes of the five wisdoms—raging fires, pulsating, swirling, and spinning to the left.

de ltar lha tshogs gsal bar gnas pa'i gtso mo'i spyi bo'i gtsug tu rigs kyi bdag po bla ma bde ba chen po dang bcas pa/ thams cad kyang gdod ma nas dam tshig ye shes dbyer med pa lha'i sku snang la rang bzhin med pa chu yi zla ba lta bu/ gsal la rtog pa med pa mkha' la 'ja' tshon shar ba lta bur gsal ba'i thugs kar nyi ma la gnas pa'i yi ge mi shigs pa'i thig le/ yi ge drug gi bdag nyid ye shes sems dpa' ba~M gyi rnam pas mtshon pa/

Thus the assembled deities appear clearly. On the crown of the head of the principal one is her family guru-lord with great bliss. All are the primordial inseparability of samaya and wisdom, appearing in the forms of deities, and yet they lack any nature, like the moon reflected in water. They are clear and nonconceptual, like rainbows in the sky. At their hearts, on suns, abide the letters, indestructible bindus: embodiments of the six letters, the wisdom sattvas are marked by the manifestation of vaṃ.

de'i spyi bor zla ba la oM dkar po/ mgrin par pad+ma la AHdmar po/ snying gar nyi ma la hU~M sngon po/ thugs ka'i sa bon dang hU~M las 'od zer 'phros pas o rgyan rang byung gi dur khrod chen po nas gsang ba ye shes mkha' 'gro 'khor dang bcas pa spyan drangs par mos la

At their heads, on moons, are white oṃs. At their throats, on lotuses, are red āḥs. At their hearts, on suns, are blue hūṃs. Light radiating from the seed syllables in their hearts and the hūṃs invite, from the great self-arising charnel ground of Oḍḍiyāna, Secret Jñānaḍākinī and her retinue. Thus, contemplate. {233}

cung zad langs pa'i rkang pa g.yas pa'i mthe bong gis g.yon (233) mnan la/ 'bar ba'i phyag rgya ni lag pa'i mthe bong gnyis sbyar/ mdzub mo gnyis mdud byas gung mo gshibs/ mthe'u chung dang srin lag gis mdzub mo bzhi bsgrad de dpral ba'i dbyings su bskor la/

[Stand] with the big toe of your slightly raised right leg pressing on your left. Make the blazing mudrā by joining your thumbs, intertwining your index fingers, lining up your middle ones, and with your little fingers and ring fingers fanned out, circle in the space at your forehead.
pheM pheM pheM/ oM e badzra A ra li hoHdzaHhU~M ba~M hoH/ badzra DA ki nI sa ma ya hU~M/ sa ma ya s+t+waM/ dr-i sh+ya hoH pheM pheM pheM pheM pheM pheM pheM hU~M/
pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ / oṃ e vajra ārali hoḥ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ / vajraḍākinī samaya hūṃ / samayastvaṃ / dṛśya hoḥ / pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ hūṃ
ma lus sems can kun gyi mgon gyur cing / / zhes pa nas/ mkhyen gyur cig / bcom ldan rdo rje phag mo 'khor bcas rnams/ / sems can don la dgongs mdzod la/ / skad cig tsam gyis gshegs su gsol/ /

Protectors of all sentient beings without exception, [deities who destroy Māra and the terrible hordes, who know all things just as they are,] Bhagavatī Vajravārāhī with your retinue, please consider the welfare of sentient beings. Please come here instantly.
zhes mdun gyi nam mkhar byon par bsam/
Think they come into the space in front.
bcom ldan 'dir ni byon pa legs/ / zhes dang /

It is good that the Bhagavatī has arrived [I have merit and fortune. In order to accept my offerings, please remain here. Due to your kindness for me and all beings, and through the power of your miracles, as long as I worship you, Bhagavatī, please remain. oṃ guru sarvatathāgata padma kamalāyastvaṃ] And:
stong gsum kun dang mnyam pa yi/ / sogs nas/ bzhugs su gsol/ /
Equal to the three-thousandfold universe, [the lotuses with eight petals, pistils and stamens, we offer are comfortable and spacious. In whatever ways are comfortable,] please be seated.

dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH pad+ma ka ma la ye s+t+waM/ gu ru badzra bA rA hI ma hA yo gi nI kA ya wAk+tsit+ta badzra sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM/ pA d+yaM/ puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ A lo ke gan+d+he/ nai wi d+ya/ shab+da AHhU~M/
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ / padma kamalayestvaṃ / guru vajravārāhī mahāyoginī kāya vākcitta vajra saparivāra arghaṃ / pādyaṃ / puṣpe / dhūpe / āloke / gandhe / naividya / śabda āḥ hūṃ
slar yang thugs ka'i sa bon las 'od zer 'phros pas dbang gi lha rigs lnga 'khor bcas spyan drangs/
Again, light rays radiate from the seed syllables at their hearts, inviting the five families of abhiṣeka deities with their retinues.
pany+tsa ku la sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaH
pañcakula saparivāra vajra samājaḥ
pany+tsa ka la sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod la gsol ba btab pas/
Offer with pañcakula saparivāra arghaṃ and so forth. Supplicate:
ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni/ sogs/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born [the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bestow the abhiṣeka. oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya śriye hūṃ]

dbang bskur dri ma dag chu'i lhag ma yar lud pa las/ gtso mo la rnam par snang mdzad/ mkha' 'gro ma la mi bskyod pa/ lA ma la don yod grub pa/ khaN+Da ro hi la 'od dpag med/ gzi ldan ma la rin chen 'byung ldan gyis dbu brgyan par gyur/ mchod pa byin rlabs rgyas par byas la/ rang gi thugs ka'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer las mchod pa'i lha mo bcu drug sogs phyi nang gsang ba'i mchod pa dpag tu med pa sprul te/ mchod pa'i sprin tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa sa dang nam mkha' bar snang thams cad yongs su gang bas mdun bskyed kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la mchod cing bstod par dmigs te /

The abhiṣeka is bestowed. Your stains are purified. The excess water rising up and overflowing becomes the crown of Vairocana on the principal one, Akṣobhya on Ḍākinī, Amoghasiddhi on Lāma, Amitābha on Khaṇḍarohi, and Ratnasambhava on Tejā. Do an extensive consecration of the offerings. Light rays from the seed syllable in the heart emanates as innumerable offerings—outer, inner, and secret, the sixteen offering goddesses and more—filling space and everywhere in between with unimaginable clouds of offerings. Offerings and praises are made to the maṇḍala of the front visualization. Visualize that.
oM badzra wA rA hI ma hA yo gi ni sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM AHhU~M/
oṃ vajravārāhī mahāyogini saparivāra arghaṃ āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du/
Similarly:
pA d+yaM/ puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ A lo ke gan+d+he/ (234) nai wi d+ya/ shab+da AHhU~M/ zhes dang /
…pādyaṃ…puṣpe…dhūpe…āloke…gandhe…naividya…śabda āḥ hūṃ {234}
de nas thog mar thun mong ma yin pa sngags kyi mchod pa 'bul ba ni/
Then, first present the offering of the uncommon mantra.

oM badzra b+hA rA hI/ pro ta ge pro taM ge ha na ha na prA NAM/ kiM ki ni khiM khi ni/ d+hu na d+hu na/ badzra ha ste/ sho Sha ya sho Sha ya/ badzra kha T+wAM ga kA pa la d+hA ri Ni/ ma hA pi shi ti mAM sA sha ni/ ma nu Sh+yAM tra pra br-it+te san+ni d+h+yaM/ nA ra shi ro mA lA graM thi ta d+hA ra Ni/ sum+b+ha ni sum+b+he/ ha na ha na prA NAM/ sarba pA pa sa twa nAM/ sarba bA shU nAM/ ma hA mAM sa ts+tsha da ni/ kro d+ha mu rte daMshatra ka rA li ni/ ma hA mu dre shrI he ru ka de wa s+ya a gra ma hi Shi/ sa ha sra shi re/ sa ha pra wA ha be sha ta sa ha sra A na ne dz+wa li ta te dza she dz+wa la mu khi piM ga la/ lo tsa ne badzra sha rI re/ badzra A sha ne/ mi li mi li/ ti mi li ti mi li/ he he/ ha ha/ hU~M hU~M/ kha kha/ d+hu d+hu/ ru ru/ d+hu ru d+hu ru/ mu ru mu ru/ a twai te/ ma hA yo gi nI pa thi ta sid+d+hi/ draiM d+haM draiM d+haM/ graM graM/ he he/ ha ha/ b+hI me taM/ ha sa ha sa/ bi re/ hA hA/ hoHhoH hU~M hU~M/ trai lo kya bi nA sha ni sa ta sa ha pra/ ko Ti ta thA ga ta/ pa ri wA ri te hU~M hU~M phaT/ se d+ha rU pe khaHga dza rU pe gaH/ AHtrai lo kyo da re ma hA sa mu dra me kha la gra sa gra sa hU~M hU~M phaT/ bI rA rwe te hU~M hU~M haHhaHma hA pa shU/ mo ha ni ma hA yo gI shwa ri s+t+waM/ DA ki ni sarba lo kA nAM/ ban+d+ha ni sad+ya pra t+ya ya kA ri Ni hU~M hU~M phaT/ b+hU ta trA sa ni ma hA bI re pa ra ma sid+d+he/ yo gI shwa ri phaT hU~M hU~M phaT/ hU~M hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/

oṃ vajravārāhī / protage / protaṃge / hana hana prāṇāṃ / kiṃkini khiṃkhini / dhuna dhuna / vajrahaste / śoṣya śoṣya / vajrakhatvāṃgakāpaladhāriṇi / mahāpiśtimāṃsāśani / manuṣyāṃtrapravṛtte sannidhyaṃ / nāraśiromālāgraṃthitadhāraṇi / sumbha nisumbhe / hana hana prāṇāṃ / sarvapāpasatvānāṃ / sarvavāśūnāṃ / mahāmāṃsacchadni / krodhamurte daṃśtrākarālini / mahāmudre śrīheruka / devasyagramahiṣi / sahasraśire / sahapravāhave śatasahasrānane jvalitatejaśe jvālamukhi piṃgala / locane vajraśarīre / vajrāśane / mili mili / timili timili / he he / ha ha / hūṃ hūṃ / kha kha / dhu dhu / ru ru / dhuru dhuru / muru muru / advaite / mahāyoginī pathitasiddhi / draiṃ dhaṃ draiṃ dhaṃ / graṃ graṃ / he he / ha ha / bhīme taṃ / hasa hasa / vire / hā hā / hoḥ hoḥ / hūṃ hūṃ / trailokyavināśani satasahapra / koṭitathāgata / parivārite hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / seṅharūpe khaḥ gajarūpegaḥ / āḥ trailokyodare mahāsamudramekhala grasa grasa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / vīrārvete hūṃ hūṃ haḥ haḥ mahāpaśū / mohani mahāyogīśvaristvaṃ / ḍākini sarvalokānāṃ / vandhāni sadyapratyayakāriṇi hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / bhūtatrāsani mahāvīre paramasiddhe / yogīśvari phaṭ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

oM pra tsaN+De huM hU~M phaT/ oM tsaN+Da Ak+She ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM pra b+hA wa ti ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA na me huM hU~M phaT/ oM bI re ma tI huM hU~M phaT/ oM kharba ri ye hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM laM ke shwa ri ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM dru mats+tsha ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM ai rA ba ti ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA b+he ra bi ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM ba yu be ge ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM su ra b+hak+ShI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM sh+yA ma de wi ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM su b+ha dre huM hU~M phaT/ oM ha ya karme huM hU~M phaT/ oM kha ga a na ne huM hU~M phaT/ oM tsakra be ge huM hU~M phaT/ oM khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT/ oM shauN+Di nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM tsakra warmi NI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM su bi re huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA ba le huM hU~M phaT/ oM tsakra warti ni ye huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ pracaṇḍe hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ caṇḍakṣiye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ prabhāvatiye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahāname huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vīrematī huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ kharvariye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ laṃkeśvariye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ drumacchaye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ airāvatiye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahābheraviye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vayuvegeye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ surabhakṣiye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ śyamadeviye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ subhadre huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hayakarme huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ khaganane huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ cakravege huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ śauṇḍinīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ cakravarmiṇīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ suvire huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahābale huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ cakravartiniye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / {235}
oM ma hA (235) bI r+Ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ mahāvīrye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
ces thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sngags kyis mchod/ gzhan yang skabs 'dir spro na/
Thus, offer with the common and uncommon mantras. Furthermore, if you wish to elaborate here, say:
rdo rje lha mo pi wang rdung / /
The vajra goddess strums a lute.[*8]
zhes sogs tshigs bcad dang bcas pa'am/ bsdu na so so'i phyag rgya dang bcas pas/
Offer with those verses. Alternatively, if you wish to abbreviate, with the individual mantras, say:
oM badzra wI Ni hU~M hU~M phaT/
oṃ vajra vīṇi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
de bzhin du thog mtha' sbyar la/
Similarly, add that beginning and end to:
waM she/ mr-i taM ge/ mu rany+dze/ hA s+ya/ lA s+ya/ gI ti/ nr-i t+ya/ puSh+pe/ d+hU pe/ dI pe/ gan+d+he/ rU pa/ rA sa/ spar+she/ d+harma d+hA tu/
…vaṃśe…mṛtaṃge…murañje…hāsya…lāsya…gīti…nṛtya…puṣpe…dhūpe…dīpe…gandhe…rūpa…rasa…sparśe…dharmadhātu…
zhes pa dang rgyal srid bdun/ 'dod yon lnga dang nang mchod kyi bdud rtsi gtor la/ brgyud rim dang yi dam gyi mtshan gyis 'bul te/ pany+tsa a mr-i ta sa mchod/ bde ba chen po'i mchod pa'i 'dun pas/

Offer the seven [emblems of] sovereignty and five sense pleasures. Sprinkling the inner-offering amṛta, offer that using the names for the succession of the lineage and the yidams. Offer with pañca amṛta. With the intention of offering great bliss, say:
badzra ma taM gi AHhU~M/ zhes pa rnams kyis mchod la
vajra mataṃgi āḥ hūṃ Those are the offerings.
bstod pa ni/
The praises.

oM nA mo b+ha ga wA t+yai badzra wA rA hI ba~M hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM Ar+Ya a pa rA dzi te trai lo kya mA te ma hA bI d+ye shwa ri hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM sarba b+hU ta b+ha yA ba he ma hA badzre hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM badzrA sha ne a dzi te a pa rA dzi te ba sh+yaM ka ri ni tra b+h+rA ma Ni hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM sho Sha ni ro Sha Ni/ kro d+ha ni ka rA li ni hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM trA sa ni mA ra Ni pra b+he da ni a pa rA dza ye hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM bi dza ye dzam+b+ha ni s+t+waM b+ha ni mo ha ni hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM badzra wA rA hI ma hA yo gi kA me sha ri kha gi hU~M hU~M phaT/

oṃ namo bhagavātyai vajravārāhī vaṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ārya aparājite trailokyamāte mahāvīdyeśvari hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ sarvabhūtabhayāvahe mahāvajre hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajrāśane ajite aparājite vaśyaṃkari nitrabhrāmaṇi hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ śoṣani roṣaṇi / krodhani karālini hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ trāsani māraṇi prabhedani aparājaye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vijaye jambhani stvaṃbhani mohani hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajravārāhī mahāyogi kāmeśari khage hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ
ces rkang pa brgyad pa dang /
Those are the eight lines.
hU~M bcom ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor los sgyur/ / ye shes lnga dang sku gsung thugs/ / 'gro ba skyob la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
hūṃ Bhagavatī Vajraḍākinī, cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage.
ji snyed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / kun tu rtog pa'i 'ching gcod cing / / 'jig rten bya bar rab 'jug ma/ / de snyed rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To all the many vajraḍākinīs who cut through the bonds of concepts and engage the things of the world, to all of them, I pay homage and offer praise.
zhes brjod cing mchod la rang la bsdu/ rdzogs rim 'od gsal gyi ngang la mnyam par bzhag /
Say that and offer. [The maṇḍala] dissolves into you. Rest evenly in the perfection process, luminosity.

bdag mdun 'di rnams kyi rjes thob kyi skabs su/ bza' ba zas kyi rnal 'byor/ / bgo ba gos kyi rnal 'byor/ 'gro 'dug spyod lam gyi rnal 'byor/ nyal ba gnyid kyi rnal 'byor dang bzhis bya spyod tshogs su bsgyur ba dang / dang po tha ma khrus dang chos spyod gnyis te/ de ltar na bkru ba khrus kyi rnal 'byor dang bya cha chos spyod kyi rnal 'byor dang drug po ni/ rje btsun ma'i rgyal blon 'bangs kyi sgrub thabs nyid ltar nyams su len par bya'o/ /

During the subsequent attainment for both the self and the front [visualizations], transform all activities and conduct into a gaṇacakra through the yoga of eating food, the yoga of wearing clothes, the yoga of going, sitting and daily conduct, and the yoga of sleeping. The washing and dharma activities, which are at the beginning and end respectively, are the yoga of bathing and the yoga of dharma activities, making six. Practice them according to the sādhana of the queen, ministers, and people of the Jetsunma.
skabs 'dir phrin las gtor ma'i rnal 'byor ni/ gtor ma'i yo byad la/ gnang bkag med pas gtor gzhong gtsang ma gang yang rung ba'i nang du mtheb kyu la sogs pas (236) bkang bar byas la gsungs pa ni/

At this point there is the yoga for the torma, the activity. It is taught that since there are no prescriptions and prohibitions for the materials of the torma, fill a clean torma dish, whatever you have, with tepkyu, and so forth. {236}

sgrub pa nyams len gyi dus dang 'dir gtor mchod dang 'bul gtor rgyas pa yod pa la ni gtor ma rnams la dang po phud rgod kyis bran/ de nas chu blugs/ gsum pa bdud rtsis bran zhing lha'i nga rgyal gyis sum+b+ha ni 'am/ khaN+Da ro hi sa bsang swa b+hA wa sa sbyang /

When practicing the sādhana and here, there are extensive torma offerings and offering tormas. Sprinkle the tormas first with a “select wild” substance, [9] and then pour water [on them]. Third, sprinkle them with amṛta. With the pride of the deity, cleanse with either sumbha ni or khaṇḍarohi, and purify with svabhāva.

stong pa'i ngang las yaM las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu yi dbyibs can/ ces pa nas sngon gyi nang mchod ltar byin gyis brlab/ gtor mgron mdun bskyed kyi skabs ltar spyan 'dren/ nyer spyod sogs kyis mchod/ lag pa rdo rje thal mo phye ste bskor zhing se gol brdabs pas

Within emptiness, from yaṃ, appears a wind maṇḍala in the shape of a bow…[*9] Thus, do the consecration according to the inner offering above. Invite the torma guests as done in the context of the front visualization. Present the traditional offerings and so forth. With your hands in open vajra palms, circle and snap your fingers.

thugs ka'i baM las mkha' 'gro ma dpag tu med pa 'phros nas/ ka pA la'i bdud rtsir bcas nas thams cad la drangs par mos pa/ thog mar brgyud pa'i bla ma rnams la 'bul bar dmigs la/ chos sku rdo rje 'chang chen po/ rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug tai lo pa la sogs te rim bzhin/ drin chen rtsa ba'i bla ma brgyud pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi zhal du i daM ba ling+ta kha kha khA hi khA hi/

From the vaṃ in the heart, innumerable ḍākinīs radiate, and holding kapālas with amṛta, they serve everyone. Thus, contemplate. First, visualize offering to the lineage gurus. Dharmakāya great Vajradhara, lord of yogins Tilopa, and the others, in succession, [down to] my kind root gurus and the lineage, idaṃ baliṅta kha kha khāhi khāhi.

sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las thams cad brnyes nas mchog thun mong gnyis kyi dngos grub ma lus pa stsal du gsol/ de nas/ grub chen brgyad dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i lha tshogs bde chen gyi rnal 'byor ma bzhi dang bcas pa'i 'khor dpa' bo so bdun po rnams la so so'i sngags ring sogs sngags thams cad brjod pa'i mthar/ i daM ba ling+ta btags shing 'dod don gsol ba dang bcas pa gsang sngags nang gtor ltar rgyas par 'bul lo/

Having achieved body, speech, mind, excellent qualities, and activities, please bestow all the supreme and common siddhis. Then, say all the mantras, such as the long mantras, of each of the eight mahāsiddhas, the assembly of deities of Vajrayoginī, the four yoginīs of great bliss, and the thirty-seven retinue heroes, adding idaṃ baliṅta at the end and requesting [the fulfillment of] your desired aims. Make extensive offerings according to the Secret Mantra inner torma.

skabs 'dir tshogs kyi gong du gtor bsngos mdzad pa ni/ cho ga snga ma rnams kyi phyag bzhes ji lta ba yin la/ tshogs kyi rjes gtor bsngos mdzad pa rje don ldan man chad kyi kar lugs kyi phyag len du 'dug pas 'dir phyag len snga ma ltar gtor ma 'bul ba'i rim pa rgyas par bya'o/ / des ni cho ga'i rim pa slob dpon gyi 'jug pa'i bya ba rnams so/ /

At this point, doing the torma dedication before the feast is the procedure in the earlier rituals. However, doing the dedication of the torma after the feast is the procedure of the Kar[ma] tradition since the time of the exalted [sixth Karmapa, Tongwa] Dönden. Therefore, here do the extensive process of offering tormas according to the earlier procedure. Those are the sections for entering the ācārya, the stages of the ritual.
gnyis pa slob ma'i 'jug pa
B. Entering the Disciples
['di] la gnyis te/ sngon 'gro dang / dngos gzhi'o/ /
This has two parts: (1) the preliminaries and (2) the main practice.
dang po ni/
1. The Preliminaries
las bum gyi chus slob ma rnams khrus bya zhing /
Wash the disciples with water from the activity vase.
ji ltar bltams pa sogs brjod/
Just as when [the Buddha] was born [the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bathe your body. oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya…]
oM tsak+Shur+b+han+d+ha wA ra ma na ye swA hA/
oṃ cakṣurbhandha vāramanaye svāhā
zhes gdong g.yogs bcing /
Tie the blindfolds.
oM a khaM wI ra hU~M/
oṃ a khaṃ vīra hūṃ
zhes pas me tog lag tu gtad/
Give them flowers.

de nas sngon 'gro'i skabs ltar dkar gtor gcig dang sgrub bo rnams kyi glud gtor bshams la/ gzhi bdag la gtor ma btang zhing bka' bsgo byed/ 'byung po la bgegs gtor (237) btang zhing byin gyis brlabs pa'i nas kyis bgegs bskrad cing rol mo drag tu byas nas mthar srung ba'i 'khor lo brtan por bsgom/

Then, as done in the preliminaries, arrange one white torma and substitute tormas for the practitioners. Give a torma to the local deities and command them. {237} Give an obstructors’ torma to the bhūtas, expel obstructors with consecrated grains, and play music forcefully. At the end, meditate on the circle of protection as being firm.

de nas slob ma rnams kyis yol ba'i phyi rol nas phyag 'tshal sngon du 'gro bas maN+Dal phul nas bsam pa bzang po rtse gcig pas 'khod pa la/ slob dpon gyis 'di skad gdams par bya ste/ sems bskyed gsal btab la/

Next, the disciples should begin by doing prostrations outside the curtain and offer a maṇḍala. With a one-pointed excellent attitude, they should be seated. The ācārya gives the following instructions. They should clarify their arousing of bodhicitta.

spyir ston pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gdul bya rnams la 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin spong bar byed pa'i thabs kyi theg pa'i 'jug sgo mang du gsungs kyang sems can rnams kyi blo yi bye brag tha dad pas gang la gang mos kyi tshul mthun du sbyangs te mthar thug theg pa chen po gcig nyid du rtogs par byed pa yin la/

In general, the Teacher, the true, perfect Buddha taught for his disciples many doors to enter the yānas, which are methods for abandoning the nature of suffering in saṃsāra. Nevertheless, given the differences in the minds of sentient beings, they train in keeping with their dispositions. In the end, they will realize the one Mahāyāna.

theg pa chen po la'ang byang chub sgrub pa'i rgyu lam du byed pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa dang / 'bras bu lam du byed pa gsang sngags kyi lam gnyis kyi khyad par du 'phags pa ni gsang sngags rdo rje theg pa/ de'i nang nas kyang rnal 'byor bla med kyi rgyud zab cing de la'ang byin rlabs can gyi rgyud bde mchog 'khor lo zhes bya ste/ gsang ba bla na med pa'i bstan pa kun gyi mthar thug dpal 'khor lo sdom pa bya ba yin/ de nyid kyi'ang yang snying don gyi gnas lugs su nges pa kun las kyang gsang ba rmad du byung ba ni mkha' 'gro'i snyan brgyud dri ma med pa 'di yin la/ 'di la'ang smin grol gnyis las smin lam yid bzhin gyi nor bu zhes bya ba yin/

The Mahāyāna consists of two paths: the Pāramitāyāna, which takes the causes for achieving awakening as the path, and Secret Mantra, which takes the results as the path. Of these, the Secret Mantra Vajrayāna is especially distinguished. Within that, the niruttara yoga tantras are profound. Among those is the tantra with blessings called Cakrasaṃvara. The culmination of all the secret niruttara teachings is the glorious Cakrasaṃvara. Within that, what is the most wonderful secret of all—what is determined to be the ultimate abiding nature, the innermost essence—is this stainless Aural Transmission of the Ḍākinīs.
