Among its two sections, maturation and liberation, this is called the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Maturing Path.

smin lam yang thabs shes gnyis kyi sgo nas ston pa las/ 'dir ni shes rab dang 'brel pa bcom ldan 'das dpal lhan skyes rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sin+d+hU ra rdo rje ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor du dbang skur bar byed pa'o/ /

The Maturing Path is taught by means of methods and prajñā. Now, you will be given the abhiṣeka for the sindhūra vajra wisdom maṇḍala of the Bhagavatī, glorious Sahajā, Vajrayoginī, which is connected to prajñā.

de la spyir theg pa chen po gsang sngags 'di byin rlabs kyi lam yin/ sgos su snyan brgyud 'di byin rlabs kho na'i lam yin/ byin rlabs kyang mos gus la rag las pas thog mar mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bla ma la bka' rtags kyi chos bzhi/ zab pa'i gnad bzhi dang ldan pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni sa steng rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por gsungs pa'i bla ma dam pa ste/ (238) rgyud ldan des kyang slob ma snod ldan mtshan nyid tshang zhing khyad par gyi yon tan bco brgyad dang ldan pa gcig gam gsum las mang ba la spel du mi rung ste/

Generally speaking, this Mahāyāna Secret Mantra is a path of blessings. In particular, this Aural Transmission is a path solely of blessings. Since blessings are dependent on devotion, first [what is necessary is] an authentic guru who teaches by means of the four dharmas that are the authentic marks and the four profound vital points. Such a genuine guru who is said to be a great vajra holder on this earth. {238} Such a lineage holder will not spread [these teachings] to more than one or three suitable disciples who have all the characteristics and are endowed with the eighteen special virtues. It is said:
gcig la ma bcad zab mo'i rigs brgyud chad/ / gnyis las ma spel gsang ba nyams sa re/ /
Cut the single path, and the transmission of the profound family is cut. Do not spread beyond two: there is the danger that what is secret will degenerate.
zhes gsungs pas sbyangs pa'i las 'phro sad cing rigs dang skal bar ldan pa'i slob ma de nyid kyis dad gus drag po'i sgo nas gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos gyis/
Disciples who have the karmic continuity of training and are endowed with fortune and good family should, with strong faith and respect, repeat the following supplication:
bcom ldan bde chen rnal 'byor ma/ / skyabs med skyob pa skyob med skyabs/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor los sgyur/ / rgyu med par ni thugs rje che/ / mgon med bdag gi mgon mdzod cig /

Bhagavatī Mahāsukha Yoginī, the refuge for those without refuge, who provides refuge for those without refuge, cakravartin of ḍākinīs, Great Compassionate One without cause, I have no protector—be my protector.
bdag nyid che khyod ci 'dra bar/ / gtso bos bdag la de 'drar mdzod/ / 'khor ba 'dam gyi tshogs nang du/ / bying ba bdag la skyabs mdzod cig /
May the principal one make me just like you, Great Being. In the quagmire of saṃsāra, where I am sinking, please provide me with refuge.
ces lan gsum du gsol ba gdab/
Supplicate three times.

de nas bla ma zab pa dang rgya che ba'i chos spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid ci ltar rigs pa dang / khyad par du zab mo'i tshul 'di'i rtogs pa lam du byed pa'i dbang bskur ba'i tshul yang gsum du yod pa yin te/

Then, the guru [teaches] the profound and vast dharma, in general, and the specific characteristics, as they are. In particular, there are three approaches to bestowing the abhiṣekas that take as their path the realizations of this profound approach.

thog mar bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor la brten nas bde mchog yab bka' rgyas 'bring bsdus gsum sogs kyi dbang bskur nas rgyud 'chad pa'i snod du rung bar byas te yab la brten pa'i bskyed rdzogs phyi nang gi rnal 'byor nyams su len par byed pa la dbang dang 'brel ba rgyud kyi gdams pa zhes bya/

First, on the basis of the maṇḍala of the Bhagavān, glorious Cakrasaṃvara, the extensive, intermediate, and abbreviated abhiṣekas of Saṃvara Yab Ka are conferred, creating suitable recipients for the explanation of the tantras. The outer and inner yogas, the generation and perfection [processes] based on the male consort, are practiced. This [approach] is called the Instructions of the Transmission connected with the abhiṣekas.

lhan skyes rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sin+d+hU ra'i dkyil 'khor la brten pa'i dbang bskur dang byin gyis brlabs pa la brten nas snyan brgyud zab mo bla na med pa'i man ngag rnams nyams su len pa la byin rlabs dang 'brel pa snyan brgyud kyi gdams pa zhes bya ste/

On the basis of blessings and the abhiṣekas that rely on the sindhūra maṇḍala of the Sahajā, Vajrayoginī, the esoteric instructions of the unexcelled and profound Aural Transmission are practiced. This [approach] is called the Instructions of the Aural Transmission connected with blessings.

lus med ye shes kyi DA ki ma'i brda dbang ngo sprod la brten nas lus med mkha' 'gro'i chos skor dgu la sogs pa nyams su len pa la brda dang 'brel pa ngo sprod kyi gdams pa zhes bya ba rnams yod pa las/

On the basis of the symbolic abhiṣekas and the pointing-out instructions of the formless Jñānaḍākinī, the ninefold dharma of the formless ḍākinīs and so forth are practiced. This [approach] is called the Pointing-Out Instructions connected with the symbols.

da res bde mchog snyan brgyud yi ge med pa'i gsang lam zab mo'i man ngag ston par byed pa la dbang bskur (239) byin rlabs kyi smin byed zab mo 'di nyid kho nas rgyud smin par byed dgos pa yin/ de lta bu'i gsang ba bla na med pa'i sgor 'jug par byed pa la thog mar rgyud dag par byed pa'i bsags sbyangs mchog tu gyur pa bdun rnam dag gi tshogs bsags gal che bas/

Among those, now, in order to present the esoteric instructions on the secret, profound path of the Letterless Saṃvara Aural Transmission, it is necessary to mature your mindstreams solely through this profound means of maturation, the blessings of abhiṣeka. {239} In order to enter such a secret and unexcelled door, first, the sevenfold gathering of the accumulations—which is the supreme way of training and gathering [the accumulations] that will make your mindstream pure—is important.

mdun gyi nam mkhar bla ma dang yi dam gyi lha tshogs 'khor dang bcas pa bzhugs pa'i spyan sngar phyag 'tshal ba dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / dge ba la rjes su yi rangs ba dang / thun mong du skyabs su 'gro zhing sems bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan don du bsngo bar bgyi snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos gyis/

In the sky in front are seated the gurus and the assembly of yidam deities with their retinues. In their presence, thinking that you are paying homage, confessing your negative actions, rejoicing in virtue, taking refuge and arousing bodhicitta in the usual way, and dedicating the roots of virtue for the welfare of others, repeat the following:

rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po dang / / rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal mchod/ / bdag gis sdig pa gang bgyis dang / / bgyid du stsal dang yi rang gang / / sangs rgyas spyan sngar mchis nas ni/ / de dag thams cad bshags par bgyi/ /

I pay homage to and worship great Vajradhara and the Yoginī. I offer my body and possessions. Whatever negative actions I have done, have commanded to be done, or have rejoiced in, I confess all of them in the presence of the buddhas.
sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang / / rang rgyal dgra bcom 'gro rnams kyis/ / bsgoms dang bzlas brjod bsod nams la/ / de la bdag ni yi rang ngo / /
I rejoice in the merit gathered by the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and all beings through their meditations and recitations.
sems bskyed mngon par sangs rgyas nas/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi mchog / de la bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ /
I take refuge in the supreme of assemblies of bodhisattvas who have aroused bodhicitta, awakened fully, and turn the wheel of dharma.
sangs rgyas 'byung ba ji lta bar/ / skal ldan byang chub sems dpa' yis/ / byang chub sems ni bskyed pa ltar/ / de bzhin du ni sems bskyed do/ /
I arouse bodhicitta just as the fortunate bodhisattvas have aroused bodhicitta in the same way the buddhas have done.
bdag gi dge ba'i las rnams 'di dag gis/ / 'jig rten 'dir ni myur du sangs rgyas shog / 'gro la phan phyir chos rnams ston bgyid cing / / 'jig rten sdug bsngal mang pos gzir las sgrol/ /

May I, through all these virtuous actions, quickly become a buddha in the world. For the sake of beings, may I teach the dharma. May sentient beings be free from the torments of their many sufferings.
zhes lan gsum brjod/
Say that three times.
de nas dam la bzhag pa ni/ bdud rtsi lce la bzhag la/
Next, your commitment will be established. Place amṛta on their tongues and say:
'di ni khyod kyi dam tshig chu/ / dam tshig bsrungs na dngos grub thob/ / dam tshig nyams na sreg par byed/ / rdo rje bdud rtsi'i chu 'dis 'grub/ / ces brjod/
This is your samaya water. If you preserve samaya, you will achieve siddhi. If you transgress samaya, it will burn. You will become accomplished with this water of vajra amṛta.
rdo rje slob dpon gyi bka' nyan par dam la bzhag pa ni/ rdo rje spyi bor bzhag la/
Then say: Your commitment will be established with the strict command of the vajrācārya. Place a vajra on their heads and say:
deng nas brtsams te bu khyod kyi/ / rdo rje 'dzin pa nga yin gyi/ / nga yi bka' las 'da' mi bya/ / 'das na brlag (240) 'gyur dam tshig srungs/ / zhes brjod/
From now on, I am Vajradhara for you, child. Do not transgress my command. {240} If you do transgress it, you will be destroyed: preserve samaya.
de dag ni sngon 'gro'i rim pa ste yol ba phyi 'jug yin te snga ma'i cho ga rnams las byung ngo / /
Those are the stages of the preliminaries done outside the curtain. They are from the earlier rituals.
gnyis pa dbang gi dngos gzhi
2. The Main Practice
['di] la gsum ste/ ye shes kyi 'khor lo ru gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / rjes gnang sbyin pa'o/ /
This has three parts: (1) entering into the wisdom cakra, (2) bestowing the abhiṣekas, and (3) giving the authorizations.
dang po
a. Entering into the Wisdom Cakra
['di] la'ang gsum ste/ ye shes dbab pa/ me tog dor ba/ spyan 'dren cing lha ngo bstan pa'o/ /
This has three sections: (1) the descent of the wisdom ones, (2) throwing the flowers, and (3) opening the eyes and introducing the deities.
dang po ni
i. The Descent of the Wisdom Ones
yol ba phyi 'jug ltar na las kyi rdo rjes khrid nas nang du gral byas te bzhag la bla mas slob ma'i gnas gsum du/ oM AHhU~M brjod cing dri yi thig le byas la/
First, those who have been outside the curtain are led by the vajra assistant to sit inside. The guru, saying oṃ āḥ hūṃ, places scented drops at the three places of the disciples.

khyed rang rnams skad cig gis rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma sku mdog dmar mo mtshal li khri'i mdog lta bu zhal gcig phyag gnyis gri gug thod khrag 'dzin pa/ spyan gsum pa phyag rgya lngas brgyan zhing gru mo na kha T+wAM ga bcug pa/ gzi brjid nyi ma 'bum gyi 'od zer las ches 'bar ba de lta bu'i rtsa gsum 'dus pa'i mdor yi ge hrIHyig dmar po tsheg drag dang bcas pa las 'od zer 'phros pas u rgyan dang mkha' spyod dag pa'i zhing khams nas rang 'dra ba'i ye shes pa rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs dpag tu med pa spyan drangs/

Instantly, you become Jetsun Vajrayoginī, red in color, like vermillion. You have one face and two arms, holding a hooked knife and a skull cup with blood. You have three eyes, are adorned with the five mudrās, and hold a khaṭvāṃga in the crook of your elbow. You blaze with majesty greater than the light of hundreds of thousands of suns. At the junction of your three channels is the brilliantly red letter hrīḥ. Light rays radiating from that invite from Oḍḍiyāna and the pure lands of Khecarī innumerable vajraḍākinīs, wisdom ones like yourself.
dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
gnyis su med par gyur/
They become nondual.
oM badzra Ar+g+haM AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra arghaṃ āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du puSh+pe sogs dang / sarba pany+tsa a mr-i ta dang / badzra ma taM gis mchod la /
Similarly, offer: …puṣpe…sarva pañca amṛta…vajra mataṃgi…
dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / zhes sogs
Glorious Vajraḍākinī, [cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage and offer praise.]
sh+lo ka gcig gis bstod nas/
Praise with that one śloka.
da ye shes dbab pa'i don du gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos gyis/
Now, repeat the following supplication for the descent of the wisdom ones:

bla ma dpal ldan rdo rje rnal 'byor ma dpa' bo dang mkha' 'gro ma ma lus shing lus pa med pa thams cad kyis/ bdag la de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen po nam mkha' lta bu lham me lhan ne lhang nger mdzad du gsol/ zhes lan gsum du gsol ba gdab/

Gurus, glorious Vajrayoginī, heroes, and ḍākinīs, all, everyone with none left out, please confer upon me immutable great bliss, the wisdom of suchness, which is like space, sparkling, serene, and vivid. Supplicate three times.

de nas slob ma mdun du langs la rkang ba gnyis gshibs pa'i g.yas pa'i mthe bong gis g.yon pa mnan la/ rting pa cung zad yar bkyag / lag pa gnyis chos 'byung gi phyag rgya spyi bor bcings la lus drang por bsrang / mig gyen la ldog / ngag gi gnad ni 'jam rlung cung zad bzung / yid kyi gnad ni ting nge 'dzin 'di ltar sgoms mdzod ces brda sprad nas /

Now, disciples, stand up in front with both legs straight. Press down on your left big toe with your right big toe. Raise your heels slightly. Hold your hands in the source of dharmas mudrā above your head. Keep your body straight. Roll your eyes back. The vital point for your speech is to hold the gentle breath slightly. The vital point for your mind is to cultivate samādhi in this way. Thus, transmit the symbols. {241}

mdun gyi nam mkhar (241) bla ma dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i lha tshogs rnams kyi sku gsung thugs las 'od zer dmar po 'phros/ khyed rang rnams kyi lus ngag yid gsum la phog pas 'od du zhu nas/ thig le dmar po shin tu bde ba'i nyams dang ldan pa zhig dmar kyi li li byed par sgoms mdzod/ ces dpon slob gnyis kas dmigs pa drag tu gtad la/

From the bodies, speech, and minds of the guru and assembled deities of Vajrayoginī in the space in front, red light rays radiate. Meditate that these strike your body, speech, and mind, and that you dissolve into light, becoming a red bindu that is very blissful, spinning red. The ācārya and disciples focus intently on that visualization.

gu gul dang sha chen byi la nag po'i brun sogs 'bebs rdzas rnams kyi spos kyis bdug cing / slob dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das ma'i snying po drag tu brjod cing rol mo dkrol la skor cig phab/ de nas slar yang dmigs pa gsal gdab pa ni/

Fumigate with incense of descent substances, such as guggula, great flesh, and the scat of black cats. The ācārya recites the essence mantra of the Bhagavatī forcefully. Play music with a circle and roll down. Again, clarify the visualization.

de nas thig le de yongs su gyur pa las/ pad+ma dang nyi ma'i gdan la khyed rang slob ma rnams rdo rje rnal 'byor ma sku mdog phyag mtshan rgyan cha lugs dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur ba'i spyi bo bde chen gyi 'khor lor/ rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug tai lo pa sku mdog mthing nag / spyan rtsa dmar la 'khrugs pa/ rus pa'i rgyan cha drug dang ldan pa/ gar stabs su bzhengs shing phyag na cang te'u dang dril bu 'khrol bzhin pas/ zhabs g.yon skor kyi li li mdzad pa/

Next, the bindu transforms. On lotus and sun seats, you disciples become Vajrayoginī with her color and all her emblems, ornaments, and attributes exactly as they are. At the mahāsukhacakra in your head is the lord of yogins, Tilopa. He is dark blue with roaming bloodshot eyes. He has the six bone ornaments and stands in a dancing posture. While playing a changteu and ghaṇṭā, he twirls counterclockwise on his feet.

gsang gnas bde spyod kyi 'khor lo dga' ba 'khyil ba'i steng du rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma gar stabs kyi tshul du rgyan cha lugs dang ldan pas cang te'u dang dril bu 'khrol nas g.yon skor kyi li li byed pa/ de gnyis kyi bar du bde mchog lhan cig skyes pa sku chung la yan lag rags pa gzi brjid che zhing rgyan cha lugs dang ldan pas/ cang te'u dang dril bu 'khrol zhing zhal nas pheM pheM gyi sgra sgrog cing gar stabs kyi tshul du yar 'byon mar 'byon byed pa/

At the cakra of the enjoyment of bliss in the secret place, on top of a coil of joy, is Jetsun Vajrayoginī. In a dancing posture, with her ornaments and attributes, while playing a changteu and ghaṇṭā, she twirls counterclockwise. Between those two is Cakrasaṃvara Sahaja in a small form, with large limbs, majestic, and with all his ornaments and attributes. He plays a changteu and ghaṇṭā, makes the sounds of pheṃ pheṃ, and moves up and down in a dancing posture.

de dag rnams kyi 'od zer gyis mdun gyi nam mkhar bka' brgyud bla ma grub thob pho mo rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i lha tshogs sa gsum gyi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyis nam mkha' dang bar snang thams cad yongs su gang ba/ 'ur 'ur shig shig tu byon nas khyed rang rnams kyi ba spu'i bu gar thim/ bde stong gi nyams phri li li rgyud la skyes/ zhabs kyi pad+ma dang nyi ma'i gdan g.yas g.yon du 'khor bar (242) gyur/ zhes brjod la

Light rays from all of them [cause] the Kagyu lamas, the male and female siddhas, the assembled deities of Jetsun Vajrayoginī, and the heroes and yoginīs of the three planes, who are in the space in front, to fill the whole of space and everywhere in between. Coming with a roar and rush, they dissolve into your pores, arousing a tingling experience of bliss-emptiness. The lotus and sun seats at your feet turn clockwise and counterclockwise. {242}
bla mas snying po'i rjes su/ kA ya wakra tsit+ta hriM hri dza dzaH A we sha ya A we sha ya a AH zhes lan mang du phab pas/
The guru says after the essence mantra: kāya vak citta hriṃ hri ja jaḥ / āveśaya āveśaya a āḥ Saying that many times, [the wisdom ones] descend.
phebs pa'i tshe ye shes phebs pa de rang sems su ngo sprod pa'i don du bla mas snying po bzhi'i glu len pa ni/
During the descent, in order to point out that that descent of the wisdom ones is your own mind, the guru sings the song of the four essences:
ltos shig rang gi sems la ltos/ / sna tshogs chos rnams rang gi sems/ / sems ni stong nyid mtshan nyid med/ / 'od gsal mkha' ltar dri med pa/ /
Look: look at your own mind. All the various phenomena are your own mind. Mind is emptiness, devoid of characteristics, and luminosity, stainless, like space.
bde gshegs kun gyi gsang ba'i gnas/ / rnal 'byor ma dpal dngos nyid de/ / mthong bas ye shes bla na med/ / ltos shig ltos shig rigs kyi bu/ /
Seeing the source of the secret of the sugatas, the actual glorious Yoginī, look, look, child of good family, at unsurpassable wisdom.
zhes brjod la slob ma rnams kyi lus gnad bshig ste 'dug tu bcol la ye shes phebs pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid glur blang ba ni/
Tell the disciples to relax their physical posture and sit down. Sing the song of the characteristics of the signs of the descent of the wisdom ones:
sku lus la bab pa rnam pa gsum/ / gar dang mkha' spyod 'gro ba dang / / rnal 'byor ma yi sku nyid thob/ /
[Wisdom] body descending into your body is threefold: you dance, go to the celestial realm, and achieve the body of the Yoginī.
gsung ngag la bab pa rnam pa gsum/ / sna tshogs smra dang chos rnams ston/ / brjod med gsung nyid thob pa'o/ /
[Wisdom] speech descending into your speech is threefold: you speak in a variety of ways, teach the dharma, and achieve inexpressible speech.
thugs sems la bab pa rnam pa gsum/ / mi rtog pa dang bden pa mthong / / shes dang shes bya'i rang bzhin dag / rnal 'byor ma yi thugs nyid thob/ /
[Wisdom] mind descending into your mind is threefold: you see nonconceptuality and the truth, the natures of your cognitions and objects cognized are pure, and you achieve the mind of the Yoginī.
phyir mi ldog par the tshom med/ / ces ngo sprad par bya'o/ /
You will not regress—have no doubts. Thus, give the pointing out.
gnyis pa me tog dor ba ni/
ii. Throwing the Flowers
slob mas me tog sngar byin pa'am yang na bla mas yum gyi rtsa sngags bdun bzlas pa'i me tog gtad pa de me long gi sin+d+hU ra'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dor ba'i mos pas/

With the flowers they already have or with flowers given to them over which the guru has recited the root mantra of the female consort seven times, the disciples should have the sense that they toss them on the sindhūra maṇḍala [drawn on] a mirror.
pra tIts+tsha badzra hoH/
pratīccha vajra hoḥ
zhes brjod la me tog dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs su gtor ba de bla mas rnal 'byor ma'i thugs kar phog par mos la/
Saying that, throw the flowers in the direction of the maṇḍala. The guru, feeling that [the flowers] land on the heart of the Yoginī, says:

me tog de nyid bla ma rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i thugs kar phog pas khyed kyi tshe rabs kun gyi lhag pa'i lhar shes nas/ bla ma rdo rje rnal 'byor ma me tog dang dbyer med par spyi bor thim pa'i mos pa gyis shig /

By this flower striking the heart of the guru Vajrayoginī, recognize her to be your special deity throughout the succession of your lives. Feel that the flower, inseparable from the guru Vajrayoginī, dissolves into the top of your head.
ces me tog slob ma'i spyi bor bzhag la/ bla ma rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rtag tu mi 'bral bar spyi bor sgoms shig / ces brjod pas sbyin par bya'o/ /
Place flowers on the tops of the disciples’ heads and say: Meditate that the guru Vajrayoginī is never separate from the top of your head. Give them the flowers.
gsum pa spyan 'byed cing lha ngo bstan pa ni/
iii. Opening the Eyes and Introducing the Deities
khyed rnams kyis thog mar sin+d+hU ra ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas ma rig pa'i ling thog bsal nas/ thams cad mkhyen gzigs ye shes kyi spyan du gyur par mos mdzod/
To begin with, feel that your cataracts of ignorance are removed by relying on the sindhūra wisdom maṇḍala and that you have wisdom eyes, all-knowing and all-seeing.
oM badzra ne tra a pa ha ra pa Ta laM hriH zhes (243) brjod la spyan dar bkrol lo/ /
oṃ vajra naitra apahara paṭalaṃ hrīḥ {243} Remove their blindfolds.
de nas lha ngo bstan pa ni/
Next introduce the deities.
bla ma rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i lha tshogs mngon sum du mjal bar mos pa gyis shig
Feel that you will actually meet the assembled deities of the guru Yoginī.
kyai rigs kyi bu mchog thun mong gi dngos grub thams cad kyi rtsa ba bka' brgyud bla ma rnams la ltos shig / 'di mthong ba tsam gyis rigs gzhan du dman par grub pa mtha' dag las grol ba yin no/ /
Kye, child of good family, behold the Kagyu gurus, the roots of all supreme and common siddhis. Simply seeing them will free you from all inferior achievements in other families.
gsang ba bla na med pa'i gnas rnams 'dzin pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po bcu la ltos shig / 'di mthong ba tsam gyis theg pa'i gnas ngan len mtha' dag las grol ba yin no/ /
Behold the ten great lords of yogins, the holders of the secret, unsurpassable sources. Simply seeing them will free you from all negative propensities related to the yānas.
byin rlabs gyi rtsa ba rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la ltos shig / 'di mthong ba tsam gyis 'khor 'das rang bzhin gyis rang sar dag ste/ don da lta nyid du mthar phyin pa la the tshom med pa yin no/ /
Behold Vajrayoginī, the root of blessings. Simply seeing her, saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are naturally pure on the spot. Have no doubts about achieving your aims now.

phrin las kyi rtsa ba chos skyong rnams la ltos shig / 'di mthong ba tsam gyis bdud dang rgol ba ngan pa thams cad zil gyis gnon par nges pa yin no/ / zhes ngo sprad par bya'o/ / de ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo ru gzhug pa'o/ /
Behold the dharma protectors, the roots of activity. Simply seeing them definitely overpowers māras and evil adversaries. That is the pointing out. Now they can enter the wisdom cakra.
gnyis pa dbang bskur ba
b. Bestowing the Abhiṣekas
['di] la lnga ste/ bum pa'i dbang dang / gsang ba'i dbang dang / shes rab ye shes dang / tshigs dbang dang / byin rlabs bdud rtsis dbang bskur ba'o/
This has five parts: (1) the vase abhiṣeka, (2) the secret abhiṣeka, (3) the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka, (4) the word abhiṣeka, and (5) the abhiṣeka bestowed through consecrated amṛta.
dang po ni/
i. The Vase Abhiṣeka
slob mas maN+Dal phul/
The disciples offer a maṇḍala.
dbang dngos gzhi zhu ba'i don du gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos gyis/
Now, to request the main abhiṣekas, repeat the following supplication:
kye kye gsang ba chen po dgongs su gsol/ / skye med sku la brjod med gsung / / rtog med thugs kyi bum pa'i dbang / / bdag la sku drin stsal du gsol/ /
Kye kye, Great Secret, please consider me. Through your kindness, please bestow upon me the vase abhiṣeka of unborn body, inexpressible speech, and nonconceptual mind.
ces lan gsum brjod/
Say that three times.
de nas bla mas bum pa slob ma'i mgo thog tu bzung la/
Next the guru holds the vase above the disciples’ heads and says:
bum pa 'di khyod kyi spyi bor bzhag nas dbang bskur bas bla ma rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i thugs rab tu mi gnas pa'i ye shes khyod kyi rgyud la 'phos par sgoms shig / ces brjod la
Meditate that when this vase is placed on your heads and the abhiṣeka is bestowed, the nonabiding wisdom of the mind of the guru Vajrayoginī is transmitted to your mindstream.
dpon slob gnyis kas bsgoms la bum pa spyi bor bzhag la/
Thus, the ācārya and the disciples meditate. Place the vase on [the disciples’] heads and say:
hU~M rang byung bcom ldan rnal 'byor ma/ / gsang gsum bla med gnas las byung / / bder gshegs kun gyis phyag byas pa/ / rdo rje ye shes dbang bskur sbyin/ /
hūṃ Self-arisen Bhagavatī Yoginī, arising from the unexcelled abodes of the three secrets, worshipped by all sugatas, gives the abhiṣeka of vajra wisdom.
oM badzra wA rA hI/ sarba ta thA ga ta a b+hi Shiny+tsa tu mAM/ ces cung zad lag tu blugs la btung du gzhug /
oṃ vajravārāhī / sarvatathāgata abhiṣiñcatumāṃ Pour a little [vase water] into their hands and have them drink it. {244}
ji (244)ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni/ / lha rnams= lha yi= de bzhin dag pas sku=
Just as when [the Buddha] was born, the gods [bathed him,] now with [the pure water of the gods] I [bath your body].
oM sarba ta thA ga ta a b+hi She ka te sa ma ya shri ye hU~M/ zhes brjod pas bum chu cung zad sbyin pas spyi bo la sogs bkru'o/ /
oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekate samaya śrīye hūṃ Give them a little vase water and wash their heads and so forth.
dag pa brjod pa ni/
The pronouncement of purification.

de ltar bum pas dbang bskur bas lus kyi dri ma dag kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa sprul pa'i sku lhan skyes ye shes kyi rnal 'byor mar gyur/ bum pa'i dbang thob pa'i rtags su rigs kyi bdag po rdo rje sems dpas dbu brgyan par sgoms mdzod/

By bestowing the abhiṣeka with the vase, the stains of your body are purified. Your ālaya consciousness becomes the nirmāṇakāya Sahajā, Jñānayoginī. As a sign of having received the vase abhiṣeka, meditate that Vajrasattva crowns your head as the lord of the family.

rjes gnang la thog mar bum dbang dang 'brel ba'i rjes su gnang ba la rtsa ba bdun yan lag lnga dang bcu gsum yod pa'i dang po ni/ bla mas nor bu slob ma'i spyi bor bzhag la/ dngos grub kun gyi rtsa ba ste/ / bla ma rin chen zungs zhig bu/ / zhes brjod nas

For the authorizations, first there are the authorizations connected to the vase abhiṣeka: the seven roots and the five branches, making thirteen.[10] First, the guru places a gem on the disciples’ heads and says: Child, hold the root of all siddhis: the precious guru.
brda sprad pa ni/
Explaining [the significance of] the symbol.
rin po che 'di'i brda yis mtshon nas bla ma dam pa spyi bor 'bral med du sgoms shig
Having been shown this precious symbol, meditate that the genuine guru is never separate from the crown of your head.
de nas rnal 'byor ma'i sku byin la/
Then, give the body of the Yoginī and say:
mtshon pa sku yi dkyil 'khor du/ / brgyud pa yid bzhin nor bu zung / /
In the maṇḍala of body that is shown, hold the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Lineage.
zhes brda 'di yis mtshon nas lus lha ngag sngags sems ting nge 'dzin dang ma bral bar sgoms shig ces pa'o/ / snying po sngags kyi 'khor lo byin la/

Having been shown this symbol, meditate that your body is never separate from the deity, your speech is never separate from mantra, and your mind is never separate from samādhi. Give them the cakra of the essence mantra and say:
yig sngags kyi dkyil 'khor du/ / smin lam yid bzhin nor bu zung / /
In the maṇḍala of letters and mantras, hold the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Maturing Path.
zhes pa'i brda yis mtshon nas rgyu lam 'bras bu'i dbang rnams zung zhig ces pa'o/ / gser gyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa byin la/
Having been shown this symbol, hold the abhiṣekas of cause, path, and result. Give them a golden five-pointed vajra and say:
phyag mtshan thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du/ / gnas lugs yid bzhin nor bu bzang / /
In the maṇḍala of mind, the emblems, hold the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Abiding State.
zhes pa'i brdas mtshon nas gzhi lam 'bras bu'i man ngag rnams zung zhig ces pa'o/ / yon tan mtshon pa mda' gzhu byin la/
Having been shown this symbol, hold the esoteric instructions of ground, path, and result. Give them the bow and arrow, symbolizing excellent qualities, and say:
thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i/ / lam mchog rmad byung 'di zung zhig /
Hold this sublimely wondrous path in which method and prajñā are inseparable.
ces pa'i brdas mtshon nas thabs dang shes rab zung 'jug tu spyod cig ces so/ /
Having been shown this symbol, practice the unification of method and prajñā.
phrin las ni
Activity.
sna tshogs rdo rje phyin la/
Give them the viśvavajra and say:
sna tshogs nor bu ci bzhin du/ / sna tshogs rab 'byams las rnams zung / /
Embrace the infinite varied actions, as varied as gems are.
zhes pa'i brdas mtshon nas zhi rgyas la sogs pa'i las rab 'byams sgrubs shig ces pa'o/ /
Having been shown this symbol, undertake the infinite actions of pacifying, enriching, and so forth.
mchod pa ni
Offerings.
'ja' tshon byin la/
Give them the rainbow and say:
'gags med ye shes rol pa can/ / 'dod yon sna tshogs spyod cig bu/ /
Enjoy various sense pleasures with the play of unceasing wisdom. {245}
zhes pa'i brdas (245) mtshon nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i 'dod yon rtag tu spyod cig / ces pa'o/ /
Having been shown this symbol, enjoy the sense pleasures of gaṇacakras continuously.
de dag ni rtsa ba bdun gyi brda dbang ngo / /
Those are the seven root symbolic abhiṣekas.
yan lag la lta sgom spyod 'bras dam tshig dang lnga las dang po ni/ me tog byin la/
The branches are five: view, meditation, conduct, result, and samaya. First, give them flowers and say:
u dum wA ra'i me tog bzhin/ / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs rnams dang / / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma yi gsang / / bzung du yod de bstan du med/ / des na khyad 'phags thabs 'di zung / /
Like udumvāra flowers, this secret of the tathāgatas, the heroes, and Yoginī can be held but not taught. Therefore, hold it with special methods.
zhes pa'i brdas mtshon nas lta ba dri ma med pa rang bzhin gyis bsam gyis mi khyab par zung zhig ces pa'o/ /
Having been shown this symbol, hold the naturally inconceivable, stainless view.
de nas nyi zla sgom pa'i brda don bzung nas/ brda 'di yis mtshon nas kun rtog gi mun pa nyid gdod ma nas 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa la yin bzhin du sgoms shig ces pa'o/ /

Next, hold the symbol that shows the meaning of meditating on the sun and moon and say: Having been shown this symbol, meditate that, from the outset, the darkness of thoughts is of the nature of luminosity: that is how it is.
de nas shes rab kyi ral gri byin nas/ brda 'dis mtshon nas shugs 'byung 'gags med kyi ye shes de nyid rang shar thogs med du spyod cig ces pa'o/ /
Then, give them the sword of prajñā and say: Having been shown this symbol, cultivate, without impediment, the self-arising of the naturally occurring and unceasing wisdom.
phag gi dbu byin la/ brda 'dis mtshon te stong nyid snying rje'i 'bras bu lhun grub kyi ngo bo la re dogs med do zhes pa'o/ /
Give them the pig’s head and say: Having been shown this symbol, have no hopes or fears about the essence of the innately present result: emptiness-compassion.
de bzhin du rin po che man shel byin la/ brda 'dis mtshon te dam tshig la dri ma med par zung dang yon tan sna tshogs 'gags med du 'char ro zhes pa'o/ /
Give them a precious crystal and say: Having been shown this symbol, hold samaya flawlessly and various excellent qualities will arise without impediment.
de dag ni brda dbang bcu gsum te bum pa'i dbang grub pa'o/ /
Those are the thirteen symbolic abhiṣekas. This completes the vase abhiṣeka.
gnyis pa gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba ni/
ii. The Secret Abhiṣeka
ka pA la'i bdud rtsi slob ma'i spyi bor bzung la/
Hold the amṛta in the kapāla over the disciples’ heads.
hU~M rang byung bcom ldan rnal 'byor ma/ / gsang dbang bla med gnas las byung / / bde gshegs kun gyis phyag byas pa/ /
hūṃ Self-arisen Bhagavatī Yoginī, arising from the unexcelled abodes of the secret abhiṣeka, worshipped by all sugatas,…

snyan brgyud kyi yig cha snga ma la phyi bum dbang gi brda bcu gcig nang gsang dbang gi brda bcu gcig gsang ba sher dbang gi brda drug dang nyer brgyad byung yang 'dir de rnams bsdom par mdzad pa'o/ / byang sems bdud rtsis dbang bskur ro/ / zhes spyi bor bzhag cing lag tu cung zad sbyin la btung /

In the earlier Aural Transmission texts, there are eleven symbols for the outer vase abhiṣeka, eleven symbols for the inner secret abhiṣeka, and six symbols for the secret prajñā abhiṣeka, making twenty-eight. Here, however, they are combined. …bestows the abhiṣeka with the bodhicitta-amṛta. Place it on their heads, and pour a small amount into their hands to drink.

bdud rtsi'i btung bas khyod rang gi lus rtsa gnas kyi pho brang thams cad byang chub sems kyi bdud rtsis gang nas bde stong gi ye shes rgyud la skyes/ ngag gi dri ma dag kun gzhi'i ye shes longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku lhan skyes ye shes kyi rnal 'byor mar gyur pas gsang ba'i dbang thob pa la dga' ba bsgom par byos (246) shig

By drinking the amṛta, the palaces of the channel locations in your body are filled with the amṛta of bodhicitta, and the wisdom of bliss-emptiness arises in your mindstream. The stains of your speech are purified. Meditate with delight that through your ālaya wisdom becoming the saṃbhogakāya Sahajā, Jñānayoginī, you have received the secret abhiṣeka. {246}
dbang gsum pa shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba ni/
iii. The Third Abhiṣeka: The Prajnājnāna Abhiṣeka
sin+d+hU ra'i me long gi dkyil 'khor spyi bor bzhag la/
Place the maṇḍala of the sindhūra mirror on their heads and say:
hU~M rang byung bcom ldan rnal 'byor ma/ / gsang gsum bla med gnas las byung / / bder gshegs kun gyis phyag byas pa/ / lhan skyes dga' ba'i dbang bskur ro/ /
hūṃ Self-arisen Bhagavatī Yoginī, arising from the unexcelled abodes of the three secrets, worshipped by all sugatas, bestows the abhiṣeka of connate joy.

zhes brjod sin+d+hU ra'i srin lag gis blangs la slob ma'i dpral bar thig le byas la/ khyod rang gi dpral bar stong pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo dga' ba 'khyil ba dmar po g.yon du 'khor bar sgoms mdzod/

Take up some sindhūra on your ring finger, and place bindus on the disciples’ foreheads. Meditate that at your forehead is a red coil of joy, the essence of the wisdom of inconceivable emptiness, swirling counterclockwise.
gsang gnas su thig le byas la/ b+ha gar lhan skyes bde ba chen po'i ngo bo dga' ba 'khyil ba dmar po g.yon du 'khor bar sgoms/
Place bindus at their secret places. Meditate that at your bhaga is a red coil of joy, the essence of connate great bliss, swirling counterclockwise.
snying gar thig le bya/ de gnyis kyang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor bsam mdzod/
Place bindus at their hearts. Contemplate that although those are two, they are of a nondual essence.

des khyod la bde ba chen po ye shes mchog tu mi 'gyur ba rgyud la skyes/ sems kyi dri ma dag ngo bo nyid kyi kun gzhi chos kyi sku lhan skyes ye shes kyi rnal 'byor mar gyur/ shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob pa la dga' ba sgoms shig

Thus, the immutable wisdom of great bliss arises in your mindstream. The stains of your mind are purified. Your svabhāva ālaya becomes the dharmakāya Sahajā, Jñānayoginī. Meditate with delight that you have received the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka.
de nas dbang bzhi pa tshig dbang rin po che bskur ba ni/
iv. The Fourth Abhiṣeka: The Precious Word Abhiṣeka
bla mas rdo rje phyag tu bsnams nas 'di la ltos shig byas la lan gsum du gsor te/
The guru, holding a vajra, says, “Look,” while brandishing it three times.
phyag rgya chen po'i zhing khams na/ / bde chen rnal 'byor ma dpal bzhugs/ / byar med rtsol med skye 'chi med/ / mtshan nyid bral ba bsam mi khyab/ /
In the pure land of mahāmudrā, the glorious Mahāsukha Yoginī resides. [She is] nonaction, noneffort, without birth or death, beyond characteristics, and inconceivable.
de yang ming tsam brda tsam tha snyad tsam mo/ / zhes brjod pa
Even that is just a name, just a symbol, just a label.
brda don ngo sprad pa ni/ rdo rje ni
Pointing out the meaning of the symbols.
bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes so/ / lag mthil ni de yi gnas so/ / lan gsum gsor ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin no/
The vajra is inconceivable wisdom. The palm of the hand is its abode. Brandishing it three times [shows] its nondual nature.

des rang bzhin gyis rnam par dga' ba'i ye shes rgyud la skyes/ lus ngag yid gsum tha dad du 'dzin pa'i dri ma dag / kun gzhi'i khams nyid lhan cig skyes ma'i sku lhan skyes ye shes kyi rnal 'byor mar gyur/ tshig dbang rin po che thob pa la dga' ba bsgom par bya'o/ /

Thus, the wisdom of naturally pure joy arises in your mindstream. The stains of regarding your body, speech, and mind as separate are purified. The dhātu of your ālaya becomes the sahajākāya, Sahajā Jñānayoginī. Meditate with delight that you have received the precious word abhiṣeka.
brgyud pa'i byin rlabs bdud rtsis dbang bskur ba ni/
v. The Abhiṣeka Bestowed through Consecrated Amṛta
b+han+d+ha lcang lo can slob ma'i spyi bor bzhag la/
Place the bhandha with braided hair on the tops of the disciples’ heads.
hU~M/ he ru ka dpal bdud rtsi'i gzugs/ / bdud rtsi he ru ka'i rang bzhin/ / mi zad sku yi 'khor lo'i dbang / / gang bsten grol lo bu (247) rnams kye/ /
hūṃ The glorious Heruka is the form of amṛta. The amṛta is of the nature of the Heruka. Whoever relies on the abhiṣeka of the cakra of inexhaustible body will be liberated, kye children! {247}

zhes lag pa g.yas par bdud rtsi cung zad blugs nas byin la btung du bcug khyod kyi lag pa g.yas par byin zhing lce la bzhag ste btung bas la la nA'i rtsa gang bas sku mi zad pa rgyan gyi 'khor lo'i dbang thob par sgoms mdzod/ yang spyi bor bzung nas/

Pouring a small amount of amṛta into their right hands, give them the amṛta and have them drink it. Having given this into your right hand, placed it on your tongue, and having you drink this, it fills your lalanā channel. Meditate that you have received the abhiṣeka of the cakra of inexhaustible ornamented body. Again, hold [the bhandha with braided hair] on the tops of the disciples’ heads.
hU~M rnal 'byor ma dpal bdud rtsi'i gzugs/ / bdud rtsi rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin/ / mi zad gsung gi 'khor lo'i dbang / / gang bsten grol lo bu rnams kye/ /
hūṃ The glorious Yoginī is the form of amṛta. The amṛta is of the nature of the Yoginī. Whoever relies on the abhiṣeka of the cakra of inexhaustible speech will be liberated, kye children!

zhes lag pa g.yon par bdud rtsi blugs nas byin la btung / khyod kyi lag pa g.yon par byin zhing btung bas ra sa nA'i rtsa gang bas gsung mi zad pa rgyan gyi 'khor lo la dbang thob par bsgom/ de nas snying gar bzung la/

Pouring a small amount of amṛta into their left hands, give them the amṛta and have them drink it. Having given this into your left hand and having you drink this, it fills your rasanā channel. Meditate that you have received the abhiṣeka of the cakra of inexhaustible ornamented speech. Then, hold [the bhandha with braided hair] at the disciples’ hearts.

hU~M thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa/ / mkha' 'gro chos kyi sku can gyi/ / 'chi med ye shes bdud rtsi 'di/ / bla ma brgyud par legs 'ong ba'i/ / bdud rtsi'i rgyun lam ma chad par/ / mi zad thugs kyi 'khor lo'i dbang / / gang bsten grol lo bu rnams kye/ /

hūṃ This deathless wisdom amṛta— the inseparability of method and prajñā, the dharmakāya of the Yoginī— is an unbroken stream of amṛta coming from the transmission of the gurus. Whoever relies on the abhiṣeka of the cakra of inexhaustible mind will be liberated, kye children!
zhes lag pa gnyis kar byin nas lce la bzhag cing btung bas d+hU tI'i rtsa gnas gang nas thugs mi zad pa rgyan gyi 'khor lo la dbang thob par bsam mo/ /

Having given this into both your hands, placed it on your tongue, and having you drink it, it fills the places of your avadhūti channel. Meditate that you have received the abhiṣeka of the cakra of inexhaustible ornamented mind.
des ni khams kyi gnas bde ba chen po'i sku lhan skyes ye shes kyi rnal 'byor mar gyur/ sku gsung thugs mi zad pa rgyun gyi 'khor lo'i dbang thob pa la dga' ba bsgom par byos shig /

Then, the places of your dhātus become the mahāsukhakāya Sahajā, Jñānayoginī. Meditate with delight that you have received the abhiṣeka of the cakra of the inexhaustible continuity of body, speech, and mind.
'dir bdud rtsi'i phan yon cung zad bshad par bya ste/ gsang rgyud kyi bshad rgyud las/
Here, explain a little bit about the benefits of amṛta. The explanatory tantra of the Guhyasamāja Tantra says:
sha chen dam tshig mchog gi ni/ / rdo rje gsum po mchog 'grub 'gyur/ / bshang gci dam tshig mchog gi ni/ / rig pa 'dzin pa'i gtso mor 'gyur/ /
With the sublime samaya of great flesh, you will achieve the supreme three vajras. With the sublime samaya of feces and urine, you will become the principal one, a vidyādhara.[11]
zhes sogs rgyas par pha rgyud las kyang gsungs la/ ma rgyud mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur gyi rgyud las/
There are more extensive teachings in the father tantras. The Ḍākinī Vajrapañjarā of the mother tantras says:
mi bskyod bsten pa'i rnal 'byor pas/ / nad rnams thams cad spangs pa'o/ / rtag pa yis ni bde chen po/ / rdo rje nyi mas tsha rims sel/ /
Yogic practitioners who rely on Akṣobhya abandon all types of illnesses. Constantly, great bliss, Vajrasūrya, clears up heat diseases.
don yod grub pa rgyal po che/ / rdo rje nus pa 'byung bar 'gyur/ / dpal ldan don kun 'grub par byed/ / de phyir rnal 'byor pas bsten bya/ /
The great king Amoghasiddhi is the source of vajra energy and, endowed with glory, achieves all aims. Therefore, yogic practitioners rely on him.
mi bskyod 'byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa/ / lo ni lnga stong bar du rol/ / rtag (248)pa yis ni khri ru brjod/ / rdo rje nyi mas bye bar 'gyur/ /
The yoga arising from Akṣobhya is enjoyed for five thousand years. {248} It is said to be continuous for ten thousand. Vajrasūrya multiplies by ten million.
tshe dpag med pas grangs med de/ / mdun gyi nam mkhar ji bzhin bshad/ / rdo rje nyi ma dpag med gnyis/ / rtsa bar bsdus pa bsgrub pa'o/ /
Amitābha is said to be incalculable,[12] like the space in front. Vajrasūrya is two unfathomables,[13] condensing and producing the root.
'di gnyis bsten pa'i rnal 'byor pa/ / kun tu bzang dang mnyam pa 'gyur/ / shes rab pha rol phyin ye shes/ / rdo rje nyi ma zhes ni brjod/ /
Yogic practitioners who rely on these two become equal to Samantabhadra. The wisdom of prajñāpāramitā is called “Vajrasūrya.”
chos rnams kun gyi thabs la ni/ / de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag med/ / sangs rgyas rdo rje can nyid kyi/ / thabs dang shes rab skyed byed pa/ /
The method for all phenomena, the tathāgata Amitābha, generates the methods and prajñā of the buddha Vajrin.
khams gsum po ni thams cad bsdu/ / sa 'og sa steng sa bla yi/ / khrag dang khu ba'i rang bzhin bsdu/ / rdo rje dbang phyug gis ni gsungs/ /
What gathers all three realms, what gathers the natures of blood and semen, below the earth, on the earth, and above the earth, is said to be Vajreśvara.
sen mo sha dang de bzhin khams/ / khu ba la ni spyan ras gzigs/ / pags pa khrag ni snang byed che/ / rkang dang tshil bu rdo rje 'dzin/ /
Nails, flesh, the dhātus, and semen are Avalokiteśvara. Skin and blood are great Avabhāsakara. Marrow and fat are Vajradhara.
rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad mgon/ / mgon po'i klad pa rta mgrin rgyal/ / de la yan lag sangs rgyas lnga/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gros gsungs pa'o/ /
Vajra Vairocana is the protector. The brain of the protector is the king Hayagrīva. Those branches are the five buddhas. Vajrayoginī taught this.
sa yi khams ni rnam dag pas/ / spyan ni 'khor lo 'dzin ldan ma/ / rdo rje btsun mo'i de bzhin chu/ / drod ni pad+ma'i bu mo'o/ /
The earth dhātu is Purity. The eyes are Cakra Holding Lady. Vajra Queen is water. Heat is Lotus Girl.
rgyud dag bas ni sgrol ma ste/ / bzhi ni rdo rje'i btsun mo'o/ / de dag gur gyis gsungs pa ste/ / rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya'o/ /
The purity of continuity is Tārā. The four are Vajra Queen. Those are taught in the Pañjarā. They are called Vajrayoginī.[14]
ces sogs gsar rnying gi rgyud sde thams cad nas 'chi med sgrub pa'i bcud len dang dngos grub gnyis kyi rtsa bar gsungs pa ltar yid ches par bya'o/ / de ni dngos gzhi dbang bskur ba'i rim pa'o/ /

There are many other such statements. Be confident about [the benefits of amṛta] being in keeping with the teachings in the new and old tantras on the rasāyana that brings deathlessness and being the root of the two siddhis. That completes the bestowal of the main abhiṣekas.
gsum pa rjes su gnang ba ni
c. The Authorizations

['di la] bzhi ste/ gsang gsum mchog gi rjes su gnang ba dang / / byin rlabs 'bral med kyi rjes su gnang ba dang / khyad par dam tshig gi rjes su gnang ba dang / / gzhan don phrin las kyi rjes su gnang ba'o/ /

This has four parts: (1) the authorization of the supreme three secrets, (2) the authorization for never being separate from blessings, (3) the authorization of the special samayas, and (4) the authorization for the activity of benefiting others.
dang po ni/
First.

mdun gyi nam mkhar bka' brgyud bla ma rnams dang / /rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po bcu/ rdo rje rnal 'byor ma mkha' 'gro'i tshogs dang bcas pa thams cad kyi dpral ba nas 'od zer dkar po ldem ldem khyug khyug pa re byung nas slob ma'i smin mtshams su zhugs/ so so'i 'od zer gyi rgyud las so so'i sku yi (249) gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo so so'i sku kha dog dkar po gzi brjid dang ldan pa re rer byon nas dpral bar thim/ /

From the foreheads of the Kagyu gurus, the ten lords of yogins, and Vajrayoginī and her assembly of ḍākinīs, who are in the space in front, white light rays arise, pulsating and swirling, and enter the point between the eyebrows of you, the disciples. {249} From those streams of light rays appear the individual forms of their own bodies, white and majestic, the essences of the unimaginable secrets of their individual bodies. These dissolve into your forehead.
yang thams cad kyi mgrin pa nas 'od zer dmar po byung nas mgrin par zhugs pa'i rgyud nas so so'i sku kha dog dmar po re rer byon nas mgrin par thim/
Then, red light rays arise from all their throats and enter your throat. From the streams [of those light rays] appear individual red forms of their bodies, which dissolve into your throat.
yang thams cad kyi thugs ka nas 'od zer sngon po re byung nas snying gar phog pa'i rgyud nas so so'i sku kha dog sngon po re rer byon nas snying gar thim pas/ /
Again, light rays arise from all their hearts and strike your heart. From the streams [of those light rays] appear individual blue forms of their bodies, which dissolve into your heart.
bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi yon tan thams cad rang la rdzogs pas sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbang thob par sgoms mdzod/ /

Since the excellent qualities of the bodies, speech, and minds of the gurus, yidams, and ḍākinīs are complete within you, meditate that you have received the abhiṣekas of the unimaginable secrets of body, speech, and mind.
gnyis pa 'bral med kyi rjes su gnang ba ni/ /
Second: The authorization for never being separate [from blessings].
bla ma dang me long gi sin+d+hU ra srin lag gis byugs shing rjes zlos kyi tshul du dpon slob gnyis kas ngag tu brjod pa ni/ /
With your ring finger, rub the sindhūra on the mirror held by the guru. In the manner of repetition, both the ācārya and the disciples say the following:
deng nas bzung ste tshe rabs thams cad du/ / bka' brgyud bla ma rnams dang mi 'bral shog / mtshan ldan bla ma rje dang mi 'bral shog /
From now on, in all my successive lives, may I never be separated from the Kagyu gurus. May I never be separate from authentic gurus.
mgrin par byugs la/ /
[The disciples] anoint their throats and say:
deng nas bzung ste tshe rabs thams cad du/ / rnal 'byor dbang phyug bcu dang mi 'bral shog / rje btsun tai lo pa dang mi 'bral shog /
From now on, in all my successive lives, may I never be separated from ten lords of yogins. May I never be separate from the exalted Tilopa.
snying gar byugs la/ /
[The disciples] anoint their hearts and say:
deng nas bzung ste tshe rabs thams cad du/ / ma tshogs mkha' 'gro rnams dang mi 'bral shog / lhan skyes rnal 'byor ma dang mi 'bral shog /
From now on, in all my successive lives, may I never be separated from the ḍākinīs of the assembly. May I never be separate from the Sahajā Yoginī.
yan lag kun tu byugs la/ /
[The disciples] anoint their limbs and say:
deng nas bzung ste tshe rabs thams cad du/ / chos skyong srung ma rnams dang mi 'bral shog / ye shes mgon po rnams dang mi 'bral shog /
From now on, in all my successive lives, may I never be separated from the dharma protectors and guardians. May I never be separate from the Wisdom Protector.
ces brjod la byin no/ /
Say that and give them the mirror.
gsum pa khyad par dam tshig gi rjes su gnang ba ni/
Third: The authorization of the special samayas.

khyed rang rnams kyis zab pa dang rgya che ba gnyis su med pa'i dam tshig gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyi'i dam tshig rnams dang / / nang gi dam tshig brgyad kyis bsdus pa dang / phyi nang gi dam tshig ma nyams par srung bar gyis shig / ces brjod par bya'o/ /

You must preserve without impairment what contain the profound and vast nondual three samayas: the outer samayas, the inner samayas, which are contained within the eight, and the outer and inner samayas.
bzhi pa gzhan don phrin las kyi rjes su gnang ba ni/ /
Fourth: The authorization for the activity of benefiting others.
snyan brgyud kyi glegs bam slob ma'i lag tu gtad la/ /
The Aural Transmission volume is placed in the hands of you, the disciples.
deng nas bzung ste srid zhi ji srid bar/ / lhan skyes ye shes gsang ba'i rnal 'byor (250) ma/ / sku gsung thugs kyi phrin las dpag med kyis/ / sems dang sems mchog ma lus don grub mdzod/ /

From now on, as long as existence and peace endure, {250} may the unfathomable activities of the body, speech, and mind of the Yoginī of secret connate wisdom bring benefit to all minds and supreme minds.

kye rigs kyi bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / gzhan yang gdul bya mchog rnams kyi don gyis shig / de ni rjes su gnang ba ste dngos gzhi dbang bskur ba'i rim pa ma lus pa thob pa yin pas bla ma la gus pa sogs rtsa ba dang yan lag gi dam tshig mtha' dag srung snyam pa'i blos 'di'i rjes zlos gyis/

Kye. Child of good family, be of benefit to the world, to those who transcend the world, and especially to supreme disciples. Now, since you have received the authorizations and all the stages of the main abhiṣekas, thinking that you will preserve all the root and branch samayas, such as respecting the gurus, repeat the following:
gtso bos ji ltar bka' stsal pa/ / zhes sogs dang /
Whatever the principal one commands, [all that I will do.] And:
deng nas bzung ste bdag bran du/ / zhes sogs brjod pa dang gtang rag gi maN+Dal 'bul lo/ /
From today onward, I offer myself, [to you as a servant. Please accept me as a disciple, and use any part of me.] Offer a maṇḍala as thanks.

'di ni yum bka'i gzhung ma nyams par gzhan gyi don du dbang bskur ba'i rim pa yin la/ rang gis sgrub mchod byas nas bdag 'jug len pa lta bu la ni/ slob ma la brjod bya thams cad bzhag la gzhan slob ma la ci ltar bskur ba'i lag len ltar rang gis dbang len pa'i tshul de shes par bya'o/ /

This is the process of bestowing the abhiṣekas for the benefit of others using the flawless Yum Ka texts. To do this as self-entering, having done the sādhanapūjā yourself, know that you leave out what is said to the disciples, and, for the rest, you take the abhiṣekas yourself according to the procedure for conferring on the disciples.
spyi don gsum pa rjes kyi rim pa la/
III. The Third General Topic: The Concluding Section

thog mar tshogs mchod 'bul ba'i rim pa ni/ sngon nas bshams pa'i tshogs rdzas rnams phud chu chang gis bran zhing nang mchod kyi bdud rtsi gtor la/ oM badzra khaN+Da ro hi sa bsang / oM swa b+hA wa sa sbyang zhing thog mar nang mchod ltar byin gyis brlabs nas/

First, the stages of offering the gaṇapūjā. Sprinkle the previously arranged feast substances with select water and alcohol. Sprinkling them with the inner-offering amṛta, cleanse with oṃ vajra khaṇḍarohi and purify with oṃ svabhāva. First, consecrate as done with the inner offering. Then:
na mo thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo rgya chen po zhes pa nas/ ga Na tsakra khA hi/
namo This vast gaṇacakra in which method and prajñā are not dual,[*10] ………………………………………………. gaṇacakra la khāhi
zhes pa lan gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pas kyang 'thus par 'dug na'ang rgyas par spro na/ yab bka' las 'byung ba'i tshogs lha spyan 'dren/
Say that three times for the consecration. That will suffice. However, if you wish to elaborate, do the invocation of the feast deities that occurs in the Yab Ka [rituals].
hU~M bzhengs shig bla ma rnams bzhengs shig / ces sogs bla ma yi dam chos skyong spyan drangs la/
hūṃ Arise, gurus, arise…[*11] Inviting the gurus, yidams, and dharma protectors, say:

hU~M phyag rgya chen po'i gzhal yas nas/ / bka' brgyud bla ma 'khor bcas la/ / zhes sogs tshang bar tshogs chen ltar tshogs rdzas bstab cing tshogs phud sogs bzhag gong du gtor bsngos ma byas pa'am/ byas kyang chos skyong bka' srung rnams kyi gtor chog mchod 'grigs skong bshags la sogs dus skabs dang bstun te rgyas bsdus ci ltar rigs pa byed pa shin tu gal che zhing / yum bka' 'di shin tu bka' gnyan pas tshogs gtor bskang gsol gal che gsungs nas nan tan mdzad pa'i srol 'dug go /

hūṃ In the palace of mahāmudrā, to the Kagyu gurus and their retinues,[*12] Do that in its entirety. As done in great feasts, serve the feast substances and arrange the select portion of the feast and so forth. Previously a torma may not have been dedicated, or, even if it was, in keeping with the occasion, it is very important to do a torma ritual, the arranging of offerings, restoration, confession, and so forth for the dharma protectors and dharma guardians, extensive or abbreviated, as is appropriate. It is taught that since there is a very strict command in relation to this Yum Ka, the restoration-supplication is important. Therefore, it is the custom to do those with exertion. {251}

de nas rdo rje slob dpon nas bzung ste dkyil 'khor pa rnams la (251) tshogs phud 'bul ba bdud rtsi 'gyed pa sogs rdzas bstab pa'i lan dang bcas pa yab bka' dang tshogs chen gyi dus ltar byas nas tshogs la longs spyad/ phud lhag bsdus nas slob dpon gyi lhag mas gong mnan zhing slob dpon gyis 'bar ba'i phyag rgya'i bar nas chang gi kha phru'i bdud rtsi bran la/

Then, enjoy the feast, as done in the Yab Ka [rituals] and on the occasions of great feasts, by serving the substances, accompanied by the reply: offer the select feast to the maṇḍala beginning with the vajrācārya, distribute the amṛta, and so forth. Gather the select leftovers and put the ācārya’s leftovers on top. The ācārya, with the blazing mudrā, sprinkles amṛta that is alcohol spit.

hU~M gzhan yang las kyi mkha' 'gro ma/ / zhes sogs bzhi ka 'don ba phag mo'i lugs yin snang bas de ltar bya/ rdo rje'i glu sngags dang tshig gi sgo nas len/ 'bul gtor bdun po rdo rje phag mo/ mkha' dbyings bde chen/ gnas mchog nyer bzhi/ 'jig rten mkha' 'gro yan lha so bdun dang / bka' srung e ka dzA Ti/ lha mo dud sol ma/ chos skyong phyag bzhi pa rnams 'di'i bka' srung yin pas 'bul/ de nas lhag po yod na dur khrod brgyad dang dbang mo nyer brgyad/ tshe ring ma brtan ma rnams la 'bul/

hūṃ Karmaḍākinīs,…[*13] Since it is the Vārāhī custom to recite those four, do that. Sing vajra songs using mantras and verses. There are seven offering tormas: Vajravārāhī, Khaying Dechen,[15] [the deities of] the twenty-four supreme places, the thirty-seven deities up to and including the worldly ḍākinīs, the dharma guardian Ekajāṭi, the goddess Vetali, and the dharma protector Four-Armed One. Since they are the dharma guardians here, offer to them. Then, if there are extra [tormas], offer them to the eight charnel grounds, the twenty-eight powerful ladies, and Tseringma and the sthāvarās.
de nas rjes kyi cho ga dngos la mchod pa kha gsos nas/ byin rlabs dang mchod bstod rgyas bsdus long skabs dang bstun par byas la
Next, for the actual concluding ritual, replenish the offerings. Do the consecration, offerings, and praises in either an extensive or abbreviated way, depending on your time.
bzod par gsol ba ni/
The request for patience.
ma 'byor pa dang nyams pa dang / / gang yang bdag rmongs blo yis ni/ /
With anything missing or done wrong, or things I did or had others do [out of my ignorance, protectors, please be patient.]
zhes sogs yab bka'i cho ga ji ltar 'byung ba ltar gyis bzod gsol dang / yig brgya/ 'dod gsol smon lam gdab pa rnams bya'o/ /
As done in the Yab Ka rituals, request patience, [recite] the hundred syllables, and make aspiration prayers for [the fulfillment of] your desired aims.

Although the expression of auspiciousness according to the extensive Yab Ka [rituals] is excellent,
hU~M bka' brgyud bla mas legs byin pa'i/ /
“By the excellent gift of the Kagyu gurus,”[*14]
rtag tu ye shes thugs rje yis/_/ gzigs shing chos skur ngo sprod pa'i/_/ byin brlabs mchog gi bkra shis shog_/
[*14] Who look on constantly with wisdom and kindness And transmit the dharmakāya, May the goodness of supreme blessings be present.
rdo rje phag mos legs byin pa'i/_/ gsang sngags mchog gi cho ga la/_/ lus ngag yid gsum mthu grub pa'i/_/ dngos grub mchog gi =_/
By the excellent gift of Vajravārāhī, The sādhana of the supreme secret mantra Bestows the power of body, speech, and mind. May the goodness of supreme siddhi be present.
rdo rje mkha' 'gros legs byin pa'i/_/ sems nyid 'od gsal 'dus ma byas/_/ gnyis med dpe bral don rtogs pa'i/_/ phyag rgya chen po'i=/
By the excellent gift of the Vajraḍākinī, Mind is realized as uncreated, luminous, Nondual, beyond analogy. May the goodness of mahāmudrā be present.
sangs rgyas mkha' 'gros =_/ chos rnams rang bzhin rang gi sems/_/ rgyud 'di chos kyis ma bcings pa'i/_/ chos kyi phyag rgya'i =_/

pad+ma mkha' 'gros =_/ thabs dang shes rab gnyis med sbyor/_/ bde chen ye shes thabs kyi mchog_/ gsang ba shes rab=_/
By the excellent gift of the Padmaḍākinī, Upāya and prajñā are nondually joined In the supreme upāya of mahāsukhajñāna. May the goodness of the secret prajñā be present.
las kyi mkha' 'gros=_/ rnal 'byor dam tshig ldan pa la/_/ zhi dang rgyas la sogs pa yi/_/ las rnams 'grub pa'i=_/
By the excellent gift of the Karmaḍākinī, Yogins who possess the samaya Are able to perform pacifying, enriching, and so on. May the goodness of those actions be present.
'jig rten mkha' 'gros=_/ 'gro ba'i bsam pa rab shes nas/_/ thabs rnams du mas 'dul mdzad pa/_/ mngon shes drug ldan=_/
By the excellent gift of the Lokaḍākinīs, We know the minds of beings And tame them by various means. May the goodness of the six super-knowledges be present.
dpa' bo rnams kyis=_/ rdo rje gsum gyi 'od zer gyis/_/ bgegs rigs stong phrag zhi ba dang*/_/ sku gsung thugs kyi=_/
By the excellent gift of the ḍākas, The light rays of the three vajras Pacify the thousand kinds of obstructing forces. May the goodness of body, speech, and mind be present.

By the excellent gift of the devīs, Through gathering and expanding the five elements We please the sugatas. May the goodness of pure offering be present.
chos skyong rnams kyis=_/ 'khor bzang longs spyod ldan pa dang*/_/ nad dang gdon las thar ba yi/_/ bar chad med pa'i=_/
By the excellent gift of the dharmapālas, We enjoy good attendants and wealth, Freedom from disease and döns. May the goodness of no-hindrance be present.
zhes sogs kyi shis pa rgyas par brjod pa ni snyan brgyud yum bka'i lugs yin pas legs par mngon no/ /
…is an extensive expression of auspiciousness that is clearly excellent since it is the custom of the Yab Ka Aural Transmission.

rdo rje 'chang dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma/ / rgya bod grub thob brgyud pa'i snyan brgyud kyi/ / bcud kyi yang zab smin byed zab mo'i lam/ / 'dren mchog bla mas bka' stsal rjes gnang zhing / / gus ldan slob mas bskul ngor bkod 'di yang / / gzhung las gzhan pa'i slad 'khris ma bcug cing / /

The profound path, the means of the most profound maturation— the elixir of the Aural Transmission, the transmission from Vajradhara, Vajrayoginī, and the Indian and Tibetan siddhas— was arranged in response to the order and authorization given by the supreme guide, my guru, and the urging of respectful disciples.
dgongs don ci bzhin bkod par mos na yang / / go rim 'khrul dang brjod pa de'i tshig zur sogs/ / nongs pa chos bdag mkha' 'gros bzod bzhes la/ / sgrib med tshangs pa mchog gi dngos grub stsol/ /

Even though this does not introduce anything corrupt, which is not found in the main texts, and has been arranged according to the intended meaning, may the dharma masters and ḍākinīs be patient with any confused sequencing or mistakes in the words or verses for recitation, and so forth. Please bestow the unobscured pure supreme siddhi.

rnam dkar dge ba'i legs tshogs gang mchis pa/ / chos bdag gong ma rnams dang chos bdag la/ / mchod pas 'chi med bdud rtsi'i rgyun lam gyis/ / sgrub brgyud chu bo'i klung ltar rgyas pa des/ / ma rgan sems can smin cing grol gyur cig /

Whatever accumulation there is of virtue, it is offered to the previous dharma lords and [my] dharma lord. May the stream of deathless amṛta increase the practice transmission like a summer river, maturing and liberating my mother sentient beings.

ces snyan brgyud lhan cig skyes ma'i yum bka' rgyas pa'i cho ga dbang chog dang bcas pa 'di yang / bya bral kun dga'i ming can gyis rmo nyin dkar lha yi pho (252) brang du 'brug lo zla ba dang po'i yar tshes bzang po la bris pa

This liturgy with the abhiṣeka ritual of the extensive Yum Ka of the Aural Transmission Sahajā was written by the renunciate with the name of Kunga in the palace of Monyin Karlha[16] during the excellent waxing period of the first month of the Dragon year.[17] {252}
shU b+ha mastu sarba dza ga tA ma/
śūbhamastu sarvajagatām
bkra shis par gyur cig dge'o/ / legs so// //(253)
May there be auspiciousness. May there be virtue. May there be excellence. {253}
@#/ /mai tri lugs kyi sdom pa bcu gsum ma'i sgo nas thod dbang me'i 'khor lo'i byin rlabs bya ba'i lag len bde drod dpung bskyed ces bya ba bzhugs so//
23. Arousing the Forces of Bliss and Heat. Procedures for the Blessings of the Skull-Cup Abhiṣeka, the Fire Cakra, Bestowed through the Thirteen Saṃvara Deities in the Maitrīpa Tradition[1]
(254)@#/ /na mo gu ru tsakra sam+ba rA ya/
namo guru cakrasamvarāya
mtshan dang rig sngags sku yi rnam 'gyur gyis/ / de nyid mchog tu grol ster bde ba mchog / dbyer med bla ma'i zhabs la gus btud nas/ / snyan brgyud me dbang zab mo bklag chog dgod/

I bow with respect at the feet of the guru inseparable from Saṃvara, bestower of the supreme liberation of suchness through the manifestations of his kāya with the marks and awareness mantra. I will arrange the liturgical text of the profound Aural Transmission fire abhiṣeka.
dpal ldan 'brug pa'i bka' srol mai tri snyan brgyud las byon pa rdo rje'i tshig rkang gi dngos bstan ye shes me'i dbang bskur ba
The abhiṣeka of wisdom fire, which is explicitly taught in the Vajra Verses, comes from the Aural Transmission of Maitrīpa in the tradition of the glorious Drukpa [Kagyu].
['di] la gsum/ sngon 'gro yo byad sta gon/ dngos gzhi dbang gi las rim/ rjes kyi bya ba rnams so/
It has three parts: (1) the preliminary requisite items: the prelude; (2) the procedures for the main abhiṣekas; and (3) the concluding section.
dang po ni/
I. The Preliminary Requisite Items: The Prelude

dben pa'i gnas su stegs bu bzang po dar ras kyis bkab la me tog sil ma bkram/ de'i dbus pho thad mtshan ldan chang gis bkang ba'i nang du/ sga pi pho gsum/ shing tshwa/ a ru ra/ lan tshwa cung zad/ bur sbrang rnams btab/ me long la cu gang dang sin+d+hU ra chang sbyar gyis byugs la bde mchog yab yum gyi nye snying bris pas kha bcad la dar dmar gyis bkab/ mchod yon dang nyer spyod g.yon bskor du bsham/ las bum/ 'bul gtor/ tshogs kyi yo byad/ slob dpon gyi mdun du/ nang mchod/ DA dril sogs nyer mkho rnams tshogs par bya'o/

In an isolated place, cover a well-made small stand with a silk cloth and spread bits of flowers. In the center, place an authentic male skull cup filled with alcohol.[2] Inside that put ginger, pipiling [long pepper], black pepper, cinnamon, chebulic myrobalan,[3] a pinch of salt, molasses, and honey. Smear a compound of bamboo juice, sindhūra, and alcohol on a mirror, and inscribe it with the quintessence mantras of the Saṃvara male and female consorts. Arrange a red silk as its covering. In a counterclockwise circle, set out the offering water and the traditional offerings. Have an activity vase, offering torma, and feast items. In front of the ācārya, gather all the necessary things, such as the inner offering, ḍamaru, and ghaṇṭā.
gnyis pa
II. The Procedures for the Main Abhiṣekas
['di] la gnyis/ dbang don sgrub mchod dang dbang bskur ba dngos so/
This has two parts: (1) the sādhanapūjā for the sake of the abhiṣekas and (2) the actual bestowal of the abhiṣekas.
dang po
A. The Sādhanapūjā for the Sake of the Abhiṣekas
['di] la bdag mdun gnyis las
This has two sections: (1) the self [visualization] and (2) the front [visualization]. {255}
thog mar bdag (255) bskyed ni/
1. The Self Visualization
slob dpon he ru'i ka'i chas bya bar gsung kyang mi 'grub na der mos pa dang dpral bar mtsham gyis ram yig bris la 'khod/
It is taught that the ācārya should have the accoutrements of a heruka. However, if you are not able to do that, imagine them and draw the letter ram on your forehead with vermillion.
dang po rnal 'byor la 'jug pa'i yan lag
a. The Branches for Entering the Yoga
rang skad cig gis he ru ka'i skur gsal bas/ bdud rtsi byin rlabs byas nas myang ba dang / skyabs 'gro/ sems bskyed/ rdor sems he ru ka'i sgom bzlas rnams bde mchog yab yum spyi ltar btang /

Instantly I am the form of the Heruka. Visualize that. Consecrate the amṛta and taste it, take refuge, arouse bodhicitta, and do the meditation and recitation of Heruka Vajrasattva as is generally done in [the practices of] the Saṃvara male and female consorts.
tshogs bsag pa ni/
Gathering the accumulations.

rang nyid skad cig gis dpal he ru ka sku mdog sngon po zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa yum dang bcas par gsal ba'i thugs kar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i hU~M sngon po las 'phros pa'i 'od zer lcags kyu'i dbyibs can gyis/ bla ma dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs mdun gyi nam mkhar

Instantly I am the glorious Heruka, blue, with four faces and twelve arms with my consort. At my heart, resting on a sun maṇḍala is a blue hūṃ. Light rays in the form of iron hooks radiate from that, inviting the gurus and the assembly of deities of the maṇḍala into the space in front.
badzra sa mA dzaH
vajra samājaḥ
gang gis 'khor ba'i nyes pa ni/ / dran pa tsam gyis 'joms mdzad cing / / bla med byang chub thob mdzad pa'i/ / bla ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To those who destroy the flaws of saṃsāra when I simply recollect them, who have achieved the highest awakening, to the feet of the gurus, I pay homage.
dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ni/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor los sgyur/ / ye shes lnga dang sku gsum nyid/ / 'gro ba skyobs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Glorious Vajraḍākinī, cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage.
ji snyed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / (256)kun tu rtog pa'i 'ching gcod cing / / 'jig rten bya ba rab 'jug ma/ / de snyed rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
To all the many vajraḍākinīs {256} who cut through the bonds of concepts and engage the things of the world, to all of them, I pay homage.
slar yang rang gi snying ga'i hU~M las 'phros pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo mchod rdzas du ma thogs pa rnams kyis nam mkha' khengs par gyur/
Next, from the hūṃ in my heart, offering goddesses holding offering substances stream forth and fill the space.
ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni/ / lha rnams kun gyis khrus gsol ltar/ / lha yi chu ni dag pa yi/ / de bzhin bdag gis sku khrus gsol/ /
Just as when [the Buddha] was born the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bathe your body.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta a b+hi She ka ta sa ma ya shri ye hU~M/ zhes mchod yon phul/
oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya śriye hūṃ Thus, present the offering water.
oM AHbadzra puSh+pe hU~M/ de bzhin du/
oṃ aḥ vajra puṣpe hūṃ Similarly:
d+hu pe/ A lo ke gan+d+he/ nai wi d+ya/ oM AHbadzra g+haN+Da ra Na hU~M/
…dhūpe…āloke…gandhe…naividya oṃ āḥ vajra ghāṇḍaraṇa hūṃ

ri rab gling bzhi gling phran nyi zla lcags rir bcas/ / rin chen sna bdun gter gyi bum pas legs bkang nas/ / bdag lus longs spyod snang srid bcas pa kun 'bul na/ / thugs rje chen pos dgongs te bzhes nas bskyab tu gsol/ /

Meru, the four continents, the subcontinents, sun, moon, and iron mountains are filled with the seven kinds of jewels and treasure vases. I offer all that along with my body, possessions, and all possible appearances. With your great compassion, please consider me, accept this, and grant refuge.
bdag gis thog ma med pa'i dus mtha' nas/ / byas dang byed du bcug dang yi rang ba'i/ / sdig pa ma lus skyon kun 'jigs byed pa'i/ / spyan sngar so sor bshags shing slar yang ni/ /
Whatever mistakes and negative actions I have done, caused to be done, or rejoiced in— from beginningless time— I confess each and every one in the presence of Bhairava.
mi bgyid pa yi sdom pa blang bar bgyi/ / nyan thos rang rgyal bla med byang chub sems/ / rgyal ba'i sras pos bsags pa'i dge ba gang / / de dag la ni rjes su yi rang zhing / /
I make the commitment to never do them again. I rejoice in all the virtue accumulated by śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the buddhas’ children, the highest bodhisattvas.

byang chub tu ni yang dag bdag gis bsngo/ / rgyal ba la sogs dkon mchog gsum po la/ / dngos po kun gyis bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ / byang chub tu ni sems bskyed de bzhin du/ / bla na med pa'i lam la brten par bgyi/ /
I dedicate it to true awakening. In the three jewels, the victors and the others, I take refuge with all things. Just as they aroused bodhicitta, I will rely on the unsurpassable path.
'gro ba'i don phyir sangs rgyas phrin las rnams/ / ma lus rdzogs par bdag gis bgyid par shog mdun gyi lha dang bla ma rang la thim par gyur/
For the sake of beings, may I enact perfectly all the activities of the buddhas. The deities and gurus in front dissolve into me.
sems can thams cad bde ba dang sogs tshad med bzhi bsgom/

May all sentient beings have happiness [and the causes of happiness. May all sentient beings be free from suffering and the causes of suffering. May all sentient beings never be separated from the genuine happiness that is free from suffering. May all sentient beings abide in the great equanimity that is free from attachment and aggression to those near and far.] Thus, cultivate the four immeasurables. {257}
rnal 'byor dngos
b. The Actual Yogas
['di] la dgu las
This has nine parts.
dang po 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ni/
i. The Yoga for Entering
oM (257)shU n+ya tA dz+nyA na badzra swa b+hA wa Arma ko‘haM/ sarba d+harma shU n+ya ta dz+nyA na badzra swa b+hA wa Arma ko‘haM/
oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ / sarvadharma śūnyata jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ[4]
rang nyid mi gnas pa'i bdag nyid can gyi stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la gnas pa 'gyur/
I abide as the nature of emptiness, the embodiment of nonabiding.
gnyis pa ldang ba'i rnal 'byor ni/ /
ii. The Yoga of Arising

stong pa'i ngang las nam mkha'i gnas su/ rang gi sems nyid yi ge hU~M nag po gcig tu gyur/ hU~M de las yi ge yaM gcig chad pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po gzhu'i dbyibs can yaM gyis mtshan pa/ de'i steng du raM gcig chad pa las me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum ra~M gyis mtshan pa/ de'i steng du baM gcig chad pa las chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po zlum po baM gyis mtshan pa/ de'i steng du laM gcig chad pa las sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po gru bzhi pa laM gyis mtshan pa/ /

Within emptiness, in the location of space, my mind-itself becomes a single black hūṃ. From that hūṃ, a single letter yaṃ manifests, from which appears a blue wind maṇḍala in the shape of a bow, marked by yaṃ. Above that, a single raṃ manifests, from which appears a red fire maṇḍala, a triangle marked by raṃ. Above that, a single vaṃ manifests, from which appears a white water maṇḍala, a circle marked by vaṃ. Above that, a single laṃ manifests, from which appears a yellow earth maṇḍala, a square marked by laṃ.

de'i steng du suM gcig chad pa las byung ba'i ri rab gru bzhi bang rim bzhi pa rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin can/ de'i steng du paM gcig chad pa las sna tshogs pad+ma yangs shing rgya che ba'i dbus su hU~M gcig chad pa las/ sna tshogs rdo rje rgya gram shar dkar/ lho ser/ nub dmar/ byang ljang ba'i kha dog can gyi lte bar hU~M gis mtshan pa las 'od 'phros/

Above that, a single suṃ manifests, from which appears Meru, square with four terraces of the natures of four types of jewels. Above that, a single paṃ manifests, from which appears a multicolored lotus, spacious and vast. In its center, a single hūṃ manifests, from which appears a crossed viśvavajra, white in the east, yellow in the south, red in the west, and green in the north. Its center is marked by hūṃ. Light rays radiate from that.
oM me dI ni badzrI b+ha wa badzra b+han+d+ha hU~M baM hU~M/
oṃ medīni vajrībhava vajra bhandha hūṃ vaṃ hūṃ
'og thams cad rdo rje'i sa gzhir gyur/
Below, all is a vajra ground.
oM badzra prA ka ra hU~M saM hU~M/
oṃ vajraprākara hūṃ saṃ hūṃ
phyogs mtshams thams cad rdo rje'i ra bar gyur/
In all directions is a vajra fence.
oM badzra pany+tsa ra hU~M yaM ma hU~M/
oṃ vajrapañcara hūṃ yaṃ hūṃ
steng thams cad rdo rje'i gur du gyur/
Above, all is a vajra tent.
oM badzra bi twa na hU~M khaM hU~M/
oṃ vajravitāna hūṃ khaṃ hūṃ
gur gyi 'og tu rdo rje'i bla bres su gyur/
Below the tent is a vajra canopy.
oM badzra sha ra dzA la traM saM tra/
oṃ vajraśrajāla traṃ saṃtra
ra gur gyi phyi rol du rdo rje mda'i dra bar gyur/
Outside the fence and tent is a net of vajra arrows.
oM badzra dz+wa la a na lArka hU~M hU~M hU~M/
oṃ vajrajāla analārka hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ
phyi rol du rdo rje'i me ri kha dog rnam pa lnga rab tu 'bar ba/ bskal pa 'jig pa'i me dpung lta bus yongs su bskor ba'i srung ba'i 'khor lo/
Outside are blazing vajra volcanoes of five colors. They are encircled by a mass of fire like that which destroys an eon. This is the protection cakra.

de'i dbus su sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar b+h+rU~M gcig chad pa las 'od zer (258)'phros/ lha'i gzhal yas khang thams thad bsdus nas b+h+rU~M la thim/ de 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i rin po che sna tshogs las grub pa'i thar pa chen po'i gzhal yas khang gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa phyi nas rim pa bzhin dkar ser dmar ljang sngo ba'i rtsig pa rim pa lnga dang ldan pa/ rtsig pa'i steng na rin po che'i pha gu ser po la drwa ba dang drwa ba phyed pas brgyan pa/ bya 'dab las thur du 'phyang ba'i rin po che'i shar bu dang / gyen du phyogs pa'i mnga' yab mdzes pas bskor ba/ rtsig pa'i phyi rol nas 'dod yon gyi stegs bu la 'khod pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams mchod pa 'bul ba/

In the middle of that, at the center of the viśvavajra, a single bhrūṃ manifests, from which light radiates. {258} All the palaces of the deities gather and dissolve into the bhrūṃ. That melts into light and becomes a palace of great liberation made from various jewels. It is square with four doors. From the outside, the walls have five layers: white, yellow, red, green, and blue. Above the walls is a yellow jeweled frieze adorned with garlands and pendants. Suspended from the eaves is the jeweled fascia and a beautiful parapet facing upward surrounds it. Outside the walls, on the plinth of pleasure are the offering goddesses making offerings.

nang ka ba brgyad dang ldan pa'i steng du rdo rje'i gdung gis mdzes par phub pa/ dbus 'phyur bur gyur ba'i rtse mo rdo rje rin po che'i tog gis spras pa/ sgo'i thad so bzhir ka ba bzhi bzhis btegs pa'i rta babs bang rim bzhi dang ldan pa'i steng du pad+ma la gnas pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo dang / rin po che'i gdugs/ ri dwags pho mo dang /

Inside are eight columns, above which are vajra beams, supporting a beautifully constructed [roof]. The peak of the domed [roof] is marked by a precious vajra finial. Next to the four doors are the torans, which are each supported by four columns and have four layers. On their tops are dharmacakras resting on lotuses, along with jeweled parasols and male and female deer.
gzhan yang gos dang 'phan dang / me tog gis phreng ba dang / zla ba rlung gis bskyod pa dang / rnga yab nor bu'i yu ba can la sogs pa rgyan du mas mdzes par byas pa'i gzhal yas khang du gyur/
Furthermore, the palace is beautified with many other ornaments, such as cloths, pendants, garlands of flowers, moons blown by the wind, yak-tail fans with jeweled handles, and so forth.

de'i phyir rol du dur khrod chen po brgyad ni/ shar du gtum drag gi dur khrod/ byang du tshang tshing 'khrigs pa/ nub tu 'ur 'ur 'bar ba/ lhor 'jigs byed thod pa can/ byang shar du ha ha rgod pa/ shar lhor dbang phyug nags tshal/ lho nub tu mun pa mi bzad pa/ nub byang du kI li ki li'i sgra sgrogs pa'o/ / de rnams la gnas pa'i phyogs skyong ba brgyad/ shing chen po brgyad/ zhing skyong ba brgyad/ klu brgyad/ sprin brgyad/ rnal 'byor brgyad/ gzhan yang ri dang mchod rten me brgyad chu grub pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa dang / dam tshig la (259)spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pho mo dang / gnod sbyin dang / ro langs dang / sha za srin po'i tshogs dang / bya rgod dang / lce spyang dang / ro'i tshogs kyis gang bas bskor ba'o/

Outside are the eight great charnel grounds. In the east is the Caṇḍogra charnel ground, in the north is Gahvara, in the west is *Raṇitavjālavyāpta, in the south is Terrifying Skulls, in the northeast is Aṭṭaṭehāsa, in the southeast is Īśvara Grove, in the southwest is Ghorāndhakāra, and in the northeast is Kilikilārava. In all are the eight protectors of the directions, the eight great trees, the eight field protectors, the eight nāgas, the eight clouds, and the eight yogins. There are also eight mountains, stūpas, and fires. {259} The charnel grounds are filled with yogins and yoginīs who are practicing the water siddhas, vidyādharas, and samayas, along with yakṣas, zombies, flesh-eating rākṣasas, vultures, jackals, and masses of corpses.
[gsum pa 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ni/]
[iii. The Yoga of Entering]

gsum pa 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ni/ gzhal yas khang gi steng 'og rnams shar dkar/ byang ljang / nub dmar/ lho ser ba'i dbus su sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa phyogs bzhi dmar/ me rlung ser/ bden bral ljang / dbang ldan sngo/ lte ba mthing kha'i steng du/ a A/ i I/ u U/ r-i r-I/ l-i l-I/ e A+ai/ o au/ aM A/ phrag gnyis g.yon du 'khor ba las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor/

The third is the yoga of entering. Above and below, the palace is white in the east, green in the north, red in the west, and yellow in the south. In the middle is an eight-petaled multicolored lotus. In the four main directions, it is red. In Agni’s and Vāyu’s [directions], it is yellow; in Nairṛti’s direction, it is green; and in Īśāna’s direction, it is blue. Its center is deep blue.
