Above that are a ā / i ī / u ū / ṛ ṝ / ḷ ḹ / e ai / o au / aṃ ā, two times, circling counterclockwise. From those appears a moon maṇḍala.

de'i steng du/ ka kha ga g+ha nga / tsa tsha dza dz+ha nya/ Ta Tha Da D+ha Na/ ta tha da d+ha na/ pa pha ba b+ha ma/ ya ra la wa/ sha Sha sa ha k+Sha/ ya ra la wa Da D+ha/ phrag gnyis gnyis g.yas su 'khor ba las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor/

Above that are ka kha ga gha ṅa / ca cha ja jha nya / ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa / ta tha da dha na / pa pha ba bha ma / ya ra la va / śa ṣa sa ha kṣaḥ / ya ra la va ḍa ḍha, two times, circling clockwise. From those appears a sun maṇḍala.

de gnyis kyi bar du rang gi sems rdo rje sems dpa' bdag nyid nam mkha'i hU~M sngon po zhugs/ de las 'od 'phros/ 'phags pa mchod/ sems can gyi don byas/ tshur 'dus hU~M la thim pas rdo rje rtse lnga pa lte ba la hU~M gis mtshan par gyur/

In between those two, my mind resides as a blue hūṃ of space, the embodiment of Vajrasattva. Light radiating from that offers to the noble ones and benefits sentient beings. Gathering back, it dissolves into the hūṃ, which becomes a five-pointed vajra whose center is marked by hūṃ.
bzhi pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ni/
iv. The Yoga of Complete Perfection

de rnams ro gcig tu 'dres pa yongs su gyur pa las/ bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo sdom pa in+d+ra nI la dang mtshungs pa'i sku mdog sngon po zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyang pas dus mtshan ma dmar mo'i nu ma mnan pa/ g.yon cung zad bskum pas 'jigs byed sngon po'i dpral ba mnan pa/ rtsa zhal sngon po/ g.yon zhal ljang gu/ rgyab zhal dmar po/ g.yas zhal ser po/ zhal re re la spyan gsum gsum dang ldan pa nor bu dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang / zla ba phyed pas mtshan pa'i ral (260) pa'i thor tshugs can/

Those mix as one taste and transform into the Bhagavān, glorious Cakrasaṃvara, who is blue like indranīlī, with four faces and twelve arms. With my right leg extended I press down on the breast of red Kālarātri, and with my left slightly bent I trample on the forehead of blue Bhairava. My main face is blue, my left face is green, my rear one is red, and my right is yellow. Each face has three eyes. My topknots of hair are each marked by a gem, viśvavajra, and a half moon. {260}

dbu re re la mi mgo skam po lnga lnga'i dbu brgyan dang / rlon pa lnga bcu'i do shal byas pa/ 'khor lo dang / rna cha dang / mgul rgyan dang / gdu bu dang / ske rag dang / thal chen te phyag rgya drug gis brgyan pa/ zhal mche ba gtsigs shing 'jigs par byed pa/ stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can gar gyi nyams dgu dang ldan pa/ phyag bcu gnyis kyis spras pa'i dang po gnyis kyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas yum la 'khyud pa/ de'i 'og ma gnyis kyis glang po che'i pags pa rlon pa gdengs nas 'dzin pa/ g.yas kyi gsum pa na DA ma ru/ bzhi pa na dgra sta/ lnga pa na gri gug / drug pa na mdung rtse gsum pa/ g.yon gyi gsum pa kha T+wAM ga / bzhi pa na thod pa khrag gis bkang pa/ lnga pa na rdo rje'i zhags pa/ drug pa na tshangs pa'i mgo bo gdong bzhi pa bsnams pa/

Each head is adorned by a crown of five dried human heads. I am also adorned by a necklace of fifty fresh heads and the six mudrās: cakra, earrings, collar necklace, bracelets, skirt, and great ashes. My fangs are bared, and I am terrifying. Wearing a tiger-skin skirt, I display the nine moods of the dramatic arts. Of my twelve hands, my first two, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā, embrace my consort. The pair below those hold aloft a fresh elephant hide. My third right one holds a ḍamaru; my fourth, a battle-ax; my fifth, a hooked knife; and my sixth, a trident. My third left holds a khaṭvāṃga; my fourth, a skull cup filled with blood; my fifth, a vajra noose; and my sixth, Brahmā’s head with his four faces.

de'i pang na yum rdo rje rnal 'byor ma sku mdog dmar mo/ zhal gcig phyag gnyis spyan gsum pa/ thod pa dum bu'i ske rags can/ kha T+wAM ga dang thod pas mtshan pa'i phyag g.yon pas yab la 'khyud pa/ g.yas rdo rje dang bcas pa'i sdigs mdzub steng gi nam mkha' la 'phyar ba/ mi mgo skam po lnga'i dbu rgyan dang / rlon pa lnga bcu'i do shal can/ gcer bu skra grol zhing phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa/ byin pa gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi brla gnyis la 'khyud pa/

In my lap is Vajrayoginī, who is red, with one face, two hands, and three eyes. She has a skirt of bits of skulls. With her left arm marked by a khaṭvāṃga and skull cup, she embraces me, her consort. Her right, holding a vajra with the threatening gesture, is raised aloft to the sky. She has a crown of five dried human heads and a necklace of fifty fresh ones. She is naked, her hair is free, and she is adorned with the five mudrās. Her calves are wrapped around the Bhagavān’s thighs.

gnyis ka'ang ye shes kyi me 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs pa'o/ / shar gyi 'dab ma la mkha' 'gro ma sku mdog nag mo/ / byang du lA ma ljang khu/ nub tu dum skyes ma dmar mo/ / lhor gzugs can ma ser mo/ / mtshams kyi 'dab ma bzhi la byang chub sems kyis gang ba'i bum pa bzhi'i steng du bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i thod pa bzhi'o/ /

We both reside in the midst of a raging fire of wisdom. On the eastern petal is black Ḍākinī, in the north is green Lāma, in the west is red Khaṇḍarohā, and in the south is yellow Rūpiṇī. On the four petals in the intermediate directions are four vases filled with bodhicitta, above which are four skull cups filled with amṛta.
shar sgo khwa gdong ma nag mo/ / byang sgor 'ug gdong ma ljang (261) khu/ nub sgo khyi gdong ma dmar mo/ / lho sgor phag gdong ma ser mo/ /
In the eastern door is black Kākāsyā. In the northern door is green Ulūkāsyā. {261} In the western door is red Śvānāsyā. In the southern door is yellow Śūkarāsyā.

shar lhor gshin rje ma brtan ma g.yas sngo g.yon ser ba/ lho nub tu gshin rje pho nya mo g.yas ser g.yon dmar ba/ nub byang du gshin rje mche ba ma g.yas dmar g.yon ljang ba/ byang shar du gshin rje 'joms ma g.yas ljang g.yon sngo ba/

In the southeast is Yamadāḍhī, her right side blue, her left side yellow. In the southwest is Yamadūtī, her right side yellow, her left side red. In the northwest is Yamadaṃṣṭriṇī, her right side red, her left side green. In the northeast is Yamamathanī, her right side green, her left side blue.

lha mo de dag thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag bzhi ma/ g.yas gnyis na gri gug dang DA ma ru/ g.yon gnyis thod pa dang kha T+wAM ga 'dzin pa/ skra grol zhing phyag tu lngas brgyan pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyang bas pad nyi dang ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa/ thod pa dang rdo rje'i phreng bas dbu la brgyan pa/ mi mgo lnga bcu'i do shal can/ sku drag mo'i gzugs can du gyur/

All those goddesses have one face and four hands. They hold hooked knives and ḍamarus in their two right hands, and skull cups and khaṭvāṃgas in their two left hands. Their hair is free, and they are adorned with the five mudrās. Their outstretched right legs stand on lotus, sun, and corpse seats. Their heads are adorned with skulls and garlands of vajras. They have necklaces of fifty human heads. They manifest wrathful forms.
lnga ba byin gyis brlabs pa'i rnal 'byor ni/
v. The Yoga of Consecration
lha de dag thams cad kyi spyi bor oM las 'khor lo dkar po oM gyis mtshan pa/ mgrin par AHlas pad+ma dmar po AHsa mtshan pa/ snying khar hU~M las rdo rje sngon po hU~M gis mtshan pa/

All deities have at their heads oṃs, from which are white cakras marked by oṃs. At their throats are āḥs, from which are red lotuses marked by āḥs. At their hearts are hūṃs, from which are blue vajras marked by hūṃs.

gtso bo la oM haHsnying khar rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po/ na ma hi dpral bar rnam par snang mdzad ser po/ swa hA hu spyi bor rin chen 'byung ldan dmar po/ bau Sha Ta he phrag pa gnyis la he ru ka nag po/ hU~M hU~M ho spyan gsum la 'od dpag med mthing kha/ phaT haM yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad la don yod grub pa ljang khu ste/ thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/

As the principal one: Oṃ haḥ, at my heart is white Vajrasattva. Nama hi, at my forehead is yellow Vairocana. Svāhā hu, at the top of my head is red Ratnasambhava. Vauṣaṭ he, at both shoulders are black Herukas. Hūṃ hūṃ hoḥ, at my three eyes are deep blue Amitābhas. Phaṭ haṃ, at my limbs and secondary limbs are green Amoghasiddhis. All have one face and two hands holding vajras and ghaṇṭās.

yum la oM baM lte bar phag mo dmar mo/ haM yauM snying gar gshin rje ma sngon mo/ hriM mauM khar rmongs byed ma dkar mo/ hriM hriM dpral bar skyod byed ma ser mo/ hU~M hU~M spyi bor skrag byed ma ljang khu/ phaT phaT yan lag dang nying lag thams cad la tsaN+Di ka dud kha ste thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa/ / (262)

For my female consort: Oṃ vaṃ, at her navel is red Vārāhī. Haṃ yauṃ, at her heart is blue Yāminī, Hriṃ mauṃ, at her mouth is white Mohanī. Hrīṃ hriṃ, at her forehead is yellow Saṃcālanī. Hūṃ hūṃ, at the top of her head is green Saṃtrāsanī. Phaṭ phaṭ, at her limbs and secondary limbs are smoky Caṇḍikās. All have one face and two hands holding hooked knives and skull cups. {262}
mig tu oM las gti mug rdo rje dkar po/ rna bar hU~M las zhe sdang rdo rje nag po/ sna la khaM las phrag dog rdo rje ljang gu/ lce la maM las 'dod chags rdo rje dmar po/
At my eyes, from oṃ, are white Mohavajras. At my ears, from hūṃs, are black Dveṣavajras. At my nostrils, from khaṃs, are green Mātsaryavajras. At my tongue, from maṃ, is red Rāgavajra.

dpral bar trAM las ser sna rdo rje ser po/ snying gar ham las dbang phyug rdo rje sngon po/ thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin par gyur/ rang gi thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od 'phros/ 'khor lo bde mchog lha bcu gsum gyi dkyil 'khor la dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor mas bskor ba dbang gi lha tshogs dang bcas pa pheM dzaHhU~M baM hoH dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang gnyis su med par gyur/

At my forehead, from trāṃ, is yellow Īrṣyāvajra. At my heart, from ham, is blue Vajreśvara. All have one face and two hands holding vajras and ghaṇṭās. From the hūṃ in my heart, light radiates, inviting the maṇḍala of the thirteen deities of Cakrasaṃvara surrounded by the heroes and yoginīs, accompanied by an assembly of abhiṣeka deities. pheṃ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ They become nondual with the samaya cakra.
drug pa dbang bskur ba'i rnal 'byor ni/
vi. The Yoga of Bestowing the Abhiṣekas

dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis bdag la dbang bskur du gsol/ zhes gsol ba btab pas/ dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sbyor mtshams nas rig pa'i lha mo bdud rtsis bkang ba'i rin po che'i bum pa thogs pa dpag tu med pa byung ste/

Heroes and yoginīs, please confer the abhiṣekas on me. Having supplicated in that way, from the places of union of the heroes and yoginīs, innumerable vidyā goddesses appear holding precious vases filled with amṛta.
ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni/ / lha rnams kun gyis khrus gsol ltar/ / lha yi chu ni dag pa yi/ / de bzhin bdag gis sku khrus gsol/ /
Just as when [the Buddha] was born the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bathe your body.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta a b+hi Shi ka ta sa ma ya shri ye hU~M/
oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣikata samaya śriye hūṃ

zhes bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i chus lus gang dri ma dag / chu lhag ma yar lud pa las gtso bo la mi bskyod pa/ yum la rnam par snang mdzad/ phyogs ma bzhi la rin chen 'byung ldan/ sgo ma bzhi la snang ba mtha' yas/ mtshams ma bzhi la don yod grub pas dbu brgyan par gyur/

Thus, a stream of amṛta bestows the abhiṣeka on the top of my head. The water of that fills my body and purifies all stains. From the excess water rising up and overflowing, [I], as the principal one, am crowned with Akṣobhya, my female consort with Vairocana; those in the four main directions, with Ratnasambhava; the four female gatekeepers, with Amitābha; and the four female gatekeepers of the intermediate directions, with Amoghasiddhi.
bdun pa mchod pa'i rnal 'byor ni/
vii. The Yoga of Offerings

thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad dang / gzugs sogs 'dod pa'i yon tan dang / bde ba'i yo byad thams cad bsdus/ zhal nas zhugs pa thugs kar rjes chags kyi mes zhu ba byang chub sems kyi rnam par rdo rje'i lam nas yum gyi pad+mar lhung bas (263)mchod pa'i lha mo dpag tu med par gyur pa sbyor 'tshams nas byung bas nam mkha'i khams thams cad gang mchod par bsam la /

Light rays from the seed syllable in my heart gather all the heroes and yoginīs, all sense pleasures, such as forms, and all enjoyable things. These enter my mouth and are melted by the fire of passion in my heart. In the form of bodhicitta, they stream through my vajra and fall into my female consort’s lotus. {263} Becoming innumerable offering goddesses, they come out from our place of union, fill space, and make offerings. Imagining that, say:
oM badzra puSh+pe pra tIts+tsha hU~M swA hA/
oṃ vajra puṣpe pratīccha hūṃ svāhā
de bzhin du sbyar te/
Apply that similarly to:
d+hU pe/ a lo ke / gan+d+he/ nai wi d+ya/ badzra g+haN+Da ra Na 'i nyer spyod rol mo bcas pa dang /
…dhūpe…aloke…gandhe…naividya…vajra ghaṇḍaraṇa… Present the traditional offerings with music.
oM A:badzra A dar+sha pra tI ts+tsha hU~M swA hA/
oṃ āḥ vajra ādarṣa pratīccha hūṃ svāhā
des 'gres te/ wi Ne gan+d+he/ ra sa/ / spar+she/
Do the same for: …viṇe…gandhe…rasa…sparśe…

zhes 'dod yon lngas mchod/ de nas lha mo mchod rdzas dang bcas pa gtso bo yab yum la thim pas/ gtso bo yab yum mchog tu bde ba chen por ro gcig pa'i dbyings su thim pa na/ /'khor gyi lha mo bcu gnyis kyis gdung ba'i dbyangs kyis bstod cing bskul ba ni/

Thus, offer the five sense pleasures. Then, the goddesses with their offering substances dissolve into the principal male and female consorts. When the principal male and female consorts dissolve into the expanse of the one taste of supreme great bliss, the twelve retinue goddesses praise and exhort them with longing melodies.

khyod ni rnal 'byor ma tshogs yongs su bskor/ / khyod ni nyid kyi thugs la bde legs thob/ / der ni rgyu dang mi rgyu'i 'gro rnams dag / snying rje'i thugs kyis sems can sad mdzad cing / / sgyu ma'i sprul pas don kun grub mdzad pa/ / mgon po bde mchog dpal ldan dgyes par bzhengs/ /

You are surrounded by an assembly of yoginīs. You have achieved excellence in your minds. There, beings, who move and do not move, are pure. With your mind of compassion, wake up sentient beings, and with your illusory emanations, achieve all benefits. Protector, glorious Saṃvara, arise with joy.
zhes gsol ba btab pa na chos kyi sku las sgyu ma lta bur sngon bzhin du bzhengs te/ rnam par rol pa mtha' yas pas sems can gyi don mdzad par bsam mo/ /
Contemplate that, when supplicated that way, [Cakrasaṃvara] actually arises from the dharmakāya like an illusion and that his infinite displays act for the welfare of sentient beings.

de nas/ mdun du yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po gzhu'i dbyibs can rgyal mtshan gyis mtshan pa/ de'i steng du raM las me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum 'bar bas mtshan pa'i log gsum la oM AHhU~M gsum las mi mgo'i sgyed pu gsum gyi steng du/ a yig las byung ba'i thod pa phyi dkar la nang dmar ba yangs shing rgya che ba'i nang du/ oM las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su mUM dang go las dri chu dang ba glang gi sha hU~M dang mUM gyis mtshan pa/ shar du bi dang na las dri chen dang mi'i sha oM dang baM gyis mtshan pa/ lhor ra dang ku las rak+ta dang khyi'i sha trAM dang lam gyis mtshan pa/ nub tu shu dang da las byang sems dang rta'i sha AM dang pAM gyis mtshan pa/ byang du ma dang ha las mAM sa dang glang po che'i sha khaM dang tAM gyis (264)mtshan pa/

de rnams kyi steng du AHlas byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du hU~M las skyes pa'i rdo rje hU~M gis mtshan pa/ bdag gis thugs kha nas 'od 'phros/ rlung g.yos/ me 'bar ba thod pa'i nang gi rdzas rnams 'khol/ / dam tshig gi bdud rtsir zhu/ yang thugs ka nas 'od 'phros/ rdo rje lte ba'i hU~M la phogs de las 'od 'phros pas dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis sbyor 'tshams nas byang chub kyi sems phab/ rdo rje'i sbu gu nas mar thim/ zla ba'i kha bkab kyang zhu/ rdo rje des lan gsum dkrugs pas dam tshig gi bdud rtsi dang gnyis su med par 'dres shing rdo rje yang bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin du zhu bar gyur/

Above those, from āḥ, is a moon maṇḍala. Above that, from hūṃ, is a vajra marked by hūṃ. Light streams forth from my heart. The wind moves, the fire blazes, and the substances inside the skull cup boil. They melt into samaya amṛta. Again, light radiates from my heart and strikes the hūṃ at the center of the vajra. From that, light streams forth, causing bodhicitta to fall from the places of union of the heroes and yoginīs. It comes through the vajra’s tube and dissolves below. The moon cover also melts. That vajra stirs three times, mixing [those] in a nondual way with the samaya amṛta. The vajra melts into the nature of amṛta.
oM AHhU~M: zhes lan gsum gyis byin gyis brlab/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Saying that three times, consecrate.
de nas/ lha rnams kyi ljags hU~M las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'od kyi sbu gu can du gyur te rim pa bzhin gsol bas zag pa med pa'i bde ba rgyud la skyes par bsam pa ni bdud rna myang ba'o/ /
Next: The deities’ tongues, from hūṃs, become five-pointed hollow vajras of light. Receiving [the amṛta], undefiled bliss arises in their mindstreams. Taste the amṛta.[5]
brgyad pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor ni
viii. The Yoga of Samādhi
chags grol gyi lam gnyis gang rung bsgom pa'o/ /
Meditate on either one of the two paths: passion or liberation.
dgu pa nyer bsdu'i rnal 'byor ni/
ix. The Yoga of Dissolution

bsam mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis lhar snang 'od gsal gyi dbyings su bsdus la mnyam par bzhag / yan lag bzlas pa'i rim pa bya ba la/ lhar lha'i skur gsal bar bltas la byin gyis brlabs pa'i thod phreng lag g.yon pas bzung la/

Through unimaginable samādhi, dissolve what appear as deities into the expanse of luminosity, and rest evenly. As a subsidiary [practice], do the stages of recitation. See the deities as clear forms of the deities and hold a consecrated skull mālā in your left hand.

thugs kar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du hU~M yig sngon po'i mtha' mar sngags kyis bskor bas 'od zer sngags phreng gi rnam par lta bu byung nas/ rdo rje'i lam nas yum gyi pad+mar song ba a wa d+hU ti'i lam nas byung ste/ yum gyi zhal nas yab kyi zhal du zhugs shing hU~M gi nA da la thim par bsams te/

In my heart, on a sun maṇḍala, is a blue letter hūṃ, surrounded by the mantra. Light rays in the form of mantra garlands arise and go through the path of my vajra to my female consort’s lotus, then through the path of her avadhūti. Going from my female consort’s mouth to my mouth, as the male consort, these dissolve into the nāda of the hūṃ.

dbang gi snying po ni/ oM shrI badzra he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la saM wa raM swA hA/ nye snying ni/ oM hriHha ha huM hU~M phaT: yum gyi snying po ni/ oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI yai badzra war+N+Na nI yai huM hU~M phaT swA hA/ nye snying ni/ oM badzra bai ro tsa nI yai huM hU~M phaT swA hA/ 'khor sngags (265) ni/

The essence mantra of the male consort.[6] oṃ śrīvajra he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā His quintessence mantra. oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ The essence mantra of the female consort. oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīyai vajravarṇṇanīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā Her quintessence mantra. oṃ vajravairocanīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā {265} The retinue mantras.

oM DA ki nI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM lA me huM hU~M phaT/ oM khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT/ oM rU pi Ni yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ka kA s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM U lu kA s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM shwa na ka s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM sU ka ra s+yai huM hU~M/ oM ya ma dA D+hi yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma dU ti yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma daMSh+Ti nI yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma ma tha ni huM hU~M phaT/

ōṃ ḍākinīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ lāme huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ rūpiṇīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ kakāsyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ūlukāsyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ śvanakasyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ sūkarasyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadāḍhiyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadūtiyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadaṃṣṭiṇīyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamamathani huṃ hūṃ phaṭ

ces gtso bo yab yum ci 'grub dang 'khor sngags rnams kyang cung zad re bzla/ 'dir rkang brgyad sngon du 'gro ba'i rtsa sngags dang go cha'i sngags rnams kyang bzla bar gsungs pas 'grub na de ltar bya'o/ /

Do as many of the mantras of the principal male and female consorts as you can, and recite the retinue mantras a small amount. Here, it is said to recite the root mantra preceding the eight lines and the armor mantras. Therefore, if you can, do that.
gnyis pa mdun bskyed ni/
2. The Front Visualization
sum+b+ha ni sa bsang / swa b+hA ba sa sbyang /
Cleanse with sumbha ni, and purify with svabhāva.

stong pa'i ngang las mdun rten thod pa bde ba skyed pa'i snod shin tu yangs pa'i nang du/ yaM las rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po gzhu'i dbyibs can yaM gis mtshan pa/ de'i steng du raM las me'i dkyil 'khor sogs bdag bskyed ltar la/ chad ces pa rnams dor/ byang ljang ba'i kha dog can gyi lte bar b+h+rUM yongs su gyur pa las/ rin po che sna tshogs las grub pa'i thar pa chen po'i gzhal yas khang sogs nas/ lte ba mthing kha'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo sdom pa sogs nas rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin par gyur/

Within emptiness, the front support is a skull cup, a very spacious container that arouses bliss. Within that, from yaṃ, is a blue wind maṇḍala in the shape of a bow, marked by yaṃ. Above that, from raṃ, is a fire maṇḍala,…[*1] Recite according to the self visualization, leaving out “manifests.”[*2] …and green in the north. Its center is marked by bhrūṃ, which becomes a palace of great liberation made from various jewels….[*3] Above its deep blue center, in the middle of a sun maṇḍala, is the Bhagavān, glorious Cakrasaṃvara,…[*4] holding vajras and ghaṇṭās.

bar gong ltar/ thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od zer 'phros pas bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo sdom pa lha bcu gsum gyi dkyil 'khor la dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs kyis bskor ba dbang gi lha tshogs dang bcas pa mdun gyi nam mkhar pheM/

Up to there, as above. From the hūṃ in his heart, light radiates, inviting into the space in front of the maṇḍala of the thirteen deities of the Bhagavān, glorious Cakrasaṃvara surrounded by the heroes and yoginīs, accompanied by an assembly of abhiṣeka deities. pheṃ
hU~M/ bcom ldan 'khor lo sdom pa la/ / dpa' bo mkha' 'gros bskor nas ni/ / gnas 'dir spyan 'dren gshegs su gsol/
hūṃ Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, surrounded by heroes and ḍākinīs, I invite you to please come here.
oM hrIHha ha hU~M hU~M phaTaHoM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT swA hA/ badzra sa ma ya dzaH dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā / vajra samaya jaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ

dam tshig pa dang gnyis su med par gyur/ dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis (266)mngon par dbang bskur du gsol/ zhes gsol ba btab pas sogs nas/ don yod grub pas dbur brgyan par gyur/ bar phrang sgrub thabs ltar brjod/ bsang sbyangs/ mchod pa byin rlabs spyi ltar bya/

They become nondual with the samaya ones. {266} Heroes and yoginīs, please actually confer the abhiṣekas. Having supplicated in that way,…[*5] with Amoghasiddhi. Recite according to the sādhana.[7] Cleanse and purify. Consecrate the offerings as is customarily done.
ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni/ / de bzhin gshegs kun khrus gsol ltar/ / lha yi= de bzhin=
Just as when [the Buddha] was born all the tathāgatas bathed him, now with [the pure water of the gods] I [bath your body].
shrI ye hU~M/ zhes mchod yon phul/
[oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya] śrīye hūṃ Thus, present the offering water.
dkyil 'khor kun tu rgyal ba mnyes byed pa'i/ / mdzes ldan dkar mo rdo rje dril bu dang / / me tog spungs pa'i rin chen snod 'dzin ma/ / nam mkha' gang ba'i dkyil 'khor lha tshogs mchod/

To please the victors in all the maṇḍalas, the beautiful white vajra lady, holding a ghaṇṭā and a precious container with heaps of flowers, offers to the assembly of deities in the maṇḍalas filling space.
oM AHbadzra puSh+pe pra tits+tsha hU~M swA hA/
oṃ āḥ vajra puṣpe praticcha hūṃ svāhā
dkyil 'khor= / yid 'ong dud kha rdo rje= / bdug spos 'thul ba'i rin chen= / nam mkha'=
To please the victors… the pleasing smoky vajra lady,… and a precious receptacle with wafting incense, offers to the assembly of deities…
d+hU pe= dkyil 'khor= kun snang dmar ser rdo rje= / mar mes gang ba'i= / nam mkha'=
…dhūpe… To please the victors… the illuminating orange vajra lady,… and a precious receptacle filled with lamps, offers to the assembly of deities…
A lo ke= / dkyil 'khor= / gdud sel ljang khu= / dri mchog byug pa'i rin chen= / nam mkha'=
…āloke… To please the victors… the longing-dispelling green… and a precious receptacle with perfume ointments, offers to the assembly of deities…
gan+d+he= dkyil 'khor= zhal zas ser mo rdo rje= bdud rtsis gang bas= nam mkha' gang bas=
…gandhe… To please the victors… the yellow vajra lady of food,… and a precious receptacle filled with amṛta, offers to the assembly of deities…
nai wi d+ya= dkyil 'khor= sgra snyan sna tshogs rdo rje= / pi waM gling bu rnga chen sogs 'dzin ma/ nam mkha' gang =
…naividya… To please the victors… the multicolored vajra lady of melodious sounds,… and lutes, flutes, large drums, and so forth, offers to the assembly of deities…
oM AHbadzra g+haN+Da ra Na pra tIts+tsha hU~M swA hA/ zhes nyer spyod lnga rol mor bcas pa dang /
oṃ āḥ vajra ghāṇḍaraṇa pratīccha hūṃ svāhā Thus, present the five traditional offerings along with music.
rgyal ba rnams kyi 'dod 'byung lha mo'i tshul/ / gzugs mdzes dkar mo me long pad+ma'i snod/ / cang te'u'i sgra 'khrol kha T+wAM la brten ma/ / nam mkha'=

The sense pleasures for the victors are in the form of goddesses: the white lady of beautiful forms, who holds a lotus container with a mirror, plays a changteu, and relies on a khaṭvāṃga, offers to the assembly of deities…
oM AHbadzra A dar+sha pra tits+tsha hU~M swA hA/
oṃ āḥ vajra ādarśa praticcha hūṃ svāhā
rgyal ba rnams= dbyangs snyan sngon mo pi waM pad+ma'i snod/ cang te'u'i= nam mkha'=
The sense pleasures for the victors… the blue lady of pleasing melodies, who holds a lotus container with a lute, plays a changteu,… offers to the assembly of deities…
wI Ne= rgyal ba= dri ldan ser mo sgos khang pad+ma'i snod/ cang te'u= nam mkha'=
…vīṇe… The sense pleasures for the victors… the yellow lady of scents, who holds a lotus container with incense,[8] plays a changteu,… offers to the assembly of deities…
gan+d+he= rgyal ba= bcud ldan dmar mo bza' btung pad+ma'i snod/ cang te'u=
…gandhe… The sense pleasures for the victors… the red lady of elixirs, who holds a lotus container with food and drink, plays a changteu,…
nam mkha'= ra sa= rgyal ba= (267) bde ldan ljang khu ras bzang pad+ma'i snod/
offers to the assembly of deities… …rasa…{267} The sense pleasures for the victors… the green lady of bliss, who holds a lotus container with excellent fried breads,
cang te'u= nam mkha' gang bas= spar+she= zhes 'dod yon gyis lha mos mchod/
plays a changteu,… offers to the assembly of deities… …sparśe… Thus, the goddesses offer the sense pleasures.

oM na mo b+ha ga ba te wi re shA ya huM hU~M phaT/ oM ma hA kalpA sni san+ni b+ha ya huM hU~M phaT/ oM dza Ta mu ku Tot+ka TA ya huM hU~M phaT/ oM daMSh+Ta ka rA lo gra b+hi Sha Na mu kha ya huM hU~M phaT/ oM sa hA sra b+hu dza b+hA su ra ya huM hU~M phaT/ oM pa ra shu pa sho d+ya ta shU la kha TAng+ga d+hA ri Ne huM hU~M phaT/ oM byA b+h+rA dzi nAM ba ra d+hA ra ya huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ namo bhagavate vireśāya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ mahākalpāsnisannibhaya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ jaṭamukuṭotkaṭāya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ daṃṣṭakarālograbhīṣaṇamukhaya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ sahāsrabhujabhāsuraya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ paraśupaśodyataśūlakhaṭāṅgadhāriṇe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vyāghrājināṃbaradhāraya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ /

oM ma hA d+hU mran+d+ha kA ra wa pu ShA ya huM hU~M phaT/ oM na mo b+ha ga wa tI badzra wa rA hI baM huM hU~M phaT/ oM na ma Ar+Ya a pa rA dzi te tre lo kya mA te ma hA bid+ya shwa rI huM hU~M phaT/ oM na maHsarba b+hu ta b+ha yA ba he ma hA badzre huM hU~M phaT/ oM na mo badzra A pa rA dzi te wa sh+yaM ka ri ne tra b+h+ra ma Ni huM hU~M phaT/ oM na maHsho Sha Ni ro Sha Ni kre d+he ka rA li ni huM hU~M phaT/ oM na maHtrA sa ni mA ra Ni pra b+he da ni a pa rA dza ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM na mo bi dza ye dzam+b+ha ni s+t+waM b+ha ni mo ha ni huM hU~M phaT/ oM na mo badzra wA ra hi ma hA yo gi ni ka me shwa ri kha ge huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ mahādhumrandhakāravapuṣāya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ namo bhagavatī vajravarāhī vam huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ namo ārya aparājite trelokyamāte mahāvidyeśvarī huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ namaḥ sarvabhūtabhayāvahe mahāvajre huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ namo vajra āpana aparājite vaśyaṃkari netrabhramaṇi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ nāmaḥ śoṣaṇi roṣaṇi kredhe karālini huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ nāmaḥ trāsani māraṇi prabhedani aparājaye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ namo vijaye jambhani stvaṃbhani mohani huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ namo vajravārahi mahāyogini kameśvari khage huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
ces sam/ yang na/ bcom ldan mgon po sogs yab yum gyi rkang pa brgyad pa bod skad gang rigs kyis bstod do/ /
Say those or: Bhagavān, protector,…[*6] Praise with the eight lines [of praises] for the male and female consorts in [Sanskrit or] Tibetan [translated into English], as suitable.
gsum pa las bum sgrub pa ni/
3. The Practices for the Activity Vase
bsang sbyang /
Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las b+h+rUM las rin po che'i bum pa mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i dbus su paM las pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar/ a las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du hU~M las rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa lte ba la hU~M gis mtshan pa las 'od 'phros/ 'phags pa mchod/ sems can thams cad kyi sdig sgrib sbyangs/ tshur 'dus hU~M la thim/ yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sems dpa' sku mdog dkar po rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas yum la 'khyud pa/ yum rdo rje snyems ma dkar mo gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas yab la 'khyud pa/ gnyis ka'ang rus pa dang rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ skyil mo krung (268)gis bzhugs pa'i dpral bar oM/ mgrin par AHthugs kar hU~M/ hU~M las 'od 'phros sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum gyi rnam par spyan drangs/

Within emptiness, from bhrūṃ, is a precious vase complete with all the characteristics. In its middle, from paṃ, is an eight-petaled lotus. In its center, from a, is a moon maṇḍala. Above that, from hūṃ, is a white five-pointed vajra, whose center is marked by hūṃ. Light radiates from that, making offerings to the noble ones and purifying the negative actions and obscurations of sentient beings. It gathers back and dissolves into the hūṃ. That transforms into white Vajrasattva, who, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā, embraces his consort. His consort Vajragarvā is white. Holding a hooked knife and skull cup of blood, she embraces her consort. They are both adorned by bone and precious ornaments. {268} They are seated cross-legged. At their foreheads are oṃs, at their throats are āḥs, and at their hearts are hūṃs. Light radiates from the hūṃs, inviting all the buddhas and bodhisattvas in the form of Vajrasattva male and female consorts.
dzaHhU~M baM hoH
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ

bcom ldan 'das bdag dang mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par mdzad du gsol/ ces gsol ba btab pas sku las bdud rtsi'i rgyun babs bum pa gang bar gyur/ ces mos la/

Bhagavān, please cleanse and purify the negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains of myself and all limitless sentient beings. Having supplicated, a stream of amṛta falls from their bodies and fills the vase. Thus, contemplate.
oM shrI badzra he ru ka sogs he ru ka'i yig brgya nyer gcig las mi nyung ba bzla/ mthar/
oṃ śrīvajraheruka… Recite the hundred syllables of the heruka no less than twenty-one times. At the end:
mgon po bdag ni sogs kyi gsol ba btab/

Protector, through ignorance and delusion, [I have transgressed and broken my samaya. Guru Vajrasattva, please grant me refuge. Vajradhara, principal one, embodiment of compassion, I take refuge in you, leader of beings. I admit and confess all broken and impaired root and branch samayas of body, speech, and mind. Please cleanse and purify my negative actions, obscurations, flaws, and downfalls.]
dpal rdo rje sems dpa' 'od du zhu nas bum pa'i chur gyur bar bsgom la/
Glorious Vajrasattva melts into light and becomes the water in the vase.

tshogs bsang sbyang / bdag bskyed kyi bdud rtsi'i skabs ltar byin brlab/ 'dod pa'i yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pas bla ma dang bcas pa'i lha tshogs rnams la mchod par bsam zhing rol mo dang bcas pas/ tshogs 'khor rgyas pa'i skabs/ bkra shis gang zhig chos kyi dbyings las legs byung ba/ zhes shis brjod/ gsung srol yod pa sogs spro na bya/ bsdu na/

Cleanse and purify the feast. Consecrate it as done for the amṛta during the self visualization. Think that you offer unimaginable sense pleasures to the assembly of deities and the gurus accompanied by music. During an extensive gaṇacakra, say: One auspiciousness abides in the dharmakāya:[*7] Thus, express the auspiciousness. There is the custom of saying that and similar verses, so if you wish to elaborate with that, do so. If you wish to abbreviate, say:
gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro/ / reg bya 'dod yon rnam lnga 'di/ / bka' brgyud bla ma rnams la 'bul/ / thim pa'i tshul gyis bzhes su gsol/ /
These five sense pleasures—forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects— I offer to the Kagyu gurus. Please accept them as if you were dissolving them.
ga Na tsakra pU dza khA hi/
ganacakra pūja khāhi
gzugs dang = reg bya 'dod yon= rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la 'bul/ / thim pa'i tshul gyis=
These five sense pleasures—forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects— I offer to Vajrayoginī. Please accept them as if you were dissolving them.
ga Na tsakra pU dzaH
ganacakra pūjaḥ
de bzhin thog ma'i rkang pa gnyis dang / mtha' ma'i rkang pa gnyis 'dra ba la/
In the same way, with the same first two lines and last two lines, substitute the following [for the third line]:
yi dam lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ / dpa' bo mkha' 'gro rnams la 'bul/ / chos skyong srung ma rnams la 'bul/ / phyogs skyong zhing skyong rnams la 'bul/ /
I offer to the assemblies of yidam deities. I offer to the heroes and ḍākinīs. I offer to the dharma protectors and guardians. I offer to direction protectors and field protectors.
gzhi bdag gnas bdag rnams la 'bul/ / rdo rje spun grogs rnams la 'bul/ zhes sbyar la tshogs 'bul lo/ /
I offer to local deities and regional deities. I offer to our vajra siblings and companions. Thus, offer the feast.
gnyis pa dbang dngos ni/
B. The Actual Abhiṣekas
snod du rung ba'i slob ma rnams/ ji ltar bltams pa sogs las bum chus khrus bya/

For disciples who are suitable recipients: Just as when [the Buddha] was born [the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bathe your body. oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya śrīye hūṃ] Cleanse them with water from the activity vase. {269}
gral la 'khod (269) bla ma he ru ka'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas bgegs gtor/
Have them sit in rows. The guru with the pride of the heruka expels obstructors.
oM a ka ro mu khaM sogs/ phaT swA hA/ lan gsum gyis bsngos la/
oṃ akaro mukaṃ…phaṭ svāhā Saying that three times, dedicate.
bden pa bdar ba ni/
Setting out the truth.
phaTaH dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
phaṭ Homage to the three jewels.

rje btsun rtsa ba dang brgyud par bcas pa'i dpal ldan bla ma dam pa rnams kyi bka' bden pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka'= chos kyi bka'= dge 'dun gyi bka'= yi dam dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs rnams kyi= ma gnas gsum gyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi= dam pa chos skyong ba'i srung ma rnams kyi bka' bden pa dang / bden po chen po de'i byin rlabs dang / rnal 'byor pa bdag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i mthu la brten nas/ bdag rdo rje 'dzin pas ding 'dir slob ma rnams la ye shes me'i byin rlabs zab mo bgyi ba la/ 'byung po mi dang mi ma yin pa sngags nyan pa la mi dbang zhing / phyag rgya lta ba la mi dbang ba'i bdud bgegs bar du gcod par byed pa thams cad mchod sbyin gyi gtor ma rgya chen po 'di khyer la myur ba nyid du phyir dengs shig /

Through the truth of the words of the glorious, genuine, and exalted root and lineage gurus, the truth of the words of the buddhas, the truth of the words of the dharma, the truth of the words of the saṅgha, the truth of the words of the yidam deities of the maṇḍala, the truth of the words of the mother ḍākinīs of the three places, the truth of the words of the guardians who protect the genuine dharma, the blessings of great truth, and through the force of the pure superior intentions of us yoga practitioners, so that I, the vajra holder, may give the profound blessings of wisdom fire, here and now, to these disciples—may all those bhūtas, humans, nonhumans, those who are not authorized for this strict Mantra, māras and obstructors who are not authorized to see the mudrā, all those who create obstacles take this vast torma that is offered and given, and depart from here quickly.
gang dag mi 'gro ba de dag ye shes kyi rdo rje me rab tu 'bar ba 'dis mgo bo tshal ba brgyar 'gas par 'gyur ta re/
Those who do not go will risk having their heads split in hundreds of pieces by this blazing vajra of wisdom.
zhes bgegs gtor btang nas/ oM hrIHha ha sogs yi dam gyi gzungs sngags dang / sum+b+ha ni brjod cing / gu gul gyi dud pa btang / thun gyi brab te bgegs skrad/ bla mas/

Take out the obstructors’ torma. Recite the dhāraṇī mantra of the yidam, oṃ hrīḥ ha ha…, and sumbha ni. Fumigate with guggula. Pelt with consecrated substances and expel the obstructors. The guru says:
bdag gi slob ma 'di rnams la ye shes kyi drod la bar du gcod pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar byin gyis brlab tu gsol/
Please grant your blessings that pacify anything that obstructs the heat of wisdom for my disciples.
ces bla ma dang lha la gsol ba gdab/
Thus, supplicate the gurus and deities.
maN+Dal bkye bsdu dang sems bskyed gsal gdab/ drang nges kyi chos bshad ji ltar 'os pa dang /
Distribute and collect [grains] for a maṇḍala offering, and clarify bodhicitta. Explain the provisional and definitive dharma, as suitable.

khyad par/ de la 'dir skabs su babs pa/ mtshan nyid rgyu'i theg pa las khyad par du mas 'phags pa 'bras bu gsang sngags rdo rje'i theg pa la'ang rgyud sde bzhir bzhugs pa las mchog dang phul du gyur pa bde (270) dgyes gtso bor gyur pa'i bla med ma rgyud rnams kyi rdzogs rim bde stong mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes skyed pa'i thabs lam rnams kyi rtsa ba lhan skyes tsaN+Da lI sgom pa la gegs sel zhing bogs myur du thon pa sogs yon tan gyi rtsal skyed pa la/ mchog tu bsngags pa la rdo rje'i tshig rkang las khyad par drod kyi dbang bskur ces dngos su bstan pa'i gdams ngag grub thob brgyud pa bar ma chad pa las byon pa ste/

In particular, say: {270} This is the occasion for the following: Within the resultant Secret Mantra Vajrayāna, which is even more distinguished than the causal Philosophical Yāna, there are the four classes of tantras. Within those there are the niruttara mother tantras, in which the sublime and perfect Saṃvara and Hevajra are preeminent. Within those is the path of method, which generates the immutable wisdom of bliss-emptiness, the perfection process of the niruttara mother tantras. The root of the path of method is the meditations on connate caṇḍālī. To give rise to the roots of its excellent qualities—such as what dispels obstacles for that meditation, quickly enhances it, and so forth—what are highly praised are the special instructions, called “the heat abhiṣeka,” which are explicitly taught in the Vajra Verses. These have come down in an unbroken transmission of siddhas.

de'ang rgyud dang 'brel ba thabs lam gyi gdams pa dang / byin rlabs dang 'brel ba snyan brgyud kyi gdams pa zhes bka' brgyud rin po che rnams la yongs su grags pa'i bka' srol phyi ma 'di nyid kyi byin rlabs ring brgyud rdo rje 'chang / sha ba ri pa/ me tri pa/ ti pu dre med bshes gnyen/ ras chung pa sogs las brgyud de dpal ldan 'brug pa bka' brgyud las bar ma chad par byon pa dang / nye brgyud rje btsun ye shes kyi sku brnyes pa ras chung rdo rje grags pas mtshungs med 'gro ba'i mgon pos 'jam dbyangs chos kyi grags pa la dngos su stsal ba rdo rje 'chang gis gsang tshig ye shes mkha' 'gro'i thugs bcud/ byin rlabs kyi gzi byin dang ldan pa mai trI snyan brgyud las byon pa thod dbang me'i 'khor lo'i byin rlabs zab mo bsgrub pa la slob dpon gyis bgyi bar 'os pa rnams tshul bzhin grub pa lags/

Furthermore, the instructions on the path of method, which are connected to the lineage, and the instructions of the Aural Transmission, which are connected with blessings, are traditions renowned in the precious Kagyu. The blessings of the latter come through the long transmission: it is transmitted from Vajradhara, Śavaripa, Maitrīpa, Tipupa Vimalamitra, Rechungpa, and so on, coming down unbroken through the Drukpa Kagyu lineage. [The blessings also come through] the short transmission: Jetsun Rechung Dorje Drakpa, who achieved a wisdom body, directly bestowed this on the unequaled protector of beings, Jamyang Chökyi Drakpa.[9] The secret words of Vajradhara, the mind elixir of the Jñānaḍākinī, along with the majesty of blessings, come through the Aural Transmission of Maitrīpa. For the accomplishment of the profound blessings of the Skull-Cup Abhiṣeka, the Fire Cakra, the ācārya has completed what is necessary in the correct way.

khyed rang slob ma rnams kyi ngo skal du gyur pa la thog mar byin rlabs zhu ba'i yon tu dmigs te maN+Dal 'bul bar zhu/ zhes mtshams sbyar la maN+Dal 'bul gzhug bla ma dang lhag pa'i lhar mos gdung rtse gcig pas gsol ba btab pa 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/

For your part as disciples, you should first visualize a gift and offer a maṇḍala to request blessings. Having said that as an introduction, have them offer a maṇḍala. With one-pointed devotion and longing for the guru and the special deity, repeat the following supplication:
dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa ste/ / phag mo lhan cig yang dag sbyor/ / byang chub chen po'i tshul bstan pa/ / mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo/ /
Great joy, you are my teacher, united with Sahajā Vārāhī. I request the great protector to teach the way to great awakening.
dam tshig de nyid bdag la stsol/ / byang chub (271)sems kyang bdag la stsol/ / sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / skyabs gsum dag kyang bdag la stsol/ /
Bestow on me this samaya. {271} Bestow on me bodhicitta. Bestow on me the three refuges: the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha.
thar pa chen po'i grang mchog tu/ / mgon pos bdag ni gzhug tu gsol/ lan gsum/
Protector, please enter me into the city of great liberation. Three times.
bla mas/ de ltar gsol ba btab pas snod rung du gyur pa la sdom pa bsgrag pa yin pas 'di la gsan 'tshal/
The guru says: Having supplicated in that way, to become a suitable receptacle, you must commit to the vows. Please listen to this.
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song / / 'di ni sangs rgyas rigs dag pa'i/ / sdom pa brtan por gyur pa'o/ /
In the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha, the three jewels, you should take refuge. This will stabilize the vow of the pure buddha family.
rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya ni/ / blo chen khyod kyis bzung bar bya/ / byang chub sems gang de rdo rje/ / shes rab dril bu zhes grags so/ /
Intelligent ones, you should hold the vajra, ghaṇṭā, and mudrā. The bodhisattvas call those vajra, prajñā, and ghaṇṭā.
blo chen khyod kyis bzung bya ste/ / bla ma sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam/ / 'di ni rdo rje'i rigs dag pa'i/ / dam tshig sdom pa yin par bshad/ /
Intelligent ones, you should hold the gurus as equal to all buddhas. This is explained as being the vows and samayas of the pure vajra family.
rin chen rigs la rtag tu ni/ / nyin re bzhin du dus drug tu/ / chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs byams/ / sbyin pa rnam bzhi rtag tu sbyin/ /
For the ratna family, during six times each day you should always perform the four types of generosity: the dharma, material goods, fearlessness, and kindness.
phyi dang gsang ba theg pa gsum/ / dam pa'i chos kyang ma lus gzung / / 'di ni pad+ma'i rigs dag pa'i/ / dam tshig yid du 'ong ba'o/ /
You should hold the genuine dharma of the three yānas, outer and secret. This is the pleasing samaya of the pure padma family.
las kyi rigs mchog chen po la/ / sdom pa thams cad ldan pa ni/ / yang dag nyid du bzung bar bgyi/ / mchod pa'i las kyang ci nus bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme karma family, you should hold perfectly all the vows. You should perform all possible acts of worship.
de las gzhan pa bcu bzhi ni/ / phas pham par ni rab tu bshad/ / spang zhing dor ba mi bya ste/ / rtsa ba'i ltung ba zhes bshad do/ /
In addition to those, there are fourteen, explained as the fundamental defeats. Do not abandon or reject: those are explained as the root downfalls.
ji ltar bsgrags pa'i sdom pa de rnams tshul bzhin gsungs pas/ rim gnyis kyi rnal 'byor zab mo rgyud la skye ba'i skal ldan du 'gyur ba yang /
By preserving correctly those vows that are thus renowned, you will become fortunate ones within whose mindstreams the profound yoga of the two processes arises.
ji skad du dam tshig sdom pa mig gi 'bras bu ltar/ / bsrungs pas rim gnyis lam gyi snod 'gyur zhing / / skye shi bar do'i mun pa kun sel 'gyur/ /
Thus it is that protecting your samayas and vows, just as you would your eyes, makes you a receptacle for the path of the two processes, and dispels the darkness of the bardo of birth and death.
zhes pa'i don yid dang 'dres nges par bsam la 'di'i rjes zlos lan (272) gsum mdzod/
Mixing that point with your mind, contemplate with certainty and repeat this three times: {272}
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun la/ / rtag tu bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ / rnal 'byor gsang sngags mkha' 'gro ma/ / 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid can/ / kun la rtag tu skyabs su mchi/ /
In the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha, I always take refuge. In the Yogin, the secret mantras, and ḍākinīs, who are embodiments of the three cakras, I always take refuge.
dpa' bo dpa' mo dbang lha mo/ / byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid che/ / khyad par du yang slob dpon la/ / rtag tu bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ /
In the heroes, heroines, abhiṣeka goddesses, bodhisattvas, great beings, and, especially, the ācārya, I always take refuge.
dpal ldan khrag 'thung sogs dpa' bo/ / rnal 'byor ma ni snang mdzad sogs/ / byang chub sems dpa' dpag med pa/ / thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
Heroes, the glorious Heruka and others, the yoginīs, Vairocana and the others, the innumerable bodhisattvas, please consider me.
bdag cag dus 'di nas bzung ste/ / ji srid gnyis med la gnas par/ / de yi tshangs spyod gnyis med par/ / nyi shu rtsa gnyis legs par bsrung /
From this time onward, as long as I abide in nonduality, I will hold properly the twenty-two forms of the nondual pure conduct.
zhes lan gsum brjod/
Say that three times.

de nas ye shes pa'i byin rlabs dbab pa la dmigs pa 'di bzhin du mdzod/ slob dpon bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo sdom pa in+d+ra nI la dang mtshungs pa'i sku mdog sngon po/ sogs nas/ gnyis ka'ang ye shes kyi me 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs pa'o/ /

Next, do the visualization for the descent of the blessings of the wisdom ones as follows: The ācārya is the Bhagavān, glorious Cakrasaṃvara, who is blue like indranīlī,…Both reside in the midst of a raging fire of wisdom.[*8]

gtso bo la oM ha snying khar rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po sogs nas thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa/ yum la oM baM lte bar phag mo dmar mo sogs nas thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin par gsal ba'i thugs ka'i sa bon las 'od zer 'phros pas ye shes kyi 'khor lo mdun gyi nam mkhar spyan drangs ba'i mos pas/

For the principal one: Oṃ haḥ, at his heart is white Vajrasattva;…[*9] All have one face and two hands holding vajras and ghaṇṭās. For the female consort: Oṃ vaṃ, at her navel is red Vārāhī;…[*10] All have one face and two hands holding hooked knives and skull cups. From the seed syllables in the heart of those visualized, light rays stream forth inviting the wisdom cakra into the space in front. Thus, contemplate.
hU~M/ bcom ldan 'khor lo sdom pa la/ / dpa' bo mkha' 'gros bskor nas ni/ / gnas 'dir spyan 'dren gshegs su gsol/
hūṃ Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, surrounded by heroes and ḍākinīs, I invite you to please come here.
yab yum gyis snying po nye snying gi mthar/
At the end of the essence and quintessence mantras of the male and female consorts, say:
badzra sa ma ya dza dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
vajra samaya jaḥ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
zhes drag tu brjod cing DA dril bskrol ba dang bstun/ slob ma'i rgyud byin gyis rlobs pa'i dmigs 'dun bskyed/ slob ma rnams khaN+Da ro hE sa bsang la/
Say that forcefully and play ḍamaru and ghaṇṭā in conjunction with doing the front visualization for blessing the mindstreams of the disciples. Cleanse the disciples with khaṇḍarohē. {273}

khyed rang (273)rnams skad cig gis rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma sku mdog pad+ma rA ga'i 'od ltar dmar ba zhal gcig phyag gnyis spyan gsum ma/ phyag g.yas gri gug 'bar ba nam mkha'i mthong su 'phyar ba/ rnam par rtog pa'i zug rngu ma lus pa gcod cing / g.yon thod khrag thugs kar 'dzin pa/ zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i ros tshim par mdzad pa/ mi mgo skam po lnga'i dbu rgyan dang / rlon pa khrag 'dzag pa lnga bcu'i do shal byas pa/ thal chen spangs pa'i phyag rgya lngas brgyan cing / gru mo na yab he ru ka mtshon pa'i kha T+wAM ga bsnams pa/ gcer bu brgyad gnyis lon pa'i lang tsho can/ zhabs g.yas bskum g.yon brkyang srog bral ba'i snying gar mnan te ye shes kyi me 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs pa'i lte bar oM ba~M/ snying gar haM yauM/ khar hriM moM/ dpral bar hriM hriM/ spyi gtsug tu hU~M hU~M/ yan lag thams cad la phaT phaT rnams gsal thob/

You are instantly Jetsun Vajrayoginī, red like the light of padmarāga, with one face, two arms, and three eyes. Your right hand raises a blazing hooked knife to the sky, severing the pain of thoughts. Your left hand holds to your heart a skull cup with blood, creating satisfaction through the taste of undefiled bliss. You wear a crown of five dried human heads and a necklace of fifty fresh ones dripping blood. You are adorned with the five mudrās, leaving out the great ashes. In the crook of your elbow is a khaṭvāṃga, symbolizing your consort, Heruka. You are naked with the splendor of one who has reached twice eight. Your right leg is bent, and your left is outstretched, pressing down on the heart of one without life. You stand in the center of a blazing fire of wisdom. At your navel is oṃ vaṃ, at your heart is haṃ yauṃ, at your mouth is hriṃ moṃ, at your forehead is hriṃ hriṃ, at the top of your head is hūṃ hūṃ, and at all your limbs are phaṭ phaṭs. Those are clearly present.
slob ma rnams kyi dbus su bla mas rdo rje gdengs te yi ge bdun pa lan lnga bdun gang rung brjod rjes/ rdo rje spyi bor 'jog pa dang bstun/
In the middle of the disciples, the guru brandishes a vajra and says the seven letters, five, seven, or however [many times they wish]. In conjunction with placing a vajra on their heads, say:

deng khyod kyi dpal he ru ka nga yin gyi/ ngas ji ltar bsgo ba khyod kyis bya dgos so/ khyed kyi nga la brnyas par ma byed/ khyod mi bde ba ma spangs par tshe'i dus byas nas dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ta re/ zhes dam bsgrag dbang bskur dngos gzhi la/ lus la me yi byin rlabs zhu snyam pas gsol ba gdab pa 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/

Now I am your Heruka. Whatever I command, you must do. You must not have contempt for me. You risk not being able to abandon unhappiness and, when your life ends, falling into hell. Thus, announce the commitment. For the main abhiṣeka, thinking that you are requesting to receive the blessings of fire for your body, repeat the following supplication:
bla ma 'khor lo sdom pa yis/ / bdag gi lus la ye shes kyi/ / me yi byin rlabs stsal du gsol/ lan gsum/
Guru Cakrasaṃvara, please bestow upon my body the blessings of the fire of wisdom. Three times.

slob dpon gyi thugs ka nas 'od zer 'phros thod pa'i nang gi yi dam yab yum gyi sku'i byin rlabs me'i rang bzhin oM gyi rnam pa 'od zer gyi tshul du 'phros pa phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas byang sems yi dam zhi khro rgyal sras 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi sku rdo rje dang ro gcig tu 'dres (274)pa khyed rang rnams kyi dpral bar thim pa'i mos pa gyis/

Light rays radiate from the heart of the ācārya. The blessings of the bodies of the male and female yidam consorts inside the skull cup are of the nature of fire and are in the form of oṃs, radiating light rays. They mix as one taste with the vajra bodies of the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions, the peaceful and wrathful yidams, and the assembly of noble victors and their children. {274} Feel that they dissolve into your foreheads.
oM hrIHha ha hU~M hU~M phaT/ oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye hU~M hU~M phaT swa hA/
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajravairocanīye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

zhes nye snying brjod cing / thod pas dpral mtshams su dbang bskur zhing rol mo sgrog gu gul gyi dud pas bdug dpal 'bar ram gyis mtshan pa lus la bskor bas lus me'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Thus, recite the quintessence mantra. Bestow the abhiṣeka on their foreheads with the skull cup and play music. Fumigate with guggula smoke. Feel that your body is surrounded by a fire cakra marked by ram and that your body becomes of the nature of fire.
dz+nyA na dz+wa la raM su pra tiSh+Tha badzrA ya swA hA/
jñāna jvala raṃ supratiṣṭha vajrāya svāhā

zhes brjod cing dpal 'bar lus la bskor/ de ltar dbang bskur bas sku'i byin rlabs lus la zhugs pas sku rdo rje 'grub pa'i skal ldan du gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod/ de nas gsung gi byin rlabs zhu snyam pas gsol ba gdab pa 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/

Circle a fire cakra around their bodies. Feel that having received the abhiṣeka, the blessings of body have entered your body and you have the fortune of achieving vajra body. Next, thinking that you are requesting to receive the blessings of speech, repeat the following supplication:
bla ma 'khor lo sdom pa yis/ / bdag gi ngag la ye shes kyi/ / me yi byin rlabs stsal du gsol/ lan gsum/
Guru Cakrasaṃvara, please bestow upon my speech the blessings of the fire of wisdom. Three times.

slob dpon gyi thugs ka nas 'od zer 'phros/ thod pa'i nang gi yi dam gyi gsung gi byin rlabs me yi rang bzhin AH'i rnam pa 'od zer gyi tshul du 'phros pa/ phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas byang sems yi dam zhi khro rgyal sras 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi gsung rdo rje dang ro gcig tu 'dres pa khyed rang rnams kyi mgrin par thim pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Light rays radiate from the heart of the ācārya. The blessings of the speech of the yidams inside the skull cup are of the nature of fire and are in the form of āḥs, radiating light rays. They mix as one taste with the vajra speech of the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions, the peaceful and wrathful yidams, and the assembly of noble victors and their children. Feel that they dissolve into your throats.
AHi hrIHswA/
āḥ i hrīḥ svā
zhes thod pas mgrin par dbang bskur zhing rol mo dang dud pa bya/
Bestow the abhiṣeka on their throats with the skull cup, play music, and [circulate] smoke.
de nas sngags 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
Next, repeat this mantra.
ces 'tshams sbyar nas slob dpon gyis phreng ba nas bzung du bcug la/ yi dam yab yum gyi nye snying lan/ kha shas bgrang bu bcug / bdud rtsi thur mgo re ster/

Having made this introduction, the ācārya should have them take hold of the mālā and recite the quintessence mantras of the male and female yidam consorts a few times. Give them each a spoonful of amṛta.
dpal 'bar raM gyis mtshan pa ngag la bskor bas ngag rlung ye shes me yi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that your speech is surrounded by a fire cakra marked by raṃ and that your speech and winds become of the nature of wisdom fire.
dz+nyAn dz+wa la ri su pra tiSh+Tha badzra ya swA hA/
jñāna jvala raṃ[10] supratiṣṭha vajraya svāhā
brjod cing dpal 'bar bskor/
Circle a fire cakra.
de ltar dbang bskur bas gsung gi byin rlabs ngag la zhugs pas gsung rdo rje 'grub pa'i skal ldan du byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/ thugs kyi byin rlabs zhu snyam pas gsol ba gdab pa 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/

Feel that having received the abhiṣeka, the blessings of speech have entered your speech and you have the fortune of achieving vajra speech. Thinking that you are requesting to receive the blessings of mind, repeat the following supplication:
bla ma 'khor lo sdom pa yis/ (275) bdag gi yid la ye shes kyi/ / me yi byin rlabs stsal du gsol/ lan gsum/
Guru Cakrasaṃvara, {275} please bestow upon my mind the blessings of the fire of wisdom. Three times.

yang slob dpon gyi thugs ka nas 'od zer 'phros thod pa'i nang gi yi dam yab yum gyi thugs kyi byin rlabs me'i rang bzhin hU~M gi rnam pa 'od zer gyi tshul du 'phros pa/ phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas byang sems yi dam zhi khro rgyal sras 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi thugs rdo rje dang ro gcig tu 'dres pa khyed rang rnams kyi snying khar thim pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Again, light rays radiate from the heart of the ācārya. The blessings of the mind of the male and female yidam consorts inside the skull cup are of the nature of fire and are in the form of hūṃs, radiating light rays. They mix as one taste with the vajra minds of the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions, the peaceful and wrathful yidams, and the assembly of noble victors and their children. Feel that they dissolve into your hearts.
hU~M/ zhes brjod cing thod pa snying gar 'jog pa dang rol mo/ dud pa bya/ de nas/ dpal 'bar ram gyis mtshan pa yid la bskor bas ye shes me'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod/

hūṃ Bestow the abhiṣeka on their hearts with the skull cup, play music, and [circulate] smoke. Then say: Think that your mind is surrounded by a fire cakra marked by ram and that it becomes of the nature of wisdom fire.
dz+nya na dz+wa la raM su pra tiSh+Tha badzra ya swA hA/ zhes dpa' 'bar bskor/
jñāna jvala raṃ supratiṣṭha vajraya svāhā Circle a fire cakra.

de ltar dbang bskur bas thugs kyi byin rlabs yid la zhugs pas thugs rdo rje 'grub pa'i skal ldan du byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/ de nas sku gsung thugs dbyer mi phyed pa'i byin rlabs zhu snyam pas gsol ba gdab pa 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/

Feel that having received the abhiṣeka, the blessings of mind have entered your mind and you have the fortune of achieving vajra mind. Thinking that you are requesting to receive the blessings of the inseparable body, speech, and mind, repeat the following supplication:
bla ma 'khor lo sdom pa yis/ / bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum la/ / ye shes me yi byin rlabs stsol/ lan gsum/
Guru Cakrasaṃvara, please bestow upon my body, speech, and mind the blessings of the fire of wisdom. Three times.

thod pa'i nang gi dpal 'khor lo sdom pa yab yum 'od du zhu ba las ye shes me'i bdud rtsi'i rnam par gyur pa khyed rang rnams la byin pas sgo gsum sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod/ thod pa gnas gsum du gtugs nas yi ge gsum brjod cing rol mo dang dud pa bya/ bdud rtsi sbyin/ dpal 'bar ram gyis mtshan pa lus la bskor bas lus ngag yid gsum ye shes me'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Inside the skull cup, the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, male and female consorts, melt into light and become the form of amṛta of wisdom fire. By giving this to you, feel that your three doors become of the natures of their body, speech, and mind. Touch the skull cup to their three places, say the three syllables, play music, and [circulate] smoke. Give them amṛta. Feel that your body is surrounded by a fire cakra marked by ram and that your body, speech, and mind become of the nature of wisdom fire.
dz+nyA na dz+wa la raM su pra tiSh+Tha badzra ya sA hA/ zhes brjod cing dpal 'bar bskor/
jñāna jvala raṃ supratiṣṭha vajrāya svāhā Circle a fire cakra.

de ltar dbang bskur bas sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i byin rlabs sgo gsum la zhugs pas 'pho med bde chen thob pa'i skal ldan du byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/ des dbang dngos song nas dbang don (276) gyi ye shes ngo sprod pa la/ lus gnad/ rlung gnad/ dmigs pa'i gnad gsum las/

Feel that having received the abhiṣeka, the blessings of vajra body, speech, and mind have entered your three doors and you have the fortune of attaining unmoving great bliss. {276} Next, after the actual abhiṣekas, is the pointing out of the wisdom that is the meaning of the abhiṣekas. For this, there are the vital points of body, the vital points of breath, and the vital points of the objects of meditation. The vital points of body are as follows:
lus gnad ni/
For the body:
lus ni rdo rje skyil mo krung / / sgal tshig rin chen rtsal la brgyus/ / mthong kha rgyun du yangs pa dang / / stong sgo shin tu sba bar bya/ /
sit in the vajra position, your spine is like jewels strung on a reed, your chest should always be spacious, and your upper door very concealed.
lce ni yar rkan nyid du gtad/ / mnyam bzhag phyag rgya lte 'og btsir/ / mig dang shes pa ma 'gyur bar/ / rlung sems dril la drag tu gcun/ /

Your tongue should be directed toward your upper palate. With the mudrā of equipoise, press below your navel. Not changing your eyes or consciousness, your winds and mind are concentrated and forcefully held.
rdo rje skyil krung rdzogs sangs rgyas/ zhes gsungs pa'i don/
The vajra posture is complete buddhahood. Thus it is said.[11]

rkang pa g.yas steng du bton pa'i rdo rje skyil krung / mnyam gzhag gi phyag rgya lte 'og tu bcas pa'i gru mos stod gcun/ sgal tshigs dong rtse brtsegs pa ltar bsrang / mthong kha rgyun du yangs par bya/ og skos mdud mnan/ lce yar rkan la gtad pa'i mig gnyis sna rtse'am/ thad ka'i bar snang la blta ba'i rnam snang chos bdun legs par bca' dgos pas lus gnad de ltar mdzad par zhu/ zhes lus gnad de ltar 'char gzhug

The meaning of that is as follows: Sit in the vajra position with your right foot placed on top. With the mudrā of meditative equipoise [held] below your navel, draw your elbows toward your torso. Keep your spine straight like a stack of coins. Always keep your chest expanded. Press your chin down toward your Adam’s apple.[12] With your tongue directed at your palate, your eyes should gaze into the space at the tip of your nose or straight in front. Since it is important to hold those seven dharmas of Vairocana, please take up those vital points for the body. Thus, have them hold those vital points for the body.

de nas rlung gnad la/ sngon 'gro 'bud ba dgu phrugs ni/ g.yas nas g.yon/ g.yon nas g.yas/ dbus nas thad dkar gtad nas 'jam po mis mi tshor ba gsum/ drag po gsum/ gcud cing 'bud pa gsum ste dgu phrugs su bus shig ces slob dpon gyis bslab la rlung ro 'bud/ dngos gzhi sbyor ba bzhi ldan la/ / rngub dang dgang dang gzhil ba dang / / 'phang bar bya dang rnam pa bzhi/

Next, the vital points for the breath are as follows: The preliminary is to do the ninefold exhalations. Inhale through the right and exhale through the left, inhale through the left and exhale through the right, and from the center to directly in front, exhale gently three times so that it is not perceptible to humans, exhale forcefully three times, and press down and then expel three times.[13] Those are the ninefold exhalations. The ācārya should have the disciples expel their stale breath. The main practice is the four yogic techniques. Inhaling, filling, dispersing, and releasing are the four points. Thus it is said.

zhes pa'i don ni phyi'i sor bcu drug tsam gyi thad nas sgra med du sna gnyis kyi nang du gzhug pa rngub pa/ de lte 'og tu mnan/ 'og rlung cung zad 'then nas kha sbyor du 'dzin pa dgang ba dang / mi thub la khad pa dang rngub chung byas/ g.yas bcag g.yon bcag cha mnyam du bcag pa gzhil ba/

The meaning of that is as follows: From a distance of about sixteen fingerbreadths outside, inhale through both nostrils without a sound. Press that down below your navel. Drawing up your lower wind slightly, hold those in union. That is filling. When you almost cannot hold, take small inhalations. Press them to the right, press them to the left, press them everywhere. That is dispersing.

de nas mi thub la khang pa dang sna gnyis nas dang po dang mjug tu shed chung zhing / bar du shugs che (277) bar dbyung ba mda' ltar 'phang ba ste sbyor ba bzhi ldan gyi sgo nas rlung khug pa bcu re 'dzin par zhu/ zhes slob dpon dang lhan cig 'dzin/

Next, when you almost cannot hold, exhale with less force at the beginning and end and with greater force in the middle, shooting like an arrow. {277} Using those four yogic techniques, hold ten cycles of breathing. [Have the disciples] hold together with the ācārya.
de nas dmigs pa'i gnad ni khyed rang rnams kyi spyi bor rtsa brgyud kyi bla ma rnams tho brtsegs su bzhugs pa'i mos pas gdung shugs drag pos gsol 'debs 'di bzhin lhan cig tu gsung bar zhu/

Next, the vital points of the objects of meditation are as follows: Feel that on the top of your head are your root and lineage gurus, seated stacked in tiers. With forceful longing, please say the following supplication together.

'khor lo sdom pa dpal ldan sha wa ri/ / ras chung pa dang 'jam dbyangs chos kyi grags/ / tsaN+Da lI dang mi pham pad+ma dkar/ / chos kyi mgon po ngag dbang bzang po'i zhabs/ / mi pham blo gros kun dga' lhun grub dang / / chos kyi dbang phyug dge legs bzhad pa'i zhabs/ / 'jam mgon dgyes pa 'jam dpal dpa' bo dang / / chos kyi snang ba ye shes grub pa la/ / gsol ba 'debs so rtsa rlung byin gyis rlobs/ /

Cakrasaṃvara, glorious Śavari, Rechung, Jamyang Chökyi Drak, Caṇḍalī, Mipam Pema Kar, Chökyi Gönpo, Ngakwang Zangpo, Mipam Lodrö, Kunga Lhundrup, Chökyi Wangchuk, Gelek Zhepa, Jamgön Gyepa, Jampal Pawo, Chökyi Nangwa, and Yeshe Drupa, we supplicate you: bless our channels and winds.
lus la bde drod 'bar bar byin gyis rlobs/ / phung po 'ja' lus 'grub par byin gyis rlobs/
Bless us that bliss and heat blaze in our bodies. Bless us that we achieve rainbow bodies with our skandhas.
lan bcu brjod/
Say that ten times.

de ltar gsol ba btab pas 'khor lo sdom pa nas bzung brgyud pa'i bla ma rnams rtsa ba'i bla ma la thim/ rtsa ba'i bla ma 'od du zhu nas khyed rang rnams la so sor thim pas bla ma'i thugs dang rang sems dbyer med kyi ngos nas/ gnas lugs phyag rgya chen po'i ngang du cung zad mnyam par 'jog pa zhu/ des gtum mo'i me dbang du grags pa'i byin rlabs legs par thob pa yin pas/ dbang dus su thob pa'i dam tshig rnams ma nyams par bsrung snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/

Having supplicated in that way, Cakrasaṃvara and then the lineage gurus dissolve into your root guru. Your root guru melts into light and dissolves into each of you. With the perspective of your mind being inseparable from your guru’s mind, rest evenly for a short time in the abiding-state mahāmudrā. Through that you have properly received the blessings of what is renowned as the abhiṣeka of the fire of caṇḍālī. Thinking that you will preserve in an unbroken manner the samayas that you received during the abhiṣekas, repeat the following:
gtso bos ji ltar sogs dang / gtong rag gi maN+Dal/ lus 'bul/ dge bsngo rnams spyi ltar byas la slob ma byes so/
Whatever the principal one commands, [all that I will do.] As a maṇḍala of thanks, offer your body. Do the dedication of virtue as it is generally done, and send the students away.
gsum pa rjes kyi bya ba ni/
III. The Concluding Section
tshogs kyi yo byad rnams brda'i 'bul len byas la nang gi sregs blugs kyi longs spyad nas lhag ma logs su bzhag
Perform the offering and receiving of the feast items with the symbolic gestures and enjoy them as an inner burning and pouring. The leftovers should be put to the side.
gtor ma 'bul ba ni/
The torma offering.
chu chad nang mchod bran la bsang sbyang / bdud rtsi ltar byin rlabs bya/
Sprinkle with water, alcohol, and the inner offering. Cleanse and purify. Do the consecration as done for the amṛta. {278}
mdun gyi nam mkhar 'byung ba rim brtsegs ri (278) rab dang bcas pa'i steng du dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor rten dang brten par bcas te dur khrod brgyad dang bcas pa skad cig gis gsal bar gyur/
Instantly, in the sky in front, above the layers of elements and Meru, the maṇḍala of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, support and supported, with the eight charnel grounds, clearly appears.
'bar ba'i phyag rgya lta stangs bcas/
Do the blazing mudrā with the gaze and say:
pheM pheM brjod/ de nas rol mo dang bcas pas/
pheṃ pheṃ Then, with music, say:

shrI badzra he ru ka A kar+d+ha ya A kar+d+ha ya/ pra we sha ya pra we sha ya/ b+han+d+ha ya b+han+d+ha ya/ to Sha ya to Sha ya/ sarba badzra DA ki nI hr-i da ya/ a pa to Sha ya/ dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH oM AHhU~M/ sarba bI ra yo gi ni swa b+hA wa Arma ko‘haM/

śrīvajraheruka ākardhaya ākardhaya / praveśaya praveśaya / bhandhaya bhandhaya / toṣaya toṣaya / sarvavajraḍākinī hṛdya / apatoṣaya / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ / oṃ āḥ hūṃ / sarvavīrayoginī svabhāva ārmako ’ham
zhes pas lan gsum dang /
Say that three times.

thugs ka'i sa bon las 'od 'phros pas/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nas dpa' bo dang / rnal 'byor ma thams cad spyan drangs te sprin gtibs pa bzhin mdun gyi nam mkhar byon par bsam la/ pang skor byed cing yab yum gyi snying po dang nye snying gi mthar/

From the seed syllables at their hearts, light rays radiate, inviting all the heroes and yoginīs in the worldly realms of the ten directions. They come into the space in front, gathering like clouds. Do a lotus circle, and at the end of the essence and quintessence mantras of the male and female consorts, say:
oM badzra A ral+li hoHdzaHhU~M baM ho/ badzra DA ki nI sa ma ya s+t+waM/ dr-i sh+ya hoH
oṃ vajra āralli hoḥ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ / vajraḍākinī samayastvaṃ / dṛśya hoḥ

rgyas par 'khor sngags rnams la sngags btags pa brjod/ bsdu na snga mas chog mthar 'khyud rgya dang bcas dkyil 'khor gyi lha gtso 'khor dpag tu med pa byon nas lha so so la thim par bsam/ lha rnams kyi ljags hU~M las skyes pa'i rdo rje sbu gu can du gyur par gtor ma gsol bar bsam la/ gtso bo'i snying po nas gshin rje 'joms ma'i bar gyi sngags lan gsum gyis 'bul/ /

If you wish to be extensive, add the mantra to the mantras for the retinue. If you wish to abbreviate, the previous is sufficient. At the end, with the embracing mudrā, think that the limitless deities of the maṇḍala, the principal ones and their retinue, come and dissolve into the respective deities. From hūṃs, the tongues of the deities become hollow vajras and they receive the tormas. Offer by reciting the mantras from the essence mantra of the principal one through the mantra of Yamamathanī three times.
shes na phreng sngags kyang brjod/
If you know it, also say the mālā mantra.
gtor ma'i steng rim nas bdud rtsi myang ba'i tshul gyis gsol bas zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang ldan par bsam la/
Eat the torma, taking it from the upper level, [enjoying it] in the manner of tasting amṛta. Think that is accompanied by undefiled bliss.
de nas/
Next say:
oM/ dur khrod dang ni shing gcig dang / / ri bo dang ni ri sul phug / grong dang gzhi bdo zhing dang ni/ / khyad par du ni khyim stong dang / /
oṃ [Those dwelling in] the charnel grounds, by a single tree, on mountains, in ravines, in caves, in towns, and by trees at crossroads and, especially, in empty houses,
sems can smod dang thang dang ni/ / khyad par du ni chu la gnas/ / nag po drag po drag chen po/ / lha sbyin mnyam du bsten pa dang / /
in [the homes of] despised beings, on plains, and, particularly, in watery places, there are Kṛṣṇarudra, Mahārudra, those attending Devadatta,
nag po gtsigs dang mi sdug dang / / rga las 'das dang log 'dren dang / / rgan byed ma dang drag mo dang / / 'jigs byed ma dang u ma dang / /
Kṛṣṇa, Karāla, Bībhatsa, Nandātīta, Vināyaka, Cāmuṇḍī, Ghorī, Bībhatsī, Umā, {279}
rgyal (279)dang rnam par rgyal ma dang / / mi thub gzhan gyis mi thub ma/ / nag mo bzang mo nag chen mo/ / nag sbom ma dang rnal 'byor ma/ /
Jayā, Vijayā, Ajitā, Aparājitā, Bhadrakālī, Mahākālī, Sthūlakālī yoginī,
dbang mo dang ni zla ba mo/ / dreg tu sdang dang 'phyang ba mo/ / 'phrog byed ma dang mar me ma/ / 'jigs byed grong gnas rnal 'byor ma/ /
Indrī, Candrī, Ghorī, Duṣṭī, Lambakī, Kāmbojī, Dīpinī, Cūṣiṇī, yoginīs living in towns,
drag mo'i gzugs dang gzugs chen mo/ / mche ba gtsigs dang thod chen ma/ / thod phreng phreng dang kha T+wAM ga / sprul chen ral gri dgra s+t+wa can/ / rdo rje de ni gzhu can ma/ /
Ghorarūpā, Mahārūpā, Daṃṣṭrārūpā, Karālinī, *Mahākapālā, Kapālamālā, Mālinī, Khaṭvāṅgāyī, Maharddhikā, Khaḍg[ahast]ā, Paraśuhastā, Vajrahastā, and Dhanur[hastā].
de nyid chen mo'i mkha' 'gro lnga/ / las kun rjes su sgrub byed pa/ /
The five ḍākinīs of great suchness accomplish all activities.
sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor rgyal chen mo/ / de bzhin rdo rje dbang phyug gtso/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku chen mo/ / rdul med rnal 'byor sbyin pa mo/ /
The great queen of the maṇḍala of union is thus: Vajreśvarī, the principal one, the great lady of the body of tathāgatas, bestower of the pure yoga.
rdo rje dbang mo'i bka' 'di yis/ / thams cad ma lus 'dir 'dus shig / bcom ldan 'khor lo bde mchog la/ / dam can srung ma'i tshogs kyis bskor/ /
Through the command of Vajraśachī, everyone gather here.[14] Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, surrounded by an assembly of protectors of samaya holders,
rgyal chen bzhi po 'khor dang bcas/ / phyogs skyong bcu po 'khor dang bcas/ / lha chen brgyad po= klu chen brgyad po=
the four great kings with their retinues, the ten protectors of the directions with their retinues, the eight great gods… the eight great nāgas…
gza' chen brgyad po= rgyu skar nyer brgyad= de la sogs te mkha' 'gro'i tshogs/ / mkha' 'gro'i tshogs rnams ma lus dang / /
the eight great planetary [gods]… [the gods of] the twenty-eight lunar mansions… those and others, and assemblies of ḍākinīs, all assemblies of ḍākinīs without exception,
'byung po'i tshogs rnams ma lus dang / yi dwags tshogs rnams= gnod sbyin tshogs rnams= srin po'i=
all assemblies of bhūtas without exception, all assemblies of hungry ghosts… all assemblies of yakṣas… all assemblies of rākṣasas…
sha za'i= smyo byed= rjed byed= ma lus ji snyed yod pa kun/ / thams cad ma lus 'dir 'dus shig
all assemblies of piśācas… all assemblies of those causing madness… all assemblies of those causing forgetfulness… all of them, however many they may be, everyone, without exception, gather here.
ces pas spyan drangs la/
Thus, invite them.
oM badzra A ral+li hoHdzaHhU~M ba~M hoH badzra DA ki ni sa ma ya s+t+waM dri sh+ya hoH
oṃ vajra āralli hoḥ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ / vajraḍākinī samayastvaṃ driśya hoḥ
zhes 'khyud pa'i phyag rgya dang bcas dur khrod brgyad na gnas pa rnams la bstim la/ de nas mgron rnams kyi ljags hU~M las byung ba'i rdo rje spu bu can gyis gtor ma gsol bar bsam zhing /

With the embracing mudrā, think that they dissolve into those who dwell in the eight charnel grounds. Then, think that, from hūṃs, the tongues of the deities become hollow vajras with which they receive the tormas.

oM kha kha khA hi khA hi/ sarba ya k+Sha/ rak+Sha sa b+hU ta/ pre ta/ pi shA tsa/ un+mA da/ a pasmA ra/ badzra DA ka DA (280)ki n+ya da ya/ i dam ba liM gr-ih+Na tu/ sa ma ya rak+Shan+tu/ ma ma sarba sid+d+hi m+me pra yats+tshan+tu/ ya the ba~M/ ya theSh+TaM/ b+huny+dza tha/ bi wa tha/ dzig+h+ra tha/ ma ti kra ma tha/ ma ma sarba ka ra ta ya/ sat+su khaM/ bi shrAd+d+ha ye/ sa hA yi ka b+ha wan+tu hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/

oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi / sarvayakṣa / rakṣasa bhūta / preta / piśāca / unmāda / apasmāra / vajraḍāka / {280} ḍākinyadaya / idam baliṃ gṛhṇatu / samaya rakṣantu / mama sarvasiddhimme prayacchantu / yathevaṃ / yatheṣṭaṃ / bhuñjatha / pīvatha / jighratha / matikramatha / mama sarvakarataya satsukhaṃ / viśuddhaye[15] / sahāyika bhavantu hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā
zhes lan gsum gyis phul bas tshims par bsam/ de nas/
Offer with that three times, and think that it satisfies. Next:
oM AHbadzra puSh+pe pra tIts+tsha hU~M swA hA/
oṃ āḥ vajra puṣpe pratīccha hūṃ svāhā
d+hU pe= A lo ke= gan+d+he= nai wid+ya= shab+da pra tIts+tsha hU~M swA hA/
…dhūpe…āloke…gandhe…naividya…śabta pratīccha svāhā
rnam lnga rol mo dang bcas pas mchod/
Offer those five with music.
hU~M/ bcom ldan ldan mgon po dpa' bo chen po ni/ / bskal pa'i me chen lta bur rab tu 'bar/ / ral pa'i cod pan dbu yi rgyan du bcings/ / mche ba rab gtsigs drag shul 'jigs pa'i gzugs/ /
hūṃ Bhagavān, protector, great hero, blazing like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs.
sku la phyag stong gzi brjid ldan pa po/ / dgra s+t+wa zhags pa kha T+wAM mdung bsnams shing / / rab 'jigs stag gi pags pa gos su gyon/ / sku chen dud kha bgegs mthar mdzad la 'dud/
You are majestic with a thousand arms, hold a battle-ax, noose, khaṭvāṃga, and spear, and are frightening, draped in a tiger skin. To the one with the great smoky body, subduer of obstructors, I bow.
hU~M/ bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo 'phags ma ni/ / 'jig rten gsum sogs phyogs gzhan rgol bas mi thub cing / / 'byung po'i 'jigs pa ma lus rdo rje chen mos 'joms/ /
hūṃ Bhagavatī, noble Vajravārāhī, unswayed by opponents, the three worlds, great Vajra Lady, conquering fears of bhūtas,

rdo rje gdan bzhugs tshangs sogs dbang byed las rgyal zhing / / rdo rje phag mo kho mo'i gzugs can drag snyems ma/ / rmugs byed rengs byed myos byed las ni rnam rgyal zhing / / bdud kyi 'jigs pa pham zhing skem par mdzad pa mo/ /

residing at Vajrāsana, and victorious over the powerful, such as Brahmā, Vajrayoginī, with the form of a krodī, wrathful haughty lady, you are victorious over those who cause sluggishness, those who cause paralysis, and those who cause insanity, you dry up and destroy fears of Māra.
rnal 'byor chen mo 'dod pa'i dbang phyug khyod la 'dud/
To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I bow.

zhes brjod/ srid dang zhi la chags rnams kun tu rtog pa'i rlabs bcom zhing / khyod ni dngos kun rang bzhin mkha' ltar gzigs pa nyid gyur kyang / / snying rje lci ba'i chu yis rab rgyas thugs kyi mtsho ldan mgon/ / lha mo rnams kyis bdag la shin tu rjes brtser mdzad du gsol/ zhes gsol ba gdab bo/

And: You destroy the waves of thoughts impassioned about existence and peace. You see the nature of all things to be like space. You are the protectors, whose ocean-like minds are full with the heavy waters of compassion. Goddesses, please hold me in your kindness. Thus, supplicate. {281}
oM shrI he ru ka sa ma (281)ya sogs/ zhes yi ge brgya pa lan gsum brjod nas/
oṃ śrīheruka samaya… Say the hundred syllables three times.
dam can rgya mtsho khyed rnams kyis/ / mchod sbyin gtor ma 'di bzhes la/ / rnal 'byor bdag cag 'khor bcas la/ sogs nas/

All you ocean of holders of samaya, accept this offering and gift of torma. May we yogins and yoginīs with our retinues [be without illness, have long lives, might, glory, fame, excellent fortune, and vast enjoyments. Bestow on us the siddhis of actions: pacifying, enriching, and the others. Samaya holders, protect us. Be our friend and aid for the siddhis. May we not meet with untimely death, illness, spirits, or hindrances. May we not have bad dreams, bad omens, or bad interactions. May there be peace in the world, good harvests, plentiful grains, the flourishing of dharma, and an abundance of goodness.]
yid la 'dod pa kun 'grub shog / de bzhin pha rol tshogs 'joms shing / / dgra rnams thams cad pham par mdzod/ / mchod sbyin 'di yi mthu stobs kyis/ / bsam pa yid bzhin 'grub par shog

May all that we desire be accomplished. Similarly, conquer the hordes of outsiders and destroy all our enemies. Through the power of this offering and gift, accomplish our intentions just as we conceive them.
zhes phrin las bcol/
Thus, entrust them with activity.
sems can thams cad sdig med cing / / sems can thams cad bde gyur cig / sangs rgyas nyid dang 'phrad gyur pa'i/ / lam de nyid la zhugs nas kyang / /
May all beings be without evil. May all beings have happiness. Having entered this path, which connects with buddhahood,
ma bsgral ba rnams bsgral ba dang / / ma grol ba rnams dgrol ba dang / / rnal 'byor gtsug lag dam tshig la/ / da lta nyid du gnas par shog
may those not released be released, those not liberated be liberated, and may all abide right now in samaya, the temple of yoga.
zhes smon lam gdab par byas la/
Thus, make that aspiration.
gtor mgron ye shes pa rnams bdag nyid la thim zhing / 'jig rten pa rnams rang gnas su gshegs par bsam mo/ /
