byang dzA lan+d+ha rar ma hA kang+ka la dang gtum mig ma/ nub o rgyan du kang+ka la dang (305)'od ldan ma/ lho Arbu dar mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa dang sna chen ma/ me go dA wa rir su ra bai ri dang brtan pa'i blo gros ma/ bden bral rA me shwa rar 'od dpag med dang mi'u thung ma/ rlung de wI ko Tar rdo rje'i 'od dang lang+ka'i dbang phyug ma/ dbang ldan mA la bar rdo rje'i sku dang shing gi grib ma ste thams cad kyang sku mdog sngon po'o/ /

On the northern spoke, Jālandhara, are Mahākaṇkāla and Caṇḍākṣī. On the western spoke, Oḍḍiyāna, are Kaṅkāla and Prabhāvatī. {305} On the southern spoke, Arbuda, are Vikaṭadaṃṣṭrī and Mahānāsā. On Agni’s spoke, Godāvarī, are Surāvairī and Vīramatī. On Nairṛti’s spoke, Rāmeśvarī, are Amitābha and Kharvarī. On Vāyu’s spoke, Devīkoṭa, are Vajraprabha and Laṅkeśvarī. On Īśāna’s spoke, Mālava, are Vajradeha and Drumacchāyā. They all have blue forms.

de'i 'og gsung gi 'khor lo'i shar gyi rtsibs kA ma rU par myur gu can dang sa srung ma/ byang o trer rdo rje ral pa can dang 'jigs byed chen mo/ nub tri sha ku ner dpa' bo chen po dang rlung gi shugs can ma/ lhor ko sa lar rdo rje hU~M mdzad dang chang 'thung ma/ shar lho ka ling+kar rab tu bzang po dang sngo bsangs lha mo/ lho nub laM pa kar rdo rje bzang po dang shin tu bzang mo/ nub byang 'jigs byed chen po dang rta rna ma/ byang shar hi ma la yar mig mi bzang dang bya gdong ma ste thams cad kyang sku mdog dmar po'o/ /

Below that is the speech cakra. On its eastern spoke, Kāmarūpa, are Aṅkuraka and Airāvatī. On the northern spoke, Oḍra, are Vajrajaṭila and Mahābhairavā. On the western spoke, Triśakuni, are Mahāvīra and Vāyuvegā. On the southern spoke, Kośala, are Vajrahūṃkāra and Surābhakṣī. On the southeastern spoke, Kaliṅga, are Subhadra and Śyāmādevī. On the southwestern spoke, Lampāka, are Vajrabhadra and Subhadrā. On the northwestern spoke, Kāñchi, are Mahābhairava and Hayakarṇī. On northeastern spoke, Himālaya, are Vīrūpākṣa and Khagānanā. They all have red forms.

de'i 'og sku'i 'khor lo'i shar gyi rtsibs pre ta pu rir stobs po che dang 'khor lo'i shugs can ma/ byang gr-i ha de war rin chen rdo rje dang du ma skyes ma/ nub sau raSh+Tar rta mgrin dang shoN+Di nI/ lho su war+Na dI par nam mkha'i snying po dang 'khor lo'i go cha ma/ me nA ga rar dpal he ru ka dang shin tu dpa' mo/ bden bral sin+d+hU rar pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug dang stobs chen ma/ rlung ma rur rnam par snang mdzad dang 'khor los bsgyur bas/ dbang ldan ku lu tAr rdo rje sems dpa' dang brtson 'grus chen mo/ / de thams cad kyang sku mdog dkar po ste/

Below that is the body cakra. On the eastern spoke, Pretapurī, are Mahābala and Cakravegā. On the northern spoke, Gṛhadevatā, are Ratnavajra and Khaṇḍarohā. On the western spoke, Saurāṣṭra, are Hayagrīva and Śauṇḍinī. On the southern spoke, Suvarṇadvīpa, are Ākāśagarbha and Cakravarmiṇī. On Agni’s spoke, Nagara, are glorious Heruka and Suvīrā. On Nairṛti’s spoke, Sindhu, are Padmanarteśvara and Mahābalā. On Vāyu’s spoke, Maru, are Vairocana and Cakravartinī. On Īśāna’s spoke, Kulutā, are Vajrasattva and Mahāvīryā. They all have white forms.

dpa' bo thams cad zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa la g.yas dang po thams cad thugs kyi dpa' bo rnams rdo rje/ gsung gi rnams pad+ma/ sku'i rnams 'khor lo 'dzin cing / g.yon dang po thams cad de dag gis yu ba byas pa'i dril bu 'dzin pas rang rang gi yum la 'khyud cing / lhag ma g.yas DA ma ru dang g.yon kha T+wAM ga 'dzin pa/ zhal mche ba gtsigs shing spyan gsum ral (306) pa'i cod pan stod cha gyen du brdzes pa'i rtse rang rang rigs bdag gi phyag mtshan dang nor bu'i phreng bas mdzes shing lhag mthur du grol ba/

All the heroes have one face and four hands. In their first right hands, all the heroes of mind hold vajras, all those of speech hold lotuses, and all those of body hold cakras. In their first left hands, they all hold ghaṇṭās with handles. With [these two hands] they embrace their respective consorts. In their remaining hands they hold ḍamarus with their right and khaṭvāṃgas with their left. Their fangs are bared, and they have three eyes. {306} The upper part of their topknot of hair sweeps upward, and its tip is beautified by the emblem of their respective family lord and a garland of gems. The remainder of their hair hangs free.

thod skam lnga lnga'i dbu rgyan dang / rlon pa khrag 'dzag pa lnga bcu'i do shal can/ gcer bu sbrul dang rus pa'i rgyan drug gis brgyan cing stag lpags kyi sham thabs gsol pa/ sgeg pa la sogs gar dgu'i nyams dang ldan pa/ pad+ma dang nyi ma ro'i gdan la zhabs g.yas brkyang zhing g.yon cung zad bskum pa'i rol stabs kyis bzhugs pa/ yum thams cad zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ dbu skra sil bu'i stod cha gyen du brdzes pa rim pa bzhin/ rdo rje/ pad+ma/ 'khor lo rnams kyis mdzes shing / gzhan phyag mtshan rgyan cha lugs 'khyud stangs rnams ni gtso mo dang mthun pa'o/ /

They wear crowns of five dried skulls and necklaces of fifty fresh ones dripping blood. They are naked, adorned with snakes and the six bone ornaments. They wear tiger-skin skirts. They display the nine moods of the dramatic arts, such as alluring. They stand on seats of lotuses, suns, and moons in the playful posture with their right legs extended and their left slightly bent. All the female consorts have one face and two arms. The upper part of their loose hair sweeps upward and is beautified, in order, with vajras, lotuses, or cakras. Their remaining emblems, ornaments, attributes, and embracing posture are the same as those of the principal female.

de'i phyi rol lha snam dam tshig gi 'khor lo'i shar sgor khwa gdong ma sngon mo/ byang sgor 'ug gdong ma ljang gu/ nub sgor khyi gdong ma dmar mo/ lho sgor phag gdong ma ser mo/ mer gshin rje brtan ma g.yas sngo g.yon ser ba/ bden bral du gshin rje pho nya mo g.yas ser g.yon dmar ba/ rlung du gshin rje mche ba ma g.yas dmar g.yon ljang ba/ dbang ldan du gshin rje 'joms ma g.yas ljang g.yon spo ba/ thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag bzhi ma dbu skra sil bu'i stod cha gyen du brdzes pa ral gris mdzes shing / gzhan phyag mtshan rgyan cha lugs bzhugs stangs rnams ni nang gi mkha' 'gro ma bzhi dang mthun pa ste/ dpa' bo mkha' 'gro thams cad ye shes kyi me rab tu 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs pa'o/ /

Outside of that is the samaya cakra, the deity podium. In the eastern door is blue Kākāsyā. In the northern door is green Ulūkāsyā. In the western door is red Śvānāsyā. In the southern door is yellow Śūkarāsyā. In Agni’s door is Yamadāḍhī, her right side blue, her left side yellow. In Nairṛti’s door is Yamadūtī, her right side yellow, her left side red. In Vāyu’s door is Yamadaṃṣṭriṇī, her right side red, her left side green. In Īśāna’s door is Yamamathanī, her right side green, her left side blue. All have one face and four arms. The upper part of their loose hair sweeps upward and is beautified with swords. Their remaining emblems, ornaments, attributes, and standing posture are the same as those of the inner ḍākinīs. All the heroes and ḍākinīs stand in the midst of a raging fire of wisdom.
de nas gsum pa phyi'i 'khor bskyed pa ni/
iii. Generating the Outer Retinue

gtso 'khor rnams kyi thugs ka nas 'od zer sku dang phyag mtshan yig 'bru thig le'i rnam pa dpag tu med pa gzhal yas khang pa'i phyi rol du 'phros te/ steng 'og phyogs mtshams khyams dang dur khrod kun tu khyab pas/ phyi'i 'khor dmangs lta bur gyur pa ni/

From the hearts of the principal ones and their retinues, light rays in the forms of innumerable bodies, emblems, seed syllables, and bindus radiate outside the palace. Pervading above, below, the main and intermediate directions, the courtyard, and the charnel grounds, they become the external retinue, which is like the populace. {307}

steng du me (307) tog dang bdud rtsi'i char rgyun 'bebs pa dang / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan la sogs te mchod rdzas du ma thogs nas mchod pa la brtson pa'i lha'i bu dang bu mos gang ba/ 'og mchod snam steng du mchod rdzas du ma thogs pa'i lha mo bcu drug mchod pa'i las la brtson pa/ khyams su rgyud sde bzhi'i lha tshogs dang mchod rdzas kyis gang ba/

Above, amidst a falling rain of flowers and amṛta, is filled with children of the gods, devoted to making offerings, holding many offering substances, such as parasols and victory banners. Below, on the offering plinth, are the sixteen offering goddesses holding various offering substances, all devoted to the activity of offering. The courtyard is filled with assemblies of deities of the four classes of tantras and offering substances.
dur khrod brgyad kyi shing rnams kyi rtsa bar phyogs skyong / rtse mor zhing skyong / chu la klu chen brgyad/ ri la rnal 'byor pa chen po brgyad bzhugs pa'o/ /

In the eight charnel grounds, at the bases of the trees, are the protectors of the directions and, at the tops, are the field protectors. In the rivers are the eight great nāgas, and on the mountains are the eight great yogins.

gtsang rigs kyi dpal mgon rnams kyang rang rang gi rgyan cha lugs bzhon par bcas pa'i 'khor gyis bskor ba/ gzhan yang dpa' bo mkha' 'gro/ 'dre dang srin po/ sha za dang smyo byed/ rjed byed dang ro langs rnams 'khrugs shing 'dzin ba dang / rgyug cing mchong ba dang / keng rus gar byed pa la sogs pa dang / seng ge stag gzig la sogs gcan gzan gyi tshogs dang / kaM ka dang khyung la sogs te bya'i tshogs rnams rnam par bam pa la sogs te ro'i tshogs rnams rngam par za bas gang ba ste/

The glorious protectors belonging to pure families are surrounded by retinues with their respective ornaments, attributes, and mounts. Furthermore, there are heroes and ḍākinīs, spirits and rākṣasas, piśācas and those causing madness, and those causing forgetfulness and zombies, all fighting and warring, running and jumping. There are skeletons, those causing dance, and others. There are bands of predatory animals, such as lions, tigers, and leopards, and flocks of birds, such as kaṃkas and garudas, all zealously eating masses of corpses, decomposing ones and the like.
mdor na rigs drug gi sems can rnams las dge sdig zhi rgyas dbang drag sna tshogs la spyod pas gang bde thams cad gtso bo dpal he ru ka'i sprul pa'o/ /

In brief, it is filled with sentient beings of the six kinds engaged in various activities: virtuous, unvirtuous, peaceful, enriching, magnetizing, and wrathful. They are all emanations of the principal one, the glorious Heruka.
gnyis pa go cha bgo zhing sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i yan lag ni/
b. The Branch of Placing the Armor and Consecrating Body, Speech, and Mind

bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa'i dpa' bo rnams kyi thugs kar oM ha las rdo rje sems dpal dkar po g.yas rdo rje 'dzin pa/ dpral bar na ma hi las rnam par snang mdzad dkar po g.yas 'khor lo 'dzin pa/ spyi gtsug tu swA hA hu las pad+ma gar dbang dmar po g.yas pad+ma 'dzin pa/ phrag par bau Sha Ta he las mi bskyod pa sngon po g.yas rdo rje 'dzin pa/

At the hearts of all the heroes, the Bhagavān and the others, from oṃ has, are white Vajrasattvas holding vajras in their right hands. In their foreheads, from nama his, are white Vairocanas holding cakras in their right hands. At the crowns of their heads, from svāhā hus, are red Padmanarteśvaras holding lotuses in their right hands. In their shoulders, from vauṣat hes, are blue Akṣobhyas holding vajras in their right hands.

mig tu hU~M hU~M hoHlas rdo rje nyi ma ser po g.yas rin po che 'dzin pa/ lhu tshigs thams cad la phaT phaT las rta mchog ljang gu g.yas sna tshogs rdo rje 'phyar stabs su (308)'dzin cing g.yon thams cad de dag gis yu ba byas pa'i dril bu sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa thugs kar 'dzin pa'i gru mo na kha T+wAM ga 'chang ba/ gcer bu dpa' bo'i rgyan cha lugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyang zhing g.yon cung zad bskum pa'i rol stabs kyis pad nyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/ /

In their eyes, from hūṃ hūṃ hoḥs, are yellow Vajrasūryas holding jewels in their right hands. In the segments of their limbs, from phaṭ phaṭs, are green Paramāśvas holding viśvavajras in their right hands in an aloft position. {308} With their left hands, they hold to their hearts ghaṇṭās with handles, using the threatening gesture, and khaṭvāṃgas in the crooks of their elbows. They are naked and complete with all the ornaments and attributes of heroes. They stand on seats of lotuses, suns, and corpses in the playful position with their right legs extended and their left slightly bent.

rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi lte bar oM ba~M phag mo dmar mo/ snying gar ha~M yoM gshin rje ma sngon mo/ mgrin par hriM moM rmongs byed ma dkar mo/ dpral bar hrIM hriM skyod byed ma ser mo/ spyi gtsug tu hU~M hU~M skrag byed ma ljang gu/ yan lag thams cad la phaT phaT las gtum mo dung ka /

At the navels of all the yoginīs, Vajravārāhī and the others, from oṃ vaṃs, are red Vārāhīs. At their hearts, from haṃ yoṃs, are blue Yāminīs. At their throats, from hrīṃ moṃs, are white Mohanīs. At their foreheads, from hreṃ hriṃs, are yellow Saṃcālanīs. At the crowns of their heads, from hūṃ hūṃs, are green Saṃtrāsanīs. In all their limbs, from phaṭ phaṭs, are smoky Caṇḍikās.

de thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma g.yas gri gug dang g.yon thod khrag 'dzin pa'i gru mo na kha T+wAM ga 'chang ba gcer bu dpa' mo'i rgyan cha lugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa/ zhabs g.yas bskum zhing g.yon brkyang pa'i gar stabs kyis pad nyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa ste/ dpa' bo dpa' mo thams cad me long nang gi gzugs brnyan ltar snang la rang bzhin med par bsam mo/ /

They all have one face and two hands. In their right, they hold hooked knives; and in their left, skull cups with blood. Khaṭvāṃgas rest in the crooks of their left elbows. They are naked and complete with the ornaments and attributes of heroines. They stand on seats of lotuses, suns, and corpses in the dancing position with their right legs bent and their left extended. All the heroes and heroines appear but lack any nature, like images reflected in a mirror. Thus, contemplate.
de nas sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa ni/
The consecration of body, speech, and mind.
lha thams cad kyi spyi bor oM dkar po/ mgrin par AHdmar po/ thugs kar hU~M sngon pos mtshan par bsam/
All deities are marked at their heads with white oṃs, at their throats with red āḥs, and their hearts with blue hūṃs. Thus, contemplate.
gsum pa snod bcud sbyangs shing ye shes pa gzhug pa'i yan lag
c. The Branch of Purifying the Environment and Its Inhabitants and the Entering of the Wisdom Ones
['di] la gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po snod bcud sbyang ba ni/
i. Purifying the Environment and Its Inhabitants

lha rnams kyi sgo gsum gyi oM AHhU~M dang gzhal yas khang las 'od zer dpag tu med pa 'phros/ phyi snod kyi 'jig rten la phog gzhal yas khang du gyur/ nang bcud kyi sems can thams cad la phog pho thams cad 'khor lo sdom pa dang / mo thams cad rdo rje phag mor gyur/ par bsam mo/ /

Immeasurable light rays radiate from the oṃ āḥ hūṃs at the three doors of all the deities and from the palace. Striking the world, the external environment, it becomes a palace. Striking sentient beings, the internal inhabitants, all males become Cakrasaṃvara and all females become Vajravārāhī. Thus, contemplate.
gnyis pa ye shes pa gzhug pa
ii. The Entering of the Wisdom Ones
['di] la gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po spyan drang ba ni/
A) The Invocation

lha rnams kyi thugs ka'i hU~M las 'phros pa'i 'od dang / 'bar ba'i phyag rgya dpral bar bskor zhing ngag tu/ pheM pheM zhes pa'i sgras mngon par dga' ba'i zhing la sogs (309)te rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i zhing khams rgya mtsho nas 'khor lo sdom pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor rten dang brten par bcas pa la/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dpag tu med pas bskor ba/
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra sam+ba raM wI ra yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaH sa spyan drang /
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasamvaraṃ vīra yoginī saparivāra vajra samājaḥ
gnyis pa mchod pa ni/
B) Offerings
oM b+ha ga wA na shrI he ru ka tsakra sam+ba raM wI ra yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM nas/ shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasamvaraṃ vīra yoginī saparivāra arghaṃ…śabda Thus, offer.
gsum pa ye shes pa gzhug pa dngos ni/
C) The Actual Entering of the Wisdom Ones
oM b+ha ga wA na shrI nas/ sa pa ri wA ra dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH zhes phyag rgya dang bcas pas/
oṃ bhagavān śrī…saparivāra jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ With the mudrā, say:
ye shes pa dam tshig pa la thim pas dbyer med du gyur par bsam mo/ /
The wisdom ones dissolve into the samaya ones, thereby becoming inseparable. Thus, contemplate.
gsum pa sems dpa' sum brtsegs su bsgom pa ni/
iii. Meditating on the Three Sattvas Layered
skabs 'dir/
At this point:

rang gtso bo dam tshig sems dpa'i thugs kar rtsa dbu ma sngon po 'dab ma brgyad dang / khams dmar po nyi ma/ dkar po zla ba'i gdan gyi steng du rang 'dra'i ye shes sems dpa'/ de'i thugs kar pad nyi'i steng du gong gi rlung sems dbyer med kyi ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' hU~M sngon po 'od kyis nam mkha' gang nus pa zhig grub par gyur/

In the heart of myself—the principal one, as the samayasattva—in my blue madhyamā channel with eight petals, on seats of a sun, the red dhātu, and a moon, the white dhātu, is the wisdom sattva like myself. In his heart, on a lotus and sun, is the samādhisattva, the inseparability of the wind and mind of the previous [sattva], as a blue hūṃ with the ability to fill space with its light.
de dang 'brel bar lus kyi dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ni/
The body maṇḍala meditation in connection with that.

dam tshig sems dpa' 'khor lo drug dang rtsa chen rtsa phran ba spu'i bu ga rnams su/ bla ma yi dam dpa' bo mkha' 'gro/ rigs lnga yab yum/ sems dpa' sems ma/ yul nyi shu rtsa bzhi/ gnas sum cu rtsa gnyis/ dur khrod chen po brgyad kyi dpa' bo mkha' 'gro chos skyong bsam gyis mi khyab pa ri rab kyi rdul phra rab kyi grangs dang mnyam pa til gyi gong bu kha bye ba ltar lus kyi dkyil 'khor gsal zhing rdzogs la grub pa nyid du gyur par bsam mo/ /

In the samayasattva, in the six cakras, the major channels, the minor channels, and the pores are the gurus, yidams, heroes, ḍākinīs, male and female consorts of the five families, the male and female bodhisattvas, the heroes and ḍākinīs of the twenty-four sacred regions, of the thirty-two sacred places, and of the eight great charnel grounds, and all the dharma protectors—all in unimaginable numbers, equaling the number of atoms in Mount Meru. Like an opened sesame seed pod, the body maṇḍala is clearly present and fully formed. Thus, contemplate.
de nas bzhi pa dbang bskur zhing rigs bdag gi rgyas gdab pa'i yan lag
d. The Branch of Bestowing the Abhiṣekas and Sealing with the Family Lords
['di] la gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po/ dbang lha spyan drangs shing gdan 'bul ba ni/
i. The Invocation of the Abhiṣeka Deities and the Offering of Seats
pheM pheM
pheṃ pheṃ
slar yang dbang lha rnams kyi thugs ka'i sa bon las 'od zer 'phros pas/ rang bzhin gyi gnas nas bla (310) ma dang mi bskyod pa dbyer med pa'i dbang gi lha rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pa

Again, light rays radiate from the seed syllables in the hearts of the abhiṣeka deities, invoking, from their natural abodes, the five families of abhiṣeka deities, who are the inseparability of the guru and Akṣobhya, with their retinues.
oM pany+tsa ku la sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaH sa spyan drang /
oṃ pañcakula saparivāra vajra samājaḥ Thus, invite. {310}
pad+ma ka ma lA ya s+t+waM/ gyis pad+ma'i gdan 'bul/
padma kamalāyastvaṃ Thus, offer lotus seats.
gnyis pa mchod bstod gsol ba gdab pa ni/
ii. Offerings, Praises, and Supplications
oM pany+tsa ku la sa pa ri wA ra badzra ma hA Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/ oM badzra puSh+pe A:hU~M/
oṃ pañcakula saparivāra vajra mahā arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā oṃ vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du/ d+hU pe/ A lo ke / gan+d+he/ nai waM d+ye/ shab+da AHhU~M gis mchod/
Similarly, offer: …āloke…gandhe…naividye…śabda āḥ hūṃ

chos sku nam mkha' bzhin du dbyer med kyang / / gzugs sku 'ja' tshon bzhin du so sor gsal/ / thabs dang shes rab mchog la mnga' brnyes pa'i/ / rigs lnga bde bar gshegs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ ces bstod cing /

Although inseparable from the space-like dharmakāya, your rainbowlike form kāyas appear individually. Homage and praises to the sugatas of the five families, those who have mastered the sublime methods and prajñā. Thus, praise.
bcom ldan 'das rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pas bdag cag rnams la dbang bskur du gsol/ zhes gsol ba btab pas/
Bhagavān with your retinue of the five families, please bestow the abhiṣekas upon us. Thus we supplicate.
gsum pa dbang bskur zhing rigs bdag gis dbu brgyan pa dngos ni/
iii. The Actual Bestowing of the Abhiṣekas and Crowning with the Family Lords
rigs lnga'i 'khor rnams kyis rol mo'i sgra sna tshogs sgrog cing mchod pa sna tshogs 'bul ba dang bcas te lha tshogs rnams kyis/
The retinues of the five families play a variety of music and present myriad offerings. The assembled deities say:
he ru ka dpal 'khor bcas kyi/ / sku gsung thugs las byung ba yi/ / sgrib gnyis bag chags sbyong byed pa'i/ / rdo rje'i dbang bskur chen po sbyin/ /
You are given the great vajra abhiṣeka that arises from the body, speech, and mind of the glorious Heruka and retinue, purifying the latent tendencies of the two obscurations.
oM sarba ta tha ga ta a b+hi Shiny+tsa sa ma ya shri ye hU~M/
oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣiñca samaya śrīye hūṃ

zhes gsungs shing bum pa'i chus spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas lha thams cad kyi sgo gsum gyi dri ma thams cad dag / lus thams cad bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis gang ste yar lud cing spyi bor 'khyil ba rigs bdag tu gyur pa ni/ gtso bo yab yum la rdo rje 'chang yab yum/ nang gi lha mo bzhi la rin chen 'byung ldan/ thugs kyi lha rnams la mi bskyod pa/ gsung gi lha rnams la 'od dpag med/ sku'i lha rnams la rnam par snang mdzad/ sgo mtshams ma brgyad la don yod grub pa/ phyi'i lha rnams la rang rang rigs bdag gis dbu brgyan pa las/ dbang lha rnams rang rang rigs bdag gis dbu brgyan pa la thim par bsam mo/ /
gsum pa mchod (311) pa
C. Offerings
la bzhi'i
This has four parts.
dang po phyi'i mchod pa ni/
1. The Outer Offerings

b+h+rUM aM dzri khaM hU~M rnams 'od du zhu ba/ lha rdzas las grub pa'i gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya rnams ngo bo bzang zhing rgya che ba bkod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa thogs pa'i lha mo dpag tu med pas bdag la mchod par bsams la/

Bhrūṃ aṃ jrīṃ khaṃ hūṃ melt into light. Innumerable goddesses holding unimaginable amounts of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects, all made from divine substances, excellent in essence and vast, present them to me. Thus, contemplate and say:
oM AHrU pa badzre hU~M/ de bzhin du/
oṃ āḥ rūpa vajra hūṃ Similarly:

shab+da/ gan+d+he/ ra sa/ spar+she/ badzre hU~M/ oM b+ha ga wA na shrI he ru ka tsakra saM b+ha ra bI ra yo gi ni sa pa ri wA ra pany+tsa kA ma gu Na pU dza hoH zhes sngags rgya rol mo bcas pas mchod/
śabda…gandhe…rasa…sparśe…vajra hūṃ oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasaṃvara vīra yogini saparivāra pañcakāmaguṇa pūja hoḥ Thus, offer with mantras, mudrās, and music.
gnyis pa nang gi mchod pa ni/
2. The Inner Offerings

bde chen 'khor lo'i mtshams bzhi'i bum thod bdud rtsis gang ba rnams las/ thod pa bdud rtsis gang ba dpag tu med pa 'phros pas/ lha re re'i phyag tu thod pa bdud rtsis gang ba re re byung ba rnams gsol bas lha thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs zag pa med pa'i bdud rtsis tshim par bsam/

From the skull cups filled with amṛta on the vases in the four intermediate directions of the mahāsukhacakra, innumerable skull cups filled with amṛta stream forth. A skull cup filled with amṛta goes into the hand of each deity. Drinking from them, the bodies, speech, and minds of all the deities are satisfied by the undefiled amṛta. Thus, contemplate and say:
oM AHhU~M ha hoHhrIH lan gsum dang /
oṃ āḥ hūṃ ha hoḥ hrīḥ Three times.
oM b+ha ga wA na shrI= sa pa ri wA ra a mr-i ta pU dza hoH zhes mtheb srin kyis bdud rtsi 'thor zhing 'bul lo/ /
oṃ bhagavān śrī…saparivāra amṛta pūja hoḥ Sprinkling amṛta with your thumb and ring finger, offer it.
gsum pa gsang ba'i mchod pa ni/
3. The Secret Offerings

gtso bo yab yum sku gsung thugs kyi lha rnams dang / khyams dang dur khrod kyi 'khril sbyor can rnams snyoms par zhugs pas/ nang gi mkha' 'gro ma bzhi dang / sgo mtshams ma brgyad la sogs te 'khril sbyor med pa rnams kyang ra ro ba'i zag med kyi bde ba myong bar gyur par bsams la/

The principal male and female consorts, the deities of body, speech, and mind, all those paired in the courtyard and the charnel grounds enter into union. Through that, those not paired—the four internal ḍākinīs, the eight female gatekeepers, and others—experience the intoxicating undefiled bliss. Thus, contemplate and say:
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka sa pa ri wA ra ma hA su kha gu h+ya pU dza hoH zhes 'khyud rgya bya/
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka…saparivāra mahāsukha guhya pūjā hoḥ Make the embrace mudrā.
bzhi ba de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa ni/
4. The Suchness Offering
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI= pa ri wA ra shU n+ya twa dz+nya na pU dza hoH zhes gnas lugs kyi ngang du mnyam par bzhag go /
oṃ bhagavān śrī…parivāra śūnyatā jñāna pūja hoḥ Rest evenly in the abiding state.
bzhi pa bstod pa ni/
D. Praises
hU~M/ pad nyi 'jigs byed dus mtshan gdan steng na/ / srid zhi mnyam sbyor 'khor lo sdom pa ni/ / mthing nag zhal bzhi bcu gnyis phyag dang ldan/ / gar dgu'i nyams ldan phyag rgya drug gis mdzes/ /

hūṃ On seats of a lotus, sun, Bhairava, and Kālarātri, Cakrasaṃvara, who unites existence and peace, deep blue, with four faces and twelve hands, you have the nine moods of dance and are beautified with the six mudrās. {312}
shes rab 'khril (312) sbyor rdo rje phag mos 'khyud/ / drug cu la sogs dpa' bo mkha' 'gros bskor/ / sgyu ma'i gar gyis sa gsum 'gro ba 'dul/ / 'khor lo sdom pa'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /

Paired with prajñā in your embrace with Vajravārāhī, surrounded by the heroes and ḍākinīs, the sixty and more, you subdue the beings of the three planes with your illusory dance. To the feet of Cakrasaṃvara, I pay homage and offer praise.
lnga pa bzlas pa bya ba ni/
E. The Recitations

thog mar dbyangs gsal/ rten snying / yig brgya sogs kyis phreng ba byin brlab/ rang gi snying gar d+hU ti pad+ma 'dab brgyad sngon po'i steng du khams dkar po zla ba/ dmar po nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du hU~M yig sngon po 'od kyis nam mkha' 'gengs nas pa/ de'i mthar thig le dkar dmar 'dres pa las grub pa'i yig 'bru/

First, consecrate a mālā with the vowels and consonants, the essence of dependent origination, the hundred syllables, and the like. In my heart, in the avadhūti, on a blue eight-petaled lotus, is the white dhātu, a moon, and the red dhātu, a sun maṇḍala. Above those is a blue letter hūṃ whose light fills space. Around that, the white and red bindus mix and form the seed syllables.
oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/ yab kyi nye snying yi ge bdun pa dang /
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ That is the seven-syllable quintessence mantra of the male consort.
oM shrI badzra he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dz+wa la sam+ba raM swA hA/ zhes snying po yi ge nyer gnyis pa'o/ /
oṃ śrīvajra he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā That is his twenty-two-syllable essence mantra.
de bzhin du yum la ba~M gyi mthar/ oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ ces snying po dang /
Similarly, for the female consort, around vaṃ are: oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā That is her essence mantra.
oM badzra be ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
nye snying gis bskor bar bsam mo/ /
That is her quintessence mantra.

de bzhin du dpa' bo dpa' mo rnams la'ang / thugs kar pad nyi'i steng du dpa' bo rnams la hU~M dang / rnal 'byor ma rnams la ba~M gyi mthar sngags gang bzlas pa des bskor ba las 'od zer kha dog rnam pa lnga 'phros pas/ dkar pos bdag gzhan gyi phyi yi nad gdon dgra bgegs sogs mi mthun phyogs rnams dang / nang gi nyon mongs pa zhi bar byas/ de bzhin du ser pos tshe dang bsod nams dge legs nyams rtogs rnams rgyas par byas/ dmar pos skye 'gro rnams dang rtsa rlung thig le rnams dbang du bsdus/ nag pos dgra bgegs gdug pa can rnams dang bdud bzhi brlag par byas/ ljang gus phrin las kun gyi grogs su gyur par bsams la mdor bsdus re bzla/ rgyas par 'khor rnams rang rang gi sngags bzla ba ni/

Similarly, for the heroes and heroines, on lotuses and suns in their hearts, are hūṃs for the heroes and vaṃs for the yoginīs. The mantras recited encircle those, radiating five-colored light. Think that the white light pacifies unfavorable external conditions—illnesses, spirits, enemies, obstructors, and the like—and internal mental afflictions for yourself and others. Similarly, the yellow light enriches longevity, merit, virtue, excellence, experiences, and realizations. The red light controls beings and the channels, winds, and bindus. The black light pulverizes enemies, obstructors, malevolent ones, and the four māras. The green light assists all activities. To abbreviate, do those with each recitation. To be extensive, recite the mantras of each of the retinue as follows:
oM DA ki nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM lA ma ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT/ oM rU pi nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ ḍākinīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ lāmaye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ rūpinīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
nang gi mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'i sngags so/ /
Those are the mantras of the four internal ḍākinīs.

oM ka ra ka ra khaN+Da ka pA la phra tsaN+De huM hU~M phaT/ oM ku ru ku ru ma hA kaM ka la/ tsaN+Da tsak+Shu ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM b+han+d+ha b+han+d+ha kaM kA la/ pra b+hA wa tI (313) ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM trA sa ya trA sa ya bi ka Ta daMSh+TI Ni/ ma hA nA se ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM k+Sho b+ha ya k+Sho b+ha ya su ra bI ra ni/ wI ra ma tA ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM hrauM hrauM a mi ta b+ha wa/ kharba rI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM hraHhraHbadzra pra b+ha/ laM ke shwa rI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM phaiM phaiM badzra kA ya/ dru mats+tsha ye huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ kara kara khaṇḍakapāla pracaṇḍe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ kuru kuru mahākaṃkala / caṇḍa cakṣuye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ bhandha bhandha kaṃkāla / {313} prabhāvatīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ trāsaya trāsaya vikaṭadaṃṣṭrīṇī / mahānāseye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ kṣobhaya kṣobhaya suravīrani / vīramatāye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hrauṃ hrauṃ amitabhava / karvarīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hraḥ hraḥ vajraprabha / laṃkeśvarīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ phaiṃ phaiṃ vajrakāya / drumacchaye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
thod pa'i dum bu dang rab tu gtum mo sogs rim pa bzhin thugs kyi 'khor lo'i dpa' bo dpa' mo rnams kyi sngags so/ /
Those are the mantras of the heroes and heroines of the mind cakra, in order [starting with] Khaṇḍakapāla and Pracaṇḍā.

oM phaT phaT aM ku re/ e rA wa tI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM da ha da ha badzra dzA Ta/ ma hA b+hai ra bI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM pa tsa pa tsa ma hA wI ra/ wa yu be ge huM hU~M phaT/ oM b+hak+Sha b+hak+Sha ba sa ru d+hi ra An+ta mA lA ba laM bi ne badzra hU~M ka ra/ su ra b+hak+Shi ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM gr-ih+Na gr-ih+Na sap+ta pA ta la ga tA b+hu dzaM gaM sa ra waM bA ta rdza ya su b+ha dra/ sh+yA ma de wI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM A kaD+D+h+ya aD+D+h+ya badzra b+ha dra/ su b+ha dre huM hU~M phaT/ oM hriM hriM ma hA b+hai ra wa/ ha ya kar+Ne huM hU~M phaT/ oM dz+nyauM dz+nyauM bi rU pAk+She/ kha gA na ne huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ phaṭ phaṭ aṃ kure / erāvatīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ daha daha vajra jāṭa / mahābhairavīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ paca paca mahāvīra / vayuvega huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ bhakṣa bhakṣa vasarudhira antamālāvalaṃvine vajrahūṃkāra / surabhakṣiye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa saptapātalagatābhujaṃgaṃ sarvaṃ vā tarjaya subhadra / śyāmadevīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ākaḍḍhya ākaḍḍhya vajrabhadra / subhadre huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hriṃ hriṃ mahābhairava / hayakarṇe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ jñauṃ jñauṃ virūpākṣe / khagānane huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
myu gu can dang sa srung ma sogs rim pa bzhin gsung gi 'khor lo'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams kyi sngags so/ /
Those are the mantras of the heroes and heroines of the speech cakra, in order [starting with] Aṅkuraka and Airāvatī.

oM k+Sh+mAM k+Sh+mAM ma hA ba la/ tsakra be ge huM hU~M phaT/ oM hAM hAM rat+na badzra/ khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT/ oM hIM hIM ha ya grI wa/ shauN+Di nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM hU~M hU~M A kA sha gar+b+ha/ tsakra warmi nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM ki li ki li shrI he ru ka / su wI rI huM hU~M phaT/ oM si li si li pad+ma na rte shwar/ ma hA ba le huM hU~M phaT/ oM hi li hi li bai ro tsa na/ tsakra wartI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM d+hi li d+hi li badzra sa twa/ ma hA bIr+Ya ye huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ kṣmāṃ kṣmāṃ mahābala / cakravege huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hāṃ hāṃ ratnavajra / khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hīṃ hīṃ hayagrīva / śauṇḍinīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hūṃ hūṃ ākāśagarbha / cakravarminīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ kili kili śrīheruka / suvīrīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ sili sili padmanarteśvara / mahābale huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ hili hili vairocana / cakravartīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ dhili dhili vajrasatva / mahāvīryaye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
stobs po che dang 'khor lo'i shugs can ma sogs rim pa bzhin sku'i 'khor lo'i dpa' bo dpal mo rnams kyi sngags so/ /
Those are the mantras of the heroes and heroines of the body cakra, in order [starting with] Mahābala and Cakravegā.

oM kA kA s+ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM u lU kA s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM shwa nA kA s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM su ka rA s+yai huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma da D+hIye huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma dU tI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma daM Sh+TI Ni ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM ya ma ma tha nI ye huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ kākāsye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ulūkāsyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ śvanākāsyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ sukarāsyai huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadaḍhīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadūtīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamadaṃṣṭīṇīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ yamamathanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
khwa gdong ma sogs rim pa bzhin sgo mtshams kyi rnal 'byor ma brgyad kyi sngags so/ / (314)
Those are the mantras of the eight yoginīs who are the female gatekeepers, in order [starting with] Kākāsyā. {314}
oM haH na ma hi/ swA hA hu/ pau Sha Ta he/ hU~M hU~M hoHphaT phaT/ yab dpa' bo rnams kyi go cha'i sngags so/ /
oṃ haḥ nama hi / svāhā hu / vauṣat he / hūṃ hūṃ hoḥ phaṭ phaṭ Those are the armor mantras for the male consort and the heroes.
oM baM/ haM yoM/ hrIM moM/ hre hrIM/ hU~M hU~M/ phaT phaT/ yum dpa' bo rnams kyi go cha'i sngags so/ /
oṃ vaṃ / haṃ yoṃ / hrīṃ moṃ / hreṃ hriṃ / hūṃ hūṃ / phaṭ phaṭ Those are the armor mantras for the female consort and the heroines.
oM suM b+ha ni suM b+ha huM hU~M phaT/ oM gr-ih+Na gr-ih+Na huM hU~M phaT/ oM gr-ih+Na pa ya gr-ih+Na pa ya huM hU~M phaT/ oM A na ya hoHb+ha ga wAn badzra huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ suṃbha nisuṃbha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ānayahoḥ bhagavān vajra huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
hU~M bzhi'i sngags te de ltar gtso 'khor gyi 'gros ltar mang nyung skabs dang sbyar la bzla'o/ /
That is the four-hūṃ mantra. Recite the mantras proportionately according to the usual procedure for the principal ones and retinue, in keeping with the situation.
de ltar sngags bzlas la dus kyi bsnyen pa zla ba drug / 'bring bzhi/ tha ma gnyis so/ /
The mantra recitations [can be done as follows]: The approach in terms of time is six months; or, in an intermediate way, four months; or, in the most basic way, two months.

grangs yi ge bdun pa dang / yi ge nyer gnyis pa la 'bru 'bum/ 'bring yi ge bdun pa la 'bru 'bum dang snying po la 'bum phrag bzhi/ tha ma yi ge bdun pa la 'bum phrag bzhi dang snying po la nyis 'bum/ yum la sum 'bum bzhi khri/ 'khor rnams rab 'bring kun la khri tsho re re/ mtshan ma'i bsnyen pa rang zhal mthong nas chos dbang lung bstan thob cing nyams rtogs skyes pa/ 'bring dam rdzas khol ba/ tha ma rmi ltas bzang po ma byung bar du bya'o/ /

In terms of numbers, do one hundred thousand for each syllable of the seven-syllable mantra and the twenty-two-syllable mantra. The intermediate way is to do one hundred thousand for each syllable of the seven-syllable mantra and four hundred thousand of the essence mantra. The most basic way is to do four hundred thousand of the seven-syllable mantra and two hundred thousand of the essence mantra. For the female consort, do three hundred and forty thousand. For the retinue, do ten thousand for each in all instances, best, intermediate, [and basic]. In terms of the approach of characteristics, the best will see the [yidam’s] face, receive the dharma, abhiṣekas, and prophecies, and develop experiences and realizations. For those of intermediate abilities, the samaya substances will boil. Those of normal abilities should continue until good signs arise in their dreams.
gzhan yid bzlas/ rlung bzlas/ rdo rje'i bzlas pa/ do li'i bzlas pa sogs bla ma'i zhal shes ltar bya'o/ /
Furthermore, the mental recitation, the breath recitation, the vajra recitation, the palanquin recitation, and others should be learned from the guru’s oral instructions.
drug pa dang bdun pa/ thun mthar mchod bstod ni/
F. and G. The Offerings and Praises at the End of the Session
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra sam+ba raM bI ra yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra badzra Ar+g+haM nas/ shab+da pU dza me g+ha sa mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye AHhU~M gis mchod/
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasamvaraṃ vīra yoginī saparivāra vajra arghaṃ…śabda pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye āḥ hūṃ Thus, offer.
hU~M/ pad nyi 'jigs byed sogs gong ltar gyis bstod/
hūṃ On seats of a lotus, sun, Bhairava,…[*2] Praise, as above.
brgyad pa bdag bskyed bsdu ba ni/
H. The Dissolution of the Self Visualization

rang gi thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od 'phros pas snang srid thams cad 'od du zhu ba dur khrod la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang gzhal yas khang rten dang brten par bcas pa la thim/ de yang gtso bo yab yum la thim/ de ye shes sems dpa' la thim/ de ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' la thim/ de gyen rdzogs thig ler yal ba'i ngang du mi dmigs par bsams la/ rtag mtha' bsal zhing / slar yang 'od gsal stong nyid de'i ngang las skad cig gis chu las nya 'bar ba'i tshul du rang nyid 'khor lo sdom pa zhal gcig phyag gnyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i skur langs par bsams pas chad pa'i (315) mthar bsal zhing zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin chu bo'i rgyun lta bu la spyod par bya'o/ /

Light streams forth from the hūṃ in my heart, causing all the appearances of the world to melt into light and dissolve into the deities of the charnel grounds and elsewhere and into the palace, support and supported. Those dissolve into us, the principal male and female consorts. We dissolve into the wisdom sattva. Those dissolve into the samādhisattva. Be without reference point in the state where the bindu has disappeared upward completely. Thus, contemplate and dispel the extreme of permanence. Then: Again, from within luminosity-emptiness, instantly, like a fish leaping from water, I arise in the form of Cakrasaṃvara, with one face and two hands, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā. {315} Thus, contemplate and dispel the extreme of annihilation. Practice the samādhi of unification, which is like a flowing river.
III.
[III. The Concluding Section]

thun mtshams kyi bya ba dmangs phal pa phrin las mthun sbyor gyi bya ba bdun las/ 'dir skabs su babs pa gtor ma 'bul ba ni/ ji ltar 'byor pa'i gtor ma cha gnyis bshams la/ bdud rtsi ltar byin gyis brlab/ rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od 'phros pas rang bzhin gyi gnas nas gtor mgron rnams byon par bsams la/

The activities during the breaks between meditation sessions are the seven conducive activities of the common people. Among those, at this point, [the first] is the torma offering. Arrange two tormas according to your means. Consecrate as done with the amṛta. Light radiates from the seed syllable in my heart, causing the torma guests to come from their natural abodes. Thus, contemplate.
hU~M/ dmigs med mkha' ltar dag cing khyab pa'i sku/ / spyan 'dren gshegs su gsol bar mi dmigs kyang / / thugs rje'i ngang nyid chos skur dag pa las/ / ye shes sgyu mar rol te gshegs su gsol/

hūṃ Your pure and pervasive kāyas are without reference points, like space, and our invitation and request to come are not observed. Yet, within your compassion and through your purity as the dharmakāya, please come as the display of illusory wisdom.
badzra sa mA dzaH sa spyan drang /
vajra samājaḥ Thus, invoke.
pad+ma ka ma lA ya s+t+waM/
padma kamalāyastvaṃ
gtor mgron rnams kyi ljags rdo rje'i sbu gu can gyis bdud rtsi'i bcud drangs te gsol bar bsams la/
The torma guests with their hollow vajra tongues draw up and enjoy the amṛta elixir. Thus, contemplate.
oM gu ru maN+Da la de ba DA ki nI d+harma pA la badzra dzo ka dzo ki ni sa pa ri wA ra i daM ba liM ta kha kha khA hi khA hi/
oṃ guru maṇḍala deva ḍākinī dharmapāla vajra joka jokini saparivāra idaṃ baliṃta kha kha khāhi khāhi
na maHsarba ta thA ga ta b+h+yoHbi shwa mu khe b+h+yaHsarba thA khaM ut+ga te s+pha ra Na i maM ga ga na khaM gr-ih+Ne daM ba l+yA dI swA hA/
namaḥ sarvatathāgatabhyoḥ viśvamukhebhyaḥ sarvathā khaṃ utgate spharaṇa imaṃ gagana khaṃ gṛhṇe daṃ balyādī svāhā
de nas 'dod don gsol ba ni/
The supplication for your desired aims.

bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro chos skyong rdo rje spun la sogs pa'i skyabs gnas mchod 'os dam pa rnams bdag cag che ge rnams la thugs brtse ba chen pos dgongs su gsol/ bdag cag bsam pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis sbyor ba lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas/ so sor thar pa'i sdom pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bslab bya/ gsang sngags kyi dam tshig dang 'gal bas/ dam pa khyed rnams kyi sku gsung thugs dang 'gal bar gyur te/ 'khor ba dang ngan song gi rgyur gyur cing mtho ris dang thar pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad gnong ngo 'gyod do mthol lo bshags so/ /

Gurus, yidams, ḍākinīs, dharma protectors, vajra siblings—all genuine beings who are sources of refuge and worthy of worship—please consider me, (insert your name), with your great kindness. I have, under the influence of mental afflictions as my intention and by means of my body, speech, and mind, transgressed my prātimokṣa vows, bodhisattva trainings, and Secret Mantra samayas. Thus, I have been in opposition with the bodies, speech, and minds of you, genuine beings. I acknowledge and confess with remorse and regret all my negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains, which are causes for saṃsāra and negative states and are hindrances for the higher states and liberation.
rtsa ba nas byang zhing dag par byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ ces dang /
Please grant your blessings that they may be cleansed and purified from their roots. And:

de ltar byin gyis brlabs nas kyang / sa lam gyi 'gal rkyen thams cad phyir zlog tu gsol/ mthun rkyen thams cad lhun gyis grub (316) ste tshe 'di nyid la phyag rgya chen po mchog gi dngos grub thob nas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' dag sbyang zhing dag nus pa dang / sems can thams cad smin grol gyi lam la 'god nus pa'i dngos grub stsal du gsol/

Also, having given those blessings, please avert all adverse conditions for the bhūmis and paths. May the conducive conditions be naturally present. {316} Having attained the supreme siddhi of mahāmudrā in this very life, please grant the siddhis of being able to train in and purify all the buddha fields and being able to establish all sentient beings on the paths to maturation and liberation.
sngags tsam gyis mchod/
Make offerings with just mantras.
chos dbyings rnam dag dbyings las ma g.yos kyang / / thabs kyis khro bo'i skur ston gdug pa 'dul/ / che ba'i che mchog lha yi lhar gyur pa/ / kun bzang he ru ka la phyag 'tshal bstod/

Though you never move from the pure expanse of the dharmadhātu, you tame malevolent ones by skillfully displaying your wrathful form. You are the greatest of the greats, the deity of deities. Homage to Samantabhadra Heruka.
gtor ma gnyis pa/
The second torma.
oM sarba lo ka DA ki nI sa pa ri wA ra kha kha khA hi khA hi/ lan gsum gyis bsngo ba dang /
oṃ sarvalokaḍākinī saparivāra kha kha khāhi khāhi Dedicate it by saying that three times.
lha klu gnod sbyin sogs sngon gtor ltar phrin las bcol/ rten yod na gtor mgron ye shes pa rnams dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH sa bstim/ rten med na/ badzra muH sa rang gnas su gshegs/ 'jig rten pa rnams la/

Gods—the great local deities and others[*3]— Entrust them with activity as you did with the preliminary torma. If there is a representation, the wisdom ones of the torma guests dissolve into it with jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ. If there is no representation, they depart to their own places with vajra muḥ. For the worldly ones say:
'byung po gang dag 'dir ni lhags gyur tam/ zhes sh+lo ka gcig dang / sarba b+hU ta gats+tsha sa gshegs par bya/ bsngo smon dang shis brjod gang rung bya'o/ /

Bhūtas gathered here, [be it on the earth or in the space, may you always demonstrate love for all beings and engage in dharma day and night.] Say that one śloka and have them depart with sarvabhūta gaccha. Do whatever dedications, aspirations, and expressions of auspiciousness you can.
byin rlabs gzi brjid dus kyi mtha' 'dir yang / / nyams med tshe gcig sangs rgyas 'bras ster ba/ / ma rgyud yang snying sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor pas/ / sa steng kun khyab 'khor ba dong sprugs shog /

Now, in this last period of time, may the blessings and brilliance not deteriorate, and may the yogins and yoginīs who practice the mother tantras, the innermost essence, which bestow the result of buddhahood in one life, be present everywhere on the earth and dredge saṃsāra from its depths.

ces pa'ang gdams ngag mdzod bka' brgyud rin po che'i khrid rim rnams kyi smin byed du bzhugs su gsol ba dang / mkhan chen bla ma rin po che karma bkra shis 'od zer rab tu rgyas pa'i sde'i zhal snga nas gsung bskul gnang ba ltar/ ris med kyi bstan pa la gus pa karma ngag dbang yon tan rgya mtsho phrin las kun khyab dpal bzang pos rtsa ba'i yi ge gtsang smyon he ru ka'i nor bu skor gsum dang mthun par shrI de bI ko Ti tsA 'dra rin chen brag gi sgrub gnas su rang lo gya bdun par sbyar ba'i yi ge pa ni nye bar gnas pa blo gsal gsang sngags bstan 'dzin nas bgyis pa dge legs 'phel// //(317)

In the context of including within The Treasury of Instructions the means of maturation for the precious Kagyu instruction manuals, in accordance with the urging given previously by Khenchen Lama Rinpoche Karma Tashi Özer Raptu Gyepede, [I,] Karma Ngakwang Yönten Gyatso Tinle Kunkhyap Palzangpo, one with faith in the nonsectarian teachings, compiled this in accordance with the Three Cycles of Gems[4] of Tsangnyön Heruka as the root text. This was done in my eighty-seventh year at the retreat center of Śrī Devīkoṭi Tsādra Rinchen Drak. The secretary was my attendant Losel Sangak Tenzin. May virtue and excellence increase. {317}
@#/ /dpal 'khor lo bde mchog ras chung lugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bde chen lang tsho zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ /
25. Bloom of Great Bliss. The Maṇḍala Ritual for the Rechung Tradition of the Glorious Cakrasaṃvara[1]
(318)@#/ /na mo gu ru shrI dz+wa la sam+ba re b+h+yaH
namo guru śrījvala samvarebhyaḥ
kun khyab zag med dbyings las mi g.yo bar/ / ye shes rol pa'i gar mdzad bde ba mchog / 'khor lo lnga yi lha la gus btud nas/ / dkyil 'khor cho ga'i lag len nyung gsal bkod/ /

Though not moving from the all-pervasive, undefiled expanse, you display the dance of wisdom’s play, to Saṃvara and deities of the five cakras, I bow with respect. I will arrange the ritual procedures for the maṇḍala briefly and clearly.

de'ang bka' srol 'di'i lugs kyi smin lam yid bzhin nor bu la dbang po rab 'bring tha gsum gyi dbang gis sgrub thabs rgyas 'bring bsdus gsum/ smin byed rgyas 'bring bsdus gsum gnang / re re bzhin sbyang bas smin byed rnam grangs bzhi bcu rtsa grangs 'byung yang rgyas pa'i khongs su bsdus pa shugs kyis 'du ba dang / dbang po tha ma la/ phyi dkyil rgyas pa la dbang bskur rgyas pa sbyar na gzhan rnams zhar byung du grub pas de'i dbang du byas na/ rtsa ba'i sdom la/

In the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Maturing Path of this tradition, from the perspective of the highest, intermediate, and normal abilities, there are extensive, intermediate, and abbreviated sādhanas, and extensive, intermediate, and abbreviated means of maturation are given. By combining each of those, there are more than forty variations.[2] Nevertheless, given that all are implicitly included with the extensive form, if the external extensive maṇḍala for those of normal abilities is combined with the extensive abhiṣeka, everything else will be naturally present. From that point of view, the root Saṃvara says:
slob dpon slob ma dgos dus gnas/ / ji ltar dbang bskur tshul dang drug / ces gsungs pa las/
The ācārya bestows the abhiṣekas in six ways according to the disciple’s needs, timing, and abode.[3]

'dir ji ltar dbang bskur ba'i tshul bshad/ de yang sngon 'gro/ dngos gzhi/ rjes gsum/ re re la'ang nang tshan dbye ba mang du dbye bar gsungs kyang 'dir rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor mi 'grub pa'i dbang du byas nas/ ras bris kyi phyogs la nges par dgos pa'i lag len mdor bsdus te

Here, the way to bestow the abhiṣekas will be explained accordingly. Although it is taught that each of the three parts—the preliminaries, the main practice, and the conclusion—has many internal divisions, here the perspective is that a maṇḍala of colored powders will not be constructed, and thus the procedures required for a cloth-drawn [maṇḍala] are abbreviated.
bkod na/ sngon 'gro/ dngos gzhi/ rjes gsum/
If that is what is done, there are three parts: (1) the preliminaries, (2) the main practice, and (3) the concluding section.
sngon 'gro
I. The Preliminaries
['di] la sa chog skabs 'dir mi dgos/ sta gon rnams la 'jug pa'i thog mar sgrub thabs kyi dbu nas brtsams bdag bskyed (319) bzlas pa bsdu ldang gi bar grub par bya/

The ground ritual is not necessary in this context. {319} To undertake the preludes, first start at the beginning of the sādhana and complete up through the self visualization, the recitations, the dissolution, and the arising.
de nas sta gon gyi
A. The Preludes
rim pa bzhi'i
This has four stages.
dang po lha sta gon ni/
1. The Deity Prelude

mdun tu stegs bu dri bzang gi chus chag chag btab pa'am/ lag len bde ched maN+Dal byi dor byas par slob dpon gyis gtso bo yab yum gyi snying po dang nye snying / so so'i sa bon rnams brjod bzhin pas dbus su chang dang dri bzang sbyar ba'i thig le gru bzhi/ de rgyab phyogs bzhir bzhi/ de rgyab phyogs mtshams brgyad rim pa bzhi la thig la brgyad tshan bzhi bcas g.yon pa'i smin mdzub kyis g.yon skor du bkod/

In front, set up either a stand that has been sprinkled with scented water or, as an easy [to implement] procedure, a polished maṇḍala. While reciting the essence and quintessence mantras of the principal male and female consorts and the individual seed syllables, the ācārya should place, in the center, a square [of] bindus that are a compound of beer and scented water. Outside that, in the four directions, place four [bindus]. Outside of those, in the eight main and intermediate directions, arrange four sets of eight bindus in four stages. All are arranged counterclockwise using the left ring finger.[4]

de rnams kyi steng du las rdor gyis gtso bo la tshom bu che gcig / 'khor rnams la chung ba re bkod la gzhi stegs su bkod/ mdun du nang mchod thod pa'i bdud rtsi/ mtha' skor du mchod yon dang nyer spyod g.yon skor du bsham/

Above those, the vajra assistant should arrange one large offering pile for the principal ones and smaller ones for each of the retinue on the main stand. In front, set out the inner offering, amṛta in a skull cup, and, outside of those, the offering water and the traditional offerings, circling counterclockwise.
sgrub thabs ltar mchod pa rnams byin brlab/ tshom bu rnams khaN+Da ro he sa bsang / swa b+hA wa sa sbyang /
Consecrate the offerings, as done in the sādhana. Cleanse the offering piles with khaṇḍarohe and purify with svabhāva.

stong pa'i ngang las tshom bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gzhir 'byung ba rim brtsegs srung 'khor dang bcas pa'i steng du thar pa chen po'i gzhal med khang rgyan dang bkod pa mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dur khrod chen po brgyad kyis bskor ba'i gzhal yas khang gi lte bar pad nyi 'jigs byed dus mtshan gyi gdan/ 'khor lo lnga'i lha rnams la so so'i gdan dang bcas grub par gyur/ (320)

Within emptiness, on the ground below the maṇḍala of the offering piles, are the layers of the elements and the protection cakra. Above those is a palace of great liberation complete with all the ornaments, arrangements, and characteristics. In the middle of this palace, surrounded by the eight great charnel grounds, are seats of a lotus, sun, Bhairava, and Kālarātri, and the seats for the individual deities of the five cakras. {320}

dbus kyi gdan gyi steng du hU~M mthing nag las rdo rje sngon po hU~M gis mtshan pa de las 'od zer 'phros/ rgyal ba sras bcas mchod/ sems can gyi don byas/ tshur 'dus yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka 'khor lo sdom pa'i skur gyur pa ni sogs sgrub thabs nas 'byung ba ltar la/ ye shes kyi me 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs pa'o/ /

Above the seat in the middle, from a dark-blue hūṃ, appears a blue vajra marked by hūṃ. Light rays stream forth from it, making offerings to the victors and their children and benefiting sentient beings. They gather back, and the vajra transforms into the form of the Bhagavān, the glorious Heruka Cakrasaṃvara… Continue according to the sādhana up to: …reside in the midst of a raging fire of wisdom.[*1]

yab yum bde ba chen por snyoms par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems kyi thig le'i 'od zer phyi rol tu 'phros te 'khor rnams kyi gdan thog tu 'khod pa las bde chen 'khor lo'i phyogs kyi pad 'dab bzhi la sogs nas/ dpa' bo mkha' 'gro thams cad ye shes kyi me rab tu 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs pa'o/ /

The light rays of the bodhicitta bindus of the male and female consorts united in great bliss radiate externally and go to the seats of the retinue. On the four petals of the lotus in the main directions of the mahāsukhacakra, [in the east is blue Ḍākinī]…All the heroes and ḍākinīs stand in the midst of a raging fire of wisdom.[*2]
de rnams kyi spyi bor oM dkar po/ mgrin par AHdmar po/ thugs kar hU~M sngon pos mtshan par gyur/ 'bar ba'i rgya dang /
All are marked at their heads with a white oṃs, at their throats with red āḥs, and their hearts with blue hūṃs. With the blazing mudrā, say:
phaiM phaiM zhes pa nas/ dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH 'i bar dang /
phaiṃ phaiṃ…jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ[*3] And:
slar yang lha rnams kyi thugs ka'i sa bon sogs nas/ rang rang gi rigs bdag gis dbur brgyan par gyur/ bar sgrub thabs bzhin bya/
Again, light radiates from the seed syllables in the hearts of the deities…crowned by their respective family lords.[*4] That is as is done in the sādhana.
de nas 'og gi mdun bskyed skabs ltar phyi mchod mchod yon nyer spyod/ rig ma bcu drug rnams dang / nang mchod/ gsang mchod/ de kho na nyid mchod rnams sgrub thabs ltar byas la/

Then, like the later section in the front visualization, present the outer offerings—the offering water, the traditional offerings, and the sixteen vidyās—the inner offerings, the secret offerings, and the suchness offerings, as is done in the sādhana.
oM/ bcom ldan mgon po sogs rkang brgyad kyis bstod/

oṃ Bhagavān, protector [great hero, blazing like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs. You are majestic with three eyes, hold a battle-ax, noose, khaṭvāṃga, and spear, and are frightening, draped in a tiger skin. To the one with the great smoky body, subduer of obstructors, I bow.] Thus, praise with the eight lines.

thal mo sbyar te spos thogs la/ bla ma dang dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i lha tshogs 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ rnal 'byor pa rdo rje che ge mo zhes bgyi ba bdag gis kyang dam pa khyed rnams kyi rjes su zhugs nas 'gro ba ma smin pa rnams smin par bya ba dang / ma grol ba rnams sol bar bya ba dang / dbugs ma phyung ba rnams dbugs dbyung bar bya ba'i slad du slob ma rnams la dbang bskur ba'i rim pa la 'jug par bgyi na/ thugs brtse ba chen pos nye bar dgongs te bkas gnang ba dang byin gyis brlab tu gsol/ ces gsol ba btab pas dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i gnang ba thob par mos nas 'degs pa'i rgya dang /
oM badzra u d+dISh+Tha/
oṃ vajra uddīṣṭha
zhes dkyil 'khor gyi (321) lha rnams nam mkha'i dbyings su bzhugs par mos pa/
The deities of the maṇḍala reside in the expanse of space. Thus, have that sense.
oM su pra tiSh+Tha badzrA ya swA hA/
oṃ supratiṣṭha vajrāya svāhā
zhes brjod la maN+Dal bsdu'o/ /
Thus, they dissolve into the maṇḍala.
gnyis pa bum pa sta gon la/
2. The Vase Prelude

rnam rgyal dar sngon po dang las bum dar dmar po'i mgul chings/ gnyis kar dri bzang chus sum gnyis bkang / bum rdzas so lnga btab/ gu gul gyis bdug / yungs kar 'thor la sum+b+ha ni'i sngags brjod la bgegs bskrad/ rnam rgyal dkyil 'khor gyi dbus many+dzi'i stegs dang las bum g.yon ngos su kha rgyan dang bcas te bzhag rnam rgyal gyi khar dung chos dri bzang gi chus bkang ba dang gzungs rdor bkod/ gtor ma dang mchod pa rnams sngar ltar bshams la byin brlab/ bum pa gnyis gong ltar bsang sbyang /

Tie a blue ribbon around the neck of a victory vase and a red ribbon around the neck of an activity vase. Fill both two-thirds with scented water and add the thirty-five vase substances. Fumigate with guggula. Throw mustard seeds, say the sumbha ni mantra, and expel obstructors. Place the victory vase on the mañji stand in the center of the maṇḍala, and the activity vase with its top ornament to the left. On the mouth of the victory vase, place a conch filled with scented water and the dhāraṇī vajra. Arrange the torma and offerings, as before, and consecrate them. Cleanse and purify the two vases, as before.

stong pa'i ngang las pa~M pa~M las pad+ma dang / a a las zla ba'i gdan gnyis kyi steng du/ b+h+rU~M b+h+rU~M las rin po che bai DUr+Ya las grub pa'i bum pa gnyis lto ba yangs shing mgrin pa phra ba/ kha g.yel zhing mchu 'phyang ba/ lha rdzas dar gyis mgul pa dkris shing / dpag bsam shing gis kha brgyan pa/ nang chu dang bcud bzang pos yongs su gang ba'i rnam rgyal bum pa'i nang du 'og gzhi 'khor lo dkar po/

Within emptiness, from paṃ paṃ, appear lotuses; from a a, two moon seats, above which, from bhrūṃ bhrūṃ, appear two vases made from precious vaiḍūrya. Both vases have spacious bellies, small necks, wide mouths, and spouts. Their necks are tied with cloths of divine substances and adorned with branches from wish-granting trees. The victory vase is filled with inner water and excellent elixirs. Inside it, on the ground, is a white cakra.
de steng dmar po/ de steng sngon po thams cad kyang rtsibs brgyad pa 'khor lo dang pad+ma dang rdo rje'i phreng bas bskor ba/
Above that is a red one; above that, a blue one. All have eight spokes and are encircled by garlands of cakras, lotuses, and vajras.

de steng pa~M las pad+ma 'dab brgyad a las zla ba ra~M las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du 'jigs byed dus mtshan dang bcas pa/ mtshams bzhir bum thod bdud rtsis gang ba'i khar sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa re/ 'khor lo gsum gyi rtsibs rnams dang sgo mtshams brgyad la pad+ma dang nyi ma'i gdan re re grub par gyur/

Above those, from paṃ, is an eight-petaled lotus. From a is a moon, and from raṃ is a sun maṇḍala. Above those are Bhairava and Kālarātri. In the four intermediate directions are vases, on top of which are skull cups filled with amṛta, marked by viśvavajras. On the spokes of the three cakras and in the eight doors are lotuses and sun seats.
dbus kyi gdan gyi steng du rdo rje mthing nag hU~M sngon pos mtshan pa las 'od zer 'phros sogs gong gi lha sta gon ltar/ gtso bo yab yum dang 'khor rnams kyi bskyed chog tshang bar brjod/

Above the seat in the middle is a dark-blue vajra marked by a dark-blue hūṃ. Light rays stream forth from it,… As is done above in the deity prelude, recite the complete ritual for generating the principal male and female consorts and their retinue.

las thams cad pa'i bum pa'i nang du/ pa~M las pad+ma dang / ra~M las nyi ma/ ba~M las ro'i gdan gyi steng du lha mo khaN+DA ro he ma sku mdog dmar mo zhal gcig phyag bzhi ma/ g.yas dang po gri gug / gnyis (322) pa na DA ma ru/ g.yon dang po thod khrag / gnyis pa na kha T+wAM ga 'dzin pa/ khro la 'dzum pa'i zhal mche ba cung zad gtsigs shing mdzes la yangs pa'i spyan gsum dang ldan pa/ dbu skra sil bu'i stod cha gyen du brdzes pa nor bu dang me tog gi phreng bas mdzes shing lhag ma thur du grol bas rked pa non pa/ thod pa skam po lnga'i dbu rgyan dang / rlon pa khrag 'dzag pa lnga bcu'i do shal can/ gcer bu rus pa'i rgyan drug gis brgyan pa/ gzugs dang lang tsho dar la babs shing b+ha ga dang nu ma rab tu rgyas pa/ bde ba chen pos rnam par myos pa'i cha byad can gyi zhabs gnyis g.yas bskum zhing g.yon brkyang ba'i gar stabs kyis pad nyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/ /

Within the vase for all activities, from paṃ, is a lotus; from raṃ, a sun; and from vaṃ, a corpse seat. Above those is the goddess Khaṇḍarohe, red, with one face and four hands. {322} Her first right one holds a hooked knife; and her second one, a ḍamaru. Her first left one holds a skull cup with blood; and her second one, a khaṭvāṃga. Her face is wrathful yet smiling, and she bares her fangs slightly. She is beautiful with three wide-open eyes. The upper part of her loose hair sweeps upward and is adorned with a gem and flower garland. The remainder is free, reaching to her waist. She has a crown of five dried skulls, a necklace of fifty fresh ones dripping blood, and is naked with the six bone ornaments. Her form, splendor, vitality, bhaga, and breasts are radiant. Her two legs, which have the quality of intoxicating with great bliss, are planted on seats of a lotus, sun, and corpse in a dancing posture with her right bent and left extended.

lha thams cad kyi spyi bor oM dkar po sogs gnas gsum byin brlab/ dam ye bsre ba/ dbang bskur/ rgyas gdab rnams lha sta gon ltar bya ba'i tshig mjug don yod grub pas dbur brgyan/ khaN+Da ro he la rin chen 'byung ldan gyis dbur brgyan/ dbang lha rnams kyang dbu rgyan la thim par gyur/

All deities are marked at their heads with a white oṃs,… Consecrate the three places, mix the samaya and wisdom ones, bestow the abhiṣekas, and place the seal as was done in the deity prelude. After the sentence that ends “crowned by Amoghasiddhi,” say: Khaṇḍarohe is crowned by Ratnasambhava. The abhiṣeka deities dissolve into the crown.
de nas phyi'i mchod pa ni/
The outer offerings.

b+h+rU~M oM dzriM kha~M hU~M rnams 'od du zhu ba/ lha rdzas las grub pa'i gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya rnams ngo bo bzang zhing rgya che ba bkod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa thogs pa'i lha mo dpag tu med pas bum nang gi lha la mchod par bsams la/

Bhrūṃ aṃ jriṃ khaṃ hūṃ melt into light. Innumerable goddesses holding unimaginable amounts of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects, all made from divine substances, vast and excellent in essence, present them to the deities inside the vase. Thus, contemplate.
oM AHrU pa badzra hU~M/
oṃ āḥ rūpa vajra hūṃ
de bzhin du/
Similarly:
shab+da/ gan+d+he/ ra sa/ spar+she badzra hU~M/
śabda…gandhe…rasa…sparśe vajra hūṃ
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra sam+ba raM wI ra yo gi nI khaN+Da ro he sa pa ri wA ra pany+tsa kA ma gu Na pU dza hoH
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasamvaraṃ vīra yoginī khaṇḍarohe saparivāra pañcakāmaguṇa pūjā hoḥ
nang mchod ni/
The inner offerings.

bde chen 'khor lo'i mtshams bzhi'i bum thod bdud rtsis gang ba rnams las thod pa bdud rtsis gang ba dpag tu med pa 'phros pas/ lha re re'i phyag tu thod pa bdud rtsis gang ba re re byung ba rnams gsol bas/ lha thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs zag pa med pa'i bdud rtsis tshim par bsam/

From the skull cups filled with amṛta on the vases in the intermediate directions of the mahāsukhacakra, innumerable skull cups filled with amṛta stream forth. A skull cup filled with amṛta goes into the hand of each deity. Drinking from them, the bodies, speech, and minds of all the deities are satisfied by the undefiled amṛta. Thus, contemplate.
oM AHhU~M ha hoHhrIH
oṃ āḥ hūṃ ha hoḥ hrīḥ
lan gsum/
Three times.
oM b+ha ga= sa pa ri wA ra a mr-i ta pU dza hoH zhes bdud rtsi 'thor zhing 'bul lo/ /
oṃ bhaga…saparivāra amṛta pūjā hoḥ Sprinkling amṛta, offer it. {323}
gsang mchod (323) ni/
The secret offerings.

gtso bo yab yum sku gsung thugs kyi lha rnams snyoms par zhugs pas nang gi mkha' 'gro ma bzhi dang lha mo khaN+Da ro he phyogs mtshams ma brgyad la sogs te 'khril sbyor med pa rnams kyang ra ro ba'i zag med kyi bde ba myong bar bsams la/

The principal male and female consorts, the deities of body, speech, and mind, all those paired in the courtyard and the charnel grounds enter into union. Through that, those not paired—the four internal ḍākinīs, the goddess Khaṇḍarohe, the eight female gatekeepers, and others—experience the intoxicating undefiled bliss. Thus, contemplate.
oM b+ha ga= wA ra ma hA su kha gu h+ya pU dza hoH zhes 'khyud rgya bya/
oṃ bhaga…vāra mahāsukha guhya pūjā hoḥ Make the embrace mudrā.
de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa ni/
The suchness offering.
oM b+ha ga= wA ra shun+ya tA dz+nyA na pU dza hoH zhes gnas lugs kyi ngang la mnyam par bzhag go /
oṃ bhaga…vāra śūnyatā jñāna pūjā hoḥ Rest evenly in the abiding state.
hU~M/ pad nyi 'jigs byed sogs dang /

hūṃ On seats of a lotus, sun, Bhairava, [and Kālarātri, Cakrasaṃvara, the equalizer of existence and peace, deep blue, with four faces and twelve hands, you have the nine moods of dance and are beautified with the six mudrās. Paired with prajñā, embraced by Vajravārāhī, surrounded by the heroes and ḍākinīs, the sixty and more, you subdue the beings of the three planes with your illusory dance. To the feet of Cakrasaṃvara, I pay homage and offer praise.]
las bum gyi lha la/ dpal ldan rin chen mkha' 'gro ma/ / mkha' 'gro ma yis 'khor los sgyur/ / ye shes lnga dang sku gsung thugs/ / 'gro ba skyob la phyag 'tshal bstod/ ces pas bstod/
For the deity in the activity vase: Glorious Ratnaḍākinī, cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage. Thus, praise.
bzlas pa bya ba ni/
The recitation.

gzungs thag la 'jus te/ rang gi thugs ka nas sngags kyi phreng ba gzungs thag la 'khril te bum nang gi lha yi thugs kar thim pas lha tshogs rnams kyi sku las bdud rtsi'i rgyun babs pas bum pa gang bar gyur par bsams la/

Hold the dhāraṇī cord. From my heart, a mantra garland radiates and winds along the dhāraṇī cord. It dissolves into the heart of the deity in the vase. A stream of amṛta flows from the bodies of the deities, filling the vase. Thus, contemplate.
bzlas pa bya ba ni
The recitation.
lha gtso 'khor thams cad kyi thugs srog sngags phreng dang bcas pa man ngag ltar gsal btab la/
Visualize the life forces of mind, [the seed syllables,] with the mantra garlands of the principal and retinue deities, according to the esoteric instructions.
oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
yab kyi nye snying ngo / /
That is the quintessence mantra of the male consort.
oM shrI badzra he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dz+wa la saM pa raM swA hA/
oṃ śrīvajra he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā
yab kyi snying po'o/ /
That is the essence mantra of the male consort.
oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā
yum gyi snying po'o/ /
That is the essence mantra of the female consort.
oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
yum gyi nye snying ngo / /
That is the quintessence mantra of the female consort.

'di rnams brgya rtsa las mi nyung bar ci 'grub bzla/ mkha' 'gro ma bzhi/ 'khor lo gsum/ sgo mtshams ma brgyad bcas kyi sngags rnams kyang nyer gcig gam bdun re tsam bzla/ gzungs thag las bum la spos te/

Recite those as much as you can, not less than a hundred. Recite the mantras of the four ḍākinīs, the three cakras, and the eight female gatekeepers either twenty-one times or seven times each. Move the dhāraṇī cord to the activity vase.
oM khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
mthar mchod pa kha gso/
At the end, replenish the offerings.
gtor ma byin rlabs ni/
Consecration of the torma.
oM stong pa nyid du gyur/
oṃ All is emptiness.

AH rin po che las grub pa'i snod yangs shing rgya che ba rnams kyi nang du/ hU~M 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i gtor ma gzugs dam pa/ sgra dam pa/ dri dam pa/ ro dam pa/ reg bya dam pa/ 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa yul sa dang nam mkha' bar snang (324) thams cad la khyab cing rgyas pa nyid du gyur/

āḥ There is a vessel made from jewels, spacious and vast. Inside that, hūṃ melts into light. From that arises a torma with the five sense pleasures: sacred forms, sacred sounds, sacred smells, sacred tastes, and sacred tangible objects. {324} It pervades and expands to all areas, space, and everywhere in between.
oM AHhU~M ha hoHhrIH
oṃ āḥ hūṃ ha hoḥ hrīḥ
lan gsum gyis brlab/ rdo rje thal mo kha gyen du phye ba'i phyag rgyas/
Saying that three times, consecrate it. With the mudrā of vajra palms open upward, say:
oM b+ha ga wAn shri he ru ka tsakra sam+ba raM wI ra yo gi nI khaN+Da ro hi sa pa ri wA ra i daM ba liM ta kha kha khA hi khA hi/
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasamvaraṃ vīra yoginī khaṇḍarohi saparivāra idaṃ baliṃta kha kha khāhi khāhi
lan gsum gyis phul la/
Saying that three times, offer.

bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i lha tshogs rnams kyis bdag cag rnams la thugs brtse ba chen pos dgongs te mchog thun mong gi dngos grub ma lus pa stsol ba dang bde chen phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub myur ba nyid du stsal bar mdzad du gsol/ /

Assembled deities of the Bhagavān, the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, please consider us with your great kindness. Please bestow the supreme and common siddhis upon us. Please quickly bestow the siddhi of mahāmudrā, great bliss, upon us.

slar yang sgrub thabs ltar mchod rdzas byin brlab/ rab 'byams zhing gi dkyil 'khor thams cad par/ / rgyal ba'i spyan la mdzes pa ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus gzugs kyi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bcom ldan bum pa'i lha la 'bul bar bgyi/ /

Again, consecrate the offering substances as done in the sādhana. In all the maṇḍalas in the infinite pure lands, all that is beautiful for the eyes of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra forms and presented to the bhagavān deities of the vase.
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra sam+ba raM wi ra yo gi nI khaN+Da ro he sa pa ri wA ra badzra rU pa pU dza me g+ha sa mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye AHhU~M/
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka saṃvaraṃ vīra yoginī khaṇḍarohe saparivāra vajra rūpa pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye āḥ hūṃ
rab 'byams zhing gi= rgyal ba'i snyan la 'jebs pa ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus sgra yi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bcom ldan bum=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is sweet for the ears of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra sounds and presented…
shab+da pU dza=
…śabda pūja…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i shangs la zhim pa ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus dri yi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bcom ldan=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is fragrant for the noses of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra smells and presented…
gan+d+he pU dza=
…gandhe pūja…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i ljags la bda' ba ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus ro yi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bcom ldan=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is tasty for the tongues of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra tastes and presented…
ra sa pU dza=
…rasa pūja…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i sku la bde ba ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus reg bya rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bcom ldan=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is blissful for the bodies of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra tangible objects and presented…
spar+she pU dza=
…sparśe pūja…
srab 'jam yang ba lha yi gos/ / mi bskyod rdo rje'i sku bsnyes la/ / mi phyed dad pas bdag 'bul na/ / bdag kyang rdo rje'i sku thob shog /
To achieve the body of Vajra Akṣobhya, I offer with undivided faith divine cloth, solid, soft, and light. May I attain vajra body.
oM b+ha ga wan= badzra spar+she pU dza me g+ha sa mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye AHhU~M/
oṃ bhagavān…vajra sparśe pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye āḥ hūṃ
de las gzhan yang mchod pa'i tshogs/ / rol mo dbyangs snyan yid 'ong ldan/ / (325)sems can sdug bsngal sel mdzad pa'i/ / sprin rnams so sor gnas gyur cig /
Beyond all those, may other masses of offerings, music, melodies, and all pleasing sounds {325} form individual clouds that dispel the suffering of sentient beings.
ces rol mo bya'o/ /
Play music.
bstod pa ni/
Praises.
hU~M/ bcom ldan mgon po sogs

hūṃ Bhagavān, protector, [great hero, blazing like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs. You are majestic with three eyes, hold a battle-ax, noose, khaṭvāṃga, and spear, and are frightening, draped in a tiger skin. To the one with the great smoky body, subduer of obstructors, I bow. oṃ Bhagavatī, great Vajravārāhī of all manifestations, unswayed by opponents, the three worlds, Vajravārāhī, conquering fears of bhūtas, residing at Vajrāsana, and victorious over Brahmā, you dry up and destroy all fears of Māra. With a form the nature of all birth, abiding, and arising, you are empress of the three planes, the perfection of phenomena. To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I bow.]
yab yum gyi rkang brgyad dang /
Praise with the eight lines for the male and female consorts.
dpal ldan rin chen mkha' 'gro ma/ sogs kyis bstod/
Glorious Ratnaḍākinī,… Thus, praise.
de nas bdud rtsir bsgyur ba ni/
The transformation into amṛta.
dung chos kyi mchod yon gtso bo dang las kyi bum par dbul ba dang bcas/
As you present the offering water in the conch to the principal [vase] and the activity vase, say:

rang gi thugs ka'i hU~M yig las 'od zer bum nang du 'phros pas/ bum nang gi lha ye shes pa rnams phye ste rang gi snying gar dzaHhU~M baM hoH dam tshig pa 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i bdud rtsi'i nus pa phun sum tshogs pas bum pa gang bar gyur bar bsam mo/ /

Light rays from the hūṃ in my heart radiate to the interiors of the vases. The wisdom ones separate from the deities inside the vases and [dissolve] into my heart, jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ. The samaya ones melt into light, which becomes an abundant potency of amṛta and fills the vases. Thus, contemplate.
slob ma sta gon ni/
3. The Disciple Prelude

smin lam yid bzhin nor bu las rtsa ba'i sdom tshig bco lngar gsungs kyang / 'dir mdor bsdus tsam du/ thog mar/ slob ma rnams phyi rol du khrus bya/ nang du 'khod/ maN+Dal bkye bsdu byas la/ ma gyur nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad kyi don du bde chen phyag rgya chen po dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi go 'phang thob par bya/ de'i ched du zab lam mkha' 'gro snyan brgyud kyi smin byed kyi dbang bskur zhus nas grol byed rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor nyams su blang bar bgyi'o snyam du byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa dang / chos gsan pa'i kun spyod rnams tshul bzhin ldan pas gsan par zhu/

Although in the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Maturing Path it is taught in the root summarizing verses that [the disciple prelude] has fifteen sections, here these are abbreviated. First, the disciples should wash outside and then arrange themselves inside. Distribute and collect [grains] for a maṇḍala offering. For the sake of all mother sentient beings, who equal the limits of space, you should attain the state of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, mahāmudrā, great bliss. To do that, think that you are requesting the maturing abhiṣekas of the Ḍākinī Aural Transmission, the profound path, and that you will practice the yogas of the two processes, the means of liberation. Arouse supreme bodhicitta and listen in the four proper ways to listen to the dharma.

'dir drang nges kyi chos bshad dang brgyud pa yid bzhin nor bu'i lo rgyus rgyas par bshad par gsungs la/ mi nus pas mdor bsdu na/ de'ang rang re rnams rnyed par dka' ba dal ba brgyad 'byor pa bcu dang ldan pa'i mi lus rin po che lha bas lhag pa'i lus rten khyad par can thob/

Here, explain the provisional and definitive dharma and teach extensively on the stories of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of Lineage. If you are unable to do that, say the following as a summation: Now, we have all achieved that which is most difficult to acquire: a precious human body with its eight leisures and ten opportunities that are difficult to acquire, a special physical support that is superior even to that of the gods.

mjal bar dka' ba'i bla ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mjal/ thos par dka' ba dam pa'i chos spyi dang khyad par theg pa chen po/ de'i yang snying dus gsum du 'byon par dka' ba gsang sngags rdo rje theg pa'i zab chos 'di lta bu ni dbul pos yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnyed pa las kyang ngo mtshar (326) shin tu che ba yin kyang / /

We have met with gurus, authentic spiritual friends, who are difficult to meet. We have encountered that which is difficult to hear: the genuine dharma, in general, and the Mahāyāna, in particular. Beyond that, we have encountered the innermost essence, what is difficult to appear in the three times: the profound dharma of Secret Mantra Vajrayāna. It is more wonderful than a poor person finding a wish-fulfilling gem. {326}

myur du nyams len la ma 'bad na/ spyir 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag /sgos 'gro ba'i tshe srog nam mkha'i glog dang chu'i chu bur las kyang 'jig sla bas de ring tsam du'ang mi 'chi ba'i nges pa med/ shi ba'i 'og tu rnam bar shes pa las dge sdig gi rjes su 'brang zhing mtho ris dang ngan song du skye/ srid pa'i rtse mo nas na raka dmyal khams yan chad sdug bsngal gsum gyi rang bzhin las ma 'das pas/ 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas da lta'i bar du lus grangs med par blangs shing sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa myong / da dung yang mtha' med pa'i 'khor bar 'khyams shing sdug bsngal de tsam myong bar 'gyur bas 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho 'di la zhen log dang nges 'byung gi blo drag tu bskyed pa thog mar gal che/

If we do not apply ourselves to practice quickly, since, in general, all conditioned things are impermanent and, especially, the life force of beings is easily destroyed—like lightning in the sky or bubbles on water—it is not even certain that we will not die today. Once we die, our consciousness will chase our virtuous and evil karma. We will be born in higher states or negative states. And yet, the Pinnacle of Existence down to the narak hell realms are never beyond being of the nature of the three types of suffering. From beginningless saṃsāra up until now, we have taken countless bodies and experienced immeasurable suffering. Even now, we still wander in endless saṃsāra and will continue to experience such sufferings. Therefore, it is important in the beginning to arouse a strong sense of revulsion for this ocean of suffering, saṃsāra, and the determination to be released.

'khor ba las thar bar byed pa la blo bla ma dkon mchog la gtad cing skyabs su 'gro/ theg dman dang mthun par dge ba'i las bcu bsgrubs pas mtho ris kyi bde ba thob cing de'ang byang chub sems kyis zin na sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur/ mi dge ba bcu spyad na ngan song gi sdug bsngal tshad med pa myong bar 'gyur bas dge ba ci nus su bsgrub/ sdig pa mi dge ba srog la bab kyang spang ba ni dam pa'i chos sgrub pa bya ba yin/

With a mind directed toward being liberated from saṃsāra, we entrust ourselves to the gurus and jewels and take refuge. Practicing the ten virtuous actions in accordance with the Hīnayāna brings the happiness of the higher states. If that is embraced by bodhicitta, it becomes a cause for achieving buddhahood. If we engage in the ten unvirtuous actions, we will experience limitless suffering in the negative states. Therefore, practice virtue as much as you can. To avoid evil unvirtuous actions even if it comes down to our lives is the practice of the sacred dharma.

gzhan yang lus kyi sgo nas rten gsum bzhengs pa/ phyag bskor la brtson pa/ ngag gi sgo nas mdo rgyud dang gzungs sngags zab mo klog pa/ kha ton bzlas brjod gsol 'debs la 'bad pa/ yid kyi sgo nas dad pa mos gus phan sems bzang po/ khyad par theg pa chen po'i chos bsgrub pa la byang chub kyi sems bskyed bzang pos zin pa'i lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / spyod pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa gal che ba lags/ de dag ni nges 'byung bskyed nas blo bcos par gsungs pa rnams yin la skabs su bab pa'i lo rgyus cung zad brjod na/
