Furthermore, with your body, construct the three supports and apply yourself to doing prostrations and circumambulations. With your speech, read aloud the profound sūtras, tantras, and dhāraṇī mantras, and exert yourself in your daily prayers, repetitions, recitations, and supplications. With your mind, cultivate faith, devotion, altruism, and a positive attitude. In particular, for the practice of the Mahāyāna dharma, having the pure view that is embraced by an excellent arousing of bodhicitta and pure ethical conduct is critical. Those are said to arouse the determination to be released and change our mental orientation. At this point, the following account will be related. {327}

theg dman nyan (327) thos kyi grub mtha' 'dzin pa brgya phrag las theg chen gyi sde snod 'dzin pa gcig gis khyad par 'phags/ theg chen pa brgya las kyang sngags lam la zhugs pa gcig gis khyad par 'phags/ sngags kyang bya spyod rnal 'byor bla med kyi rgyud sde bzhi po gong nas gong du khyad par 'phags pas/ deng sang bstan pa'i mthar thug pa'i dbang gis tshe 'dir 'bras bu dngos su thob pa dkon kyang / dbang thob cing dam tshig ma nyams la sngags kyi lta spyod la the tshom med pa'i dad mos dang ldan na bskyed rdzogs kyi ting nge 'dzin cher nyams su ma lon kyang dbang po rab mi tshe gsum/ dbang po 'bring skye ba bdun/ dbang po tha ma'ang skye ba bcu drug nas 'bras bu mchog thob pa rgyal ba drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi gsung mi bslu ba'i tshad ma can yin/

A single [person] holding the Mahāyāna piṭaka is superior to a hundred holding the śrāvaka tenets in the Hīnayāna. A single [person] entering the Mantra path is superior to a hundred entering the Mahāyāna. Within Mantra, the four sections of tantra, kriyā, caryā, yoga, and niruttara, are increasingly superior. Nowadays, because this is the last period of the teachings, it is rare that anyone actually attains the result in this life. However, if you receive abhiṣeka, do not impair samaya, and have faith and devotion, free from doubts, in the view and conduct of Mantra, even if you do not practice the samādhis of the generation and perfection processes a great deal, those of the highest abilities will attain the supreme result after three lifetimes, those of intermediate abilities after seven births, and those of normal abilities after sixteen births. That is the authentic infallible teaching of the sixth victor, Vajradhara.
de las da lam skabs su bab pa 'di ni ma rgyud thams cad kyi yang snying dpal 'khor lo sdom pa yin/
Among those, this is the occasion of the innermost essence of all the mother tantras: the glorious Cakrasaṃvara.

rgya gar 'phags pa'i yul du lu dril nag gsum gtso bor gyur pa'i grub thob grangs med pa byon pa thams cad phal cher 'khor lo sdom pa'i sgo nas grub pa thob pa sha stag yin par snang la bka' srol yang mi 'dra ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi tsam byung ba phal cher bod du'ang byon la deng sang yang rgyun bzhugs par 'dug /

In the Noble Land of India, most of the countless siddhas who appeared—including the foremost trio: Lūyipa, Ghaṇṭapa, Kṛṣṇācārya—attained siddhi only through Cakrasaṃvara. Around twenty-four different systems developed, most of which came to Tibet and are extant even today. Among those, this is the especially distinguished Aural Transmission Cycle.

thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa snyan brgyud kyi skor 'di ni 'phags yul grub pa'i dbang phyug tai lo shes rab bzang pos rdo rje 'chang dngos su mjal nas byin gyis brlabs pas rgyud sde thams cad kyi mnga' bdag tu gyur kyang tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi snang ngor bka' babs bzhi'i bla ma rnams brten nas de skabs su bzhugs so cog gi rgyud sde rnams gsan pa'i tshul bstan/ khyad par du gsang ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas nub phyogs o rgyan yul du phebs nas chos sku ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro rdo rje rnal 'byor ma dngos su mjal ba'i skabs/ rnal 'byor mas brda gsum bstan pas/ tai lo (328) pas brda'i don go ste/

Tilopa Prajñābhadra, the lord of siddhas in the Noble Land, actually met Vajradhara, received his blessings, and gained mastery of all classes of tantras. Nevertheless, in the eyes of ordinary people, he relied on gurus for four entrusted transmissions and during that time displayed the approach of listening to all the classes of tantras available at that time. In particular, he went to Oḍḍiyāna in the west, the source of all secrets. When he actually met the dharmakāya Jñānaḍākinī, Vajrayoginī, the Yoginī showed him three symbols. {328} Tilopa understood the meaning of the symbols and said:
sku tsaka li yi dkor mdzod nas/ / brgyud pa yid bzhin nor bu zhu/ / gsung yi ge bdun gyi dkor mdzod nas/ / smin lam yid bzhin nor bu zhu/ /

From the treasure chest of body, the icon, I request the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of Lineage. From the treasure chest of speech, the seven syllables, I request the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Maturing Path.
thugs rdo rje rtse lnga'i pho brang nas/ / grol lam yid bzhin nor bu zhu/ /
From the palace of mind, the five-pointed vajra, I request the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Liberating Path.

zhes gsol ba btab pas/ rnal 'byor mas brda'i don khrol bas/ dbang rab skal ldan gyi gang zag tu dgongs nas/ snyan brgyud nor bu rnam gsum gyi mdzod yongs su rdzogs par gtad nas/ mi rabs bcu gsum du chig brgyud kyi bka' rgyas btab/

Having supplicated, the Yoginī revealed the meaning of the symbols. Recognizing him to be a worthy individual of the highest abilities, she gave him the treasury of the Three Gems of the Aural Transmission in its entirety. She placed the command seal that it be a single transmission for thirteen generations.

de la paN chen nA ro pas mi lo bcu gnyis su bsten te dka' ba chen po bcu gnyis spyad pa'i mthar 'khor lo sdom pa spyi dang / khyad par snyan brgyud 'di nyid gnang bas grub pa'i go 'phang mthon por gshegs/

The great paṇḍita Nāropa attended Tilopa for twelve years. At the end of twelve great hardships, Tilopa bestowed upon him Cakrasaṃvara, in general, and this very Aural Transmission in particular. Nāropa arrived at the level of accomplishment.

de la bod yul gyi lho brag mar pa lo tsA zhes phyi dar gyi lo tsA'i nang nas sus kyang 'gran zla med pa yongs su grags pa bcom ldan 'das dgyes mdzad rdo rje dang / DoM bi he ru ka mi'i srid pa bzung ba de nyid kyis dka' ba chen por spyad nas rgya gar dang bal yul du lan bzhi byon/ 'phags yul mtha' dbus med par phebs nas mkhas grub kyi bla ma brgya dang lnga bcu bsten te gsan bsam mtha' yas pa mdzad tshul rdo rje'i mgur las gsal ba ltar dang / khyad par paN chen nA ro pa nyid lo drug dang zla ba bdun bsten nas gsan bsam sgom pa chab cig tu mdzad pas grub pa'i dbang phyug chen por gyur nas 'phags yul du'ang grub thob kyi snyan pas khyab/

Lhodrak Marpa of Tibet was known as a lotsāwa and was famous among all the lotsāwas of the later spread [of dharma in Tibet] as being unrivaled by anyone. He was the bhagavān Hevajra and Ḍombi Heruka in a human existence. Undertaking great hardships, he went to India and Nepal four times. He traveled all over the Noble Land, with no borders or centers, and attended upon one hundred and fifty gurus who were scholar-siddhas. The way he engaged in infinite study and reflection is clearly described in his vajra songs. In particular, he attended upon the great paṇḍita Nāropa for six years and seven months. Combining listening, reflection, and meditation, he became a great lord of siddhas and was even famous throughout the Noble Land for being a siddha.

lan rjes mar phebs skabs dpal nA ro pa spyod pa la gshegs nas slob ma nyid dang skal mnyam re re tsam ma gtogs thun mong ba sus kyang mjal rgyu med pa la rje mar pas tshogs 'khor phul zhing gsol ba rtse gcig tu btab nas rgya gar gyi yul phyogs kun tu btsal bas byang puSh+pa ha ri'i dgon par mngon sum du mjal nas zla ba drug bzhugs pa'i skabs snyan brgyud nor bu skor gsum (329) gdams pa zhus pas khyod la gdams pa 'di 'dra yod ces sus zer gsungs/ nga la bod na slob ma mi la thos pa dga' zhes bya ba zhig yod pas/ de la mkha' 'gro mas lung bstan byung zer zhus pas/ de ma thag thal mo sbyar te/ /

On the occasion of his last journey, the glorious Nāropa had gone off to engage in [yogic] conduct, and except for his disciples and a few of equal fortune, no one ordinary could meet him. The exalted Marpa offered a gaṇacakra and supplicated one-pointedly, and then searched for him all over India. He met him directly in the Puṣpahari hermitage in the north. {329} During the six months he then stayed with Nāropa, he requested the instructions of the Threefold Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Aural Transmission. [Nāropa] asked him, “Who said you should ask, ‘Do you have this type of instruction’? [Marpa replied,] “I have a disciple in Tibet called Mila Töpaga. He received a prophecy from the ḍākinīs.” Immediately, [Nāropa] joined his hands in añjali and said:
byang phyogs mun pa'i smag rum na/ / gangs la nyi ma shar 'dra ba/ / thos pa dga' zhes bya ba yi/ / skyes bu de la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
In the darkness to the north, there is one like the sun striking the snow who is called Töpaga: to this being, I pay homage.
zhes gsungs nas dbu dud par mdzad pas phyogs de'i rtsi shing rnams kyang lho phyogs su mgo dud pa da lta'i bar du yod par bshad/
As he said this, he bowed his head. It is said that all the grasses and trees in that area can be seen even to this day to be bowing their heads to the south.[6]

rje mar pa'i slob ma gtso bo ka chen bzhi las mes rngog mtshur gsum la bshad brgyud kyi bka' babs/ rje btsun mi la la sgrub brgyud kyi bka' babs te snyan brgyud nor bu rnam gsum gyi gdams ngag rdzogs par chig brgyud du gnang /

Among the foremost disciples of the exalted Marpa, called the four great pillars, three—Mai, Ngok, and Tsur—received the entrusted transmission of the explanatory tradition. Jetsun Milarepa received the entrusted transmission of the practice tradition, and the single transmission of the complete instructions of the Three Gems of the Aural Transmission was given to him.

rje btsun mi las mi'i lto gos thams cad spangs te mnga' ris stod kyi gangs brag rnams su zwa tshod dang ras gos tsam la brten te sku tshe gcig tu sgrub pa'i rgyal mtshan btsugs pas bod yul tsam na yongs su grags pa'i grub thob chen po 'phags yul gyi grub chen rnams dang rnam dbyer med pa byung /

Jetsun Milarepa gave up the food and clothing of humans and survived on nettles and wore cotton clothes while living in the snowy rocks of Ngari Tö. Planting the victory banner of practice in a single lifetime, he became a great siddha famous throughout Tibet and was inseparable from the great practitioners of the Noble Land.

de la slob ma mkha' spyod du gshegs pa brgyad sogs grangs las 'das pa byung yang gtso bor gyur pa/ nyi ma lta bu dwags po zla 'od gzhon nu dang / zla ba lta bu ras chung rdo rje grags pa gnyis yin la/ skabs shig tu rje btsun nyid la yi dam rdo rje phag mos lung bstan te thugs sras brgyad la snyan brgyud kyi dum bu re byin cig ces gsungs pa ltar gnang bar nges kyang ras pa zhi ba 'od dang / khyi ra ba mgon po rdo rje sogs phal cher mkha' spyod du gshegs pas brgyud pa 'dzin pa ni ma byung bar snang / ras chung rdo rje grags pa la gnang ba snyan brgyud 'bring po dang / mnyam med dwags po rin po che la gnang ba snyan brgyud rgyas pa dang / ngan rdzong ston pa byang chub rgyal por gnang ba la snyan brgyud bsdus pa zhes grags (330) shing / de gsum ka'i smin grol yig cha tshang ma'i rgyun bcas da lta'i bar ma nyams par bzhugs pa las/

He had countless disciples, such as the eight who went to the celestial realms. The foremost were the sunlike Dakpo Daö Zhönu and the moonlike Rechung Dorje Drakpa. On one occasion, the Jetsun received a directive from Vajravārāhī. She said, “Give a portion of the Aural Transmission to your eight heart sons.” He did accordingly, but since most, such as Repa Zhiwa Ö and Khyirawa Gönpo Dorje, went to the celestial realms, they did not become lineage holders. It is well known that what Rechung Dorje Drakpa received is called the intermediate Aural Transmission, what the unequaled Dakpo Rinpoche received is the extensive Aural Transmission, and what Ngendzong Tönpa Jangchup Gyalpo received is the abbreviated Aural Transmission. {330} The complete sets of the maturing and liberating texts of those three are present today without interruption.

skabs su bab pa 'di ni ras chung pa'i lugs yin/ de la'ang ras chung slob ma grub thob chen po khyung tshang ras pa nas rim par byon te brgyud pa bco brgyad pa gtsang smyon he ru ka'i bar du byon pa rnams la/ rtsa ba rdo rje'i tshig rkang dang / yig cha sa bon tsam las yig tshogs rgyas par ma bzhugs par mngon la/ gtsang smyon he ru ka phyogs las rnam rgyal gyis nor bu skor gsum gyi gzhung / 'grel bshad/ khrid yig rnams sogs yig cha gsal la rgyas par mdzad cing / de'i slob ma rgod tshang ras pa sogs kyis kyang yig cha mang du mdzad pa'i rgyun deng sang yang bzhugs pa 'di ni ras chung rtsa ba'i bka' brgyud yin la/

On this occasion, [the transmission] belongs to the tradition of Rechungpa. This passed from Rechungpa’s disciple the mahāsiddha Khyung Tsang Repa down to Tsangnyön Heruka, the eighteenth generation. At that time, it seems that other than the root text Vajra Verses and the “seeds” of texts, there were no extensive collections of texts. Tsangnyön Heruka Chokle Namgyal composed clear and extensive texts, such as the those on the Threefold Gems, commentaries, and instruction manuals. His student Götsang Repa and others also wrote many texts, which are extant today. This is called the Root Rechung Kagyu.

yang 'gro mgon gtsang pa rgya ras gyis ras chung rdo rje grags pas sbas pa'i gter kha ro snyoms skor drug sogs lho brag mkhar chu nas spyan drangs pa dang / phyis chos rje 'brug pa la bka' babs pa'i ras chung snyan brgyud 'brug lugs kyang mchis pa las 'di rtsa ba'i bka' brgyud kyi lugs yin/

Also, Drogön Tsangpa Gyare brought forth from Lhodrak Kharchu the Six Cycles of Equalizing Tastes and other treasures hidden by Rechung Dorje Drakpa. Later, the Rechung Aural Transmission that was an entrusted transmission for Chöje Drukpa became part of the Drukpa tradition. It is a Root Kagyu tradition.

'di'i smin byed kyi dbang bskur ba la slob ma dbang po rab 'bring tha gsum/ de re re la'ang nang gses kyis gsum gsum du dbye bas nang gses dgur yod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas dkyil 'khor sgrub tshul dang dbang bskur tshul rnam grangs bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis tsam gsungs kyang mdor bsdu na yab rgyal po lta bu'i dkyil 'khor bzhi/ yum btsun mo lta bu'i dkyil 'khor bzhi/ de rnams dang 'brel ba'i rang byung lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang dgu yod pa las da lam rim gyis pa rjes su bzung thabs yab kyi dkyil 'khor lha drug cu rtsa gnyis la brten pa'i smin byed kyi dbang bskur ba la slob ma lhag par gnas pa sta gon gyi rim pa dang / dngos gzhi'i dbang bskur ba gnyis su 'byung ba las/

In the context of bestowing the maturing abhiṣekas of this tradition, there are three types of disciples: those of highest abilities, those of intermediate, and those of normal abilities. Since each of those can be subdivided into three types, there are nine categories. From that perspective, there are said to be about forty-two variations of the way to practice the maṇḍala and the way to bestow the abhiṣekas. If these are abbreviated, there are four maṇḍalas of the king-like male consort, four maṇḍalas of the queenlike female consort, and the self-arisen body maṇḍala, which is connected with those, making nine. Among those, now the maturing abhiṣeka that is based on the sixty-two deity maṇḍala of the male consort will be conferred as a method for guiding the gradual type. There are two parts: (1) the stages of the prelude, the consecration of the disciples, and (2) the bestowing of the main abhiṣekas. {331}
da lta'i skabs su slob ma sta (331) gon gyi rim pa rnams bsgrub par bya ba lags pas de nyid zhu ba'i slad du zhing khams 'bul bar zhu/ zhes slob ma rnams kyis maN+Dal 'bul/
Among these, now the practices of the stages of the disciple prelude will be done. As a request for that, offer the pure realms. The disciples offer a maṇḍala.
de nas gsol ba gdab pa ni/
Next, the supplication:
rdo rje phag mos mgrin 'khyud pa'i/ / dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa ste/ / slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol/ /
Great joy, you are my teacher, whose neck is embraced by Vajrayoginī. Ācārya, please consider me.
byang chub chen po'i tshul bsten pa/ / mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo/ / dam tshig de nyid bdag la stsol/ / byang chub sems kyang bdag la stsol/ /
I request the great protector to teach the way to great awakening. Bestow on me this samaya. Bestow on me bodhicitta.
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / skyabs gsum dag kyang bdag la stsol/ / thar pa chen po'i grong mchog tu/ / mgon pos bdag ni gzhug tu gsol/ /
Bestow on me the three refuges: the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha. Protector, please enter me into the city of great liberation.
zhes gsum/
Say that three times.
de nas khyad par gyi chos bshad pa ni/ /
Next, the explanation of the special dharma:
'jig rten du ni kun mkhyen dag / u dum wA ra'i me tog bzhin/ / brgya lam na ni res 'ga' zhig / 'byung 'gyur yang ni mi 'byung ngo / /
In the world, omniscient ones, like udumbāra flowers, may appear once in a hundred times or not even then.
gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung ba/ / de bas kyang ni dkon pa ste/ / gang gis sems can mnyam med don/ / bla med byed par nus pa yin/ /
The appearance of Secret Mantra practice is even rarer than that. That has the ability to create what is highest: unequaled benefit for beings.
bskal pa bye ba bsam yas su/ / sngon du sdig pa byas pa gang / / dkyil 'khor bzang po mthong ma thag / de dag zad par 'gyur yin na/ /
Even evil acts previously committed throughout inconceivable millions of eons, will be expunged immediately when the excellent maṇḍala is seen.
grags pa mtha' yas sngags brjod pa'i/ / tshul la gnas na smos ci dgos/ / skyob pa'i gsang sngags bzlas na ni/ / go 'phang bla na med par 'gyur/ /
What need is there to mention abiding in the way of mantra recitation, whose fame is infinite. If you recite the secret mantras of refuge, you will achieve the unsurpassable state.
gang gis spyod pa mchog 'di la/ / blo gros shin tu mi g.yo na/ / sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung ba yi/ / ngan 'gro de yis spong bar 'gyur/ /
If your mind does not waver about this sublime practice, you will be free from the negative states, sources of suffering.

bdag nyid chen po khyed rnams kyis/ / rnyed pa mnyam med de ring nyid/ / gang phyir rgyal ba sras bcas pa'i/ / bdag nyid chen po kun gyis ni/ / bstan pa 'di la khyed rnams kun/ / yongs su bzung ste skye bzhin pa/ /
Today, you, great beings, have made this unequaled discovery. The victors and their children, and all great beings, have accepted you into this teaching—it is like birth.

de phyir khyed rnams theg chen du/ / da lta rab tu skye bar 'gyur/ / theg pa chen po cher 'byung ba'i/ / lam mchog (332)'di ni dpal dang ldan/ / khyed rnams 'dir ni dong bas na/ / rang byung skal pa chen po pa/ / 'jig rten thams cad mkhyen pa yi/ / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su 'gyur/

Therefore, now you will take birth in the Mahāyāna. {332} Since you will proceed on this supreme, glorious path arising as the greatness of the Mahāyāna, being of self-arisen great fortune, you will become tathāgatas, who know all worlds.[7]
zhes dang /
And:

bskal par bsags pa'i mun pa yang / nyi zla dang sgron me la sogs pa'i 'od kyi snang ba skad cig ma gcig gis sel nus pa ltar/ tshe 'khor ba thog mtha' med pa nas bsags pa'i sdig sgrib rnams kyang ye shes kyi snang ba skad cig mas sel nus pa'i thabs gsang sngags rdo rje theg pa'i dbang zab mo bskur bas/ khyed rnams dga' ba dang spro bar gyis shig / ces brjod/

Even darkness that has built up for eons can be cleared away by a single moment of illuminating light, such as that of the sun, moon, or a lamp. Similarly, the negative actions and obscurations, which have built up throughout lifetimes in beginningless and endless saṃsāra, can be dispelled by a single moment of illuminating wisdom. The methods for that are conferred in this profound abhiṣeka of the Secret Mantra Vajrayāna. You should all feel joy and be inspired. Say that.
de nas sdom pa sbyin pa la byang sems kyi sdom pa ni rjes zlos byas te/
Next, to be given the vows, repeat the following vows of a bodhisattva:
bla ma yi dam gtsor bzhugs pa'i/ / sras bcas sangs rgyas thams cad dang / / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma tshogs kun/ / thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
Gurus and yidams, present as the principal ones, all buddhas together with your children, and the whole assembly of heroes and yoginīs, please consider me.
che ge mo zhes bgyi ba bdag / bla med byang chub ma thob bar/ / dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/
I, (insert your name), until attaining unsurpassable awakening, take refuge in the three jewels.[*5]
sogs lan gsum brjod/
Say that three times.
rig 'dzin sngags kyi sdom pa sbyin pa ni/
Giving the Mantra vidyādhara vows.
bla ma yi dam nas/ dgongs su gsol/ gyi mthar/ /
Gurus and yidams,… please consider me. At the end:

che ge mo zhes bgyi ba bdag / dus 'di nyid nas bzung nas ni/ / ji srid byang chub ma thob bar/ / ji ltar dus gsum mgon po rnams/ / byang chub tu ni nges mdzad pa'i/ / byang chub sems ni bla na med/ / dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi/ /

I, (insert your name), starting from this time until reaching awakening, give rise to genuine [bodhicitta], just as the protectors of the three times gave rise to unsurpassable bodhicitta, which definitely brings awakening.
tshul khrims kyi ni bslab pa dang / / dge ba'i chos ni sdud pa dang / / sems can don byed tshul khrims gsum/ / so sor brtan por bzung bar bgyi/ /
I will hold firmly each of the three modes of ethical conduct: training in ethical conduct, gathering virtuous qualities, and benefiting sentient beings.
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / bla na med pa'i dkon mchog gsum/ / sangs rgyas rnal 'byor las skyes pa'i/ / sdom pa deng nas brtan por bzung / /
I will hold firmly, starting now, the vow arising from buddhayoga: those of the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha, the unsurpassable three jewels.
rdo rje rigs mchog chen po la/ / rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya yang / / yang dag nyid du bzung bar bgyi/ / slob dpon dag kyang bzung bar bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme vajra family, I will hold perfectly the vajra, ghaṇṭā, and mudrās and I will hold the ācārya.
rin chen rigs mchog chen po yi/ /(333) dam tshig yid du 'ong ba la/ / nyin re bzhin yang dus drug tu/ / sbyin pa rnam bzhi rtag tu sbyin/ /
For the great, supreme ratna family, {333} I will always perform the four types of generosity six times each day as the samaya that is pleasing to the mind.
byang chub chen po las byung ba'i/ / pad+ma'i rigs chen dag pa la/ / phyi nang gsang ba theg pa gsum/ / dam pa'i chos ni ma lus bzung / /
For the great, pure padma family, arising from great awakening, I will hold the genuine dharma of the three yānas, outer, inner, and secret.
las kyi rigs mchog chen po la/ / sdom pa thams cad ldan par ni/ / yang dag nyid du bzung bar bgyi/ / mchod pa'i las kyang ci nus bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme karma family, I will hold perfectly all the vows. I will perform all possible acts of worship.
byang chub sems ni bla med mchog / dam pa bdag gis bskyed bgyis nas/ / sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir/ / bdag gis sdom pa ma lus bzung / /
Having developed genuine, supreme, unsurpassable bodhicitta, I will hold all the vows for the benefit of all sentient beings.
ma bsgral ba rnams bdag gis bsgral/ / ma grol ba rnams bdag gis bgrol/ / dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung zhing / / sems can mya ngan 'das la 'god/
May I release those who have not been released. May I liberate those who have not been liberated. May I provide relief to those who have no relief. May I establish sentient beings in nirvāṇa.
ces lan gsum rjes zlos bya/
Repeat that three times.
nang gi dbang bskur ba ni/
Bestowing the internal abhiṣeka.

bla ma dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo yab yum dang bcas par gsal ba'i thugs ka'i hU~M gi 'od kyis slob ma rnams kyi sgo gsum gyi dri ma sbyangs shing / 'od du zhu hU~M re rer gyur te yab kyi zhal du drangs shing zhugs pa/ thugs kar rjes chags kyi mes 'od du zhu gsang gnas brgyud yum gyi mkhar byon pas he ru ka zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa re rer gyur pa la slob dpon gyis go cha bgo ba ni/

The guru appears clearly as the principal male and female consorts of the maṇḍala. The light from the hūṃs in their hearts purifies the stains of the three doors of you, the disciples. You melt into light, and each become a hūṃ. Those enter the mouth of the male consort and abide. The fire of passion causes those to melt into light at his heart center, then travel to his secret place and enter the consort’s space. They become herukas with one face and two arms. The ācārya places the armor as follows:

bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar oM ha las rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po zhes sogs sgrub thabs ltar brjod la/ pad nyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa de dpa' bo dpa' mo thams cad me long nang gi gzugs brnyan ltar snang la rang bzhin med par gsal btab/

At the heart of the Bhagavān, from oṃ ha, is white Vajrasattva…[*6] Recite according to the sādhana up to: …They stand on seats of lotuses, suns, and corpses in the dancing position with their right legs bent and their left extended. All the heroes and heroines appear but lack any nature, like images reflected in a mirror. Thus, visualize.
ye shes pa gzhug pa ni/
The entering of the wisdom ones.
bla ma dkyil 'khor gtso bor gsal ba'i thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od 'phros phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad he ru ka'i rnam par
Light radiates from the hūṃ in the heart of the guru, appearing clearly as the principal one of the maṇḍala, inviting the buddhas and bodhisattvas in the ten directions in forms of the Heruka.
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra saM pa ra wI ra yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaH
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasaṃvara vīra yoginī saparivāra vajra samājaḥ
zhes ye shes pa spyan drang /
Thus, invite the wisdom ones.
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka sogs mtshan sngags kyi mthar/
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka… At the end of the name mantra, say:
Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/ (334) zhes sogs kyis mchod/
…arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā…{334} Thus, offer.
ye shes pa de rnams khyed rang rnams la bstims byung snyam pa'i mos pa mdzod/ phyag rgya dang bcas/
Feel that the wisdom ones dissolve into you. With the mudrā, say:
dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH zhes rol mo bya/
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ Play music.
slar yang bla ma'i thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od 'phros/ rang bzhin gyi gnas nas rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pa
Again, light radiates from the hūṃ in the guru’s heart, inviting the five families and their retinues from their natural abodes.
oM pany+tsa ku la sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaH pad+ma ka ma lA ye s+t+waM/
oṃ pañcakula saparivāra vajra samājaḥ / padma kamalāyastvaṃ
oM pany+tsa= Ar+g+haM=
oṃ pañca…arghaṃ…
chos sku nam mkha' bzhin du sogs/

Although inseparable from the space-like dharmakāya, [your rainbowlike form kāyas appear individually. Homage and praises to the sugatas of the five families, those who have mastered the sublime methods and prajñā.]
bcom ldan rgyal ba rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pas slob ma 'di rnams la dbang bskur du gsol/
Bhagavān victors with your retinue of the five families, please bestow the abhiṣekas on these disciples.
zhes gsol ba btab pas rigs lnga'i 'khor rnams kyis rol ma'i sgra sna tshogs sgrogs shing mchod pa sna tshogs 'bul ba dang bcas te/
Having supplicated, the retinues of the five families play a variety of music and present myriad offerings:
he ru ka dpal 'khor bcas kyis/ / sku gsung thugs las byung ba yi/ / sgrib gnyis bag chags sbyong byed pa'i/ / rdo rje'i dbang bskur chen po sbyin/ /
You are given the great vajra abhiṣeka that arises from the body, speech, and mind of the glorious Heruka and retinue, purifying the latent tendencies of the two obscurations.
oM gu ru sarba ta thA ga ta=
oṃ guru sarvatathāgata…

zhes gsungs shing bum pa'i chus spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas sku gang dri ma dag chu lhag ma yar lud pa/ spyi bor 'khyil ba mi bskyod pa sprul sku'i cha byad can re res dbu brgyan par gyur pa de nyid yum gyi rtsibs logs g.yon nas thon/ pad nyi ro gdan gyi steng du gral rim gyis bzhag byung snyam pa'i mos pa mdzod/ ces slob dpon rdor dril pad kor dang bcas/

Through saying that and conferring the abhiṣeka on your head with the water in the vase, your stains of body are purified and the excess water rises up and overflows. Swirling at the tops of your heads, it becomes the crown of the body of Akṣobhya, with all his attributes, on each of your heads. Feel that you come out through the left ribs of the female consort and are seated in rows on lotus, sun, and corpse seats. The ācārya makes a lotus circle with vajra and ghaṇṭā.
shrI tsakra saM ba ra pad+ma ka ma lA ya s+t+waM/
śrīcakrasaṃvara padma kamalāyastvaṃ
zhes pad+ma'i phyag rgya dang bcas te bzhag /
Thus, with the lotus mudrā, they are seated.
de nas bsrung ba ni/
Next, the protection.

srang bu dmar po sum bltabs la 'bru gsum brjod bzhin mdud pa gsum bor ba oM AHhU~M gis byin rlabs byas/ skyes pa'i dpung pa g.yon dang / bud med kyi g.yas su gnyis bltabs su bcing zhing mdud pa bor te/ yi ge bdun pa dang 'bru gsum brjod bzhin du dung chos su dri bzang las bum gyi chu blugs la rdo rje 'dzin pas srin lag g.yon pas mnan/ de bzhin dpral mgrin snying gar reg la/

While saying the three seed syllables over red threads folded three times, tie three knots and consecrate them with oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Around the upper left arm on men and the upper right arm on women, wrap those twice and tie a knot. While saying the seven syllables and the three seed syllables, pour scented water into the conch from the activity vase. Holding a vajra, press down [on the knot of the protection cord] with your left ring finger. Similarly, touch their foreheads, throats, and hearts, and say:
de yang srung skud dmar po 'dom gang ba skyes pa'i g.yon dang / bud med kyi g.yas kyi dpung par 'ching ba des byang sems dkar dmar srung bar byed pa yin/ (335)
The red protection cord, a fathom in length, tied to the left upper arm on men and the right upper arm on women, will protect your white and red bindus. {335}
dri bzang gi chus snying ga / mgrin pa/ dpral ba rnams su mas rim gyis thig le bkod la/ hU~M AHoM/ brjod pas/
With scented water, place drops at their heart, throat, and head and say: hūṃ āḥ oṃ

dpral bar sku rnam snang / mgrin par gsung 'od dpag med/ snying gar thugs mi bskyod pa sngon po rnams su gyur pa las/ sangs rgyas byang sems thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin snyam pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Those become Vairocana, body, at your forehead; Amitābha, speech, at your throat; and blue Akṣobhya, mind, at your heart. Feel that they are the embodiments of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas and bodhisattvas.
mchod pa ni/
Offerings.
slob ma lhar gsal ba'i mdun du mchod pa sna lnga bshams la/ khyed rang rnams lhar gsal ba la slob dpon gyis mchod pa'i lha mo spros te mchod byung snyam pa'i mos pa mdzod/

In front of the disciples, who are visualized as the deities, place the five offerings. Feel that for you, who are visualized as the deities, the ācārya emanates offering goddesses who present the offerings.
oM badzra Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/
oṃ vajra arghaṃ… Make offerings.
so shing 'dor ba ni/
Throwing the toothsticks.

maN+Dal tshom bu dgu bkod la bzhag / so shing dri bzangs kyis byugs shing 'bru gsum gyis rin po cher byin gyis brlabs/ thal mo sbyar ba'i bar du bcug pas skyug sman zos pa ltar sdig sgrib skyug par bsams la so la cung zad drud de/ sngags kyis 'bul ba ni/

Arrange nine offering piles on a maṇḍala. Anoint the toothsticks with scented water, and with the three seed syllables, consecrate them as jewels. Holding them between palms joined in añjali, bring them toward your teeth, thinking that, like [after] ingesting an emetic, you vomit your negative actions and obscurations. Brush it lightly on your teeth and offer with the mantra:
oM AHdzi hwa/
oṃ āḥ jihvaḥ
badzra saM war+d+ha ni ye swA hA/
vajra saṃvaradhaniye svāhā
so shing 'o ma can sor bcu gnyis pa 'di/ rang gi so la cung zad drung la skyug sman zos pa ltar/ sdig sgrib thams cad skyug par bsams la/
Brush this toothstick with sap, twelve fingers long, lightly on your teeth, and, like after ingesting an emetic, think that you vomit all your negative actions and obscurations.
oM badzra ha sa ha/
oṃ vajra hasa ha
zhes tshom bu dbus ma la the tshom med par phul/
Offer it without hesitation to the middle offering pile.

de ltar phul bas rtse mo me tog yod pa de rang dang bla ma tshom bu dbus ma la bstan na mchog gi dngos grub thob/ steng du bstan na rig 'dzin gyi go 'phang thob/ 'og tu sa la gnas pa'i gter gyi dngos grub thob/ phyogs bzhir phrin las bzhi/ mtshams bzhir dngos grub sna re thob par lung bstan to/ /

Having offered it, if its tip, which has a flower, faces you, the guru, and the offering pile in the middle, you will attain the supreme siddhi. If it faces upward, you will attain the level of a vidyādhara. If it faces downward, you will attain the siddhi of discovering treasures residing in the earth. Facing one of the four directions prophesizes achieving one of the four activities and facing one of the four intermediate directions prophesizes attaining a single siddhi.
skyor chu sbyin pa ni/
Giving a handful of water.

las bum gyi chus bkrus pas sdig sgrib dag par mos pa gyis la khrus mdzod/ ces dang yig brgya brjod/ de nas rmi lam brtag phyir ku sha sbyin pa ni/ ku sha'i chun po che ba lag g.yas dang chung ba g.yon du gtad/ che ba gdan/ chung bas sngas byas la seng ge'i nyal stabs kyis nyal dgos pas/

Having been washed by the water of the activity of vase, feel that your negative actions and obscurations are purified and you have bathed. Recite the hundred syllables. Then, give them the kuśa to examine their dreams. Place the larger bunch of kuśa in their right hands, and the smaller one in their left. The larger one should be placed on their beds and the smaller one on their pillows. They should go to sleep in the sleeping position of a lion.

bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ku sha'i gdan la 'dug nas bdud btul zhing sangs rgyas pa yin pas/ khyed (336) rang rnams kyang chun po che ba gdan dang / chung ba sngas su gyis la bla ma dang dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs la mgo bstan te seng ge'i nyal stabs kyis nyal zhing / nangs par dbang zab mo thob yong bas re dga' snyam pa dang / rmi lam bzung dgos snyam pas nyol/ zhes brjod/

The Bhagavān sat on a seat of kuśa and tamed Māra and became a buddha. {336} You should take the larger bunch as your bed and the smaller as your pillow. With your head facing in the direction of the guru and the maṇḍala, go to sleep in the sleeping position of a lion. Go to sleep thinking with joy that you are ready to receive the profound abhiṣeka in the morning and that you must recognize your dreams.

dge ba bsngos la slob ma rnams grol/ de nas slob dpon gyis grub na gtor 'bul dang tshogs mchod sogs rjes kyi rim pa bya/ mi 'grub na gtor 'bul mchod bstod tsam dang / nongs bshags shis brjod sogs byas pas grub bo/ /

Dedicate the merit and release the disciples. Then if the ācārya can do it, do the torma offering and the concluding sections, such as the gaṇapūjā. If they are unable to do that, do the torma offering, brief offerings and praises, the confession of mistakes, the expression of auspiciousness, and so forth.
bzhi pa dkyil 'khor sta gon ni/
4. The Maṇḍala Prelude
a.
[a. Preparation][8]

rdul tshon dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa'i skabs thig tshon gyi bya ba rnams dgos kyang 'dir stegs bu gtsang mar khebs kyis bkab pa'i steng ras bris kyi dkyil 'khor mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bkram/ dbus su many+dzi'i khar sngar sta gon byas pa'i rnam rgyal bum pa/ dung chos gzungs rdor bcas bkod/

When constructing a maṇḍala of colored powders, you need to perform all the activities related to the lines and colors. Here, on top of a clean small stand covered with a cloth, place an authentic cloth-drawn maṇḍala. In the middle, on a mañji, place the victory vase used for the prelude, with the conch and dhāraṇī vajra.
g.yas g.yon rnams su rigs lnga'i dbu rgyan/ rdo rje/ dril bu/ mdun ngos su gsang dbang thod chang bdud rtsi ril bu sbyar ba dang / sher dbang kha T+wAM ga bzhag /

To the left and right, put the crown of the five families, a vajra, and a ghaṇṭā. Directly in front, place the skull cup with the mixture of alcohol and amṛta pills for the secret abhiṣeka and the khaṭvāṃga for the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka.

logs gang bder snod gcig tu mnga' gsol chas thor tshugs skra tshab thal raka zhag gsum thod skam dbu rgyan thod rlon do shal rus rgyan sbrul chun bcas phyogs bsdus/ mi lpags glang lpags stag sham/ ro gdan/ rdo rje dril bu/ gri gug thod pa/ kha T+wAM ga dang cang te'u/ thod rnga dang rkang gling rnams dngos sam ri mor bris pa/ snod gcig tu rjes gnang chas/ nor bu/ ral gri/ bgrang phreng / glegs bam/ mig thur/ dgang gzar blugs/ sna tshogs rdo rje/ mda' gzhu/ dug sbrul dang bud med gzugs bzhag /

To the side, wherever is convenient, in one tray, group together the following items for the investiture: the topknot wig; ashes, rakta, and fat; the crown of dried skulls; the necklace of fresh skulls; bone ornaments; and bunches of snakes. The human skin, elephant hide, tiger-skin skirt, corpse seat, vajra and ghaṇṭā, hooked knife and skull cup, khaṭvāṃga and changteu, and the skull-cup drum and kangling may either by actual or drawings. In another tray, put the following items for the authorization: gem, sword, mālā, book, eye spoon, pātrī and śruva, viśvavajra, bow and arrow, poisonous snakes, and an image of a woman.
dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' skor du mchod yon dang nyer spyod g.yon bskor/ rgyab phyogs sogs gang bder 'bul gtor bshos zlum bza' btung bzung dgus bskor ba rnams bkod/

Around the outside of the maṇḍala, place offering water and the traditional offerings, circling counterclockwise. To the rear and elsewhere, wherever is convenient, arrange the offering tormas, round cakes, surrounded by all kinds of excellent food and drink.
snod gzhan zhig tu slob ma mchod pa mchod yon nyer spyod/ 'dod yon lnga bcas gang bder bzhag / gzhan yang sngon gtor sogs nye bar mkho ba'i yo byad rnams 'du bya'o/ /

In another tray, arrange the offering water and traditional offerings, along with the five sense pleasures, to be offered to the disciples. Place it where it is convenient. Also gather the requisite items, such as the preliminary torma.
gnyis pa dbang don dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa la/
b. The Practice of the Maṇḍala for the Purpose of [Conferring] the Abhiṣeka

thog mar sgrub thabs ltar sngon 'gro gtor ma btang ba nas bzlas pa bsdu ldang gi bar bdag bskyed tshang bar btang / (337) bum bskyed bzlas pa khyugs tsam dang bum lha bdud rtsir bsgyur/ de nas mdun bskyed dkyil 'khor bsang sbyang /

First, do the complete self visualization, from giving the preliminary torma up through the recitations and the dissolution and arising, as done in the sādhana. {337} Do the vase visualization and recitation briefly. Confer the vase deities on the amṛta. Then, cleanse and purify the maṇḍala of the front visualization.

mdun rten mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid du gyur/ stong pa'i ngang las nam mkha'i khams su e e las sogs sgrub thabs ltar bskyed chog rdzogs par btang / go cha bgo/ gnas gsum byin gyis brlab/ ye shes pa gzhug pa'ang de ltar la dpag tu med pas bskor ba dang / sta gon gyi dkyil 'khor nam mkhar bzhugs pa rnams kyang spyan drangs/

The front support becomes nonreferential emptiness. Within emptiness, in the dhātu of space, from e and e,…[*7] Do the complete ritual of generation according to the sādhana. Continue with the placement of the armor, the consecration of the three places, and the entering of the wisdom ones up to: …surrounded by innumerable assemblies of buddhas and bodhisattvas and the prelude maṇḍala present in the sky.
oM gu ru b+ha ga wAn sogs sngags dang /
oṃ guru bhagavān… Say that mantra and:
badzra sa mA dzaH 'i rjes su/
vajra samājaḥ After that:
ma lus sems can kun gyi mgon gyur cing / / bdud sde dpung bcas mi bzad 'joms mdzad lha/ / dngos rnams ma lus ji bzhin mkhyen gyur pa'i/ / bcom ldan 'khor bcas gnas 'dir gshegs su gsol/ /
Protectors of all sentient beings without exception, deities who destroy Māra and the terrible hordes, who know all things just as they are, Bhagavān and your retinue, please come here.

bcom ldan bskal pa grangs med du ma ru/ / 'gro la brtse phyir thugs rje rnam sbyangs shing / / smon lam rgya chen dgongs pa yongs rdzogs pa'i/ / khyed bzhed 'gro don mdzad dus 'di lags na/ / de phyir chos dbyings pho brang lhun grub nas/ / rdzu 'phrul byin rlabs sna tshogs ston mdzad cing / / mtha' yas sems can tshogs rnams bsgral ba'i phyir/ / yongs dag 'khor dang bcas te gshegs su gsol/

Bhagavān, for many countless eons, you have trained with compassion out of your love for beings, and you have perfected your intention with vast aspirations. Now, at this time of benefiting beings in keeping with your commitment, from the innately present palace of the dharmadhātu, demonstrate various magical displays and blessings. In order to release all the infinite sentient beings, lord and your retinue, please come here.
zhes dang /
And:
oM badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA sa mchod yon dang /
oṃ vajra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā Thus, present the offering water.
pad+ma ka ma lA ya s+t+waM gyis gdan 'bul/
padma kamalāyastvaṃ Thus, present the seat.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta a b+hi She ka te sa ma ya shrI hU~M gis khrus gsol/
oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekate samaya śrī hūṃ Thus, offer the bath.
mchod rdzas dam pa 'di dag dang / / 'jig rten khams kyi mchod rdzas kun/ / thams cad blo yis blangs nas ni/ / bcom ldan 'khor dang bcas la 'bul/ /
Imagining all these sacred offering substances and all the offering substances in the worldly realms, I present them to the Bhagavān and his retinue.
oM gu ru b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra saM pa raM wI ra yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM nas/ shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ guru bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasaṃvaraṃ sarvavīrayoginī saparivāra arghaṃ…śabda Thus, offer.
bstod par 'os pa thams cad la/ / zhing rdul kun gyi grangs snyed kyis/ / lus btud pa yis rnam kun tu/ / mchog tu dad pas bstod par bgyi/ /
To those worthy of praise, with bodies as numerous as atoms in the realms, I bow and always offer praises with supreme faith.
zhes mchod bstod bya/
Thus, offer and praise.
oM gu ru sogs nas/ sa pa ri wA ra dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH (338)
oṃ guru…saparivāra jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ {338}
ye shes pa dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la thim pas dbyer med du gyur/
The wisdom ones dissolve into the samaya maṇḍala, and they become inseparable.
dbang bskur ba ni/
Bestowing the abhiṣeka.

slar yang thugs ka'i sa bon las 'od zer 'phros pas sogs/ rigs bdag gi dbu rgyan la thim bar dang / mchod bstod/ bzlas pa bcas sgrub thabs bzhin bya/ bzlas dmigs rdo li'am bde chen bzlas pa dang sbyar la bzlas grangs skabs bstun bya/ de nas mchod bstod rgyas par 'bul ba'i thog mar mchod pa kha gsos la sgrub thabs ltar byin brlab/

Again, light radiates from the seed syllables in the hearts…dissolve into the crowns of their respective family lords.[*8] Offer and praise, and do the recitation according to the sādhana. The visualization for the recitation should be either the palanquin or the great bliss recitation. The number of recitations should accord with the time. Next, present extensive offerings and praises. First, replenish the offerings and consecrate them according to the sādhana.
dang po phyi mchod ni/
First, the outer offerings.
gtsang bde bsil sogs yan lag brgyad ldan chab/ / yid kyi gdung sel kun dga'i dpal ster ba'i/ / lha yi mchod yon dam pa'i mchod pa 'di/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnam la 'bul/ /

Water with the eight qualities, clean, pleasing, cooling, and so on, soothes mental torment and bestows the glory of joy. This offering of the holy offering water of the gods is presented to the guru and the assembly of deities of the maṇḍala.
oM gu ru b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra saM pa ra wI ra yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra badzra Ar+g+haM pU dza me g+ha sa mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye A hU~M/
oṃ guru bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasaṃvara vīra yoginī saparivāra vajra arghaṃ pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du/
Similarly:
kha dog rnam par bkra ba'i 'dab phreng las/ / sa phyogs bsung zhim ngad pas bsil sbyin mkhan/ / mig gi bdud rtsir bzhad pa'i me tog 'di/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs=
With rings of petals of vibrant colors, bestowing coolness with their sweet fragrances filling the space, these flowers bursting with amṛta for the eyes are presented to the guru…
sngags thog mtha' gong ltar la/
With the same beginning and end of the mantra, insert:
badzra puSh+pe=
…vajra puṣpe…
rang byung dri ngad sbyar ba'i spos kyi sprin/ / nam mkha'i ba mthar gtibs las zhing khams kun/ / rab tu zhim pos kun dgar byed pa 'di/ bla ma=
Clouds of incense of self-arisen fragrances, billowing out to the ends of space, in all the pure realms, create pleasure with their sweet scents. These are presented to the guru…
badzra d+hU pe=
…vajra dhūpe…
nyi zla nor bu'i zer phreng 'bru mar mes/ / ma lus mun pa'i dpal 'phrog snang ba yis/ / nyin mtshan mi phyed kun tu gsal ba 'di/ / bla ma=

The radiance of the sun, moon, and gems, and oil flames are illumination that vanquishes the power of darkness, lighting up everything with no distinction as to day or night. These are presented to the guru…
badzra A lo ke=
…vajra āloke…
dri med chab la tsan+dan ga pur dang / / gur gum la sogs rnam par sbyar ba'i rdzas/ / bsil bde nyon mongs tshad nad drung 'byin dri/ / bla ma=
Compound substances, such as stainless water with sandalwood, camphor, and saffron, are cooling and pleasant, and eradicate the fever of mental afflictions. These are presented to the guru…
badzra gan+d+he=
…vajra gandhe…
kha dog dri dang ro brgyar ldan pa'i bshos/ / ji tsam myong yang mi mthun med pa yi/ / lha yi zhal zas bda' dgu ji snyed pa/ / bla ma=
Food with color, scent, and a hundred flavors, no matter how much is eaten, never disturbs. This delectable food of the gods is presented to the guru…
badzra nai wi d+ya=
…vajra naividya…
rnga sil dung dang rgyud mang cha lang sogs/ / yan lag 'bum sde'i sgra dbyangs snyan sgrogs pa/ / rol mo'i khyad par ma lus ji snyed kun/ / bla ma= (339)
Drums, small cymbals, conches, strings, and cymbals, producing melodious sounds with a hundred thousand variations, all this exceptional music, as much as there is, is presented to the guru…
badzra shab+da pU dza/ sogs kyis mchod cing rol mo bya'o/ /
…vajra śabda pūja… Thus, offer and play music. {339}
'dod yon lnga 'bul ba ni/
Offering the five sense pleasures.
rab 'byams zhing gi dkyil 'khor thams cad bar/ / rgyal ba'i spyan la mdzes pa ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus gzugs kyi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ /

In all the maṇḍalas in the infinite pure lands, all that is beautiful for the eyes of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra forms and presented to the guru and the assembly of deities of the maṇḍala.
oM gu ru= badzra rU pa pU dza=
oṃ guru…vajra rūpa pūja…
rab 'byams zhing gi= rgyal ba'i snyan la 'jebs pa ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus sgra yi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bla ma=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is sweet for the ears of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra sounds and presented to the guru…
badzra shab+da=
…vajra śabda…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i shangs la zhim pa ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus dri yi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bla ma=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is fragrant for the noses of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra smells and presented to the guru…
badzra gan+d+he=
…vajra gandhe…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i ljags la bda' ba ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus ro yi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bla ma=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is tasty for the tongues of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra tastes and presented to the guru…
badzra ra sa=
…vajra rasa…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i sku la bde ba ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus reg bya rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bla ma=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is blissful for the bodies of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra tangible objects and presented to the guru…
badzra spar+she pU dza=
…vajra sparśe pūja…
de'i rjes 'brel phyi snod 'jig rten 'bul ba ni/
Connected to that, the offering of the external environment, the world.
bdag pos bzung dang ma bzung mchod pa'i tshogs/ / dngos dang yid kyi 'phrul 'khor las byung ba'i/ / sgyu 'phrul rdo rje'i rol rtsal mchod pa'i sprin/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ /

Masses of offerings, both owned and not owned, actual and magical displays arising from the mind’s imagination, clouds of offerings, vajra displays, are presented to the guru and the assembly of deities of the maṇḍala.
nang bcud 'bul ba ni/
Offering the internal inhabitants.
bdag lus phung khams 'phral yun gtan bde dang / / mkha' khyab zhing gi 'gro ba longs spyod bcas/ / rgyal ba rnams kyi 'bangs su bdag 'bul na/ / rjes bzung brtse bas dgongs te bzhes su gsol/ /

My body, skandhas, dhātus, temporary and lasting happiness, beings of the fields pervading space, and their possessions, I offer as subjects for the victors. Please consider and accept us with your kindness.
gnyis pa nang mchod bdud rtsi 'bul ba ni/ /
Second, presenting the inner-offering amṛta.
mtheb srin gyis bdud rtsi 'thor zhing /
Sprinkle amṛta with your thumb and ring finger and say:
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
dman pa'i yul las rab 'das shing / / rgyal ba kun gyi dam tshig mchog / dngos grub kun gyi gzhir gyur pa'i/ / bdud rtsi mchog gi mchod pa 'bul/ /
Far beyond inferior spheres and being the supreme samaya of all victors, I present the supreme offering of amṛta, what forms the ground of all siddhis.
rdo rje 'chang chen rdo rje rnal 'byor ma/ / tai lo nA ro mar pa mi la'i zhabs/ / ras chung rdor grags khyung tshang ras pa dang / / grub thob rnam gsum (340) zhal du oM AHhU~M/ /
Great Vajradhara, Vajrayoginī, Tilopa, Nāropa, Marpa, Milarepa, Rechung Dorje Drakpa, Khyung Tsang Repa— {340} to the three groups of siddhas, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
zhang ston lo tsA 'gro mgon d+hA ra shrI/ / bsod nams rgyal mtshan 'khrul zhig ras ma dang / / gzi brjid rgyal mtshan dbang phyug shes rab rje/ / ri khrod ras chen zhal du oM AHhU~M/ /
Zhangtön Lotsāwa, Drogön Dhāraśrī, Sönam Gyaltsen, Trulzhik Rema, Ziji Gyaltsen, Wangchuk Sherap, to the great repas of the wilderness, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
gzhon nu dpal ldan nam mkha' rgyal mtshan dang / / ngag gi dbang po rab 'byams chos kyi rje/ / gtsang smyon he ru rgod tshang ras chen pa/ / sangs rgyas rdo rje'i zhal du oM AHhU~M/ /
Zhönu Palden, Namkha Gyaltsen, Ngaki Wangpo, Rapjam Chökyi Je, Tsangnyön Heruka, Götsang Rechenpa— to the vajra buddhas, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
byams pa phun tshogs khyab bdag grub mchog dbang / / nam mkha'i mtshan can phrin las rgya mtsho dang / / karma bshad sgrub rgyal mchog 'chi med dbang / / bstan pa'i sgron me'i zhal du oM AHhU~M/ /
Jampa Puntsok, Khyapdak Drupchok Wang, Namkhai Tsenchen, Tinle Gyatso, Karma Shedrup, Gyalchok Chime Wang— to the lamps of the teachings, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
yon tan rgya mtsho 'dzam gling grags pa'i zhabs/ / ngag gi dbang po ye shes skal bzang dang / / dpal ldan rgya mtsho nges don bstan pa 'dzin/ / chos kyi rgya mtsho'i zhal du oM AHhU~M/ /
Yönten Gyatso, Dzamling Drakpa, Ngaki Wangpo, Yeshe Kalzang, Palden Gyatso, Ngedön Tendzin— to the oceans of dharma, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
mthu stobs rgya mtsho rin chen 'od zer pa/ / phrin las dbang phyug kun bzang rdo rje dang / / o rgyan rnam grol rtsa ba'i bla ma sogs/ / snyan nas brgyud pa'i zhal du oM AHhU~M/
Tutop Gyatso, Rinchen Özerpa, Tinle Wangchuk, Kunzang Dorje, Orgyen Namdrol, my root guru, and others— to the Aural Transmission, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
dpal ldan 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To the assembly of deities of the maṇḍala of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
rgyud sde bzhi dang 'brel ba'i yi dam lha tshogs rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To the assemblies of yidam deities connected to the four classes of tantras, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
gnas gsum gyi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To the heroes and yoginīs of the three places, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
ma mgon lcam dral la sogs pa chos skyong srung ma rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To Ma-Gön cham-dral and the other dharma protectors and guardians, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
dkar phyogs skyong ba'i gzhi gnas yul bdag rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To the local deities of the area, place, and ground who protect the those on the virtuous side, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can thams cad yi dam gyi lhar gsal ba'i zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To all sentient beings of the six classes of beings, visualized as the yidam deities, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
rang gi lcer myangs la/
Taste it with your own tongue and say:
oM AHhU~M/ brjod/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
gsum pa gsang ba'i mchod pa ni/
Third, the secret offering.
kha dog dbyibs legs yid 'ong rgyan spras ma/ / sku mdog sngon mo mchod rdzas pi waM 'dzin/ / zag med bde ster ye shes lha mo 'di/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ /

With fine colors and shapes, the charming lady dressed in ornaments is blue in color and holding her offering of a lute. This wisdom goddess who bestows undefiled bliss is presented to the guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala.
oM badzra bI Ne AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra vīṇe āḥ hūṃ
kha dog= sku mdog ser mo mchod rdzas (341) gling bu 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is yellow in color and holding her offering of a flute. {341} This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
oM badzra waM she AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra vaṃśe āḥ hūṃ
kha dog= sku mdog dmar mo mchod rdzas rnga zlum 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is red in color and holding her offering of a round drum. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
mr-i daM ge=
…mṛdaṃge…
kha dog= sku mdog ljang gu mchod rdzas rdza rnga 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is green in color and holding her offering of a clay drum. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
mu ra dze=
…muraje…
kha dog= bzhad ma dmar mo 'dzum pa'i bzhin ldan zhing / / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is the lady of laughter, red, with smiling face. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
hA s+ye=
…hāsye…
kha dog= sgeg ma sngon mo mdzes pa'i 'gying bag can/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is the lady of grace, blue, with elegant beauty. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
lA s+ye=
…lāsye…
kha dog= glu ma ljang gu snyan pa'i dbyangs len pa'i/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is the lady of song, green, singing sweetly. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
gi tI=
…gitī…
kha dog= gar ma ser mo mdzes pa'i gar bsgyur ma/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is the lady of dance, yellow, executing gorgeous dances. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
nr-i t+ye=
…nṛtye…
kha dog= sku mdog dkar mo mchod rdzas me tog 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is white in color and holding her offering of flowers. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
puSh+pe=
…puṣpe…
kha dog= sku mdog sngon mo mchod rdzas bdug spos 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is blue in color and holding her offering of incense. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
d+hU pe=
…dhūpe…
kha dog= sku mdog dmar mo mchod rdzas mar me 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is red in color and holding her offering of a lamp. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
dI paM=
…dīpaṃ…
kha dog= sku mdog ljang gu mchod rdzas dri chab 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is green in color and holding her offering of perfume. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
gan+d+he=
…gandhe…
kha dog= gzugs ma dkar mo mchod rdzas me long 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is white in color and holding her offering of a mirror. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
A dar+she=
…ādarśe…
kha dog= ro ma dmar mo mchod rdzas zhal zas 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is the lady of music, red, and holding her offering of food. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
ra sa=
…rasa…
kha dog= reg ma ser mo mchod rdzas na bza' 'dzin/ / zag med= bla ma=
With fine colors… is the lady of touch, yellow, and holding her offering of cloth. This wisdom goddess… is presented to the guru…
spar+she=
…sparśe…
kha dog= dbyings ma sngon mo mchod rdzas chos 'byung 'dzin/ / zag med bde ster ye shes lha mo 'di/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ /

With fine colors… is the lady of the dhātu, blue, and holding her offering of a source of dharmas. This wisdom goddess who bestows undefiled bliss is presented to the guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala.
oM badzra d+ha rme AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra dharme āḥ hūṃ
bzhi pa de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa ni/
Four, the offering of suchness.
gnas lugs rang ngo shes pa'i shes rab dang / / bdag pas gzhan gces ldan pa'i snying rje dang / / rang bzhin dbyer med zung 'jug mchod pa 'di/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ /

Prajñā recognizing the abiding state and the compassion that cherishes others more than oneself are the offering of unification, the inseparable nature. This is presented to the guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala.
srid zhi rtog dpyod bral ba'i mnyam gzhag (342) dang / / snang ba stong par myong ba'i rjes thob dang / / ngo bo mnyam rjes khyab gdal mchod pa 'di/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor=

Meditative equipoise free from discriminating existence and peace, {342} and the postmeditative attainment of experiencing appearances as empty are the offering of the essence, all-pervasive equipoise and post-attainment. This is presented to the guru…
sna tshogs snang ba stong pa'i rol rtsed 'di/ / sku gsum lhun grub sgyu ma'i gar mkhan la/ / yongs grub mi 'bral chos dbyings mchod pa 'di/ / bla ma=

This play of various appearances and emptiness for the illusory dancer of the innately present three kāyas is the offering of the dharmadhātu, inseparable from the consummate. This is presented to the guru…
mchod gnas dam pa mchod mkhan 'khor gsum po/ / dbyer med chos nyid ngang du ro gcig pa'i/ / bla med blo 'das mchod pa dam pa 'di/ / bla ma=

The three spheres of the sacred offering place, the offerings, and the agent, inseparable and of one taste in dharmatā, are the highest sacred offerings transcending the intellect. This is presented to the guru…
dge bas 'gro kun de nyid rtogs par shog / ces 'khor gsum dmigs med kyi gnas lugs ngang la mnyam par bzhag /
Through this virtue, may all beings realize suchness. Rest evenly in the abiding state in which the three spheres are not observed.
bstod pa rgyud nas byung ba'i rkang brgyad ni/
Praises: the eight lines drawn from the tantras.
hU~M/ bcom ldan mgon po dpa' bo'i dbang phyug ni/ / bskal pa'i me ltar 'od zer rab tu 'bar/ / ral pa'i cod pan dbu yi rgyan du bcings/ / mche ba rab gtsigs drag shul 'jigs pa'i zhal/ /
hūṃ Bhagavān, protector, lord of heroes, blazing with light like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs.
sku la phyag rgya gzi brjid ldan pa po/ / dgra s+t+wa zhags pa kha T+wAM mdung sogs bsnams/ / rab 'jigs stag gi pags pa'i gos 'dzin pa'i/ / sku chen dud kas bgegs 'joms mdzad la 'dud/ /

You have a form majestic with the mudrās, holding an axe, noose, khaṭvāṃga, spear, and more, and are frightening, wearing a tiger skin. To the one with the great smoky body, destroyer of obstructors, I bow.

hU~M/ bcom ldan rnam kun rdo rje phag mo che/ / 'jig rten gsum gzhan rgol bas mi tshugs shing / / 'byung po'i 'jigs pa ma lus rdo rje phag mos 'joms/ / rdo rje gdan bzhugs tshangs pa las rgyal zhing / / bdud kyi 'jigs pa ma lus skem zhing pham mdzad pa/ /

hūṃ Bhagavatī, great Vajravārāhī of all manifestations, unswayed by opponents, the three worlds, Vajravārāhī, conquering fears of bhūtas, residing at Vajrāsana, and victorious over Brahmā, you dry up and destroy all fears of Māra.
skye gnas 'byung ba kun gyi rang bzhin gzugs/ / sa gsum dbang phyug chos rnams yongs rdzogs mdzad/ / rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i dbang phyug chen mor bstod/
With a form the nature of all birth, abiding, and arising, you are empress of the three planes, the perfection of phenomena. To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I offer praise.
spro na/ bde mchog lha drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi bstod pa 'bring po ni/
If you wish to elaborate, say the following intermediate-length praises of the sixty-two Saṃvara deities.
oM/ srid zhi'i dge legs ma lus stsol mdzad pa'i/ / bka' brgyud bla ma dam pa rnams dang ni/ / bcom ldan 'khor lo sdom pa 'khor bcas la/ / bdag gis sgo gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal lo/ /
oṃ Those who bestow the virtue and excellence of existence and peace, the genuine Kagyu gurus and the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, and retinue, I respectfully pay homage with my three doors.
AH pad nyi 'jigs byed dus mtshan gdan steng na/ / srid zhi mnyam sbyor 'khor (343)lo bde mchog ni/ / mthing nag zhal bzhi bcu gnyis phyag can gyi/ / zhal rnams sngo ljang dmar ser spyan gsum ldan/ /

āḥ On seats of a lotus, sun, Bhairava, and Kālarātri, {343} Cakrasaṃvara, the equalizer of existence and peace, is deep blue, with four faces and twelve hands. Your faces are blue, green, red, and yellow with three eyes.
mche gtsigs smin ma sma ra ag tshom ser/ / ral pa gyen brdzes zla phyed rdo rjes mtshan/ / dang po'i phyag gnyis rdor dril yum la 'khyud/ / tha ma zhing glang lpags rlon brgyangs te 'dzin/ /

Your fangs are bared, your eyebrows, moustache, and beard are yellow. Your dreadlocks sweep upward, marked by a half moon and vajra. Your first two hands with a vajra and ghaṇṭā embrace your consort. Your last two hold aloft a skin of one meeting the criteria and a fresh elephant hide.

lhag ma g.yas rnams cang te'u gri gug dang / / dgra s+t+wa rtse gsum 'dzin cing g.yon rnams kyang / / kha T+wAM thod khrag zhags pa tshangs mgo bsnams/ / gar dgu'i nyams ldan dur khrod chas kyis mdzes/ /

Your remaining right ones hold a changteu, hooked knife, battle-ax, and trident. Your left hold a khaṭvāṃga, skull cup with blood, noose, and Brahmā’s head. You have the nine moods of dance and are beautified by charnel ground ornaments.

'khril sbyor rdo rje phag mo dmar mo ni/ / rab mdzes yid 'ong zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ / gri thod 'dzin pas yab la 'khyud cing stob/ / sgyu ma'i gar gyis sa gsum 'gro ba 'dul/ / bcom ldan bde mchog yab yum phyag 'tshal bstod/

You are entwined with red Vajravārāhī, who is captivating and beautiful, with one face and two hands. Holding a hooked knife and skull cup, she embraces and serves her consort. You subdue the beings of the three planes with your illusory dance, Bhagavān, Saṃvara, male and female consorts, I pay homage and offer praise.

hU~M/ he ru ka dpal yab yum sprul pa'i 'khor/ / pad 'dab brgyad kyi phyogs bzhir rim pa bzhin/ / mkha' 'gro lA ma dum skyes gzugs can ma/ / sngo ljang dmar ser zhal gcig phyag bzhi yis/ / gri gug cang te'u thod khrag kha T+wAM 'dzin/ /

hūṃ The retinue emanated from the glorious Heruka, male and female consorts, are on the eight lotus petals; in the four main directions are Ḍākinī, Lāma, Khaṇḍarohā, and Rūpiṇī, blue, green, red, yellow, with one face and four hands, holding hooked knives, changteus, skull cups with blood, and khaṭvāṃgas.
zhabs rnams skyil krung phyed pa'i gar stabs kyis/ / pad 'dab nyi dkyil ro yi gdan la bzhugs/ / lang tsho rab rgyas rus pa'i rgyan gyis mdzes/ / bde chen gsang yum rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Their legs are in the dancing position, loosely crossed, planted on seats of lotus petals, sun maṇḍalas, and corpses. Full of splendor, they are beautified with bone ornaments. To the secret consorts of great bliss, I pay homage.

sa gsum 'khor lo'i rtsibs gyur nyer bzhi yi/ / yul rnams skyong byed dpa' bo mkha' 'gro'i tshogs/ / thod dum rab gtum mo sogs sku mdog sngo/ / myug can sa srung ma sogs sku mdog dmar/ / stobs chen 'khor lo ma sogs sku mdog dkar/ /

yab rnams zhal gcig phyag bzhi'i dang po rnams/ / g.yas rnams rang rang rigs bdag phyag mtshan dang / / g.yon rnams de mthun dril 'dzin yum la 'khyud/ / de 'og g.yas rnams cang te'u 'dzin cing 'khrol/ / g.yon 'og rnams kyang kha T+wAM rtse gsum 'dzin/ / (344)

The male consorts have one face and four hands. Their first right ones hold the emblems of their own family lords, and their left hold corresponding ghaṇṭās, embracing their consorts. Their lower right hold and play changteus, and their lower left grasp three-pronged khaṭvāṃgas. {344}

rus pa'i rgyan can gar dgu'i nyams dang ldan/ / 'khril sbyor yum rnams rgyan dang cha lugs dang / / phyag mtshan 'khyud stangs gtso mo dang mtshungs pa'i/ / dpa' bo mkha' 'gro rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

With bone ornaments and having the nine moods of dance, they are entwined with their consorts, who have the same ornaments, attributes, emblems, and embracing posture as the principal female. To the heroes and ḍākinīs, I pay homage.

sgo mtshams bzhugs pa'i khwa 'ug khyi phag gdong / / gshin rje brtan po mche 'joms dpa' mo rnams/ / rang rang gnas pa'i phyogs mtshams sku mdog can/ / zhal phyag la sogs gsang yum bzhi dang mtshungs/ / ye shes mkha' 'gro rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Standing at the doors, Kākāsyā, Ulūkāsyā, Śvānāsyā, and Śūkarāsyā, Yamadāḍhī, Yamadūtī, Yamadaṃṣṭriṇī, and Yamamathanī, all heroines, have the colors of the directions where they reside. Their faces, hands, and so forth are the same as the four secret consorts. To the wisdom ḍākinīs, I pay homage.
pho brang steng 'og phyogs mtshams thams cad na/ / yid 'ong mchod sprin du mas mchod byed pa'i/ / lha mo bcu drug rgyud sde bzhi la sogs/ / bar khyams gang ba'i 'khor la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

In the palace, above, below, and in all the directions, are those who present the pleasing offering clouds: the sixteen goddesses, those of the four classes of tantras, and so on. To the retinue who fill the courtyard spaces, I pay homage.
dur khrod nang bzhugs phyogs skyong zhing skyong klu/ / rnal 'byor pho mo 'dre srin yi dwags dang / / sha za smyo byed 'byung po ro langs sogs/ / mtha' yas phyi 'khor rnams la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Residing in the charnel grounds are the protectors of the directions, field protectors, nāgas, yogins and yoginīs, spirits, rākṣasas, hungry ghosts, piśācas, those causing madness, bhūtas, zombies, and the others. To the infinite outer retinue, I pay homage.
bcom ldan 'khor lo sdom pa 'khor bcas la/ / phyag 'tshal mchod 'bul sdig pa ma lus bshags/ / dge la yi rangs chos 'khor bskor bzhin du/ / mya ngan mi 'da' rtag par bzhugs su gsol/ /

To the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, and retinue, I pay homage, present offerings, and confess my negative actions. I rejoice in virtue and request the turning of the dharma wheel. Please do not pass into nirvāṇa—always remain.

dge ba bla med byang chub chen por bsngo/ / 'dir phyag len ltar smon lam ni/ lha mo tshad ma dam tshig tshad ma dang / / des gsungs tshig kyang mchog tu tshad ma ste/ / bden pa de yis lha mo mchog gis ni/ / bdag la rjes su 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur cig /

I dedicate all virtue to the unsurpassable great awakening. Here, make the aspiration according to the customary procedure. The Goddess is genuine, the samaya is genuine, and the words spoken are supremely genuine. May that truth be the cause for the supreme goddess to accept me.

de nas sgrub mchod kho na'i skabs yin na/ rang nyid kyi dam tshig gso ba dang / lam dus kyi bya ba gtso bo yin pas bdag 'jug len brgyud sde spyi'i phyag len yin pa dang / slob ma gzhug pa'i skabs dang slob dpon rtogs dgongs dman na bdag 'jug rdzogs par ma blangs thabs med yin pas 'og tu slob ma la dbang bskur ba'i skabs ltar 'dor len byed par byas te dbang bskur rdzogs par blang ngo / /

Next, if the occasion is only a sādhanapūjā, since the emphasis is on renewing your own samaya and the activities, [that is, practices] of the path, doing the self-entering and taking [of the abhiṣekas is done as] is the general procedure of the tantras. If the occasion is entering disciples and the ācārya’s realization is weak, there is no way that the self-entering cannot be done in its entirety. Do the giving and receiving according to the occasion of conferring the abhiṣekas on the disciples found below, taking the abhiṣekas in their entirety.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi dbang bskur ba
II. The Main Practice: Conferring the Abhiṣekas
['di] la gnyis/ 'jug pa dang / dngos gzhi'o/ /
This has two parts: (1) entering and (2) the actual practice.
dang po
A. Entering
['di] la phyi nang gnyis las (345)
This has two sections: (1) external and (2) internal. {345}
1. The External Entering
phyi 'jug gi sdom tshig tu sa bcad bcur gsungs pa'i
In the summarizing verses for the external entering, this is taught as ten topical headings.
dang por khrus bya ba ni/
a. Bathing
slob dpon kyis/ ji ltar bltams pa sogs brjod/
The ācārya says: Just as when [the Buddha] was born [the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bathe your body. oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya śrīye hūṃ]
las rdor gyis sgo drung du slob ma rnams la thog mar chu gtsang / de nas las bum gyis khrus bya/
At the door, the vajra assistant gives the disciples pure water first, and then they wash with the activity vase water.
gnyis pa bgegs bskrad pa ni/
b. Expelling Obstructors

slob dpon dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i sprul pa zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa'i sku las skyes pa'i ye shes kyi me dang / thugs ka'i mtshon cha'i char gyis bgegs bskrad par bsams la thun gyis brab cing dril bu drag tu dkrol/

An emanation of the principal one of the maṇḍala, the ācārya, appears with one face and two arms. The wisdom fire from his body and the rain of weapons from his heart expel obstructors. Pelt with consecrated substances, play the ghaṇṭā forcefully, and say:
oM su b+ha ni sogs brjod/
oṃ subha ni…
gsum pa maN+Dal 'bul ba ni/
c. Offering a Maṇḍala
sems bskyed gsal btab/
Clarify the generation of bodhicitta.

da lam skabs su bab pa rigs drug pa rdo rje 'chang yab yum gyi gsang tshig bde mchog mkha' 'gro snyan brgyud ras chung rdo rje grags pa'i lugs kyi smin byed rgyas par bsgrub pa la sta gon gyi rim pa rnams khar sang gi skabs su song zin/ de ring dbang bskur dngos la 'jug pa dang dngos gzhi gnyis las thog mar 'jug pa'i chos rnams zhu ba'i yon du dmigs te zhing khams 'bul bar zhu/

Now the occasion is the extensive practice for maturation in the Rechung Dorje Drakpa tradition of the Saṃvara Ḍākinī Aural Transmission, the secret verses of the sixth family Vajradhara, male and female consorts. The stages of the prelude were completed yesterday. Today will be the two parts for the actual bestowing of the abhiṣekas: entering and the main practice. First, visualize a gift to request the dharma for entering, and offer a pure realm.
zhes maN+Dal rgyas par phyag len ltar 'bul du gzhug /
Thus, have them offer an extensive maṇḍala as is the procedure.
bzhi pa
d. [Dreams]

rmi lam dris nas bzang na spro bskyed dang ngan na sgrib sbyong dgos par gsungs kyang spyi tsam du/ khyed rang rnams la mdang sum rmi lam bzang ngan gang byung rung sgyu ma dang rmi lam gyi chos rnams bden par ma grub pas bzang ngan gang byung yang dga' mi dga'i re dogs kyi rtog pa ma byed cig /

It is taught that, having questioned [the disciples] about their dreams, if they were good, they should feel inspired and if they were bad, they should purify their obscurations. As general [instruction, say the following:] Whatever kind of dream you had last night, be it good or bad, since all the phenomena of illusions and dreams are not real, do not entertain ideas involving hopes or fears, or being pleased or displeased, over the good and bad things that occur.

'dir 'byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sbyin sreg bya bar gsungs pas 'dzom na sku dang thab khung sogs slob dpon mdun du bkod/ ma 'dzom na me snod tsam bzhag / las rdor gyis me long du til nag blugs pa slob ma rnams kyi sngon tu 'grim/ slob dpon gyi thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od 'phros khyed rang rnams la phog pas sdig sgrib thams cad rang rang gi snying gar yi ge kaM nag po'i rnam par 'dus/ de'ang bya phag sbrul gsum gyi rnam par gyur nas kha'i sgo nas thon te mdun gyi til la thim par bsam/

Here, it is taught that a homa of Devouring Vajraḍākinī is to be done. If that can be arranged, set a statue, firepit, and so forth in front of the ācārya. If that cannot be arranged, simply set up a container with fire. The vajra assistant pours black sesame seeds on a mirror and places that in front of the disciples. Light streams forth from the hūṃ in the heart of the ācārya, striking you and causing your negative actions and obscurations to gather in the form of a black letter kaṃ at your heart. That transforms into birds, pigs, and snakes, which exit through your mouth and dissolve into the sesame seeds in front of you. Thus, contemplate.
til snod bzed la/ hag brjod/ de slob dpon mdun du bzhag /
Hold the dish with the sesame seeds [in front of the disciples’ mouths]. Have them say hak. Place that in front of the ācārya.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ {346}

mchod rdzas bdud rtsi'i (346) rang bzhin tu gyur/ mdun du zhi ba'i thab khung zlum zhing dkar ba mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs shing me dkar gsal du 'bar ba'i dbus na za byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro mthing nag rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin cing khro bo'i chas thams cad kyis brgyan pa zhal rab tu gdangs pa las ye shes kyi me 'bar ba la bdud rtsi'i mchod pa 'bul bas mnyes par bsams la/ g.yon pa'i mtheb srin gyis til 'bul zhing /

Those become offering substances of the nature of amṛta. In front is a pacifying firepit, round, white, and complete with all the characteristics. In it a white fire blazes. In the center is dark-blue Devouring Vajraḍākinī, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā, adorned with all the wrathful attributes. From her gaping mouth, wisdom fire blazes. By presenting the amṛta offerings to her, she is pleased. Offer the sesame seeds with your left thumb and ring finger.
oM DA ka kha kha khA hi/ sarba pA paM da ha na b+ha smin ku ru ye swA hA/
oṃ dāka kha kha khāhi / sarvapāpaṃ dahana bhasmina kuruye svāhā
zhes bdun nam nyer gcig tsam brjod la mi dmigs par bzhag /
Recite that seven or twenty-one times, and rest in nonobservation.
las bum gyi chu byin pas phyi nang gi sdig sgrib thams cad dag par mos shig /
Feel that by being given the water of the activity vase, your external and internal negative actions and obscurations are purified.
oM hrIHbi shud+d+ha sarba pA paM nish+tsa saM shod+d+ha ya sarba bi kalpan a pa na ya hU~M phaT/
oṃ hrīḥ viśuddha sarvapāpaṃ niśca saṃśodhaya sarvavikavan apanaya hūṃ phaṭ
slob ma rnams kyi las dang nyon mongs pa byur dang skal pa ngan pa thams cad shan+tiM ku ru swA hA/ zhes brjod/
All the karma, mental afflictions, mishaps, and misfortunes of the disciples, śīntaṃ kuru svāhā.
rmi lam gyi skor 'di bdag 'jug skabs mi dgos so/ /
This section on dreams is not necessary during the self-entering.
lnga pa gsol ba gdab pa ni/
e. Supplication
rdo rje phag mos mgrin 'khyud pa'i/ / dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa ste/ / slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol/ / byang chub chen po'i tshul ston pa'i/ / mgon po chen por bdag 'tshal lo/ /
Great joy, you are my teacher, whose neck is embraced by Vajrayoginī. Ācārya, please consider me. I request the great protector to teach the way to great awakening.
dam tshig de nyid bdag la stsol/ / byang chub sems kyang bdag la stsol/ / sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / skyabs gsum dag kyang bdag la stsol/ /
Bestow on me this samaya. Bestow on me bodhicitta. Bestow on me the three refuges: the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha.
thar pa chen po'i grong mchog tu/ / mgon pos bdag ni gzhug tu gsol/ /
Protector, please enter me into the city of great liberation.
drug pa lha la gsol gdab dang gnang sbyin ni/
f. Supplicating the Deities and Granting Permission
slob dpon gyis dril bu res 'jog tu 'khrol la/
The ācārya plays the ghaṇṭā intermittently and says:
de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas/ / he ru ka yi grong khyer mchog / snying po'i dkyil 'khor 'di ru ni/ / bdag gis slob ma gzhug par bgyi/ zhes brjod/
Into the place of all tathāgatas, the supreme city of the glorious Heruka, this heart maṇḍala, I will enter the disciples.
bdun pa sdom pa bsgrag pa ni/
g. Stating the Vows

khyed rnams snying po'i dkyil 'khor du 'jug cing zhugs nas/ tshe 'dir phyag rgya chen po mchog gi dngos grub thob par 'dod pas spyir so thar byang sems/ khyad par du rig 'dzin sngags kyi sdom pa mtha' dag ma nyams par bsrung dgos/ de ltar rig pa 'dzin pa sngags kyi (347)dam tshig dang sdom pa bsrungs pas/ sdom pa thams cad bsrung bar 'gyur bas sngags sdom bsrung dgos/

Once you have entered the heart maṇḍala and reside there, those of you who wish to attain the supreme siddhi, mahāmudrā, in this life, must, in general, preserve the prātimokṣa and bodhisattva vows without impairment and, in particular, must preserve all the Mantra vidyādhara vows without impairment. {347} By preserving the Mantra vidyādhara samayas and vows, you will preserve all the vows. Therefore, you must preserve the Mantra vows.

de yang rigs lnga'i dam tshig bsrung ba la tshang ste/ phyi nang gi 'byung ba lnga/ phung khams skye mched la sogs te/ chos thams cad rgyal ba rigs lnga'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin la/ dam tshig dang sdom pa thams cad kyang rigs lnga'i dam tshig dang sdom pa'i khongs su 'dus pas/ der bsdus nas bsrung dgos pas srungs shig / ces bsgo/

Furthermore, the complete preservation of the samayas of the five families is that all phenomena—the external and internal five elements, skandhas, dhātus, āyatanas, and so forth—abide as being of the natures of the five families of victorious ones. All samayas and vows are included within the vidyādhara samayas and vows. Therefore, since you must preserve what is included there—guard them. Thus, give that instruction.
brgyad pa sdom pa bzung ba ni/
h. Holding the Vows

sngar so thar byang sems kyi sdom pa ma thob pa thob par byed pa/ thob nas nyams chag byung ba sor chud par byed cing / nyams chag med na gong 'phel du byed pa yin pas/ so thar byang sems kyi sdom pa len snyam pas tshig don mthun pa'i sgo nas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/ /

You are receiving the prātimokṣa and bodhisattva vows that previously you had not received, you are restoring any breaks and impairments that may have arisen once you received those, and you are increasing those if there are no breaks and impairment. Thinking you are taking the prātimokṣa and bodhisattva vows, and will maintain them in harmony with the words and their meaning, repeat the following:
bla ma yi dam gtsor bzhugs pa'i/ / sras bcas sangs rgyas thams cad dang / / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma tshogs kun/ / thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/
Gurus and yidams, present as the principal ones, all buddhas together with your children, and the whole assembly of heroes and yoginīs, please consider me.
che ge mo zhes bgyi ba bdag / bla med byang chub ma thob bar/ / dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/ / sdig pa mi dge so sor bshags/ /
I, (insert your name), starting from this time until attaining unsurpassable awakening, take refuge in the three jewels.
'gro ba'i dge la rjes yi rang / / sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis bzung / / sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs mchog la/ / byang chub bar du bdag skyabs mchi/ /

I confess each and every negative action and unvirtuous deed. I rejoice in the virtuous actions of all beings. Holding the awakening of the buddhas in mind, I take refuge in the buddhas, dharma, and supreme assembly until awakening.
rang gzhan don ni rab sgrub phyir/ / byang chub sems ni bskyed par bgyi/ / byang chub mchog gi sems ni bskyed bgyis nas/ / sems can thams cad bdag gis mgron du gnyer/ /
In order to achieve benefit for myself and others, I arouse bodhicitta. Having aroused the supreme bodhicitta, I invite all beings as my guests.
byang chub spyod mchog yid 'ong spyad par bgyi/ / 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas myur thob shog /
I will practice the supreme pleasing conduct of bodhisattvas. For the sake of beings, may I quickly attain buddhahood.
lan gsum gyis thun mong gi sdom pa dang /
Say that three times [to take] the common vows.
