bla ma yi dam gtsor bzhugs pa'i/ / sras bcas sangs rgyas thams cad dang / / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma tshogs kun/ / thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
Gurus and yidams, present as the principal ones, all buddhas together with your children, and the whole assembly of heroes and yoginīs, please consider me.

che ge mo zhes bgyi ba bdag / dus 'di nyid nas bzung nas ni/ / ji srid byang chub ma thob bar/ / (348) ji ltar dus gsum mgon po rnams/ / byang chub tu ni nges mdzad pa'i/ / byang chub sems ni bla na med/ / dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi/ /

I, (insert your name), starting from this time until reaching awakening, {348} give rise to genuine [bodhicitta], just as the protectors of the three times gave rise to unsurpassable bodhicitta, which definitely brings awakening.
tshul khrims kyi ni bslab pa dang / / dge ba'i chos ni sdud pa dang / / sems can don byed tshul khrims gsum/ / so sor brtan por bzung bar bgyi/ /
I will hold firmly each of the three modes of ethical conduct: training in ethical conduct, gathering virtuous qualities, and benefiting sentient beings.
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / bla na med pa'i dkon mchog gsum/ / sangs rgyas rnal 'byor las skyes pa'i/ / sdom pa deng nas brtan por bzung / /
I will hold firmly, starting now, the vow arising from buddhayoga: those of the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha, the unsurpassable three jewels.
rdo rje rigs mchog chen po la/ / rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya yang / / yang dag nyid du bzung bar bgyi/ / slob dpon dag kyang bzung bar bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme vajra family, I will hold perfectly the vajra, ghaṇṭā, and mudrās and I will hold the ācārya.
rin chen rigs mchog chen po yi/ / dam tshig yid du 'ong ba la/ / nyin re bzhin yang dus drug tu/ / sbyin pa rnam bzhi rtag tu sbyin/ /
For the great, supreme ratna family, I will always perform the four types of generosity six times each day as the samaya that is pleasing to the mind.
byang chub chen po las byung ba'i/ / pad+ma'i rigs chen dag pa la/ / phyi nang gsang ba theg pa gsum/ / dam pa'i chos ni ma lus bzung / /
For the great, pure padma family, arising from great awakening, I will hold the genuine dharma of the three yānas, outer, inner, and secret.
las kyi rigs mchog chen po la/ / sdom pa thams cad ldan par ni/ / yang dag nyid du bzung bar bgyi/ / mchod pa'i las kyang ci nus bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme karma family, I will hold perfectly all the vows. I will perform all possible acts of worship.
byang chub sems ni bla med mchog / dam pa bdag gis bskyed bgyis nas/ / sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir/ / bdag gis sdom pa ma lus bzung / /
Having developed genuine, supreme, unsurpassable bodhicitta, I will hold all the vows for the benefit of all sentient beings.
ma bsgral ba rnams bdag gis bsgral/ / ma grol ba rnams bdag gis dgrol/ / dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung zhing / / sems can mya ngan 'das la 'god/
May I release those who have not been released. May I liberate those who have not been liberated. May I provide relief to those who have no relief. May I establish sentient beings in nirvāṇa.
ces lan gsum gyis sngags sdom gzung /
Repeating that three times, take the Mantra vows.
dgu pa me tog dang gdong g.yog ni
i. Flowers and Blindfold
mtshams sbyor spyi ltar byas/
Make the transition, as is generally done.
A khaM bI ra hU~M/ zhes me tog sbyin/
ā kaṃ vīra hūṃ Give the flowers.
oM tsak+Shu b+han+d+ha ba ra ma Na ye hU~M/ zhes ras yug dmar pos gdong 'ching /
oṃ cakṣu bhandha varamaṇaye hūṃ Tie the red cloths around their faces.
bcu pa byang chub kyi sems gnyis bskyed pa ni/
j. Arousing the Two Bodhicittas

khyed rang rnams lhar gsal ba'i snying gar kun rdzob byang sems kyi ngo bo zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nya gang ba re re bsam/ de'i steng du don dam byang chub sems kyi ngo bo rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa re sgoms shig / slob dpon kyis rdo rje 'phred dang gyen du 'jog bzhin pas (349)

Visualize yourself as the deity. In your heart is a maṇḍala of the full moon, the essence of conventional bodhicitta. Meditate that above that is a white five-pointed vajra, the essence of ultimate bodhicitta. The ācārya places the vajra horizontally and vertically, and says: {349}
oM sarba yo ga tsit+ta ut+pa da yA mi su ra ta sa ma ya s+t+waM hoH sid+d+hi badzra ya thA su khaM/
oṃ sarvayogacitta utpadayāmi surata samayastvaṃ / siddhi vajra yathā sukhaṃ

zhes dang / ngas khyed rnams dpal he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug par bya yis/ yi dam lha yi dam tshig dang / byang chub kyi sems ma dor bar gong 'phel du gyis shig / 'bras bu dam pa sku gnyis thob par 'gyur ro/ /

And: I have brought you into the maṇḍala of the glorious Heruka. You must not abandon the samayas of the yidam deities and bodhicitta and must increase them. You will attain the two sacred kāyas as the result.
gnyis pa
2. The Internal Entering
nang 'jug gi dam tshig bdun tu gsungs pa'i/
It is taught that there are seven samayas related to entering.
dang po dkyil 'khor nang du gzhug pa ni/
a. Entering the Interior of the Maṇḍala

slob dpon dkyil 'khor gtso bo'i sprul pa he ru ka zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa zhig srung 'khor gyi phyi rol du byon te/ khyed rang rnams kyi lag nas khrid de rdzu 'phrul gyis skad cig / 'khor nang du tshud par gyur snyam pa mdzod/

An emanation of the principal one of the maṇḍala, the ācārya, a Heruka with one face and two arms, goes outside the protection cakra. Think that he takes you by the hand and, miraculously, in an instant, leads you inside the cakra [of protection].
dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
gnyis pa phyag 'tshal ba ni/
b. Homage

de ltar slob dpon dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i sprul pa de nyid kyi phyi bzhin phyin pas/ shar sgo'i thad kyi nam mkha' la yar bltas pas rang gi rtsa ba'i bla ma la brgyud pa'i bla ma'i tshogs kyis bskor te bzhugs 'dug pa de la phyag 'tshal snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/ /

Having followed that emanation of the principal one of the maṇḍala, the ācārya, look up into the sky directly above the eastern door. Think that your root guru is seated there surrounded by the assembly of lineage gurus and that you make prostrations while repeating the following:
sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa'i sku/ / yid bzhin nor bu gtsug gi rgyan/ / tshogs kyi slob dpon tshogs kyi mchog / dpal ldan sku la skyabs su mchi/
In the embodiment of all the buddhas, with the crown ornament of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems, the ācārya of the assembly, the supreme one of the assembly, the glorious kāya, I take refuge.
de nas rim bzhin phyin pas lho sgo'i thad du slebs pa de'i nam mkhar bltas pas yi dam 'khor lo sdom pa la rgyud sde bzhi'i lha tshogs kyis bskor te bzhugs 'dug pa la phyag 'tshal snyam pas/

Then proceed sequentially and arrive at the southern door. Looking up into the sky above that, think that the yidam Cakrasaṃvara is seated there surrounded by assemblies of deities of the four classes of tantras and that you make prostrations.
'khor ba'i 'khor lo rgyun gcod cing / / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor mdzad pa/ / bde mchog 'khor lo bde ba'i mchog / dpal ldan sku la skyabs su mchi/ /
In the one who stops the wheel of saṃsāra and turns the wheel of dharma, Cakrasaṃvara, the sublime bliss, the glorious kāya, I take refuge.
de nas nub sgo'i nam mkha' la yum rdo rje phag mo la 'khor rigs bzhi'i mkha' 'gros bskor te bzhugs pa la phyag 'tshal snyam/
Then, think that, in the sky above the western door, the consort Vajravārāhī is seated surrounded by her retinue of ḍākinīs of the four families and that you make prostrations.
sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa'i yum/ / bcom ldan 'das ma rje btsun ma/ / ma gcig rdo rje rnal 'byor ma/ / dpal ldan ma la skyabs su mchi/ /
In the mother who gives birth to all buddhas, the Bhagavatī, Jetsunma, the one mother, Vajrayoginī, the glorious lady, I take refuge. {350}
de nas byang sgo'i thad kyi nam mkha' la (350) bltas pas rdo rje mched lcam thams cad dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i tshul du bzhugs pa la phyag 'tshal snyam pas/
Then, looking up into the sky above the northern door, think that all the vajra brothers and sisters are seated there in the forms of heroes and heroines and make prostrations.
dpa' bo dpa' mo rdo rje yi/ / spyan can chos skyong rdo rje spun/ / ma lus lus pa med pa la/ / phyag 'tshal gus pas skyabs su mchi/
To the heroes and heroines with vajra eyes, vajra siblings who are dharma protectors, to every one, without exception, I prostrate and respectfully take refuge.
gsum pa dam bzhag
c. Establishing the Commitment
['di] la bzhi las/
This has four parts.
phan yon gyi sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/
i. Establishing the Commitment by Referring to the Benefits
rdo rje spyi bor bzhag /
Place a vajra on their heads.

ngas khyed rnams la dkyil 'khor bzang po 'dir dbang zab mo bskur bas tshe 'dir phyag rgya chen po mchog gi dngos grub kyang thob par 'gyur na dngos grub gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos/ de lta bu'i dbang bskur zab mo sbyin par bya yi/ khyed rnams kyis he ru ka'i gsang chen dam pa 'di dbang ma thob pa dang / ma dad pa rnams kyi mdun du smra bar mi bya ste/ sam+bu Ti las/

Since I will bestow upon you the profound abhiṣeka for this excellent maṇḍala, in this life you will attain the supreme siddhi, mahāmudrā. Thus, what need is there to mention other siddhis? Although you will receive this profound abhiṣeka, you must not speak of it to those who have not received this abhiṣeka of the sacred, great secret of Heruka and not speak of it in the presence of those lacking faith. The Sampuṭa says:

khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug chen po dang tshangs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir gsang ba'o/ / zhes gsungs/ gal te smras na bu khyod dam tshig nyams par 'gyur bas/ rdo rje 'dis khyod kyi mgo bo 'gems par 'gyur ro/ / zhes brjod/
Because this is not the province of Viṣṇu, Maheśvara, Brahmā, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, it is secret.[9] If you speak of this child, you will impair your samaya. This vajra will split your head.
gnyis pa nyes dmigs kyi sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/
ii. Establishing the Commitment by Referring to the Disadvantages
he ru ka dpal deng khyod kyi/ / snying la yang dag zhugs par 'gyur/ / gal te tshul 'di smras na ni/ / de ma thag tu dral gyur nas/ /
Today, glorious Heruka has truly entered your heart. If you speak about this state, immediately he will separate and be gone.
rdo rje'i dmyal bar gnas bzhin du/ / mi bzad sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur/ / de bas dam tshig bsrung bar gyis/
Like being in vajra hell, you will experience unimaginable suffering. Thus, you must preserve your samaya.
gsum pa phan yon nyes dmigs gnyis ka'i sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/
iii. Establishing the Commitment by Referring to Both the Benefits and the Disadvantages
las bum gyi sbyor chu blud la/ 'di ni khyod kyi dam tshig chu/ / dam tshig 'das na sreg par byed/ / dam tshig bsrungs na dngos grub ni/ / rdo rje bdud rtsi'i chu 'dis 'grub/ /
Pour a handful of water of the activity vase. This is your samaya water. If you transgress samaya, it will burn. If you preserve samaya, you will achieve siddhi with this water of vajra amṛta.
oM badzra a mr-i ta u da ka sa ma ya hU~M brjod/
oṃ vajra amṛta udaka samaya hūṃ
bzhi pa rdo rje slob dpon bka' gnyan pa'i sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/
iv. Establishing the Commitment by Referring to the Strict Command of the Vajrācārya

deng phyin chad khyed rnams kyi dpal he ru ka de nga yin no/ / ngas ji ltar bsgo ba bzhin sgrub dgos so/ / ma bsgrubs na khyed rnams bka'i chad pa drag po'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir bam (351) spangs par tshe'i dus byas te sems can dmyal ba chen por gnas dgos par 'gyur ro/ / brjod/

From today on, I am your glorious Heruka. Whatever I say to do, you must do that. {351} If you do not, your punishment will be that you will not be able to abandon the pain of terrible suffering and that, when your life ends, you must remain in the great hell of sentient beings.
bzhi pa ye shes pa dbab pa ni/
d. The Descent of the Wisdom Ones
slob ma rnams sgo gsum gyi gnad gcun du gzhug la/ khaN+Da ro he sa bsang / swa b+hA wa sa sbyang /
The disciples should sit with the vital points of their three doors intensified. Cleanse with khaṇḍarohe and purify with svabhāva.

gzung 'dzin gyis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du gyur/ stong pa'i ngang las sa phyogs dag pa'i zhing khams gnas khang thar pa chen po'i gzhal med khang gi dbus su khyed rang rnams gang du gnas pa'i go sar pa~M las pad+ma ra~M las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor/ de'i steng du 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan bsgyel ba'i gdan la khyed rang rnams kyi sems nyid hU~M mthing nag las rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa hU~M gis mtshan pa de las 'od 'phros/ 'phags pa mchod/ sems can gyi don byas tshur 'dus yongs su gyur pa las

All phenomena involving percepts and perceivers become empty. Within emptiness, this place is a pure realm, and the building is a palace of great liberation. In the center of that, wherever you are seated, from paṃ, is a lotus, and, from raṃ, a sun maṇḍala. Above that are the seats of prone Bhairava and Kālarātri. On that is your own mind as a dark-blue hūṃ, which becomes a blue five-pointed vajra marked by hūṃ. From that, light radiates, making offerings to the noble ones and benefiting sentient beings. It gathers back and the vajra transforms.
khyed rang rnams bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo sdom pa sogs kyi mngon rtogs sgrub thabs ltar la/ ye shes kyi me 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs pa'o/ /
You are the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara,… Recite the method of realization, [the visualization,] according to the sādhana. …reside in the midst of a raging fire of wisdom.[*9]
yab kyi thugs kar oM ha las rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po sogs nas/ gdan la bzhugs pa'o/ /
At the heart of the male consort, from oṃ ha, is white Vajrasattva…with their right legs extended and their left slightly bent.[*10]
yum gyi lte bar oM ba~M sogs nas/ pad nyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/ / bar dang /
At the navels of all the yoginīs, Vajravārāhī and the others, are oṃ vaṃs…with their right legs bent and their left extended.[*11]
de'i spyi bor oM dkar po/ mgrin par AHdmar po/ thugs kar hU~M sngon pos mtshan par gsal bar mos la gsol 'debs rjes zlos/
Imagining that their heads are marked with white oṃs, their throats with red āḥs, and their hearts with blue hūṃs, repeat the following supplication:
bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis/ bdag la dpal he ru ka dbab par mdzad du gsol/
Guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala, bring the glorious Heruka down into me.
lan gsum/ des na dmigs pa 'di bzhin mdzod cig /
Say that three times. Next do this visualization:

slob dpon gyi thugs ka'i hU~M dang / khyed rang rnams yi dam du gsal ba'i stong ra'i nang rtsa dbu ma pad+ma sngon po 'dab brgyad dang / khams dmar po nyi ma dkar po zla ba'i gdan gyi steng du rang 'dra'i ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' he ru ka tshon gang tsam gsal la dod pa mgar ba'i sol me las thon pa'i lcags bsregs lta bu las 'od zer phyogs bcur 'phros pas/ phyogs bcu'i bla ma yi dam sangs (352) rgyas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rang 'dra'i sku dang yig 'bru phyag mtshan me'i rang bzhin 'od rab tu 'bar ba'i rnam par spyan drangs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gtso bo las kyang rang 'dra dpag tu med pa 'phros/ tsheg sgra 'ur sgra bcas/ snying ga'i he ru ka'i lus la thim pas he ru ka mer 'bar ba drag tu 'bar zhing rang lus mer 'bar bas mi bzod pa'i bde ba rgyas par gyur/ par bsams la
sha chen dang gu gul gyi dud pa btang / rol mo drag tu 'khrol zhing rig pa hur phyungs la/
Circulate smoke of great flesh and guggula, play music forcefully, intensify your awareness, and say:
oM shrI he he ru ru kaM badzra dz+nyA na A we sha ya A we sha ya dza/ dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
oṃ śrī he herurukaṃ vajra jñāna āveśaya āveśaya jaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
zhes lan mang du brjod/
Say that many times.
sku gsung thugs kyi ye shes dbab pa'i rtags lus ngag yid la ji ltar 'char na so sor ngo sprad/ gang ltar brtan par bya ba'i phyir spyi bor rdo rje rgya gram du bzhag la/

If the signs of the descent of the wisdom ones of body, speech, or mind arise in some way for the [disciples’] body, speech, and mind, identify each one individually. In any case, to stabilize, place crossed vajras on their heads.
oM shrI dz+nyA na he ru ka su pra tiSh+Tha badzrA ya swA hA/
oṃ śrījñāna heruka supratiṣṭha vajrāya svāhā
lnga pa phrin las brtag cing /
e. Examining Activity

khyed rang rnams mig dar dang bcas pa'i mig gis dkyil 'khor gyi steng gi nam mkha' la kha dog ci 'drar mthong ba ltos shig / ces pa ltar gzhug / kha dog ji snang dris pas mthong tshul smra/ kha dog dkar por mthong na zhi ba/ ser pos rgyas pa/ dmar pos dbang / ljang gus drag po/ kha dog sna tshogs kyis las sna tshogs 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no/ /

With your eyes covered by your blindfold, look into the sky above the maṇḍala and notice what color you see. Have them look. Ask them what colors appear and to describe what they see. If you see white, you will achieve pacifying activity; if you see yellow, enriching; if you see red, magnetizing; if you see green, wrathful; and if you see various colors, you will achieve various kinds of activities.
de nas me tog dbang thob myong ba rnams rang rang gi lhag pa'i lha la 'bul/ ma thob pa rnams dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo la dmigs te 'bul ba ni/
Next, those who have received an abhiṣeka flower should offer it to their special deity. Those who have not received that should focus on the principal one of the maṇḍala and offer.
oM puSh+pe ma la pra tIts+tsha hoH zhes ltos med du 'dor du gzhug /
oṃ puṣpe māla pratīccha Have them throw it without looking.
khyed rang rnams kyi me tog phog pa'i lha de las mar me gcig las gnyis mched kyi tshul du bye ste khyed rang rnams kyi spyi bor thim pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that the deity upon whom your flower fell replicates and dissolves into the top of your head, like one candle flame becoming a second one.
oM puSh+pe mA la sa ma ya hU~M/ zhes brjod cing me tog spyi bor bcing /
oṃ puṣpe māla samaya hūṃ Tie flowers to their head.
drug pa mig dbye ba ni/
f. Opening the Eyes
'byed pa'i phyag rgya dang bcas/
With the mudrā of opening, say:

slob dpon gyis ma rig pa'i 'thib po bsal byung snyam pa'i mos pa mdzod/ he ru ka dpal deng khyod kyi/ / mig 'byed par ni brtson par mdzad/ / rdo rje'i mig ni bla na med/ / phye bas ye shes mthong (353)bar 'gyur/
Feel that the ācārya removes the darkness of your ignorance. Today the glorious Heruka has strived to open your eyes. Vajra eyes are unsurpassable: {353} once open, they will see wisdom.
oM badzra nai tra a pa ha ra pa Ta laM hrIHtrAM/ brjod/
oṃ vajra naitra apahara paṭa laṃ hrīḥ trāṃ
bdun pa dkyil 'khor bstan pa ni/
g. Revealing the Maṇḍala
slob dpon gyis/
The ācārya says:
thar pa chen po'i grong khyer mchog / ltos shig ltos shig sems dpa' che/ / dkyil 'khor bzang po 'di la ltos/ / me tog gang du lhung gyur pa/ / de ni khyod kyi lhag pa'i lha/ /
Look, look, great sattva at the supreme city of great liberation. Look at this excellent maṇḍala. Upon whomever your flower fell, they are your special deity.

de la dad pa rab tu bskyed/ / sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlabs/ / bskal pa bye ba du ma ru/ / sngon du sdig pa byas pa gang / / dkyil 'khor 'di 'dra mthong ma thag / de dag zad par 'gyur yin na/ /

Arouse great faith in them. You are blessed by mantras and mudrās. Even evil acts previously committed throughout many millions of eons, will be expunged immediately when a maṇḍala such as this is seen.
grags pa mtha' yas sngags brjod pa'i/ / tshul la gnas na smos ci dgos/ / skyob pa'i gsang sngags bzlas na ni/ / go 'phang bla na med par 'gyur/ /
What need is there to mention abiding in the way of mantra recitation, whose fame is infinite. Those who recite the secret mantra of refuge achieve the highest state.
bdag nyid chen po khyed rnams kyis/ / rnyed pa mnyam med de ring rnyed/ / de phyir khyed rnams skal ldan 'gyur/ / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rigs skyes/ /
Today, you, great beings, have made this unequaled discovery. Thus, you have become one of good fortune. You have been born in the family of heroes and yoginīs.
dam tshig mchog la gnas par gyis/
Abide in the supreme samaya.

nus na srung 'khor nas gtso bo'i bar mngon rtogs ltar rgyas par brjod/ mi nas na/ bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo sdom pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor rten dang brten par bcas pa mngon sum bzhin du mthong bar gyur/ zhes pa rnams brjod do/ /

If you can, recite the extensive form from the protection cakra through the principal one, according to the method of realization, [the visualization]. If you cannot, say: Behold, as if you are seeing them directly, the sixty-two-fold maṇḍala of the glorious Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, support and supported.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi dbang bskur ba
B. The Actual Practice: The Bestowal of the Abhiṣekas
['di] la/ bum pa/ gsang ba/ sher ye/ tshig dbang bzhi las/
This has four parts: (1) the vase abhiṣeka, (2) the secret abhiṣeka, (3) the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka, and (4) the word abhiṣeka.
dang po bum dbang ni/
1. The Vase Abhiṣeka
dngos gzhi'i dbang bskur ba'i thog mar bum dbang zhu ba'i yon du maN+Dal phul/ zhes mtshams sbyar la/
To begin the bestowal of the abhiṣekas, the main practice, offer a maṇḍala as a gift for requesting the vase abhiṣeka. Having said that as the introduction, say:
phyi snang ba sna tshogs kyi maN+Dal la/ / nang du ma ro gcig gi chag chag btab/ / rang gsal 'dzin med kyi me tog bkod/ / pha bla ma rnams kyi sku la 'bul/ /

Externally, on the maṇḍala of various appearances, internally, I sprinkle the water of the one taste of the many and arrange the flowers of reflexive clarity free from clinging. I offer this to the bodies of the father gurus.
sku la phul ba'i bsod nams kyis/ / bdag gzhan lus kyi sgrib pa dag gyur cig / bdag gzhan lus la yon tan rdzogs pa dang / / bdag gzhan lus kyis 'gro don 'grub par shog /

Through the merit of offering to their bodies, may the obscurations of the bodies of myself and others be purified. May I and others perfect the excellent qualities related to our bodies, and may I and others benefit beings through our bodies.
ces maN+Dal sngon du 'gro bas/ mkhyen brtse ye shes lnga yi bdag / 'gro ba'i ded dpon bla ma mchog / bcom ldan he ru (354)ka dpal gyis/ / bdag la bum dbang bskur du gsol/
Thus, the maṇḍala goes first. Lord of knowledge, kindness, and the five wisdoms, captain of beings, supreme guru, {354} Bhagavān, glorious Heruka, please bestow the vase abhiṣeka upon me.
zhes gsol ba gdab/
Thus, supplicate.
bum dbang gi sdom la bcu gcig tu gsungs pa'i
The summary for the vase abhiṣeka teaches that there are eleven [sections].[10]
dang por mi bskyod pa chu'i dbang ni/
a. The Water Abhiṣeka of Akṣobhya
las bum gyi chu 'thor la/ oM khaN+Da ro hi sa bsang / swa b+hA wa sa sbyang /
Sprinkle water from the activity vase. Cleanse with oṃ khaṇḍarohi and purify with svabhāva.

slob ma rnams mi dmigs te stong pa nyid du gyur/ stong pa'i ngang las pa~M las pad+ma ra~M las nyi ma ba~M las ro'i gdan gyi steng du hU~M las rdo rje sngon po hU~M gis mtshan pa las 'od 'phros 'phags pa mchod/ sems can gyi don byas tshur 'dus yongs su gyur pa las mi bskyod 'khor lo sdom pa sku mdog sngon po zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis kyi g.yas pa drug gis rdo rje dang / g.yon pa drug gis des yu ba byas pa'i dril bu 'dzin pa'i dang po gnyis kyis yum mA ma kI sngon mo gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa la 'khyud pa/ zhabs gnyis g.yas brkyang zhing g.yon bskum pa'i rol stabs kyis bzhugs pa/ rgyan dang cha lugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa gar dgu'i nyams dang ldan par gyur/

The disciples become unobservable: emptiness. Within emptiness, from paṃs, appear lotuses; from raṃs, suns; and from vaṃs, corpse seats. Above those, from hūṃs, are blue vajras marked by hūṃs. From those, light radiates, making offerings to the noble ones and benefiting sentient beings. It gathers back and the vajras transform into Akṣobhya Cakrasaṃvaras, who are blue with four faces and twelve hands. Their six right hands hold vajras, and their six left hands hold ghaṇṭās with handles. The first two embrace their consorts, Māmakīs, who are blue and hold hooked knives and skull cups. With two legs, they stand in the playful posture with their right extended and their left bent. They are complete with all the ornaments and attributes and have the nine moods of the dramatic arts.
de'i spyi bor oM dkar po mgrin par AHdmar po thugs kar hU~M sngon pos mtshan par gyur/ thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od zer 'phros rang 'dra'i ye shes pa spyan drangs/
Their heads are marked by white oṃs; their throats, by red āḥs; and their hearts, by blue hūṃs. Light rays radiating from the hūṃs at their hearts invoke the wisdom ones like themselves.
badzra sa mA dza/ dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
vajra samājaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab pa ni/
The supplication for the bestowal of the abhiṣeka.
bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis bdag la mngon par dbang bskur du gsol/
Guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala, please actually bestow the abhiṣeka upon me.

zhes gsol ba btab pas dbang yul gyi dkyil 'khor gtso bo de bzhin gshegs pa yab rnams kyis dbang bskur ba'i dgongs pa mdzad/ yum rnams kyis bum pa la sogs rdzas so sos dbang bskur/ mchod pa'i lha dang lha mo rnams kyis bkra shis pa'i glu dbyangs brjod cing mchod/ las dbang gi khro bo khro mo rnams kyis bgegs skrod pa'i las mdzad pa dang / bum pa'i chus spyi bo nas dbang bskur bar gyur bar bsams la/

Having supplicated, the tathāgatas, the principal ones of the maṇḍala of the abhiṣeka objects, direct their attention to bestowing the abhiṣeka. The female consorts confer the abhiṣekas with their respective implements, vases and so on. The offering gods and goddesses offer and sing songs of auspiciousness. The krodhas and krodhīs, the faculties of actions, perform the activity of dispelling the obstructors. The vase water on your head confers the abhiṣeka. Thus, contemplate.
rnam rgyal bum pa lag tu thogs te/
Holding the victory vase in your hand, say:
he ru ka dpal 'khor bcas kyi/ / sku gsung thugs las byung ba yi/ / sgrib gnyis bag chags (355)sbyong byed pa'i/ / rdo rje'i dbang bskur chen po sbyin/ /
You are given the great vajra abhiṣeka that arises from the body, speech, and mind of the glorious Heruka and retinue, {355} purifying the latent tendencies of the two obscurations.
oM badzra u da ka a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ vajra udaka abhiṣiñca hūṃ

bum pa spyi bor bzhag cing bum chu myong / zhes gsung zhing bum pa'i chus spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas sgo gsum gyi dri ma thams cad dag / lus thams cad bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis gang ste spyi bor 'khyil ba las mi bskyod pas dbur brgyan par gyur/ /

Place the vase on their heads, and have them drink the vase water. Having said that, and by conferring the abhiṣeka on your head with the vase water, the stains of your three doors are purified. Your body is filled with the stream of amṛta. It swirls to the top of your head, and you are crowned by Akṣobhya.
de la mchod pa ni/
The offerings to them.
mchod yon bogs btegs la/
Hold up[11] the offerings and so forth, and say:
oM badzra Ar+g+haM nas shab+da pra tIts+tsha swA hA'i bar brjod/
oṃ vajra arghaṃ…śabda pratīccha svāhā

des mi bskyod pa chu'i dbang thob/ rnam shes kyi phung po dang nyon mongs pa zhe sdang gi dri ma dag / mi bskyod pa'i bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / / me long lta bu'i ye shes thob pa'i skal pa can du byas pa yin no/ / zhes rtogs pa brjod/

Through that you receive the water abhiṣeka of Akṣobhya. Your skandhas of consciousnesses and the stains of your mental afflictions of aggression are purified. You are empowered to meditate on the generation process of Akṣobhya. You have become a fortunate one who will achieve the mirrorlike wisdom. That describes the realization.
gnyis pa rin 'byung dbu rgyan gyi dbang ni/
b. The Crown Abhiṣeka of Ratnasambhava
slob ma dang dbang rdzas dbu rgyan gnyis ka bsang sbyang / slob ma dang dbang rdzas gnyis ka mi dmigs te stong pa nyid du gyur/
Purify and cleanse both the disciples and the abhiṣeka implement, the crown. The disciples and the abhiṣeka implement become unobservable: emptiness.

stong pa'i ngang las pa~M pa~M las pad+ma/ ra~M ra~M las nyi ma/ ba~M ba~M las ro'i gdan gyi steng du/ trA~M trA~M las rin po che ser po trA~M gyis mtshan pa las 'od 'phros 'phags pa mchod/ sems can gyi don byas tshur 'dus yongs su gyur pa las rin 'byung 'khor lo sdom pa sku mdog ser po zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis kyi g.yas pa drug gis rin po che dang / g.yon pa drug gis des yu ba byas pa'i dril bu 'dzin pa'i dang po gnyis kyis yum rin chen sgrol ma ser mo gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa la 'khyud pa/ zhabs gnyis sogs gong bzhin la/

Within emptiness, from paṃ paṃ, appear lotuses; from raṃ raṃ, suns; and from vaṃ vaṃ, corpse seats. Above those seats, from trāṃ trāṃ, are yellow jewels marked by trāṃs. From those, light radiates, making offerings to the noble ones and benefiting sentient beings. It gathers back and the jewels transform into Ratnasambhava Cakrasaṃvaras, who are yellow with four faces and twelve hands. Their six right hands hold jewels, and their six left hands hold ghaṇṭās with handles. The first two embrace their consorts, Ratnatārās, who are yellow and hold hooked knives and skull cups. With two legs,…[*12]
hU~M las 'od 'phros dkyil 'khor gtso bo'i thugs ka nas rang 'dra'i ye shes pa dang phyogs pa'i mchod 'os thams cad rin 'byung 'khor lo sdom pa'i rnam par
Light rays radiating from the hūṃs at their hearts invoke wisdom ones like themselves and all that is worthy of worship in the ten directions in the form of Ratnasambhava Cakrasaṃvaras.
badzra sa mA dzaH dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
vajra samājaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
dbang rdzas la dbang bskur ba ni/
The bestowal of the abhiṣeka on the abhiṣeka implement.
dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis/ / 'di la mngon par dbang bskur du gsol/ /
Assembled deities of the maṇḍala, please actually bestow the abhiṣeka upon this.
zhes gsol ba btab pas dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyis dbang rdzas la dbang bskur bar mos la/
Having supplicated, feel that those of the maṇḍala confer the abhiṣeka on the abhiṣeka implement.
oM badzrI b+ha wa a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ (356)
oṃ vajrībhava abhiṣiñca hūṃ {356}
rnam rgyal bum chu 'thor/
Sprinkle victory vase water.

zhes gsungs shing dbang rdzas kyi lha la dbang bskur bas sgo gsum gyi dri ma thams cad dag / lus thams cad bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis gang ste spyi bor 'khyil pa rin chen 'byung ldan du gyur/ Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/

Having said that and by conferring the abhiṣeka on the deities of the abhiṣeka implements, the stains of their three doors are purified. Their bodies are filled with the stream of amṛta. It swirls to the top of their heads, and they are crowned by Ratnasambhava. Offer with arghaṃ and so forth.

dbang rdzas kyi rin 'byung yab yum snyoms par zhugs 'od du zhu ba las rin po che'i cod pan du gyur/ yang slob mas gsol ba gdab pa ni/ bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis bdag la mngon par dbang bskur du gsol/ ces brjod/ dbu rgyan spyi bor bcings la/

The Ratnasambhava male and female consorts in union who are the abhiṣeka implements melt into light, which becomes the jeweled crown. Again, the disciples supplicate. Guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala, please actually bestow the abhiṣeka upon me. Tie the crown to their heads.
sangs rgyas kun gyi dbu rgyan dbang / / de ring khyod la bskur bar bya/ / sangs rgyas mchog tu bsgrub pa'i phyir/ / dbu rgyan 'di yis mdzes par byos/ /
The crown abhiṣeka of all buddhas, I confer upon you today. In order to become a supreme buddha, be beautified by this crown.
oM rat+na mu ku Ta a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ he ru ka dpal sogs/ rnam bum chu 'thor la/
oṃ ratna mukuṭa abhiṣiñca hūṃ You are given…[*13] Sprinkle victory vase water.
oM badzrI b+ha ba a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ zhes sogs gong ltar brjod/ spyi bor 'khyil ba las rin chen 'byung ldan gyis dbur brgyan/ Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/
oṃ vajrībhava abhiṣiñca hūṃ… Continue as above up to: It swirls to the top of your head, and you are crowned by Ratnasambhava. Offer with arghaṃ and so forth.

des rin chen 'byung ldan cod pan gyi dbang thob/ tshor ba'i phung po dang nyon mongs pa nga rgyal gyi dri ma dag / rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sku bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu mnyam nyid ye shes mngon du 'gyur ba'i skal pa can du byas pa yin no/ /

Through that you receive the crown abhiṣeka of Ratnasambhava. Your skandhas of feelings and the stains of your mental afflictions of pride are purified. You are empowered to meditate on the body of Ratnasambhava. You have become a fortunate one who will achieve the wisdom of equality as the result.
gsum pa 'od dpag med rdo rje'i dbang ni/
c. The Vajra Abhiṣeka of Amitabhā
slob ma dang rdo rje bsang sbyang / slob ma dang dbang rdzas rdo rje gnyis ka mi dmigs te sogs gong dbu rgyan skabs ltar la/
Purify and cleanse the disciples and the vajra. The disciples and the vajra, the abhiṣeka implement, become unobservable:… Recite as above in the section for the crown.

gdan gyi steng du hrIHhrIHlas pad+ma dmar po hrIHsa mtshan pa las sogs/ 'od dpag med 'khor lo sdom pa sku mdog dmar po zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis kyi g.yas pa drug gis pad+ma dang / g.yon pa drug gis des yu ba byas pa'i dril bu 'dzin pa'i dang po gnyis kyis yum gos dkar mo dmar mo gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa la 'khyud pa sogs/ hU~M las 'od 'phros dkyil 'khor gtso bo'i thugs ka nas rang 'dra'i ye shes pa dang phyogs bcu'i mchod 'os thams cad 'od dpag med 'khor lo sdom pa'i rnam par

Above those seats, from hrīḥ hrīḥ, are red lotuses marked by hrīḥs…. Amitābha Cakrasaṃvaras, who are red with four faces and twelve hands. Their six right hands hold lotuses, and their six left hands hold ghaṇṭās with handles. The first two embrace their consorts, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, who are red and hold hooked knives and skull cups… Light rays radiating from the hūṃs at their hearts invoke wisdom ones like themselves and all that is worthy of worship in the ten directions in the form of Amitābha Cakrasaṃvaras.
badzra sa mA dzaH dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
vajra samājaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ {357}
dbang (357) rdzas la dbang bskur ba ni/
The bestowal of the abhiṣeka on the abhiṣeka implement.
dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis sogs gong ltar/
Assembled deities of the maṇḍala,… As above.
'khyil ba 'od dpag med du gyur nas dbu brgyan par/ gong ltar mchod/
…It swirls to the top of their heads, and they are crowned by Amitābha. Offer as above.
'od dpag med yab yum snyoms par zhugs 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i dbang rdzas rdo rjer gyur par bsam/ yang slob mas/
The Amitābha male and female consorts in union melt into light, which become the vajra, the abhiṣeka implement. Again, the disciples supplicate:

bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad= gsol btab rjes zlos bya/ slob dpon gyis/ sangs rgyas kun gyi rdo rje'i dbang / / de ring khyod la bskur bar bya/ / sangs rgyas kun tu rab bsgrub phyir/ / rdo rje 'di ni khyod kyis zungs/ /

Guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala,… Have them repeat that supplication. The ācārya says: The vajra abhiṣeka of all buddhas, I confer upon you today. In order to become a supreme buddha, hold this vajra.
oM ma hA badzra a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ mahāvajra abhiṣiñca hūṃ
he ru ka dpal sogs gong bzhin dang /
You are given… As above.
'od dpag med kyis dbur brgyan/ Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/
…crowned by Amitābha. Offer with arghaṃ and so forth.

des 'od dpag med rdo rje'i dbang thob/ 'du shes kyi phung po dang nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dag / 'od dpag med kyi bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / / 'bras bu so sor rtog pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa'i skal pa can du byas pa yin no/ /

Through that you receive the vajra abhiṣeka of Amitābha. Your skandhas of perceptions and the stains of your mental afflictions of desire are purified. You are empowered to meditate on the generation process of Amitābha. You have become a fortunate one who will achieve the discriminating wisdom as the result.
bzhi pa don grub dril bu'i dbang ni/
d. The Ghaṇṭā Abhiṣeka of Amoghasiddhi

slob ma dang dbang rdzas dril bu gnyis ka mi dmigs te sogs nas/ gdan kyi steng du a a las ral gri ljang gu as mtshan pa las sogs/ don grub 'khor lo sdom pa sku mdog ljang gu zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis kyi g.yas pa drug gis ral gri dang / g.yon pa drug gis des yu ba byas pa'i dril bu 'dzin pa'i dang po gnyis kyis yum dam tshig sgrol ma ljang gu sogs/ mchod 'os thams cad don grub 'khor lo sdom pa'i rnam par

Purify and cleanse the disciples and the vajra. The disciples and the ghaṇṭā, the abhiṣeka implement, become unobservable:… Above those seats, from a a, are green swords marked by a’s… Amoghasiddhi Cakrasaṃvaras, who are red with four faces and twelve hands. Their six right hands hold swords, and their six left hands hold ghaṇṭās with handles. The first two embrace their consorts, Samayatārās, who are green…all that is worthy of worship in the ten directions in the form of Amoghasiddhi Cakrasaṃvaras.
badzra sa mA dzaH dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
vajra samājaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
dbang rdzas la dbang bskur/
The bestowal of the abhiṣeka on the abhiṣeka implement.
'khyil ba don grub tu gyur nas dbu brgyan par gyur/ gong ltar mchod/
…It swirls to the top of their head, and they are crowned by Amoghasiddhi. Offer as above.
don grub yab yum snyoms par zhugs/ 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i dbang rdzas dril bur gyur/ slob mas/
The Amoghasiddhi male and female consorts in union melt into light, which become the ghaṇṭā, the abhiṣeka implement. The disciples supplicate:
bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs sogs/ 'di de sangs rgyas thams cad kyi/ / shes rab dbyangs kyi rjes 'gror bshad/ / byang chub mchog tu rgyal bas bzhed/ / khyod kyis kyang ni rtag tu zungs/ /
Guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala,… This expresses what accompanies the prajñā melodies of all buddhas. The victors call it sublime awakening. You must always hold this.
oM ma hA g+hAN+De a (358) b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ mahāghāṇḍe abhiṣiñca hūṃ {358}
he ru ka dpal sogs dbang bskur/
You are given… Bestow the abhiṣeka.
don yod grub pas dbur brgyan par gyur/ Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/
…crowned by Amoghasiddhi. Offer with arghaṃ and so forth.

des don yod grub pa dril bu'i dbang thob/ 'du byed kyi phung po dang nyon mongs pa phrag dog dag / don yod grub pa'i bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu bya ba grub pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa'i skal pa can du byas pa yin no/ /

Through that you receive the ghaṇṭā abhiṣeka of Amoghasiddhi. Your skandhas of mental formations and the stains of your mental afflictions of jealousy are purified. You are empowered to meditate on the generation process of Amoghasiddhi. You have become a fortunate one who will achieve the all-accomplishing wisdom as the result.
lnga pa rnam par snang mdzad ming gi dbang ni/
e. The Name Abhiṣeka of Vairocana

slob ma mi dmigs te stong pa nyid du gyur/ stong pa'i ngang las pa~M las pad+ma ra~M las nyi ma pa~M las ro'i gdan gyi steng du oM las 'khor lo oM gyis mtshan pa las sogs/ rnam snang 'khor lo sdom pa sku mdog dkar po zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis kyi g.yas pa drug gis 'khor lo dang / g.yon pa drug gis des yu ba byas pa'i dril bu 'dzin pa'i dang po gnyis kyis yum sangs rgyas spyan ma sku mdog dkar mo sogs/ rnam snang 'khor lo sdom pa'i rnam par

The disciples become unobservable: emptiness. Within emptiness, from paṃs, appear lotuses; from raṃs, suns; and from vaṃs, corpse seats. Above those, from oṃs, are cakras marked by oṃs…Vairocana Cakrasaṃvaras, who are white with four faces and twelve hands. Their six right hands hold cakras, and their six left hands hold ghaṇṭās with handles. The first two embrace their consorts, Buddhalocanās, who are white…in the form of Vairocana Cakrasaṃvaras.
badzra sa mA dzaH dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
vajra samājaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
yang slob mas/ bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs sogs gsol gdab/
Again, the disciples supplicate: Guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala,…
dkyil 'khor gtso bo'i phyag g.yas spyi bor bzhag cing g.yon mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya dang bcas te/ rdor dril spyi bor bsnol la/
The principal one of the maṇḍala places their right hand on [the disciples’] heads and holds their left hand in the mudrā of fearlessness. Cross the vajra and ghaṇṭā on [the disciples’] heads.
sangs rgyas kun gyi ming gi dbang / / de ring khyod la bskur bar bya/ / sangs rgyas mchog tu rab bsgrub phyir/ / rdo rje'i ming ni khyod kyis zungs/
The name abhiṣeka of all buddhas, I confer upon you today. In order to become a supreme buddha, hold your vajra name.
'dir me tog gang la thog pa'i rigs so so'i ming btags dgos par gsungs kyang spyi tsam du/
Although here it is taught that [the disciples] should be given names of the specific family according to where their flowers fell, it can be done in a general way:
oM shrI he ru ka na maHa d+hi pa ti staM a b+hI Shiny+tsa hU~M
oṃ śrīheruka nāmaḥ adhivatistvaṃ abhiṣiñca hūṃ
mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o/ / he ru ka dpal sogs chu dbang bskur/ rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbur brgyan par gyur/ Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/
You are the tathāgata called Akṣobhyavajra. You are given… Bestow the water abhiṣeka. …crowned by Amoghasiddhi. Offer with arghaṃ and so forth.
de ltar rnam par snang mdzad ming gi dbang thob/ /
Thus, you receive the name abhiṣeka of Vairocana.
gzugs kyi phung po dang nyon mongs pa gti mug dag / rnam par snang mdzad kyi bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes mngon du 'gyur ba'i skal pa can tu byas pa yin no/ /

Your skandhas of forms and the stains of your mental afflictions of bewilderment are purified. You are empowered to meditate on the generation process of Vairocana. You have become a fortunate one who will achieve the wisdom of the dharmadhātu as the result.
drug pa brtul zhugs rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang ni/
f. The Abhiṣeka of Vajrasattva for Discipline
slob ma bsang sbyang / (359)
Cleanse and purify the disciples. {359}

slob ma dang rdo rje gnyis ka mi dmigs te stong pa nyid du gyur/ stong pa'i ngang las pa~M pa~M las pad+ma a a las zla ba'i gdan gyi steng du hU~M hU~M las rdo rje dkar po hU~M gis mtshan pa las sogs/ rdo rje sems dpa' sku mdog dkar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pas yum la 'khyud pa/ zhabs gnyis rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa'i pang na/ yum rdo rje snyems ma dkar mo gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pas yab kyi mgul nas 'khyud cing / zhabs gnyis pad+ma'i skyil krung gis yab kyi sku la 'khril ba/ gnyis ka'ang rus pa dang rin po che'i rgyan du mas mdzes pa/ de'i spyi bor oM dkar po/ mgrin par AHdmar po/ thugs kar hU~M sngon po/ hU~M las 'od 'phros dkyil 'khor gtso bo'i thugs ka nas rang 'dra'i ye shes pa dang / phyogs bcu'i mchod 'os thams cad rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam par

The disciples and the vajra become unobservable: emptiness. Within emptiness, from paṃ paṃ, appear lotuses, and from a a, moons. Above those seats, from hūṃ hūṃ, are white vajras marked by hūṃs…Vajrasattvas, who are white with one face and two hands. Holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā, they embrace their consorts. Their two legs are in the vajra position. In their laps are white Vajragarvās, who, holding hooked knives and skull cups, embrace their consorts around their necks. Their two legs are in the lotus position, wrapped around the body of their consort. Both are beautified by many ornaments of bones and jewels. At their heads are white oṃs, at their throats are red āḥs, and their hearts are blue hūṃs. Light rays radiating from the hūṃs at their hearts invoke, from the hearts of the principal ones of the maṇḍala, wisdom ones like themselves and all that is worthy of worship in the ten directions in the form of Vajrasattvas.
badzra sa mA dzaH dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
vajra samājaḥ / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad= spyi bor 'khyil pa rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum du gyur nas dbu brgyan par gyur/
Assembled deities of the maṇḍala,…It swirls to the top of their heads, and they are crowned by Vajrasattva male and female consorts.
Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/
Offer with arghaṃ and so forth.
dbang rdzas kyi rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum snyoms par zhugs te 'od du zhu ba las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs ye shes las byung ba'i rdo rjer gyur/
The Vajrasattva male and female consorts in union who are the abhiṣeka implements melt into light, which becomes a vajra arising from the wisdom minds of all buddhas.
'di de sangs rgyas thams cad kyi/ / sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo ste/ / rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag na gnas/ / khyod kyis kyang ni rtag tu bzung / /
This is the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas. It abides in the hand of Vajrasattva. You must always hold this.
lag na rdo rje'i brtul zhugs brtan/ /
Stabilize the vajra discipline in your hand.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta sid+d+hi badzra sa ma ya s+t+waM/ e Sha d+ha ra yA mi hi hi hi hi hU~M/
oṃ sarvatathāgata siddhi vajra samayastvaṃ / eṣa dharayāmi hi hi hi hi hūṃ
zhes rdo rje snying gar bcang /
Hold the vajra to their hearts.
zhes sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo rdo rje rtse lnga pa byin pas snying gar rdo rje sems dpa' gsal bar bsam/ Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/
Having been given the five-pointed vajra, the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas, Vajrasattva appears clearly in your heart. Offer with arghaṃ and so forth.

de ltar rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang thob 'khor ba'i rang bzhin myang 'das su rtogs/ dman par 'dzin pa'i dri ma dag / rdo rje sems dpa'i bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / /'bras bu nyon mongs (360) pa lnga ye shes lnga mngon du gyur pa'i skal pa can du byas pa yin no/ /

Thus, you receive the abhiṣeka of Vajrasattva and realize that the nature of saṃsāra is nirvāṇa. Your stains of taking [saṃsāra] to be inferior are purified. You are empowered to meditate on the generation process of Vajrasattva. {360} You have become a fortunate one whose five mental afflictions will manifest as the five wisdoms as the result.
bdun pa mnga' dbul ba
g. The Investiture
['di] la sa bcad bcu gnyis su yod pa'i
There are twelve topical headings.
dang po slob ma lhar bskyed pa ni/
i. Generating the Disciples as Deities
bsang sbyang /
Cleanse and purify.

slob ma mi dmigs te stong pa nyid du gyur/ stong pa'i ngang las pa~M las pad+ma ra~M las nyi ma ba~M las 'jigs byed dus mtshan gyi steng du khyed rang rnams kyi rnam shes hU~M las bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo sdom pa yab yum gyi skur grub cing gsal ba ni sku mdog mthing nag zhal bzhi las zhes pa nas/ yab yum gnyis ka'ang ye shes kyi me 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs par gyur/ bar sgrub thabs ltar dang /

You, the disciples, become unobservable: emptiness. Within emptiness, from paṃ, appears a lotus; from raṃ, a sun; and from vaṃ, Bhairava and Kālarātri. Above those your consciousness is hūṃ, which exists and appears in the form of the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, male and female consorts. You are dark blue with four faces….[*14] Both the male and female consorts reside in the midst of a raging fire of wisdom. Do that according to the sādhana.
bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar oM ha las sogs/ rdo rje phag mo'i lte bar sogs/ spyi bor oM dkar po/ mgrin par AHdmar po/ thugs kar hU~M sngon pos mtshan par gyur/
At the heart of the Bhagavān, from oṃ ha,…[*15] At the navels of Vajravārāhī…[*16] They are marked at their heads with a white oṃs; at their throats, with red āḥs; and their hearts, with blue hūṃs.
spro na ye shes dbab pa gong ltar bya/
If you wish to elaborate, do the descent of the wisdom ones as above.
slob mas gsol ba gdab pa ni/
The supplication by the disciples.
bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis/ bdag la mngon par dbang bskur du gsol/ lan gsum/
Guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala, please actually bestow the abhiṣeka upon me. Three times.
lha tshogs rnams kyis gsung par bsams la/ rnam bum lag tu thogs/
Think that the assembled deities say the following and, holding the victory vase in your hand, say:
he ru ka dpal sogs bum dbang ltar la/ rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum gyis dbur brgyan par gyur/
You are given the great vajra abhiṣeka… Continue according to the vase abhiṣeka up to: …you are crowned by Vajrasattva, male and female consorts.
dang po'i lcang lo'i dbang ni/
ii. The Braided Hair Abhiṣeka[12]
khyed rang rnams yi dam gyi lhar gsal ba de la lcang lo spyi bor bcings pa'i mos pa mdzod/ /
You appear clearly as the yidam deity. Feel that the braided hair is tied to your head.
skra grol nyon mongs grol ba ste/ / mu tig rgyan ldan yid 'phrog pa/ / lcang lo cod pan thor tshugs ni/ / ye shes sgron me'i rgyan du khyer/ /
Free hair is freedom from mental afflictions. What is adorned with pearls captivates the mind. The braided hair, your topknot crown, serves as the ornament of the wisdom lamp.
lcang lo spyi bor bcing tshul bya/ /
Make the motions of tying the braided hair to their heads.
gnyis pa byugs pa'i rtsi gsum gyi dbang ni/
iii. The Abhiṣeka of the Three Anointing Elixirs

khyed rang rnams kyi mkhur rtse gnyis/ / og ma'i rtse sna'i rtse rnams su khrag gi thig le/ lkog ma'i mgo brang rnams la zhag gi zo ris/ 'gram pa gnyis/ rna ltag gnyis dpral ba sogs lus bying la thal chen gyi tshom bu byugs pa'i mos pa mdzod/ / khrag ris dmar po snying rje'i rgyan/ / zhag gi zo ris byams pa'i rgyan/ / thal chen tshom bu stong nyid rgyan/ / snang stong dbyer med rgyan du khyer/ / thal raka zhag gsum (361) byugs/

Feel that drops of blood anoint the high points of your cheekbones and chin and the tip of your nose; that smears of fat anoint your chin and chest; and that piles of great ashes anoint your whole body, both cheeks, the back of both ears, your forehead, and elsewhere. Red lines of blood are the ornaments of compassion. Smears of fat are the ornaments of love. Piles of great ashes are the ornaments of emptiness. Those serve as ornaments of inseparable appearance-emptiness. Anoint them with ashes, rakta, and fat. {361}
gsum pa 'dogs rgyan gsum gyi dbang ni/
iv. The Abhiṣeka of the Three Ornaments to Wear
dbu la mi mgo skam po lnga/ /lus la thod rlon khrag 'dzag pa lnga bcu'i do shal/ yan lag bzhi la sbrul gyi gdu bus brgyan pa'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Feel that on your head are five dried human heads, on your body is a necklace of fifty fresh skulls dripping blood, and that your four limbs are adorned with bracelets of snakes.
rus rgyan sbrul gyi chun po dang / / thod skam lnga yi dbu rgyan dang / / khrag 'dzag lnga bcu'i do shal rnams/ / deng nas khyod kyis rgyan du khyer/ /
Bone ornaments, bunches of snakes, a crown of five dried skulls, and a necklace of fifty, dripping blood, serve as your ornaments starting today.
bzhi pa bgo ba'i gos rnams kyi dbang ni/
v. The Abhiṣeka of the Clothes to Wear
sku stod la glang chen gyi ko rlon/ sku smad la stag lpags kyi sham thabs/ sku sked la zhing chen gyi g.yang gzhis g.yogs pa'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Feel that you have a fresh elephant hide on your upper body, a tiger-skin skirt on your lower body, and a human skin of one meeting the great criteria at your waist.
'dod chags dag pa'i g.yang gzhi dang / / zhe sdang dag pa'i stag sham dang / / gti mug dag pa'i glang lpags te/ / bla med na bza' rgyan du khyer/
The human skin, the purity of desire, the tiger-skin skirt, the purity of aggression, and the elephant hide, the purity of bewilderment, serve as your unsurpassable clothing.
lnga pa gdan gyi dbang ni/
vi. The Abhiṣeka of the Seats
pad+ma nyi ma ro'i gdan rkyang 'og tu bting ba'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Feel that seats of a lotus, sun, and corpse are spread out below.
'jigs rung dur khrod dbus su ni/ / he ru ka yi nyams ldan pas/ / rtog med ro gdan la 'dug ste/ / nyam nga med pa'i spyod pa gyis/
In the middle of a terrifying charnel ground, with the moods of a heruka, sit on the seat of a thought-free corpse: engage in conduct without inhibitions.
drug pa thabs shes phyag rgya'i dbang ni/
vii. The Abhiṣeka of the Mudrās of Method and Prajnā
phyag g.yas su rdo rje dang g.yon du dril bu gtad byung ba'i mos pa mdzod/ /
Feel that you are given a vajra in your right hand and a ghaṇṭā in your left.
rdo rje thabs ldan bde ba ste/ / dril bu shes rab stong pa nyid/ / thabs dang shes rab gnyis med pa'i/ / rdo rje dril bu bzung bar bya/
The vajra is method, bliss. The ghaṇṭā is prajñā, emptiness. Hold the vajra and ghaṇṭā, the nonduality of method and prajñā.
bdun pa gri thod kyi dbang ni/
viii. The Abhiṣeka of the Hooked Knife and Skull Cup
yang gri gug dang thod pa sprad pa thugs ka'i stong 'og tu 'dzin tshul mdzod/ /
Make the motions of holding a hooked knife and skull cup, joining above and below your heart.
g.yas kyi sdig can srog gcod gris/ / bdud bzhi la sogs srog bcad nas/ / g.yon gyi ye shes ka pA lar/ / bdud rtsi lnga la rol par bya/
With the knife that kills evildoers in your right, kill the four māras and the like, and enjoy the five amṛtas in the wisdom kapāla in your left.
brgyad pa ni/
ix. [The Ninth][13]
phyag g.yas la cang te'u dang g.yon gru mor kha T+wAM ga gtad par mos la/
Feel that a changteu is placed in your right hand and a khaṭvāṃga in the crook of your left elbow.
he ru ka dpal kha T+wAM ga / rnal 'byor ma dpal DA ma ru/ / dpa' bo dpa' mo gnyis med pa'i/ / kha T+wAM cang te'u bzung bar bya/
The glorious Heruka is the khaṭvāṃga. The glorious Yoginī is the ḍamaru. Hold the khaṭvāṃga and changteu, the nonduality of the Hero and Heroine.
dgu pa ni/
x. [The Tenth]
thod rnga dang mi rkang gling bu gtad pa 'bud dkrol mdzod cig /
You are given a skull-cup drum and a human kangling and should play and blow those.
thod pa ltag sprod rnga chung dang / / mkha' 'gro 'bod pa'i gling bu 'di/ / dam can spyan 'dren mchod pa dang / / phrin las rnam bzhi sgrub (362) phyir zungs/
Hold the small drum of skull cups joined at their napes and the flute that calls the ḍākinīs in order to invite those with samaya, make offerings, and cultivate the four types of activities. {362}
bcu pa mchod pa ni/
xi. Offerings
mchod pa'i lha mo rnams kyis mchod rdzas du mas khyed rang rnams la mchod pa byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that the offering goddesses present numerous offering substances to you.
oM b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra sam+ba raM wI ra yo gi nI badzra Ar+g+haM nas shab+da 'i bar gyis rol mo dang bcas te mchod/
oṃ bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasamvaraṃ vīra yoginī vajra arghaṃ…śabda… Play music and offer.
bcu gcig pa bstod pa ni/
xii. Praises
mchod pa'i lha mo de dag gis bstod par mos/
Feel that those offering goddesses present praises.
oM/ bcom ldan mgon po sogs rkang brgyad kyis bstod/

oṃ Bhagavān, protector, [great hero, blazing like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs. You are majestic with three eyes, hold a battle-ax, noose, khaṭvāṃga, and spear, and are frightening, draped in a tiger skin. To the one with the great smoky body, subduer of obstructors, I bow.] Offer praises with the eight lines.
brgyad pa dbang don ngo sprad pa ni/
h. Pointing Out the Significance of the Abhiṣeka

de ltar bum pa'i dbang thob pas/ sbyang gzhi lus lha la sbyang bya dman par 'dzin pa'i dri ma sbyangs shing / sbyong byed bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / sbyangs 'bras mchog gi sprul sku thob par 'gyur ro/ / zhes dbang don gyi rtogs pa bskyed/

Having thus received the vase abhiṣeka, your body, the ground for purification, is purified as the deity; and the stains of taking it to be inferior, what are to be purified, are purified. You are empowered to meditate on the generation process, the means of purification. You will achieve the supreme nirmāṇakāya, the result of purification. Thus, arouse the realization of the significance of the abhiṣeka.
gnyis pa gsang dbang
2. The Secret Abhiṣeka
['di] la gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po maN+Dal ni/
a. Maṇḍala
ngag tha snyad sna tshogs kyi maN+Dal la/ / brjod du med pa'i chag chag btab/ / brjod bya mtshon byed kyi me tog bkod/ / pha bla ma rnams kyi gsung la 'bul/ /
On the maṇḍala of various verbal conventions, I sprinkle the water of inexpressibility and arrange the flowers showing what is to be expressed. I offer this to the speech of the father gurus.
gsung la phul ba'i bsod nams kyis/ / bdag gzhan ngag gi sgrib pa byang gyur cig / bdag gzhan ngag la yon tan rdzogs pa dang / / bdag gzhan ngag gis 'gro don 'grub par shog /

Through the merit of offering to their speech, may the obscurations of the speech of myself and others be purified. May I and others perfect the excellent qualities related to our speech, and may I and others benefit beings through our speech.
ces maN+Dal sngon du 'gro bas
Thus, the maṇḍala goes first.
gsol ba gdab pa ni/
The supplication.
he ru ka dpal 'gro ba'i mgon/ / bka' drin mnyam med rje btsun gyis/ / bla med gsang ba'i dbang gis kyang / / bdag cag smin par mdzad du gsol/
Heruka, glorious protector of beings, kind, unequaled Jetsun, please mature us through the unexcelled secret abhiṣeka.
lan gsum/
Three times.
dbang dngos ni/
b. The Actual Abhiṣeka[14]

bla ma dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo yab yum du gsal ba sbyor ba mdzad pa'i sbyor mtshams nas/ byang sems dkar dmar A li kA li'i rnam par nar gyis byon/ khyed rang rnams kyi lce thog tu myangs bas rtsa gsum 'khor lo bzhi la sogs pa'i rtsa sbubs mer gyis gang bas/ lus phyi gsal nang gsal thogs pa med par bsams la/

The guru appears clearly as the principal one of the maṇḍala, male and female consorts in union. From their place of union, white and red bodhicittas in the form of ā li kā li appear in a line. You taste this with your tongue, and the interior of your channels—the three channels, those of the four cakras, and elsewhere—fills with fire. This causes your body to be clear externally and to be clear and unobstructed internally. Thus, contemplate.
bdud rtsi sbyin zhing /
Give the amṛta and say:
'khor lo sdom pa yab yum gyi/ / gsang ba sku yi dkyil 'khor las/ / byung ba'i byang sems dkar dmar gyis/ / skal ldan khyod la dbang bskur ro/ /
The white and red bodhicittas that arise from the maṇḍala of the secret body of the Cakrasaṃvara male and female consorts confers the abhiṣeka upon you, fortunate ones.
oM badzra gu h+ya a b+hI Shany+tsa hU~M/
oṃ vajra guhya abhiṣiñca hūṃ
zhes brjod cing bdud rtsi lce thog tu blang /
Say that and place amṛta on their tongues. {363}
gsum (363) pa dbang don ngo sprad pa ni/
c. Pointing Out the Significance of the Abhiṣeka

de ltar gsang ba'i dbang thob pas/ sbyang gzhi ngag sngags la sbyang bya dman par 'dzin pa'i dri ma sbyangs shing sbyong byed gtum mo bsgom pa la dbang / sbyangs 'bras chos thams cad brag cha ltar stong par rtogs pas chos sku thob par 'gyur ro/ / zhes dbang don gyi rtogs pa bskyed/

Having thus received the secret abhiṣeka, your speech, the ground for purification, is purified as mantra, and the stains of taking it to be inferior, what are to be purified, are purified. You are empowered to meditate on caṇḍālī, the means of purification. By realizing that all phenomena are empty, like echoes, you will achieve the dharmakāya, the result of purification. Thus, arouse the realization of the significance of the abhiṣeka.
gsum pa sher dbang
3. The Prajnājnāna Abhiṣeka
['di] la gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po/
a. [Maṇḍala]
yid rtog pa sna tshogs kyi maN+Dal la/ / spros dang bral ba'i chag chag btab/ / rang byung lhan skyes kyi me tog bkod/ / pha bla ma rnams kyi thugs la 'bul/ /

On the maṇḍala of the various thoughts in the mind, I sprinkle the water of freedom from elaborations and arrange the flowers of the self-arising connate state. I offer this to the minds of the father gurus.
thugs la phul ba'i bsod nams kyis/ / bdag gzhan yid kyi sgrib pa dag gyur cig / bdag gzhan yid la yon tan rdzogs pa dang / / bdag gzhan yid kyis 'gro don 'grub par shog /

Through the merit of offering to their minds, may the obscurations of the minds of myself and others be purified. May I and others perfect the excellent qualities related to our minds, and may I and others benefit beings through our minds.
ces maN+Dal sngon du 'gro bas
Thus, the maṇḍala goes first.
gsol ba gdab pa ni/
The supplication.
zag med bde chen la gnas pa'i/ / bcom ldan he ru ka dpal gyis/ / bde chen lhan skyes dbang gis kyang / / bdag cag smin par mdzad du gsol/ /
Bhagavān, glorious Heruka, who abides in undefiled bliss, please mature us through the abhiṣeka of connate great bliss.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi ni
b. The Actual Abhiṣeka
thog mar don dri ba la/
First, the question about the meaning.
gsang sngags bla med don rig pas/ / zas la dme gtsang med pa dang / / 'khor 'das gnyis su mi rtog pa'i/ / dam tshig bdag gis bsrung nus sam/
By knowing the meaning of the unexcelled Secret Mantra, are you able to preserve the samayas of not regarding any food as unclean and not regarding saṃsāra and nirvāṇa as two separate things?
zhes dris pa'i lan btab pa ni/
The answer to the question.
gsang sngags bla med don rig pas/ / zas la dme gtsang med pa dang / / 'khor 'das gnyis su mi rtog pa'i/ / dam tshig bdag gis bsrung nus so/ /
Knowing the meaning of the unexcelled Secret Mantra, I am able to preserve the samayas of not regarding any food as unclean and not regarding saṃsāra and nirvāṇa as two separate things.
zhes brjod/
And:

bla ma'i thugs ka nas rje btsun ma mar me gcig las gnyis mched kyi tshul du byon te khyed rang rnams la gnang zhing / de dang mnyam par sbyar ba tsam gyis dga' bzhi'i bde bas sems 'od gsal du thim pa'i mos pa dang / thur sel yang cung zad 'then la dga' ba ngos bzung gyis shig / kha T+wAM ga yum du gsal ba lag tu gtad nas/

From the heart of the guru, a Jetsunma comes, like one candle flame becoming a second one, and is given to you. Feel that by simply uniting with her, the bliss of the four joys cause your mind to melt into luminosity. Draw up the downward-expelling wind slightly, and recognize joy. Place the khaṭvāṃga visualized as the female consort in their hand.
srid pa'i 'dod chags spangs nas ni/ / 'khor ba'i mtsho las sgrol ba'i thabs/ / zag med dga' bzhi'i dpal skyed pa'i/ / ye shes lha mo 'di bzhes shig /
Having cast aside the desires of existence, as a method for being freed from the ocean of saṃsāra, take this wisdom goddess who arouses the glory of the undefiled four joys. {364}
oM ma hA dz+wa la pra dz+nyA (364)dz+nyA na a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ mahāsukha[15] prajñājñāna abhiṣiñca hūṃ
de dang snyoms par zhugs pas dga' ba bzhi'i ye shes mngon du byas par bsams la kha T+wAM ga'am rig tsag bzung ngo / /
By joining in union, you actualize the wisdom of the four joys. Have them hold the icon of a khaṭvāṃga or vidyā.
gsum pa dbang don ngo sprad pa ni/
c. Pointing Out the Significance of the Abhiṣeka

de ltar shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob pas/ sbyang gzhi sems kyi 'char sgo snang stong zung 'jug la/ sbyang bya tha dad gnyis su 'dzin pa'i dri ma sbyangs shing sbyong byed pho nya bsgom pa la dbang / sbyangs 'bras zung 'jug longs sku thob par 'gyur ro/ / zhes dbang don gyi rtogs pa bskyed/

Having thus received the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka, the manifestations of your mind, the ground for purification, are purified as the unification of appearances and emptiness; and the stains of taking those to be two separate things, what are to be purified, are purified. You are empowered to meditate with emissaries, the means of purification. You will achieve the saṃbhogakāya, unification, the result of purification. Thus, arouse the realization of the significance of the abhiṣeka.
bzhi pa tshig dbang
4. The Word Abhiṣeka
['di] la gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po/
a. [Maṇḍala]
sgo gsum rnam dag gi maN+Dal la/ / blo dang bral ba'i chag chag btab/ / sku gsum lhun grub kyi me tog bkod/ / pha bla ma rnams kyi sku gsung thugs la 'dul/ /

On the maṇḍala of the purity of the three doors, I sprinkle the water of freedom from the intellect and arrange the flowers of the innately present three kāyas. I offer this to the bodies, speech, and minds of the father gurus.

sku gsung thugs la phul ba'i bsod nams kyis/ / bdag gzhan lus ngag yid gsum sgrib pa byang gyur cig / bdag gzhan lus ngag yid la yon tan rdzogs pa dang / / bdag gzhan lus ngag yid kyis 'gro don 'grub par shog /

Through the merit of offering to their bodies, speech, and minds, may the obscurations of the bodies, speech, and minds of ourselves and others be purified. May I and others perfect the excellent qualities related to our bodies, speech, and minds, and may I and others benefit beings through our bodies, speech, and minds.
ces maN+Dal sngon du 'gro bas
Thus, the maṇḍala goes first.
gsol ba gdab pa ni/
The supplication.
byang chub rdo rje sangs rgyas la/ / mchod sbyin ji ltar stsal ba ltar/ / bdag kyang bskyab pa'i don slad du/ / nam mkha'i rdo rje deng bdag stsol/ lan gsum/
Just as Bodhivajra made generous offerings to the Buddha, for the sake of protecting me, please grant me the vajra space today. Three times.
de nas dbang dngos ni/
b. The Actual Abhiṣeka[16]
khyed rang rnams lus rnam snang gi chos bdun dang ldan zhing / ngag mi sma dbugs thad sor rgyur 'jug / sems bzang ngan gyi 'dzin rtog spangs la ci gnas kyi bar la mnyam par bzhag mdzod/

With your body, sit in the seven-point posture of Vairocana. With your speech, do not speak and let your breath move naturally. With your mind, cast aside thoughts that cling to good and bad. Rest evenly as long as you can. Rest a bit.
cung zad bzhag / bla mas/ slob ma 'di rnams kyis don dam pa'i bden pa mthong bar gyur cig / ces smon lam bya/
The guru says: Disciples, through these, see the ultimate truth. Thus, make that aspiration.
de nas bla mas/
Then, the guru says:
bu/ de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes ni/ / mchog tu mi 'gyur bde bas gang / / bde mchog 'khor lo bde ba'i mchog /
Child, the wisdom of thusness is filled with immutable bliss: Cakrasaṃvara, the sublime bliss.
de ni rang gi sems nyid yin/ / ltos shig rang gi sems la ltos/ / rang gi sems la bltas pas na/ / dbang bskur la sogs snang ba rnams/ / gdod nas rang gi sems su gsal/ /
That is your mind-itself. Look: look at your mind. When you look at your mind, all appearances, including the bestowal of abhiṣeka, are clear as your mind from the beginning.
gsal tsam nyid nas stong pa ste/ / stong pa nyid rang gsal ba'i (365)phyir/ / snang stong zung 'jug sems kyi don/ / smra bsam brjod med shes par gyis/ zhes brjod cing don bsam/

That mere clarity itself is empty. Because that emptiness is self-clarity, {365} the unification of appearances and emptiness is the nature of mind. Know that to be inexpressible through speech or thought. Say that, and contemplate its meaning.
gsum pa rjes dbang don ngo sprad pa ni/
c. Pointing Out the Significance of the Abhiṣeka

de ltar tshig dbang thob pas sbyang gzhi sgo gsum dbyer med 'das brjod bral la/ sbyang bya rtag 'dzin smra brjod kyi dri ma sbyangs shing / sbyong byed blo 'das phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa la dbang / sbyangs 'bras ngo bo nyid sku thob par 'gyur ro/ / zhes dbang don gyi rtogs pa bskyed/

Having thus received the word abhiṣeka, your three doors, the ground for purification, are purified in being inseparable, beyond the intellect,[17] and free from expression; and the stains of expressing clinging to permanence, what are to be purified, are purified. You are empowered to meditate on mahāmudrā, which is beyond the intellect, the means of purification. You will achieve the svabhāvakāya, the result of purification. Thus, arouse the realization of the significance of the abhiṣeka.
gnyis pa mtha' rten
Two. The Conclusion[18]
['di] la bzhi/ rjes gnang / lung bstan/ dbugs dbyung / gzengs bstod rnams so/ /
This has four parts: (1) the authorization, (2) the prophecy, (3) the confirmation, and (4) the assurance.
dang po rjes gnang
One. The Authorization
['di] la rnam grangs bcu gnyis yod pa las/
This has twelve variations.
dang por brgyud pa yid bzhin nor bu'i rjes gnang byin par mos shig / nor bu spyi bor bzhag la/
First, feel that you are given the authorization of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Lineage. Place a gem on their heads.
sprul sku bla ma yid bzhin gyi/ / nor bu rin chen gtsug gi rgyan/ / rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pas/ / bka' brgyud bla ma'i brgyud pa zungs/ /
The precious Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the gurus, the nirmāṇakāyas, are your crown ornament. Since they are inseparable from Vajradhara, hold the lineage of the Kagyu gurus.
gnyis pa smin lam yid bzhin nor bu'i rjes gnang byin par mos shig / rnam rgyal bum pa lag tu gtad la/
Second, feel that you are given the authorization of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Maturing Path. Place the victory vase in their hands.
mkhyen brtses 'gro ba rjes bzung phyir/ / dkyil 'khor cho ga bzhin bris nas/ / dbang bzhi'i skal ldan gdul bya rnams/ / smin byed las la brtson par gyis/

In order to care for beings with knowledge and kindness, draw the maṇḍala according to the ritual, and, disciples endowed with the fortune of the four abhiṣekas, apply yourselves to the maturing activities.
gsum pa grol lam yid bzhin nor bu'i rjes gnang byin par mos shig / ral gri lag tu gtad la/
Third, feel that you are given the authorization of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Liberating Path. Place the sword in their hand.
'gro kun 'khor bar 'ching byed pa'i/ / ma rig zhags pa ji snyed pa/ / shes rab ral gris bcad nas kyang / / rnam grol lam la 'god par gyis/ /
However many nooses of ignorance there are that bind beings in saṃsāra, the sword of prajñā cuts them and sets all on the path to liberation.
bzhi pa bzlas pa'i rjes gnang ni/ /
Fourth, the authorization for the recitation.

slob dpon dang slob ma gnyis ka lhar gsal ba'i thugs kar pad nyi'i steng du hU~M sngon po re re bsam/ bla ma'i thugs kar hU~M yig sngags phreng gis bskor ba de las sngags phreng 'phros/ khyed rang rnams kyi khar zhugs snying ga'i hU~M gi mthar 'khod pa'i dmigs pa mdzod la 'di'i rjes zlos/

Think that in the heart centers of both the ācārya and the disciples, who appear clearly as the deities, on top of lotuses and suns, are blue hūṃs. The hūṃ in the guru’s heart is surrounded by a mantra garland. Visualize that a mantra garland radiates from that, enters your mouth, and arranges itself around the hūṃ in your heart. Repeat the following:
bcom ldan bdag gi bzung lags kyi/ / bdag la 'go bar mdzad du gsol/
Bhagavān, I will hold this. May it impact me.
zhes brjod la snying po yongs rdzogs rjes zlos byar gzhug / mthar bgrang phreng gtad (366) la/
Have them repeat the complete essence mantra. At the end, give them a mālā and say: {366}
rin chen thod pa'i bgrang phreng 'di/ / he ru ka dpal 'khor bcas kyi/ / mkhyen brtse ye shes thugs rgyud ni/ / snying po sngags kyis bskul bar gyis/ /
This precious skull mālā is the wisdom mindstream of the knowledge and kindness of the glorious Heruka and retinue. It is aroused by the essence mantra.
bcom ldan 'di la stsal lags kyi/ / 'di la 'go bar mdzad du gsol/ zhes brjod la me tog 'thor/
Bhagavān, please grant this. Please impact them. Throw flowers.
lnga pa mchod pa'i rjes su gnang ba ni/
Fifth, the authorization for offerings.
stong gsum mchod rdzas kyis bkang ba bla mas dkyil 'khor lha tshogs la 'bul tshul byas la sngags dang phyag rgya lan gcig mdzad par zhu/ las rdor gyis mchod pa btegs/

With offering substances filling the three-thousandfold universe, the guru creates the display of making offerings to the assembled deities in the maṇḍala. For that, please do the mantra and mudrā one time. The vajra assistant holds up the offerings.
oM gu ru b+ha ga wAn shrI he ru ka tsakra saM pa raM wI ra yo gi nI sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM nas/ shab+da 'i bar dang /
oṃ guru bhagavān śrīheruka cakrasaṃvaraṃ vīra yoginī saparivāra arghaṃ…śabda… And:
oM badzra rU pa AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra rūpa āḥ hūṃ
shab+da gan+d+he ra sa spar+she AHhU~M/
…śabda…gandhe…rasa…sparśa āḥ hūṃ
deng nas byang chub ma thob bar/ / bla ma rgyal ba sras bcas la/ / phyi nang gsang ba de kho na'i/ / mchod pa'i las la brtson par gyis/ /
From today until attaining awakening, I will apply myself to the activity of presenting the outer, inner, secret, and suchness offerings to the guru and the victors and their children.
drug pa bstod pa'i rjes gnang byin par mos shig / skal ldan skyes bu khyed rnams kyi/ / dad gus bsam sbyor gdung dbyangs kyis/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs la/ / yon tan sgo nas bstod par bya/ /

Sixth, feel that you are given the authorization for praises. All you fortunate beings with faith and devotion, in thought and deeds, and with songs of longing, should praise the excellent qualities of the guru and the assembly of maṇḍala deities.

bdun pa chos 'chad pa'i rjes gnang byin par mos shig / glegs bam lag tu gtad la/ 'gro rnams smin cing grol bya'i phyir/ / mdo rgyud bstan bcos man ngag rnams/ / mtha' drug tshul bzhi'i sgo nas ni/ / deng nas sna tshogs chos 'khor bskor/ /

Seventh, feel that you are given the authorization for expounding the dharma. Place a volume of text in their hands. In order to mature and liberate beings, starting today, turn the multifaceted dharmacakra of the sūtras, tantras, śāstras, and esoteric instructions using the six parameters and four modes.

brgyad pa rab gnas kyi rjes su gnang bar mos shig / mig thur gtad la/ sku gsung thugs kyi rten rnams la/ / dbang bskur spyan dbye mnga' dbul sogs/ / rab tu gnas pa'i bya ba rnams/ / deng nas khyod kyis yang dag byos/ /

Eighth, feel that you are given the authorization for consecrations. Give them an eye spoon. All the activities of consecrating the representations of body, speech, and mind— conferring abhiṣekas, opening eyes, investiture, and so on— from today onward, you must do perfectly.

dgu pa sbyin sreg gi rjes gnang byin par mos shig / dgang gzar blugs sprad la/ stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa'i/ / dgang gzar dgang blugs 'chang ba yis/ / phyi nang gsang ba de kho na'i/ / sbyin sreg las la brtson par gyis/ /

Ninth, feel that you are given the authorization for homas. Give them a pātrī and śruva and say: Holding the pātrī and śruva, the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, apply yourself to the activities of the outer, inner, secret, and suchness homas.

bcu pa phrin las bzhi'i rjes gnang byin par mos shig / sna tshogs rdo rje gtad la/ bstan dang 'gro ba'i don du ni/ / (367) zhi rgyas dbang drag la sogs pa'i/ / las tshogs rab 'byams rgya mtsho la/ / khyed rnams dbang bas brtson par gyis/

Tenth, feel that you are given the authorization for the four activities. Give them a viśvavajra. For the benefit of the teachings and beings, {367} apply yourself with energy to the vast ocean of activities: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, wrathful, and others.

bcu gcig pa theg dman bdud kyi phyogs gzhom pa'i rjes gnang byin par mos shig / mda' gzhu gtad la/ dpa' bo mi yi seng ge khyod/ / shes rab snying rje'i mda' gzhu yis/ / nyan rang zhi bde'i sems dang ni/ / bdud phyogs gzhom zhing gzhan don gyis/

Eleventh, feel that you are given the authorization for destroying the Hīnayāna and factions of māras. Give them a bow and arrow. You, warrior, lion among humans, with the bow and arrow of prajñā and compassion, destroy the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha intention for peace and happiness and the factions of māras—benefit others.

bcu gnyis pa 'gro kun 'khor ba las sgrol phyir stong nyid snying rje'i rjes gnang byin par mos shig / dug sbrul dang mi mo'i gzugs bstan la/ sdig pa dug sprul reg mthong 'joms/ / de phyir ci yang mi bya zhing / / dge ba ma ltar byams pa nyid/ / de phyir phun sum tshogs par bya/

Twelfth, feel that you are given the authorization for emptiness and compassion in order to free all beings from saṃsāra. Show them an image of poisonous snakes and women. Evil, like poisonous snakes, destroys upon touch or sight, therefore, do not do it all. Virtue, like mothers, is love, therefore, engage its goodness.
gnyis pa lung bstan pa ni/
Two. The Prophecy

slob dpon shAkya thub pa'i cha lugs su bsgyur la mi 'jigs phyag rgya chos gos kyi sna gnyis ri dwags kyi rgyal po seng ge'i rna ba ltar bya/ snying gar bzung / g.yas g.yon rdor dril 'dzin cing / slob dpon ston pa shAkya'i rgyal por gyur pas mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya snying gar bzung ba ni/ ri dwags kyi rgyal po seng ge de ri dwags phal pa gang la'ang 'jigs pa med pa ltar/ khyed rnams kyang dkyil 'khor 'dir dbang bskur bas phyis nas nyam nga dang bag tsha ba byed mi dgos pas/

The ācārya transforms into having the attributes of Śākyamuni. Hold at your heart the mudrā of fearlessness, making the two ends of your dharma robe be like the ears of a lion, the king of wild herbivores. Hold a vajra and ghaṇṭā in your right and left hands. The ācārya becomes the Teacher, the king of Śākyas, and holds the mudrā of fearlessness at their heart. In the same way that lions, the kings of wild herbivores, are never afraid of ordinary herbivores, having received the abhiṣeka into this maṇḍala, henceforth you should not feel intimidated or anxious.
de'i brda chos mtshon bzhin bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis so so'i gsang mtshan dang mthun par 'tshang rgya ba'i lung ston par gyur/
In keeping with that symbolic dharma just shown, the guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala deliver a prophecy of your awakening in keeping with your own secret name.
oM/ 'di ltar khyod la ngas lung bstan/ / rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs/ / srid pa gdod nas dag pa'i phyir/ / spang bya kun las grol ba yi/ / khams gsum chos kyi rgyal srid mchog /

oṃ In this way I prophesize for you: in order to become the tathāgata Vajrasattva, primordially pure existence, [take hold of] the sublime kingdom of dharma, the three realms, free from all that is to be abandoned.
kye/ dpal so so'i gsang mtshan brjod la 'di zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro/ /
Kye You will become the tathāgata, called the glorious (insert your own secret name).
shrI he ru ka gsang mtshan 'di zhes bya ba sarba ta thA ga ta sid+d+hi sa ma ya s+t+waM/ b+hur+b+hu wA swA/ zhes brjod/
oṃ śrīheruka (insert your secret name) sarvatathāgata siddhi samayastvaṃ / bhurbhuvāsvā
gsum pa dbugs dbyung ba ni/
Three. The Confirmation

bla ma dkyil 'khor pa'i lha tshogs rnams kyis khyed (368) rang rnams la dbugs dbyung stsol bar mos shig / gsang chen mchog gi dkyil 'khor 'dir/ / dbang bskur zab mo thob pas ni/ / khams gsum chos kyi rgyal srid che/ / dpal ldan yon tan 'byung ba'i gnas/ / bdud tshogs kun las nges rgyal ba'i/ / grong khyer mchog tu gzhug pa yin/

Feel that the guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala bestow upon you the confirmation. {368} By receiving the profound abhiṣeka in this maṇḍala of the sublime great secret, you have entered the supreme city— the great dharma kingdom of the three realms, the source of glorious virtue— where the hordes of Māra are definitely defeated.
bzhi pa gzengs bstod pa ni/
Four. The Assurance
slar yang gzengs bstod stsol bar mos/ / mchog tu gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor 'dir/ / bcug pa dang ni mthong ba yis/ / sdig to'i chos las rnam par grol/ /
Feel that you are given the assurance. Having been brought into and seen this supremely secret maṇḍala, you are freed from any evil dharma.
de phyir khyed rnams bde bar gnas/ / phyis nas nyam nga dang bral ba'i/ / bde chen theg pa 'di yis ni/ / mi thub pa dang mi chod pa/ / gcig kyang med pas dga' bar gyis/ / zhes brjod/
Thus you abide in happiness. Hereafter, since this yāna of great bliss, free from anxieties, cannot be subdued or cut off in any way, be joyful.
gsum pa rjes kyi bya ba ni/
Three. Concluding Activities[19]
dam tshig bsrung dgos par gdams pa/
Instruct them about the necessity of preserving samaya.
gtso bos ji ltar sogs dang bdag gis sgo gsum longs spyod bcas/ / deng nas 'dren pa khyed la 'bul/ /
Whatever the principal one commands, [all that I will do.] And: I offer my three doors and possessions, starting today, to you, the guide.
nyes ltung dri mas gos gyur na/ / cha yis spyad cing skyob tu gsol/ / zhes lan gsum/
If I am tainted by the stains of flaws and downfalls, please use any part of me and protect me. Three times.
gtang rag gi maN+Dal 'bul/ dge bsngo byas la slob ma grol lo/ /
Offer a maṇḍala in thanks. Dedicate the virtue and release the disciples.
rtsa ba'i gsum pa rjes kyi bya
III. Concluding Section
['di] ba la/ rtsa ba'i gzhung las sa bcad bcu gcig gis bstan pa'i
The root text presents this through eleven topical headings.
dang po gtor 'bul ni
A. Torma Offering
sgrub thabs kyi gsham nas blangs te 'dir sbyar/
Take this from the end of the sādhana and use it here.[*17]
gnyis pa
B. Gaṇapūjā
