rtsa'i gzhung du tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya bar gsungs kyang deng sang tshogs 'khor dngos nus mkhan gyi rnal 'byor pa dkon bas sa bcad tsam du tshogs mchod 'bul ba ni/ stag lpags la sogs pa'i gdan gyi steng du ma dan dang bA la gtso bor gyur pa'i bza' btung bzang po ci 'byor pa bsham/ bdud rtsi ltar byin brlab/

Although the root text says to do a gaṇacakra, these days yogic practitioners who are able to actually perform gaṇacakras are rare. Therefore, offer a gaṇapūjā simply [to comply with] the topical headings. On a seat, such as a tiger skin or the like, arrange whatever excellent food and drink you have, with the main ones being madana and bāla. Consecrate as done with the amṛta.
tshogs zhing spyan 'dren pa ni/
The invocation of the field of accumulation.

oM AHhU~M/ gnas spyi gtsug nyi zla'i gdan steng na/ / de na rtsa ba'i bla ma bzhugs/ / 'khor ni brgyud pa'i bla mas bskor/ / theg chen chos 'khor de na bskor/ / bde chen tshogs 'khor 'di na bskor/ / gnas 'dir spyan 'dren gshegs su gsol/ /

oṃ āḥ hūṃ In the place of the crown of my head, on sun and moon seats, there sits my root guru, surrounded by a retinue of lineage gurus, there turning the dharmacakra of the Mahāyāna, here turning the gaṇacakra of great bliss. You are invited to this place, please come.

gnas 'og min chos kyi pho brang na/ / de na 'khor lo bde mchog bzhugs/ / 'khor ni (369)rgyud sde bzhi yis bskor/ / theg chen chos 'khor de na bskor/ / bde chen tshogs 'khor 'di na bskor/ / gnas 'dir spyan 'dren gshegs su gsol/ /

In the place of Akaniṣṭha, in the palace of dharma, there sits Cakrasaṃvara, {369} surrounded by retinues of the four classes of tantra, there turning the dharmacakra of the Mahāyāna, here turning the gaṇacakra of great bliss. You are invited to this place, please come.

gnas dgos 'dod kun 'byung gter gling na/ / de na ku ru kul+le bzhugs/ / 'khor ni gnod sbyin mkha' 'gros bskor/ / theg chen chos 'khor de na bskor/ / bde chen tshogs 'khor 'di na bskor/ / gnas 'dir spyan 'dren gshegs su gsol/ /

In the place where all desires are fulfilled, a treasure isle, there sits Kurulle, surrounded by a retinue of yakṣa ḍākinīs, there turning the dharmacakra of the Mahāyāna, here turning the gaṇacakra of great bliss. You are invited to this place, please come.
gnas bde chen shar lho nub byang na/ / de na rigs bzhi'i mkha' 'gro bzhugs/ / dam tshig las kyi mkha' 'gros bskor/ / theg chen= bde chen= gnas 'dir=

In the place of great bliss, east, south, west, and north, there sit the ḍākinīs of the four families, surrounded by a retinue of samaya karmaḍākinīs, there turning the dharmacakra… here turning the gaṇacakra… You are invited…
gnas bsil ba tshal gyi dur khrod na/ / de na ma mgon lcam dral bzhugs/ / 'khor ni dam can rgya mtshos bskor/ / theg chen= bde chen= gnas 'dir=

In the place of the Śītavana charnel ground, there sit Ma-Gön cham-dral, surrounded by a retinue of an ocean of samaya holders, there turning the dharmacakra… here turning the gaṇacakra… You are invited…
gnas phyogs bcu dben pa'i ri khrod na/ / de na rdo rje mched lcam bzhugs/ / 'khor ni skal ldan pho mos bskor/ / theg chen= bde chen= gnas 'dir=

In the place of isolated mountains of the ten directions, there sit the vajra brothers and sisters, surrounded by a retinue of fortunate men and women, there turning the dharmacakra… here turning the gaṇacakra… You are invited…
gnas rang lus rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor na/ / de na rang byung ye shes bzhugs/ / 'khor ni sems byung tshogs kyis bskor/ / theg chen= bde chen= gnas 'dir=

In the place of the maṇḍala of the victors, my own body, there sits self-arisen wisdom, surrounded by a retinue of the assembly of mental factors, there turning the dharmacakra… here turning the gaṇacakra… You are invited…
gshegs nas bde chen tshogs la rol/ / byin gyis rlobs la dngos grub stsol/ / phrin las ma lus bsgrub tu gsol/ /
Having arrived, revel in the feast of great bliss. Bestow your blessings and siddhis. Please perform all activities.
gu ru de ba DA ki nI d+harma pA la sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaH ma hA su kha ga Na pU dzaHhoH
guru deva ḍākinī dharmapāla saparivāra vajra samājaḥ / mahāsukha khaṇa pūja hoḥ
bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro dang / / chos skyong srung ma rdo rje spun/ / mchod pa'i yul du spyan drangs pas/ / dgyes bzhin gnang ste byon pa yis/ /
Gurus, yidams, ḍākinīs, dharma protectors and guardians, and vajra siblings: having been invited to this place of offerings, partake with pleasure.
tshogs gnyis spel mdzad thams cad kyang / / nyams dang rtogs pa 'u ru ru/ / thugs rje'i sprin tshogs thibs se thib/ / byin rlabs na bun thu lu lu/ /
And having come, increase the two accumulations. May experiences and realizations roar, u-ru-ru.[20] May masses of clouds of compassion billow, tip-se-tip. May the mists of blessings swirl, tu-lu-lu.

dngos grub char rgyun 'bebs bzhin du/ / gnas mchog 'di ru bzhugs su gsol/ / bzhugs nas bde chen tshogs la rol/ / tshogs la rol la dgyes bzhin du/ / rig 'dzin bdag cag (370) 'khor bcas la/ / sku gsung thugs kyi dbang bskur stsol/ /

While a rain of siddhis falls, please remain in this sublime place. While remaining, revel in the feast of great bliss. Revel in the feast, and while enjoying it, {370} please bestow the abhiṣekas of body, speech, and mind upon us vidyādharas and our retinues.
mos pa'i bu la byin gyis rlobs/ / bgegs dang log 'dren bar chad sol/ / mchog dang thun mong dngos grub stsol/ / rang gzhan don gnyis 'grub par mdzod/ /
Bless your devoted children. Dispel obstructors, corrupting influences, and obstacles. Bestow the supreme and common siddhis. Achieve the benefit for ourselves and others.
gu ru maN+Da la de wa DA ki nI sa pa ri wA ra ma hA su kha ga Na pU dza hoH
guru maṇḍala deva ḍākinī saparivāra mahāsukha gaṇacakra pūja hoḥ
zhes slob dpon gyis bdud rtsi 'thor/
The ācārya sprinkles amṛta.
yan lag bdun pa 'bul ba ni/
Offering the sevenfold service.
thal mo sbyar te/ bla ma yi dam lha tshogs la/ / sgo gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal lo/ / phyi nang gsang gsum mchod pa 'bul/ / dug gsum dbang gi sdig pa bshags/ /
Join your hands in añjali. To the gurus and assembly of yidam deities, I respectfully pay homage with my three doors. I present outer, inner, and secret offerings.
dus gsum dge la rjes yi rang / / theg gsum chos 'khor bskor bzhin du/ / khams gsum 'gro ba'i don bzhugs gsol/ / dge bas sku gsum myur thob shog / ces brjod/

I confess negative actions done under the influence of the three poisons. I rejoice in the virtue of the three times. While turning the dharmacakra of the three yānas, please remain for the sake of beings in the three realms. Through virtue, may the three kāyas be quickly achieved.
rdo rje'i glu blang ba ni/
Singing a vajra song.

kol+la i r+TeTha a bol+la/ mum+mu Ni re kak+kO la/ / g+ha Na i ki pi Ta ho badz+dza i/ / ka ru Ne ka a i Na ro lA/ / ta hiM bA la khAdz+dza i/ / gA DeM ma a NA bidz+dza a i/ / ha le kA liny+dza ra ba Ni a i/ / dun+du ra ta hiM padz+dza a i/ / tsa u sa ma kas+thu ri si h+lA/ / kaspu ra lA i a i/ / ma lA i in+d+ha Na sA liM dza a i/ / ta hiM b+ha ru khA i a i/ / phreng+kha Na She Ta ka ran+te/ / shud+d+ha a shud+d+haN+Na ma Na a i/ / ni raM shu ang+ge tsa DA bi a i/ / ta hiM dza sa rA wa ap+pa pa Ni a i/ / ma la a dze kun+du ru bA DA i/ / DiN+Di ma ta heM Na badz+dza a i/

kolla ire ṭṭha abolla / mummuṇire kakkōla / ghaṇa ikipiṭa ho vajja i / karuṇe ka a i ṇa rolā / tahiṃ bāla khājja i / gāḍeṃ ma aṇā bijja a i / hale kāliñjara baṇi a i / dunduru tahiṃ pajja a i / ca usama kasthuri sihlā / kaspura lā i a i / malā i indhaṇa sāliṃja a i / tahiṃ bharu khā i a i / preṅkhaṇa ṣeṭa karante / śuddha aśuddhaṇṇa maṇa a i / niraṃśu aṅge caḍābi a i / tahiṃ ja sarāva appa paṇi a i / māla aje kunduru vāḍā i / ḍiṇḍima taheṃ ṇa vajja a i[21]
de nas tshogs phud 'bul ba ni/ /
Offering the select portion of the feast.
slob dpon gyis bdud rtsi 'thor la/
The ācārya sprinkles amṛta.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
bla med mchog gi mchod pa dam pa 'di/ sogs dkyil chog ltar 'bul/

This unexcelled, supreme, sacred offering [radiates light rays of the five wisdoms and is adorned with the five sense pleasures— please happily accept it in keeping with your samayas.][22] Offer according to the maṇḍala ritual.
lugs 'dir dam tshig bsre bar gsungs pa'i tshogs la rol pa ni/ las rdor gyis tshogs bdud rtsi thogs/
The enjoyment of the feast, which is taught in this tradition to be mixed with samaya, is as follows. The vajra assistant holds up the feast and amṛta, and says:
kye/ rdo rje slob dpon dgongs su gsol/ / 'dir ni chos rnams bzang po ste/ / 'dus pa rnams la the tshom med/ bram ze khyi dang gdol pa phag / rang bzhin gcig tu dgongs te rol/
Kye. Vajrācārya, please consider us. Here the dharma is excellent. Those gathered have no doubts. Regarding brahmans, dogs, śūdras, and pigs to be of one nature, enjoy.
slob dpon gyis pad kor bcas blangs la/ /
The ācārya receives it with a lotus circle and says:
rin thang med las legs 'ong chos/ / 'dod chags la sogs dri ma bral/ / (371) gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pas/ / de bzhin nyid la bdag phyag 'tshal/
Beyond what is priceless, the dharma of Svāgata {371} is unsullied by desire and the rest, free from percepts and perceivers. Thus, I pay homage to thusness.
a la la hoH zhes blang /
a la la hoḥ Thus, receive it.
mched lcam rnams la'ang drangs te tshim pa drug ldan tu rol/
Offer to the brothers and sisters, and enjoy it with the six ways of being satisfied.
de nas gsum pa skong bshags dang 'dod don gsol gdab bya ba ni/
C. The Restoration, Confession, and Request for [the Fulfillment of] Desired Aims
hU~M/ bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro dang / / chos skyong srung ma rdo rje spun/ / tshogs zhing dam pa 'khor bcas rnams/ / brtse bas bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
hūṃ Gurus, yidams, ḍākinīs, dharma protectors and guardians, and vajra siblings— the genuine field of accumulation with your retinues— please consider us with your kindness.
rnal 'byor bdag cag 'khor bcas rnams/ / nyon mongs dug lnga'i dbang gyur bas/ / 'dod log tshe 'di'i bya ba yis/ / sgo gsum nyin mtshan kun yengs nas/ /

We, yogins and yoginīs, and our retinues, under the influence of our five poisonous mental afflictions, are distracted day and night in all three doors with inappropriate desires and the activities of this life.

phyi nang gsang ba mthar thug gi / bsnyen sgrub bzlas brjod tshogs gtor rnams/ / chag dang chung dang nyams la sogs/ / sku gsung thugs dang 'gal ba yi/ / rtsa ba dang ni yan lag gi / dam tshig nyams chag nyes ltung ni/ / 'khor ba ngan song rgyur gyur cing / / mtho ris thar pa'i gegs gyur rnams/ /

Thus, our practices of approach, accomplishment, repetitions, recitations, and feast tormas are broken, diminished, impaired, and so on. The impairment, breaking, flaws, and downfalls of the root and branch samayas that contravene [awakened] body, speech, and mind are causes for the negative states of saṃsāra and hindrances for the higher states and liberation.
gnod 'gyod drag po'i sems kyis ni/ / ma lus bdag gis mthol lo bshags/ / slan chad sdom zhing dag par bgyid/ / brtse bas byin gyis rlabs tu gsol/ /
With a mind of strong remorse for harm done, we acknowledge and confess all without exception. we will refrain from now on and will purify them. Please grant your blessings out of kindness.
dngos 'byor yid kyis sprul pa yi/ / phyi nang gsang ba mthar thug gi / 'dod yon rnam lnga'i mchod sprin ni/ / bkod pa mchog gyur kun tshang zhing / / sa dang bar snang khyab pa yis/ /

Clouds of offerings of the five sense pleasures— outer, inner, secret, and ultimate— those actually present and those imagined by the mind, are beautifully arranged and complete, pervading the earth and surrounding spaces.
bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro dang / / chos skyong srung ma rdo rje spun/ / 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad kyi/ / thugs bzhed rnam dag 'grub gyur cig /
With these, may the pure wishes of the gurus, yidams, ḍākinīs, dharma protectors and guardians, and vajra siblings, and their retinues be accomplished.
thugs bsam rnam dag rdzogs gyur cig / thugs dam gnyan po bskangs gyur cig /
May their pure intentions be fulfilled. May their weighty commitments be restored.
thugs dam gnyan po skong gyur nas/ / mkhyen brtse mthu stobs nus pa dang / / rdzu 'phrul drag shul rgyas gyur cig /
Having restored their weighty commitments, may their knowledge, kindness, strengths, abilities, and fierce magical powers increase.

khyed kyi thugs dam bskangs gyur nas/ / rnal 'byor bdag cag 'khor bcas kyi/ / dam tshig nyams chags bskang du gsol/ / dam tshig nyams chags bskangs nas kyang / / brtse ba chen pos rjes bzung phyir/ / 'gyur med sku yi dngos (372) grub stsol/ /

Having restored your commitments, please restore the impaired and broken samaya of us, yogins and yoginīs, and our retinues. Having restored our impaired and broken samaya, because you have accepted us with your great kindness, {372} please bestow the siddhis of unchanging body.
tshangs dbyangs gsung gi= 'khrul med thugs kyi= yon tan re skor= phrin las 'gro 'dul dngos grub stsol/ /

Please bestow the siddhis of speech, the melodies of Brahmā. Please bestow the siddhis of mind, free from delusion. Please bestow the siddhis of excellent qualities, what fulfill hopes. Please bestow the siddhis of activities, what tame beings.
mdor na mchog dang thun mong ga / dngos grub ma lus khyed kyis stsol/ / sngon las 'phral rkyen la sogs pa'i/ / bar chad ma lus khyed kyis sol/ /
In brief, please bestow all siddhis, supreme and common, without exception. Please dispel all obstacles without exception, the suddenly arising circumstances due to our previous actions and the like.
deng nas byang chub ma thob bar/ / blo 'gel ltos skyur re sa dang / / skyabs gnas gzhan na ma mchis pas/ /
From now on, until awakening, we have no other source of refuge, place of trust, reliance, and hope.
mkhyen brtse nus ldan khyed rnams kyis/ / bdag cag 'khor dang bcas pa rnams/ / brtse bas 'bral med bskyang du gsol/ /
With your knowledge, kindness, and abilities, please protect us and our retinues— may we not be separated from your care.
bzhi pa lhag ma btang ba ni/
D. Giving the Leftovers
las rdor gyis lhag ma rnams bsdus te slob dpon mdun du bzhag pa la/ slob dpon gyis bya khyung gi phyag rgya dang / ma da nas kha phru btab la/
The vajra assistant collects the leftovers and places them in front of the ācārya. The ācārya makes the garuda mudrā and spits with madana.
oM uts+tshiSh+Ta ba liM ta b+hak+Sha sI swA hA/
oṃ ucchiṣṭa baliṃta bhakṣasī svāhā

oM brjod pas lhag gtor mi dmigs te stong par bsam/ AHbrjod pas thod pa la sogs pa'i snod yangs shing rgya che ba du mar bsam/ hU~M brjod pas de thams cad kyi nang du zad mi shes pa'i 'dod yon lnga/ ngo bo bzang zhing rgya che bas yid la zag pa med pa'i bde ba skyed nus pa/ rnam pa'i bkod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas dbang po lnga tshims nus par gyur/

Saying oṃ, think that the leftover torma becomes unobservable: empty. Saying āḥ, think that it becomes many spacious and vast containers, such as skull cups. Saying hūṃ, in all of those are inexhaustible pleasures of the five senses. Being in essence excellent and vast, they have the power to arouse undefiled bliss in the mind. Being in manifestation an unimaginable display, they have the power to satisfy the five sense faculties.
lhag ma mtshams stegs la bkod/ rdor thal phye bas/
Place the leftovers on a side plate. With open vajra palms, say:
oM dz+nyA na DA ki nI/ sa ma ya DA ki nI/ lo ka DA kI nI/ sa pa ri wA ra ba liM ta kha kha khA hi/
oṃ jñānaḍākinī / samayaḍākinī / lokaḍākīnī / saparivāra baliṃta kha kha khāhi
lan gsum/ nam mkha' mdzod dang / a kA ro rnams kyang brjod/
Three times. Say the Gaganagañja mantra and akāro.

hU~M/ dang po phud kyis mi mchod du/ / bla ma yi dam phud kyi bdag / bar du tshogs la mi rol du/ / mkha' 'gro chos skyong tshogs la mnyes/ / de tshe 'dod yon mi spyod du/ / rnal 'byor pho mo 'dod pas tshim/ /

hūṃ First, why would we not offer the select portion— the gurus and yidams are lords of the select portion. In between, why would we not revel in the feast— it pleases the assembly of ḍākinīs and dharma protectors. At that time, why would we not enjoy the sense pleasures— the pleasures satisfy the yogins and yoginīs.
lhag ma khyod la mi ster du/ / khyed rnams nga yi bran dang g.yog / lhag ma kha phru mi btab tu/ / rje dang 'bangs su khyad bar che/ /
Why would we not give the leftover to you— you are our servants and attendants. Why would we not spit upon the leftover— this is something special for lords and subjects.

tha mar gcig tu mi bsre ru/ / chos nyid ngang du khyad par med/ / da lan rnal 'byor pho mo yi/ / 'dod yon tshogs la rol pa'i lhag / sna tshogs 'dod pa'i (373) gtor ma 'di/ / rang rang 'dod pa'i snod du blugs/ / byams pa chen po'i kha phru btab/ /

In the end, why would all not be blended as one— there is no distinction in dharmatā. Now, the leftover of the enjoyment of the sense pleasures of the yogins and yoginīs {373} is this torma of various pleasures. It is poured into containers according to your desires. The spit of great love is delivered.
snying rje chen po'i sngags bzlas nas/ / gzhan don dga' spro'i phyag rgya bstan/ / srid zhi mnyam nyid ting 'dzin gyis/ / 'dod rgu 'byung bar byin brlabs pa'i/ / dpal gyi gtor ma 'di longs shig /

Reciting the mantra of great compassion, the mudrā of delight in benefiting others is shown. Through the samādhi of the equality of existence and peace, enjoy this glorious torma consecrated as the source of all pleasures.
blangs nas rol zhing tshims gyis la/ / he ru ka yi bka' bzhin du/ / bcol ba'i phrin las thams cad sgrubs/ /
Take it, enjoy it, and be satisfied. In keeping with the command of the Heruka, perform all the entrusted activities.
sa ma ya ma nu sma ra/ sa ma ya rak+Shan+tu/
samaya manusmara / samaya rakṣantu
lnga pa gtor ma btang ba ni/
E. Giving the Torma
chos skyong spyi gtor bran la/
Sprinkle on the general dharma protector torma.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ

b+h+rU~M oM dzriM kha~M hU~M rnams 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i drag po'i mchod yon dang nyer spyod/ rgyal srid sna bdun/ mkha' lding dang seng ge la sogs pa'i rkang bzhi'i tshogs dang / mtshon cha dang dur khrod kyi yo byad sogs dam can rgya mtsho mnyes pa'i mchod sprin sa dang nam mkha' bar snang thams cad khyab par bsams la/

Bhrūṃ aṃ jriṃ khaṃ hūṃ all melt into light and become offering clouds that are pleasing to the oceans of samaya holders—wrathful offering water and the traditional offerings, the seven emblems of sovereignty, the gatherings of garudas and quadrupeds, such as lions, weapons, the things of charnel grounds, and more—all filling the earth, the sky, and everywhere in between. Thus, contemplate.
oM badzra ma hA Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṃ vajra mahā arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā
oM badzra puSh+pe AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du/
Similarly:
d+hU pe= a lo ke= gan+d+he= nai wi d+ya= shab+da 'i bar kyis sngags rol mo dang bcas pas byin gyis brlab/
…dhūpe…āloke…gandhe…naividya…śabda… Thus, consecrate with mantras and music.
hU~M/ khrag 'thung rgyal po he ru ka lha chen nag po dpal 'bar dang /
hūṃ Heruka, king of the blood-drinkers, glorious, blazing Great Black Deity and
b+h+yoH lha mo nag mo re mA ti/ / mkha' 'gro me lce 'bar ma gnyis/ / bka' nyan 'khor gyis bskor ba ni/ / 'jig rten gsum gyi dregs pa'i gtso/ /
bhyoḥ Black Goddess, Remāti, ḍākinī Agnijihva Jvalā, the two, surrounded by your retinue of attendants— principal ones of the arrogant ones of the three worlds—
lha chen brgyad dang klu chen brgyad/ / gza' chen brgyad dang 'jigs byed dgu/ / rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang / / phyogs skyong bcu dang rgyal chen bzhi/ /
eight great gods, eight great nāgas, eight great planetary [gods], nine bhairavas, [gods of] the twenty-eight lunar mansions, ten protectors of the directions, four great kings,
bsil ba tshal la sogs pa yi/ / dur khrod rnams kyi bdag po dang / / nA lan+da la sogs pa yi/ / gtsug lag khang gi srung ma dang / /
lords of the charnel grounds— Śītavana and the others— protectors of the vihāras— Nālanda and the others—
lha srin sde brgyad dregs pa can/ / rgyan dang cha lugs bzhon par bcas/ / sprul pa yang sprul nyid sprul dang / / 'khor 'bangs bran g.yog ma lus pa/ /

and eight classes of gods and rākṣasas with the arrogant ones, with your ornaments, attributes, and mounts, with your emanations, re-emanations, and further emanations, and with all your retinues, subjects, servants, and attendants:
'dir gshegs bdag la dgongs su gsol/ / brgyan pa'i gtor ma 'di bzhes shig / dmar chen gtor (374) ma 'di bzhes shig /
rak+ta'i mchod yon= dbang po'i me tog= sha chen bdug spos= zhun chen snang gsal=
Accept this offering water of rakta. Accept these flowers of the sense faculties. Accept this incense of great flesh. Accept these lamps of great fat.
bdud rtsi'i dri chab= sha khrag zhal zas= rkang gling rol mo= bdud rtsi sman raka=
Accept this scented water of amṛta. Accept this food of meat and blood. Accept this musical offering of kanglings. Accept this amṛta, medicinal herbs, and rakta.
dza gad phud mchod= dpa' bo'i ngar chu= sngar bcol gtang rag= phyi ma'i zhu gsol 'di bzhes shig /
Accept this, the select offering of jagad. Accept this powerful drink of heroes. Accept my thanks for previous service. Accept my requests for the future.
bla med mchod pa 'di bzhes nas/ / mkha' mnyam sems can thams cad la/ / phan bde ma lus 'byung ba'i gnas/ / sangs rgyas bstan pa rin po che/ /
Having accepted these unexcelled offerings, please unceasingly perform activities that spread, increase, and cause to endure, throughout all directions, times, and states,
phyogs dus gnas skabs thams cad du/ / dar rgyas yun ring gnas pa dang / / 'gro la bde skyid 'byung ba yi/ / phrin las g.yel med mdzad du gsol/ /
the precious teachings of the Buddha, the source of all benefit and happiness for sentient beings who equal space, and perform activities that bring happiness and joy to beings.
rnal 'byor bdag cag 'khor bcas kyi/ / chos ldan bsam sbyor kun 'grub cing / / re ba thams cad bskang du gsol/ / bsam pa thams cad bsgrub tu gsol/ /
May the intentions, actions, and hopes linked with dharma of us, yogins and yoginīs, and our retinues be fulfilled. May all our intentions be fulfilled.
zhes gtor ma 'bul/
Thus, offer the torma.
badzra muH gtor mgron ye shes pa rnams gshegs/
With vajra muḥ, the wisdom ones of the torma guests depart.
drug pa gtang rag gi mchod pa ni/
F. Offerings in Thanks
mchod pa kha gsos la bsang sbyang / sgrub thabs ltar byin brlab/ rab 'byams zhing gi dkyil 'khor sogs 'dod yon lnga mchod dkyil chog ltar 'bul/

Replenish the offerings, and cleanse and purify them. Consecrate them as done in the sādhana. In all the maṇḍalas in the infinite pure lands…[*18] Thus, offer the five sense pleasures as done in the maṇḍala ritual.
hU~M/ bcom ldan mgon po sogs rkang brgyad kyis bstod/

hūṃ Bhagavān, protector, [great hero, blazing like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs. You are majestic with three eyes, hold a battle-ax, noose, khaṭvāṃga, and spear, and are frightening, draped in a tiger skin. To the one with the great smoky body, subduer of obstructors, I bow.] Praise with the eight lines.
bdun pa dbang bzhi blang ba ni/
G. Receiving the Four Abhiṣekas
dpal ldan bla ma rin po che/ / sku gsung thugs las byung ba yi/ / bdag la dbang bzhi bskur du gsol/ / smin cing grol bar mdzad du gsol/ /
Glorious, precious guru, with your body, speech, and mind, please bestow upon me the four abhiṣekas. Please mature and liberate me.
bla ma'i sku la gsol ba 'debs/ / lus la bde drod 'bar bar byin gyis rlobs/ / bla ma'i gsung la gsol= ngag la nus pa thon par=
I supplicate the body of the guru. Bless my body so that it blazes with bliss and warmth. I supplicate the speech of the guru. Bless my speech that it may be efficacious.
bla ma'i thugs la gsol= sems la rtogs pa 'char bar= bla ma'i sku gsung thugs la gsol ba 'debs/ / sgo gsum dbyer med rtogs par byin gyis rlobs/ /

I supplicate the mind of the guru. Bless my mind so that realization dawns. I supplicate the body, speech, and mind of the guru. Bless me that I may realize that my three doors are inseparable [from those of the guru].

zhes gsol ba btab pas/ bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi spyi bo'i oM dkar po las 'od zer dkar po'i tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phros/ bdag dang (375) sems can thams cad kyi spyi bor thim/ sku las kyang sku dpag tu med pa 'phros/ lus la thim pas skye ba dang tshe rabs thams cad du lus kyi sgo nas bsags pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par byas/ sku bum pa'i dbang thob/ lus sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur/ lam bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu sprul sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur/

Having supplicated in that way, from the white oṃs at the heads of the guru and the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, immeasurable masses of white light rays stream forth and dissolve into the heads of myself and all sentient beings. {375} From their bodies, innumerable forms of their bodies appear, and dissolve into our bodies. Our negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains accumulated by means of our bodies throughout all our births and successive lives are cleansed and purified. We receive the vase abhiṣeka of body. Our bodies become of the nature of vajra body. We are empowered to meditate on the generation process as the path. We become endowed with the fortune of attaining the nirmāṇakāya as the result.

yang bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi mgrin pa'i AHdmar po las 'od zer dmar po'i tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phros/ bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi mgrin par thim/ zhal nas kyang A li kA li la sogs te sngags kyi phreng ba dpag tu med pa 'phros/ lce la thim pas skye ba dang tshe rabs thams cad du ngag gi sgo nas bsags pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par byas/ gsung gsang ba'i dbang thob/ ngag gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur/ lam gtum mo bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu chos sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur/

From the red āḥs at the throats of the guru and the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, immeasurable masses of red light rays stream forth and dissolve into the throats of myself and all sentient beings. From the mouths of the guru and deities, innumerable mantra garlands—ā li kā li and others—appear, and dissolve into our tongues. Our negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains accumulated by means of our speech throughout all our births and successive lives are cleansed and purified. We receive the secret abhiṣeka of speech. Our speech becomes of the nature of vajra speech. We are empowered to meditate on caṇḍālī as the path. We become endowed with the fortune of attaining the dharmakāya as the result.

yang bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi thugs ka'i hU~M sngon po las 'od zer sngon po'i tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phros/ bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi snying gar thim/ yang rdo rje dril bu gri gug thod pa Da ma ru kha T+wAM ga la sogs te phyag mtshan dpag tu med pa 'phros/ snying gar thim pas skye ba dang tshe rabs thams cad du yid kyi sgo nas bsags pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par byas/ thugs shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob/ yid thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur/ lam pho nya bsgoms la dbang / 'bras bu longs sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur/

From the blue hūṃs at the hearts of the guru and the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, immeasurable masses of blue light rays stream forth and dissolve into the hearts of myself and all sentient beings. Again, innumerable emblems—vajras, ghaṇṭās, hooked knives, skull cups, ḍamarus, khaṭvāṃgas, and others—appear, and dissolve into our hearts. Our negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains accumulated by means of our minds throughout all our births and successive lives are cleansed and purified. We receive the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka of mind. Our minds become of the nature of vajra mind. We are empowered to meditate on emissaries as the path. We become endowed with the fortune of attaining the saṃbhogakāya as the result.

de nas bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi spyi mgrin snying ga'i gnas gsum la thim pas skye ba dang tshe rabs thams cad du sgo gsum gcig char du bsags pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri (376) ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par byas/ dbang bzhi pa tshig dbang rin po che thob/ sgo gsum sku gsung thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur/ lam phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu ngo bo nyid sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur par bsam mo/ /

Then, from the three places, head, throat, and heart, of the guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala, [white, red, and blue light rays stream forth together] and dissolve [into the three places of myself and all sentient beings].[23] Our negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains accumulated by means of our three doors together throughout all our births and successive lives are cleansed and purified. {376} We receive the fourth abhiṣeka, the precious word abhiṣeka. Our three doors become of the natures of vajra body, speech, and mind. We are empowered to meditate on mahāmudrā as the path. We become endowed with the fortune of achieving the svabhāvakāya as the result. Thus, contemplate.
brgyad pa bzod par gsol ba ni/
H. Request for Patience
oM badzra he ru ka sa ma ya sogs/
oṃ vajraheruka samaya…
ma 'byor pa dang nyams pa dang / / gang yang bdag rmongs blo yis ni/ / bgyis pa dang ni bgyid stsal ba/ / de kun mgon pos bzod par gsol/ /
With anything missing or done wrong, or things I did or had others do out of my ignorance, protectors, please be patient.
lhag pa dang ni chad pa dang / / cho ga'i yan lag nyams pa dang / / bdag gis bgyis nongs ci mchis pa/ / de yang mgon pos bzod par gsol/ /
Whatever additions, omissions, and impairments of the sections of the ritual I have done in error, protectors, please be patient.
bag med brjod pa ma dag pa/ / rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin/ / ma lcogs 'khrul pa ci mchis pa/ / de yang mgon pos bzod par gsol/ /
Whatever careless, impure recitations I have done, whatever I have been incapable of or confused about in terms of the rituals taught in the tantras, protectors, please be patient.
zhes nongs pa bshags/
Thus, confess your mistakes.
dgu pa nyer bsdu ni/
I. Dissolution
dkyil 'khor ras bris skabs/ ye shes pa rnams rten 'di nyid la 'byung ba bzhis gnod pas ma zhig gi bar du brtan par bzhugs nas bstan pa dang sems can gyi don mdzad du gsol/

On occasions when there is a cloth-drawn maṇḍala, say: May the wisdom ones firmly reside in this representation as long as it is not destroyed by the damage caused by the four elements. May they be of benefit to the teachings and sentient beings.
oM su pra tiSh+Tha badzrA ya swA hA/ dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
oṃ supratiṣṭha vajrāya svāhā / jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor 'od du zhu nas rang la thim par gyur/
The samaya maṇḍala melts into light and dissolves into me.
bcu pa bsngo ba ni/
J. Dedication

bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nye bar mtshon te bdag dang 'khor 'das sems can thams cad kyi dus gsum du bsags pa dang yod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la brten nas bdag gzhan nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las zhing khams gdul bya sku tshe mdzad pa sogs da lta nyid du mnyam par gyur nas chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i mthar thug gi sems can thams cad 'khor ba dong nas ma sprugs kyi bar du 'bad rtsol dang thogs thug med par 'gro ba'i don rgyun chad med pa 'byung bar gyur cig / sangs rgyas sku bzhi brnyes pa'i byin rlabs dang / sogs sh+lo ka brjod/
bcu gcig pa shis brjod bya ba ni/
K. Expression of Auspiciousness
me (377) tog 'thor la/
Toss flowers and say:
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
sku gsum mngon gyur rdo rje 'chang / / bde gsal mi rtog ngang las ni/ / khams gsum 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i/ / bka' brgyud bla ma'i bkra shis shog /

May there be the auspiciousness of the Kagyu gurus, who are Vajradhara, manifestations of the three kāyas, and who benefit the beings of the three realms from within bliss, clarity, and nonconceptuality.
chos dbyings srid zhi'i ngo bo nyid/ / dkyil 'khor lha yi rnam par shar/ / dran pas dngos grub gnyis 'byung ba'i/ / yi dam lha yi=

May there be the auspiciousness of the yidam deities, who are the dharmadhātu, the essence of existence and peace, appearing in the forms of maṇḍala deities, and who, when recollected, are the sources of the two siddhis.
bla med rgyal ba'i 'khril sbyor yum/ / 'gro kun dge legs sgrub mdzad ma/ / rnal 'byor nyams rtogs skyed pa'i srid/ / ma srid mkha' 'gro'i bkra=

May there be the auspiciousness of the mother and sister ḍākinīs, the female consorts, entwined with the unexcelled victors, mothers who accomplish virtue and excellence for all beings, and sisters who arouse experiences and realizations in yogic practitioners.
chos nyid zhi ba'i ngang bzhugs kyang / / bstan dgra sgrol phyir drag shul can/ / rnal 'byor phrin las kun sgrub pa'i/ / chos skyong srung ma'i=

May there be the auspiciousness of the dharma protectors and guardians, who, though remaining in dharmatā, peace, adopt a fierce mode to free the enemies of the teachings and who accomplish the activities of yogins and yoginīs.
bla ma'i bka' lung dbang bzhi'i don/ / yengs med nyams len dam tshig srung / / rang bas bla ma mched lcam gces/ / rdo rje spun gyi=

May there be the auspiciousness of the vajra siblings, who preserve samaya and practice without distraction the point of the guru’s oral teachings and the four abhiṣekas, and who cherish their gurus and brothers and sisters more than themselves.
gdod nas stong pa chos kyi sku/ / srid zhi gang du'ang ma grub cing / / rang ngo shes pas rang sar grol/ / ye shes sems kyi=
May there be the auspiciousness of the wisdom mind, primordially empty, the dharmakāya, not established at all in either existence or peace and free in its own spot when recognized itself.
mdor na dam pa khyed rnams kyi/ / bden pa chen po'i mthu las ni/ / gnas 'dir dam chos 'phel ba dang / / bde legs phun sum tshogs par shog / ces brjod la bde legs su bya'o/ /

In brief, through the power of the great truth of you, holy ones, may the sacred dharma increase in this place and may there be an abundance of happiness and excellence. Thus, may there be happiness and excellence.
kun las khyad 'phags thun mong ma yin pa'i/ / grub thob snyan nas brgyud pa'i zab chos 'dis/ / skal ldan mtha' dag rgyud smin rnam grol mchog / bde chen rtag pa dam pa'i dpal thob shog /

This profound dharma of the siddhas’ Aural Transmission, which is extraordinary and superior to all, is supreme in maturing and liberating the mindstreams of fortunate ones. May they attain the glory of genuine, eternal great bliss.

ces pa'ang gdams ngag mdzod bka' brgyud rin po che'i khrid rim rnams kyi smin byed du bzhugs su gsol ba dang / mkhan chen bla ma rin po che karma bkra shis 'od zer rab tu rgyas pa'i sde'i zhal snga nas gsung bskul gnang ba ltar/ ris med kyi bstan pa la gus pa karma ngag dbang yon tan rgya mtsho phrin las kun khyab dpal bzang pos rtsa ba'i yi ge gtsang smyon he ru ka'i nor bu skor gsum dang mthun par shrI de bI ko Ti tsA 'dra rin chen brag gi sgrub gnas su rang lo gya bdun par sbyar ba'i yi ge pa ni nye bar gnas pa blo gsal gsang sngags bstan 'dzin nas bgyis pa

In the context of including within The Treasury of Instructions the means of maturation for the precious Kagyu instruction manuals, in accordance with the urging given previously by Khenchen Lama Rinpoche Karma Tashi Özer Raptu Gyepede, [I,] Karma Ngakwang Yönten Gyatso Tinle Kunkhyap Palzangpo, one with faith in the nonsectarian teachings, compiled this in accordance with the Three Cycles of Gems of Tsangnyön Heruka as the root text. This was done in my eighty-seventh year at the retreat center of Śrī Devīkoṭi Tsādra Rinchen Drak. The secretary was my attendant Losel Sangak Tenzin.
dge legs 'phel// // (378) (379)
May virtue and excellence increase. {378}
@#/ /rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma snyan brgyud lhan cig skyes ma'i brda dbang zab mo'i sgrub thabs dbang bskur dang bcas pa zab gsang bde chen shing rta zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ /
26. Chariot of Profound, Secret Great Bliss. The Sādhana and Abhiṣekas for the Profound Symbolic Abhiṣeka of the Sahajā in the Jetsun Vajrayoginī Aural Transmission[1]
(380)@#/ / bla ma dang bcom ldan 'das ma lhan cig skyes ma'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Homage to the gurus and the Bhagavatī, Sahajā.

rjes su rab chags pad rAka lhun po la/ / nyi ma bye bas 'khyud pa'i gzi mdangs kyis/ / 'khor 'das brtan g.yo dbang du byed pa yi/ / bde chen dgyes rol bla ma rnal 'byor mar/ / gus pas btud nas snyan brgyud kyi/ /

To Guru Yoginī, enjoying the delights of great bliss— controlling saṃsāra and nirvāṇa, the animate and inanimate, through the brilliance of embracing, with ten million suns, the padmarāga Meru, intense passion— I bow with respect.
brda dbang zab mos dbang rnon gyi/ / skal ldan rjes su 'dzin pa'i tshul/ / khungs gtsang bklag chog yi ger spel/ /

May there be the flourishing of the pure scriptural sources, liturgical texts, and manuals that are the way to guide fortunate ones of sharp faculties through the profound symbolic abhiṣeka of the Aural Transmission.

'dir rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i nang zab mo brda tsam gyis dbang rnon skal pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud la rdo rje ye shes kyi dbang bzhi'i dgongs pa ngo sprod par byed pa'i gsang lam rmad du byung ba rdo rje 'chang gis rab tu phyes pa'i lam srol brgyud pa rin po che 'di nyid kyi grub thob gong ma dag gi dgongs bcud rmad du byung ba'i sgo nas gzhan rjes su 'dzin par byed pa la

Here, the wondrous secret path that introduces the mindstreams of those possessing sharp faculties and excellent fortune to the realizations of the four abhiṣekas of vajra wisdom by means of just the profound inner symbols of Jetsun Vajrayoginī is the system revealed by Vajradhara. Through the wondrous distilled realizations of the previous siddhas of this precious transmitted system, others are guided.
sbyor ba yo byad kyi gshom ni/
The arrangements of the preparatory requisites are as follows:

gnas dben par yar mar gyi tshes bcu la sogs pa'i dus bzang por gnas khang rgyan dang bkod pas mdzes par brgyan pa'i gung du rten bkram pa'i mdun stegs bu khebs ldan steng / ras chung snyan brgyud yum bka'i dbang bskur rgyas pa dang rjes su 'brel na de nyid kyi lugs ltar dkyil 'khor gsum bkod/ 'di nyid la sger du dgos pa'i brda dbang gi chas bris 'bur sogs gang bder bkod pas 'thus shing /

In an isolated place, on an excellent day, such as the tenth lunar day of the waxing or waning moon, beautifully adorn your dwelling with ornaments and the arrangements. In the center of those, in front of the arranged representations, place a small stand with a covering. If this is being done in connection with the extensive Yum Ka abhiṣeka of the Rechung Aural Transmission, arrange the three maṇḍalas according to that tradition. In keeping with that tradition, arrange what you can, such as drawn or sculpted items for the symbolic abhiṣeka, which are particularly necessary, and that will suffice. {381}

'di nyid khol 'don du byas skabs kyang rdul tshon ras bris gang rung rdo rwa me ris (381) bskor ba'i chos 'byung nang du pad+ma 'dab bzhi'i mthar dur khrod kyis bskor ba bri/ bsdu na maN+Dal tshom bus kyang 'thus/

In the context of doing this as an extract, [use a maṇḍala drawn from] colored powders or a cloth-drawn one, and draw a source of dharmas surrounded by a vajra fence and volcanoes. Within that, draw a four-petaled lotus and the encircling charnel grounds outside. To abbreviate, a maṇḍala with offering piles will suffice.

de'i steng du many+dzi khar thod pa mtshan ldan bdud rtsi ril bu dang sbyar ba'i myos byed blugs la dar dmar gyi bkab de'i steng du me long la sin+d+hu ra brdal bar chos 'byung bsnol ma'i dbus su pad+ma 'dab bzhi/ lte bar hrIH de'i mthar oM gsum ma g.yon bskor/ 'dab bzhi la ha ri ni sas bskor ba bris shing bkod/

Above that, on top of a mañji, place an authentic skull cup. Fill it with an intoxicant made with amṛta pills, and cover it with a red silk cloth. Above that, place a mirror to which sindūra has been applied. Draw crossed sources of dharmas and, in their center, a four-petaled lotus. In the middle, draw hrīḥ and, outside of that, the mantra of the three oṃs, circling counterclockwise. On the four petals, draw ha ri ni sa, circling around.

brda dbang chas mda' gzhu/ phag mgo thod pa/ rgya gram bcas bris 'bur gang rigs phyogs gang bder bzhag / dkyil 'khor mdun nas brtsams mchod yon dang nyer spyod rnams g.yon bskor du bshams/ mdun du nang mchod ka pA lar bdud rtsi ril bu dang sbyar ba'i chang dang / rgyab ngos su 'bul gtor bza' bca' bzang dgu'i brgyan pa bsham/ spro na tshogs kyi yo byad kyang 'du bya/

The symbolic abhiṣeka accoutrements—a bow and arrow, pig’s head, skull cup, crossed [vajras], either drawn or sculpted, whatever you can acquire—should be placed wherever it is convenient. Starting from in front of the maṇḍala, arrange the offering water and the traditional offerings in a counterclockwise circle. In front, place the inner offering kapāla with alcohol mixed with amṛta pills. To the rear, place an offering torma with food and adorned with everything excellent. If you wish to elaborate, gather the requisite items for a feast.
gzhan yang sngon gtor/ las bum/ sbyar spos/ rang nyid kyi mdun du rdor dril/ Da ma ru/ nang mchod sogs tshogs par bya'o/ /
Furthermore, arrange the preliminary torma, activity vase, and incense. Place in front of yourself a vajra and ghaṇṭā, ḍamaru, inner offering, and so forth.
nyams len dngos la gsum/ sngon 'gro/ dngos gzhi/ rjes so/ /
The actual practice has three parts: (1) the preliminaries, (2) the main practice, and (3) the conclusion.[2]
dang po
I. The Preliminaries
['di] la bdud rtsi byin rlabs/ sngon gtor/ srung 'khor/ mchod pa byin rlabs/ skyabs sems so/ /
This has [five] parts: (1) consecrating the amṛta, (2) the preliminary torma, (3) the protection cakra, (4) consecrating the offerings, and (5) refuge and bodhicitta.
dang po ni/
A. Consecrating the Amṛta
bdag nyid skad cig gis rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i skur gsal bar gyur/
Instantly I clearly become the form of Jetsun Vajrayoginī. {382}
oM khaN+Da ro he sa (382) bsang / swa b+hA wa sa sbyangs/
Cleanse with oṃ khaṇḍarohe[3] and purify with svabhāva.
dam tshig rdzas rnams mi dmigs gyur pa las/ /
The samaya substances become unobservable.
yaM las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu yi dbyibs/ / ba dan gnyis kyis mtshan pa de yi steng / / raM las me yi dkyil 'khor gru gsum dmar/ / zur gsum raM gyis mtshan pa de yi steng / /
From that, from yaṃ, is a maṇḍala of wind, bow-shaped, marked by two pennants. Above that, from raṃ, is a maṇḍala of fire, triangular and red, marked by raṃs at its three corners.
kaM las mi mgo'i sgyed po gsum la gnas/ / a las thod pa yangs shing rgya che'i nang / / go ku da ha na las sha lnga dang / / bi mu ma ra shu las bdud rtsi lngas/ /

Above that, from kaṃs, are three hearths of human heads. Resting there, from a, is a skull cup, spacious and vast. It is filled with, from go ku da ha na, the five meats and, from vi mu ma ra śu, the five amṛtas.
yongs su gang ba'i steng du a yig las/ / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor kha chod tshul du'o/ / de steng rdo rje sngon po hU~M gis mtshan/ /
Above it, from the letter a, is a moon maṇḍala, resting as a lid. Above that is a blue vajra marked by hūṃ.
sngo dmar dkar ba'i hU~M AHoM yig ni/ / mgo bo 'og tu phyogs las 'od 'phros pas/ / rlung g.yos me sbar rdzas rnams zhu ba yi/ / rlangs pas zla ba zhu zhing 'dres pa dang / /
Blue, red, and white hūṃ, āḥ, and oṃ letters, with their heads facing down, radiate light. Wind moves, fire blazes, and the substances melt. The steam causes the moon to melt and mix.
rang gi snying ga'i 'od zer hU~M la phog / bdud rtsir zhu dang 'dres pas kha dog sngo/ / AHyig zhu bas nyi ma 'char kha bzhin/ / oM yig zhu bas zla zhun mdog tu snang / /

Light rays from my heart strike the hūṃ. It melts into the amṛta and mixes, becoming the color blue. The letter āḥ melts, looking like the sun at dawn. The letter oṃ melts, appearing as the color of the setting moon.
oM AHhU~M/ rdo rjes lan gsum dkrugs pas dri ro reg / skyon rnams bsal te nus pa phun tshogs byas/ / lte ba'i sa bon 'od kyis ye shes kyi/ / bdud rtsi bkug ste ro gcig 'dres par gyur/ /

oṃ āḥ hūṃ Stirred three times by the vajra, all impurities of scent, taste, and tactile sensation are removed, and its potency is enhanced. Light from the seed syllable at the center attracts wisdom amṛta, which blends in as one taste.
ces nang mchod byin gyis brlabs nas mtheb srin gyis myang ste kha dag par byas/
Thus, the inner offering is consecrated. Taste it using your thumb and ring finger, and purify your mouth.
gnyis pa
B. The Preliminary Torma
sngon gtor nang mchod ltar byin rlabs byas nas/ 'bar ba'i rgyas pheM pheM pheM gyis mgron rnams spyan drangs la/ pad skor rdor thal kha phye bas/
Consecrate the preliminary torma as you did the inner offering. With the blazing mudrā and pheṃ pheṃ pheṃ, invite the guests. With a lotus circle opening to vajra palms, say:
oM kha kha khA hi sogs gsum gyis phul nas/
oṃ kha kha khāhi… Saying that three times, offer.
zhing skyong chen po sogs nas/

Eight great field protectors, [thirty-two ḍākinīs, with all your retinues, please come here. Accept this offering and gift of torma May we yogins and yoginīs with our retinues be without illness, have long lives, might, glory, fame, excellent fortune, and vast enjoyments. Bestow on us the siddhis of actions: pacifying, enriching, and the others. Samaya holders, protect us. Be our friend and aid for the siddhis. May we not meet with untimely death, illness, spirits, or hindrances. May we not have bad dreams, bad omens, or bad interactions. May there be peace in the world, good harvests, plentiful grains, the flourishing of dharma, and an abundance of goodness.]
yid la 'dod pa kun 'grub mdzod/
May all that we desire be accomplished.
ces phrin las bcol te gtor ma phyi rol du dor/
Thus, entrust them with activity. Throw the torma outside.
gang dag nag po'i phyogs gyur pa/ sogs nas hU~M bzhi'i sngags bcas nag phyogs bskrad do/ /

All those on the dark side, [who are not permitted to hear or see the rituals of the profound Secret Mantra, must go elsewhere—everyone. Those who transgress this command will have their heads shattered into a hundred pieces by the blazing vajra khaṭvāṃga weapon. All obstructors will be crushed—rest assured.] With the mantra of the four hūṃs, drive out those on the dark side.
gsum pa ni/
C. The Protection Cakra
oM badzra rak+Sha rak+Sha hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/
oṃ vajra rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā
'og thams cad rdo rje'i sa gzhi/ bar thams cad rdo rje'i ra ba dang drwa ba/ steng thams cad rdo rje'i gur dang bla bres su gyur par bsam/
Below, all is a vajra ground. Between, everything is a vajra fence and net. Above, all is a vajra tent and canopy. Thus, contemplate.
bzhi pa ni/
D. Consecrating the Offerings
nang mchod 'thor/ (383) zhing / khaN+Da ro he sa bsang / swa b+hA wa sa sbyangs/
Sprinkle with the inner offering. {383} Cleanse with khaṇḍarohe, and purify with svabhāva.

stong pa'i ngang las a las thod pa'i snod yangs shing rgya che ba rnams kyi nang du/ hU~M yig nag po'i tshogs dpag tu med pa 'od du zhu ba las byung zhing lha rdzas las grub pa'i rdo rje'i mchod yon/ me tog / bdug spos/ mar me/ dri chab/ zhal zas/ rol mo la sogs pa mchod pa'i sprin rab 'byams nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam par gyur/

Within emptiness, from a’s, are skull-cup vessels, spacious and vast. Within them, innumerable black letter hūṃs melt into light, from which appear vast clouds of offerings: vajra offering water, flowers, incense, lamps, scented water, food, music, and more, all made from divine substances and equaling the expanse of space.
oM badzra Ar+g+haM nas/ shab+da 'i bar gyis byin brlab/
oṃ vajra arghaṃ…śabda… Thus, consecrate.
lnga pa ni/
E. Refuge and Bodhicitta
bdag sogs 'gro ba nam mkha'i sogs skyabs 'gro dang /

I and others, all beings who equal space [take refuge in the buddhas. We take refuge in the genuine dharma. We take refuge in the saṅgha. We take refuge in the gurus, the embodiment of all.][4] Thus, take refuge.
sangs rgyas chos tshogs sogs kyis skyabs sems lan grangs gang nus bya/

In the Buddha, dharma, and supreme assembly, [I take refuge until attaining awakening. Through amassing acts of generosity and so forth, may I achieve buddhahood to benefit all beings.] Recite [liturgies] for refuge and bodhicitta as many times as you can.
gzhan yang / bdag nyid skad cig gis rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor mar gsal ba'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyis tshogs zhing rnams spyan drangs par bsam la/ dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/ /
Next: Instantly, I appear clearly as Jetsun Vajrayoginī. The seed syllable in my heart invites the field of accumulation. Thus, contemplate and say: I take refuge in the three jewels.
sogs yan lag bdun pa lan gsum bya/ mthar/

[I confess each and every negative action and unvirtuous deed. I rejoice in the virtuous actions of all beings. I supplicate you to turn the wheel of dharma. I supplicate you not to pass into nirvāṇa. May I abide on the path of yoga. May I guard all samayas. May I achieve the freeing of all sentient beings from suffering. May I become a buddha: one endowed with all the most sublime manifestations, the virtues of the teachings, and so on. May I liberate all beings.] Recite the sevenfold service three times and, at the end, say:
tshogs zhing rnams rang nyid la thim par gyur/
The field of accumulation dissolves into me.
oM AHhU~M/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ
sems can thams cad bde ba dang sogs tshad med bzhi sgom pa sogs bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa ste sngon 'gro'i rim pa'o/ /

May all sentient beings have happiness [and the causes of happiness. May all sentient beings be free from suffering and the causes of suffering. May all sentient beings never be separated from the genuine happiness that is free from suffering. May all sentient beings abide in the great equanimity that is free from attachment and aggression to those near and far.] Cultivating the four immeasurables and so forth are the gathering of the accumulation of merit. Those are the stages of the preliminaries.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi
II. The Main Practice
['di] la gsum/ bdag bskyed/ mdun bskyed thod pa sgrub pa dang bcas pa'i mthar dbang bskur ba'o/ /
This has three parts: (1) the self visualization, (2) the front visualization with the skull-cup practice, and, at the end, (3) the bestowal of the abhiṣekas.[5]
dang po ni/
A. The Self Visualization
swa b+hA wa sogs/ stong pa nyid du gyur ces dbang bzhi pa'i don la mnyam par bzhag pa ye shes kyi tshogs gsog /
svabhāva… All is emptiness. Rest evenly in the nature of the fourth abhiṣeka. That is the amassing of the accumulation of wisdom.

stong pa'i ngang las srung ba'i 'khor lo dur khrod chen po brgyad dang bcas pa'i dbus su e las chos kyi 'byung gnas gru gsum pa/ rtsa ba phra zhing gdengs ka che ba/ phyi dkar la nang dmar ba yangs shing rgya che ba'i dbus su/ paM las sna tshogs pad+ma dang ra~M las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rang sems yi ge hrIHdmar po las 'od zer 'phros/ 'phags pa mchod/ sems can gyi sgrib gnyis bag chags dang bcas pa sbyangs nas rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i ngo bor gyur/

Within emptiness, in the middle of the protection cakra and the eight great charnel grounds, from e, is a triangular source of dharmas. Its apex is tiny and its top wide open. It is white on the outside and red on the inside, spacious and vast. In its center, from paṃ, is a multicolored lotus. From raṃ is a sun maṇḍala. On top of that is my own mind as a red letter hrīḥ. Light rays radiate from that, making offerings to the noble ones and, by purifying their two obscurations and latent tendencies, causing sentient beings become of the essence of Vajrayoginī. {384}

slar 'dus te hrIHla (384)thim pa yongs su gyur pa las/ rang nyid rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma sku mdog rab tu dmar zhing nyi ma 'bum gyi 'od zer 'phro ba/ spyan gsum khro zhing 'dzum pa'i nyams dang ldan pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyangs pas 'jigs byed nag po dang / g.yon bskums pas dus mtshan ma dmar mo mnan pa/ dbu skra nag po'i tshogs sil bur grol ba la thod skam lnga'i dbu rgyan dang ldan pa/ thod rlon lnga bcu'i do shal 'phyang zhing gcer bu phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa/ phyag g.yas rdo rje gri gug thur du brkyang bas gdug pa can la bsdig pa/ g.yon bdud bzhi'i khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa thugs kar 'dzin pa/ gru mo na rdo rje'i kha T+wAM ga la DA ma ru dang / dril bu dar dpyang gis spras pa bsnams pa/ lang tsho phun sum tshogs shing gzi brjid dang ldan pa/ bskal pa 'jig dus kyi me ltar 'bar ba'i phreng ba 'khrugs pa'i dbus na bzhugs pa'i lte bar oM ba~M dmar po las rdo rje phag mo dmar mo/ /

Next, the light rays gather back and dissolve into the hrīḥ. It transforms, and I am Jetsun Vajrayoginī, intensely red, radiating the light of a hundred thousand suns. I have three eyes and the moods of being fierce and smiling. My right leg is extended, pressing down on black Bhairava. My left leg is drawn up, trampling on red Kālarātri. My mass of black hair is loose and free, and I have a crown of five dried skulls. I wear a necklace of fifty fresh skulls, am naked, and have the five mudrās. My right hand is outstretched holding a vajra hooked knife downward threatening malevolent ones. My left holds a skull cup filled with the blood of the four māras at my heart. In the crook of that elbow rests a vajra khaṭvāṃga decorated with a ḍamaru, ghaṇṭā, and silk ribbons. I am majestic and full of splendor. I reside in the middle of raging garlands of flames, like the fire that destroys an eon. At my navel, from red oṃ vaṃ, is red Vajravārāhī.

snying gar ha~M ya~M sngon po las gshin rje ma sngon mo/ / khar hrIM ma~M dkar mo las rmongs byed ma dkar mo/ / mgo bor hriM hriM ser po las skyong byed ma ser mo/ / spyi gtsug tu hU~M hU~M ljang gu las skrag byed ma ljang gu/ yan lag thams cad la phaT phaT dud ka las tsaN+Di ka dud kha/ shar du ha las rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma sngon po sogs nas/ byang dus las las kyi mkha' 'gro ma ljang gu/ de thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis gri gug dang thod khrag bsnams shing rgyan cha lugs thams cad gtso mo dang mtshungs pa'o/ / gtso mo'i thugs kar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i hrIH'i 'od zer gyis ye shes pa dbang lha dang bcas pa spyan drangs/

At my heart, from blue haṃ yoṃ, is blue Yāminī. At my mouth, from white hriṃ moṃ, is white Mohanī. At my head, from yellow hreṃ hriṃ, is yellow Saṃcālanī. At the crown of my head, from green hūṃ hūṃ, is green Saṃtrāsanī. In all my limbs, from smoky phaṭ phaṭ, is smoky Caṇḍikā. In the east, from ha, is blue Vajraḍākinī. [In the south, from ri, is yellow Ratnaḍākinī. In the west, from ni, is red Padmaḍākinī.] In the north, from sa, is green Karmaḍākinī. They all have one face and two hands, holding hooked knives and skull cups. Their ornaments and attributes are the same as those of the principal one. In my heart, as the principal one, resting on a sun maṇḍala is hrīḥ. Its light rays invite the wisdom ones together with the abhiṣeka deities.
oM badzra Ar+g+haM sogs nas/ shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ vajra arghaṃ…śabda Thus, offer.
dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH gnyis su med par gyur/
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ They become nondual.
dbang gi lha rnams kyis dbang bskur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / chu'i lhag ma yar lud pa las rnam par snang mdzad kyis dbu brgyan par (385) gyur/
The abhiṣeka deities confer the abhiṣekas. My body is filled, my stains purified, and the excess water rises up and my head is crowned with Vairocana. {385}
slar yang thugs ka'i sa bon las spros pa'i lha mo rnams kyis mchod par gyur/ par bsam la/
Next, from the seed syllable in my heart, emanated goddesses make offerings. Thus, contemplate and say:
oM shrI badzra wA ra hi Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/ nas/ shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ śrīvajravārahi arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā…śabda… Thus, offer.
oM pany+tsa a mr-i ta swa dA naM swa b+hA wa At+ma ko‘haM/ zhes pas nang mchod 'bul/
oṃ pañca amṛta svadānaṃ svabhāva atmako ’haṃ Thus, present the inner offering.
gang gi drin gyis bde chen nyid/ sogs sh+lo ka dang /
Through your kindness, great bliss [arises in an instant. To the lotus feet of the guru, with a precious vajra body, I bow.] Say that śloka and:
stong nyid snying rje'i snying po can/ / khams gsum pa yi ngo bo nyid/ / bskal pa'i me ltar 'bar ba'i 'od/ / rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la 'dud/ /
Emptiness with the heart of compassion, the essential nature of the three realms, with light blazing like the eon-ending fires: I bow to Vajrayoginī.
dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / sogs sh+lo ka dang /
Glorious Vajraḍākinī, [cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage.] Say that śloka and:
bde ba ngang rig ma skyes pa/ / ji bzhin nyid du rtogs gyur pas/ / gzhan don mthar phyin mdzad pa yi/ / rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Vidyā, born within bliss, through your realization of suchness, you perfect the benefit for others. Homage to the Yoginī.
ji snyed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / kun rtog 'ching ba gcod mdzad cing / / 'jig rten bya ba rab 'jug pa'i/ / de snyed rnams la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
To all the many vajraḍākinīs who cut through the bonds of concepts and engage the things of the world, to all of them, I pay homage and offer praise.
bde gshegs sku la gnyis mid 'khril/ / zag med bde ba sku nyams bstar/ / sems can rnams la bde ster ma/ / phag mo'i sku la phyag 'tshal 'dud/ /
Entwined in a nondual way with the Sugata’s form, having the experience of undefiled bliss in the body, you are the one to bestow bliss on sentient beings. I bow and pay homage to the body of Vārāhī.
lte ba'i dbus gnas 'byung bzhi 'phro/ / sogs sh+lo ka kyang bstod/
Abiding in the middle of the navel, radiating the four elements [with the perfection of the dharma and saṃbhoga, gatherer of ḍākinīs, I bow and offer praises to Jetsunma.] Praise with those ślokas.
bzlas pa ni/
The recitation.

thugs kar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du hrIHyig sngags phreng g.yon bskor dang bcas pa las 'od zer 'phros/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs thams cad kyi thugs rgyud bskul te de dag gi ye shes bdag gi rgyud la zhugs/ sdig sgrib thams cad dag / tshe bsod dpal 'byor ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan thams cad 'phel zhing rgyas par gyur/ zhes dmigs la/

In my heart, on a sun maṇḍala, is the letter hrīḥ with the mantra garland surrounding it counterclockwise. From that, light rays stream forth, arousing the mindstreams of the assembly of buddhas, bodhisattvas, heroes, and yoginīs. Their wisdom enters my mindstream, purifies my negative actions and obscurations, and increases and expands all excellent qualities of longevity, merit, prosperity, and samādhi. Thus, visualize.
snying po oM gsum ma dang / nye snying / oM hrIHhU~M swA hA/ zhes ci nus bzlas mthar/
Recite the essence mantra, the three oṃs, and the quintessence, oṃ hrīḥ hūṃ svāhā, as much as possible. At the end:
snod bcud thams cad 'od gsal bde ba chen po'i ngang du gyur ces stong nyid du bcug / slar yang zung 'jug lhan cig skyes ma'i skur gsal bar blta'o/ /
The entire environment and its inhabitants become a state of luminosity, great bliss. Thus, they have become emptiness. Again, all is seen clearly to be the body of the Sahajā, unification.
gnyis pa mdun bskyed dkyil 'khor dang me long la dmigs te/
B. The Maṇḍala of the Front Visualization and the Visualization for the Mirror
oM AHhU~M gsum gyis bsang ba dang /
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Saying that three times, cleanse. {386}
zlum bskor (386) dang / chos 'byung rnams bya/
Create a circle and a source of dharmas.
hrIHha ri ni sa/
hrīḥ ha ri ni sa

chos 'byung pad+ma 'dab bzhi lte ba dang bcas par yi ge lnga yongs su gyur pa las/ rje btsun ma gtso 'khor lnga sku mdog phyag mtshan rgyan cha lugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i thugs ka'i sa bon yi ge lnga las 'od zer 'phros/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin rlabs sngags phreng gi rnam par spyan drangs nas me long gi sngags 'khor la thim par gyur/ ces bsam la/ oM gsum ma ci ltar rigs pa bzla'o/ /

In a source of dharmas and on a lotus, with four petals and a center, those five letters transform, becoming Jetsunma, the principal one, and her retinue, the five. Their colors, emblems, ornaments, and attributes are all complete. From the five seed letters at their hearts, light rays radiate, inviting the blessings of all buddhas in the form of mantra garlands, which dissolve into the mantra circle on the mirror. Thus, contemplate and repeat the mantra of the three oṃs as much as you can.
thed pa sgrub pa ni/
The practice of the kapāla.
oM AHhU~M/ hrIHha ri ni sa/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ / hrīḥ ha ri ni sa

rlung me thod sgyed kyi steng du ka pA la phyi dkar la nang dmar ba yangs shing rgya che ba'i nang du/ chos 'byung pad+ma 'dab bzhi lte ba dang bcas par yi ge lngas mtshan par gyur/ par dmigs pa dang bcas oM gsum ma ci rigs bzlas/ mthar lag pa g.yon du/

Above wind, fire, and a hearth of skulls is a kapāla, white on the outside, red on the inside, spacious and vast. Inside that is a source of dharmas and lotus, with four petals and a center, marked by the five letters. Thus, visualize and repeat the mantra of the three oṃs as much as you can. At the end, on your left hand:
hrIHha ri ni sa/
hrīḥ ha ri ni sa
chos 'byung pad+ma 'dab bzhi lte ba dang bcas par yi ge lnga yongs su gyur pa las rje btsun ma gtso 'khor lnga sku mdog phyag mtshan rgyan cha lugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gyur/

In a source of dharmas and on a lotus, with four petals and a center, those five letters transform, becoming Jetsunma, the principal one, and her retinue, the five. Their colors, emblems, ornaments, and attributes are all complete.
oM badzra puSh+pe AHhU~M/ sogs nyer spyod lngas mchod/
oṃ vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ… Present the five traditional offerings.

lag pa lha'i dkyil 'khor bdud rtsir zhu ba/ thod pa sngags kyi dkyil 'khor dang dbyer med du gyur pa las ngo bo lha dang sngags kyi rang bzhin rnam pa ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i rgya mtsho chen por gyur/ par bsam la/

The maṇḍala of deities on my hand melts into amṛta and becomes inseparable with the maṇḍala of the mantra in the kapāla. It becomes in essence the deities, the nature of mantra, and a great ocean of wisdom amṛta in manifestation. Thus, contemplate.
oM AHhU~M gsum brjod/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Say that three times.

srin lag gis blangs te rang dang phyogs mtshams mchod rdzas la 'thor zhing / drwa gur dang / ba spu'i bu ga rnams mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs dang / bdud rtsir gyur/ par bsam zhing oM gsum ma lan gsum brjod/

Take up the amṛta with your ring finger and sprinkle it on yourself, in all directions, and on the offering substances. The net, tent, and pores become assemblies of ḍākinīs and amṛta. Contemplate that and say the mantra of the three oṃs three times.
oM phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo dpal ldan rtsa ba'i bla ma'i zhal du oM AHhU~M/
oṃ To the glorious root gurus, the essence of the tathāgatas of the ten directions and three times, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
gzhan yang brgyud pa'i bla ma dam pa rnams dang / yi dam dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dpa' bo mkha' 'gro chos skyong srung ma thams cad kyi zhal du=
To the genuine gurus of the lineage, the assembled yidam deities of the maṇḍala, to the buddhas, bodhisattvas, heroes, heroines, ḍākinīs, and dharma protectors and guardians, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
'bru gsum brjod pas rang gis myang / gong ltar mchod bstod mdor bsdus bya/ gtor (387) ma nang mchod ltar byin gyis brlab la/ pheM gsum gyis gtor mgron spyan drangs la/

Saying the three seed syllables, taste this yourself. Do the abbreviated offerings and praises as above. {387} Consecrate the torma as you did the inner offering. With three pheṃs, invite the torma guests.
na mo rat+na gu ru e daM ba liM ta kha kha khA hi khA hi/
namo ratna guru idaṃ baliṃta kha kha khāhi khāhi
zhes pas bla ma dang /
Thus, offer to the gurus.
oM gsum ma'i mthar i daM sogs brtags pas bcom ldan 'das ma la ste lan gsum res 'bul/ mchod bstod mdor bsdus bya'o/ /
Adding idaṃ…to the end of the mantra of the three oṃs, offer to the Bhagavatī. Do each three times. Do the abbreviated offerings and praises.
de nas slob ma la ji tsam bskur ba'i dbang bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis blang bar bya ba yin no/ /
Then, through your own samādhi of visualizations, take whatever abhiṣekas you will be bestowing on the disciples.
slob ma la dbang bskur ba'i tshul ni/
[C.] The Way to Bestow the Abhiṣekas on Disciples

las bum du khaN+Da ro he bskyed bzlas 'od zhu byas pa'i chus slob ma rnams phyi rol du khrus nas dbyung zhing / sngon gtor srung mtshams gong du smos pa bzhin btang nas me tog bkye bsdu grub pa dang bsam pa 'chos pa'i chos bshad ji ltar rigs pa'i mthar lo rgyus kyi des shes bskyed pa ni/

Using the water in the activity vase—that has been generated as Khaṇḍarohe, with the recitations, and has melted into light—the disciples should wash outside and discard [that water]. Do the preliminary torma and set up the protection boundaries as described above. Distribute and collect the flowers. Explain the dharma that is the attitude to be adopted, in an appropriate way. Finally, generate certainty in the following account.

'dir ma rgyud mtha' dag gi yang snying bcom ldan 'das 'khor lo sdom pa'i yum bka'i dkyil 'khor rnal 'byor gsang mtha'i rgyud sde thams cad kyi yang snying zab pa las kyang ches zab pa ste/ spyir sangs rgyas thams cad skyed mdzad kyi yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma nyid/ rdo rje snyems ma dang / sna tshogs yum bdag med ma/ rdo rje phag mo sogs mtshan dang sku'i rnam 'gyur mtha' yas pa las 'dir rdo rje phag mo/ /

Here, the maṇḍala of the Yum Ka of the Bhagavān, Cakrasaṃvara, the innermost essence of all tantras is even more profound than the profound innermost essence of all classes of tantras of the final secret yogas. Generally speaking, the mother who gives birth to all buddhas has infinite names and forms, such as Prajñāpāramitā, Vajragarvā, Viśvamātā, Nairātmyā, and Vajravārāhī. Here she is Vajravārāhī.

de la'ang rgyud gzhung so so'i rjes su 'brangs ba'i sgrub thabs du ma'i nang na khyad par du 'phags pa'i bka' babs kyi chu bo thams cad gcig tu 'dres pa ste/ dang po khyab bdag rdo rje 'chang dang 'khor lo'i dbang mo dbyer med pas bram ze chen po sang ha rjes su bzung / de nas sha ba ra/ kor ni ru ba/ tsang ngu pa/ 'gar sngags nan nas rje sgam po pa la brgyud pa zhal gnyis ma'i phyogs dang /

Among the many sādhanas that follow the individual texts of the tantras, this one blends into one all the rivers of the special entrusted transmissions. First, the omnipresent lord Vajradhara and the Empress of the Cakras, inseparable, guided the Great Brahman, Saraha. Then, the transmission passed to Śavara, Kor Nirupa, Tsang Ngupa, Gar Ngakgen,[6] and to the exalted Gampopa. That is for the Lady of Two Faces.

chos sku ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro mas mnga' bdag mai tri pa/ des rje btsun chos kyi blo gros brda'i dbang zab mos smin par mdzad pa ni rdo rje'i mgur las gsal bar gsungs pa ltar rim pas brgyud pa zhal gnyis ma'i nye brgyud dang /

The dharmakāya Jñānaḍākinī matured the master Maitrīpa through the profound symbolic abhiṣeka, and then he matured Jetsun Chökyi Lodrö through the profound symbolic abhiṣeka, as is clearly stated in a vajra song. This was transmitted gradually and is the short transmission of the Lady of Two Faces.

drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen pos dpal tai lo sangs rgyas/ des paN chen nA ro (388) zhabs/ des bod yul phyi dar gyi lo tsA ba thams cad kyi rgyal po rtsod med grub thob dgyes mdzad rdo rje dngos snang lho brag mar pa la gnang ba rim par mi la ras chen/ mnyam med dwags po sogs las brgyud pa ni snyan brgyud lhan cig skyes ma rang gzhung gi don brgyud dang /

The transmission that passed from great Vajradhara, the sixth one, to the glorious Tilopa buddha, to the great paṇḍita Nāropa, {388} to Lhodrak Marpa, the king of lotsāwas during the later spread [of dharma] in Tibet, an undisputed siddha who manifested Hevajra in actuality, to the great Milarepa, to the unequaled Gampopa, and then on is the ultimate transmission of this text, the Aural Transmission Sahajā.

khyad par snyan brgyud lhan skyes ma'i dbang dang man ngag mtha' dag rje mar pas byang phyogs tsam na che ba'i grub thob yongs gyi spyi mes rje btsun bzhad pa rdo rjer bum pa gang byor stsal/ rje btsun gyis rgyas 'bring bsdus pa'i skor tsho gsum du phyes te thugs kyi sras mchog gsam la gtso bor gnang ba'i rtsa ba'i smin byed rgyas pa zur du mchis pa las/ 'dir de dag gi snying po'i gsang don zab mo brda'i dbang bzhi byin rlabs gyi tshul du bskur ba ni/ rje btsun ras pas/

In particular, all the abhiṣekas and esoteric instructions of the Aural Transmission Sahajā were bestowed by the exalted Marpa, the grandfather of all siddhas in the northern lands, on Jetsun Shepa Dorje, as if he were filling a vase. The Jetsun divided these into three cycles, extensive, intermediate, and abbreviated, which he primarily gave to his three supreme heart sons. Putting the extensive means of maturation, which is the root of those, to the side, here, the way to bestow the four profound symbolic abhiṣekas—the ultimate secret of the heart of those abhiṣekas—in the form of blessings, is as follows. Jetsun Repa sang:
nang zab mo brda yi dbang bzhi de/ / dus da lta bskur na dga' ba la/ / da lta bskur na skyid pa la/ / nga 'bul ba chung yang 'bul snying 'dod/ / mos gus chung yang zhu ba zhig lags te/

The four inner profound symbolic abhiṣekas: What joy if they were bestowed right now. What happiness if they were bestowed now. Although I have little to offer, I long in my heart to make offerings. Although my devotion is small, I request the four.

zhes gsungs pa ltar gsang ba'i de kho na nyid dbang rnon gyi rgyud la rtsol ba med pa brda tsam gyi thabs la brten nas ngo sprod cing rgyud smin par byed pa'i gdams pa zab mo 'di nyid kyi brgyud pa'i chu bo thams cad gcig 'des kyi lugs su/ 'dir rje btsun 'ja' tshon gyi sku can skyes bu ras chung rdo rje grags pa'i bka' srol snyan brgyud 'khor lo sdom pa yab yum 'bring po las yum bka' lhan cig skyes ma dang 'brel ba'i zab mo brda'i dbang gis skal ldan gyis rgyud smin par bgyid pa skabs su bab pa la thog mar zhu ba'i yon du dmigs te maN+Dal 'bul bar zhu/ zhes mtshams sbyar maN+Dal phul nas/

These profound instructions—that, for those with sharp faculties, point out the secret suchness and mature their mindstreams using the effortless method of just symbols—combine into one all the rivers of transmission. Now, [in keeping with] that tradition, what will be given comes from the intermediate [system of] the Aural Transmission of Cakrasaṃvara, male and female consorts, the system of Jetsun Rechung Dorje Drakpa, a being with a rainbow body. This is the occasion when the mindstreams of fortunate ones will be matured through the profound symbolic abhiṣekas connected to the Yum Ka, Sahajā. First, visualize a gift to request the abhiṣeka, and offer a maṇḍala. Having made the introduction and offered a maṇḍala, say:
de ltar maN+Dal phul bas mtshams sbyar nas dbang gi ched du gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos mdzod/
Having made the connection by offering a maṇḍala, to supplicate for the abhiṣeka, repeat the following:

dam pa rje btsun pa rnams dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i lha tshogs thams cad la bdag phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su mchi'o/ / bdag la de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes nam (389) mkha' lta bus gang bar mdzad du gsol/ smin par mdzad du gsol/ yongs su smin par mdzad du gsol/ shin tu smin par mdzad du gsol/

To the genuine exalted ones and the assembly of deities of Vajrayoginī, I pay homage and take refuge. {389} Please fill me with the space-like wisdom of thusness. Please mature me. Please fully mature me. Please truly mature me.
de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes nor bu lta bus gang bar mdzad du gsol sogs gong ltar/ de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes bdud rtsi lta bus sogs gong ltar gsol ba gdab/
Please fill me with the gem-like wisdom of thusness… Continue as above. Please fill me with the amṛta-like wisdom of thusness… Supplicate as above.
ye shes pa dbab pa la/
The descent of the wisdom ones.

da ye shes pa dbab pa dbang gi gzhi dgod pa la lus gnad dang ldan pas dmigs pa 'di ltar mdzod/ slob ma rnams skad cig gis sna tshogs pad+ma dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du hrIHyig dmar po yongs su gyur pa las rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma sku mdog rab tu dmar zhing nyi ma 'bum gyi 'od zer 'phro ba/

Now, to establish the foundation for the abhiṣeka, the descent of the wisdom ones, sitting with the vital points for the body, visualize the following: Disciples, you are instantly a red letter hrīḥ on top of a multicolored lotus and sun maṇḍala. That transforms, and you are Jetsun Vajrayoginī, intensely red, radiating the light of a hundred thousand suns.

spyan gsum khro zhing 'dzum pa'i nyams dang ldan pa/ dbu skra nag po'i tshogs sil bur grol ba la thod skam lngas dbu brgyan pa/ thod rlon lnga bcu'i do shal 'phyang zhing gcer mo phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa/ phyag g.yas pas rdo rje'i gri gug zur du bsdig pa/ g.yon pas gdug pa'i khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa thugs kar 'dzin pa/ gru mo na rdo rje'i kha T+wAM ga la DA ma ru dang / dril bu dar dpyang gis spras pa bsnams pa/ zhabs g.yas brkyang bas 'jigs byed nag po dang / g.yon bskums pas dus mtshan ma dmar mo mnan pa/ gzhon nu ma'i lang tsho'i dpal phun sum tshogs pa/ bskal pa 'jig dus kyi me ltar 'bar ba'i phreng ba 'khrugs pa'i dbus na bzhugs pa/

You have three eyes and the moods of being fierce and smiling. Your mass of black hair is loose and free, and you have a crown of five dried skulls. You wear a necklace of fifty fresh skulls, are naked, and have the five mudrās. Your right hand holds a vajra hooked knife downward in a threatening manner. With your left, you hold a skull cup filled with the blood of malevolent ones at your heart. In the crook of that elbow rests a vajra khaṭvāṃga decorated with a ḍamaru, ghaṇṭā, and silk ribbons. Your right leg is extended, pressing down on black Bhairava. Your left leg is drawn up, trampling on red Kālarātri. You have the abundant glory of youthful splendor. You reside in the middle of raging garlands of flames, like the fire that destroys an eon.

de'i smin mtshams su'ang rje btsun ma'i sku gsal la dod pa mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar 'khor ba/ snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na bai ro tsa na'i sngags phreng g.yon bskor du dmar sga ra ra 'khor ba/ lte bar chos 'byung dmar po'i dbus na pad+ma 'dab bzhi'i lte bar hrIH 'dab ma bzhi la ha ri ni sa g.yon du 'khor ba/

At the point between your eyebrows, a form of Jetsunma appears clearly and prominently, turning like a circling firebrand. At your heart, on a sun maṇḍala, is the mantra garland of vairocana, counterclockwise, spinning as a red circle. At your navel, in the center of a red source of dharmas, is a four-petaled lotus, in whose center is hrīḥ. On its four petals are ha ri ni sa turning counterclockwise.

de ltar gsal ba'i lha dang yig 'bru rnams las 'od zer (390) 'phros pas lus kyi nang gang sdig pa dang sgrib pa thams cad dag / slar yang sin+d+hU ra'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi hrIHyig las 'od zer dmar po rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i lha tshogs rnams kyi rnam pa dpag tu med pa 'phros/ slob ma'i snying ga dang lte ba'i hrIHla thim pas zag pa med pa'i bde ba chen pos gang bar gyur pa'i mos pa mdzod cig / byas la 'beb rdzas bdug / thod rnga dang dril bu'i sgra sbyar bas/

From those visualized deities and seed letters, light rays stream forth. {390} Filling the interior of your body, your negative actions and obscurations are purified. Again, from the letter hrīḥ in the middle of the sindūra maṇḍala, immeasurable red light rays in the form of the assembled deities of Vajrayoginī radiate. Disciples, it dissolves into your hearts and the hrīḥs at your navels. Feel that you are filled with undefiled great bliss. Fumigate with the descent substances and, with the sounds of a skull-cup drum and ghaṇṭā, say:
oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/ badzra wA ra hi a be shA ya AHAH
oṃ vajravairocanīye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā / vajravārahi aveśāya āḥ āḥ
zhes bzlas pas byin dbab/
Reciting that, blessings descend.
ye shes pa phab pa de nyid sngags rgyas brtan par byas pa'i mos pa mdzod/ spyi bor rdo rje bsnol mar bkod de/
Feel that that descent of the wisdom ones is expanded and stabilized with the mantra. Place crossed vajras on their heads.
tiSh+Tha badzra/
tiṣṭha vajra
de dag gis ni byin rlabs kyi snod rung du bsgrub pa sngon du bya ba'i rim pa lags/
Those establish you as a suitable receptacle for blessings. They are the preliminary steps.
dngos gzhi ni
The actual practice.
mnga' bdag mar pas rje mai tri pa mjal dus kyi rdo rje'i mgur las/
The master Marpa recounted his meeting with the exalted Maitrīpa in a vajra song:
nang zab mo brda yi dbang bzhi bskur/ / rgyud yongs su smin par byin gyis brlabs/
I requested the four inner profound symbolic abhiṣekas. He blessed me, maturing my mindstream.
zhes gsungs pa'i don khyad chos thun mong ma yin pa brda yis dbang bzhi ngo sprod pa'i tshul ni 'di dag tu gda' bas so so'i brda don shes pa'i sgo nas ma yengs par gsan 'tshal/ /

The meaning of that statement is that special, uncommon symbols are the way the four abhiṣekas are pointed out. Since that is so, with an understanding of the significance of each symbol, please listen without distraction.
zhes pas mda' gzhu/ phag mgo/ thod pa/ rdo rje rgya gram rnams 'og gi tshig ris dang bstun te rim par bstan la/
Show, in order, the bow and arrow, pig’s head, skull cup, and crossed vajras in conjunction with the lines below.

khyed rnams la mda' gzhu bstan pa 'di thabs shes dbyer med kyi brda ste/ lha yab yum snang stong gi bskyed rim sgoms shig pa'i brda'o/ / phag mgo bstan pa 'di phag pas kha zas la gtsang rme med par longs spyod pa ltar gnyis med kyi ye shes sgoms shig pa'i brda'o/ / thod pa bstan pa 'di'i nang stong par yod pa ltar chos thams cad stong nyid du sgoms shig pa'i brda'o/ / rdo rje rgya gram bstan pa 'di'i rwa rnams phyogs bzhir yod pa ltar phrin las rnam pa bzhi la dbang ba'i brda'o/ / de ltar na de rnams ni bum dbang gi don yin no/ /

I show you the bow and arrow. They symbolize the inseparability of method and prajñā. They symbolize that you should meditate on the generation process: the empty appearances of the male and female consort deities. I show you the pig’s head. This symbolizes that you should meditate on nondual wisdom like the way a pig enjoys all types of food with no regard for cleanliness or filth. I show you the skull cup. This symbolizes that you should meditate that all phenomena are empty, just as the interior of this skull cup is empty. I show you the crossed vajras. They symbolize that you are empowered for the four types of activities, just as they have four spokes in the four directions. Those are the points of the vase abhiṣeka.

de nas bdud rtsi lce thog tu byin te/ bdud rtsi'i ro (391) bde ba des lus thams cad bde phril gyis song bar sgoms shig / de ni gsang ba'i dbang gi don yin no/ / bde ba de'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog par sgoms shig / de ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang yin no/ /

de nas slob dpon gyis lag mthil stong pa dang / der rdo rje bzhag pa dang / se gol gsum rim par bstan la/ khyed rnams la lag mthil stong par bstan pa 'di chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i brda'o/ / de'i steng du rdo rje bzhag pa 'di snang grags kyi chos thams cad med bzhin glo bur du snang ba'i brda'o/ /

Then, the ācārya shows their empty palm, places a vajra there, and snaps their fingers three times. I show you an empty palm. This symbolizes that all phenomena are unborn. On top of it, I place a vajra. This symbolizes that while all phenomena that appear and resound do not exist, they appear adventitiously.
se gol gsum tog pa 'dis sgra thams cad grags stong du gcig pa ltar chos thams cad du ma ro gcig gi brda'o/ /
