I snap my fingers three times. This symbolizes that in the same way that all sounds are the same in being sound-emptiness, all phenomena are many with one taste.
phyag rgya chen po'i gnas mchog na/ / byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa'i blo gros bzhugs/ / de ni ming tsam brda tsam btags pa tsam/
In the sublime place of mahāmudrā, the bodhisattva Caryamati resides. Even that is just a name, just a symbol, just a label.
lan gsum/
Three times.

de ltar chos thams cad dngos po de nyid du ma grub/ khyed rang gi sems nyid gzhi med rtsa bral spros pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'o/ / sna tshogs su snang yang snang sems gnyis med chos kyi sku ngos bzung med par ngo shes par gyis shig / de yang ming dang brda tsam du shes pa ni dbang bzhi pa'i don yin no/ / zhes ngo sprad do/ /

Thus, all phenomena do not exist as things. Your mind-itself has no foundation, no root, and is free from elaborations. Although it manifests as a variety of appearances, appearances and mind are nondual. Recognize the unidentifiable dharmakāya. Know that to be simply a name and a symbol. That is the point of the fourth abhiṣeka. Thus, give the pointing out.

brda bzhi'i don 'di dag rgyas shing spro na zhib par spros te bshad nas go brnyed par bya'o/ / de ltar na de dag gi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das ma rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma snyan brgyud lhan cig skyes ma la brten pa'i thun mong ma yin pa nang zab mo brda'i dbang bzhi'i byin rlabs ngo sprod kyi rim pa brgyud pa'i phyag bzhes ltar legs par grub pa'i skabs su thob cing zhal gyis bzhes pa'i dam tshig dang sdom pa'i gnas la srung sdom tshul bzhin bgyi'o snyam pa'i blos 'di'i rjes zlos/

If you wish to elaborate and expand the points of the four symbols, by elaborating in detail and explaining, understanding will develop. Thus, by means of those, you have reached the occasion of excellently completing—according to the custom of the transmission—the process of receiving the blessings and pointing out of the four uncommon inner profound symbolic abhiṣekas, which rely on the Bhagavatī, Jetsunma Vajrayoginī, the Aural Transmission Sahajā. Thinking that you will properly guard and hold the vows and samayas you have accepted, repeat the following:

gtso bos ji ltar (392)sogs/ de ltar dbang bskur zab mo phyag rgya chen po rdo rje'i ye shes kyi byin rlabs su grags pa legs par thob pa'i sku drin gtong rag gi yon du dmigs te maN+Dal re gnang bar zhu/ zhes maN+Dal phul/

Whatever the principal one commands, [all that I will do.] {392} Please visualize a gift in thanks for the kindness of having excellently received this profound abhiṣeka—known as the blessings of vajra wisdom, mahāmudrā—and present a maṇḍala. Offer a maṇḍala.
rang gi lus longs spyod dge rtsa dang bcas pa bla ma dang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso mo gnyis su ma mchis pa la gus pas 'bul na cha shas nas bzhes la longs spyad du gsol snyams pas 'di'i rjes zlos/

Thinking that having offered respectfully your body, possessions, and roots of virtue to the gurus and the principal one of the maṇḍala, who are not dual, that they accept even a part of them and enjoy them, repeat the following:
deng nas brtsams te sogs/ dge ba bsngos te slob ma rnams rang gnas su btang ngo / /
From today onward, [I offer myself to you as a servant. Please accept me as a disciple, and use any part of me.] Dedicate the merit, and send the disciples to their own places.
gsum pa rjes ni/
III. The Concluding Section

tshogs mchod spro na yum bka' rgyas pa'i sgrub dkyil ltar shes par byas la dkyus su mi dgos/ mchod pa byin rlabs/ mchod bstod rnams gong du smos pa ltar dang / bzod gsol/ rten yod na rten bzhugs dang med na gshegs gsol/ bsngo ba smon lam/ shis brjod rnams spyi ltar byas pas 'grub bo/ /

If you wish to elaborate with a gaṇapūjā, know it is done according to the extensive Yum Ka sādhanas and maṇḍala [rituals], but usually it is not needed. Do the consecration of the offerings and the offerings and praises, as above. Request patience. If you have a representation, do the request to remain in the representation. If you do not have one, do the request to depart. Do dedications, aspiration prayers, and expressions of auspiciousness as is customarily done. This completes it.

brda dbang 'di ni rje btsun ma so sor phyes na bden gnyis zhal pa dang gtso bor 'brel yang / bla ma dam pa gong ma rnams kyi phyag bzhes la lugs gnyis ka'i smin byed du'ang mdzad pas stag lung rjes gnang zhe gsum ma'i khongs nas bden gnyis zhal can la sbyar ba'i brda dbang nyid skabs 'dir brgyud pa'i chu bo thams cad gcig 'dres kyi bka' srol kho nar nges pas ras chung snyan brgyud lugs kyi lhan cig skyes mar sbyar te rgyun dang khungs thub kyi yig cha dag las tshig gi phrad dang bsnon 'brid phren bu tsam ma gtogs slad dang rang bzo'i dri ma med par bklags chog tu bsdebs pa'o/ /

This symbolic abhiṣeka is, when [the two forms of] Jetsunma are separated, connected primarily with the Lady with the Faces of the Two Truths. However, the custom of the earlier genuine gurus is to use it as the means of maturation for both traditions, [that is, both forms]. Thus, the symbolic abhiṣeka connected to the Lady with the Faces of the Two Truths that is part of the forty-three Taklung authorizations is definitely a tradition that blends all the rivers of transmission into one, and therefore, in this context, it is connected to the Sahajā of the Rechung Aural Transmission tradition. This liturgical text has been arranged using the extant genuine, pure texts, and except for minor additions and omissions connected to composition, it is without the stains of corruptions or personal fabrication.
dus gsum rgyal ba'i yum mchog rje btsun ma/ / drwa ba sdom pa dgyes pa'i btsun mo ni/ / dus mtha'i me lce lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis/ / 'khor 'das za byed dpa' mo tsaN+Da lI'i/ /

Jetsunma, the supreme mother of the victors of the three times, is the queen who delights in binding the net, the heroine whose brilliance, like the flames at the end of time, consumes saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.
shin tu zab pa'i mthar thug brda yi dbang / / rdo rje 'chang gi zhal lung mngar po'i bcud/ / grub thob rgya mtshos myang de 'dir byung na/ / skal ldan kun kyang bde chen gyis myos shog /

The consummate symbolic abhiṣeka of the very profound caṇḍālī is the sweet elixir of the oral instructions of Vajradhara, experienced by an ocean of siddhas. When that occurs here, may all fortunate ones become intoxicated by great bliss. {393}

ces gdams ngag rin po che'i mdzod (393) bka' brgyud kyi smin byed las snyan brgyud lhan cig skyes ma'i smin dbang gi cha lag tu 'jam mgon bla ma rdo rje 'chang gi dgongs bzhed mchis pa dang bka'i rjes su gnang ba nos pa la brten nas gsang bdag rdo rje 'dzin pa rnams kyi bka' 'bangs tha shal pa karma bkra shis 'od zer kyis dpal spungs sgrub khang gi skyed mos tshal lha klu dgyes par rol pa'i bsti gnas su stan thog gcig tu spel ba'i yi ge pa ni karma bkra shis chos 'phel gyis bgyis pas dpal ldan bla ma'i thugs dgongs rdzogs shing zab gsang bstan pa mi nyams yun du gsal ba'i rgyur gyur cig /

In the context of including the maturing abhiṣekas of the Aural Transmission Sahajā within the maturing section of the Kagyu tradition in The Treasury of Precious Instructions, and in reliance on the explanations and instructions received from Jamgön Guru, Vajradhara, [I] Karma Tashi Özer, a humble subject of all the lords of the secrets, the vajra holders, composed this in a single sitting in the refreshing location of Palpung retreat center park, a place which delights gods and nāgas. The secretary was Karma Tashi Chöpal. May this fulfill the intention of the glorious guru and be a cause for the profound secret teachings to shine for a long time without deterioration.
dge legs 'phel// // (394) (395)
May virtue and excellence increase. {394}

@#/ /bde mchog snyan brgyud ras chung lugs kyi thun mong phyi dkyil brgyad las yum bka' bsdus pa lhan cig skyes ma'i sgrub dkyil dbang chog dang bcas pa pad+ma rA ga'i bum bzang zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ /

27. Excellent Padmarāga Vase. The Sādhana, Maṇḍala Ritual, and Abhiṣeka Rituals of the Sahajā, the Abbreviated Yum Ka from the Eight Common, Outer Maṇḍalas in the Rechung Tradition of the Saṃvara Aural Transmission[1]
(396)@#/ /gu ru badzra wA rA hI na mA mi/
guru vajravārāhī namāmi
rgyal kun skyed mdzad gsang chen kun 'byung gnas/ / 'khor lo kun gyi 'dren pa mo de dang / / dbyer med bla ma'i zhabs la gus btud nas/ / gang gi smin grol lam zab 'dir dgod bya/ /

I bow respectfully at the feet of the guru, who is inseparable from she who is the leader of all cakras, who produces all victors and is the source of all great secrets. Now I will arrange the profound path of maturation and liberation.

gnas dben par yar mar gyi tshes bcu la sogs pa'i dus bzang por gnas khang rgyan dang bkod pas mdzes shing rten bkram pa'i mdun du stegs bu khebs ldan steng / dkyil 'khor gsum las 'og gi dkyil 'khor rdul tshon nam ras bris gang yin kyang rdo rwa me ris bskor ba'i chos 'byung nang du pad+ma 'dab ma bzhi pa'i mtha' dur khrod kyis bskor ba bri/ bsdu na tshom bus kyang rung ngo / /

In an isolated place, on an excellent day, such as the tenth lunar day of the waxing or waning moon, beautify your dwelling with ornaments and the arrangements. In front of the arranged representations, on a small covered stand, set up the first of the three maṇḍalas: the lower maṇḍala, which can either be made from colored powders or be a cloth-drawn one. Draw a source of dharmas surrounded by a vajra fence and volcanoes. Within that draw a four-petaled lotus and the encircling charnel grounds outside. To abbreviate, offering piles are sufficient.

bar bdud rtsi'i dkyil 'khor ni/ de'i dbus su many+dzi'i khar thod pa mtshan ldan bdud rtsi sbyar ba blugs la dar dmar bkab po/ / de'i steng sin+d+hU ra'i dkyil 'khor ni/ maN+Dal lam me long la bdud rtsis cung zad brlan phar bya sra te/ seng ras kyis sin+d+hU ra khod snyoms par btsags la dkyil 'khor 'og dang mthun par bris shing bkod par bya/

In the middle is the maṇḍala of amṛta. In the center of that [lower maṇḍala], on top of a mañji, place an authentic skull cup. Fill it with [liquid] made with amṛta, and cover it with a red silk cloth. Above that is the sindhūra maṇḍala. Moisten a maṇḍala or mirror slightly with amṛta. Sift the sindhūra with gauze so that it is uniform, and draw and arrange a maṇḍala in keeping with the lower one.

dkyil 'khor gyi g.yas phyogs su rnam bum/ / g.yon phyogs su las bum/ gnyis ka dar dmar gyi mgul chings dang dri bzang gi chus bkang / rnam bum la so lnga'i rdzas btab/ khar dung chos dang gzungs rdor bzhag / las bum la nyer lnga'i rdzas dang kha rgyan bkod/

To the right of the maṇḍala, place the victory vase and, to the left, the activity vase. Tie red silk cloths around both their necks and fill them with scented water. Put the thirty-five substances in the victory vase, and place a conch and dhāraṇī vajra on its top. Put the twenty-five substances in the activity vase and place its top ornament.
dbu rgyan/ rdo rje/ dril bu (397) rnams ci bder bzhag /
Set the crown ornament, vajra, and ghaṇṭā wherever it is convenient. {397}

lcang lo/ byugs rdzas/ gos rgyan/ phyag mtshan nams phyogs bsdus kyi tsa kli'ang bkod/ dkyil 'khor mdun nas brtsams/ mchod yon dang / nyer spyod rnams g.yon bskor du bsham/ mdun tu nang mchod ka pA lar bdud rtsi ril bu dang sbyar ba'i chang dang / rgyab ngos su 'bul gtor bza' bca' bzad dgus brgyan pa bsham/ tshogs kyi yo byad rnams dang / sngon gtor sogs nye bar mkho ba rnams 'du bya'o/ /

Arrange the group of icons for the braided hair, anointing substance, clothing, ornaments, and emblems. Starting from in front of the maṇḍala, arrange the offering water and the traditional offerings in a counterclockwise circle. In front, place the inner offering kapāla with alcohol mixed with amṛta pills. To the rear, place an offering torma with food and adorned with everything excellent. Gather the requisites for the feast and the necessary items, such as a preliminary torma.
nyams len dngos la gsum/ sngon 'gro/ dngos gzhi/ rjes so/ /
The actual practice has three parts: (1) the preliminaries, (2) the main practice, and (3) the concluding section.
dang po la/
I. The Preliminaries

thun mong yid bzhin nor bu las sa bcad brgyad du gsungs pa 'ga' zhig gong du tshad grub/ sngon 'gro gtor ma btang ba dang srung 'khor bsgom pa/ bdud rtsi byin rlabs/ gnas khang dang mchod pa byin rlabs skyabs sems dang rdor sems sgom bzlas/ bla ma'i rnal 'byor dbang bzhi blang ba yan chad yab bka'i sgrub thabs ltar bya ba las der bde mchog bsgom pa'i tshab tu/ rang nyid phag mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis gri thod kha T+wAM 'dzin pa nyid do/ / zhes bsgyur

The Shared Wish-Fulfilling Gems present eight topical headings. A few were completed above. Do the giving of the preliminary torma, the meditation on the protection cakra, consecrating the amṛta, consecrating the place and the offerings, refuge and bodhicitta, the meditation and recitation of Vajrasattva, and guru yoga up through taking the four abhiṣekas according to the Yab Ka sādhana.[*1] There, as a substitute for meditating on Saṃvara, say this instead: I am Vārāhī, with one face and two hands, holding a hooked knife, skull cup, and khaṭvāṃga.
gnyis pa dngos gzhi
II. The Main Practice
['di] la gsum/ bdag bskyed/ bum bskyed/ mdun bskyed dbang bskur dang bcas pa'o/ /
This has three parts: (1) self visualization, (2) the vase visualization, and (3) the front visualization along with the conferring of the abhiṣekas.
dang po bdag bskyed
A. The Self Visualization
['di] la sa bcad brgyad du gsungs pa'i
This is taught as eight topical headings.
dang po rten srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom pa ni/
1. The Meditation on the Protection Cakra, the Support

dbang bzhi pa'i mnyam gzhag gi ngang nas/ nam (398)mkha'i khams su e e las chos kyi 'byung gnas phyi dkar la nang dmar ba kha sbyor gyi nang du/ pa~M las pad+ma dang / ra~M las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor/ de'i steng du hU~M las sna tshogs rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa/ shar dkar/ lho ser/ nub dmar/ byang ljang / lte ba mthing nag hU~M gis mtshan pa de las 'od zer phyogs bcur 'phros pas/ 'og gzhi rdo rje'i sa gzhi/ steng rdo rje'i gur dang bla re/ phyogs mtshams rdo rje'i ra ba dang dra ba/ phyi rol thams cad ye shes kyi me rab tu 'bar bas khyab pa'i srung ba'i 'khor lo yangs shing rgya che ba grub par gyur/

Within the meditative equipoise of the fourth abhiṣeka, say: {398} In the dhātu of space, from e and e, sources of dharmas appear, white on the outside, red on the inside, with [their tops] facing each other. Within those, from paṃ, is a lotus, and, from raṃ, a sun maṇḍala. Above that, from hūṃ, is a five-pointed viśvavajra. Its east is white; its south, yellow; west, red; and north, green. Its center is dark blue, marked by hūṃ. Light rays stream forth from it to the ten directions, forming the spacious and vast protection cakra: a vajra ground below, a vajra tent and canopy above, a vajra fence and net in all directions, and a fiercely blazing wisdom fire pervading everywhere outside.
oM badzra rak+Sha rak+Sha hU~M hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/
oṃ vajra rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā
lan gsum/
Three times.
gnyis pa brten pa lha bskyed pa
2. Generating the Deities, the Supported
['di] la yan lag bzhi'i
This has four branches.
dang po dam tshig pa bskyed pa ni/
a. Generating the Samaya Ones

de'i nang du dur khrod chen po brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i dbus su sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba'i steng du pa~M las pad+ma dang / ra~M las nyi sa 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan gan rkyal du 'gyel ba'i gdan gyi steng du/ rang gi rnam shes yi ge ba~M dmar po las 'od zer dpag tu med pa phyogs bcur 'phros pas/ bka' brgyud bla ma la sogs te 'phags pa rnams la mnyes pa'i mchod pa phul/ ngan song gsum sogs sems can thams cad kyi don byas/ tshur 'dus yongs su gyur pa las/ bdag nyid rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma gcer bu sku mdog dmar mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma'i g.yas gri gug thur du bzung nas gdug pa can la bsdigs shing / g.yon bdud bzhi'i khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa thugs kar 'dzin pa'i gru mo na yab he ru ka mtshon pa'i kha T+wAM ga 'chang ba/

Within that, in the middle of the surrounding eight great charnel grounds, is a viśvavajra. Above its center, from paṃ, is a lotus and, from raṃ, a sun maṇḍala.[2] On top of seats of Bhairava and Kālarātri, lying on their backs, my consciousness as a red letter vaṃ radiates immeasurable light rays in the ten directions, making offerings that please the noble ones, such as the Kagyu gurus, and benefiting all sentient beings, such as those in the three negative states. These gather back and the vaṃ transforms: I am Jetsun Vajrayoginī, naked, red, with one face and two hands. My right holds a hooked knife down, threatening malevolent ones. My left holds a skull cup filled with the blood of the four māras at my heart, and in the crook of that elbow is a khaṭvāṃga symbolizing the Heruka.

dmar la 'khyug cing mdzes la yangs pa'i spyan gsum zur gyis gzigs shing / khro la 'dzum pa'i zhal mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa/ dbu skra sil bu'i stod cha gyen du brdzes shing / 'khor lo dang me tog gi phreng bas mdzes pa/ lhag ma thur du grol bas rked pa non cing / zhabs gnyis g.yas brkyangs pas 'jigs byed nag po'i snying ga dang g.yon cung zad bskums pas dus mtshan (399) dmar mo'i nu dbrag mnan pa'i rol stabs kyis bzhugs pa'i sku la mi mgo skam po lnga yi dbu rgyan dang rlon pa khrag 'dzag pa lnga bcu'i do shal 'phyang zhing rus pa'i rgyan drug gis mdzes pa/ gzugs dang lang tsho dar la babs shing b+ha ga dang nu ma rab tu rgyas pa/ bde ba chen pos rnam par myos pa'i cha byad can/

I glance from the corners of my three eyes, which are red and darting, beautiful and wide. In my wrathful and smiling face my fangs are slightly bared. The upper part of my loose hair sweeps upward and is beautified by a cakra and garlands of flowers. The remainder hangs down freely, reaching to my waist. With my two legs, I stand in the playful posture with my right extended, pressing down on the heart of black Bhairava, and my left, slightly drawn up, trampling on the middle of the chest of red Kālarātri. {399} My body is beautified with a crown of five dried human heads, a necklace of fifty fresh ones dripping blood, and the six bone ornaments. My form, splendor, vitality, bhaga, and breasts are radiant. I have the quality of intoxicating with great bliss.

snang la rang bzhin med pa'i sku yi 'od kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'gengs nus pa/ phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thugs su chud cing skye 'gro kun gyi yid 'phrog pa'i bdag nyid ma/ ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas ye shes kyi me rab tu 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs par gyur par bsams la/

The light of my body, which appears yet is without nature, has the power to fill the entire world. I embody fathoming the minds of the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions and captivating the minds of all living beings. I stand in the middle of raging wisdom fire coming from all my pores. Thus, contemplate.
'khor bskyed pa ni/
Generating the retinue.

rang gi thugs ka'i ba~M las 'od zer sku dang phyag mtshan yig 'bru thig le'i rnam par dpag tu med pa khyams dang dur khrod du 'phros/ 'khor gyi lhar gyur pa ni/ khyams kyi steng 'og bar snang rnams su 'ja' 'od sprin gyi gur khang ngos la rgyud sde bzhi'i lha tshogs dang / 'dod yon lnga'i mchod pa bkod legs du ma thogs nas mchod pa la brtson pa'i lha yi bu dang bu mos gang ba/ dur khrod rnams su phyogs skyong zhing skyong klu la sogs te gzugs brnyan dang cha lugs sna tshogs 'chang zhing ston pa'i dpa' bo mkha' 'gro'i tshogs dpag tu med pas gang ba'o/ /

From the vaṃ in my heart, light rays in the forms of immeasurable bodies, emblems, seed letters, and bindus radiate throughout the courtyard and charnel grounds, becoming the retinue deities. The courtyard, above, below, and in its surrounding spaces, is filled with domes of clouds of rainbow light in which there are the assemblies of deities of the four classes of tantras and the male and female children of the gods, who, holding excellent arrangements of the five sense pleasures, exert themselves in making offerings. The charnel grounds are filled with the protectors of the directions, field protectors, nāgas, and others, and, holding various images and signs, innumerable heroes and ḍākinīs.
gnyis pa go cha bgo zhing sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i yan lag la
b. The Branch of Placing the Armor and Consecrating Body, Speech, and Mind
go bgo ba ni/
Placing the Armor.

rdo rje phag mo'i lte bar/ oM ba~M phag mo dmar mo/ snying gar haM yoM gshin rje ma sngon mo/ mgrin par hrIM moM rmongs byed ma dkar mo/ / dpral bar hrIM hrIM skyod byed ma ser mo/ / spyi gtsug tu hU~M hU~M skrag byed ma ljang gu/ yan lag thams cad la phaT phaT las gtum mo dud ka ste/ thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma g.yas gri gug dang g.yon thod khrag 'dzin pa'i gru mo na kha T+wAM ga 'chang ba/ gcer bu dpa' mo'i rgyan cha lugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa/ zhabs g.yas bskum zhing g.yon brkyang ba'i gar stabs kyis pad nyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/ /

As Vajravārāhī, at my navel is oṃ vaṃ, red Vārāhī. At my heart is haṃ yoṃ, blue Yāminī. At my throat is hrīṃ moṃ, white Mohanī. At my forehead is hreṃ hriṃ, yellow Saṃcālanī. At the crown of my head is huṃ hūṃ, green Saṃtrāsanī. In the joints of all my limbs are phaṭ phaṭs, smoky Caṇḍikās. They all have one face and two hands. In their right, they hold hooked knives and in their left, skull cups with blood. Khaṭvāṃgas rest in the crooks of their left elbows. They are naked and complete with the ornaments and attributes of heroines. They stand on seats of lotuses, suns, and corpses in the dancing position with their right legs bent and their left extended. {400}
sku gsung (400) thugs byin gyis brlab pa ni/
Consecrating body, speech, and mind.
lha rnams kyi spyi bor oM dkar po/ mgrin par AHdmar po/ thugs kar hU~M sngon po rnams bsam/
All deities have white oṃs at their heads, red āḥs at their throats, and blue hūṃs their hearts. Thus, contemplate.
gsum pa snod bcud sbyar zhing ye shes pa gzhug pa'i yan lag
c. The Branch of Purifying the Environment and Its Inhabitants and the Entering of the Wisdom Ones
['di la] gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po snod bcud sbyang ba ni/
i. Purifying the Environment and Its Inhabitants

hU~M las 'od 'phros phyi snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad la phog pas gzhal yas khang du gyur/ nang bcud kyi sems can thams cad la phog pas pho thams cad 'khor lo sdom pa dang / mo thams cad rdo rje phag mor gyur par bsam mo/ /

Light radiates from the hūṃ. Striking the world, the external environment, it becomes a palace. Striking sentient beings, the inhabitants, all males become Cakrasaṃvara and all females become Vajravārāhī. Thus, contemplate.
ye shes pa gzhug pa
ii. The Entering of the Wisdom Ones
['di] la gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po/ spyan drang ba ni/
A) The Invocation
phaiM phaiM/
pheṃ pheṃ

bdag dang lha rnams kyi thugs ka'i sa bon las 'od zer 'phros pas/ o rgyan la sogs te rang bzhin gyi dag pa'i zhing khams rgya mtsho nas bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dpag tu med pas bskor ba/

Light rays stream forth from the seed syllables in the hearts of myself and all deities, inviting, from the ocean of the naturally pure realms, Oḍḍiyāna and the others, the Bhagavatī, Vajravārāhī, surrounded by innumerable assemblies of buddhas and bodhisattvas.
oM b+ha ga wA ti badzra b+ha ra hI sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaH sa spyan drangs/
oṃ bhagavāti vajrabharahī saparivāra vajra samājaḥ Thus, invite.
gnyis pa mchod pa ni/
B) Offerings
oM b+ha ga wA ti badzra b+ha ra hI sa pa ri wA ra badzra Ar+g+haM nas shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ bhagavāti vajrabharahī saparivāra vajra arghaṃ…śabda Thus, offer.
gsum pa gzhug pa dngos ni/
C) The Actual Entering of the Wisdom Ones
oM b+ha ga wA ti badzra b+ha ra hI sa pa ri wA ra dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
oṃ bhagavāti vajrabharahī saparivāra jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
zhes phyag rgya dang bcas pas ye shes pa dam tshig pa la thim pas dbyer med du gyur par bsam/
Saying that with the mudrā, think that the wisdom ones dissolve into and become inseparable from the samaya ones.
gsum pa lus dkyil bsgom pa ni/
iii. Meditating on the Body Maṇḍala

de'i rkyen gyis spyi bor bka' brgyud bla ma/ snying gar 'khor lo sdom pa/ yan lag tshigs bzhi la mkha' 'gro chos skyong / ba spu'i bu gar rdo rje spun grogs te/ lus kyi dkyil 'khor gsal zhing rdzogs pa grub pa nyid du gyur par bsam mo/ /

Those conditions cause the body maṇḍala to be clear and complete: the Kagyu gurus are on the top of my head, Cakrasaṃvara is at my heart, the ḍākinīs and dharma protectors are in my limbs and four joints, and vajra siblings in all my pores. Thus, contemplate.
bzhi pa dbang bskur zhing rigs bdag gi rgyas btab pa'i yan lag
d. The Branch of Bestowing the Abhiṣekas and Sealing with the Family Lords
['di] la gsum gyi
This has three parts.
dang po dbang lha spyan drangs shing ba dan 'bul ba ni/
i. The Invocation of the Abhiṣeka Deities and the Offering of Seats
phaiM phaiM/
pheṃ pheṃ
slar yang bdag dang lha rnams kyi thugs ka'i sa bon las 'od zer 'phros pas rang bzhin gyi gnas nas bla ma dang rnam snang dbyer med pa'i dbang gi lha rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pa

Again, light rays radiate from the seed syllables in the hearts of myself and the deities, inviting, from their natural abodes, the five families of abhiṣeka deities, who are the inseparability of the guru and Vairocana, with their retinues.
oM pany+tsa ku la sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaHsa spyan drang /
oṃ pañcakula saparivāra vajra samājaḥ Thus, invite.
pad+ma kA ma lA ya s+t+waM/ gyis gdan 'bul/
padma kāmalāyastvaṃ Thus, offer seats.
gnyis pa mchod bstod gsol ba gdab pa ni/
ii. Offerings, Praises, and Supplications
oM pany+tsa ku la sa pa ri wa ra Ar+g+haM (401 )nas shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ pañcakula saparivāra arghaṃ…śabda {401} Offer.

chos sku nam mkha' bzhin du dbyer med kyang / / gzugs sku 'ja' tshon bzhin du so sor gsal/ / thabs dang shes rab mchog la mnga' brnyes pa'i/ / rigs lnga bde bar gshegs la phyag 'tshal bstod/ ces bstod/

Although inseparable from the space-like dharmakāya, your rainbowlike form kāyas appear individually. Homage and praises to the sugatas of the five families, those who have mastered the sublime methods and prajñā. Thus, praise.
bcom ldan 'das rigs lnga 'khor dang bcas pas bdag cag rnams la mngon par dbang bskur du gsol/ zhes gsol ba btab pas/
Bhagavān with your retinue of the five families, please actually bestow the abhiṣekas upon us. Thus, we supplicate.
gsum pa dbang bskur zhing rigs bdag gis dbu brgyan pa dngos ni/
iii. The Actual Bestowing of the Abhiṣekas and Crowning with the Family Lords

rigs lnga'i 'khor rnams kyis glu dang rol mo 'dod yon sna tshogs kyi mchod pa'i sgo nas lha'i bum pa bdud rtsi dang bcas pas dbang bskur/ sku gang / dri ma dag / bdud rtsi'i rgyun yar lud pa spyi bor 'khyil ba rnam par snang mdzad du gyur nas dbu brgyan pa la/

The retinues of the five families, with songs, music, and offerings of various sense pleasures, bestow the abhiṣeka using the divine vase with amṛta. This fills your body and purifies your stains. The stream of amṛta rises up and overflows, swirling at the top of your head. It becomes Vairocana and you are crowned.
gsum pa mchod pa ni/
3. Offerings
khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyis bdag la 'dod yon kun gyis mchod cing bstod par gyur/
All sentient beings of the three realms present offerings of the sense pleasures and praises to me.
mchod yon me tog bdug spos snang gsal dang / / dri chab zhal zas rol mo sna tshogs dang / / gzugs sgra dri ro 'jam mnyen reg bya rnams/ / rdo rje rnal 'byor ma la dbul bar bgyi/
Offering water, flowers, incense, lamps, scented water, food, various kinds of music, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and soft, smooth tangible objects are offered to Vajrayoginī.
oM b+ha ga wA te badzra b+ha ra hI sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM sogs dang / rU pa/ shab+da/ gan+d+he/ ra sa/ spar+she AHhU~M/
oṃ bhagavāte vajrabharahī saparivāra arghaṃ…rūpa śabda gandhe rasa sparśe āḥ hūṃ
bzhi pa bstod pa ni/
4. Praises
hU~M/ dpal ldan sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor los sgyur/ / ye shes lnga dang sku gsung thugs/ / 'gro ba skyob la phyag 'tshal bstod/
Glorious Buddhaḍākinī, cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage and praise.
lnga pa bzlas pa bya ba ni/
5. The Recitations
rang gi rlung sems dbyer med kyi ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' ba~M gyi mthar thig le dkar dmar 'dres pa las grub pa'i yig 'bru/
The samādhisattva, which is the inseparability of your winds and mind, is vaṃ. It is surrounded by seed syllables made from the mixing of the white and red bindus.
oM bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ ces snying po dang /
oṃ buddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ That is the essence mantra.
oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
ces nye snying ste sngags kyis bskor bar bsam zhing / ci nus su bzla'o/ /
That is the quintessence mantra. Those mantras encircle. Thus contemplate and recite those as much as possible.
drug pa slar yang mchod cing bstod pa las mchod pa ni/
6. Again Offerings and Praises
mchod pa kha gsos la bsang sbyang / byin brlab/ rgyas par tshigs bcad dkyil chog nas 'byung ba ltar dang / bsdu na sngags (402 )mchod tsam dang bstod pa sh+lo ka gcig bya/

Offerings. Replenish the offerings, and cleanse, purify, and consecrate them. To be extensive, offer with the verses found in the maṇḍala ritual. {402} To abbreviate, simply offer with the mantras. For the praises use one śloka.
brgyad pa bdag bskyed bsdu ba ni/
7. The Dissolution of the Self Visualization

rang gi thugs ka'i ba~M las 'od 'phros pas/ snod bcud thams cad sbyangs nas dur khrod la sogs pa'i lha rnams la thim/ de gtso mo la thim/ de ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' la thim/ de gyen rdzogs nA da'i dbyings su thim par gyur/ ces mnyam par bzhag / slar yang skad cig gis rang nyid rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i skur gsal bar gyur/ zhes thun mtshams kyi lhar ldang /

Light streams forth from the vaṃ in my heart purifying the environment and its inhabitants, which dissolve into the deities of the charnel grounds and elsewhere. Those dissolve into me, the principal one. I dissolve into the samādhisattva. That dissolves upward completely into the expanse of nāda. Rest in equipoise. Again, in an instant, I appear clearly in the form of Jetsun Vajrayoginī. Thus, arise as the deity of postmeditation.
gnyis pa bum pa bsgrub pa ni/
B. The Vase Practice
bsang sbyang /
Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las/ pa~M pa~M las pad+ma dang / a a las zla ba'i gdan gnyis kyi steng du/ b+h+rU~M b+h+rU~M las rin po che pad+ma rA ga las grub pa'i bum pa gnyis lto ba yangs shing mgrin pa phra ba/ kha g.yel zhing mchu 'phyang ba/ lha rdzas kyi dar gyi na bza' gsol zhing / dpag bsam shing gis kha brgyan pa/ nang chu dang bcud bzang pos yongs su gang ba'i rnam rgyal bum pa'i nang du/ pa~M las pad+ma dang / ra~M las nyi ma/ 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan gan rkyal du 'gyel ba'i gdan gyi steng du/ yi ge ba~M dmar po de las 'od zer dpag tu med pa phyogs bcur 'phros pas/ sogs bdag bskyed ltar la/ ye shes kyi me rab tu 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs par gyur/

Within emptiness, from paṃ paṃ, appear lotuses; from a a, two moon seats, above which, from bhrūṃ bhrūṃ, appear two vases made from precious padmarāga. Both vases have spacious bellies, small necks, wide mouths, and spouts. Their necks are tied with cloths of divine substances and adorned with branches from wish-granting trees. The victory vase is filled with inner water and excellent elixirs. Inside it, from paṃ, is a lotus, and from raṃ, a sun. On top of seats of Bhairava and Kālarātri, lying on their backs, is a red letter vaṃ. From that, immeasurable light rays radiate in the ten directions…[*2] Continue according to the self visualization up to: …stand in the middle of raging wisdom fire coming from all her pores.

las thams cad kyi bum pa'i nang du/ pa~M las pad+ma dang / ra~M las nyi ma/ ba~M las ro'i gdan gyi steng du/ lha mo khaN+Da ro hi ma sku mdog dmar mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ g.yas gri gug nam mkha' la 'phyar stabs su 'dzin cing / g.yon thod khrag thugs kar 'dzin pa'i gru mo na kha T+wAM ga 'chang ba/ khro la 'dzum pa'i zhal mche ba cung zad gtsigs shing / mdzes la yangs pa'i spyan gsum dang ldan pa/ dbu skra sil bu'i stod cha gyen du brdzes pa/ nor bu dang me tog gi phreng bas mdzes shing lhag ma thur du grol bas rked pa non pa/ thod skam lnga yi dbu rgyan dang rlon pa khrag 'dzag pa lnga bcu'i do shal 'phyang zhing / (403)gcer bu rus pa'i rgyan drug gis brgyan cing / gzugs dang lang tsho dar la babs shing b+ha ga dang nu ma rab tu rgyas pa/ bde ba chen pos rnam par myos pa'i cha byad can gyi zhabs gnyis g.yas bskum zhing g.yon brkyang pa'i gar stabs kyis pad nyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/ / zhes dang

Within the vase for all activities, from paṃ, is a lotus; from raṃ, a sun; and from vaṃ, a corpse seat. Above those is the goddess Khaṇḍarohi, red, with one face and two hands. Her right one holds a hooked knife in the aloft position up to the sky. Her left one holds a skull cup of blood to her heart, with a khaṭvāṃga in the crook of that elbow. Her face is wrathful yet smiling, and she bares her fangs slightly. She is beautiful with three wide-open eyes. The upper part of her loose hair sweeps upward and is adorned with a gem and flower garland. The remainder is free, reaching to her waist. She has a crown of five dried skulls, a necklace of fifty fresh ones dripping blood, and is naked with the six bone ornaments. {403} Her form, splendor, vitality, bhaga, and breasts are radiant. Her two legs, which have the quality of intoxicating with great bliss, are planted on her seats of lotus, sun, and corpse in a dancing posture with her right bent and left extended.
go cha bgo ba ni/
Placing the armor.

rdo rje phag mo dang lha mo khaN+Da ro hi ma yi lte bar oM ba~M phag mo dmar mo sogs go cha bgo / sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab/ ye shes pa spyan drangs nas dam ye bsre/ dbang bskur nas/ gtso mo la rnam par snang mdzad dang / las bum gyi lha mo la rin chen 'byung ldan gyis dbur brgyan par gyur/ mchod bstod kyang gong ltar bya/ las bum lha la/ dpal ldan rin chen mkha' 'gro ma/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor los sgyur/ / ye shes lnga dang sku gsung thugs/ / 'gro ba skyob la phyag 'tshal bstod/ / ces bstod cing gzungs thag gi sne nas lag g.yas pa'i mtheb srin gyis bzung ste/

At the navels of Vajravārāhī and Khaṇḍarohi are oṃ vaṃs, red Vārāhīs….[*3] Thus, place the armor. Consecrate body, speech, and mind. Invoke the wisdom ones, and blend the wisdom ones with the samaya ones. Having bestowed the abhiṣekas, say: The principal one is crowned by Vairocana and the goddess of the activity vase by Ratnasambhava. Do the offerings and praises as above. For the deity of the activity vase, say: Glorious Ratnaḍākinī, cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage. Thus, praise. Hold the end of the dhāraṇī cord with the thumb and ring finger of your right hand.
bzlas pa ni/
The recitation.
oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
zhes rnam bum la brgya rtsa re las mi nyung ba dang / las bum la/
Say that for the victory vase not less a hundred times. For the activity vase, say:
oM khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ

ci rigs par bzla/ bzlas dmigs bdag bskyed thugs ka'i 'od zer gyis bum lha'i thugs rgyud bskul bas bdud rtsi'i rgyun babs pa sogs spyi dang 'dra/ mthar sgrub thabs ltar gtor ma 'bul/ mchod pa kha gsos la byin rlabs mdor bsdus bya/ nus na tshigs bcad dang mi lcogs na 'dod yon lnga sngags tsam gyis mchod/ gong ltar bstod/ rang gi thugs ka'i sa bon las 'od zer bum nang du 'phros pas bum nang gi lha ye shes pa phye ste rang gi snying gar dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH dam tshig pa 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i bdud rtsis bum pa gang bar gyur par bsam/

Recite that as much as you can. The visualization for the recitation is as is done generally: light rays from the heart of the self visualization invoke the mindstream of the vase deity, a stream of amṛta flows, and so forth. At the end, offer a torma according to the sādhana. Replenish the offerings and do an abbreviated consecration. If you are able, offer with verses; if you cannot, offer simply with the mantras for the five sense pleasures. Praise as above. Light rays from the seed syllable in my heart radiate to the interiors of the vases. The wisdom ones separate from the deities inside the vases and [dissolve] into my heart, jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ. The samaya ones melt into light, which fills the vases with amṛta. Thus, contemplate.
gsum pa mdun bskyed dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga
C. The Ritual for the Maṇḍala of the Front Visualization
['di] la gnyis/ dkyil 'khor sgrub mchod dang / bdag 'jug dbang bskur bya ba'i tshul lo/ /
This has two parts: (1) the sādhanapūjā of the maṇḍala and (2) the process of self-entering and conferring the abhiṣekas.
dang po ni dkyil 'khor
1. The Sādhanapūjā of the Maṇḍala
bsang sbyang /
Cleanse and purify the maṇḍala.
stong pa nyid du gyur/ stong pa'i ngang las nam mkha'i khams su e e las sogs/ gang bdag bskyed ltar la/ (404) spyan 'dren tshigs bcad/
All is emptiness. Within emptiness, in the dhātu of space, from e and e,…[*4] Do as in the self visualization. {404} Say the verse for the invocation:

ma lus sems can kun gyi mgon gyur cing / / bdud sde dpung bcas mi bzad 'joms mdzad lha/ / dngos rnams ma lus ji bzhin mkhyen gyur pa'i/ / bcom ldan 'khor bcas gnas 'dir gshegs su gsol/ / zhes spyan drangs/

Protectors of all sentient beings without exception, deities who destroy Māra and the terrible hordes, who know all things just as they are, Bhagavatī and your retinue, please come here. Thus, invite.
bcom ldan 'dir ni byon pa legs/ / bdag cag bsod nams skal par ldan/ / bdag gi mchod yon bzhes slad du/ / 'di nyid du ni bzhugs su gsol/ /
It is good that the Bhagavatī has arrived. I have merit and fortune. In order to accept my offerings, please remain here.
bdag dang 'gro la thugs brtse'i phyir/ / nyid kyi rdzu 'phrul mthu yis ni/ / ji srid mchod pa bdag bgyid pa/ / de srid bcom ldan bzhugs su gsol/ /
Due to your kindness for me and all beings, and through the power of your miracles, as long as I worship you, Bhagavatī, please remain.
oM gu ru sarba ta thA ga ta pad+ma ka ma lA ya s+t+waM/
oṃ guru sarvatathāgata padma kamalāyastvaṃ
zhes gdan 'bul/
Thus, offer a seat.
ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni/ / lha rnams kyis ni khrus gsol ltar/ / lha yi chu ni dag pa yis/ / de bzhin bdag gis sku khrus gsol/ /
Just as when [the Buddha] was born the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bathe your body.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta a b+hi She ka ta sa ma ya shri ye hU~M/
oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya śrīye hūṃ
khrus gsol/
Thus, offer the bath.
mchod rdzas dam pa 'di dag dang / / 'jig rten khams kyi mchod rdzas kun/ / thams cad blo yis blangs nas ni/ / bcom ldan 'khor dang bcas la 'bul/ /
Imagining all these sacred offering substances and all the offering substances in the worldly realms, I present them to the Bhagavatī and her retinue.
oM gu ru b+ha ga wA te badzra b+ha ra hI sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM sogs kyis mchod/
oṃ guru bhagavāte vajrabharahī saparivāra arghaṃ… Thus, offer.
bstod par 'os pa thams cad la/ / zhing rdul kun gyi grangs snyed kyi/ / lus btud pa yis rnam kun tu/ / mchog tu dad pas phyag 'tshal bstod// ces pas bstod rjes/
To those worthy of praise, with bodies as numerous as atoms in the realms, I bow and always offer praises with supreme faith. Thus, praise. Then:
oM gu ru nas/ wA ra dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
oṃ guru…vāra jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ
zhes dam ye dbyer med du bsam/ dbang bskur nas rgyas gdab kyi bar dang / mchod pa'ang de ltar la/ dpal ldan sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma sogs sh+lo ka gcig gis bstod/

Thus, think the samaya and wisdom ones become inseparable. Do the bestowal of the abhiṣekas up through the sealing, the offerings as were done,[*5] and say: Glorious Buddhaḍākinī, [cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage and praise.] Praise with the one śloka.
bzlas pa bya ba ni/
The recitations.
bzlas dmigs bdag bskyed ltar la/
The visualization for the recitations is done according to the self visualization.
oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ ces snying po dang /
oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ That is the essence mantra.
oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ ces nye snying ste ci nus su bzla'o/ /
oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ That is the quintessence mantra. Recite them as much as you are able.
mchod pa kha gsos la/ mchod rdzas rnams bsang sbyang / sgrub thabs ltar byin brlab/ mchod pa dngos la bzhi las/
Replenish the offerings. Cleanse and purify the offering substances. Do the consecration according to the sādhana. The actual offerings are fourfold.
dang po phyi mchod ni/
First, the outer offerings.
gtsang bde bsil sogs yan lag (405)brgyad ldan chab/ / yid kyi gdung sel kun dga'i dpal ster ba'i/ / lha yi mchod yon dam pa'i mchod pa 'di/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ /

Water with the eight qualities, clean, pleasing, cooling, and so on, {405} soothes mental torment and bestows the glory of joy. This offering of the holy offering water of the gods is presented to the guru and the assembly of deities of the maṇḍala.
oM gu ru b+ha ga wA ti badzra b+ha ra hI sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM pU dza me g+has mu dra s+pha ra Na sa ma ye AHhU~M/
oṃ guru bhagavāti vajrabharahī saparivāra vajra arghaṃ pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye āḥ hūṃ
kha dog rnam par bkra ba'i 'dab phreng las/ / sa phyogs bsung zhim ngad pas bsil sbyin mkhan/ / mig gi bdud rtsir bzhad pa'i me tog 'di/ / bla ma=
With rings of petals of vibrant colors, bestowing coolness with their sweet fragrances filling the space, these flowers bursting with amṛta for the eyes are presented to the guru…
sngags thog mtha' gong ltar la/
With the same beginning and end of the mantra, insert:
puSh+pe pU dza= rang byung dri ngad sbyar ba'i spos kyi sprin/ / nam mkha'i pha mthar gtibs las zhing khams kun/ / rab tu zhim pos kun dgar byed pa 'di/ / bla ma=
…puṣpe pūja… Clouds of incense of self-arisen fragrances, billowing out to the ends of space, in all the pure realms, create pleasure with their sweet scents. These are presented to the guru…
d+hU pe= nyi zla nor bu'i zer phreng 'bru mar mes/ / ma lus mun pa'i dpal 'phrog snang ba yis/ / nyin mtshan mi phyed kun tu gsal ba 'di/ / bla ma=

…dhūpe… The radiance of the sun, moon, and gems, and oil flames are illumination that vanquishes the power of darkness, lighting up everything with no distinction as to day or night. These are presented to the guru…
A lo ke= dri med chab la tsan+dan ga bur dang / / gur gum la sogs rnam par sbyar ba'i rdzas/ / bsil bde nyon mongs tshad nad drung 'byin dri/ / bla ma=
…āloke… Compound substances, such as stainless water with sandalwood, camphor, and saffron, are cooling and pleasant, and eradicate the fever of mental afflictions. These are presented to the guru…
gan+d+he= kha dog dri dang ro brgyar ldan pa'i bshos/ / ji tsam myong yang mi mthun med pa yi/ / lha yi zhal zas bda' rgu ji snyed pa/ / bla ma=
…gandhe… Food with color, scent, and a hundred flavors, no matter how much is eaten, never disturbs. This delectable food of the gods, is presented to the guru…
nai wi d+ya= rnga sil dung dang rgyud mang cha lang sogs/ / yan lag 'bum sde'i sgra dbyangs snyan sgrog pa/ / rol mo'i khyad par ma lus ji snyed kun/ / bla ma=

…naividya… Drums, cymbals, conches, strings, and large cymbals, producing melodious sounds with a hundred thousand variations, all this exceptional music, as much as there is, is presented to the guru…
shab+da= zhes dang /
…śabda…
'dod yon lnga 'bul ba ni/
Offering the five sense pleasures.
rab 'byams zhing gi dkyil 'khor thams cad par/ / rgyal ba'i spyan la mdzes pa ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus gzugs kyi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ /

In all the maṇḍalas in the infinite pure lands, all that is beautiful for the eyes of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra forms and presented to the guru and the assembly of deities of the maṇḍala.
badzra rU pa pU dza=
…vajra rūpa pūja…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i snyan la 'jebs pa ma lus kun/ / gcig bsdus sgra yi rdo rje'i sgyu 'phrul dpyid/ / bla ma=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is sweet for the ears of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra sounds and presented to the guru…
shab+da=
…śabda…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i shangs la zhim pa= gcig bsdus dri yi rdo rje'i= bla ma=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is fragrant for the noses of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra smells and presented to the guru…
gan+d+he=
…gandhe…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i (406)ljags la bda' ba= gcig bsdus ro yi rdo rje'i= bla ma=
In all the maṇḍalas…{406} all that is tasty for the tongues of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra tastes and presented to the guru…
ra sa=
…rasa…
rab 'byams= rgyal ba'i sku la bde ba= gcig bsdus reg bya rdo rje'i= bla ma=
In all the maṇḍalas… all that is blissful for the bodies of the victors is gathered into this one exquisite magical display of vajra tangible objects and presented to the guru…
spar+she=
…sparśe…
phyi snod nang bcud 'bul ba rnams kyang spro na yab bka' star bya/
If you wish to elaborate with the offering of the external environment and the internal inhabitants, do so according to the Yab Ka [maṇḍala ritual].[*6]
gnyis pa nang mchod bdud rtsi 'bul ba'ang
Second, presenting the inner-offering amṛta.
de lta rung /
This can also be done according [to the Yab Ka maṇḍala ritual].[*7]
gsum pa gsang ba'i mchod pa ni/
Third, the secret offering.
oM badzra bI Ne AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra vīṇe āḥ hūṃ
rdo rje pi waM ma sngon mos pi waM gi sgras mchod/
Vajra lady of the lute, blue, offers the sound of a lute.
oM badzra waM she AHhU~M/
oṃ vajra vaṃśe āḥ hūṃ
rdo rje gling bu ma ser mos gling bu'i sgras mchod/
Vajra lady of the flute, yellow, offers the sound of a flute.
oM badzra mr-i daM ge=
oṃ vajra mṛdaṃge…
rdo rje rnga zlum ma dmar mos rnga zlum gyi sgras mchod/
Vajra lady of the round drum, red, offers the sound of a round drum.
oM badzra mu ra dze=
oṃ vajra muraje…
rdo rje rdza rnga ma ljang gus rdza rnga'i sgras mchod/
Vajra lady of the clay drum, green, offers the sound of a clay drum.
oM badzra hA s+ye=
oṃ vajra hāsye…
rdo rje bzhad ma dmar mos bzhad pa'i 'dzum mdangs kyis mchod/
Vajra lady of laughter, red, offers with a brilliant smiling face.
oM badzra lA s+ye/
oṃ vajra lāsye…
rdo rje sgeg ma sngon mos mdzes pa'i 'gying bag sna tshogs kyis=
Vajra lady of grace, blue, offers with elegant beauty.
oM badzra gI tI=
oṃ vajra gītī…
rdo rje glu ma ljang gus snyan pa'i glu dbyangs=
Vajra lady of song, green, singing sweetly.
oM badzra nr-i t+ye=
oṃ vajra nṛtye…
rdo rje gar ma ser mos mdzes pa'i gar=
Vajra lady of dance, yellow, offers with a gorgeous dance.
oM badzra puSh+pe=
oṃ vajra puṣpe…
rdo rje me tog ma dkar mos me tog=
Vajra lady of flowers, white, offers flowers.
oM badzra d+hU pe= rdo rje bdug spos ma sngon mos bdug spos=
oṃ vajra dhūpe… Vajra lady of incense, blue, offers incense.
oM badzra dI paM= rdo rje snang gsal ma dmar mos snang gsal=
oṃ vajra dīpaṃ… Vajra lady of lamps, red, offers lamps.
oM badzra gan+d+he= rdo rje dri chab ma ljang gus dri chab=
oṃ vajra gandhe… Vajra lady of perfume, green, offers perfumes.
oM badzra dar+she= rdo rje gzugs ma dkar mos spyan la mdzes pa'i gzugs=
oṃ vajra darśe… Vajra lady of forms, white, offers beautiful forms for the eyes.
oM badzra ra sa= rdo rje ro ma dmar mos ljags la bda' ba'i zhal zas=
oṃ vajra rasa… Vajra lady of tastes, red, offers tasty food to the tongue.
oM badzra spar+she= rdo rje reg ma ser mos sku la bde ba'i na bza'=
oṃ vajra sparśe… Vajra lady of touch, yellow, offers comfortable cloth to the body.
oM badzra d+harme= rdo rje chos dbyings ma sngon mos chos dbyings bde ba chen po'i mchod pas mchod cing mnyes par rol par bsam/
oṃ vajra dharme… Vajra lady of the dharmadhātu, blue, offers the dharmadhātu, great bliss. Receiving these offerings, delight in pleasure. Thus, contemplate.
bzhi pa de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa ni/
Four, the offering of suchness.

mchod gnas dam pa mchod mkhan 'khor gsum po/ / dbyer med chos nyid ngang du ro gcig pa'i/ / bla med blo 'das mchod pa dam pa 'di/ / bla ma dkyil 'khor lha tshogs rnams la 'bul/ / dge bas 'gro kun de nyid rtogs par shog /

The three spheres of the sacred offering place, the offerings, and the agent, inseparable and of one taste in dharmatā, are the highest sacred offerings transcending the intellect. This is presented to the guru and assembled deities of the maṇḍala. Through this virtue, may all beings realize suchness.
bstod pa ni/
Praises. {407}
bcom ldan rnam kun (407 )sogs rkang brgyad dang /

Bhagavatī, great Vajravārāhī of all manifestations, [unswayed by opponents, the three worlds, Vajravārāhī, conquering fears of bhūtas, residing at Vajrāsana, and victorious over Brahmā, you dry up and destroy all fears of Māra. With a form the nature of all birth, abiding, and arising, you are empress of the three planes, the perfection of phenomena. To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I offer praise.] Thus, praise with those eight lines.
spro na/
If you wish to elaborate, say:
oM/ srid zhi'i dge legs ma lus stsol mdzad pa'i/ / bka' brgyud bla ma dam pa rnams dang ni/ / bcom ldan rdo rje phag mo 'khor bcas la/ / bdag ni sgo gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal bstod/
oṃ Those who bestow the virtue and excellence of existence and peace, the genuine Kagyu gurus and the Bhagavatī, Vajravārāhī, and retinue, I respectfully pay homage with my three doors.
AH pad nyi 'jigs byed dus mtshan gdan steng na/ / bcom ldan rdo rje phag mo dmar mo ni/ / rab mdzes yid 'ong zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma/ / gri thod 'dzin zhing kha T+wAM gru mor brten/ /

āḥ On seats of a lotus, sun, Bhairava, and Kālarātri, Bhagavatī, Vajravārāhī, red, is captivating and beautiful, with one face and two hands. Holding a hooked knife and skull cup, a khaṭvāṃga rests in the crook of your elbow.

dbu skra sil bu gyen brdzes 'khor lo dang / / me tog phreng mdzes thod skam cod pan sogs/ / lhag ma thur grol rtse mo li zhing 'khyil/ / rus rgyan dril g.yer khrag 'dzag do shal 'phyang / / spyan gsum khro 'dzum nyams rgyas mdzes chags kyi/ /

Your loose hair sweeps upward, beautified with a cakra and garlands of flowers, the remainder is free, flowing and swirling. With bone ornaments, small bells, a necklace dripping blood, and three eyes, you are beautiful with your wrathful and smiling moods.
lhan skyes bde bas myos pa'i rnam 'gyur can/ / zhabs gnyis brkyang bskum 'jigs dus snying ga brdzis/ / dus gsum sangs rgyas ma lus skyed pa'i yum/ / rje btsun rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal bstod/

You have the expression of being intoxicated with the connate bliss of passion. Your legs, extended and drawn up, trample on the hearts of Bhairava and Kālarātri. You are the mother who creates all buddhas of the three times. To Jetsun Yoginī, I pay homage and praise.
hU~M/ khyams kyi steng 'og phyogs mtshams thams cad kun/ / yid 'ong mchod sprin du mas mchod byed pa'i/ / lha mo bcu drug rgyud sde bzhi la sogs/ / bar khyams gang ba'i 'khor la= /

hūṃ In the courtyard, above, below, and in all the directions, are those who present the pleasing offering clouds: the sixteen goddesses, those of the four classes of tantras, and so on. To the retinue who fill the courtyard spaces,…
dur khrod nang bzhugs phyogs skyong zhing skyong klu/ / rnal 'byor pho mo 'dre srin yi dwags dang / / sha za smyo byed 'byung po ro langs sogs/ / mtha' yas phyi 'khor rnams la=

Residing in the charnel grounds are the protectors of the directions, field protectors, nāgas, yogins and yoginīs, spirits, rākṣasas, hungry ghosts, piśācas, those causing madness, bhūtas, zombies, and the others. To the infinite outer retinue,…
bcom ldan rdo rje phag mo 'khor bcas la/ / phyag 'tshal mchod 'bul sdig pa ma lus bshags/ / dge la yi rang chos 'khor bskor bzhin du/ / mya ngan mi 'da' rtag par bzhugs su gsol/ /

To the Bhagavatī, Vajravārāhī, and retinue, I pay homage, present offerings, and confess my negative actions. I rejoice in virtue and request the turning of the dharma wheel. Please do not pass into nirvāṇa—always remain.
dge ba bla med byang chub chen por bsngo/ / bsngos bzhin myur 'grub gyur cig
I dedicate all virtue to the unsurpassable great awakening. May it be swiftly accomplished in keeping with this dedication.
phaT swA hA/
phaṭ svāhā
gnyis pa
2. The Process of Self-Entering Oneself and Conferring the Abhiṣekas
['di] la gnyis/ bdag nyid 'jug pa dang / slob ma la dbang bskur ba'o/ /
This has two parts: (1) entering oneself and (2) conferring the abhiṣekas on disciples.
dang po ni/
a. Entering Oneself
spro zhing nus na 'og nas 'byung ba'i dbang gi cho gas rdzogs par blang / mi lcogs na bla ma'i rnal 'byor skabs ltar ting nge 'dzin gyis dbang bzhi blangs pas chog par gsungs so/ / (408)

If you wish to elaborate and are able to do so, do the complete ritual for the abhiṣeka, which appears below. If you are unable to do that, it is taught that it is sufficient to take the four abhiṣekas through the power of samādhi as done in the context of guru yoga. {408}
gnyis pa dbang bskur ba
b. Conferring the Abhiṣekas
['di] la dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa dang / zhugs nas dbang bskur ba gnyis las/
This has two parts: (1) entering the maṇḍala and (2) having entered, the bestowal of the abhiṣekas.
dang po
i. Entering the Maṇḍala
['di] la gzhung gi sdom tshig las bcu gnyis su gsungs pa'i
It is taught in the summarizing verses of the main text that this has twelve parts.
dang por khrus bya ba ni/
A) Bathing
slob ma rnams sgo drung du 'du/ ji ltar bltams pa sogs brjod cing las bum chus khrus bya/

The disciples gather in front of the door. Just as when [the Buddha] was born [the gods bathed him, now with pure water of the gods I bathe your body. oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya śrīye hūṃ] Wash them with water from the activity vase.
gnyis pa bgegs bskrad pa ni/
B) Expelling Obstructors

bla ma dang dkyil 'khor gtso bo'i sprul pa zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma'i sku las skyes pa'i ye shes kyi me dang / thugs ka'i mtshon cha'i char gyis bgegs thams cad rgya mtsho'i pha mthar bskrad par bsams la/

An emanation of the principal one of the maṇḍala and the guru, appears a lady with one face and two arms. The wisdom fire from her body and the rain of weapons from her heart expel all obstructors to the far side of the ocean. Thus, contemplate.
thun gyis brab cing / sum+b+ha ni'i sngags brjod cing bskrad/
Pelting them with consecrated substances and saying the sumbha ni mantra, expel them.
gsum pa
C) Explaining the Dharma

chos bshad rgyas bsdus skabs dang sbyar te maN+Dal 'bul ba ni/ sems bskyed gsal gdab/ lo rgyus rgyas bsdus gang rung dang / 'dir skabs su bab ma gsang sngags bla na med pa'i rgyud sde rnams kyi mthar thug ma rgyud yang snying 'khor lo sdom pa'i zab chos snyan brgyud nor bu skor gsum zhes 'phags yul gyi grub thob gzhan la ma grags pa'i zab chos thun mong ma yin pa grub pa'i dbang phyug tai lo pa nas chig brgyud rim par byon te/

Explain the dharma, extensively or briefly, in keeping with the occasion. Offer a maṇḍala. Clarify the generation of bodhicitta. Recount the stories, detailed or abbreviated, and say the following: Now, on this occasion, [what you will receive] is the profound dharma of Cakrasaṃvara, the innermost essence of the mother tantras, the culmination of all the Secret Mantra niruttara tantras, called the Three Cycles of Gems of the Aural Transmission. It is an uncommon profound dharma not known to other siddhas in India and was passed down in a single transmission from the lord of siddhas Tilopa.

de mtshungs mi la bzhad pa rdo rje la ye shes mkha' 'gros lung bstan ltar zhal slob thun mong ma yin pa la snyan brgyud kyi dum bu re gnang ba'i nang tshan/ ras chung rdo rje grags pa nas snyan nas snyan du brgyud pa'i yid bzhin nor bu skor gsum la/ rnam grangs mang du bzhugs pa las 'dir yum bka'i phyi dkyil brgyad kyi nang tshan/ bsdus pa lhan cig skyes ma'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur bar bgyi ba la sogs kyis mtshams sbyar la thog mar 'jug pa'i chos rnams zhu ba'i yon du dmigs te maN+Dal phul/

In a similar manner, in keeping with the prophecy he received from Jñānaḍākinī, Mila Shepa Dorje bestowed parts of the Aural Transmission on his exceptional personal disciples. One set of those is the Three Cycles of Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Aural Transmission transmitted orally from Rechung Dorje Drakpa. Among the many types [of teachings and texts in that cycle], here, from the set of eight outer Yum Ka maṇḍalas, the abhiṣeka for the abbreviated maṇḍala of the Sahajā will be given. Thus, make the introduction and then say: First, visualize a gift to request the dharma for entering and offer a maṇḍala.
bzhi pa gsol ba gdab pa ni/
D) The Supplication
thal mo me tog bcas/
Holding flowers in your palms:
rje btsun ma dang dbyer med pa'i/ / dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa ste/ / slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol/ / byang chub chen po'i tshul ston pa'i/ / mgon po chen por bdag 'tshal lo/ /
Great joy, you are my teacher, who is inseparable from Jetsunma. Ācārya, please consider me. I request the great protector to teach the way to great awakening.
dam tshig de nyid bdag la stsol/ / byang chub sems kyang bdag la stsol/ / sangs (409)rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / skyabs gsum dag kyang bdag la stsol/ /
Bestow on me this samaya. Bestow on me bodhicitta. {409} Bestow on me the three refuges: the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha.
thar pa chen po'i grong mchog tu/ / mgon pos bdag ni gzhug tu gsol/
Protector, please enter me into the city of great liberation.
lan gsum/
Three times.
lnga pa chos bshad pa la thun mong gi chos ni/ /
E) Explaining the Uncommon Dharma
sdug bsngal chu bo bzhi 'bab cing / / gting mtha' med pa'i srid mtsho 'dir/ / skyo ba'i sems ni rab bskyed la/ / rnyed dka'i rten mchog gru gzings 'dir/ /
The common dharma is as follows: Give rise to mental weariness toward this ocean of existence, bottomless and endless, where the four rivers of suffering flow.
stong nyid snying rje'i skya bar rdzas/ / brtson 'grus drag pos drangs byas te/ / bla med thar pa'i gling mchog tu/ / don gnyis nor bu thob par gyis/

In this boat of the supreme support, difficult to acquire, with the oars of emptiness and compassion, guided by strong exertion, on the supreme island of unsurpassable liberation, you will achieve the gem of twofold benefit.
zhes dang /
And:
khyad par gyi chos ni/ bskal par bsags pa'i mun pa yang / / nyi zla sgron me la sogs pa'i/ / 'od kyi snang bas skad cig mas/ /
The special dharma is as follows: Even darkness that has built up for eons can be cleared away by a moment of illuminating light, such as from the sun, moon, or a lamp.
sel ba ji bzhin thog med nas/ / bsags pa'i sdig sgrib ma lus pa/ / ye shes snang ba skad cig mas/ / sel babs rdo rje theg pa yi/ / gsang ba las kyang ches gsang ba/ /

Similarly, negative actions and obscurations built up from beginningless time can be dispelled by a moment of illuminating wisdom. The methods[3] for that are what is the most secret of secrets within the Vajrayāna.
bde mchog mkha' 'gro snyan brgyud kyi/ / dbang bskur zab mo sbyin bya yi/ / khyed rnams dga' dang spro bar gyis/ zhes bshad/
Be delighted and inspired that you are to be given the profound abhiṣekas of the Saṃvara Ḍākinī Aural Transmission. Thus, explain.
drug pa sdom pa bzung ba la/ /
F) Holding the Vows
thun mong gi sdom pa ni/
The common vows.
bla ma yi dam gtsor bzhugs pa'i/ / sras bcas sangs rgyas thams cad kyang / / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma tshogs kun/ / thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
Gurus and yidams, present as the principal ones, all buddhas together with your children, and the whole assembly of heroes and yoginīs, please consider me.
che ge mo zhes bgyi pa bdag / bla med byang chub ma thob bar/ / dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/ / sogs spyi ltar lan gsum/

I, (insert your name), until attaining unsurpassable awakening, take refuge in the three jewels. [I confess each and every negative action and unvirtuous deed. I rejoice in the virtuous actions of all beings. Holding the awakening of the buddhas in mind, I take refuge in the buddhas, dharma, and supreme assembly until awakening. In order to achieve benefit for myself and others, I arouse bodhicitta. Having aroused the supreme bodhicitta, I invite all beings as my guests. I will practice the supreme pleasing conduct of bodhisattvas. For the sake of beings, may I quickly attain buddhahood.] Say that three times as is customarily done.
khyad par sngags kyi sdom pa bzung ba ni/
Holding the special Mantra vows.
bla ma yi dam gtsor bzhugs pa'i/ / sras bcas sangs rgyas thams cad dang / / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma tshogs kun/ / thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
Gurus and yidams, present as the principal ones, all buddhas together with your children, and the whole assembly of heroes and yoginīs, please consider me.

che ge mo zhes bgyi ba bdag / dus 'di nyid nas bzung nas ni/ / ji srid byang chub ma thob bar/ / ji ltar dus gsum mgon po rnams/ / byang chub tu ni nges mdzad pa'i/ / byang chub sems ni bla na med/ / dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi/ / (410)

I, (insert your name), starting from this time until reaching awakening, give rise to genuine [bodhicitta], just as the protectors of the three times gave rise to unsurpassable bodhicitta, which definitely brings awakening. {410}
tshul khrims kyi ni bslab pa dang / / dge ba'i chos ni sdud pa dang / / sems can don byed tshul khrims gsum/ / so sor brtan por bzung bar bgyi/ /
I will hold firmly each of the three modes of ethical conduct: training in ethical conduct, gathering virtuous qualities, and benefiting sentient beings.
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / bla na med pa'i dkon mchog gsum/ / sangs rgyas rnal 'byor las skyes pa'i/ / sdom pa deng nas brtan por bzung / /
I will hold firmly, starting now, the vow arising from buddhayoga: those of the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha, the unsurpassable three jewels.
rdo rje rigs mchog chen po la/ / rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya yang / / yang dag nyid du gzung bar bgyi/ / slob dpon dag kyang gzung bar bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme vajra family, I will hold perfectly the vajra, ghaṇṭā, and mudrās and I will hold the ācārya.
rin chen rigs mchog chen po yi/ / dam tshig yid du 'ong ba la/ / nyin re bzhin yang dus drug tu/ / sbyin pa rnam bzhi rtag cu sbyin/ /
For the great, supreme ratna family, I will always perform the four types of generosity six times each day as the samaya that is pleasing to the mind.
byang chub chen po las byung ba'i/ / pad+ma'i rigs chen dag pa la/ / phyi nang gsang ba theg pa gsum/ / dam pa'i chos ni ma lus gzung / /
For the great, pure padma family, arising from great awakening, I will hold the genuine dharma of the three yānas, outer, inner, and secret.
las kyi rigs mchog chen po la/ / sdom pa thams cad ldan par ni/ / yang dag nyid du gzung bar bgyi/ / mchod pa'i las kyang ci nas bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme karma family, I will hold perfectly all the vows. I will perform all possible acts of worship.
byang chub sems ni bla med mchog / dam pa bdag gis bskyed bgyis nas/ / sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir/ / bdag gis sdom pa ma lus bzung / /
Having developed genuine, supreme, unsurpassable bodhicitta, I will hold all the vows for the benefit of all sentient beings.
ma bsgral ba rnams bdag gis bsgral/ / ma grol ba rnams bdag gis dgrol/ / dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung zhing / / sems can mya ngan 'das la 'god/ lan gsum/

May I release those who have not been released. May I liberate those who have not been liberated. May I provide relief to those who have no relief. May I establish sentient beings in nirvāṇa. Three times.
bdun pa mtshams sbyor
G) The Transition
spyi ltar gyis me tog byin la/
As is customary, give them flowers.
a khaM wI ra hU~M/ sngags de nyid kyis gdong g.yogs dmar po bcing /
a khaṃ vīra hūṃ With that mantra, tie the red blindfolds.
brgyad pa nga rgyal 'phos la nang du gzhug pa ni/
H) Transference of Pride and Entering the Interior

dkyil 'khor gtso mo'i sprul pa rje btsun ma zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma zhig srung 'khor gyi phyi rol du byon pas/ rang gi lag nas khrid de rdzu 'phrul gyis skad cig la srung 'khor gyi nang du tshud par gyur/ dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH zhes nang du zhugs par bsam/

A Jetsunma, with one face and two arms, an emanation of the principal one of the maṇḍala, goes outside of the protection cakra, and taking you by the hand, miraculously, in an instant, she leads you into the protection cakra. jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ Think that they enter inside.
dgu pa phyag 'tshal ba ni/
I) Homage
dkyil 'khor gyi shar sgo nas phyag 'tshal bar bsam zhing /
Imagine that they are paying homage at the eastern door of the maṇḍala.
sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa'i sku/ / yid bzhin nor bu (411) gtsug gi rgyan/ / tshogs kyi slob dpon tshogs kyi mchog / dpal ldan sku la skyabs su mchi/ /
In the embodiment of all the buddhas, {411} with the crown ornament of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems, ācārya of the assembly, the supreme one of the assembly, the glorious kāya, I take refuge.
de bzhin du lho sgo nas/ 'khor ba'i 'khor lo rgyun gcod cing / / chos kyi 'khor lo skor mdzad pa/ / bde mchog 'khor lo bde ba'i mchog /
Similarly, at the southern door: In the one who stops the wheel of saṃsāra and turns the wheel of dharma, Cakrasaṃvara, the sublime bliss,
dpal ldan sku la= nub nas/ sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa'i yum/ / bcom ldan 'das ma rje btsun ma/ / ma gcig rdo rje rnal 'byor ma/ / dpal ldan bla mar phyag 'tshal lo/ /
the glorious kāya, I take refuge. In the west: In the mother who gives birth to all buddhas, the Bhagavatī, Jetsunma, the one mother, Vajrayoginī, the glorious guru, I take refuge.
byang nas/ dpa' bo dpa' mo rdo rje yi/ / spyan can chos skyong rdo rje spun/ / ma lus lus pa med pa la/ / phyag 'tshal gus pas skyabs su mchi/
In the north: To the heroes and heroines with vajra eyes, vajra siblings who are dharma protectors, to every one, without exception, I prostrate and respectfully take refuge.
zhes thal mo gnas gsum du sbyar bas btud do/ /
They should bow with their hands joined in añjali at their three places.
bcu pa me tog dor ba ni/
J) Tossing Flowers
thal mo kha sbyar ba'i me tog rang rigs kyi lha la phul bar bsams la/
With a flower between their hands in añjali, think that they offer it to the deity of their family.
oM puSh+pe mA la pra tIts+tsha hoH zhes dor ba'i me tog lhag pa'i lhas rang gi spyi bor bcings shing lha de las mar me gnyis mched kyi tshul du spyi bor thim par bsam/

oṃ puṣpe māla pratīccha hoḥ Imagine that their special deity ties the tossed flowers to their heads and that deity replicates and dissolves into the top of their heads, like one candle flame becoming a second one.
oM puSh+pe mA la sa ma ya hU~M/ zhes me tog spyi bor bkod/ /
oṃ puṣpe māla samaya hūṃ Place the flowers on the top of their heads.
bcu gcig pa mig dbye ba ni/
K) Opening the Eyes
ma rig pa'i ling thog mig dang dang lhan cig tu bsal bar bsams la phyag rgya dang bcas/
Think that the cataracts of ignorance are removed together with the blindfold. With the mudrā, say:
rnal 'byor ma dpal deng khyod kyi/ / mig 'byed par ni brtson par mdzad/ / rdo rje'i mig ni bla na med/ / phye bas ye shes mthong bar gyur/ /
Today the glorious Yoginī has opened your eyes. Vajra eyes are unsurpassable: once open, they will see wisdom.
oM badzra nai tra a pa ha ra pa Ta laM hrIHprAM zhes mig dbye/
oṃ vajra naitra apahara paṭa laṃ hrīḥ prāṃ Thus, open their eyes.
bcu gnyis pa dkyil 'khor mthong ba bstan pa ni/
L) Revealing the Sight of the Maṇḍala
thar pa chen po'i grong khyer mchog / ltos shig ltos shig sems dpa' che/ / dkyil 'khor bzang po 'di la ltos/ / me tog gang du lhung gyur pa/ / de ni khyod kyi lhag pa'i lha/ /
Look, look, great sattva at the supreme city of great liberation. Look at this excellent maṇḍala. Upon whomever your flower fell, they are your special deity.

de la dad pa rab tu bskyed/ / sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlabs/ / bskal pa bye ba du ma ru/ / sngon du sdig pa byas pa gang / / dkyil 'khor 'di 'dra mthong ma thag / de dag zad par 'gyur yin na/ /

Arouse great faith in them. You are blessed by mantras and mudrās. Even evil acts previously committed throughout many millions of eons will be expunged immediately when a maṇḍala such as this is seen.
grags pa mtha' yas sngags brjod pas/ / tshul la gnas na smos ci dgos/ / skyob pa'i gsang sngags bzlas na ni/ / go 'phang bla na med (412)par 'gyur/ /
If that is so, what need is there to mention those who abide in the way of mantra recitation of infinite renown. Those who recite the secret mantra of refuge {412} achieve the highest state.
bdag nyid chen po khyed rnams gyis/ / rnyed pa mnyam med de ring rnyed/ / de phyir khyed rnams skal ldan 'gyur/ / dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rigs skye/ / dam tshig mchog la gnas par gyis/
Today, you, great beings, have attained the unequaled attainment. Thus, you have become one of good fortune. You have been born in the family of heroes and yoginīs. Abide in the supreme samaya.

ngas khyed rnams kyi ma rig pa'i ling tog bsal nas dkyil 'khor bzang po lta bar yod pas ltos shig / 'di na dngos grub kun gyi 'byung gnas bla ma rdo rje slob dpon gyi sku rang bzhin lhun gyis grub pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / des mtshon te mdun gyi 'og ras bris kyi dkyil 'khor gyis sprul sku/ bar bdud rtsi'i dkyil 'khor gyis longs sku/ steng sin+d+hU ra'i dkyil 'khor gyis chos sku mtshon la/ mtshon bya chos kyi sku nyid mtshon byed gzugs kyi rnam par shar ba rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma lhan cig skyes ma'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor bzhugs pa yin te/ de'ang nam mkha'i dbyings su chos kyi 'byung gnas sogs bskyed sngags bor ba'i mngon rtogs ltar ngo sprad pa las/ dbus na bzhugs par gyur/ khyams kyi steng 'og bar snang sogs nas/ dpag tu med pas gang bar gyur/ bar brjod

I have removed your cataracts of ignorance. Since the excellent maṇḍala may now be seen, look. This natural, innately present maṇḍala, the body of the guru, the vajrācārya, the source of all siddhis and what reveals it—in front, the lower cloth-drawn maṇḍala showing the nirmāṇakāya, the middle maṇḍala of amṛta showing the saṃbhogakāya, and the sindhūra maṇḍala above showing the dharmakāya—are present as the wisdom maṇḍala of Jetsun Vajrayoginī, Sahajā: the dharmakāya itself, what is to be revealed, and the arising of forms, the means of revealing. In the dhātu of space, a source of dharmas…[*8] Thus, the introduction is given according to the method of realization, [the visualization,] leaving out the mantra visualization. …I stand in the middle of raging wisdom fire coming from all my pores. The courtyard, above, below, and in its surrounding spaces,…[*9] innumerable heroes and ḍākinīs.

mthar/ dngos grub kyi 'byung gnas bla ma yin pas nga la ltos/ yi dam dkyil 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa yin pas dkyil 'khor la ltos/ zhes steng 'og bar gsum gyi dkyil 'khor gsum po mngon rtogs ltar bstan la sku gsum du ngo sprad/ phrin las sgrub pa'i mkha' 'gro dam rdzas dang / bar chad sel ba'i chos skyong gtor ma'i rnam par bzhugs pa dang / mthun rkyen sgrub pa'i rdo rje spun rnams dngos su bzhugs pa la ltos la dga' bar gyis shig / ces brjod/

At the end of that, say: Since the source of siddhis is the guru, look to me. Since the yidams abide within the maṇḍala, look to the maṇḍala. Thus, the three maṇḍalas—below, in the middle, and above—are presented according to the method of realization, [the visualization,] and the three kāyas are introduced. Look at the ḍākinīs, who achieve activity, as present in the samaya substances; at the dharma protectors, who clear away obstacles, as present in the form of the tormas; and at the vajra siblings, who bring about conducive conditions, as those actually present. Feel joy.
gnyis pa zhugs nas dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba
ii. Having Entered, the Bestowal of the Abhiṣekas
['di] la/ dbang dngos dang mtha' rten gnyis/
This has two parts: (1) the actual abhiṣekas and (2) the conclusion.
dang po
A) The Actual Abhiṣekas
['di] la'ang bzhi yod pa las/ thog mar snang ba lhar ngo sprad pa bum dbang gi sdom la brgyad du gsungs pa'i
This has four sections.[4] To begin with, the summarization of the vase abhiṣeka, which points out appearances to be the deities, is taught to be eightfold.
[1) Supplication]
dang po gsol ba gdab pa ni/
The first is supplication.
rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor mas/ / bdag la bum dbang bskur du gsol/ zhes brjod/
Jetsun Vajrayoginī, please bestow the vase abhiṣeka upon me. {413}
gnyis pa sgo gsum ba~M du (413 )bsgyur ba ni/
2) Transforming the Three Doors into Vaṃ

bla ma'i thugs ka'i 'od kyis bdag gi sgo gsum gyi sdig sgrib sbyangs shing 'od du zhu nas bla ma'i zhal du drangs pas mkha' nang du ba~M du gyur/ ba~M thugs ka nas spros pad nyi ro yi gdan gyi steng du bzhag par gyur/ ba~M zhes brjod/

Light from the guru’s heart purifies the negative actions and obscurations of your three doors. Having melted into light and been drawn in through the guru’s mouth, you become vaṃ in the space. The vaṃ goes out from [the guru’s] heart and rests on seats of a lotus, sun, and corpse. vaṃ
gsum pa lhar bskyed pa ni/
3) Generating the Deities

ba~M yongs su gyur pa las/ khyed rang rnams rje btsun rdo rje rnal 'byor ma gcer bu sku mdog dmar mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma'i g.yas gri gug thur du bzung nas gdug pa can la bsdigs shing / g.yon bdud bzhi'i khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa thugs kar 'dzin pa'i gru mo na yab he ru ka mtshon pa'i kha T+wAM ga 'chang ba

Vaṃ transforms, and you become Jetsun Vajrayoginī, naked, red, with one face and two hands. Your right holds a hooked knife down, threatening malevolent ones. Your left holds a skull cup filled with the blood of the four māras at your heart, and in the crook of that elbow is a khaṭvāṃga symbolizing the Heruka.

dmar la 'khyug cing mdzes la yangs pa'i spyan gsum zur gyis gzigs shing / khro la 'dzum pa'i zhal mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa/ dbu skra sil bu'i stod cha gyen du brdzes shing / 'khor lo dang me tog gi phreng bas mdzes pa/ lhag ma thur du grol bas rked pa non cing / zhabs gnyis g.yas brkyangs pas 'jigs byed nag po'i snying ga dang g.yon cung zad bskums pas dus mtshan dmar po'i nu dbrag mnan pa'i rol stabs kyis bzhugs pa'i sku la mi mgo skam po lnga yi dbu rgyan dang / rlon pa khrag 'dzag pa lnga bcu'i do shal 'phyang zhing / rus pa'i rgyan drug gis mdzes pa/ gzugs dang lang tsho dar la babs shing b+ha ga dang nu ma rab tu rgyas pa bde ba chen pos rnam par myos pa'i cha byad can/

You glance from the corners of your three eyes, which are red and darting, beautiful and wide. In your wrathful and smiling face your fangs are slightly bared. The upper part of your loose hair sweeps upward and is beautified by a cakra and garlands of flowers. The remainder hangs down freely, reaching to your waist. With your two legs, you stand in the playful posture with your right extended, pressing down on the heart of black Bhairava; and your left, slightly drawn up, trampling on the middle of the chest of red Kālarātri. Your body is beautified with a crown of five dried human heads, a necklace of fifty fresh ones dripping blood, and the six bone ornaments. Your form, splendor, vitality, bhaga, and breasts are radiant. You have the quality of intoxicating with great bliss.

snang la rang bzhin med pa'i sku yi 'od kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'gengs nus pa/ phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thugs su chud cing skye 'gro kun gyi yid 'phrog pa'i bdag nyid ma/ ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas ye shes kyi me rab tu 'bar ba'i dbus na bzhugs par gyur par bsam mo/ /

The light of your body, which appears yet is without nature, has the power to fill the entire world. You embody fathoming the minds of the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions and captivating the minds of all living beings. You stand in the middle of raging wisdom fire coming from all your pores.
bzhi pa go bgo ba ni/
4) The Placing of Armor

rdo rje phag mo'i lte bar oM ba~M phag mo dmar mo/ / snying gar haM yoM gshin rje ma sngon mo/ / mgrin par hriM mo rmongs byed (414)ma dkar mo/ / dpral bar hriM hriM skyod ma ser mo/ spyi gtsug tu hU~M hU~M skrag byed ma ljang gu/ yan lag thams cad la phaT phaT las gtum mo dud ka ste/ thams cad kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma g.yas gri gug dang g.yon thod khrag 'dzin pa'i gru mo na kha T+wAM ga 'chang ba/ gcer bu dpa' mo'i rgyan cha lugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa zhabs g.yas bskum zhing g.yon brkyang ba'i gar stabs kyis pad nyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o/ /

As Vajravārāhī, at your navel is oṃ vaṃ, red Vārāhī. At your heart is haṃ yoṃ, blue Yāminī. At your throat is hrīṃ moṃ, white Mohanī.[5] {414} At your forehead is hriṃ hriṃ, yellow Saṃcālanī. At the crown of your head is hūṃ hūṃ, green Saṃtrāsanī. In the joints of all your limbs are phaṭ phaṭs, smoky Caṇḍikās. They all have one face and two hands. In their right, they hold hooked knives; and in their left, skull cups with blood. Khaṭvāṃgas rest in the crooks of their left elbows. They are naked and complete with the ornaments and attributes of heroines. They stand on seats of lotuses, suns, and corpses in the dancing position with their right legs bent and their left extended.
lnga pa ye shes pa dbab pa ni/
5) The Descent of the Wisdom Ones
bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis bdag la dpal rnal 'byor ma dbab par mdzad du gsol/ / zhes gsol ba btab pas/
Guru and all the deities of the maṇḍala, please cause the glorious Yoginī to descend into me. Thus, supplicate.

slob dpon gyi thugs ka'i ba~M dang / rang lus yi dam du gsal ba'i stong ra'i nang / rtsa dbu ma pad+ma dmar po 'dab brgyad dang khams dmar po nyi ma/ dkar po zla ba'i gdan gyi steng du rang 'dra'i ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' rnal 'byor ma tshon gang tsam gsal la yangs pa mgar ba'i sol mal nas thon pa'i lcags bsregs lta bu las 'od zer phyogs bcur 'phros pas phyogs bcu'i bla ma yi dam sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rang 'dra'i sku dang phyag mtshan yig 'bru me'i rang bzhin 'od zer rab tu 'bar ba'i rnam par spyan drangs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gtso mo las kyang rang 'dra dpag tu med pa 'phros/ tsheg sgra 'ur sgra dang bcas snying ga'i rnal 'byor ma rang lus la thim pas/ rnal 'byor ma mer 'bar ba dang drag tu 'bar zhing rang lus kyang mer 'bar bas mi bzod pa'i bde ba rgyas par gyur par bsams la rig pa hur phyungs la rol mo drag tu 'khrol zhing /

In the heart of the ācārya is a vaṃ. You appear clearly as the yidam, and within your empty enclosure, in your madhyamā channel is a red eight-petaled lotus with a sun, the red dhātu, and a moon, the white dhātu. On those seats appears a clear and spacious thumb-sized samādhisattva Yoginī, who resembles yourself and is like the burning iron produced by a blacksmith’s charcoal fire. From [the vaṃ and the samādhisattva,] light rays radiate to the ten directions, invoking the gurus, yidams, buddhas, and bodhisattvas of the ten directions in forms like yourself, emblems, seed letters, and blazing light with the nature of fire. From the principal one of the maṇḍala, innumerable forms like themselves radiate. With crackling sounds and roaring sounds, they all dissolve into the body of the Yoginī at your heart. The Yoginī is on fire, and your body blazes, causing overwhelming bliss to expand. Thus, contemplate. Intensify your awareness, play music forcefully, and say:
oM badzra b+ha ra hI dz+nyA na A be sha ya a AH zhes dbab/ oM badzra b+ha ra hI su pra tiSh+Tha badzra ya swA hA/ zhes spyi bor rgya gram du bzhag pas brtan par bsam/
