oṃ vajrabharahī jñāna āveśaya a āḥ Thus, [the wisdom ones] descend. oṃ vajrabharahī supratiṣṭha vajrāya svāhā By placing crossed vajra on their heads, think that is stabilized.
drug pa dbang bskur ba ni/
6) Bestowing of the Abhiṣeka

bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyis/ bdag la mngon par dbang bskur du gsol/ zhes gsol ba btab pas lha tshogs rnams (415)kyis bum pa'i chus dbang bskur bar bsam ste/ rnam rgyal bum pa lag tu thogs la/
rnal 'byor ma dpal 'khor bcas kyi/ / sku gsung thugs las byung ba yi/ / sgrib gnyis bag chags sbyong byed pa'i/ / rdo rje'i dbang bskur chen po sbyin/ /
You are given the great vajra abhiṣeka that arises from the body, speech, and mind of the glorious Yoginī and retinue, purifying the latent tendencies of the two obscurations.
oM badzra u da ka a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ zhes dbang bskur zhing bum chu sbyin/
oṃ vajra udaka abhiṣiñca hūṃ Confer the abhiṣeka and give them vase water.

zhes gsungs shing bum pa'i chus spyi bo nas dbang bskur bas sgo gsum gyi dri ma dag / lus thams cad bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis gang ste spyi bor 'khyil ba rnam par snang mdzad du gyur nas dbur brgyan par gyur/ des mi bskyod pa chu'i dbang gi go bcad nas

Having said that and by conferring the abhiṣeka on your head with the vase water, the stains of your three doors are purified. Your body is filled with the stream of amṛta. It swirls to the top of your head, becoming Vairocana, and you are crowned. That serves as the water abhiṣeka of Akṣobhya.
rin 'byung cod pan gyi dbang ni/
The crown abhiṣeka of Ratnasambhava.
dkyil 'khor gtso mo'i thugs ka nas rin 'byung gi rang bzhin dbang rdzas dbu rgyan gyi rnam par 'phros te mgo bor bcings par bsam/
From the heart of the principal one of the maṇḍala radiates the abhiṣeka implement, the nature of Ratnasambhava in the form of a crown. It is tied to your head. Thus, contemplate.
oM rat+na mu kuT a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ zhes spyi bor bcing /
oṃ ratna mukuṭa abhiṣiñca hūṃ Thus, tie it to their heads.
'od dpag med rdo rje'i dbang ni/
The vajra abhiṣeka of Amitābha.
dkyil 'khor gtso mo'i thugs ka nas 'od dpag med kyi rang bzhin dbang rdzas rdo rje'i rnam par 'phros te lag tu gtad par bsam/
From the heart of the principal one of the maṇḍala radiates the abhiṣeka implement, the nature of Amitābha in the form of a vajra. It is placed in your hand. Thus, contemplate.
oM ma hA badzra a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ zhes rdo rje gsor/
oṃ mahāvajra abhiṣiñca hūṃ Brandish the vajra.
don grub dril bu'i dbang ni/
The ghaṇṭā abhiṣeka of Amoghasiddhi.
dkyil 'khor gtso mo'i thugs ka nas/ don grub kyi rang bzhin dbang rdzas dril bu'i rnam par 'phros te/ lag tu gtad par bsam/
From the heart of the principal one of the maṇḍala radiates the abhiṣeka implement, the nature of Amoghasiddhi in the form of a ghaṇṭā. It is placed in your hand. Thus, contemplate.
oM ma hA g+hAN+De a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ zhes dril bu dkrol/
oṃ mahāghāṇḍe abhiṣiñca hūṃ Play the ghaṇṭā.
rnam snang ming gi dbang ni/
The name abhiṣeka of Vairocana.
dkyil 'khor gtso mo'i phyag g.yas spyi bor bzhag cing g.yon mi 'jigs pa'i phyag rgya dang bcas/ rdor dril spyi bor bsnol bar bsam/
The principal one of the maṇḍala places their right hand on your head and holds their left hand in the mudrā of fearlessness. The vajra and ghaṇṭā are crossed on your head. Thus, contemplate.
oM badzra b+ha ra hI/ gsang mtshan nam/ a d+hi pa ti s+t+waM/ a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ gsang mtshan 'di zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o/ /
oṃ vajra bharahī / (your secret name or) adhipatistvaṃ / abhiṣiñca hūṃ [You are] the tathāgata known as (your secret name).
brtul zhugs rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang ni/
The abhiṣeka of Vajrasattva for discipline.

oM sarba ta thA ga ta sid+d+hi sa ma ya s+t+waM/ e Sha d+ha ra ya mi hi hi hi hi hU~M/ zhes sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo rdo rje rtse lnga byin pas snying gar rdor sems gsal bar gyur par bsam/ de rnams kyi dbang don gcig char du ngo sprad pa ni/ de ltar dbang thob (416)pas nyon mongs pa lnga/ ye shes lnga/ 'byung ba lnga/ yum lnga/ phung po lnga/ rgyal ba rigs lngar ye nas grub pa la yid ches par gyis shig / ces brjod/

oṃ sarvatathāgata siddhi vajra samayastvaṃ / eṣa dharayami hi hi hi hi hūṃ Having been given the five-pointed vajra, the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas, Vajrasattva appears clearly in your heart. The significance of all those abhiṣekas are pointed out all together as follows: {416} Having received those abhiṣekas, be confident that your five mental afflictions are primordially the five wisdoms, your five elements are primordially the five female consorts, and your five skandhas are primordially the five families of victorious ones.
bdun pa mnga' dbul ba ni/
7) The Investiture
lcang lo byugs rdzas bgo rgyan phyag mtshan rnams gcig car du byin par bsam/ tsakli rnams phyogs gcig tu thogs pa'i phyag rgya dang bcas/
Think that the braided hair, anointing substances, clothing, ornaments, and emblems are given all together. With the mudrā of holding the icons together, say:

skal ldan khyed rnams lcang lo thor tshugs 'chang / / byugs rdzas byug cing rgyan rnams 'dogs pa dang / / phyag mtshan 'dzin cing mchod bstod phun tshogs pas/ / yi dam rdo rje phag mor mnga' gsol lo/ /

You, fortunate ones, by holding the braided hair as your topknot, smearing the anointing substances, wearing the ornaments, holding the emblems, and having an abundance of offerings and praises, you are invested as the yidam Vajravārāhī.
oM AHhU~M/ zhes sbyin/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Give them the icons.
oM badzra b+ha ra hI sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM nas/ shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ vajrabharahī saparivāra arghaṃ…śabda… Thus, offer.

dpal ldan sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma/ / mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo sgyur/ / ye shes lnga dang sku gsung thugs/ / 'gro ba skyob la phyag 'tshal bstod/ ces bstod cing mnga' gsol bar bya'o/ / de ltar bum pa'i dbang thob pas/ / sbyang gzhi lus lha la sbyang bya dman par 'dzin pa'i dri ma sbyangs shing / sbyong byed bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / sbyangs 'bras mchog gi sprul sku thob par 'gyur ro/ /

Glorious Buddhaḍākinī, cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage and praise. Thus, praise and perform the investiture. Having thus received the vase abhiṣeka, your body, the ground for purification, is purified as the deity; and the stains of taking it to be inferior, what are to be purified, are purified. You are empowered to meditate on the generation process, the means of purification. You will achieve the supreme nirmāṇakāya, the result of purification.
brgyad pa sku gsung thugs kyi byin rlabs zhu ba ni/
8) Requesting the Blessings of Body, Speech, and Mind

bla ma dang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi spyi bo'i oM dkar po las 'od zer dkar po'i tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phros/ slob ma'i spyi bor thim/ sku las kyang sku dpag tu med pa 'phros lus la thim pas/ skye ba dang tshe rabs thams cad du lus kyi sgo nas bsags pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par byas/ sku bum pa'i dbang thob/ lus rje btsun ma'i skur gyur/ lam bskyed rim bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu sprul sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur/

Having supplicated in that way, from the white oṃs at the heads of the guru and the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, immeasurable masses of white light rays stream forth and dissolve into the heads of you, the disciples. From their bodies, innumerable forms of their bodies appear and dissolve into your bodies. Your negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains accumulated by means of your body throughout all your births and successive lives are cleansed and purified. You receive the vase abhiṣeka of body. Your body becomes the body of Jetsunma. You are empowered to meditate on the generation process as the path. You become endowed with the fortune of attaining the nirmāṇakāya as the result.

yang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi mgrin pa'i AHdmar po las 'od zer dmar po'i tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phros/ slob ma'i mgrin par thim/ zhal nas kyang A li kA li la sogs te sngags kyi phreng ba dpag tu med pa (417) 'phros/ lce la thim pas/ skye ba dang tshe rabs thams cad du/ ngag gi sgo nas bsags pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad dag par byas/ gsung gsang ba'i dbang thob/ ngag rje btsun ma'i gsung du gyur/ lam gtum mo bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu chos sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur/

From the red āḥs at the throats of the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, immeasurable masses of red light rays stream forth and dissolve into the throats of you, the disciples. From the mouths of the deities, innumerable mantra garlands—ā li kā li and others—appear and dissolve into your tongues. {417} Your negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains accumulated by means of your speech throughout all your births and successive lives are cleansed and purified. You receive the secret abhiṣeka of speech. Your speech becomes the speech of Jetsunma. You are empowered to meditate on caṇḍālī as the path. You become endowed with the fortune of attaining the dharmakāya as the result.

yang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi thugs ka'i hU~M sngon po las 'od zer sngon po'i tshogs dpag tu med pa 'phros/ slob ma'i snying gar thim/ yang rdo rje dril bu gri gug thod pa Da ma ru kha T+wA~M ga la sogs te phyag mtshan dpag tu med pa 'phros/ snying gar thim pas/ skye ba dang tshe rabs thams cad du/ yid kyi sgo nas bsags pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par byas/ thugs shes rab ye shes kyi dbang thob/ yid rje btsun ma'i thugs su gyur/ lam pho nya bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu longs sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur/

From the blue hūṃs at the heads of the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, immeasurable masses of blue light rays stream forth and dissolve into the hearts of you, the disciples. Again, innumerable emblems—vajras, ghaṇṭās, hooked knives, skull cups, ḍamarus, khaṭvāṃgas, and others—appear and dissolve into your hearts. Your negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains accumulated by means of your mind throughout all your births and successive lives are cleansed and purified. You receive the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka of mind. Your mind becomes the mind of Jetsunma. You are empowered to meditate on emissaries as the path. You become endowed with the fortune of attaining the saṃbhogakāya as the result.

yang dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi/ spyi mgrin thugs ka'i gnas gsum nas 'od zer dkar dmar mthing gsum gcig char du 'phros/ slob ma'i gnas gsum du thim/ skye ba dang tshe rabs thams cad du sgo gsum gcig char du bsags pa'i sdig sgrib nyes ltung dri ma'i tshogs thams cad byang zhing dag par byas/ dbang bzhi pa tshig dbang rin po che thob/ sgo gsum rje btsun ma'i sku gsung thugs su gyur/ / lam blo 'das phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu ngo bo nyid sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur par bsam/

Then, from the three places, head, throat, and heart, of the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, white, red, and blue light rays stream forth all together and dissolve into the three places of you, the disciples. Your negative actions, obscurations, flaws, downfalls, and mass of stains accumulated by means of your three doors all together throughout all your births and successive lives are cleansed and purified. You receive the fourth abhiṣeka, the precious word abhiṣeka. Your three doors become the body, speech, and mind of Jetsunma. You are empowered to meditate on mahāmudrā, which transcends the intellect, as the path. You become endowed with the fortune of achieving the svabhāvakāya as the result. Thus, contemplate.
yum bka' rgyas pa'i skabs dbang gong ma gsum so sor bskur bar snang yang / bsdus pa'i skabs 'dir de kas 'thus par gsungs so/ / (418)
During the extensive Yum Ka, the three higher abhiṣekas are bestowed individually, but here, in the context of the abbreviated form, it is said that that is sufficient. {418}
gnyis pa
B) The Conclusion
mtha' rten la/ rgyas par sdom chog la bdun du gsung kyang / 'dir bsdus pa'i dbang du byas te gsum las/
Although in the extensive version it is taught in the summarizing verses that there are seven [sections of the conclusion,] here the abbreviated abhiṣeka is given and there are three.
dang po rjes gnang dang lung bstan ni/
1) The Authorization and Prophecy

rdor dril spyi bor bsnol la/ dkyil 'khor 'dir na dbang thob pas/ / deng nas rdo rje slob dpon gyi/ / las dang bya ba mtha' dag la/ / dbang zhing ma 'ongs pa yi dus/ / gsang mtshan 'di zhes bya ba yi/ / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur/ /

With crossed vajra and ghaṇṭā on their heads, say: Having received the abhiṣekas for this maṇḍala, from this point on, you are empowered for all the activities and actions of a vajrācārya, and in the future will be the tathāgata known as (insert their secret name).
gnyis pa dbugs dbyung dang gzengs bstod ni/
2) The Confirmation and Assurance
zab mo'i dbang ni thob tsam gyis/ / mi mthun phyogs las rnam rgyal zhing / / byang chub chen po'i lam zhugs pas/ / khyod rnams dga' dang spyo bar gyis/
Having received just this profound abhiṣeka, you are victorious over what is discordant and abide on the path to great awakening. Therefore, you should feel joy and inspiration.
gsum pa bdud rtsi bsten pa ni/
3) Relying on Amṛta
bdud rtsi'i dkyil 'khor gyi ka pA la'i bdud rtsi rje btsun ma 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i ye shes kyi dam rdzas su gyur/ par bsam mo/ /
The Jetsunma-amṛta in the kapāla, the maṇḍala of amṛta, melts into light and transforms into wisdom samaya substance. Thus, contemplate.
oM AHhU~M/ mchod do bstod do
oṃ āḥ hūṃ I offer. I praise.

phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las thams cad kyi ngo bo gyur pa/ chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i 'byung gnas/ 'phags pa'i dge 'dun thams cad kyi mnga' bdag / drin can rtsa ba dang brgyud par bcas pa'i dpal ldan bla ma dam pa rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/

To the glorious, genuine gurus, our kind root gurus and lineage gurus—the essence of the bodies, speech, minds, excellent qualities, and activities of all the tathāgatas of the ten directions and three times, the source of the eighty-four thousand sets of dharma, masters of the noble saṅgha—oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
yi dam dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/
To the assembly of the yidam deities of the maṇḍalas, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.
ma dang mkha' 'gro rnams kyi zhal du= chos skyong srung ma rnams kyi zhal du= rdo rje mched lcam rnams kyi zhal du= yul 'di'i gnas bdag gzhi bdag=
To the mother and ḍākinīs,… To the dharma protectors and guardians,… To the vajra siblings,… To the local deities and regional deities of this place,…
'gro ba rigs drug sems can= rang lus rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor=
To all sentient beings, the six kinds of beings,… To the maṇḍala of the victors within my own body,…
rgyal ba mched pas mnyes gyur cig / dam can thugs dam skong gyur cig / rigs drug 'dod pas tshims gyur cig / lan chags bu lon khyer gyur cig /

May the victorious ones be pleased by this offering. May the commitments of the samaya holders be restored. May the desires of the six kinds of beings by satisfied. May my debts to karmic creditors be annulled. {419}

sems can thams cad rnam mkhyen rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang rin po che (419) dus myur du thob pa'i skal pa mchog dang ldan pa nyid du gyur cig / ces pas mchod rjes bdud rtsi'i ka pA la lag pa g.yon du bzung nas g.yas pas bkab ste/

May all sentient beings be endowed with the supreme fortune of swiftly attaining the precious state of buddhahood, perfect knowledge. Hold the kapāla of amṛta, the offering substance, in your right hand, and cover it with your left.
rnal 'byor ma dpal bdud rtsi'i gzugs/ / bdud rtsi rnal 'byor ma rang yin/ / thabs shes dbyer med bdud rtsi 'di/ / gang bsten grol lo pu rnams kye/
The glorious Yoginī has the form of the amṛta. The amṛta is the Yoginī herself. This amṛta, the inseparability of method and prajñā, liberates whoever relies on it—children, kye!
zhes dang /
And:
rtsa brgyud bla ma thams cad kyang / / gnyis med bdud rtsi bsten pas grol/ / yi dam dkyil 'khor lha tshogs kyang / / gnyis med bdud rtsi bsten pas grol/ /
All root and lineage gurus have been liberated by relying on the nondual amṛta. The assembly of yidam deities of the maṇḍala have been liberated by relying on the nondual amṛta.
ma dang mkha' 'gro thams cad kyang / / gnyis med bdud rtsi= chos skyong ma mgon lcam dral yang / / gnyis med=
The mother and ḍākinīs have been liberated… The dharma protectors Ma-Gön cham-dral have been liberated…
rdo rje'i mched lcam thams cad kyang / / gnyis med= de phyir skal ldan khyed rnams kun/ / rdo rje phag mo zhu ba yi/ / gnyis med bdud rtsi 'di bsten pas/ / grol bar 'gyur ro bu rnams kye/ /
All the vajra siblings have been liberated… Therefore, all you fortunate ones, by relying on this nondual amṛta into which Vajravārāhī has dissolved, will be liberated—children, kye!
zhes brjod cing bdud rtsi bsten nas myang /
Relying on the amṛta, taste it.
'bral med smon lam gdab pa ni/
Making aspiration prayers to never be separated.
lhag pa'i bsam sbyor dag pa'i ngang nas/
Within a state of the pure highest attitude and behavior, say:
deng nas byang chub ma thob bar/ / bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro dang / / chos skyong srung ma rdo rje spun/ / tshogs zhing dam pa rnams dang ni/ / nam yang mi 'bral 'grogs par shog /
From now on until attaining awakening, may I never be separated from, and always be with, this holy gathering of gurus, yidams, ḍākinīs, dharma protectors and guardians, and vajra siblings.
dam chos mkha' 'gro'i gsang tshig dang / / nam yang mi 'bral 'grogs par shog / bdag sogs sems can thams cad ni/ / de ltar gyur pa'i mthu nus kyis/ / brgyud pa'i rnam thar 'khyongs pa dang / /

May I never be separated from, and always be with, the genuine dharma and the secret words of the ḍākinīs. Through the power of that occurring, may I and others, all sentient beings, live up to the examples of the lineage.
rgyu dang mi rgyu'i 'gro ba kun/ / bdag gis smin cing grol bar shog / ces smon lam gdab bo/ /
May I mature and liberate all beings, those who move and do not move. Thus, make that aspiration.
des dbang bskur grub nas/
Then, since the bestowal of the abhiṣekas is completed, say:
gtso bos ji ltar sogs gsum gyis dam tshig khas blang /
Whatever the principal one commands, [all that I will do.] Saying that three times, commit to the samayas.
lus longs spyod dbul ba'i mos pas/
Thinking you offer your body and possessions, say:
bdag gi sgo gsum longs spyod bcas/ / deng nas 'dren pa khyed la 'bul/ / nyes ltung dri mas gos gyur na/ / cha yis spyad cing skyob tu gsol/
I offer my three doors and possessions, starting today, to you, the guide. If I am tainted by the stains of flaws and downfalls, please use any part of me and protect me.
zhes brjod/ gtang rag maN+Dal phul/ dge bsngo (420) brjod la grol lo/ /
Offer a maṇḍala in thanks. {420} Dedicate the virtue and release [the disciples].
gsum pa rjes kyi rim pa ni/
III. The Concluding Section
sdom tshig las/
The summarizing verses say:

gtor bsngo tshogs bshags lhag gtor btang / / bzod gsol nyer bsdu bsngo shis bya/ / zhes rnam grangs bcur gsungs pa'i dang po gtor bsngos dang / gnyis pa tshogs bshags lhag gtor btang ba rnams yab bka' ltar bya/

Do the dedication of a torma, a feast, confession, giving the leftover torma, requesting patience, dissolution, dedication, and expression of auspiciousness.[*10] That enumerates ten points.[*11] Do the first, the dedication of a torma, and the second, the feast, and [the third and fourth,] the confession and giving of the leftover torma, according to the Yab Ka [texts].[*12]
lnga pa gtang rag gi mchod bstod ni/
The fifth: offerings and praises of thanks.
mchod pa kha gsos la/ byin brlab/ rgyas par na/ rab 'byams zhing gi sogs tshigs bcad sngags bcas kyis mchod/
Replenish the offerings and consecrate them. If you wish to be extensive, do as follows: In all the maṇḍalas in the infinite pure lands,…[*13] Offer with those verses and mantras.
hU~M/ bcom ldan rnam kun sogs rkang brgyad kyis bstod/

hūṃ Bhagavatī, great Vajravārāhī of all manifestations, [unswayed by opponents, the three worlds, Vajravārāhī, conquering fears of bhūtas, esiding at Vajrāsana, and victorious over Brahmā, you dry up and destroy all fears of Māra. With a form the nature of all birth, abiding, and arising, you are empress of the three planes, the perfection of phenomena. To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I offer praise.] Praise with the eight lines.
drug pa dbang bzhi len pa ni/
The sixth: receiving the four abhiṣekas.
dkyil 'khor lha tshogs thams cad kyi spyi bo'i oM dkar po las 'od zer dkar po dpag tu med pa 'phros/ sogs gong gi skabs su 'byung ba ltar brjod/ 'bras bu ngo bo nyid sku thob pa'i skal ldan du gyur/

From the white oṃs at the heads of the assembled deities of the maṇḍala, immeasurable masses of white light rays stream forth…You become endowed with the fortune of achieving the svabhāvakāya as the result.[*14]
bdun pa bzod gsol ni
The seventh: request for patience.
yig brgya lan gsum dang /
Recite the hundred syllables three times.
ma 'byor pa dang nyams pa dang / / gang yang bdag rmongs blo yis ni/ / bgyis pa dang ni bgyid stsal ba/ / de yang bzod par mdzad du gsol/ /
With anything missing or done wrong, or things I did or had others do out of my ignorance, please be patient.
lhag pa dang ni chad pa dang / / cho ga'i yan lag nyams pa dang / / bdag gis bgyis nongs ci mchis pa/ / de yang=
Whatever additions, omissions, and impairments of the sections of the ritual I have done in error, please be patient.
bag med brjod pa ma dag pa/ / rgyud nas gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin/ / ma lcogs 'khrul pa ci mchis pa/ / de yang bzod par mdzad du gsol/
Whatever careless, impure recitations I have done, whatever I have been incapable of or confused about in terms of the rituals taught in the tantras, please be patient.
zhes lhag chad kha bskang zhing nongs pa bzod par gsol/ /
Thus, request patience for your excesses, omissions, additions, and mistakes.
brgyad pa dkyil 'khor bsdu ba ni/
The eighth: the dissolution of the maṇḍala.

'og ting 'dzin sprul sku'i dkyil 'khor 'od du zhu ba longs sku'i dkyil 'khor la thim/ longs sku'i dkyil 'khor 'od du zhu ste chos sku'i dkyil 'khor la thim/ / chos sku'i dkyil 'khor rten dang brten par bcas pa 'od du zhu nas rang la thim par bsam/

The lower samādhi-nirmāṇakāya maṇḍala melts into light and dissolves into the saṃbhogakāya maṇḍala. The saṃbhogakāya maṇḍala melts into light and dissolves into the dharmakāya maṇḍala. The dharmakāya maṇḍala, support and supported, melts into light and dissolves into me. Thus, contemplate.

steng sin+d+hU ra'i dkyil 'khor nas g.yon pa'i mtheb srin gyis blangs nas dpral bar thig le bya/ gtor mgron ye shes pa rnams brtan bzhugs bya/ dgu pa bsngo ba dang bcu pa bkra shis rnams kyang yab bka'i gsham nas 'byung ba ltar bya'o/ /

From the upper sindhūra maṇḍala take some sindhūra with your left thumb and ring finger and place a bindu on your forehead. Do the request for the wisdom torma guests to reside in the representations. The ninth, dedication, and the tenth, auspiciousness, should be done according to what is found at the end of the Yab Ka [text].[*15] {421}
dpal ldan 'khor lo sdom pa'i 'dren pa mo/ / rgyal ba kun skyed rdo rje (421) rnal 'byor ma'i/ / zab gsang grub pa'i snyan nas snyan brgyud 'dir/ / 'jug par nus rnams sngon sbyangs skal ldan nges/ /

Those who have the ability to enter into this Aural Transmission, which accomplishes the profound secret of Vajrayoginī, the creator of all victorious ones, leader of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, are certainly fortunate ones with previous training.
mkha' spyod rdo rje btsun mo'i grong khyer du/ / lhan skyes mdzes ma mchog gis mdun bsus nas/ / bde stong 'gyur ba med pa'i thig ler bsdams/ / mkha' khyab 'gro kun phyam gcig sgrol nus shog /

May I be welcomed by the supreme and beautiful Sahajā into the city of the Vajra Queen, the celestial realm, bind the bindus of unchanging bliss-emptiness and have the ability to liberate together all beings, who pervade space.

ces ras chung snyan brgyud lugs kyi yab bka'i smin byed dang 'brel bar nye bar mkho bas mtshams sbyar te/ rtsa ba'i yig cha gtsang smyon he ru ka yab sras kyi gzhung dang brgyud pa snga ma rnams kyi gsung las snying por bsdus te karma bka' brgyud kyi gral mthar 'khod pa karma ngag dbang yon tan rgya mtshos dpal spungs yang khrod de bI ko TI'i dga' tshal du rang lo gya bdun par bgyis pa'i yi ge pa ni nye bar gnas pa blo gsal gsang sngags bstan 'dzin gyis bgyis pa

This was compiled by extracting the essence of the main texts of Tsangnyön Heruka, father and sons, [which serve] as the root manuals, and the essence of the teachings of the earlier transmissions, linking those with what is necessary for the means of maturation contained in the Yab Ka [texts] of the Rechung Aural Transmission tradition. [I,] Karma Ngakwang Yönten, who sits at the end of the row in the Karma Kagyu, compiled this in my eighty-seventh year at the pleasure garden of Devīkoṭi Tsādra Rinchen Drak, the isolated hermitage at Palpung. The secretary was my attendant Losel Sangak Tenzin.
dge legs 'phel// // (422) (423)
May virtue and excellence increase. {422}
@#/ /bde mchog mkha' 'gro snyan brgyud bsdus pa ngam rdzong lugs kyi sgrub dkyil dbang chog dang bcas pa he ru ka dgyes pa'i thig le zhes bya ba bzhugs so/ /
28. Bindu Pleasing To The Heruka. The Sādhana, Maṇḍala Ritual, and Abhiṣeka Rituals for the Abbreviated Ngamdzong Tradition of the Saṃvara Ḍākinī Aural Transmission[1]
(424)@#/ /na mo gu ru shrI tsakra sam+ba rA ya/
namo guru śrīcakrasamvarāya
bde stong 'khor lor chos kun sdom/ / bla ma he ru ka dpal gyi/ / zhabs pad spyi bor bkod nas 'dir/ / snyan brgyud bsdus pa'i lag len dgod/ /
Placing on my head the lotus feet of the glorious guru Heruka, swho binds of all phenomena in the cakra of bliss-emptiness, here, I will arrange the procedures of the abbreviated Aural Transmission.

ngam rdzong ston pa bo d+hi rA dza'i lugs kyi bde mchog snyan brgyud lag len du bstar ba la lnga/ bdag bskyed sgrub thabs/ sta gon gyi rim pa/ dkyil 'khor sgrub mchod/ dbang bskur ba'i cho ga / rjes kyi bya ba'i rim pa'o/ /

In the Saṃvara Aural Transmission tradition of Ngamdzong Tönpa Bodhirāja, the procedures are arranged in five parts: (1) the sādhana of the self visualization, (2) the stages of the prelude, (3) the sādhanapūjā of the maṇḍala, (4) the ritual of the abhiṣekas, and (5) the stages of the concluding activities.
dang po ni
I. The Sādhana of the Self Visualization

dbang thob cing dam tshig la gnas pa'i sgrub pa pos dben pa'i gnas su 'di nyid kyi bris sku sogs rten bkram pa'i spyan sngar phyi mchod dang / nang mchod bdud rtsi/ mchod gtor/ sngon 'gro/ dkar bgegs/ rang gi mdun du DAr dril sogs nyer mkho'i yo byad rnams tshogs par byas la/

Practitioners who have received the abhiṣekas and who abide in the samayas should, in an isolated place, arrange a representation, such as a drawn form of this [deity and maṇḍala]. In front of that, place the outer offerings, the inner-offering amṛta, an offering torma, and the preliminary white torma and obstructors’ torma. In front of yourself, place all the requisite items, such as a ḍamaru and ghaṇṭā.
thog mar dag pa gsum dran pa ni/
First, the recollection of the three purifications.
oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
rang nyid skad cig gis 'khor lo bde mchog lhan cig skyes pa'i skur gyur/ a A i I sogs dbyangs gsal tshar gcig brjod/
Instantly, I become Cakrasaṃvara Sahaja. a ā i ī… Recite the string of vowels and consonants once.
shrI he ru ka a haM/ shrI ni gnyis med ye shes te/ / he ni rgyu sogs stong pa nyid/ / ru ni spros dang bral ba ste/ / ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa/ / a haM bde ba chen po'o/ /
śrīheruka a haṃ Śrī signifies nondual wisdom. He means that causes and the rest are empty. Ru stands for the absence of collections. Ka means not dwelling anywhere. Ahaṃ is great bliss.
rdor dril byin rlabs ni/
Consecration of the vajra and ghaṇṭā.
oM ma hA badzra hU~M/ oM badzra AHoM sarba ta (425) thA ga ta a nu rA ga Na badzra swa b+hA wa ko‘haM/
oṃ mahāvajra hūṃ / oṃ vajraghāṇṭe āḥ / oṃ sarvatathāgata anurāgaṇa vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ {425}
sngon gtor dkar bgegs bsang sbyang /
Cleanse and purify the preliminary tormas, a white one and an obstructors’ one.
oM AHhU~M ha hoHhrIH lan gsum/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ ha hoḥ hrīḥ Three times.

gtor ma bdud rtsi'i rgya mtsho 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa zad mi shes par gyur/ rang gi snying ga'i 'od zer gyis dkar phyogs skyong ba rnams dang bgegs rigs lan chags kyi mgron thams cad bkug par gyur/

The torma becomes an inexhaustible ocean of amṛta with the five sense pleasures. Light rays from my heart summon the protectors on the virtuous side and the guests who are my karmic creditors belonging to the ranks of obstructors.
badzra sa mA dzaH
vajra samājaḥ
a kA ro lan gsum gyis bsngo/
Saying akāro three times, consecrate.

mchod sbyin gyi gtor ma rgya chen po 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa 'di nyid yul 'di'i gzhi yis bdag pos gtso byas pa'i lha klu gnod sbyin 'byung po'i tshogs rnams la 'bul lo/ / bzhes nas bdag gi bsam don yid bzhin du 'grub pa'i sdong grogs mdzod cig /

This offering and gift of a vast torma, endowed with the five sense pleasures, is offered to the assembly of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and bhūtas, led by the local deities of this place. Having accepted it, be my assistants for achieving my goals just as I intend them.
nag po'i phyogs la dga' ba rnams kyang gtor ma 'dis tshims par gyis la sa'i phyogs 'dir ma gnas par gzhan du dengs shig /
May all those who delight in the dark side be satisfied by this torma. Do not remain in this place. Go elsewhere.
sum+b+ha ni'i sngags drag tu brjod la rol mo bcas bskrad do/ /
Say the sumbha ni mantra forcefully, and accompanied by music, expel [the obstructors].
nang mchod byin brlab ni/
Consecration of the inner offering.
oM khaN+Da ro he huM hU~M phaT kyis bsang / swa b+hA wa sa sbyang /
Cleanse with oṃ khaṇḍarohe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ and purify with svabhāva.

stong pa'i ngang las ya~M las rlung ra~M las me ka~M las thod pa'i sgyed pu gsum la brten pa'i a yig las byung ba'i ka pA la yangs shing rgya (426)che ba'i nang du go ku da ha na las sha lnga/ bi mu ma ra shu las bdud rtsi lnga/ oM AHhU~M las sku gsung thugs kyi bdud rtsi'i ngo bo kha T+wAM ga rnams 'od zer gyi 'phro 'dus bskol zhing zhu ba las dam tshig pa dang ye shes dbyer med pa'i bdud rtsi'i rgya mtsho chen por gyur/

Within emptiness, from yaṃ is wind; from raṃ is fire; and from kaṃs are three skull hearths. Supported by those, from the letter a, is a kapāla, spacious and vast. {426} Within that, from go ku da ha na, are the five meats and, from vi mu ma ra śu, the five amṛtas. From oṃ āḥ hūṃ are khaṭvāṃgas, the essences of the amṛtas of body, speech, and mind. Light rays radiate and gather back. From the boiling and melting comes a great ocean of inseparable samaya and wisdom amṛta.
oM AHhU~M ha hoHhrIH lan gsum/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ ha hoḥ hrīḥ Three times.
gnas yo byin rlabs ni/
Consecration of the place and substances.
gong ltar bsang sbyang /
Cleanse and purify as above.

stong pa'i ngang las gnas khang b+h+rU~M las thar pa chen po'i gzhal yas khang mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyi nang thams cad oM AHhU~M 'od du zhu ba las byung ba'i lha rdzas las grub pa'i mchod yon/ me tog / bdug spos/ snang gsal/ dri chab/ zhal zas/ rol mo la sogs pa mchod pa'i sprin phung bsam gyis mi khyab par gyur/

Within emptiness, from bhrūṃ, the dwelling appears as a palace of great liberation, complete with all the characteristics. Everywhere, outside and inside, oṃ āḥ hūṃ melt into light, from which arise unimaginable masses of offering clouds of offering water, flowers, incense, lamps, scented water, food, music, and more, all made from divine substances.
oM ma hA badzra Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/ oM badzra puSh+pe AHhU~M nas/ shab+da 'i bar dang / d+harmA ra Ni ta lan gsum gyis byin dbab/
oṃ mahāvajra arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā oṃ vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ…śabda… Consecrate by saying dharmā raṇita three times.
skyabs 'gro sems bskyed ni/
Taking refuge and arousing bodhicitta.

bdag gzhan mar gyur nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam pa'i sems can thams cad bla ma la skyabs su mchi'o/ / sangs rgyas la= chos la= dge 'dun la= dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la skyabs su mchi'o/ / lan grangs ci nus brjod/

I and all others—all my mother sentient beings, who equal the extent of space—take refuge in the gurus. We take refuge in the buddhas. We take refuge in the dharma. We take refuge in the saṅgha. We take refuge in the deities of the maṇḍala of glorious Cakrasaṃvara and his retinue. Recite that as many times as you can.
sems can thams cad kyi don du dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i go 'phang myur du thob par bya/ de'i ched du rdo rje'i rnal 'byor zab mo nyams su blang bar bgyi'o/ / lan gsum brjod do/ /
For the sake of all sentient beings, I will quickly achieve the state of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara. In order to do that, I will practice the profound vajra yoga. Say that three times.
bsags sbyong gsal 'debs rnams ni/
The visualizations for the accumulations and purification.

rang nyid skad cig gis he ru ka sngon po rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa g.yon brkyang gis bzhugs pa la yum rdo rje phag mo dmar mo rdo rje dang thod pa 'dzin pas 'khyud par gyur/ hU~M las rdo rje bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin thabs dang / a las dril bu stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin shes rab tu gyur/ rang gi snying ga'i hU~M gi 'od zer gyis bla ma he ru ka'i rnam par snang ba spyi (427)bor spyan drangs/

Instantly I am the Heruka, blue, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā. Standing with my left leg outstretched, I am embraced by my consort Vajravārāhī, who is red and holds a vajra and skull cup. From hūṃ, there is a vajra, which is method and of the nature of great bliss. From oṃ, there is a ghaṇṭā, which is prajñā and of the nature of the realization of emptiness. Light rays from the hūṃ in my heart invite to the top of my head the guru appearing in the manifestation of the Heruka. {427}
gang gi drin gyis phyag bya/
Pay homage with: Through your kindness, [great bliss arises in an instant. To the lotus feet of the guru, with a precious vajra body, I bow.]
oM he ru ka Ar+g+haM= oM AHhU~M/ thog mtha' des 'gres te/ puSh+pe nas/ shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ heruka arghaṃ…oṃ āḥ hūṃ Using that beginning and ending for puṣpe through śabda, make offerings.
spangs dang rtogs pa'i yon tan phun tshogs shing / / dri med snyan brgyud yid bzhin nor bu yi/ / lam mchog mngon du mdzad nas ston mdzad pa'i/ / bde mchog rdo rje 'chang la gsol ba 'debs/ /

I supplicate Saṃvara Vajradhara, who has an abundance of the virtues of relinquishment and realization, and, having actualized the supreme path of the stainless Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Aural Transmission, teaches it.
sangs rgyas chos tshogs ma lan gsum/

In the Buddha, dharma, and supreme assembly, [I take refuge until attaining awakening. Through amassing acts of generosity and so forth, may I achieve buddhahood to benefit all beings.] Say that three times.
badzra he ru ka'i yig brgya bzla/
Recite the vajraheruka hundred syllables.

phyi yi maN+Dal gling bzhi ri rab lha mi'i dpal 'byor phun sum tshogs pas mdzes/ / nang gi maN+Dal rtsa 'khor byang sems yi ge'i rnam par bde ba'i mdangs dang ldan/ / gsang ba'i maN+Dal tshad med dga' bzhi bde chen 'gyur med byang chub sems kyis brgyan/ / de nyid maN+Dal bde stong rol ba 'bul lo mchog dang thun mong dngos grub stsol/ /

The outer maṇḍala is the four continents and Meru, beautified with the abundant riches of gods and humans. The inner maṇḍala is the manifestations of the channels, cakras, bodhicitta, and letters, with the brilliance of bliss. The secret maṇḍala is the immeasurable four joys adorned with the bodhicitta of unchanging great bliss. The suchness maṇḍala is the enjoyment of bliss-emptiness. I offer these. Please bestow the supreme and common siddhis.
oM shrI he ru ka Ar+g+haM nas/ shab+da pra tIts+tsha swA hA 'i bar gyis mchod/ pany+tsa a mr-i ta dang / badzra ma ting+ga sbyar bas nang gsang 'bul/
oṃ śrīheruka arghaṃ…śabda pratīccha svāhā Thus, offer. Inserting pañca amṛta and vajra matiṅga, make the inner and secret offerings.
yan lag lhag ma rnams dang dam tshig sdom pa bzung ba ni/
The remaining branches and holding the samayas and vows.
dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/ / sdig pa mi dge so sor bshags/ / 'gro ba'i dge la rjes yi rangs/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor du gsol/ /
I take refuge in the three jewels. I confess each and every negative action and unvirtuous deed. I rejoice in the virtuous actions of all beings. I supplicate you to turn the wheel of dharma.
mya ngan mi 'da' gsol ba 'debs/ / rnal 'byor lam la gnas bgyid cing / / dam tshig thams cad skyong ba dang / / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las/ / grol bar bdag gis bsgrub par bgyid/ /
I supplicate you not to pass into nirvāṇa. May I abide on the path of yoga. May I guard all samayas. May I achieve the freeing of all sentient beings from suffering.
bstan sogs dge ba de dag gi / rnam pa'i mchog rnams kun ldan pa'i/ / sangs rgyas nyid du bdag gyur nas/ / 'gro ba yongs su sgrol byed shog /
May I become a buddha: one endowed with all the most sublime manifestations, the virtues of the teachings, and so on. May I liberate all beings.
lan gsum/
Three times.
he ru ka yi gnas gsum gsang hoHlas/ / 'od zer dkar dmar sngo ser babs shing thim/ / dbang bzhis rgyud smin sgrib bzhi dag pa dang / / lam bzhi mthar phyin sku bzhi thob par shog /

From the three places and the secret hoḥ of the Heruka, light rays, white, red, blue, and yellow, descend and dissolve. The four abhiṣekas mature my continuum and purify my four obscurations. I complete the four paths and attain the four kāyas.
bde mchog rang la thim pas spyi bor oM/ mgrin par AH thugs kar hU~M gis mtshan par gyur/
Saṃvara dissolves into me, and my forehead is marked by oṃ; my throat, by āḥ; and my heart, by hūṃ.
oM AHhU~M/ (428 )
oṃ āḥ hūṃ {428}
lan gsum/ de rnams kyis sngon 'gro song /
Three times. Those conclude the preliminaries.
dngos gzhi'i
The main practices:
thog mar tshad med dang srung 'khor bsgom pa ni/
first the immeasurables and meditation on the protection cakra.

shrI he ru ka / rang gi thugs kar hU~M sngon po la oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT kyis bskor ba las 'od 'phros/ sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang bral ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / bde ba yun ring gnas pa dang / btang snyoms la gnas par gyur/

śrīheruka The blue hūṃ in my heart is surrounded by oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ, from which light radiates. May all sentient beings be free from suffering, have happiness, abide for a long time in happiness, and abide in equanimity.

hU~M hU~M/ 'od zer nag po hU~M gi rnam par 'phros pas/ 'og tu rdo rje'i sa gzhi/ logs su rdo rje'i rwa ba zlum po/ steng du rdo rje'i gur dang bla brel gyur/ rdo rje de dag las me 'od dpag tu med pa 'phros pa las khro mo brgyad du gyur te/

hūṃ hūṃ Black light rays radiate in the form of hūṃs. Below they become a vajra ground; on the sides, a round vajra fence; and above, a vajra tent and canopy. From those vajras, immeasurable fire light radiates, becoming the eight krodhīs.
oM hrIHg+ha g+ha g+hA ta ya g+hA ta ya sarba duSh+TaM hU~M hU~M phaT swA hA/ zhes pas g.yon du bskor bas sprul pa'i khro bo dpag tu med pa 'phros/ bgegs rnams phye mar brlags te me'i ra bar gyur/

oṃ hrīḥ gha gha ghātaya ghātaya sarva duṣṭaṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā Having said that, they circle counterclockwise and radiate immeasurable emanated krodhas. All obstructors are ground to dust and become a fence of fire.
rten brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa ni/
Generating the maṇḍala of the support and supported.
oM swa b+hA wa sogs/ chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa gzung 'dzin gyi rtog pa dang bral ba'i ngang du gnas par gyur/ /
oṃ svabhāva… All phenomena abide in a state of natural purity, free from concepts of percepts and perceivers.

stong pa'i ngang las rang sems hU~M sngon po 'od zer lnga 'phro bar gyur/ srung 'khor gyi dbus su hrIHdmar po yongs su gyur pa las/ chos 'byung gi dbus su pa~M las pad+ma/ hU~M las rdo rje rgya gram/ de'i lte bar gzhal yas khang gru bzhi sgo bzhi rta babs dang bcas pa dur khrod brgyad kyis bskor ba/ de'i dbus su sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab brgyad kyi lte bar hU~M nag po la A li dkar po g.yon skor dang kA li dmar po g.yas skor yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa/

Within emptiness, my mind is a blue hūṃ radiating light rays of the five colors. In the middle of the protection cakra, a red hrīḥ transforms into a source of dharmas. In its middle, from paṃ, is a lotus and, from hūṃ, a viśvavajra. In the center of that is a square palace with four doors and torans, surrounded by the eight charnel grounds. In the center of that is a multicolored eight-petaled lotus. In its middle is a black hūṃ encircled counterclockwise by white ā li and encircled clockwise by red kā li. They transform into a blue five-pointed vajra.
phyogs bzhir hU~M bzhi yongs su gyur pa las/ shrI he ru ka khrag 'thung dpal/ / skad cig gis ni sku rdzogs pa/ / zhal gcig phyag gnyis spyan gsum pa/ /
In the four directions are four hūṃs, which transform into Śrī Heruka, Glorious Blood-Drinker. Instantly my form is complete. I have one face, two hands, and three eyes.
dus mtshan dang ni 'jigs byed dag / g.yas brkyang zhabs kyis mnan mdzad pa/ / bai DUr nam mkha'i rang bzhin can/ / rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa mchog /
Kālarātri and Bhairava are suppressed by my right outstretched leg. I am of the nature of the vaiḍūrya sky, supreme, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā.
sna tshogs rdo rje phyag rgya drug / zla phyed mgo phreng dag gis brgyan/ / sgeg (429) sogs gar gyi ro ldan pa/ / stag lpags dar gyi cod pan can/ /
I am adorned by a viśvavajra, the six mudrās, a half-moon, and a garland of heads. {429} I have the flavors of dance, alluring and the others, a tiger skin, and silk crown.
yid bzhin nor bu spyi bor 'dzin/ / rdo rje phag mo sku la 'khril/ / dz+wa wa sin+d+hU ra mdog mtshungs/ / thod pa rdo rje sdigs mdzub mdzad/ /
With a wish-fulfilling gem at my head, I am entwined with Vajravārāhī, whose color matches jāva sindhūra, has a skull cup, and makes the vajra threatening gesture.
gcer bu bcu drug na tshod can/ / rus pa'i 'khor lo mgo phreng dang / / cod pan dum bu'i rgyan gyis spras/ / skra grol ba la spyan gsum pa/ /
She is naked, aged sixteen, and is adorned with a bone cakra, a garland of heads, a crown, and many ornaments. Her hair is free and she has three eyes.
bde chen thugs rje'i bdag nyid do/ / shar du he ru ka dkar po/ / 'khor lo dril bsnams mkha' 'gror 'khyud/ / byang du he ru ka ljang gu/ / rgya gram dril bsnams lA mar 'khyud/ /

She is the embodiment of great bliss, compassion. In the east is white Heruka, holding a cakra and ghaṇṭā, embracing Ḍākinī. In the north is green Heruka, holding crossed [vajras] and ghaṇṭā, embracing Lāma.
nub tu he ru ka dmar po/ / pad+ma dril bsnams dum skyes 'khyud/ / lho ru he ru ka ser po/ / rin chen dril bsnams gzugs mar 'khyud/ /
In the west is red Heruka, holding a lotus and ghaṇṭā, embracing Khaṇḍarohā. In the south is yellow Heruka, holding a jewel and ghaṇṭā, embracing Rūpiṇī.
kun kyang zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa/ / spyan gsum dar gyi cod pan can/ / 'jigs byed dus mtshan zhabs kyis mnan/ / phyag rgya drug gis spras pa'o/ /
All have one face, two hands, three eyes, and silk crowns. Their feet trample on Bhairava and Kālarātri. They are adorned with the six mudrās.
mtshams kyi pad+ma'i 'dab ma la/ / byang sems gang ba'i thod pa bzhi/ / gzugs phung spyi bor rnam snang mdzad/ / tshor phung dpral bar rdor nyi ma/ /

On the lotus petals in the intermediate directions are four skull cups filled with bodhicitta. My skandha of form is Vairocana at the top of my head. My skandha of feelings is Vajrasūrya at my forehead.
'du shes mgrin par pad gar dbang / / 'du byed lte bar rdor rgyal po/ / rnam shes rdo rjer rdo rje sems/ / thugs kar kun 'dus he ru ka /
My perceptions are Padmanarteśvara at my throat. My formative forces are Vajrarāja at my navel. My consciousnesses are Vajrasattva at my vajra. At my heart is Heruka, embodying all.
mig gnyis la ni sa yi snying / / rna ba gnyis la phyag na rdor/ / sna la nam mkha'i snying po dang / / kha ru spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
At both eyes are Kṣitigarbha. At both ears are Vajrapāṇi. At my nose is Ākāśagarbha. At my mouth is Avalokiteśvara.
rdo rjer sgrib pa rnam par sel/ / snying gar rdo rje sems dpa'o/ / sa chu me rlung nam mkha'i khams/ / rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs ma bkod/
At my vajra is Nivaraṇaviṣkambin. At my heart is Vajrasattva. My dhātus of earth, water, fire, wind, and space are the female tathāgatas of the five families.

rkang pa gnyis ya~M las rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po gzhu'i dbyibs lta bu ba dan gyis mtshan pa/ sum mdo ra~M las me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum pa ra~M dmar nag gis mtshan pa/ lte bar ba~M las chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po zlum po bum pas mtshan pa/ snying gar la~M las sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po gru bzhi pa rdo rjes mtshan pa/ sgal tshigs b+h+rU~M las rin po che'i ri rab (430)

At both my feet, from yaṃs, are blue wind maṇḍalas, resembling the shape of a bow and marked by banners. At the junction [of my three channels], from raṃ, is a red fire maṇḍala, a triangle marked by a dark-red raṃ. At my navel, from vaṃ, is a white water maṇḍala, a circle marked by a vase. At my heart, from laṃ, is a yellow earth maṇḍala, a square marked by a vajra. My spine, from bhrūṃ, is precious Meru. {430}

de'i steng du sna tshogs pad+ma'i dbus su/ hU~M las sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar pa~M las sna tshogs pad+ma la/ hU~M dang dbyangs gsal yongs su gyur pa las rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor 'khor lo lnga'i rnam par snang bar gyur/ /

Above that, in the center of a multicolored lotus, from hūṃ, is a viśvavajra. At its center, from paṃ, is a multicolored lotus. Hūṃ and the vowels and consonants transform into the manifestations of the five cakras, the maṇḍalas of support and supported.
bcom ldan khrag 'thung dpa' bo ni/ / zhal bzhi pa la phyag bcu gnyis/ / gsum gsum spyan mnga' 'gyur ba'i zhal/ / nam mkha'i mdog mtshungs 'od 'phro ba/ /
Bhagavān Heruka, the hero, has four faces and twelve arms. Each powerful face has three eyes. The color of the sky, he radiates light.
dus mtshan dmar ba g.yas brkyang dang / / g.yon zhabs 'jigs byed nag po mnan/ / rtsa ba'i zhal ni sku dang mthun/ / g.yas pa gser gyi mdog dang mtshungs/ /
His outstretched right leg tramples on red Kālarātri and his left on Bhairava. His main face is the same color as his body. His right face is the same color as gold.
rgyab zhal pad+ma rA ga'i mdog / in+d+ra nI la'i zhal g.yon no/ / rdo rje dril bu dang po ste/ / gnyis pas glang po'i pags pa bsnams/ /
His rear face is the color of padmarāga. His face on the left is indranīla. His first hands hold a vajra and ghaṇṭā, the second ones an elephant’s skin.
DA ma ru dang dgra s+t+wa dang / / gri gug mdung rtse gsum pa ni/ / g.yas pa'i phyag na bsnams pa'o/ /
His right hands hold a ḍamaru, battle-ax, hooked knife, and trident.
kha T+wAM ga dang thod khrag dang / / rdo rje'i zhags pa tshangs mgo ste/ / g.yon pa'i phyag na bsnams pa'o/ / sgeg sogs gar nyams kun tu bsgyur/ /
His left hands hold a khaṭvāṃga, skull cup with blood, vajra noose, and Brahmā’s head. He displays all nine moods of dance, erotic and the others.
stag lpags sham thabs mgo phreng can/ / phyag rgya drug gis spras pa'i sku/ / thor tshugs dar gyi cod pan can/ / zla phyed sna tshogs rdo rje dang / /
He has a tiger-skin skirt and garland of heads. His body is adorned with the six mudrās. He has a topknot with a crown of silks, and a half-moon, viśvavajra,
yid bzhin nor bu dbu la 'jog / rus pa'i 'khor los spyi bor mtshan/ / yang dag 'khyud pa'i phag mo yang / / bde ster rang bzhin sku mdog dmar/ /
and wish-fulfilling gem are on his head. A bone cakra marks the top of his head. Vārāhī fully embraces him. Her nature is to bestow bliss and her body is red.
zhal gcig phyag gnyis gcer bu'i tshul/ / byin pa gnyis kyis mnyam par 'khyud/ / rdo rje thod pa bsnams pa ste/ / steng phyogs la rdeg skra grol ma/ /
She has one face, two arms, and is naked. Her calves embrace him. She holds a vajra and skull cup, thrust above, and her hair is free.
phyag rgya lngas spras yab la dgyes/ / bde chen thugs rje'i bdag nyid do/ / phyogs kyi pad+ma'i 'dab bzhi la/ / shar du mkha' 'gro ma mthing ga /
Adorned by the five mudrās, she pleases her male consort. She is the embodiment of compassion, great bliss. On the four lotus petals in the main directions are, in the east, deep blue Ḍākinī,
byang du lA ma mdog ljang gu/ / nub tu dum skyes ma dmar mo/ / lho ru gzugs can ma ser mo/ / zhal gcig phyag bzhi spyan gsum ma/ /
in the north, green Lāma, in the west, red Khaṇḍarohā, and in the south, yellow Rūpiṇī. They have one face, four hands, and three eyes.
g.yas pa gnyis na DA ma ru gri gug / g.yon gnyis kha T+wAM ga dang thod pa bsnams/ / skra grol gcer (431)mo phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa/ / mtshams bzhir byang sems gang ba'i thod pa bzhi/ !

Their right two hold ḍamarus and hooked knives. Their left two hold khaṭvāṃgas and skull cups. {431} Their hair is free; they are naked and adorned by the five mudrās. In the four intermediate directions are four skull cups filled with bodhicitta.
thugs kyi 'khor lo mthing nag rdor phreng bskor/ / mkha' la spyod pa'i dpa' bo sku mdog mthing / / zhal gcig spyan gsum pa dang phyag bzhi yi/ / dang pos rdor dril 'dzin pas yum la 'khyud/ /

The mind cakra is dark blue, surrounded by a garland of vajras. The heroes who rule the sky are deep blue, have one face, three eyes, and four hands. With their first, they hold vajras and ghaṇṭās, embracing their consorts.
'og gnyis Da ma ru dang kha T+wAM ga/ dpa' mo rdo rje thod pa bsnams pa ste/ / kun gyi dpral bar rdo rje'i phreng bas mtshan/ / mgo la thod pa'i dum bu rab gtum ma/ /
Their lower two hold ḍamarus and khaṭvāṃgas. The heroines hold vajras and skull cups. All their foreheads are marked by garlands of vajras. At my head are Khaṇḍakapāla and Pracaṇḍā.
spyi gtsug keng rus chen po gtum mig ma/ / rna g.yas ka pa la dang 'od ldan ma/ / ltag khungs mche gtsigs sna chen dpa' mo'o/ / rna g.yon lha dgra dpa' bo blo chen ma/ /

At the crown of my head are Mahākaṇkāla and Caṇḍākṣī. At my right ear are Kaṅkāla and Prabhāvatī. At the nape of my neck are Vikaṭadaṃṣṭrī and the heroine Mahānāsā. At my left ear are Surāvairī and Vīramatī.
smin dbus 'od dpag med dang mi'u thung ma/ / mig tu rdo rje'i 'od dang lang dbang phyug / phrag par rdo rje'i sku dang shing grib ma/ ! /
At the point between my eyebrows are Amitābha and Kharvarī. At my eyes are Vajraprabha and Laṅkeśvarī. At my shoulders are Vajradeha and Drumacchāyā.
gsung gi 'khor lo dmar po pad phreng bskor/ /
The speech cakra is red, surrounded by a garland of lotuses.
sa la spyod dmar dang pos pad dril 'khyud/ / mchan khungs myu gu can dang sa srung ma/ / nu mar rdo rje ral can 'jigs byed ma/ / lte bar dpa' chen rlung gi shugs can ma/ /

Those who rule the earth are red; their first hands hold lotuses and ghaṇṭās, embracing [their consorts]. In my armpits are Aṅkuraka and Airāvatī. At my breasts are Vajrajaṭila and Mahābhairavā. At my navel are Mahāvīra and Vāyuvegā.

sna rtser rdo rje hU~M mdzad chang 'thung ma/ / kha ru rab bzang lha mo sngo bsangs ma/ / mgrin par rdo rje bzang dang rab bzang ma/ / snying gar 'jigs byed che dang rta rna ma/ / 'doms su mig mi bzang dang bya gdong ma/ !

At the tip of my nose are Vajrahūṃkāra and Surābhakṣī. At my mouth are Subhadra and Śyāmādevī. At my throat are Vajrabhadra and Subhadrā. At my heart are Mahābhairava and Hayakarṇī. At my genitals are Vīrūpākṣa and Khagānanā.
sku yi 'khor lo dkar po 'khor phreng bskor/ / sa 'og spyod dkar dang pos 'khor dril 'khyud/ / mtshan mar stobs po che dang 'khor shugs can/ / bshang sgor rin chen rdo rje dum skyes ma/ /

The body cakra is white, surrounded by a garland of cakras. Those who rule below the earth are white; their first hands hold cakras and ghaṇṭās, embracing [their consorts]. At my liṅga are Mahābala and Cakravegā. At my anus are Ratnavajra and Khaṇḍarohā.
brla gnyis la ni rta mgrin chang tshong ma/ / byin par nam mkha'i snying po go cha ma/ / sor mor he ru ka dang rab dpa' mo/ / rkang bol pad+ma gar dbang stobs chen ma/ /
At my thighs are Hayagrīva and Śauṇḍinī. At my calves are Ākāśagarbha and Cakravarmiṇī. At my fingers and toes are Heruka and Suvīrā. At my insteps are Padmanarteśvara and Mahābalā.
mthe bong rnam snang 'khor los sgyur ba ma/ / pus mor rdor sems brtson 'grus chen mo'o/ / shar sgor kha la khwa gdong ma nag mo/ / byang sgo sna la 'ug gdong ma ljang gu/ /
At my big toes are Vairocana and Cakravartinī. At my knees are Vajrasattva and Mahāvīryā. In the eastern door and my mouth are black Kākāsyās. In the northern door and my nose are green Ulūkāsyās.
nub sgo mchan rtser khyi gdong ma dmar mo/ / (432) lho sgo bshang lam phag gdong ma ser mo/ /
In the western door and tip of my liṅga are red Śvānāsyās. {432} In the southern door and my anus are yellow Śūkarāsyās.
shar lho rna g.yas gshin rje brtan ma g.yas sngo g.yon ser ba/ lho nub rna g.yon gshin rje pho nya mo g.yas ser g.yon dmar ba/
In the southeast and my right ear are Yamadāḍhīs, their right sides blue, their left sides yellow. In the southwest and my left ear are Yamadūtīs, their right sides yellow, their left sides red.
nub byang mig g.yas gshin rje mche ba ma g.yas dmar g.yon ljang ba/ byang shar mig g.yon gshin rje 'jom pa ma g.yas ljang g.yon sngo ba/
In the northwest and my right eye are Yamadaṃṣṭriṇīs, their right sides red, their left sides green. In the northeast and my left eye are Yamamathanīs, their right sides green, their left sides blue.

g.yas gnyis DA ma ru dang gri gug dang / g.yon gnyis kha T+wAM ga dang thod pa bsnams pa/ lha tshogs thams cad kyang snang la rang bzhin med pa 'ja' tshon lta bu/ gsal la rnyog pa med pa bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du gyur/

Their two right hands hold ḍamarus and hooked knives; their two left, khaṭvāṃgas and skull cups. All the deities appear yet lack any nature, like rainbows. They are clear, without turbidity, of the nature of great bliss.
oM AHhU~M/ oM sarba bI ra yo gi nI ka ya wA ka tsit+ta badzra swA b+hA wa ko‘haM/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ / oṃ sarvavīrayoginī kāya vak citta vajra svabhāva ātmako ’ham

kun rdzob tu snang ba'i cha ma spangs pa la/ stong pa'i cha ma dor ba'i snang stong zung du 'jug pa'i lha so bdun/ byang chub phyogs kyi chos sum cu so bdun dang / sa bcu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bor gyur/

These are the thirty-seven deities who unify appearances and emptiness, not abandoning the aspect of appearing conventionally and yet not rejecting the aspect of being empty. They are of the natures of the thirty-seven factors for awakening and the purities of the ten bhūmis.
he ru ka lha lnga'i thugs kar oM haHlas rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po g.yas rdo rje dang / g.yon sdigs mdzub kyis dril bu 'dzin pa/ zla ba'i gdan la g.yas brkyang gis bzhugs pa/

At the hearts of the five heruka deities, from oṃ haḥs, are white Vajrasattvas who hold vajras in their right hands and ghaṇṭās in their left with the threatening gesture. They reside on moon seats with outstretched right legs.

spyi bor na ma hi las rnam snang ser po g.yas 'khor lo/ ltag par swA hA hu las pad+ma gar dbang dmar po g.yas pad+ma/ phrag par bau ShaT he las badzra he ru ka mthing ga g.yas rdo rje/ mig gnyis su hU~M hU~M hoHlas rdo rje nyi ma dmar ser g.yas rin po che/ dpral bar phaT phaT ha~M las rta mchog ljang gu g.yas sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin pa/

At their heads, from nāma his, are yellow Vairocanas, holding cakras in their right hands. At their napes, from svāhā hus, are red Padmanarteśvaras, holding lotuses in their right hands. At their shoulders, from vauṣat hes, are deep blue Vajraherukas, holding vajras in their right hands. In both their eyes, from hūṃ hūṃ hoḥs, are orange Vajrasūryas, holding jewels in their right hands. In their foreheads, from phaṭ phaṭ hoṃs, are green Paramāśvas, holding viśvavajras in their right hands.

yum gyi lte bar oM ba~M las phag mo dmar mo/ / snying gar ha~M yoM las gshin rje ma sngon mo/ mgrin par hriM moM las rmongs byed ma dkar mo/ mgo bor hreM hrI las skyod byed ma ser mo/ spyi gtsug tu huM hU~M las skrag byed ma ljang gu/ dpral bar phaT phaT las gtum mo dud ka / thams cad kyang g.yas gri gug dang g.yon thod pa 'dzin cing gar stabs kyis bzhugs pa/

At the navels of the female consorts, from oṃ vaṃs, are red Vārāhīs. At their hearts, from haṃ yoṃs, are blue Yāminīs. At their throats, from hrīṃ moṃs, are white Mohanīs. At their heads, from hreṃ hriṃs, are yellow Saṃcālanīs. At the crowns of their heads, from huṃ hūṃs, are green Saṃtrāsanīs. At their foreheads, from phaṭ phaṭs, are smoky Caṇḍikās. Holding hooked knives in their right hands and skull cups in their left, they are standing in a dancing posture. {433}
rang gi thugs ka'i ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i hU~M las (433)'od zer 'phros/ rang bzhin gyi gnas nas 'khor lo lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs mdun gyi nam mkhar spyan drangs/

From the hūṃ in the heart of the wisdom sattva at my heart, light rays stream forth inviting the assembly of deities of the maṇḍala of the five cakras from their natural abodes into the space in front.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta a b+hi Shiny+tsa tu mAM/ zhes gsol ba btab pas/ lha mo 'phros/
oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣiñcatu māṃ Having supplicated in that way, goddesses radiate.

oM sarba ta thA ga ta a b+hi She ka ta sa ma ya shrI ye AHhU~M/ zhes spyi bo nas bde ba chen po rgyas byed byang sems kyi bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin spros pa dang bral ba'i bum chus dbang bzhi bskur bas/ dbang gi chus lus gang / sdig sgrib dag par byas/ chu lhag mas gtso mo la mi bskyod pa/ lha gzhan la rigs so sos dbur brgyan par gyur te/

oṃ sarvatathāgata abhiṣekata samaya śrīye āḥ hūṃ On the top of my head, the four abhiṣekas are bestowed by the vase water whose nature, free from elaborations, is bodhicitta-amṛta, which increases great bliss. The abhiṣeka water fills my body, and my negative actions and obscurations are purified. The excess water becomes the crown of Akṣobhya on the principal female and, for the other deities, the crowns of their respective families.
dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH ye shes pa de dag gnyis su med par gyur/
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ The wisdom ones become nondual with them.
oM shrI he ru ka sa pa ri wA ra Ar+g+haM= oM AHhU~M/ des 'gres te/ puSh+pe nas/ shab+da 'i bar gyis mchod/
oṃ śrīheruka saparivāra arghaṃ…oṃ āḥ hūṃ In the same way, offer from puṣpe through śabda.
phul byung gzugs mdzes yid 'phrog rgyan gyis spung / / lang tsho rab rgyas glu dang gar la mkhas/ / dbang po drug la rmad byung bde ba ster/ / kun gyi dga' skyed mchod pa'i lha mo ni/ /
With ravishingly beautiful, exquisite forms, well adorned, full of splendor, skilled in song and dance, bestowers of wondrous bliss on the six senses, the offering goddesses arouse delight in all.
pi wang gling bu mr-i tang+ga rdza rnga/ / bzhad dang snyems dang ting 'khrol gar sgyur ma/ / me tog bdug spos mar me dri zhim dang / / me long ro mchog gos bzang chos 'byung mas/ /
Holding lutes, flutes, mṛtaṅgas, clay drums, laughing, haughty, playing bell cymbals, dancing, with flowers, incense, lamps, perfume, mirrors, sublime tastes, excellent clothing, and the dharmadhātu,
rab 'byams mchod pa'i sprin gyis legs mchod na/ / dgyes bzhin bzhes te mchog rnams stsal du gsol/
they present infinite offering clouds. Please accept with delight and bestow all that is supreme.
oM/ bcom ldan mgon po dpa' bo chen po ni/ / bskal pa'i me dpung lta bur rab tu 'bar/ / ral pa'i cod pan dbu yi rgyan du bcings/ / mche ba rab gtsigs drag shul 'jigs pa'i zhal/ /
oṃ Bhagavān, protector, great hero, blazing like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs.
dbu la spyan gsum gzi brjid ldan pa po/ / dgra s+t+wa zhags pa kha T+wAM mdung rtse bsnams/ / rab 'jigs stag gi pags pa sku la gsol/ / sku chen dud ka bgegs 'dul mdzad la 'dud/
You are majestic with three eyes, hold a battle-ax, noose, khaṭvāṃga, and spear, and are frightening, draped in a tiger skin. To the one with the great smoky body, subduer of obstructors, I bow.

oM/ bcom ldan rnam kun rdo rje phag mo che/ / 'jig rten gsum gzhan rgol bas mi tshugs shing / / 'byung po'i 'jigs kun rdo rje phag mos 'joms/ / rdo rje'i gdan (434)bzhugs tshangs pa las rgyal zhing / / bdud kyi 'jigs kun skem zhing pham mdzad ma/ /

oṃ Bhagavatī, great Vajravārāhī of all manifestations, unswayed by opponents, the three worlds, Vajravārāhī, conquering fears of bhūtas, {434} residing at Vajrāsana, and victorious over Brahmā, you dry up and destroy all fears of Māra.
skye gnas 'byung ba kun gyi rang bzhin gzugs/ / sa gsum dbang phyug chos rnams yongs rdzogs mdzad/ / rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma la 'dud/ /
With a form the nature of all birth, abiding, and arising, you are empress of the three planes, the perfection of phenomena. To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I bow.
ces yab yum rkang brgyad dang / bsdu na/
Thus, praise with the eight lines for the male and female consorts. Say the abbreviated praise:
chos dbyings rnam dag ngang las ma g.yos kyang / / thabs kyis khro bo'i skur ston gdug pa 'dul/ / che ba'i che mchog lha yi lhar gyur pa/ / kun bzang he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Though you never move from the pure expanse of the dharmadhātu, you tame malevolent ones by skillfully displaying your wrathful form. You are the greatest of the greats, the deity of deities. Homage to Samantabhadra Heruka.
zhes dang /
And:
dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma/ / mkha' 'gro ma yis 'khor los sgyur/ / ye shes lnga dang sku gsung thugs/ / 'gro ba skyob la phyag 'tshal bstod/ /
Glorious Vajraḍākinī, cakravartin of ḍākinīs, to your five wisdoms, body, speech, and mind, a refuge for beings, I pay homage.
de nas bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor ni/ /
The yoga of recitation.

he ru ka lha lnga so so'i thugs kar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rang rang gi sa bon la sngags phreng gis g.yon du bskor ba las/ rang rang gi mdog can gyi 'od 'phros/ sems can thams cad bde mchog la bgod cing char thim par bsams la/

In the hearts of each of the five heruka deities, in the center of sun maṇḍalas, are their own seed syllables surrounded counterclockwise by mantra garlands. Those radiate light of their respective colors, establishing sentient beings as Saṃvara and then dissolving back. Thus, contemplate.
gtso bo zhal sbyor gyi bzlas pa dang / gzhan rnams phan tshun drwa bas 'brel ba'i tshul gyis bzla/
For the principal ones, do the recitation of union. For the others, the recitation is done in the manner of mutually connecting nets.
yab kyi snying po ni/
The essence mantra of the male consort.
oM shrI badzra he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/
oṃ śrīvajra he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā
yab kyi nye snying ni/
The quintessence mantra of the male consort.
oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
yum gyi snying po ni/
The essence mantra of the female consort.
oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā
yum gyi nye snying ni/
The quintessence mantra of the female consort.
oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/
oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
he ru ka bzhi'i snying po ni/
The essence mantras of the four herukas.
oM shrI bud+d+ha he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dzA la sam+ba raM swA hA/ oM shrI karma= oM shrI pad+ma= oM shrI rat+na=
oṃ śrībuddha he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla saṃvaraṃ svāhā / oṃ śrīkarma…oṃ śrīpadma…oṃ śrīratna…
rnal 'byor ma bzhi'i snying po ni/
The essence mantras of the four yoginīs.

oM DA ki nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM lA me ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM khaN+Da ro hi huM hU~M phaT/ oM rU pi nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM riM rIM liM lIM kaM nas saM huM hU~M phaT/ ces bzla/ thun mthar/ he ru ka'i yig brgya lan gsum kyis lhag chad bskang /

oṃ ḍākinīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ lāmeye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ khaṇḍarohi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ rūpinīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ ṛṃ ṝṃ ḷṃ ḹṃ kaṃ na sa saṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ At the end of the session, repair excesses and omissions by reciting the heruka hundred syllables.
bsdu ldang ni/
Dissolution and arising.

rang gi thugs ka'i hU~M ka las 'od 'phros/ snod bcud thams cad dkyil 'khor la thim/ he ru ka bzhi po gtso bo la thim/ de thugs ka'i hU~M la thim/ (435)de yang je phra je phrar song nas 'od gsal stong pa nyid kyi ngang la thim/ 'od gsal las he ru ka zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa'i bdag nyid can du gyur/

Light radiates from the hūṃ in my heart. The whole environment and its inhabitants dissolve into the maṇḍala. The four herukas dissolve into me, the principal one. I dissolve into the hūṃ in my heart. {435} That becomes smaller and smaller, dissolving into luminosity-emptiness. From luminosity, I become the embodiment of the Heruka with one face and two arms.

'di'i bsnyen pa byed na yab kyi snying po 'bum phrag bzhi/ nye snying 'bum phrag bdun/ yum gyi snying po dang nye snying 'bum phrag re re/ he ru ka bzhi la 'bum phrag re re/ rnal 'byor ma bzhi khri phrag re bzlas pas grub/ thun mtshams gtor 'bul sogs gsham nas 'byung ba ltar ro/ ! /

If you are doing the approach of those, recite the essence mantra of the male consort four hundred thousand times and his quintessence mantra seven hundred thousand times, the essence and quintessence mantras of the female consort one hundred thousand times each, the mantras of the four herukas one hundred thousand times each, and the mantras of the four yoginīs ten thousand times each. Between sessions, do the torma offering and so forth according to how it is done at the end of the text.
gnyis pa sta gon gyi rim pa la/
II. The Stages of the Prelude
gnas khang rnying pa dang dkyil 'khor ras bris skabs sa chog mi dgos kyang / sa bcad tsam du dkar gtor bsham/ bsang sbyang /

Although it is not necessary to do a ground ritual in the context of an old building or a cloth-drawn maṇḍala, [to include something for it since it is] a topical heading, arrange a white torma. Cleanse and purify.
stong pa'i ngang las b+h+rU~M las rin po che'i snod du oM las gtor ma bdud rtsi'i rgya mtsho kha dog dri ro nus mthu phun sum tshogs par gyur/
Within emptiness, from bhrūṃ, is a jeweled container. Within that, from oṃ, is a torma, an ocean of amṛta, of excellent color, smell, taste, and potency.
oM AHhU~M hoH lan gsum gyis brlab/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ Saying that three times, consecrate it.
b+hU mi pa ti sa pa ri wA ra badzra sa mA dzaH sa mgron dgug / sngags de mthar/ na maHsarba ta thA ga te b+h+yo bi shwa sogs nam mkha' mdzod kyi sngags btags pa lan gsum gyis bsngo/
bhūmipati saparivāra vajra samājaḥ Invite the guests. At the end of that mantra, add the Gaganagañja mantra, nāmaḥ sarvatathāgatebhyo viśva…, and, saying it three times, consecrate it.
gang yang 'dir gnas lha dang klu/ / gnod sbyin srin po'am gzhan dag la/ / sngags spyod don du gtor ma 'di/ / 'bul gyis yang dag bzhes su gsol/ /
Whoever resides here, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, or others, you are offered this torma for the sake of Mantra practice. Please accept it fully.
mchod sbyin gtor ma 'di bzhes la/ sogs kyis phrin las bcol lo/ /

Accept this offering and gift of torma. [May we yogins and yoginīs with our retinues be without illness, have long lives, might, glory, fame, excellent fortune, and vast enjoyments. Bestow on us the siddhis of actions: pacifying, enriching, and the others. Samaya holders, protect us. Be our friend and aid for the siddhis. May we not meet with untimely death, illness, spirits, or hindrances. May we not have bad dreams, bad omens, or bad interactions. May there be peace in the world, good harvests, plentiful grains, the flourishing of dharma, and an abundance of goodness. May all that we desire be accomplished.] Entrust them with activity.
sta gon dngos
The Main Practice of the Prelude
['di] la gsum/ lha/ bum pa/ slob ma sta gon no/ /
This has three parts: (1) the deity prelude, (2) the vase prelude, and (3) the disciple prelude.
dang po lha sta gon ni/
A. The Deity Prelude

bsang gtor dang dri bzang gi chus gtor ba'i gzhir slob dpon gyis gtso bo yab yum gyi snying po dang nye snying lan gsum gsum brjod de dbus su dri'i thig le gru bzhi dang / he ru ka bzhi'i sngags brjod de phyogs bzhir zlum por byas par las rdor gyis me tog gi tshom bu re dgod/ de'i mdun du gtor ma dang / mtha' mchod pas bskor te/ bsang sbyang mchod pa byin rlabs bya/ oM swa b+hA wa sogs/

On ground that has been sprinkled with purifying water and scented water, the ācārya should recite the essence and quintessence mantras of the principal male and female consorts three times each. In the center of that, make a square of scented drops and recite the mantras of the four herukas. In the four directions, make circles. The vajra assistant should arrange bunches of flowers in each one. In front of that, place a torma encircled by offerings. Cleanse, purify, and consecrate the offerings. oṃ svabhāva…

stong pa'i ngang las mdun gyi dkyil 'khor dbus su hU~M sngon po 'od zer lnga 'phro ba sogs sgrub thabs ltar la/ rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs ma bkod/ / ces pa'i bar dang / lus dkyil gyi lha sum cu so bdun byang (436)chub phyogs kyi chos sum cu so bdun dang / zhes sogs nas/ go cha dang / ye shes pa 'gugs pa/ dbang bskur/ rgyas gdab/ dam ye bsre ba rnams gyad sgrub thabs ltar bya/

Within emptiness, in the middle of the maṇḍala in front, is a blue hūṃ radiating light rays of the five colors…[*1] Continue according to the sādhana up to: …are the female tathāgatas of the five families. {436} The thirty-seven deities of the maṇḍala are of the natures of the thirty-seven factors for awakening…[*2] Continue up through the armor, invoking the wisdom ones, the bestowal of the abhiṣekas, the sealing, and the mixing of the samaya and wisdom ones according to the sādhana.
mchod bstod kyang bsdu na de ltar dang / rgyas par spro na mdun bskyed skabs ltar byas te/ rdor dril spos bcas 'dzin pas/

If you wish to do abbreviated offerings and praises, follow that [part of the sādhana]. If you wish to do extensive ones, do so according to the front visualization. Holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā with incense, say:
gnyis med ye shes las byung ba'i/ / khyab bdag dngos kun bdag nyid can/ / ston pa'i gtso bo he ru ka / phag mor lhan cig yang dag ldan/ /
Omnipresent lord arising from nondual wisdom, embodiment of all things, Heruka, the primary teacher, truly united with Vārāhī,
gang zhig phyogs bcu'i dpa' bo dang / / rig pa'i lha mo rdzu 'phrul can/ / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs kun/ / ma lus bdag la dgongs su gsol/ /
heroes of the ten directions, goddesses of awareness endowed with magical powers, all the bodhisattvas and others, everyone, please regard me.
slob ma la ni phan pa dang / / khyed rnams la yang mchod pa'i phyir/ / rdo rje can bdag 'di zhes pas/ / nangs par dkyil 'khor bzhengs par bgyi/ /
In order to benefit disciples and also worship you, I, the Vajrin, called such-and-such, will construct the maṇḍala in the morning.
rjes su brtse bas nyer dgongs te/ / kun gyis byin gyis brlab tu gsol/
Please regard me closely with your kindness. May all give their blessings.
zhes gsol ba btab pas gnang ba byin par gyur/
Having thus been supplicated, they give their permission.
ut+tiSh+Tha/ zhes pas dkyil 'khor nam mkhar btags pa nam mkhar bzhugs par gyur/ ces brjod cing bsam mo/ /
uttiṣtha Thus, the maṇḍala rises up in space and resides in space. Thus, contemplate.
gsum pa bum pa sta gon ni/
B. The Vase Prelude[2]
bum pa gnyis la gu gul gyis bdug / yungs kar gyis brab/ bum rdzas so lnga btab pa chas dang ldan pa bsang sbyang /
Two vases should be fumigated with guggula and pelleted with mustard seeds. Place the thirty-five vase substances inside. Cleanse and purify.

stong pa'i ngang las pa~M las pad+ma dang a las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du b+h+rU~M las rin po che'i bum pa gnyis ka rtsa ba dang nag po med pa/ lto ba yangs pa/ mgrin pa ring ba/ mchu 'phyang ba/ kha g.yel ba/ lha rdzas kyi gos kyis mgrin pa dkris pa/ dpag bsam gyi shing gis kha brgyan pa/ de'i nang du sman lnga/ 'bru lnga/ rin po che lnga/ dri lnga/ snying po lnga/ lcags kyu lnga/ sgron ma lnga rnams dang / lha'i bdud rtsi'i chus yongs su gang ba'i dbus su sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar pad+ma nyi zla 'jigs byed dus mtshan dang bcas pa'i steng du hU~M sngon po las rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa

Within emptiness, from paṃ, appears a lotus. From a comes a moon maṇḍala, above which, from bhrūṃs, appear precious vases. Both vases have a base and no black, a spacious belly, a long neck, a spout, and a wide mouth. Their necks are tied with cloths of divine substances and adorned with branches from wish-granting trees. Inside, they are filled with the five medicinal herbs, the five grains, the five jewels, the five scents, the five essences, the five hooks, the five lamps, and amṛta water of the gods. In their centers, in the middle of multicolored eight-petaled lotuses are lotuses, suns, moons, Bhairavas, and Kālarātris. Above those are blue hūṃs that transform into blue five-pointed vajras.
phyogs bzhir hU~M bzhi yongs su gyur pa las sogs sgrub thabs ltar la/ rigs lnga'i de (437) bzhin gshegs ma bkod/
In the four directions are four hūṃs, which transform… Continue according to the sādhana up to:[*3] {437} …are the female tathāgatas of the five families.

las bum gyi dbus su pad+ma nyi ma ro'i gdan gyi steng du pa~M las khaN+Da ro hi nI dmar mo zhal gcig spyan gsum phyag gnyis gri gug dang thod khrag 'dzin pa/ phyag rgya lngas brgyan pa gsal bar gyur/ bum mtshan rnams kyang rigs lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur/

In the middle of the activity vase, on lotus, sun, and corpse seats, from paṃ, clearly appears red Khaṇḍarohinī, with one face, three eyes, two hands holding a hooked knife and skull cup of blood, adorned with the five mudrās. The qualities of the vase are of the natures of the five families.

thugs ka'i hU~M las 'od 'phros sogs ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drangs nas dbang bskur rgyas gdab bar sgrub thabs ltar la/ so sos dbu brgyan par gyur/ las bum gyi lha mo la 'od dpag med kyis dbur brgyan/

From the hūṃ in the heart…[*4] Invite the maṇḍala of wisdom ones, bestow the abhiṣekas, and do the sealing, according to the sādhana. …the crowns of their respective families. The goddess of the activity vase is crowned by Amitābha.
dzaHhU~M ba~M hoH
jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ

ye shes pa dang dam tshig pa gnyis su med par gyur/ mchod kha gsos la mchod pa byin brlab/ mchod bstod sgrub thabs ltar bya/ gzungs thag blangs te/ rang gi thugs ka'i sa bon las sngags phreng 'od zer dang bcas pa 'phros/ gzungs thag la brgyud nas bum lha'i thugs kar phog pas thugs rgyud bskul bas sku las bdud rtsi'i rgyun babs pas bum pa khengs par gyur/ ces bsams la

The wisdom ones and samaya ones become nondual. Replenish the offerings and consecrate the offerings. Do the offerings and praises according to the sādhana. Pick up the dhāraṇī cord and say: From the seed syllable in my heart, a mantra garland with light rays radiates. It moves along the dhāraṇī cord and strikes the hearts of the vase deities, arousing their mindstreams. A stream of amṛta flows from their bodies, filling the vase. Thus, contemplate.
rnam rgyal gyi lha la lha lnga'am/ spro na 'khor sngags rnams gsum re tsam dang /
For the deity of victory vase, recite the mantras of the five deities, or, if you wish, the retinue mantras three times.
las bum la/ oM khaN+Da ro hi huM hU~M phaT/ ces bzlas nas mchod bstod sgrub thabs ltar byas la yig brgya lan gsum dang /
For the activity vase, recite: oṃ khaṇḍarohi huṃ hūṃ phaṭ Do the offerings and praises according to the sādhana and the hundred syllables three times.
ma 'byor pa dang sogs kyis bzod gsol dang /
With anything missing or done wrong, [or things I did or had others do out of my ignorance, protectors, please be patient.] Thus, request patience.
oM badzra u da ka hU~M/ oM AHhU~M/ zhes dung zhal gyi chus/ mchod yon phul ba'i rkyen gyis bum pa'i lha rnams rjes su chags pa'i mes zhu ba las bum chu dang dbyer med du gyur/ ces bsam/

oṃ vajra udaka hūṃ / oṃ āḥ hūṃ Offer conch water, and say: Through the connection of presenting offering water, the vase deities melt into a fire of passion and become inseparable with the vase water. Thus, contemplate.
las thams cad pa'i lhas dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba mthar ma phyin gyi bar du bgegs rnam par bzlog pa'i phrin las mdzod cig / ces brjod de yig brgya bzla'o/ /
May the deity of all actions perform the activity of averting all obstructors until the activities of the maṇḍala have been completed. Say that and recite the hundred syllables.
gsum pa slob ma sta gon ni/
C. The Prelude for the Disciples

slob bu rnams 'dus la sgo drung du khrus bya/ kun slong bcos pa sogs chos bshad spyi ltar dang / 'dir ye shes mkha' 'gros grub chen til+li pa snyan brgyud du stsal ba'i nor bu skor gsum gyi gdams pa rnams dgyes mdzad mar pa lo tsAs rje btsun mi la la chig brgyud du stsal/ des dka' (438) spyad chen pos nyams bzhes su mdzad pas sku tshe de nyid kyis mchog gi grub pa brnyes nas thugs sras zla ba lta bu ras chung rdo rje grags pa la snyan brgyud 'bring po/ nyi ma lta bu dwags po zla 'od gzhon nu la snyan brgyud rgyas pa/ ngan rdzong ston pa bo d+hi rA dza la snyan brgyud bsdus pa rnams stsal bzhin gsum ka'ang da lta'i bar du bka' lung gi zam ma chad cing byin rlabs kyi chu rgyun ma nyams par byon pa las/

The disciples gather and wash in front of the door. Explain the dharma—the intention to be developed, and so forth—as is customarily done. The instructions of the Three Cycles of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems that were bestowed by the Jñānaḍākinī on the mahāsiddha Tilopa as the Aural Transmission were given by Hevajra Marpa Lotsāwa to Jetsun Milarepa as a single transmission. {438} Milarepa, after practicing with great hardships, achieved the supreme siddhi in his lifetime. He bestowed the intermediate Aural Transmission on his moonlike heart son Rechung Dorje Drakpa, the extensive Aural Transmission on the sunlike Dakpo Daö Zhönu, and the abbreviated Aural Transmission on Ngendzong Tönpa Bodhirāja. Accordingly, these three come down to us today through unbroken reading transmissions and uninterrupted streams of blessings.

'dir ngan rdzong ston pa nas rje btsun gling ka ba sogs nas rim par brgyud pa'i 'khor lo bde mchog gi dbang bskur bsdus pa'i lugs bsgrub pa la slob ma lhag par gnas pa dang dbang bskur dngos gzhi gnyis su yod pa las 'dir slob ma sta gon gyi chos rnams bsgrub par bgyi ba yin pas zhu ba'i yon du dmigs te zhing khams re 'bul mdzod/ ces mtshams sbyar la maN+Dal 'bul du gzhug / de nas me tog dang bcas pa'i thal mo sbyor la dkyil 'khor du 'jug par gsol ba 'debs pa 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/

Here, to receive the tradition of the abbreviated abhiṣeka of Cakrasaṃvara that was transmitted from Ngendzong Tönpa to Jetsun Ling Kawa and others, there are two parts to the main practice: consecrating the disciples and bestowing the abhiṣekas. At this point, since the disciples are about to receive the dharma of the prelude, they should visualize a gift for their request and offer a pure realm. Having said that as an introduction, have them offer a maṇḍala. Now, with your hands in añjali holding flowers, supplicate to enter the maṇḍala by repeating the following three times:
dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa po/ / slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol/ / byang chub chen po'i tshul bstan pa/ / mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo/ /
Great joy, you are my teacher. Ācārya, please consider me. I request the great protector to teach the way to great awakening.
dam tshig de nyid bdag la stsol/ / byang chub sems kyang bdag la stsol/ / sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / skyabs gsum dag kyang bdag la stsol/ /
Bestow on me this samaya. Bestow on me bodhicitta. Bestow on me the three refuges: the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha.
