thar pa chen po'i grong khyer du/ / mgon pos bdag ni gzhug tu gsol/ /
Protector, please enter me into the city of great liberation.
de nas spro ba bskyed cing nyan par bskul ba ni/
The following will generate your interest and arouse your wish to listen.
bu tshur theg pa chen po las/ / khyod ni tshul chen snod yin gyi/ / gsang sngags spyod pa'i cho ga ni/ / khyod la yang dag bshad par bya/ /
Come, child, into the Mahāyāna. You are a receptacle of the great way. I will explain to you fully the rituals for the practices of Secret Mantra.

rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang 'das dang / / de bzhin gang dag ma byon dang / / da ltar byung ba'i rdzogs sangs rgyas/ / 'gro la phan phyir bzhugs pa kun/ / de dag kun gyis gsang sngags kyi/ / cho ga bzang po 'di mkhyen nas/ /
All the perfect buddhas of the past, those yet to come, and the perfect buddhas appearing now, who remain to benefit beings, all know this excellent ritual of Secret Mantra.
dpa' bo byang chub shing drung du/ / (439)thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan ma brnyes/ / gsang sngags spyod pa mnyam med de/ / skyob pa shAkya seng ge yis/ /
The hero under the bodhi tree {439} attained the signs of omniscience. Through the unequaled practice of Secret Mantra, the refuge, the Lion of the Śākyas,
bdud sde shin tu mi bzad pa'i/ / dpung chen dag kyang 'di yis bcom/ / de bas kun mkhyen thob bya'i phyir/ / bu yis blo gros 'di gyis shig /
conquered the great armies, the frightful hordes of Māra. Therefore, in order to attain omniscience, child, hold this in mind.
ces dang /
And:
rtog pa thams cad legs par bsdus nas ni/ / shin tu bsam pa bzang dang ldan pas nyon/ / brjed ngas blo la rdo rje sems sogs kyi/ / dus gsum rgyal ba rnams kyis byin mi rlobs/ /
Gathering all thoughts, listen with an excellent intention. The victors of the three times, Vajrasattva and others, do not bless those with a forgetful mind.

ces gsungs pa'i don ltar dga' spro khyad par can bskyed pa dang / nyan bar gdams pa'i don ltar rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis nyan par mdzad 'tshal/ de nas bla ma dang dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor dang / gzhan yang sangs rgyas byang sems ma lus pa'i drung du phyag 'tshal ba sogs yan lag bdun pa dang / skyabs su 'gro ba dang / sems bskyed pa dang / khyad par byang sdom bzung nas srung snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/

In keeping with the meaning of what was just said, arouse special enthusiasm and joy. In keeping with the meaning of the instructions for listening, please listen with a one-pointed mind. Then, in the presence of the gurus, the maṇḍala of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, and all buddhas and bodhisattvas, think that you offer the sevenfold service, such as homage, that you take refuge, arouse bodhicitta, and, in particular, commit to holding and preserving the vows of a bodhisattva. Repeat the following three times:

rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po dang / / rgyal sras tshogs la phyag 'tshal lo/ / lus dang longs spyod mchod bgyis nas/ / bdag gis sdig pa gang bgyis dang / / bgyid du stsal dang yi rang rnams/ / sangs rgyas spyan sngar mchis nas ni/ / de dag thams cad bshags par bgyi/ /

I pay homage to great Vajradhara and the victorious ones and their children. I offer my body and possessions. Whatever negative actions I have done, have commanded be done, or have rejoiced in, I confess all of them in the presence of the buddhas.
sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dang / / rang rgyal nyan thos 'gro rnams kyis/ / bsgoms dang bzlas brjod bsod nams gang / / de la bdag ni yi rang ngo / /
I rejoice in the merit gathered by the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and all beings through their meditations and recitations.
sems bskyed mngon par sangs rgyas nas/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi mchog / de la bdag ni skyabs su mchi/ /
I take refuge in the supreme of assemblies of bodhisattvas, who have aroused bodhicitta, awakened fully, and turn the wheel of dharma.
sangs rgyas 'byung ba ji lta bar/ / skal ldan byang chub sems dpa' yis/ / byang chub sems ni bskyed pa ltar/ / de bzhin du ni sems bskyed do/ /
I arouse bodhicitta just as the fortunate bodhisattvas have aroused bodhicitta, in the same way the buddhas have done.
bdag gi dge ba'i las rnams 'di dag gis/ / (440) 'jig rten du ni myur du sangs rgyas shog / 'gro la phan phyir chos rnams ston bgyid cing / / sems can sdug bsngal mang pos gzir las sgrol/ /

May I, through all these virtuous actions, {440} quickly become a buddha in the world. For the sake of beings, may I teach the dharma. May sentient beings be free from the torments of their many sufferings.
de nas sngags sdom la thun mong ba brtul zhugs nyer lnga po 'dzin cing srung snyam pas 'di'i rjes zlos lan gsum mdzod/ /
Next, think that you will hold and protect the twenty-five disciplines common to the vows of Mantra, and repeat the following three times:
rdo rje 'dzin pa dgongs su gsol/ / thun mong brtul zhugs sdom pa ni/ / srog gcod rdzun du smra ba dang / / gzhan gyi bud med nor 'phrog dang / / chang 'thung myos par mi bgyi'o/ /
Vajradhara, please consider me. As the vows of the common disciplines, I will not kill, lie, take another’s spouse or wealth, and will not drink alcohol and become intoxicated.
rgyan po kha na ma tho'i zas/ / ngan tshig bstan bcos smra ba dang / / mu stegs kla klo'i chos spyod min/ / dud 'gro byis pa bud med dang / / skyes pa mchod rten bsnun mi bya/ /

I will not gamble or consume prohibited food. I will not expound treatises with negative language and will not engage in the dharma of tīrthikas or barbarians. I will not harm animals, children, women, men, and stūpas.
dag pa'i grogs dang rje bo dang / / dge 'dun rnams dang rgyal ba dang / / yid gtad rnams la 'khu mi bya/ / gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya la/ / mig sogs dbang po zhen mi bya/ /

I will not be hostile to good friends, leaders, the saṅgha, the victors, and those who are trustworthy. I will not be attached to the forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects appearing to my eyes and other senses.
nga rgyal tshig rtsub spro thung dang / / phra ma sdig pa'i grogs rnams spang / / phyag rgya mtshan ma grib 'gom min/ / bya ba ma yin rnam par spang / /
I will abandon arrogance, harsh speech, short-temperedness, divisive speech, and evil friends. I will not taint or walk across mudrās or symbols. I will give up whatever should not be done.
kha na ma tho'i las 'di dag / deng nas brtsams te spang bar bgyi/ /
I will abandon, starting today, all proscribed actions.

de nas khyed rang slob ma rnams skad cig gis dpal he ru ka sngon po phyag gnyis rdor dril thugs kar bsnol ba'i skur gyur/ de la slob dpon gyis rdo rje dang bcas pa'i srin lag gis dri'i thig le gnas gsum du byas pas dpral bar zla ba'i steng du oM dkar po sku rdo rje/ mgrin par pad+ma'i steng du AHdmar po gsung rdo rje/ thugs kar nyi ma'i steng du hU~M sngon po thugs rdo rje'i ngo bor byin gyis brlabs pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Next, you, disciples, instantly become the form of the glorious Heruka, blue, with two hands holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā crossed at your heart. Then, holding a vajra, I, the ācārya, with my ring finger, place perfumed drops on your three places. Feel that you receive the blessings of the essence of vajra body, a white oṃ on a moon at your forehead; the blessings of the essence of vajra speech, a red āḥ on a lotus at your throat; and the blessings of the essence of vajra mind as a blue hūṃ on a sun at your heart.
oM AHhU~M/ zhes dri'i thig le bya/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Place the perfumed drops.

de nas slob ma rnams kyi spyi bor oM haHdkar po rdo rje sems dpa'/ mgo bor na ma hi ser po rnam par snang mdzad/ spyi gtsug tu swA hA hu dmar po pad+ma gar dbang / phrag pa gnyis su bau Sha Ta he nag po mi bskyod pa/ mig gnyis su huM hU~M hoHdmar ser rdo rje nyi ma/ yan lag (441)thams cad la phaT phaT haM ljang gu dpal rta mchog ste/

Next, at the tops of the heads of you, the disciples, are white oṃ haḥs, Vajrasattvas. In your heads are yellow nama his, Vairocanas. At the crowns of your heads are red svāhā hus, Padmanarteśvaras. In both your shoulders are black vauṣaṭ hes, Akṣobhyas. In both your eyes are orange huṃ hūṃ hoḥs, Vajrasūryas. {441} In all your limbs are green phaṭ haṃs, glorious Paramāśvas.
ngo bo lha la rnam pa yi ge'i go chas rgyas btab pa'i mos pa mdzod/
Feel that you are sealed with the armor that is in essence the deities, in manifestation the letters.
slob ma bud med yod na/ lte bar rdo rje phag mo'i ngo bo oM ba~M dmar po sogs so sor dgod par gsung /
If the disciples are female, say: At your navels are red oṃ vaṃs, the essence of Vajravārāhī…[*5] Say each that are necessary to be arranged.
de nas dngos grub kyi skal pa brtag pa la nyin mo dngos su brtag pa dang / mtshan mo rmi lam gyis brtag pa gnyis las/ dang po'i slad du so shing sbyin pa ni/ bsang sbyang /

Next, the examination of your fortune for siddhis is twofold: the actual examination during the day and the examination at night using dreams. For the first, you will be given toothsticks. Cleanse and purify.
stong pa'i ngang las hU~M las so shing sor bcu gnyis pa rtse mor me tog gi phreng ba can slob ma'i dngos grub kyi ltas brtag pa'i nus pa dang ldan par gyur/
Within emptiness, from hūṃ, appears a toothstick, twelve fingerbreadths long with a garland of flowers on its tip. It has the power to examine the omens of siddhis for the disciples.
oM AHhU~M/ zhes bzlas pas so shing dang so shing gi ra ba gnyis char byin gyis brlab/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Reciting that, consecrate both the toothsticks and the tray for the toothsticks.
khyed rang gi kha shar du phyogs pas so shing thal mo sbyar bas zungs la so shing gi ra bar sngags 'di'i rjes zlos mdzad de 'dor bar mdzod/
With your mouth facing toward the east, hold the toothstick in añjali. Repeat the following mantra and throw it into the tray for the toothsticks.
oM badzra ha sa ha/ dan+ta sho d+ha ni hU~M/ zhes dor/
oṃ vajra hasa ha / danta śodhani hūṃ Thus, throw it.
de yi tshe na mtshan ma ni/ /
When you do that, the signs are as follows:
de tshe bdag la blta ba dang / / rtse mo gyen du bstan gyur na/ / de yi dngos grub mchog ces bshad/ / de bzhin shar du bltas na ni/ / de yi dngos grub 'bring du 'gyur/ /
If it faces toward you and the tip turns upward, it is said to be its supreme siddhi. Similarly, if it faces toward the east, it is its intermediate siddhi.
mtshams dang byang du kha bltas na/ / 'jig rten gyi ni dngos grub 'thob/ / so shing dor ba 'ga' zhig las/ / gal te thur du kha bltas na/ / de ni nges par sa 'og gi / dngos grub de la the tshom med/ /

If it faces toward the intermediate directors or the north, you will obtain worldly siddhis. Those who throw the toothstick and it faces downward will definitely, without any doubt, obtain the siddhis below the ground.
ces pa bzhin 'byung bas nges par mdzad 'tshal/ brgyud nas rmi lam gyi sgo nas brtag pa la rmi lam gsal ba'i phyir khyor chu sbyin pa ni/
Since it will arise that way, please be certain of that. Continue on and examine using your dreams. In order to have clear dreams, you will be given water in your cupped palms.
las bum gyi chu dung zhal du blugs pa/
Pouring water from the activity vase into a conch, recite:
oM AHhU~M/ bzla/ zhes byin gyis brlabs pa lan gsum blud pa lan gsum 'thung mdzod/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ Thus, pour it three times for the consecration and drink it three times.
oM hrI bi shud+d+haHsarba d+harmAHsarba pA paM ni ShatsA s+ya saM sho d+hA ya sarba bi kalpA a pa na ya hU~M/ zhes blud/
oṃ hrīḥ viśuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ sarvapāpaṃ niṣacāsya saṃśodhāya sarvavikalpā apanaya hūṃ Thus, pour.

de nas rmi lam gyi bar chad bsrung phyir srung skud gdags pa ni/ srung skud dmar po lus tshad sum lte ba la mdud pa gsum btab pa slob ma'i (442)sgo gsum dang rmi lam gyi bar chad srung ba'i nus pa dang ldan par gyur/

Then, in order to protect your dreams from obstacles, a protection cord will be tied. A red protection cord, the length of your body, is folded in thirds and three knots are tied in its middle. {442} It has the power to protect the disciples’ three doors and dreams from obstacles.
oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/ ces bzlas pa skyas pa'i dpung pa g.yon dang bud med kyi g.yas la btags te/ las sngags brjod cing las bum chu gtor/ mdud steng rdo rje rgya gram du bzhag ste/

oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ Reciting that, tie [the protection cord] around the left upper arm on men and around the right upper arm on women. Recite the activity mantra and sprinkle water from the activity vase. Place crossed vajras on top of the knot, saying:

oM bud+d+ha mai tri rak+Sha rak+Sha sarbA na swA hA/ zhes brjod/ de nas rmi lam mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ku sha sbyin pa ni/ hU~M dang d+hIHlas byung ba'i ku sha'i chun po che chung sngo ljang rtsa rtse ma nyams pa slob ma'i rmi lam mi 'khrugs pa'i nus pa dang ldan par gyur/

oṃ buddhamaitri rakṣa rakṣa sarvāna svāhā Next, in order to ensure that your dreams will not be disturbed, you will be given kuśa. Arising from hūṃ and dhīḥ, the larger and smaller bunches of blue-green kuśa, with intact roots and tips, have the power to ensure that the disciples’ dreams are undisturbed.
d+hI hU~M/ zhes bzlas pas byin gyis brlabs pa/
dhīḥ hūṃ Reciting that, they are consecrated.
oM badzratIk+Sh+Na hU~M/ zhes pas sbyin/
oṃ vajra tīkṣaṇa hūṃ Give them the kuśa.
ku sha'i sngas gdan la nyol la rmi lam rtogs shig / de nas zab pa dang rgya che ba'i chos bshad pa ni 'di la gsan 'tshal/
Lie down on the kuśa as your pillow and bed, and recognize your dreams. The explanation of the profound and vast dharma. Please listen.
'jig rten du ni kun mkhyen dag / u dum+bA ra'i me tog bzhin/ / brgya lam na ni res 'ga' zhig / 'byung 'gyur yang ni mi 'byung ngo / /
In the world, omniscient ones, like udumbāra flowers, may appear once in a hundred times or not even then.
gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'byung ba/ / de bas kyang ni dkon pa ste/ / gang gis mnyam med sems can don/ / mya ngan mi 'da' byed par nus/ /
The appearance of Secret Mantra practice is even rarer than that. Those who are unequaled in benefiting beings, who are able not to pass into nirvāṇa,
bskal ba bye ba du ma ru/ / sngon chad sdig pa byas pa gang / / de kun dkyil 'khor 'di 'dra ba/ / mthong bas byang bar 'gyur bas na/ /
and those who have committed evil deeds throughout many millions of eons, all of them, by seeing a maṇḍala like this will become purified.
grags pa mtha' yas sngags spyod pa'i/ / tshul la gnas na smos ci dgos/ / skyob pa'i gsang sngags bzlas na ni/ / go 'phang bla na med par 'gro/ /
What need is there to mention abiding in the way of Mantra practice, whose fame is infinite. If you recite the secret mantras of refuge, you will go to the unsurpassable state.
gang dag spyod pa mchog 'di la/ / blo gros shin tu mi g.yo na/ / sdug bsngal kun 'byung rab tu gcod/ / bdag nyid chen po khyed rnams kyis/ / rnyed pa mnyam med de ring rnyed/ /
If your mind does not waver about this sublime practice, you will sever the origin of suffering. Today, you, great beings, have made this unequaled discovery.
gang phyir rgyal ba sras bcas pa/ / bdag nyid chen po kun gyis ni/ / bstan pa 'di la khyed rnams kun/ / yongs su bzung ste skye bzhin par/ /
The victors and their children, and all great beings, have accepted you into this teaching—it is like birth.

de phyir khyed rnams theg chen la/ / dbang thob rab tu skye bar 'gyur/ / theg pa chen po cher 'byung ba'i/ / lam mchog 'di ni dpal dang (443)ldan/ / lam 'dir khyod nyid 'gro gyur pas/ / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su 'gyur/

Therefore, you will take birth, receiving the abhiṣekas in the Mahāyāna. {443} Since you will proceed on this path, this supreme, glorious path arising as the greatness of the Mahāyāna, you will become tathāgatas.[3]

ces gsungs pa'i tshig gi don ltar gsang sngags kyi bstan pa dang mjal ba la dga' ba dang spro ba rgya cher skyed mdzod/ / des sta gon gyi chos rnams grub pa lags/ zhes brjod de bsngo smon byas nas slob ma rnams kyis/

In keeping with the meaning of what was just said, arouse great enthusiasm and joy in meeting the Secret Mantra teachings. That completes the dharma of the prelude. Having said that, do the dedications and aspirations and send the disciples away.
gsum pa dkyil 'khor sgrub cing mchod pa ni/
III. The Sādhanapūjā of the Maṇḍala

stegs bu'i steng du ras bris kyi dkyil 'khor bkram/ dbus su many+dzi'i steng sngar sta gon byas pa'i rnam rgyal bum pa dung chos gzungs rdor bcas bkod/ dkyil 'khor gyi byang shar du las bum/ lhor dbu rgyan/ nub tu rdo rje/ byang du dril bu/ mdun du thod chang / gsang thod dang rig tsaka / mtha' skor du chu gnyis nyer spyod g.yon skor/ rgyab phyogs su 'bul gtor lugs 'di'i phyag bzhes ltar grub dka' bas bshos zlum gtso 'khor lnga rgyan spros bcas pa bsham/ rus pa'i phyag rgya drug /

Arrange a cloth-drawn maṇḍala on top of a small stand. In the middle, on a mañji, arrange the victory vase, conch, and dhāraṇī vajra used previously during the prelude. In the northeast of the maṇḍala, place the activity vase; in the south, a crown; in the west, a vajra; in the north, a ghaṇṭā; and in front, a skull cup with alcohol, the secret [abhiṣeka] skull cup, and the vidyā icon. Arrange the two waters and the traditional offerings outside of that in a counterclockwise circle. To the rear, place the offering torma. Since it is difficult to do that according to the procedures of this tradition, place round cakes [representing] the five principal ones and retinue with ornaments and other elaborations.

kha T+wAM DA ru thod pa/ sgeg sogs brgyad rnams dngos sam tsakli gang bde/ mig thur/ me long / dril bu/ mda' gzhu/ pu sti 'khor lo dung / bde mchog gi sku tsaka / mig dang me tog / slob ma mchod pa nyer spyod lnga/ sngon 'gro'i gtor ma/ tshogs kyi yo byad sogs 'du bya/ /

Have either the real objects or icons of the ornaments, whichever is easier, for the six bone mudrās, khaṭvāṃga, ḍamaru, skull cup, and the eight [moods of dance,] erotic and the others. Gather an eye spoon, mirror, ghaṇṭā, bow and arrow, pusti [a text], cakra, conch, icon of Saṃvara, blindfolds, flowers, the five traditional offerings for the disciples, a preliminary torma, the requisite items of feasts, and so forth.
de nas sgrub thabs kyi dag pa gsum dran pa nas brtsams te thun mtshams lhas ldang gi bar rdzogs par btang / bum bskyed bzlas pa sogs gong ltar tshang bar bya/ mdun bskyed kyi dkyil 'khor la dmigs te/

Next, starting with the recollection of the three purifications in the sādhana, do the complete [practice] up to arising as the deity during postmeditation. Do the full vase visualization, the recitations, and so forth, as above. The visualization for the maṇḍala generated in the front is as follows:
hU~M hU~M/ mdun gyi nam mkhar hU~M nag po las 'od zer nag po hU~M gi rnam par 'phros pa 'og rdo rje'i sa gzhi sogs sgrub thabs ltar mngon rtogs tshang bar brjod/

hūṃ hūṃ From a black hūṃ in the sky in front, black light rays radiate in the form of hūṃs. Below they become a vajra ground,…[*6] Recite the complete method of realization, [the visualization], according to the sādhana.
ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drangs pa ni/
The invocation of the wisdom maṇḍala.
rang gi thugs ka'i sogs nas/ mdun gyi nam mkhar spyan drangs/ sta gon gyi lha la'ang dmigs te spos dang rdor dril 'dzin pas/
From the hūṃ in the heart…into the space in front.[*7] Visualize the deities of the prelude, and holding incense, vajra, and ghaṇṭā, say:
oM/ khyab bdag dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin can/ / gnas med 'gro 'ong bral ba nam mkha' bzhin/ / gshegs dang 'byon pa'i mtshan ma mi mnga' yang / / chu zla bzhin (444) du gar dmigs der snang ba/ /

oṃ Omnipresent lord, the nature of all things, nondwelling, free from coming and going, like space, although you are without the characteristics of departing or arriving, {444} you appear wherever you are visualized, like the moon reflected in water.
bdud dpung 'joms mdzad dpal ldan he ru ka / bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro'i 'khor dang bcas/ / bdag gis dad pas deng 'dir spyan 'dren na/ / dmigs med thugs rje'i dbang gis 'dir byon mdzod/ /
Glorious Heruka, destroyer of the hordes of Māra, gurus, yidams, and retinues of ḍākinīs, with faith, I invite you here and now. Through your nonreferential compassion, please come here.
badzra sa mA dzaH oM sarba ta thA ga ta sogs sgrub thabs ltar la/ de dag gnyis su med par gyur/ bar brjod/
vajra samājaḥ oṃ sarvatathāgata…[*8] Continue according to the sādhana up to: …become nondual with them.
mchod pa byin brlab/
Consecrating the offerings:
de nas phyi mchod ni/
the outer offerings.
oM/ dag cing dri med yid 'ong ba'i/ / sngags kyi mchod yon mchog 'di dag / mchog tu gus pas khyed la 'bul/ / bzhes nas bdag la dgyes par mdzod/
oṃ This sublime offering water of Mantra, pure, stainless, and pleasing, I present to you with supreme devotion. Accepting it, be pleased with me.
oM shrI he ru ka Ar+g+haM pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
oṃ śrīheruka arghaṃ pratīccha svāhā
oM/ dag cing dri med= sngags kyi zhabs bsil mchog 'di dag / mchog tu= bzhes nas=
oṃ This sublime foot water of Mantra, pure, stainless,… I present to you… Accepting it,…
pA d+yaM= me tog 'di ni gtsang zhing dge/ / dag pa'i skye gnas las dag pa/ / bdag gis dad pas 'bul lags kyi/ / bzhes nas bdag la dgyes par mdzod/
…pādyaṃ… These flowers, clean and virtuous, purer than those of pure sources, I present with faith. Accepting them, be pleased with me.
badzra puSh+pe= nags tshal las byung phan pa yi/ / dag pa'i dri ldang bdug spos mchog / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…vajra puṣpe… Sublime incense with scents pure and beneficial, found in the forests, I present with faith. Accepting this,…
d+hU pe= srin po 'joms shing dag byed la/ / dge zhing mun pa rnam sel ba/ / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…dhūpe… What purifies, is the vanquisher of rākṣasas, is virtuous, and dispels darkness, I present with faith. Accepting this,…
A lo ke= lhan cig skyes dang sbyor ba'i dri/ / tshim byed dag pa'i dri mchog 'di/ / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…āloke… These sublime scents, pure and satisfying, scents that are natural and compounds, I present with faith. Accepting them,…
gan+d+he= bshos gtsang bza' ba dang bcas pa'i/ / kha dog dri dang ro ldan pa/ / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…gandhe… Clean, edible food— flavorful, fragrant, and colorful— I present with faith. Accepting them,…
nai wi d+ya= phaT ha dang cang te'u dang / / sgra dbyangs yid 'phrog sna tshogs pa/ / bdag gis= bzhes nas=
…naividya… Various melodic, captivating sounds, made with a paṭaha and changteu, I present with faith. Accepting them,…
shab+da pra tIts+tsha swA hA/
…śabda pratīccha…
khyad par rig ma bcu drug 'bul ba ni/
In particular, the offering of the sixteen vidyās.

oM badzra wI Ne huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra waM she huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra mr-i daM ge huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra mu ra dze huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra hA s+ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra lA s+ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra gI rti huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra nr-i t+ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra puSh+pe huM hU~M phaT/ oM (445)badzra d+hU pe huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra dI pe huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra gan+d+he huM hU~M phaT/ oM rU pa badzri huM hU~M phaT/ oM ra sa badzri huM hU~M phaT/ oM spar+she badzri huM hU~M phaT/ oM d+harma d+hA tu badzri huM hU~M phaT/

oṃ vajra vīṇe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra vaṃśe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra mṛdaṃge huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra muraje huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra hāsye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra lāsye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra gīrti huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra nṛtye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra puṣpe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / {445} oṃ vajra dhūpe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra dīpe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra gandhe huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra rūpa vajri huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra rasa vajri huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra sparśe vajri huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ vajra dharmadhātu vajri huṃ hūṃ phaṭ
nang mchod bdud rtsi 'bul ba ni/
Presenting the inner-offering amṛta.

bdud rtsi byin rlabs sgrub thabs ltar bya/ g.yon pa'i mtheb srin gyis 'thor la/ byin rlabs kyi rtsa ba bka' brgyud bla ma rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/ dngos grub kyi rtsa ba yi dam lha tshogs rnams kyi= rten 'brel gyi rtsa ba dpa' bo mkha' 'gro rnams kyi= phrin las kyi rtsa ba chos skyong srung ma rnams kyi zhal du oM AHhU~M/

Consecrate the amṛta as done in the sādhana. Sprinkle it with your left thumb and ring finger as you say: To the root of blessings, the Kagyu gurus, oṃ āḥ hūṃ. To the root of siddhis, the assembly of yidam deities,… To the root of auspicious connections, the heroes and ḍākinīs,… To the root activities, the dharma protectors and guardians, oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

oM shrI badzra he he ru ru kaM huM hU~M phaT/ DA ki nI dz+wa la sam+ba raM swA hA/ oM hrIHha ha huM hU~M phaT/ oM AHhU~M/ oM sarba bud+d+ha DA ki nI ye badzra war+Na nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM badzra bai ro tsa nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ oM AHhU~M/

oṃ śrīvajra he he ru ru kaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / ḍākinījāla samvaraṃ svāhā / oṃ hrīḥ ha ha huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ āḥ hūṃ oṃ sarvabuddhaḍākinīye vajravarṇanīye hum hūṃ / oṃ vajravairocanīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ / oṃ āḥ hūṃ
de bzhin du/
Similarly:
oM shrI bud+d+ha he he= karma= pad+ma= rat+na=
oṃ śrībuddha he he… …karma he he ru… …padma he he ru… …ratna he he ru…
yum bzhi ni/
The four female consorts:
oM DA ki nI ye huM hU~M phaT/ lA me= khaN+Da ro hi= rU pi ni= oM AHhU~M/ zhes mtheb srin gyis 'thor la 'bul/
oṃ ḍākinīye huṃ hūṃ phaṭ lāme… khaṇḍarohi… rūpiṇī…oṃ āḥ hūṃ Sprinkle and offer with your thumb and ring finger.
oM a mr-i ta swA da na badzra swa b+hA wa At+ma ko‘haM/ zhes pas rang gis myong /
oṃ amṛta svādana vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ Taste it yourself.
gsang mchod ni/
The secret offering.
lta dang rgod dang lag 'dzin dang / / 'khyud dang gnyis sprod sogs mchod pas/ / dbang bskur bar ni 'gyur ba dang / / rgyud rnams kun gyi don rtogs shog /
By offering gazing, laughing, holding hands, embracing, and the joining of the two, may I receive the abhiṣekas and realize the meaning of all tantras.
oM sarba ta thA ga ta a nu rA ga Na badzra swa b+hA wa At+ma ko‘haM/
oṃ sarvatathāgata anurāgaṇa vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ
de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa ni/
The offering of suchness.
rang bzhin med pa'i gnas goms pas/ / lha yi snying po sgom byed pa/ / de ni mchod pa chen por 'dod/ / sangs rgyas thams cad rtogs byed pa'o/ /
Being accustomed to the state of no nature is to meditate on the essence of the deity. That is said to be the great offering, which brings the realization of all buddhas.
yab yum gyi bstod pa rkang brgyad ni/
The eight lines of praise for the male and female consorts.
oM/ bcom ldan mgon po dpa' bo chen po ni/ / bskal pa'i me dpung lta bur rab tu 'bar/ / ral pa'i cod pan dbu yi rgyan du bcings/ / mche ba rab gtsigs drag shul 'jigs pa'i zhal/ /
oṃ Bhagavān, protector, great hero, blazing like the eon-ending fires, your crown of hair is bound as your head ornament, your face is terrifying, fierce, with very bared fangs.
dbu la spyan gsum gzi brjid ldan pa po/ / dgra s+t+wa zhags pa kha T+wAM mdung rtse bsnams/ / rab 'jigs (446)stag gi pags pa sku la gsol/ / sku chen dud ka bgegs 'dul mdzad la 'dud/

You are majestic with three eyes, hold a battle-ax, noose, khaṭvāṃga, and spear, and are frightening, draped in a tiger skin. {446} To the one with the great smoky body, subduer of obstructors, I bow.
oM/ bcom ldan rnam kun rdo rje phag mo che/ / 'jig rten gsum gzhan rgol bas mi tshugs shing / / 'byung po'i 'jigs kun rdo rje phag mos 'joms/ / rdo rje'i gdan bzhugs tshangs pa las rgyal zhing / /
oṃ Bhagavatī, great Vajravārāhī of all manifestations, unswayed by opponents, the three worlds, Vajravārāhī, conquering fears of bhūtas, residing at Vajrāsana, and victorious over Brahmā,
bdud kyi 'jigs kun skem zhing pham mdzad ma/ / skye gnas 'byung ba kun gyi rang bzhin gzugs/ / sa gsum dbang phyug chos rnams yongs rdzogs mdzad/ / rnal 'byor 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma la 'dud/ /

you dry up and destroy all fears of Māra. With a form the nature of all birth, abiding, and arising, you are empress of the three planes, the perfection of phenomena. To the Yoginī, empress of desire, I bow.
ces bstod/
Thus, praise.

sgrub thabs ltar bzlas dmigs dang bsnyen dzab rnams ji ltar 'os pa bzlas mthar/ bcom ldan 'das bdag dang sems can thams cad la mchog dang thun mong gi dngos grub ma lus pa stsal du gsol/ zhes gsol ba gdab bo/ /

Do the recitation-visualizations and the approach-recitations as suitable according to the sādhana. At the end of the recitations, say: Bhagavān, please bestow upon me and all sentient beings all the supreme and common siddhis. Thus, supplicate.
de nas slob ma 'jug pa ltar bdag 'jug rdzogs par blangs pa'i mthar bden stobs brjod pa ni/
Next, complete the self-entering [up through] the complete arising [as the deity] according to the entering of disciples. At the end, say the expression of the strength of truth as follows:
shes rab thabs bdag dkyil 'khor 'dir/ / bden pa gang gis ye shes mchog / bden pa de yis mgon khyod kyis/ / bdag gi 'dod pa yongs rdzogs mdzod/ /
In this maṇḍala of the lord of prajñā and method is supreme wisdom of truth. You, protector of this truth, please fulfill my desires.
chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste/ / dag cing gsal la rnyog pa med/ / gzung du med cing brjod du med/ / rgyu dang las las kun tu 'byung / /
All phenomena are like reflections: pure, clear, and unsullied. They cannot be grasped and described. They arise from causes and karma.
de bzhin gnyis med las byung ba/ / bden pa de yis dkyil 'khor du/ / gzugs brnyan gsal bar slob ma rnams/ / kun gyis sgrib med mthong bar shog /
Similarly, they arise from nonduality. Due to that truth, the disciples appear as reflections in the maṇḍala. May all see without obscuration.
de nas gtor ma bdud rtsi ltar byin brlab/ /
Next, consecrate the torma like the amṛta.
sngags rnams kyi mthar/ a kA ro btags pa lan gsum gyis phul/
At the end of the mantras, add akāro and offer three times.
mchod sbyin gtor ma sogs kyis phrin las bcol lo/ !

Accept this offering and gift of torma. [May we yogins and yoginīs with our retinues be without illness, have long lives, might, glory, fame, excellent fortune, and vast enjoyments. Bestow on us the siddhis of actions: pacifying, enriching, and the others. Samaya holders, protect us. Be our friend and aid for the siddhis. May we not meet with untimely death, illness, spirits, or hindrances. May we not have bad dreams, bad omens, or bad interactions. May there be peace in the world, good harvests, plentiful grains, the flourishing of dharma, and an abundance of goodness. May all that we desire be accomplished.] Entrust them with activity.
bzhi pa slob ma la dbang bskur ba ni/
IV. Bestowing the Abhiṣekas on the Disciples
A.
[A. The Sections for Entering]
sgo drung du khrus byas/ phyag 'tshal gral du 'khod pa la sems bskyed gsal gdab/ chos bshad ci rigs dang khyad par/
In front of the door, the disciples should wash, prostrate, and sit in a row. They should clarify bodhicitta. Explain the dharma that is appropriate, and in particular, say:
'dir dgyes mdzad mar pa lo tsA'i thugs bcud bde mchog snyan brgyud bsdus pa ngan rdzong ston pa'i lugs kyi dbang bskur bgyi ba la slob dpon gyis bgyis 'os mtha' dag legs (447)par grub/

Here, what is to be done for the abhiṣekas of the abbreviated Ngendzong Tönpa tradition of the Saṃvara Aural Transmission, which is the heart-elixir of Hevajra Marpa Lotsāwa, have been properly done by the ācārya. {447}
khyed rang rnams kyi 'o skal du gyur pa la dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i skor dang / zhugs pa la mngon par dbang bskur ba gnyis las/
For all of you, there are two parts: entering the maṇḍala and, having entered, the actual bestowal of the abhiṣekas.
dang po dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i chos rnams zhu ba'i ched du maN+Dal phul mdzod/ ces maN+Dal 'bul du gzhug /
First, to request the dharma for entering the maṇḍala, offer a maṇḍala. Have them offer a maṇḍala.
'di man gyi mtshams spyod rnams spyi ltar byas la/
Make the introduction here as is customarily done.
gsol ba gdab pa ni/
The supplication.
dga' chen khyod bdag sogs lan gsum/

Great joy, you are my teacher. [Ācārya, please consider me. I request the great protector to teach the way to great awakening. Bestow on me this samaya. Bestow on me bodhicitta. Bestow on me the three refuges: the Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha. Protector, please enter me into the city of great liberation.] Three times.
oM tsak+ShU r+b+han+d+ha wa ra mA Na ya hU~M gis mig dar dang /
oṃ cakṣūrbhandha varamāṇaya hūṃ With that, give them the blindfolds.
oM a khaM gI ra hU~M gis me tog sbyin/
oṃ akhaṃ gīra hūṃ With that, give them flowers.
rigs dang 'dun pa nges pa'i phyir/
To ascertain your family and intention, you are asked:
bu khyod su yin ci la dga'/ zhes dris pa'i lan du/ skal bzang bdag ni bde ba chen po la'o/ / de yis bu la ci zhig bya/ zhes pa'i lan du/ sangs rgyas mchog gi dam tshig go /

“Child, who are you and what do you enjoy?” Having been asked, you reply: “For me, a fortunate being, it is bliss.” “Thus, child, what will you do?” Your reply to that is: “I will hold the samayas of the supreme buddhas.”
spro ba bskyed pa ni/
Arousing inspiration.
bu tshur theg pa chen po sogs brjod/
Come, child, into the Mahāyāna,…[*9]
skyabs su 'gro zhing so thar gyi sdom pa bzung ba ni/
Taking refuge and holding the prātimokṣa vows.

rdo rje 'dzin pa dgongs su gsol/ bdag dus 'di nas bzung ste byang chub ma thob kyi bar du bla ma la skyabs su mchi'o/ / bde mchog 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha tshogs dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams la skyabs su mchi'o/ /
Vajradhara, please consider me. From now until attaining awakening, I take refuge in the gurus. I take refuge in the assembly of deities, heroes, and yoginīs of the maṇḍala of Cakrasaṃvara.
bdag gis dus 'di nas bzung ste/ / snying po byang chub mchis kyi bar/ / bla ma la sogs spyan snga ru/ / mya ngan 'da' ba'i bsam pa yis/ /
I, starting from this time until reaching the heart, awakening, in the presence of the gurus and the others, and with the aim of nirvāṇa,
gnod pa gzhir bcas las ldog cing / / spong ba bcu dang bcas pa yi/ / so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la/ / yang dag nyid du gnas bgyid do/ /
will abide truly in the prātimokṣa vows, which definitely turn me away from harm and involve the ten abandonments.
lan gsum/
Three times.
bshags sdom sngon du 'gro ba'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni/
Arousing bodhicitta as the preliminary for confession and the vows.
dkon mchog gsum la bdag skyabs mchi/ sogs gsum/

I take refuge in the three jewels. [I confess each and every negative action and unvirtuous deed. I rejoice in the virtuous actions of all beings. I supplicate you to turn the wheel of dharma. I supplicate you not to pass into nirvāṇa. May I abide on the path of yoga. May I guard all samayas. May I achieve the freeing of all sentient beings from suffering. May I become a buddha: one endowed with all the most sublime manifestations, the virtues of the teachings, and so on. May I liberate all beings.] Three times.
rigs lnga'i dam tshig bzung ba ni/
Holding the samayas of the five families.
ji ltar dus gsum mgon po rnams/ / byang chub tu ni nges mdzad pa'i/ / byang chub sems ni bla na med/ / dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi/ /
I give rise to genuine [bodhicitta], just as the protectors of the three times gave rise to unsurpassable bodhicitta, which definitely brings awakening.
sangs rgyas rnal 'byor sdom pa la/ / tshul khrims kyi ni bslab pa dang / / dge ba'i chos ni sdud pa dang / / sems can don byed tshul khrims gsum/ / bdag (448) gis brtan por bzung bar bgyi/ /
For the vow of buddhayoga, I will hold firmly the three modes of ethical conduct: {448} training in ethical conduct, gathering virtuous dharma, and benefiting sentient beings.
sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te/ / bla na med pa'i dkon mchog gsum/ / deng nas brtsams te gzung bar bgyi/ / nam du yang ni mi srung ngo/ /
The Buddha, dharma, and saṅgha are the unsurpassable three jewels. From now on, I will hold them and will never abandon them.
rdo rje'i rigs mchog chen po la/ / rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya yang / / yang dag nyid du gzung bar bgyi/ / slob dpon dag kyang gzung bar bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme vajra family, I will hold perfectly the vajra, ghaṇṭā, and mudrās and I will hold the ācārya.
rin chen rigs mchog chen po yi/ / dam tshig yid du 'ong ba la/ / nyin re bzhin yang dus drug tu/ / sbyin pa rnam bzhi rtag tu sbyin/ /
For the great, supreme ratna family, I will always perform the four types of generosity six times each day as the samaya that is pleasing to the mind.
byang chub chen po las byung ba'i/ / pad+ma'i rigs chen dag pa la/ / phyi nang gsang ba theg pa gsum/ / dam pa'i chos ni ma lus bzung / /
For the great, pure padma family, arising from great awakening, I will hold the genuine dharma of the three yānas, outer, inner, and secret.
las kyi rigs mchog chen po la/ / sdom pa thams cad ldan par ni/ / yang dag nyid du gzung bar bgyi/ / mchod pa'i las kyang ci nus bgyi/ /
For the great, supreme karma family, I will hold perfectly all the vows. I will perform all possible acts of worship.
byang chub sems ni bla na med/ / dam pa bdag gis bskyed bgyis nas/ / sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir/ / bdag gis sdom pa ma lus bzung / /
Having developed genuine, unsurpassable bodhicitta, I will hold all the vows for the benefit of all sentient beings.
ma brgal ba rnams bsgal bar bgyi/ / ma grol ba rnams bdag gis dgrol/ / dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung zhing / / sems can mya ngan 'das la dgod/
May I release those who have not been released. May I liberate those who have not been liberated. May I provide relief to those who have no relief. May I establish sentient beings in nirvāṇa.
ces lan gsum/
Three times.
khyed rang rnams kyi snying gar bden gnyis kyi ngo bo zla dkyil dang / rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa'i rnam par gyur par mos la 'di'i rjes zlos/
Feel that the essences of the two truths are in your heart in the forms of a moon maṇḍala and a white five-pointed vajra, and repeat the following:
oM sarba yo ga tsit+ta ut+pa da yA mi/ gsum/
oṃ sarvayogacitta utpadayāmi Three times.
de brtan phyir rdo rje snying gar bzhag la/
To stabilize that, place a vajra at their hearts and say:
oM su ra te sa ma ya s+t+waM sid+d+hi badzra ya tha su khaM/
oṃ surate samayastvaṃ siddhi vajra yatha sukhaṃ
gsang bar gdams pa ni/
Instructions on secrecy.

deng khyod de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mchog tu gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs kyi/ gzhan ma zhugs pa rnams kyi mdun du smra bar mi bya'o/ / slob dpon gyi phyag gi rdo rje la 'jus te dkyil 'khor gyi nang du zhugs pa'i mos pa mdzod/

Today, you have entered the most secret maṇḍala of the tathāgatas. You must not speak of this in the presence of those who have not entered. Feel that you take hold of the vajra in the ācārya’s hand and enter inside the maṇḍala.
phan yon gyi sgo nas dam la bzhag pa ni/
Establishing their commitments by referring to both the benefits and the disadvantages.

ye shes gang gis khyod de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dngos grub kyang thob par 'gyur na/ dngos grub gzhan lta ci smos (449) khyod kyis dkyil 'khor chen po ma mthong ba rnams kyi mdun du smra bar mi bya ste khyod dam tshig nyams par 'gyur ta re/ nyes dmigs dam bzhag rdo rje snying gar gtugs la/

If wisdom brings the attainment of the siddhis of all tathāgatas, what need is there to mention other siddhis? {449} You must not speak of this in the presence of those who have not seen the great maṇḍala. You will risk damaging your samaya. To establish their commitments by referring to the disadvantages, place a vajra at their hearts and say:
he ru ka dpal deng khyod kyi/ / snying la yang dag zhugs gyur te/ / gal te tshul 'di smras na ni/ / de ma thag tu dral te gshegs/ /
Today, glorious Heruka has truly entered your heart. If you speak about this state, immediately he will separate and be gone.
'di ni khyod kyi dam tshig gi rdo rje ste gal te 'ga' zhig la smras na khyod mgo bo 'gem par byed do/ /
This is the vajra of your samaya. If you speak of it to others, it will split your head.
gnyis ka'i dam bzhag mna' chu sbyin pa ni/
The giving of the oath water to establish their commitments by means of both [the benefits and disadvantages].
oM AHhU~M ha hoHhrIH sa chu byin gyis brlab/
oṃ āḥ hūṃ ha hoḥ hrīḥ Thus, consecrate the water.
'di ni khyod kyi bdud rtsi ste/ / ma bsrungs sreg par byed pa'i dug / bsrungs na dngos grub 'byung ba ste/ / bdud rtsi lnga yi chus 'grub bo/ /
This is amṛta for you. If you do not protect [your commitments], it will be poison that burns. If you protect them, siddhis will appear: they will be achieved with the water of the five amṛtas.
oM badzra u da ka Tha Tha/
oṃ vajra udaka ṭhaṭha
bla ma'i bka' gnyan pa'i dam bzhag ni/
Establishing the commitment in relation to the strict command of the guru.
rdo rje spyi bor bzhag la/
Place a vajra on their heads and say:
deng phyin chad khyod kyi he ru ka nga yin gyi/ gang ngas 'di gyis shig ces bsgo ba de khyod kyis bya dgos so/ / khyod kyis nga la brnyas par ma byed cig /
From today on, I am your Heruka. Whatever I say to do, you must do that. You must not have contempt for me.
byas na khyod mi bde ba ma spangs par tshe'i dus byas nas dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ta re/ ye shes dbab pa'i slad du gsol ba 'debs pa ni/
If you do, you risk not being able to abandon unhappiness and, when your life ends, falling into hell. The supplication for the descent of the wisdom ones is as follows:

bla ma 'khor lo sdom pa'i lha tshogs dgongs su gsol/ bdag ming 'di la/ he ru ka'i byin rlabs kyi ngo bo/ / sdig pa'i drwa ba 'joms pa'i rdo rje/ mi shigs pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin/ rnam pa thams cad gsal ba'i me long / de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes nam mkha' lta bus gang bar mdzad du gsol/

Guru and assembled deities of Cakrasaṃvara, please consider me. I, with this name, supplicate: please fill me with the space-like wisdom of suchness, the essence of the blessings of the Heruka, the vajra that destroys the webs of evil actions, the nature of indestructible virtues, the mirror that illuminates all manifestations.
lan gsum/
Three times.

khyed rnams he ru ka sngon po rdo dril 'dzin cing g.yas brkyang g.yon bskums pas bzhugs pa'i thugs kar chos 'byung sngon po'i dbus su yi ge bdun pa kha dog sna tshogs pa kyi li li 'khor bar gyur/ bla ma'i thugs ka dang rang bzhin gyi gnas nas he ru ka grangs med pa byon nas snying gar thim par gyur ba'i mos pa mdzod/

You are the Heruka, blue, holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā and standing with your right leg extended and your left bent. At your heart, in the middle of a blue source of dharmas, are the seven letters, multicolored and spinning in a circle. Feel that from the guru’s heart and the natural abodes, innumerable herukas come and dissolve into your heart.
spos rol bya zhing /
With incense, play music and say:
oM AHhU~M badzra gu ru shri dz+nyA na A we sha ya a aH
oṃ āḥ hūṃ vajra guru śrījñāna āveśaya a aḥ
yab yum kyi snying po'i mthar/ (450)
At the end of the essence mantras of the male and female consorts, say: {450}
tiSh+Tha ma hA kro d+ha A be sha ya hU~M/ shrI he ru ka bid+ma he bid+yA rA dza ya d+hI ma he swA hA/
oṃ tiṣṭha mahākrodha āveśaya hūṃ / śrīheruka vidmahe vidyārājaya dhīmahe svāhā
lan mang du brjod la dang ba/ bstan pa'i phyir rdo rje spyi bor bzhag la/
Say that many times, and there is descent. To stabilize that, place a vajra on their heads and say:[4]
tiSh+Tha badzra/ pra tIts+tsha badzra hoH sa me tog 'bul/
tiṣṭha vajra / oṃ pratīccha vajra hoḥ With that, give them flowers.
pra ti gr-ih+Na i maM sa twa ma hA bA la/ zhes me tog dbang rtags su byin/
pratigṛhṇa imaṃ satva mahābāla Give them flowers as signs of the abhiṣeka.
mig dbye ba ni/
Opening the eyes.
he ru ka dpal deng khyod kyi/ / mig 'byed par ni brtson par mdzad/ / phye bas thams cad mthong 'gyur ba'i/ / rdo rje'i mig ni bla na med/ /
Today the glorious Heruka has strived to open your eyes. Once open, they are unsurpassable vajra eyes seeing everything.
oM badzra nai tra a ba ha ra pa tra laM hrI prA~M/ zhes mig ras dbye/ de nas/
oṃ vajra naitra apahara patra laṃ hrīḥ prāṃ Remove their blindfolds. Then say:
he badzra pA sh+ya/ dkyil 'khor bzang po 'di la ltos/ / da ni dad pa rab tu skyed/ / khyod ni rnal 'byor ma'i rigs skyes/ /
hevajra pāśya Behold this excellent maṇḍala. Now arouse strong faith. You have been born in the family of yoginīs.
sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlabs/ / 'gro ba phun sum tshogs kun dang / / dngos grub kun khyod mngon sum gyur/ / dam tshig thams cad skyong ba dang / / gsang sngags la yang brtson par gyis/
You are blessed by mantras and mudrās. The abundant excellence of beings and all siddhis will manifest for you. Protect all samayas. Exert yourself in Secret Mantra.
zhes dkyil 'khor blta bar bskul nas/
Urge them to view the maṇḍala.

'di na bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi lha tshogs bzhugs pa yin te/ de'ang chos 'byung gi dbus su pad+ma rdo rje rgya gram/ de'i lte bar gzhal yas khang gru bzhi sgo bzhi rta babs dang bcas pa dur khrod brgyad kyis bskor ba/ de'i dbus su sna tshogs pad+ma 'dab brgyad kyi lte ba dang / phyogs bzhir/

This is where the assembly of deities of the Bhagavān, glorious Cakrasaṃvara, reside. In the center of a source of dharmas is a lotus and viśvavajra. In the center of that is a square palace with four doors and torans, surrounded by the eight charnel grounds. In the middle of that is an eight-petaled multicolored lotus. In its center and in the four directions are…
shrI he ru ka khrag 'thung dpal/ sogs sgrub thabs ltar la/ rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs ma bkod/
Śrī Heruka, Glorious Blood-Drinker…[*10] Continue according to the sādhana up to: …are the female tathāgatas of the five families.

gtso bo yab kyi sku'i gnas rnams dang thugs kar yang dpal 'khor lo bde mchog gi lha tshogs drug cu rtsa gnyis bzhugs pa/ de rnams brten pa lha ste dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad mngon sum du mjal ba'i mos pas dad gus dga' spro rgya cher skyed mdzod/

In the heart and the places of the body of the principal male consort reside the sixty-two deities of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara. Feeling that you now actually meet those deities, who are the supported, and the entire maṇḍala, feel great faith, devotion, joy, and inspiration.
des 'jug pa'i chos rnams grub/
That completes the section of entering [the maṇḍala].
gnyis pa dbang bskur ba
B. The Bestowal of the Abhiṣekas
['di] la bzhi/ bum gsang sher yi tshig dbang ngo / /
This has four parts: (1) the vase abhiṣeka, (2) the secret abhiṣeka, (3) the prajñājñāna abhiṣeka, and (4) the word abhiṣeka.
dang po bum dbang
1. The Vase Abhiṣeka
['di] la lnga/ rdo rje slob ma'i dbang / slob dpon gyi dbang / lung bstan/ rjes gnang / khyad par (451 )lus dkyil gyi dbang rnams so/ /
This has five parts: (1) the vajra disciple abhiṣeka, (2) the ācārya abhiṣeka, (3) the prophecy, (4) the authorizations, and (5) the abhiṣeka of the special body maṇḍala. {451}
dang po ni/
a. The Vajra Disciple Abhiṣeka
zhugs nas mngon par dbang bskur ba la bum dbang rdzogs par zhu ba'i yon tu maN+Dal phul/ gsol 'debs rjes zlos/
Having entered [the maṇḍala], the actual abhiṣekas will be bestowed. As a gift to request the complete vase abhiṣeka, offer a maṇḍala. Repeat the following supplication:
he ru ka dpal dbang bskur ba/ / 'gro ba bskyab phyir gzi brjid che/ / ji ltar yon tan cher 'byung ba/ / dbang bskur ba ni bdag la stsol/
Just as the great Tejas bestowed upon the great Guṇaketu the abhiṣeka of the glorious Heruka for the sake of protecting beings, please bestow the abhiṣeka upon me.
lan gsum/
Three times.

bzlas pa'i lung sbyin pa'i slad du slob dpon gyi thugs ka'i sngags phreng las gnyis pa byung / zhal nas thon/ khyed rnams kyi zhal du zhugs/ snying gar 'khod par mos la 'di'i= sgrub thabs ltar sngags lan gsum gyi rjes zlos byar gzhug /

In order to receive the reading-permission for the recitations, [imagine that] from the mantra garland in the heart of the ācārya, a second one emerges. It comes from their mouths and enters your mouth. Feel that it is arranged in your heart. Have them repeat the mantras three times according to sādhana.
me tog phul la rjes zlos/ bcom ldan bdag la stsal lags kyi/ / bdag la bgo bar mdzad du gsol/ lan gsum/
To offer flowers, repeat the following: Bhagavān, please grant this to me. May it impact me. Three times.
slob dpon gyis me tog mgor bzhag la/ bcom ldan 'di la sogs lan gsum/
The ācārya places flowers on their heads and says: Bhagavān, [please grant this. Please impact them.] Three times.

de nas nang dbang gi slad du slob dpon gyi thugs ka'i 'od kyis khyed rnams drangs te zhal du zhugs pa bde bas zhu ba yum gyi pad+mar babs pa mi bskyod pa 'khor lo bde mchog gi skur gyur/ de nyid phyir thon te 'khod pa la bum pa mi bskyod pa zhu ba'i chur gyur/ bla ma he ru ka'i thugs kar he ru ka rdor dril 'dzin pas yum phag mo la 'khyud pa/ snyoms par zhugs pa'i sbyor mtshams nas byang chub kyi sems babs pa dang mnyam du 'od zer 'phros pas/ rigs ldan ma mkha' gang ba spyan drangs/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur ba'i dgongs pa mdzad/ rig mas glu len/ byang sems kyis bkra shis brjod/ khro bos bar chad sel/ lha mos mchod pa dang bcas te/ dbang bskur ba'i bdud rtsi mthing ga slob ma'i snying gar zhugs te/ lus sngo mer gyis gang bar gyur/

Next, for the internal abhiṣeka, light from the ācārya’s heart draws you in and you enter their mouth. You melt due to the bliss and descend to the lotus of the female consort, where you become a form of Akṣobhya Cakrasaṃvara. You come outside and are seated. The water in the vase is melted Akṣobhya. In the heart of the guru Heruka is a Heruka holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā, embracing his consort Vārāhī. From their place of union, bodhicitta descends, and with that, light rays stream forth. The five families, filling space, are invoked. The tathāgatas direct their attention to bestowing the abhiṣeka. The vidyās sing songs, the bodhisattvas recite verses of auspiciousness, the krodhas dispel obstacles, and the goddesses make offerings. Deep blue amṛta that bestows the abhiṣeka enters hearts of you, the disciples, filling your bodies with blue fire.

bkra shis gang zhig sems can kun gyi snying la gnas/ / kun gyi bdag nyid rigs kun gyi ni bdag po mchog / sems can ma lus skyed byed bde ba chen po ste/ / des ni khyod la dbang bskur (452)mchog gi bkra shis shog /

The auspiciousness abiding in the hearts of all sentient beings [is] the supreme lord of all families, embodying all, the great bliss that inspires all sentient beings. {452} Thus, may there be the sublime auspiciousness of bestowing the abhiṣeka upon you.
rnam bum spyi bor bzhag la/
Place the all-victorious vase on their heads and say:
rnam shes phung po rnam dag pa/ / me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis/ / zhe sdang rnam dag mi bskyod pa/ / dpal ldan chu yi dbang bskur ro/ /
The purity of the skandha of consciousnesses, mirrorlike wisdom, bestows the glorious water abhiṣeka, Akṣobhya, the purity of aggression.
oM shrI sarba ta thA ga ta badzra he ru ka a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ zhes dbang bskur bas chu'i lhag ma spyi bor 'dus pa las mi bskyod pas dbur brgyan/
oṃ śrīsarvatathāgata vajraheruka abhiṣiñca hūṃ Thus, having conferred the abhiṣeka, the excess water gathers at the top of your head and becomes the crown of Akṣobhya.

cod pan gyi dbang gi slad du khyed rnams dang cod pan rin 'byung 'khor lo bde mchog gi rang bzhin du gyur par mos/ bla ma he ru ka'i lte bar rat+na he ru ka ser po rin dril 'dzin pas gzugs can ma la 'khyud pa/ snyoms par zhugs pa'i sbyor mtshams nas sogs gong ltar la/ bdud rtsi ser po slob ma'i lte bar zhugs te lus ser mer gyis gang bar gyur/ dbu rgyan thogs la/

For the crown abhiṣeka, feel that you and the crown become of the nature of Ratnasambhava Cakrasaṃvara. In the navel of the guru Heruka is yellow Ratna Heruka holding a jewel and ghaṇṭā, embracing Rūpiṇī. From their place of union,… Continue as above ending with: Yellow amṛta enters the navels of you, the disciples, filling your bodies with yellow fire. Hold up the crown and say:
tshor ba'i phung po rnam dag pa/ / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis/ / nga rgyal rin chen 'byung ldan gyi/ / rdo rje'i cod pan dbang bskur ro/ /
The purity of the skandha of feelings, the wisdom of equality, bestows the vajra crown abhiṣeka, Ratnasambhava, the purity of pride.
oM shrI sarba ta thA ga ta rat+na he ru ka /
oṃ śrīsarvatathāgata ratnaheruka
dbu rgyan bcing / rnam bum chu 'thor la/
Tie the crown, sprinkle water from the all-victorious vase, and say:
oM shrI sarba ta thA ga ta he ru ka a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/ zhes dbang bskur bas chu'i lhag ma spyi bor 'dus pa las rin 'byung gis dbur brgyan/
oṃ śrīsarvatathāgata heruka abhiṣiñca hūṃ Thus, having conferred the abhiṣeka, the excess water gathers at the top of your head and becomes the crown of Ratnasambhava.

rdo rje'i dbang gi slad du khyed rnams dang rdo rje 'od dpag med 'khor lo bde mchog gi rang bzhin du gyur par mos/ bla ma he ru ka'i mgrin par pad+ma he ru ka dmar po pad dril 'dzin pas du ma skyes ma la 'khyud pa/

For the vajra abhiṣeka, feel that you and the vajra become of the nature of Amitābha Cakrasaṃvara. In the throat of the guru Heruka is red Padma Heruka holding a lotus and ghaṇṭā, embracing Khaṇḍarohā. From their place of union,…
snyoms par zhugs pa'i sogs gong ltar la/ bdud rtsi dmar po slob ma'i mgrin par zhugs te lus dmar mer gyis gang bar gyur/
Continue as above ending with: Red amṛta enters the throats of you, the disciples, filling your bodies with red fire.
rdo rje thogs la/
Hold up the vajra and say:
'du shes phung po rnam dag pa/ / so sor kun rtog ye shes can/ / 'dod chags dag pa snang mtha' yi/ / rdo rje pad+mas=
The purity of the skandha of perceptions, discriminating wisdom, is the abhiṣeka bestowed by the vajra lotus, Amitābha, the purity of pride.
oM shrI sarba ta thA ga ta pad+ma he ru ka a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ śrīsarvatathāgata padmaheruka
rdo rje lag g.yas su sbyin/ chu dbang gong ltar/
Give the vajra to their right hands. As in the water abhiṣeka above, say the following:
zhes dbang bskur bas chu'i lhag ma spyi bor 'dus pa las 'od dpag med kyis dbur brgyan/
Thus, having conferred the abhiṣeka, the excess water gathers at the top of your head and becomes the crown of Amitābha. {453}

dril bu'i dbang gi slad (453)du khyed rnams dang dril bu don grub 'khor lo bde mchog gi rang bzhin du gyur/ bla ma he ru ka'i gsang gnas su karma he ru ka ljang gu rgya gram dang dril bu 'dzin pas lA ma la 'khyud pa/ snyoms par zhugs pa'i yo gas gong ltar la/ bdud rtsi ljang gu slog ma'i gsang bar zhugs te lus ljang mer gyis gang bar gyur/

For the ghaṇṭā abhiṣeka, you and the ghaṇṭā become of the nature of Amoghasiddhi Cakrasaṃvara. In the secret place of the guru Heruka is green Karma Heruka holding crossed [vajras] and a ghaṇṭā, embracing Lāma. From their place of union,… Continue as above ending with: Green amṛta enters the secret places of you, the disciples, filling your bodies with green fire.
dril bu thogs la/
Hold up the ghaṇṭā and say:
'du byed phung po rnam dag pa/ / bya ba nan tan ye shes can/ / phrag dog dag pa don grub kyi/ / dril bu chen pos=
The purity of the skandha of formative forces, the wisdom of assiduous action, is the abhiṣeka bestowed by the great ghaṇṭā, Amoghasiddhi, the purity of jealousy.
oM shrI sarba ta thA ga ta karma he ru ka a=
oṃ śrīsarvatathāgata karma heruka a…
oM badzra a b+hi pa ti s+t+waM/ zhes dril bu lag g.yon du sbyin chu dbang gong ltar/
oṃ vajra abhipatistvaṃ Give the ghaṇṭā to their left hands. As in the water abhiṣeka above, say:
zhes dbang bskur bas chu'i lhag ma spyi bor 'dus pa las don yod grub pas dbur brgyan/
Thus, having conferred the abhiṣeka, the excess water gathers at the top of your head and becomes the crown of Amoghasiddhi.

ming dbang gi slad du khyed rnams rnam snang 'khor lo bde mchog gi rang bzhin du gyur par mos/ bla ma he ru ka'i spyi bor bud+d+ha he ru ka dkar po 'khor dril 'dzin pas mkha' 'gro ma la 'khyud pa/ snyoms par zhugs pa'i sogs gong ltar/ bdud rtsi dkar po slob ma'i spyi bor zhugs te lus dkar mer gyis gang bar gyur/

For the name abhiṣeka, feel that you become of the nature of Vairocana Cakrasaṃvara. At the top of the head of the guru Heruka is white Buddha Heruka holding a cakra and ghaṇṭā, embracing Ḍākinī. From their place of union,… Continue as above ending with: White amṛta enters the tops of the heads of you, the disciples, filling your bodies with white fire.
gzugs kyi phung po rnam dag pa/ / chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can/ / gti mug dag pa rnam snang gi/ / dpal ldan ming gis dbang bskur ro/ /
The purity of the skandha of forms, the nature of the dharmadhātu, is the abhiṣeka bestowed by the glorious name of Amitābha, the purity of bewilderment.
rdor dril bsnol mar spyi bor 'khrol la/
Play the crossed vajra and ghaṇṭā above their heads and say:
oM shrI sarba ta thA ga ta bud+d+ha he ru ka a b+hi Shiny+tsa hU~M/
oṃ śrīsarvatathāgata buddhaheruka abhiṣiñca hūṃ
so so'i gsang mtshan nam spyi tsam du/
Say either the secret name for each one or a general one:

kye dpal mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o/ / chu dbang gong ltar/ zhes dbang bskur bas chu'i lhag ma spyi bor 'dus pa las rnam snang gis dbur brgyan/ de ltar dbang lnga thob pas/ nyon mongs lnga spangs/ ye shes lnga dang ldan/ rig ma yum dang 'brel bas rig pa'i dbang thob pa yin no/ /

Kye, you are the tathāgata known as the glorious Akṣobhyavajra. As in the water abhiṣeka above, say: Thus, having conferred the abhiṣeka, the excess water gathers at the top of your head and becomes the crown of Vairocana. Thus, having received the five abhiṣekas, your five mental afflictions are abandoned, and you have the five wisdoms. By being joined with a vidyā, a female consort, you receive the abhiṣeka of awareness.
b.
[b. The Vajrācārya Abhiṣeka]
rdo rje slob dpon gyi dbang gi don du maN+Dal phul/ gsol 'debs rjes zlos/
For the sake of the vajrācārya abhiṣeka, offer a maṇḍala. Repeat the following supplication:
rdo rje 'chang gi dbang bskur ba/ / 'gro ba skyob phyir gzi brjid can/ / ji ltar yon tan 'byung (454)gnas stsal/ / sangs rgyas kun gyis sbyin par mdzod/
Just as Tejas bestowed upon Guṇaketu the abhiṣeka of Vajradhara for the sake of protecting beings, {454} may the buddhas be generous [to me].
lan gsum/
Three times.

bla ma'i lus dkyil gyi shar sgor dbang stegs seng khrir khyed rnams rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po rdor dril 'dzin pa/ yum rdo rje snyems ma gri thod 'dzin pa dang mnyam par sbyor ba'i gnas gsum du 'bru gsum gyis mtshan pa/ thugs ka'i 'od kyis rdo rje sems dpa' spyan drangs te thim par mos/ rdor dril bsang sbyang /

In the eastern door of the body maṇḍala of the guru, on the abhiṣeka stand, a lion throne, you are white Vajrasattva holding a vajra and ghaṇṭā in union with your consort Vajragarvā, who holds a hooked knife and skull cup. Your three places are marked by the three seed syllables. Feel that the light of your heart invites Vajrasattva, who dissolves into you. Cleanse and purify the vajra and ghaṇṭā.
stong pa'i ngang las hU~M las rdo rje a las dril bu rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum gyi ngo bor gyur/
Within emptiness, from hūṃ, appears a vajra, and from a, a ghaṇṭā, the essence of Vajrasattva, male and female consorts.
hU~M/ thog mtha' med pa'i sems dpa' ni/ / rdo rje sems dpa' kun gyi bdag / rdo rje sems dpa' sems dpa' che/ / rdo rje snyems tshul bdag po'i bdag
hūṃ Sattva without beginning or end, you are Vajrasattva, lord of all, Vajrasattva, mahāsattva, lord of lords, with Vajragarvā.
bcom ldan 'das dpal mchog dang po'i skyes bu'o/ /
You are the Bhagavān, the glorious, supreme first being.
oM ma hA badzra hU~M/ zhes rdo rje lag g.yas su bzhag la gsor du gzhug /
oṃ mahāvajra hūṃ Place the vajra in their right hands and have them brandish it.
aH srid pa ngo bo nyid kyi bdag / ngo bo nyid kyis srid bral byas/ / rang bzhin dag pa'i sems dpa' ni/ / dam pa'i srid pa byed par 'gyur/ /
aḥ Existence is pure in its very essence. In its very essence, there is no existence. The naturally pure sattva creates sacred existence.
badzra g+hAN+De aH zhes dril bu lag g.yon du bzhag la dkrol du gzhag /
vajra ghāṇṭe aḥ Place the ghaṇṭā in their left hands and have them play it.
phyag rgya sku'i dam tshig gi slad du rdor dril lhan cig gtad de/
For the samaya of mudrā body, you are given the vajra and ghaṇṭā together.
rang gi rig pa'i ngo bo nyid/ / phyogs bcu dus gsum bzhugs pa yi/ / rang gi sku yi sbyor ba yis/ / bdag dang gzhan la mchod par gyis/ /
The essential nature of reflexive awareness is offered to you and others through the union of your own kāya, which abides in the ten directions and three times.
oM badzra sa ma ya hoH
oṃ vajra samaya hoḥ

rdor dril 'khyud rgyas gzung du gzhug / rig pa thams cad bde stong ye shes su shar ba thugs kyi dam tshig / sgra thams cad skye ba med pa gsung gi dam tshig / snang ba thams cad lha sku phyag rgya chen por shes pa sku'i dam tshig go /

Have them hold the vajra and ghaṇṭā with the embracing mudrā. All awareness arising as the wisdom of bliss-emptiness is the samaya of mind. All sounds being unborn is the samaya of speech. All appearances being recognized as mahāmudrā, forms of the deities, is the samaya of body.

slar yang thugs ka'i 'od zer gyis rigs lnga spyan drangs pas bum chus dbang bskur bar mos shig / phung po lnga po rnam dgag ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin gyis/ / dug lnga rnam dag rigs lnga yi/ / rdo rje chu yi= dbang gi sngags lnga po brjod/

Again, light rays from your heart invite the five families. Feel that the abhiṣeka is bestowed by the vase water. The nature of the five wisdoms— the cessation of the five skandhas— bestows the abhiṣeka of the vajra water of the five families, the purities of the five poisons. Recite the five mantras of the abhiṣekas.
chus lus gang / dri ma dag / mi bskyod pas dbur brgyan par gyur te/ dbang gi (455) lhas me tog gi char phab/ rol mo'i sgra bsgrags ta khams gsum chos kyi rgyal por mnga' gsol bar gyur/

The water fills your body, purifies your stains, and you are crowned by Akṣobhya. {455} The abhiṣeka deities cause a rain of flowers to fall and the sounds of music to resound. You are installed as a dharma sovereign of the three realms.
oM su pra tiSh+Tha badzrA ya swA hA/
oṃ supratiṣṭha vajrāya svāhā
mchod pa lngas mchod pa'i mos pas/ dus 'di nyid nas bzung nas ni/ / 'khor ba'i nyes pas ma gos par/ / mchod pa kun dang ldan pa la/ / dus gsum du ni bde bar rol/
By imagining a presentation of the five offerings, from this time on, without being tainted by the flaws of saṃsāra, you will revel in pleasure with all the offerings throughout the three times.
zhes gdams/
Thus, instruct them.
bla ma'i bka' mi bcag pa dang / / gsang ba 'di gzhan la mi bshad pa dang / / dam tshig thams cad bsrung bar bya'o/ / zhes gdams pa la/ slob mas kyang / gtso bos ji ltar sogs lan gsum/ /

Do not go against the guru’s word. Do not explain these secrets to others, and preserve all the samayas. Thus, instruct them. The disciples say: Whatever the principal one commands, [all that I will do.] Three times.
ngo bo nyid kyis sems can rnams/ / ji lta ji ltar 'dul 'gyur zhing / / de lta de ltar chags la sogs/ / dri med sems can don bya'o/ /
Through the essential nature, sentient beings will be tamed appropriately, and without the stains of desire and the rest, stainless sentient beings are benefited.
lung bstan pa ni/
[c.] The Prophecy
bla ma'i phyag g.yas spyi bor bzhag la/
With their right hand placed on the top of [the disciple’s] head, the guru says:
'di yis dbang bskur gyur pa ni/ / bsngags pa 'gro ba kun gyi bdag /bla na med pa'i byang chub tu/ / bde bar gshegs pas lung bstan to/ / dkyil 'khor bzang po 'dir dbang bskur ba ni/ /
This has conferred the abhiṣeka. You will be praised, a lord of all beings. The sugatas have prophesized your unsurpassable awakening.
dkyil 'khor thams cad du dbang bskur ba yin cing / gang dag rdo rje slob dpon gyis lung bstan pa de la/ phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas byang sems kyis kyang mgrin gcig tu lung bstan par mos shig /

Receiving the abhiṣeka in this excellent maṇḍala is to receive the abhiṣeka for all maṇḍalas. Feel that whoever receives a prophecy from the vajrācārya receives a prophecy from the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions simultaneously.
de nas rjes gnang rnams las
[d.] The Authorizations
brtul zhugs kyi
The authorization for discipline.
rjes gnang ni slob ma dang rgyan drug bsang sbyang /
Cleanse and purify the disciples and the six ornaments.
stong pa'i ngang las khyed rnams he ru ka zhal gcig phyag gnyis yum dang bcas pa'i skur gyur/
Within emptiness, you become the form of the Heruka, with one face, two arms, and consort.
'khor lo hU~M las badzra he ru ka yab yum/ rna cha hrIHlas pad+ma= mgul rgyan trA~M las rat+na= gdu bu oM las bud+d+ha= ske rags AHlas karma= thal chen hU~M las rdo rje sems dpa' he ru ka yab yum/

The cakra, from hūṃ, is Vajraheruka, male and female consorts. The earrings, from hrīḥ, are Padma…. The necklace, from trāṃ, is Ratna…. The bracelets, from oṃ, are Buddha…. The skirt, from āḥ, is Karma…. The great ashes, from hūṃ, are Vajrasattva Heruka, male and female consorts.
thugs ka'i 'od kyis rigs lnga rdor sems dang bcas pa spyan drangs/ gnyis su med par thim/ rang rigs kyis dbur brgyan/ zhu ba las rgyan drug tu gyur pa khyed rnams la byin par mos shig /

Light from their hearts invites the five families with Vajrasattva. They dissolve, becoming nondual [with the five Herukas], who are crowned by their respective family. They melt and become the six ornaments. Feel that they are presented to you.

'khor lo'i tshul gyis mi bskyod pa/ / rna (456)cha'i bdag nyid 'od dpag med/ / mgul gyi phreng ba rin chen 'byung / / lag gdub rnam par snang mdzad de/ / ske rags la ni don yod grub/ / yan lag kun la rdo rje 'dzin/ zhes sbyin/

The state of the cakra is Akṣobhya. {456} The embodiment of the earrings is Amitābha. The necklace garland is Ratnasambhava. The bracelets are Vairocana. The skirt is Amoghasiddhi. All the limbs are Vajradhara. Thus, give them the ornaments.
kha T+wAM ga /Da ma ru/ ka pA la he ru ka yab yum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa byin te/
Give them the khaṭvāṃga, ḍamaru, and kapāla, which have become of the natures of the male and female consorts.
kha T+wAM gzugs la shes rab ste/ / thabs kyi gzugs ni cang te'u nyid/ / ka pA la ni At+t+ras bkang / / thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa/ / dpa' bo chen pos gzung bar gyis/ /
The form of the khaṭvāṃga is prajñā. The form of method is the changteu. The kapāla is filled with antra.[5] Method and prajñā are inseparable. Great warriors, take these.
mchod pa'i rjes gnang ni/
The authorization for offerings.
AHsgeg mo/ / oM phreng ba ma/ gI glu ma/ hoHgar ma/ AHbdug spos ma/ b+h+rU~M me tog ma/ pra mar me ma/ gi dri chab ma ste mchod pa'i rjes gnang ngo / /

Āḥ is the lady of grace, oṃ is the lady of garlands, gī is the lady of songs, hoḥ is the lady of dance, āḥ is the lady of incense, bhrūṃ is the lady of flowers, pra is the lady of lamps, and gi is the lady of scented water. This is the authorization for offerings.
sems can gyi don byed pa'i rjes gnang ni/
The authorization for benefiting sentient beings.
mig thur gyis rab rib bsal bar mos/ ji ltar mig mkhan rgyal po yis/ / 'jig rten ling tog bsal ba ltar/ / bu khyod kyi ni mi shes pa'i/ / ling tog rgyal ba rnams kyis bsal/ /
Feel that the eye spoon removes eye diseases. Just as a king who is an eye expert can remove the eye diseases of the world, the victors remove the cataracts that are your unknowing, child.
oM badzra nai tra a pa ha ra pa Ta laM hrIHprAM/
oṃ vajra naitra apahara paṭalaṃ hrīḥ prāṃ
chos thams cad me long nang gi gzugs brnyan ltar shes par gyis shig / me long bstan la/
Recognize that all phenomena are like images reflected in a mirror. Show them a mirror and say:
chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste/ / gsal zhing dag la rnyog pa med/ / gzung du med cing brjod du med/ / rgyu dang las las kun tu 'byung / /
All phenomena are like reflections: clear, pure, and unsullied. They cannot be grasped or described. They arise from causes and karma.
ngo bo nyid med gnas med pa/ / de ltar chos rnams shes gyis la/ / sems can don ni mnyam med byos/ / 'on kyang skyob pa'i sras su skye/ /
They have no essence and no abode. Know all phenomena to be that way. Perform unequaled benefit for others. Continue to take birth as a child of the Protector.

chos thams cad dril bu'i sgra ltar shes par gyis shig / dril bu dkrol la/ thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de/ / nam mkha' la ni mtshan nyid med/ / nam mkha' dang ni mnyam sbyor bas/ / kun mchog mnyam pa nyid du gsal/ /

Recognize that all phenomena are like the sounds of a ghaṇṭā. Play the ghaṇṭā and say: Everything is of the characteristic of space. Space has no characteristics. Uniting with space, [everything] is clear as all-supreme equality.[6]

mda' gzhu gtad pa phyogs drug tu 'phangs tshul byas te 'di nyid rjes zlos byar gzhug / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang rjes su chags par bya'o/ / rang sems me long nang gi rdo rje ltar rdo rje sems dpar shes par gyis shig / rdo rje dang bcas pa'i me long bstan la/

Give them a bow and arrow, have them thrust it in the six directions, and repeat the following: I will be impassioned with all the tathāgatas. Recognize your mind to be Vajrasattva, like a vajra reflected in a mirror. Show a mirror with a vajra and say: {457}
rdo rje sems (457) dpa' me long ltar/ / gsal zhing dag la rnyog pa med/ / bu khyod kyi ni snying la zhugs/ / rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin gtso/
Like Vajrasattva in a mirror, clear, pure, and unsullied, the principal one, the nature of Vajrasattva, resides in your heart, child.
chos bshad pa'i rjes gnang ni/
The authorization for explaining the dharma.
pu sti 'khor lo dung rnams byin la/ deng nas brtsams te sems bskyed pa/ / dri med kun tu gang bar gyis/ / sngags spyod tshul gyi cho ga yis/ / skye bo rnams la rtag tu shod/ /
Give them a pusti, cakra, and conch and say: From now on, arouse bodhicitta. Fill with what is always stainless. With the rituals of Mantra practices, always teach beings.
de ltar byas na sangs rgyas la/ / phan 'dogs drin du gzo zhes bya/ / rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun yang / / khyod la rtag tu srung bar mdzad/ /
If you do that, it is said you repay the kindness and benefit of the buddhas. All the vajra holders will always protect you.
rigs lnga'i sprul bshad kyi rjes gnang ni/
The authorization for explaining the emanations of the five families.
rigs lnga so so'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas so so'i phyag rgya 'ching mdzod/ /
With the pride of each of the five families, you are bound with each of their mudrās.
sems can kun la thams cad du/ / sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir/ / ji ltar sna tshogs 'dul 'gyur ba'i/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ /
For sentient beings, everywhere and always, in order to benefit all of them, turn the wheel of the dharma, which will tame them according to their myriad ways.
rdo rje'i 'khor lo= rin chen 'khor lo= pad+ma'i 'khor lo= sna tshogs 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ /
Turn the vajra wheel. Turn the ratna wheel. Turn the padma wheel. Turn the myriad wheel.
slob ma lha la 'bul ba ni/ /
Offering the disciples to the deities.
sngags dang phyag rgya 'dzin gyur pa'i/ / slob ma 'di ni 'bul ba lags/
Disciples who are holders of Mantra and mudrās are offered.
dbugs dbyung ba ni/
The confirmation.
mchog tu gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor 'dir/ / btsud pa dang ni mthong ba yis/ / de ring sdig las rnam grol 'gyur/ / de ring khyed rnams bde bar gnas/ /
Having been brought into and seen this supremely secret maṇḍala, you are now freed from any evil. Now, you abide in happiness.
bde chen theg pa 'di la ni/ / phyin chad 'chi ba yod ma yin/ / mi thub pa dang mi 'chi bas/ / cis kyang mi 'jigs dga' bar gyis/ /
Hereafter, in this yāna of great bliss there is no death. Since there is no subduing and no death, be joyful with no fear at all.
srid pa shin tu dag pas na/ / srid pa'i ngan 'gro rnams las bton/ /
Once existence is fully purified, you will leave the negative states of existence.
gzengs bstod pa ni/
The assurance.
khams gsum kun gyi rgyal srid che/ / dpal ldan yon tan 'byung ba'i gnas/ / bdud tshogs kun las nges rgyal te/ / grong khyer mchog tu zhugs pa yin/ /
In the great kingdom of the three realms, the source of all glorious virtues, you will definitely be victorious over Māra and enter the supreme city.
nan tan du gdams pa ni/
Instructions for application.
rtag tu rang gi dam tshig bsrung / / rtag tu de bzhin gshegs pa mchod/ / rtag tu bla ma la yang dbul/ / 'di ni sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam/ /
Always preserve your samaya. Always offer to the tathāgatas. Always offer to the gurus too. This is the same as all buddhas. {458}
e.
[e. The Abhiṣeka of the Uncommon Body Maṇḍala]
de nas thun mong ma yin pa lus dkyil gyi dbang ni/
The abhiṣeka of the uncommon body maṇḍala.

khyed rang rnams 'khor lo bde mchog tu (458) gsal ba'i thugs kar 'khor lo sdom pa lha lnga/ rnal 'byor ma bzhi thod pa bum pa dang bcas pa/ lus kyi gnas nyer bzhir dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma/ yan lag bzhi dang mig gnyis rna ba gnyis rnams su sgo mtshams ma brgyad de lus dkyil 'khor lo lnga'i lha tshogs drug cu rtsa gnyis gsal bar gyur/ bla ma'i sku'i 'khor lo lnga las re re chad de khyed rnams kyi lha rnams la thim par gyur/ 'khor lo lnga'i lha tshogs de dag las 'od zer sna tshogs dpag tu med pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab par 'phros te/ snod kyi 'jig rten dag pa lha'i gzhal yas khang du byas/ bcud kyi sems can lha dang lha mo'i dam par byas nas thams cad kyang he ru ka'i go 'phang la bkod cing / de dag kyang 'od dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin du byas nas rang la thim/ rang yang 'khor lo lnga'i lha tshogs la thim/

You appear clearly as Cakrasaṃvara. In your heart are the five deities of Cakrasaṃvara, the four yoginīs, with the vases and skull cups. In the twenty-four places of your body are the heroes and yoginīs. At your four limbs, two eyes, and two ears are the eight female gatekeepers. The sixty-two deities of the five cakras appear clearly as the body maṇḍala. From the five cakras of the guru’s body, each deity replicates and dissolves into your deities. Immeasurable multicolored light rays from the assembly of deities of the five cakras radiates, pervading all the realms of the world. The world, which is the environment, is purified and becomes a palace of deities. Sentient beings, who are the inhabitants, become forms of gods and goddesses. All are established on the level of the Heruka. They all become of the nature of light and dissolve into you. You dissolve into the deities of the five cakras.

'khor lo lnga po'ang rim gyis bde mchog yab yum la thim/ bde mchog kyang rim gyis 'dus nas thugs ka'i hU~M la thim/ hU~M de yang nam mkha'i dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med du 'od gsal du zhugs par gyur/

The five cakras gradually dissolve into Saṃvara, male and female consorts. Saṃvara gradually dwindles, dissolving into the hūṃ at his heart. That hūṃ enters luminosity, the inseparability of wisdom and the expanse of space.
de'i ngang las zung 'jug gi skur ldangs te/ de'ang he ru ka lha lnga lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi lha tshogs thams cad zung 'jug gi sku sgyu ma lta bur gyur/
From within that state, you arise in the body of unification. The deities who are the sixty-two deities of the body maṇḍala of the five deities of Heruka are the illusion-like body of unification.
sku rdo rje me long du ngo sprad pa ni/
Pointing out the vajra body in a mirror.
bde mchog gi sku gzugs me long la 'char du bcug la bstan te/ rdo rje sems dpa' me long bzhin/ sogs gong bzhin brjod/
Cause an image of Saṃvara to appear in a mirror and show it to them, saying: Like Vajrasattva in a mirror,…[*11] Recite as above.
gsung rdo rje brjod med du ngo sprad pa ni/
Pointing out vajra speech to be inexpressible is as follows:
dril bu dkrol te/
Play a ghaṇṭā and say:
thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de sogs gong ltar brjod/ thugs rdo rje rtog med du ngo sprad pa ni/ rdo rje rtse lnga pa bstan te/
Everything is of the characteristic of space.[*12] Recite as above. Pointing out vajra mind to be nonconceptual. Show a five-pointed vajra and say:
hU~M/ ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin nyid/ / stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa/ / skye med chos kyi rdo rje 'di/ / khyod kyi snying la yang dag zhugs/ /
hūṃ The nature of the five wisdoms, the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, this vajra of unborn phenomena truly abides in your heart.
de nas rtogs pa brjod pa ni/ /
Announcing the realization. {459}
de ltar dkyil 'khor bzhi las bla ma'i sku lus (459) la brten nas bum pa'i dbang thob/ lam bskyed pa'i rim pa nang lus dkyil bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu sprul sku 'grub pa'i skal pa can du byas so/ /

Thus, among the four maṇḍalas, you have received the vase abhiṣeka on the basis of the body of the guru. You are empowered to meditate on the inner body maṇḍala, the generation process of the path. You have become a fortunate one who will achieve the nirmāṇakāya as the result.
gnyis pa gsang ba'i dbang ni/
2. The Secret Abhiṣeka
gsol 'debs rjes zlos/ khyod zhabs pad+mo'i bka' drin gyis/ / bdag gis bla med bya ba thob/ / de phyir gsang ba'i dbang gis ni/ / mgon pos rjes su bzung bar mdzod/ lan gsum/ mig dar bcing /

Repeat the following supplication: Through the kindness of you with lotus feet, I will attain what is highest. Therefore, with the secret abhiṣeka, Protector, please guide me. Three times. Tie the blindfold.

bla ma he ru ka yum bcas snyoms par zhugs pa'i dga' ba'i sgra dang / 'od kyis dpa' bo dpa' mo spyan drangs/ thugs kar zhu/ sku'i dbyibs brgyud de sbyor mtshams nas babs pa khyed rnams la byin par mos/

The lights and sounds of joy of the guru Heruka, male and female consorts in union, invoke the heroes and heroines. Feel that they dissolve into their hearts, flow through the shapes of their bodies, and, falling from their place of union, come to you.
ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyis/ / sngon chad sras ni dbang bskur ltar/ / de bzhin du ni byang chub sems/ / bzang pos bu khyod dbang bskur ro/ / zhes bdud rtsi sbyin/
Just as the past buddhas previously bestowed abhiṣeka on their children, excellent bodhicitta will bestow abhiṣeka on you, child. Give them amṛta, saying:
a ho ma hA su kha/ zhes brjod pas myong /
aho mahāsukha Have them taste it.

lus kun dang a wa d+hU ti gang bar gyur pas gsal stong rang byung gi ye shes bskyed par mos/ mig dar 'gro la/ de ltar gsang dbang thob pas rig stong gi nyams skyes/ ngag gi dri ma dag / gtum mo bsgom pa la dbang / 'bras bu longs sku 'grub pa'i skal pa can du byas so/ /

Feel that through your entire body and avadhūti being filled, self-arisen wisdom, clarity-emptiness, arises. Remove their blindfolds. Thus, having received the secret abhiṣeka, the experience of awareness-emptiness has arisen. Your stains of speech are purified. You are empowered to meditate on caṇḍālī. You have become a fortunate one who will achieve the saṃbhogakāya as the result.
gsum pa shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ni/
3. The Prajnājnāna Abhiṣeka
gsol 'dabs rjes zlos/ byang chub rdo rje sangs rgyas la/ / mchod chen ji ltar stsal ba bzhin/ / bdag kyang skyob pa'i don gyi phyir/ / nam mkha'i rdo rje deng bdag stsol/ gsum/ mig dar 'ching /

Repeat the following supplication: Just as Bodhivajra made the greatest of offerings to the Buddha, for the sake of protecting me, please grant me the vajra space today. Three times. Tie the blindfold.
khyed rnams he ru ka zhal phyag yongs rdzogs su bsgoms pa'i gsang gnas hU~M las rdo rjer gyur/ yum las sprul pa'i rig ma mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i mkha' AHlas pad+mar gyur pa nyid byin te/

Meditate upon yourselves as being the Heruka, complete with face and arms. In your secret place, from hūṃ, is a vajra. The vidyā emanated from the female consort is complete with all the characteristics. In her space, from āḥ, is a lotus. She is given to you.
dga' ster gnas ster lha mo ni/ / sna tshogs gzugs can yid 'ong ma/ / khyer cig khyer cig sems dpa' che/ / khyer la mchod pa dag tu gyis/ /
The goddess who bestows joy and bestows its source, pleasing lady of myriad forms, take her, take her, mahāsattva. Take her and always worship her. {460}
lha mo (460) des kyang /
That goddess says:
e ma nga yi pad+ma 'di/ / bde ba thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas/ / gal te cho ga bzhin bsten na/ / de yi mdun na bdag 'dug ste/ /
E ma—this lotus of mine is the source of all bliss. If you attend to the ritual correctly, I will be there in its presence.
