['di] la gsum ste/ thod pa la sbyang ba dang / bom pa la sbyang ba dang / srog chags kyi ro la sbyang ba'o/ /
This has three sections: (1) training with a skull cup, (2) training with inanimate matter, and (3) training with a corpse of an animal.
dang po
1. Training with a Skull Cup
['di] la gnyis te/ rten ling+ga bca' ba dang / brten pa'i las sbyor bya ba'o/ /
This has two components: (1) setting up the liṅga as the support and (2) the application of activities for the supported.
dang po ni/
a. Setting Up the Liṅga as the Support

thod pa mtshan ldan gyi nang du rtsi nag pos byug / dbus su rdo rgyus kyis hU~M mgo rang la bstan pa bri/ (531)dar dmar pos kha gcad/ gnas dben par maN+Dal gru bzhi pa byi dor byas pa'i dkyil du stegs kyi khar thod pa rnal 'byor pa'i shar du bstan la gzhag go /

Anoint the inside of an authentic skull cup with black resin. In its center, with chalk inscribe a hūṃ whose head faces toward you. {531} Cover that with red silk. In an isolated place, in the center of a clean square maṇḍala, place the skull cup on top of a stand, facing to the east of the yogins or yoginīs.[72]
gnyis pa brten pa'i las sbyor bya ba ni/
b. The Application of Activities for the Supported

skyabs 'gro sems bskyed bya/ bla ma yi dam spyan drangs la gsol ba gdab/ de nas rlung gzung / hU~M dang rnam shes tha dad med pa d+hU ti'i nang nas mar song / gsang gnas su byung / 'og rlung drag tu 'then pas hU~M de d+hU ti nas yar byung / sna bug g.yas na thod pa'i kha'i dar la thal gyis song nas/ thod nang hU~M la tim gyis thim pa la shes pa shi ma shi med par gtad la/ rlung tshur bzlog tu mi 'jug par yun ring du gzhag /srog gi rgyun pa thag lta bu bsgom/

Take refuge and arouse bodhicitta. Invite the gurus and yidams, and supplicate them. Then, control your winds. Hūṃ and your consciousness, undifferentiated, go down inside your avadhūti, arriving at your secret place. Drawing up your lower wind forcefully, that hūṃ rises in your avadhūti. It goes out your right nostril and reaches the silk covering the skull cup. It dissolves completely into the hūṃ inside the skull cup. Focus on your mind, which neither dies nor does not die. Without allowing your breath to return, remain for a long time. Meditate on the continuity of your life force as being like a gossamer thread.

de ltar sbyangs pas dang po thod pa la drod tsha 'ur ngo 'ong / de nas dud pa lta bu sngo phyur phyur ba 'ong / tsag tsag pa'i skad 'ong / dar de yang 'gul 'gul bteg bteg nam mkha' la lding gis 'gro/ thod pa de'ang dum bur 'gro ba 'ong / bskyed rim brtan cing gtum mo 'byongs na 'dis nges par 'grub bo/ /

By training in that way, first the skull cup will become hot and rumble. Then it will billow with blue [light], like smoke. It will make the sound tsak tsak. The silk will quiver, rise up, and float off into space. That skull cup will fall apart. If your generation-process practice is stable and you have mastered caṇḍālī, this will definitely be achieved.[73]
gnyis pa bem po la sbyang ba ni/
2. Training with Inanimate Matter
bal 'dab bam/ ras kyi dum bu'am/ phying pa mtho skor la sogs pa la sngar ltar byas pas drod dang 'phar g.yo 'byung ngo / /
Do the same as before with some wool, a piece of cotton, a section of felt, or the like. [The cloth] will become warm, rise up, and move.[74]
gsum pa sems can gyi ro la sbyang ba ni/
3. Training with a Corpse of an Animal

lu gu la sogs pa sems can gang yang rung ba'i rol bya ste/ ro'i kha rang la bstan/ rang gi rnam shes hU~M dang dbyer med sna bug g.yas nas thon ro'i sna bug g.yon du zhugs nas de'i snying nang du hU~M la rig pa gtad/ bya'i ro yin na the gu btags la phur ba la brtod/ rtags ni mtshan khung du drod yong / de nas lus kun la yong / de nas 'gul ba dang 'dar ba yong / de'i dus su dran pa stor 'kho bas nyams myong can gyis tshod bya'o/ /

Take any available corpse of a sentient being, such as a lamb. The mouth of the corpse should face toward you. Your consciousness, inseparable from hūṃ, goes out your right nostril and enters the left nostril of the corpse. Direct your awareness to the hūṃ in the heart of that corpse. If it is a corpse of a bird, fasten a thin rope to it, and tie that to a stake. The signs are as follows: The armpits [of the corpse], then its whole body, will become warm. Next, it will shake and tremble. At that point, you will lose consciousness. With those experiences, you will measure up.[75] {532}
gnyis pa 'jug byed rten (532) gyi gnad kyis gang 'dod du 'phang ba
B. Using the Vital Points of the Supports (the Means for Entering) to Send You Where You Wish
['di] la gnyis/ shel gyi 'ben gzugs pa dang / hU~M gi mda' 'phang ba'o/ /
This has two parts: (1) setting up the crystal target and (2) shooting the arrow of hūṃ.
dang po ni/
1. Setting Up the Crystal Target

rgas pa dang / mdze pho dang / dbang po ma tshang ba la sogs pa'i ro ma yin pa dang / na so gzhon pa dang / rigs bzang ba dang / gcong nad med pa dang / rma med pa dang / ma rul ba/ ma sum pa/ glo bur du shi ba'i ro btsal la bur chu dang sug chus bkru/ dri bzang byug gos bskon/ rgyan btags/ maN+Dal gyi steng du skyil krung bzhag skra yod na brtod/ med na brten par bya/ ro de kha shar du bstan no/ /

A corpse that is elderly, of a leper, without complete sense facilities, or the like is not the one. Seek a corpse that is young, of good family, without a chronic disease, not wounded, not decomposing, not rotting, and has died suddenly. Wash it with sweet water and cardamom water.[76] Anoint it with scented water, put clothes on it, attach ornaments, and place it cross-legged on top of a maṇḍala. If it has hair, tether it using that; if it does not, prop it up. The corpse should face east.[77]
gnyis pa hU~M gi mda' 'phang ba ni/
2. Shooting the Arrow of Hūṃ

rang dkyil 'khor gyi shar du kha nub tu bltas te 'dug / sems bskyed/ rang rje btsun mar bsgom/ / bka' brgyud spyan drangs la gsol ba gdab/ ro de bla ma yi dam dbyer med du bskyed la/ snga ma ltar ro'i snying gar hU~M bsams la/ rang gi shes pa hU~M la bsdus la/ sna bug g.yas pa nas bton la/ ro'i sna bug g.yon pa nas song te snying ga'i hU~M la bstim mo/ /

You should be to the east of the maṇḍala, facing west. Arouse bodhicitta and meditate upon yourself as the Jetsunma. Invite the Kagyu lineage and supplicate them. Visualize that corpse as inseparable from the guru and yidam. As before, visualize a hūṃ in the corpse’s heart. Your mind gathers into hūṃ. It goes out your right nostril and enters the left nostril of the corpse, dissolving into the hūṃ at its heart.[78]
gsum pa mthun rkyen grogs kyi gnad kyis rnam shes gsal gdab pa
C. Using the Vital Points of Friends (the Conducive Conditions) to Clarify Your Consciousness
['di] la gsum ste/ sgras brjed bskul bya dang / zas kyis drod bskyed pa dang / mi ldog par bya ba'i phyir ro ring du 'phang ba'o/ /
This has three parts: (1) being reminded through sounds, (2) arousing heat with food, and (3) taking the corpse far away in order not to return.
dang po ni/
1. Being Reminded through Sounds

grogs blo brtan pa gcig la grong 'jug gi rog bcol/ ro de 'gul ba dang / mig hrig pa dang / rngam pa ha zer ba dang / rna ba g.yas nas gsang mtshan nas 'bod/ khyod grong 'jug byas pa yin no/ / zhes dran pa gso/

Entrust the assistance for entering a body to a friend with a stable mind. When that corpse starts shaking, rolling its eyes, and shouting ha forcefully, they should call your secret name in its right ear and refresh your memory for you, saying, “You are entering a body.”[79]
gnyis pa ni/
2. Arousing Heat with Food
gos me'am nyi ma la bsros la bskon/ sha drod la bcar/ bur chang dron mo blud/ sngar gyi ro dang gnyis gyi bar du bsgrib bo/ /

[Your friends should do the following:] Warm clothes by a fire or in the sun and put them on [the body]. Warm its flesh. Pour warm sweet beer on it. Place a screen between the previous corpse and the second one.[80]
gsum pa ni/
3. Taking the Corpse Far Away in Order Not to Return
gtam sgad na bag tsam smra shes pa dang / lus rnying pa de gsar pas mi mthong ba'i sar drag shul dang bcas pas (533)bskyar bar bya'o/ / de lta bu'i lus des mchog bsgrub la gzhan don bya'o/ /

Even though your speech [may be unclear,] you will know how to speak. The old body should be taken to a place where the new one cannot see it and be left there. {533} With your new body, you will be able to achieve great things and benefit others.[*31]

de lta bu'i grong 'jug sbyang bar byed pa la/ steng 'og gi rlung la dbang thob pa dang / / bskyed rim brtan pas bya'i/ / gzhan gyis 'jug par mi 'gyur ro/ / de phyir sbyang ba gnyis la 'bad par bya'o/ /

To be able to do that kind of entering a body, you must have mastery of your upper and lower winds and have a stable generation-process practice. Others will not be able to do it. Thus, you should exert yourself in the two trainings.

grong 'jug sbrul lpags 'dor byed kyi gdams ngag gi/ / steng sgo rnam grol chos drug go / bla ma mkha' 'gro'i gsung bzhin du/ / snya nam grod phug dgon pa ru/ / rdo rje rgyal mtshan brtse bas bris/ / mi la ras pas/ ras chung rdo rje grags pa la gtad pa rdzogs so// //

Those are the instructions on entering a body, the shedding of a snake’s skin.[81] [These instructions on] the six dharmas, which liberate through the upper door, were written according to the teachings of the guru and Ḍākinī at the hermitage of Drö Puk in Nyanam by Dorje Gyaltsen with love. This completes what Milarepa entrusted to Rechung Dorje Drakpa. ithi
rgya rgya rgya/ ! /
Sealed. Sealed. Sealed.[82]
bde mchog snyan brgyud kyi gtum mo dang thabs lam gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhugs so/ /
33. Trulkhors for the Path of Method and the Caṇḍālī of the Sam. vara Aural Transmission[1]
na mo gu ru de wa DA ki nI/
namo guru deva ḍākinī [3]

rtsa mdud grol dang gegs sel gnad kyi mchog / lus kyi nad gdon ma lus sel bar byed/ / sems kyi ye shes ngo bo 'phrod par byed/ / rdzu 'phrul yon tan ma lus ster bar byed/ / bde chen thig le'i lus su 'gyur ba'i phyir/ / rdo rje'i tshig rkang legs par bshad pa'i don/ / rtsa ba drug la yan lag so dgu yi/ / snyan brgyud 'khrul 'khor gsal ba'i me long bkod/ /

The supreme vital points for freeing the channel knots and dispelling hindrances— what clear away all physical illnesses and spirits, confer recognition of the essence of the mind’s wisdom, bestow all magical powers and excellent qualities,[4] and develop the body of great bliss bindus— are the meaning clearly taught in the Vajra Verses, presented here in the Clear Mirror: Trulkhors of the Aural Transmission, with its six roots and thirty-nine branches.[5] (1–8)
thog mar rnal 'byor sprul sku'i lus bya zhing / / bdud rtsi bcud kyi rdzas ni lus la byung / gsum pa skyabs 'gro bzhi pa sems bskyed bya/ / yid bzhin nor bu spyi bo'i gtsug gi rgyan/ /

First, yogins and yoginīs, perform the ablution of the nirmāṇakāya. [Second,] rub amṛta, elixir substances, on your body.[6] Third, go for refuge and arouse bodhicitta. Adorn the crown of your head with the wish-fulfilling gem.[7] (9–12)
srog rtsol longs sku'i chings ni brtan par bya/ / chos sku de bzhin nyid ni phrad byas shing / / 'dzam gling rlung gi rkyal ba 'bud par bya/ / srog rtsol mnan la thur sel gyen la 'then/ /

Stabilize prāṇāyāma, the binding of the saṃbhogakāya. Contemplate the subtleties of the dharmakāya, thusness. Inflate the bag of Jambudvīpa winds. Press down with prāṇāyāma and draw up the downward-expelling wind.[8] (13–16)
ro snyoms gar gyi 'khrul 'khor bskor ba ci/ / bde chen rtsa ba'i 'khor lo rnam drug la/ /
In the trulkhor set of the dance of equal taste there are six root cakras [or trulkhors] of great bliss.[9] (17–18)
seng ge rtse ba skyil krung bca'/ / lag gnyis bsnol la rkang la 'dus/ / gyen la 'then la klod par bya/ / de yis thig le 'dzin (534)par byed/ /
Playful lion. Sit cross-legged. Cross your arms and grasp your feet. Draw up, then relax. That will retain the bindus.[10] (20–23) {534}
glang chen 'gying pa'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / rkang gnyis bar du mkhyid gang bzhag / lag g.yon steng du lag g.yas gzhag / 'phong dang byin mjug lan dgu brdab/ / thig le gyen la 'dren par byed/ /

Pose of an elephant trulkhor. Place your feet a hand’s width apart. Rest your right hand on top of your left hand. Strike your buttocks and the backs of your calves nine times. That will draw up the bindus.[11] (24–28)
rma bya 'phur pa'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / lag gnyis rkang pa'i mthe bong bzung / / 'phongs dang rting pa re mos brdung / / thig le lus la khroms par byed/ /
Soaring peacock trulkhor. Hold your big toes with your hands. Strike your heels and buttocks in a series. That will spread the bindus in your body.[12] (29–32)
stag mo skyug pa'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / skyil krung bar du lag gnyis bcug / ro stod bsnyegs shing skyug tshul dgu/ / de yis thig le 'dzin par byed/ /
Vomiting tigress trulkhor. Place your hands between your crossed legs. Stretch up your upper body and imitate vomiting, nine times. That will retain the bindus.[13] (33–36)
ru sbal bskum pa'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / rkang gnyis bar du khru gang gzhag / lag gnyis brla yi nang nas ni/ / phyir la bton la rkang theb bzung / / thig le gyen la 'dren par byed/ /
Contractions of a tortoise trulkhor. Place your feet a cubit apart. Bring your arms from within your thighs to the outside and grasp your big toes. That will draw the bindus upward.[14] (37–41)
bya rgod 'phur ba'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / rkang pa 'theng 'gros re mos bya/ / lag pa phyogs bcur sprug cig 'khrab/ / de yis thig le khrems par byed/ /
Soaring vulture trulkhor. Alternate a crippled posture with your legs. Shake and flap your arms in the ten directions. That will spread the bindus.[15] (42–45)
'khrul 'khor 'di rnams byed pa'i tshe/ / chu mig gyen bzlog dar chen phyar/ / rgya mtsho brag gtad ri rab bsnyings/ / khar bar dag tu seng sbrug bya/ /
When doing those trulkhors, turn the springs up, raise the great flag, bring the ocean to the rock, and stretch Meru. From time to time, do the shaking of a lion.[16] (46–49)
ngal gso mnyam bzhag phyag rgya bya/ / de yis thig le brtan par 'gyur/ / rlung mkhris bad kan 'dus pa yi/ / nad rnams ma lus 'byung mi 'gyur/ /
Take a break, do the mudrā of resting in equipoise. That will stabilize the bindus. None of the many illnesses— wind, bile, phelgm, or combined—will arise.[17] (50–53)
rtsa mdud rags pa grol par 'gyur/ / thig le gdon gyis 'dzag pa dang / / nad kyis 'dzag dang rkyen gyis 'dzag / rang bzhin 'dzag pa gcod par byed/ /
The coarse channel knots will be freed. Bindus being released by spirits, being released by illness, being released by conditions, and being released naturally stop.[18] (54–57)
las dang nyams grib ma gtogs pa/ / thig la mthur rgyug btsan thabs ldog / dmigs pa bla ma'i zhal las dril/ / nyin re ma chags nyams su blang / /

Except in cases of karma and contamination by impaired [samaya], the quick descent of bindus is reversed by forceful means. The visualizations are learned from the guru’s oral instructions. Practice every day without interruption.[19] (58–61)
yan lag 'khrul 'khor so dgu la/ / rgyal mtshan 'khrud pa yan lag bzhi/ / 'khrud pa ltar bya khyab bar byug / spa lus rtse ba sel bar byed/ /
The thirty-nine branch trulkhors.[*1] There are the four branches of washing the victory banner. Act as if you were washing: rub all over. That dispels the “play” of the small body hairs.[20] (62–65)
ri rab 'khrul 'khor rnam bzhi la/ / sprul mnye (535)mgo bo 'khrud ltar mnye/ / nyes gnyis gang yin mgo nad sel/ / zo chun rke mjing g.yas g.yon bskor/ / gre ba rke mjing nad rnams sel/ /

There are the four trulkhors of Meru.[21] {535} Massaging the snake. Massage your head as if you were washing it. Head ailments and any of the three flaws will be dispelled. The water-bucket wheel. Rotate your neck, clockwise and counterclockwise. That dispels all illnesses related to the throat and neck.[22] (66–70)
gso ba khri mon ri rab ni/ / phyogs bzhir lan grangs gsum gsum brdab/ / mgo bo'i nad dang sna nad sel/ /
Imprisoning the shoulder blades. [On] Meru,[23] strike in the four directions, three and three, many times. That dispels illnesses in the head and illnesses of the nose. (71–73)
chu mig phyogs bcur ther tshugs blta/ / mig nad rab rib ma lus sel/ / 'on long 'gog dang ro mi tshor/ / sba ba gnyer ma mi 'byung zhing / / mgo bo'i rtsa mdud grol bar byed/ /

Springs. Look directly in the ten directions.[24] That dispels eye diseases and visual distortions. It stops deafness and blindness, and prevents the loss of taste, goiters, and wrinkles. The channel knots in the head will be freed.[25] (74–78)
de rjes ljon shing 'khrul 'khor bzhi/ / ri gsum rkang pa mgo lag gsum/ / shes tshad gyen bsgreng dpung khar len/ / rtsibs log gzer ba'i nad rnams sel/ /

Next, there are the four tree trulkhors.[26] Stretching out the three mountains. With the three—your head and arms— draw upward as much as possible, reversing the fronts of your shoulders. That dispels any ailments involving pain of the rib cage.[27] (79–82)
gru gu brkyang ba khru tshur bcang / / dpung pa g.yas g.yon re mos brdung / / dpung nad mdun rgyab gzer ba sel/ /
Stretching out the ball. Make fists and strike your right and left shoulders, alternating. That dispels shoulder illnesses and pains in front and behind.[28] (83–85)
dbang po gang ba lag pa gnyis/ / mda' gzhu 'gengs dang re mos brkyang / / lag pa mi thog na ba dang / / ro stod gzer ba sel bar byed/ /
“Drawing” the senses. With both hands, alternate extending, as if drawing a bow. That dispels the ailment of not being able to raise the arms and pains in the upper body.[29] (86–89)
mthe bong rked pa lag pa g.yas/ / zhags pa 'phen ltar bskor zhing sprug / g.yon pas rgyab tu khu tshur gsum/ / de ltar g.yon du'ang shis par bya/ /
Brandishing the thumbs. With your right hand, circle and wave, like throwing a lasso. Next, throw three fists behind. Know that the same is done on the left.[30] (90–93)
lag pa'i rtsa nad tshigs nad sel/ / sna khrag 'dzag pa sel bar byed/ / zha rengs nad rnams 'byung mi 'gyur/ / ljon shing rtsa mdud grol bar byed/ /
That dispels illnesses of the arm channels and of the joints. It stops nosebleeds. It prevents arthritic ailments. It frees the knots of the channel of the tree.[*2][31] (94–97)
stod kyi 'khrul 'khor rnam bzhi la/ / skar mda' bsnol ba lag pa gnyis/ / dpung gnyis 'jus la g.yas g.yon gcud/ / stod smad tsha grang nad rnams sel/ / mdun rgyab gzer ba sel bar byed/ /

There are the four trulkhors of the upper body.[32] Crossing the stars and arrows. With both hands, take hold of your shoulders and twist right and left. That dispels hot and cold illnesses in the upper and lower body. It dispels pains in front and behind.[33] (98–102)
li ri gtud pa lag pa gnyis/ / re mos 'jus la gyen du brten/ / 'khrug dang glo mchin nad rnams sel/ /
Twisting [as if making a rope of] liri. With both hands, take hold of your elbows, pull them and strike. That dispels [heat] disturbances and the lung and liver illnesses.[34] (103–5)
ri rab gcar la lag pa gnyis/ / rdo rje bsdams la rtse gcig bsgreng / / nu ma g.yas g.yon rkan la brdab/ / brang gi dkyil du lan gcig (536)brdab/ /
Squeezing Meru. With both hands, join them as a vajra and raise the one-point. Strike both your right and left breasts. Strike the center of your chest one time.[35] (106–9) {536}
thur la lan gsum sbrug par bya/ / mtsher nad rtsibs gzer nad dang ni/ / ro stod dgang dang na ba sel/ /
Shake three times downward. That dispels spleen diseases, ailments of rib pain, and fullness and diseases in the upper body.[36] (110–12)
gling bu 'bud pa lag pa g.yon/ / pus mo bkab la lag pa g.yas/ / dpung steng bkab la thur du bslang / / ro stod g.yas g.yon re mos gcud/ /

Blowing the flute. With your left hand covering your knee and your right hand covering the top of your shoulder, stretch up to the side. Twist your upper body right and left, alternating.[37] (113–16)
glo dang 'khrugs rnams ma lus sel/ / snying rlung 'og rlung babs pa sel/ / 'gram 'khrugs skran nad 'byung mi 'gyur/ / stod kyi rtsa mdud grol bar byed/ /

That dispels all types of coughs and [heat] disturbances. It prevents the upper winds falling [to the areas of] the lower winds. It prevents spreading [heat] disturbances and tumor diseases. It frees the channel knots in the upper body.[38] (117–20)
rked pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnam bzhi la/ / rgya mtsho dkrugs shing lte ba bskor/ / ma zhu lte ba'i nad rnams sel/ /
There are the four trulkhors of the waist.[39] Stirring the ocean. Rotate your waist. That dispels all illnesses of stomach indigestion.[40] (121–23)
sgeg mo dgye ba kag lang la/ / lag gnyis rgyab tu shes tshad brkyang / / rked pa dgye log shes tshad bya/ / mkhal nad dbyi mig gzer ba sel/ /

Graceful arching. Rise up suddenly, stretch both your arms behind as much as possible, and arch from your waist as much as you can. That dispels kidney disease and pain in the hip joints.[41] (124–27)
sa bla mnan pa rkang gnyis bsnol/ / lag gnyis bsnol la mthe bong bzung / / gyen du 'then la lhod kyis klod/ / skran dang dmu chu'i nad rnams dang / / chu kha snyir dang bsdams pa sel/ /

Pressing the earth. Cross your legs, cross your arms, and hold your big toes. Draw up, and relax completely. This dispels tumors, “water-swelling” diseases, and urinary incontinence and blockages.[42] (128–32)

sha rkyang sbyar ba 'dzub mo bsnol/ / spyi gtsug bteg nas lte bar brdab/ / lto bar thal mos nyed par bya/ / skran dang dmu chu rked pa'i nad/ / tsha grang srin nad ma lus sel/ / rked pa'i rtsa mdud grol bar byed/ /

Linking outstretched flesh. Cross your index fingers, raise them to the crown of your head, and strike your navel. Rub your stomach with your palms. That dispels tumors, “water-swelling” diseases, diseases of the waist, and all ailments of heat, cold, and microorganisms. It frees the channel knots at the waist.[43] (133–38)

smad kyi 'khrul 'khor rnam bzhi las/ / rdo rje 'gros ni lag pa gnyis/ / sgyid khung nang du bsnol la 'khra/ / pangs la log gnyis mdun du bzhag / stod 'tshangs rlung gi nad rnams dang / / drag po'i srog 'dzin rengs ba sel/ /

There are the four trulkhors of the lower body.[44] Vajra gait. Cross both hands [behind] the hollow of your knees and rise up. Once up, place both hands in front. That dispels upper “crowding,” wind illnesses, a strong life force, and paralysis.[45] (139–45)
chu srin brkyang bskum lag pa gnyis/ / brla yi phyi nas re mos dkyus/ / rkang pa re mos sprug par bya/ / lus kun na dang gyogs po dang / / rkang nad tshigs nad ma lus sel/ /

Extending and contracting makaras. Your hands go outside your thighs and grasp your elbows. Shake your legs in turn. This dispels all physical diseases, rigidity, leg illnesses, and joint ailments.[46] (146–50)
sbal 'gros 'phags cing gab gab 'gros/ / chu ser skya rbab skem bar byed/ /
Turtle gait. Rise up and withdraw. This dries up lymph and early dropsy.[47] (151–52)
gcig ni rdo rje skyil krung yin/ / smad kyi nad rnams sel bar byed/ / rags dang phra ba'i rtsa mdud grol/ /
Another is the vajra position. It clears up all lower body illnesses and frees the coarse and subtle channel knots. (153–55)
thig le bu ga dgu rnams nas/ / 'dzag srung 'khrul 'khor gnad kyi mchog / tshe ring yon tan bsam mi khyab/ /
rjes la bsngo (537)ba'i rgyas 'debs bya/ / nyin re ma chag nyams su blang / /
After doing those, place the seal of dedication. Practice every day without interruption.[49] (159–60)
'di ni lag len mdor bsdus yin/ / rlung gegs sel ba'i 'khrul 'khor dang / / gtum mo'i 'khrul 'khor bcu gcig dang / / seng ge rnam grol gzhan nas shes/ /
This is the abbreviated practice. The trulkhor for dispelling problems of wind, the eighteen trulkhors for caṇḍālī, and the liberation of a lion[*3] can be learned elsewhere.[50] (161–64)
nA ro paN chen phyag len ltar/ / kho bo mar pa lo tsA yis/ / snod ldan don du yi ger bkod/ /
According to the procedures of the great paṇḍita Nāropa, I, Marpa Lotsāwa, put this in writing for the sake of suitable recipients.[51] (165–67)
snyan brgyud 'chal du mi 'jug cing / / nyams khrid rdzogs par ma thob par/ / gal te de nyid bsten gyur na/ / nag po che dang za byed kyi/ / mkha' 'gro rnams kyis mgo bo khos/ /

If the Aural Transmission is taught to those who have not reached its depths and not received the complete experiential instructions, Mahākāla and the flesh-eating ḍākinīs will split heads.[52] (168–72)
mchog thun mong lo'am tshe 'dir ster bar byed pa 'khrul 'khor gsal ba'i me long zhes bya ba rdzogs so/ /
This completes the Clear Mirror: Trulkhors, what bestows the sublime and common [achievements] in a year or this lifetime.
maN+Dal gser zho re med par mi gnang bar bla ma mkha' 'gro'i bka' rgya yod/ !
There is the command seal of the gurus and ḍākinīs not to bestow this without a maṇḍala of a zho of gold.[53]
[gtum mo'i 'khrul 'khor bco brgyad pa]
34. Eighteen Trulkhors for Caṇḍālī[1]
na mo gu ru/
namo guru
gtum mo'i 'khrul 'khor bco brgyad la/ / lag len gnad zab yi ger bkod/ /
The eighteen caṇḍālī trulkhors. I have put in writing the profound vital points for their procedure.[3] (1–2)

rlung skyon sbyor ba'i 'khrul 'khor gcig / lus gnad sdod pa'i 'khrul 'khor bzhi/ / drod btsan thabs 'bebs pa'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis/ / bying rgod sel ba'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis/ / mtshan mo nyal ba'i 'khrul 'khor gcig / 'gro ba'i dus kyi 'khrul 'khor gnyis/ / gegs sel gnad kyi 'khrul 'khor gnyis/ / thig le 'dren pa'i 'khrul 'khor bzhi/ /

There is one trulkhor for purifying problems of the winds, four trulkhors for sitting with the vital points for the body, two trulkhors that are forceful heat falls, two trulkhors for dispelling dullness and agitation, one trulkhor for sleeping at night, two trulkhors for walking, two trulkhors that are the vital points for dispelling hindrances, and four trulkhors for drawing up the bindus.[4] (3–10)
dril bas rkang grangs bco brgyad las/ /
Eighteen in total. Of these:

rlung skyon sbyong ba'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / mdun bsnol 'khor lo ltar bskor ba/ / rkang pa rdo rje skyil krung bca'/ / lag pa mthe bong bsnol byas la/ / srin lag mnan la khu tshur sbyar/ / gcu zhing gcu zhing lan dgu ru/ / rlung ni 'jam la ring bar bus/ / de yis rlung skyon sel bar byed/ /

Trulkhor for purifying problems of the winds. Cross in front and circle like a wheel. Place your legs in the vajra position. With your hands, your thumb crosses over, presses down on your ring finger, and you form a fist. Twist and twist, nine times. Exhale your breath gently and slowly. That will dispel problems of the winds.[5] (11–18)
sdod pa'i 'khrul 'khor rnam bzhi la/ skyil krung te (538)lo'i chos bdun te/ / rnam snang chos bdun zhes kyang bya/ / rkang pa rdo rje skyil krung bca'/ / drod ni shugs la skye ba yin/ /

The four trulkhors for sitting. {538} The cross-legged position is the seven dharmas of Tilopa, called the seven dharmas of Vairocana. Place your legs in the vajra position. Heat will arise naturally.[6] (19–23)
lag gnyis lte 'og sor bzhi ru/ / mnyam gzhag phyag rgya dam du bca'/ / rtsa kha 'byed cing bde ba skye/ /
Hold your hands in the mudrā of equipoise, four fingerbreadths below your navel. That will open your channels and bliss will arise.[7] (24–26)
sgal tshing drang por bsrangs pa yis/ / rlung rnams rang sar tshud pa yin/ / mgrin pa lcags kyu lta bur dgug / snying rtse gyen log mi rtog skye/ /
By keeping your spine straight, the winds will enter their own spaces. Bend your neck like an iron hook. That will turn the tip of your heart upward, and nonconceptuality will arise.[8] (27–30)

dpung pa rgod gshog bzhin du brkyang / / dgos pa rlung nad chung ba yin/ / mig ni sna yi rtse mor blta/ / dmigs pa dag ni gsal ba yin/ / lus sems li ri ltar du bsgrim/ / bde drod myur du skye ba yin/ /

Extend your shoulders like the wings of a vulture. The purpose is to lessen wind diseases. Gaze at the tip of your nose with your eyes. That will clarify your focus. Tighten your body and mind, as if [making a rope of] liri. That will give rise to bliss and warmth quickly.[9] (31–36)
rgya mdud ching ge 'khrul 'khor ni/ / gnad rnams sngar da 'dra ba la/ / rkang bsnol tsog pus pus 'khyud bzhugs/ / yon tan gong dang 'dra ba la/ / 'di ni khyad par drod skye 'gyur/ /

Trulkhor of binding the knots. The vital points are as before. Cross your legs, sit in a crouch hugging your knees. The excellent qualities of this are as above. It specifically gives rise to warmth.[10] (37–41)
ljon shing bsnol ba'i 'khrul 'khor na/ / rkang pa re mig bzhi du bsnol/ / lag pa mkhrig ma'i mtshams nas bsdam/ / pus mo gnyis ni bkab pa yis/ / grang ba'i nad rnams 'phral du 'joms/ /
Trulkhor of crossed trees. Cross your legs like lattice work. Hold your wrists with your hands. Cover both knees. Cold ailments will be immediately vanquished.[11] (42–46)

sku gsum bsnol ba'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / rkang pa g.yon pa'i bol gong steng / / g.yas pa'i rgyu ma khug bzhag la/ / pus mo gnyis la 'khyud pas bsdam/ / rtsa rnams yo ba bsrang ba dang / / rlung rnams srog tu tshud pa yin/ /

Trulkhor of the crossed three kāyas. On top of your left foot, place the bottom of your right. Hold your knees in an embrace. This will straighten the curves of all channels and wind diseases will enter the life force.[12] (47–52)
'khrul 'khor bzhi po bsdoms pa la/ / sdod pa'i 'khrul 'khor zhes bya'o/ / rgya mdud chings ni drod myur te/ /
Altogether those four trulkhors are called “the trulkhors for sitting.” Binding knots brings heat quickly.[13] (53–55)

drod btsan thabs 'bebs pa'i 'khrul 'khor la/ / gong gi 'khrul 'khor drug chings ni/ / rkang pa re mig bzhin du bsnol/ / lag gnyis brla yi dkyil nas bsnol/ / rkang mtheb gnyis bzung g.yas g.yon bskor/ /

Among the trulkhors that are forceful heat falls, binding the six trulkhors of dance. Cross your feet like lattice work. Cross your arms around the outside of your thighs. Hold your big toes, and circle right and left.[14] (56–60)
drod tshan me ltar 'bar ba dang / / ma zhu skran nad thal ba glog / gangs lag cer nyal byas kyang (539)tshugs/ / stobs chen seng ge lta bur 'gyur/ /
Great heat, like a fire, will blaze, and illnesses of indigestion and tumors will be pulverized. You will be able to sleep naked in the snow {539} and have great strength, like a lion.[15] (61–64)
sbrul dang bya khyung gnad la bor/ / mthe bong bzhi ni sa la btsug / mgo bo pus mo'i bar du bcug / lus kyis 'gul skyod ci shes bya/ / yon tan gong dang 'dra ba la/ / chu kha snyi ga sdom par byed/ /

Four snakes holding the garuḍa to the vital point. Plant your thumbs and big toes, the four, on the ground. Place your head between your knees. Bend and move your body however you can. The excellent qualities are the same as before. This binds urinary incontinence.[16] (65–70)

bying rgod sel ba'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / bying na bya rgod mkha' la 'phur/ / lag gnyis gdengs pa 'phag cing sprug / nam mkha'i dkyil du thig le bsgom/ / yang yang rlung 'bud phaT kyis bsing / / bying rmug rig pa nyog ba sel/ /

Among the trulkhors for dispelling dullness and agitation, when you are dull, use the vulture flying in the sky. Raise your arms, lift up and flap. Meditate on a bindu in the middle of space. Again and again, exhale your breath, refreshing with phaṭ. That will dispel dullness, sluggishness, and fuzzy awareness.[17] (71–76)
rgod na shes pa bum par gzung / / lag gnyis bsnol la pus steng bzhag / ri rab lag pa'i logs la sbyar/ / rkang mthil 'od kyi thig le bsgom/ / rnam rtog 'phro zhing rgod pa sel/ /

When agitated, use holding mind in a vase. Cross your hands and place them on your knees. Join Meru to the back sides of your hands. Meditate on a bindu of light on the soles of your feet. That will dispel agitation and the proliferation of thoughts.[18] (77–81)

mtshan mo nyal ba'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ / spyang mo nyal ba zhes bya ste/ / lag g.yas mkhal ma'i steng du dgab/ / pus brang sprad la g.yon pas bsdom/ / bde drod rab tu 'bar ba dang / / nub gos ras kyis chog par 'gyur/ /

Trulkhor for sleeping at night. It is called the sleeping jackal. Place your right hand on your kidney. Bring your knees to your chest, holding them with your left [arm]. Bliss and heat will blaze strongly, and cotton clothes will be sufficient at night.[19] (82–87)

'gro ba'i dus kyi 'khrul 'khor ni/ / mkhar ltar bab pa zhes bya ba/ / gan rkyal byas la 'phra zhing sprug / chu ser rang sar 'grim par byed/ / thig le khrems par the tshom med/ / lus ni lhun stug mdzes par 'gyur/ /

Trulkhor for walking. It is called falling as if in space. Lie on your back, lift up and shake. That will spread lymph to its own spaces. The bindus will also spread—have no doubts. Your body will be spectacular.[20] (88–93)

ne le res 'jog 'khrul 'khor ni/ / thur sel drag po ma brjed bzung / / rlung gi lha mo gshogs pa can/ / gnyis kyis mchan 'og 'degs par bsam/ / rkang 'og rlung gi 'khor lo ni/ / gzhu yi dbyibs can mchog ma nas/ / ba dan 'ur 'ur bskyod par bsam/ /

Trulkhor of the alternating mongooses. Hold the downward-expelling wind forcefully without forgetting. Imagine that two wind goddesses with wings hold you aloft from underneath your armpits. Imagine that under your feet are wind cakras in the shape of bows and on the bow tips flags are fluttering ur ur.[21] (94–100)
lag gnyis khu tshur bcangs pa dang / / lag g.yas rkang g.yon gdong la bor/ / lag g.yon nang g.yon rting la zor/ / mi gcig nyi bdun phyin pa'i sar/ / nyi ma gcig la speb par 'gyur/ /

Holding your right hand in a fist, throw both it and your right foot out. Snap your left hand and left foot back. In just one day, you will arrive at a place it takes someone else seven days to reach.[22] (101–5) {540}

(540)gegs sel gnad kyi 'khrul 'khor ni/ / seng ge rtsal sprug zhes bya ba/ / skyil krung pus steng lag gnyis bzhag / lus kyis god sbag yang yang bya/ / rlung gzhi la thig le khrims par de/ / ro stod seng chen bzhin du 'gyur/ /

Among the trulkhors that are the vital points for dispelling hindrances, one is called the shaking movements of a lion. Sit cross-legged and place both hands on your knees. Shake again and again with your upper body. This will disperse the winds and spread the bindus. Your upper body will resemble a great lion.[23] (106–11)

seng ge rnam rol 'khrul 'khor ni/ / lag pa'i sor mos kha sna dang / / mig dang sna bug bkag byas la/ / ro stod 'khor lo ltar du bskor/ / rtsa rlung thig le'i gegs sel zhing / / dwangs ma 'khor lo bzhi la 'grems/ / 'pho ba byed na gnad kyi mchog /

Trulkhor of the manifestation of a lion. With your fingers, cover your mouth, nostrils, eyes, and ears. Circle your upper body like a wheel. That will dispel hindrances of the channels, winds, and bindus, and spread the quintessences to the four cakras. For transference, these are supreme vital points.[24] (112–18)

thig le 'dren pa'i 'khrul 'khor la/ / ri rab phul ba zhes bya ba/ / rkang pa rdo rje skyil krung bca'/ / mthe bong gnyis pos srin lag mnan/ / khu tshur bcangs la brla khud gzugs/ / hU~M ring hU~M thung nyer gcig brjod/ / thig le 'dzag bsrung gyen du 'dren/ /

Among the trulkhors for drawing up the bindus, one is called flying from Meru. Place your legs in the vajra position. Press down on your ring fingers with your thumbs. Form fists and place them at the top of your thighs. Say long hūṃs and short hūṃs twenty-one times. This will protect your bindus from being released and will draw them up.[25] (119–25)
khra yi bzhad tshul zhes bya ba/ / lag gnyis khu tshur steng bcas nas/ / rkang pa rdo rje skyil krung bca'/ / dbugs hU~M gis ni rngub par bya/ /
The way of the laughter of a fox. With your hands in fists above and your legs in the vajra position, inhale with hūṃ.[26] (126–29)
de rjes yi dwags 'khrul 'khor ni/ / rkang pa'i mthil ni sprad byas la/ / langs la pus mo lag pas dgag / hika ka hika ni drag tu brjod/ /
Next, the trulkhor of a hungry ghost. Join the soles of your feet, and stand with your hands covering your knees. Say hik ka hik forcefully.[27] (130–33)
seng ge gan log sbyor ba ni/ / rkang pa rdo rje skyil krung bca'/ / lag gnyis skyil krung bar du bcug / hika ka hika ka drag tu brjod/ /
The application of the looking back of a lion. Place your legs in the vajra position, and put your hands between your crossed legs. Say hik-ka hik-ka forcefully.[28] (134–37)

rjes la seng ge rtsal sprug bya/ / de rjes mnyam gzhag ngang du klod/ / 'khrul 'khor bzhi po byed pa'i tshe/ / chu mig gyen ldog dar chen phyar/ / rgya mtsho brag gtad ri rab bsnyengs/ / 'og rlung drangs la gling bzhi bsdu/ /

After that, do the shaking movements of a lion. Then, relax into a state of meditative equipoise. When doing these four trulkhors, turn the springs upward, raise the great flag, bring the ocean to the rock, and stretch Meru. Draw up the lower winds and contract the four continents.[29] (138–43)
'khrul 'khor 'di la brtson gyur na/ / sba ba sbubs nub thig le 'ching / / rags dang phra ba'i rtsa bdud grol/ / lus ni bkrag dang gzi mdangs ldan/ /

If you persevere with these trulkhors, goiters will disappear and your bindus will be bound. The knots of your coarse and subtle channels will be freed. Your body will glow and be resplendent.[30] (144–47)
tshe ring rgas pa spang bar 'gyur/ / (541) rtsa nub gnyer ma mi 'byung zhing / / gzhon nu mdzes ldan lhun stug 'gyur/ /
nang rtags mkha' 'gro dam can 'du/ / 'khrul 'khor re res glo bur du byed pa'i gnad/ /
The inner signs are the gathering of the ḍākinīs and oath-bound ones. Each trulkhor contains the vital points that suddenly create siddhas.[32] (151–52)
gtum mo'i 'khrul 'khor bco brgyad pa zhes bya bsnyan brgyud yid bzhin nor bu'i gdams pa rdzogs so// / zab bo/ /zab bo/ /
This completes the instructions of the Wish-Fulfilling Gems of the Aural Transmission called the Eighteen Trulkhors for Caṇḍālī. Profound. Profound. ithi
bka' rgya// //
Command seal.[*2][33]
